Reviews.Title: “Conference stay”
Reviews.Author: BH201256003
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this hotel while attending a conference recently. Ambiance is great. Nice and quiet. Only downside was the daily housekeeping/maintenance. Room was never vacuumed. Shower door had some caulking/sealant that was loose and hanging off the door. Bedside drawer wouldn't stay shut. A few capet stains in the living area. One day I returned to the room and all the pillows were on the floor. Another day my curtains were left with one side open and the other closed. Another day housekeeping had left a bottle of shampoo on my bedside table instead of in the bathroom. Nothing that made my stay unenjoyable. Just seemed like the housekeeping wasn't thourough and the room needed a little maintenance. Room# 27903.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel!”
Reviews.Author: drshearerss
Reviews.Content: We had the good fortune of staying at THEhotel for a night when we came up to Las Vegas for the Bon Jovi concert. Loved it! Our suite was beautiful - very classy, great bathrooms, comfortable beds, and a sofa big enough that our daughter slept on it! We loved that the property is so quiet - not having a casino gave it the perfect vibe for us. We were there over a Saturday night, and I do have to say that it was NOT CHEAP - Reading Captain Vallarta's review about their $90+ for a Thursday night stay made me want to cry - but I would do it again in a heartbeat, and will maybe try make our next trip on an "off" time so it doesn't cost so much!

Reviews.Title: “Best luxory hotel in Vegas....”
Reviews.Author: SportsReporter
Reviews.Content: The Mandalay Bay messed up our reservations (room wasn't ready) so I pitched a fit and we were "upgraded" to The Hotel, their high-end section of Mandalay Bay. I am so GLAD THEY MESSED UP. I was here on business but met hubby here with the kids for two days. The kids went nuts-- big spacious rooms in our suite and we had the penthouse. Need a housekeeper to make up your room? Push a button. No door cards. Also, you actually have a doorbell. Desk was awesome and wifi was super easy to use at no cost. The mini-bar is seriously a fun time--keep the kids away because there are so many goodies it could set you back quickly. Beds were comfy, loved two bathrooms and decor was tasteful. Lobby is bizarre--it's so quiet you can hear yourself whisper. No casino in lobby but main casino is 5 mins from the lobby at Mandalay. I LOVED this part! Highly recommend if you want to avoid smoky casinos and tacky tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for First Time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: EBal24
Reviews.Content: Like the title says - This was the first time I ever visited Las Vegas with a group of friends Positives Check in - Was a quick breeze, We all arrived at 10am and check in wasn't until 1pm. I had asked for 2 queen beds and early check in and they easily accommodated and we arrived to our rooms within the first 30 minutes of stepping into the hotel. Rooms - Very spacious and Clean. Our room was 20508 and luckily we faced the strip and the Luxor hotel. My friends had the misfortune of facing the Airport and a parking lot. So if you want a good view just remember that this is the first hotel once you enter the strip itself. They hit you with a 25 dollar room fee each day you stay and that adds up after a few days. I had to pay for WIFI?? Really what year is this??? How do you charge something that is practically for free? The ice machine on the 20th floor was broken for 2 days but they finally got it fixed. Pool - Sadly this hotel does not have a pool and you share it with the Mandalay Bay. Which means on a busy Saturday - Good Luck trying to find a chair!! On top of that it was unseasonable hot during our trip. Im from NYC and we loved it! but regardless there is no shade whatsoever by the pool. If you want an umbrella it costs an additional 75 dollars. The cabanas are EXPENSIVE!! What I don't get is if I paid extra to stay in the luxurious section of your hotel then why do I have to pay for an umbrella?? Isn't the point of paying extra for the upgrade is to have these basic things for free? Also where are the free waters?? Do not buy water or beer from the bar. Go to the service store and its 3 dollars cheaper across from the pool restaurant. The ladies who serve you by the pool were extremely friendly as was the staff in general of the hotel. Restaurants - In the Shops section I do recommend Burger Barn. The burgers were phenomenal!! We decided on eating one night at Red White and Blue. I will say the service was nice but the food was TERRIBLE!!!! It was absolutely atrocious. My brother had a burger and it was like a tops frozen hockey puck. I had the Grilled Tuna Steak which looked like something you bought at the grocers freezer. It was covered with some glaze that looked like glue. STAY AWAY!!! Clubs - MIX was a roof top club/restaurant ( i didnt eat there) the club was alot of fun! The view was amazing and the atmosphere was great. It wasn't as douchey as the other clubs in Vegas which are originally from NYC (yes Im talking to you 1 Oak and Marquee) Casino - The casino was nice, never too crowded and the drinks came quickly when we played. I like the sports betting section out of all the hotels. It was very old but I liked it.. in a world where everything is touch screen and computerized the betting area here was huge and you sit down in a school desk chair and it just had that old Vegas feel to it. Hotel overall - The hotel was nice, the service was good but where is the entrance? You enter in through a parking garage. Other hotels had a far greater lobby that you just stare in awe. Here it was dark and the black marble does not help. I would come back if I got a great deal again but other then that this hotel is the farthest away from the rest. It truly depends on how you want your Vegas experience to be. If you like it quiet then this is the best one, if you want to be in the middle of it all then my guess is you would select others.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LucyOz
Reviews.Content: Spacious suites, lovely hotel. Quite nice that the hotel is slightly out of the way of Mandalay Bay hussle and bussle of the casino. Housekeepers I came across in the hall were so so lovely and helpful, offering lots of advice. Did come across an awful lady at the front reception when we enquired why there were no robes in our room, she was very rude and snarky but luckily everyone else was lovely and it made up for it. Mandalay bay pool is very cool but super busy.

Reviews.Title: “Work trip”
Reviews.Author: NJgirl1234
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference for work so I did not get to experience all that they have to offer but we were upgraded from Mandalay Bay to The Hotel. After talking to others who were staying on the Mandalay Bay side, I was thrilled as they complained about uncomfortable beds...my bed was wonderfully comfortable. The suites are quite large, 2 bathrooms, living room area, and large bedroom with two closets. Bathroom in the bedroom was large as well with shower, jacuzzi tub, and separate toilet area. We ate as the Wolfgang Puck restaurant and the Mexican grill by the conference center (names are escaping me right now) but both were delicious and for Vegas, normally priced. I also had coffee and pastries at the cafe by the elevator each morning...always delicious. I thought the staff were extremely helpful and there wasn't a terrible smoke smell lingering in the casino like some places in Vegas. Overall, it was a great trip for work. Definitely try out the rooftop bar one night...beautiful views!

Reviews.Title: “LAs Vegas Trip with children”
Reviews.Author: estellejulie
Reviews.Content: My family lives in Vegas, but we usually stay a couple of days in one of the hotels for fun. As we have little children we try to get a non gaming hotel or at least a hotel with attractions. We chose THEHOTEL because it was advertised as non gaming but still has access to the beach/pool area at the Mandalay. It was hard to find the entrance of the hotel at first, sort of a back entrance through the garage and the check in was really crowded and slow. We did not get the room we booked for for the first night, however the hotel was really apologetic and gave us complimentary upgrades for the second night and spa passes and free dinners, which was really nice. The suites are very spacious, well appointed and the bathrooms fantastic. Huge Tub with TV and everything. Sound proof as well The spa was heaven and I really enjoyed it. The ambiance is somewhat dark walls but still light and airy. The hotel itself is shiny, dark marble and I loved the cool ambiance. The only downside was, that you HAVE to cross through the gaming lounge in order to get to the pool?? Somwheat bizaar, as you can access the pool from the Mandalay hotel without stepping into the gaming lounge. However the mandalay is advertised as a gaming hotel and THEHOTEL as non gaming. IN my opinion should be vice versa or I just did not find the correct way to the pool. The pools are really nice but very, very, very crowded.. to ding an empty lounge chair is luck and you bascially have to defend ikt tooth and nails. Also the pools close very early, which is a shame. Other than that, we really enjoyed our staff and can recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “view and suite was great”
Reviews.Author: sean w
Reviews.Content: big rooms and bathrooms. nice upkeep. view from top floors was nice. we will go back here again. kids loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: latinos28
Reviews.Content: A bit about me I was a travel agent for about 4 yrs I been to hawaii,mexico all inclusives, cruises, When we arrive to the hotels valet they took our luaggage and off i was to check in check in was nice and easy and the young lady had a nice smile. Keep in mind that this hotel is huge hotel and check will be the biggest employee interaction you will have. After check in we walk to our suite the room was very comfy sleeps about 6 people the price we pay was a bit high since their was 2 convention going on our room was always made overall happy with hotel I would stay in this hotel cabs to palms about 18$ bucks to the encore about 20$ nice wave pool

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: binz875
Reviews.Content: The main reason we had picked this hotel was because we wanted a 5 day extended weekend by a nice pool in Vegas. Well that was a mistake. If you wanted a spot by the pool you had to wait in line at least 20 minutes before they opened the pool area and then the wait line wrapped around the complex. If you werent there at that time you could forget about getting any lounges the rest of the day. If you put some clothing articles on the lounges to save a spot and then went and had breakfast like we did, the staff took your articles and gave up your chairs if you werent back in an hour. Needless to say my shoes were there but not my shirts and shorts. They checked the lost & found, but no luck.UGH!! Everytime you stood up to go get something to eat or go to the restroom you had people asking if you were leaving so they could have your spot. Other complaints we had is we requested pillows and never received them. Also if you went out to eat and had left overs you didnt dare shift a drink around in the fridge or you were charged for that item being it was sensored. It would have been nice not to have the fridge completely packed with refreshments. Every where our family went at this hotel/casino/restaurant/shop the employees acted like they were doing a big favor to wait on you and we did hear alot of complaining from them. The only staff that was pleasant were the housekeepers. Our family usually takes 2 trips a year and this was by far the worst experience at a hotel we ever had in 35 years. And when we notified them of our experience it was just a bunch of mumble jumble. I would suggest choosing another hotel over this one!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sexy, fun, up-scale - all vegas”
Reviews.Author: machine1216
Reviews.Content: Bottom line - if you are a couple or a group looking to have fun with that is a bit upscale - just come here. Done. Rooms are suites with separate bedrooms and living room, clean and comfortable. The pool area is awesome, with a beach that has a wave pool, lazy river, and pool sides with Cabanas - or go European at the topless area (yes, there is a charge, but then again...). Unbelievable choice of restaurants from a dizzying array of vodkas and caviar from Red Square, the new Fluer with a $5,000 burger, great Mexican at Border Grill, some of the best Chinese I've ever had at China Grill, blow your mind steaks at Strip Steak, and of course there is Aureole. Spas and shopping of course - this place is huge - it's on the strip, though you could stay here for a week and still not get to everything. Casino is great - a bit upscale and the aura shows it - minimums during the day are around $15 and then average $25 during the evening. Go - have fun - live.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but had a disappointing pool experience.”
Reviews.Author: Lesley S
Reviews.Content: This was the second time my husband and I stayed at The Hotel, but this was the first time we attempted to relax at the pool. The Hotel does not have it's own pool. You have to use the Mandalay Bay pool. We walked around for 30 minutes trying to find a place to sit (like many other people we saw) and never found anywhere. You can always get a reserved chair. The cheapest was for $75 per chair and then another $75 if you want an umbrella. I would think if you are staying at the more expensive hotel, these should be complimentary or have your own pool. I have stayed at many Vegas hotels (we go at least once a year or more) that are a lot less expensive and never had this issue. I was very disappointed and will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Clefsdorsf
Reviews.Content: THEhotel has a lot going for it. Great suites, a boutique feel, no casino in the lobby and a less crowded feel than most of the hotels around. If you want to be in the action but not always surrounded by it---this is a great choice. We found the service to be attentive--although we would have expected to receive evening turn down service . The only real downside to THEhotel is that you have to share the pool with main hotel--which is somewhat like experiencing a beach resort during Spring Break. (Be prepared to pay for a cabana if you want to find somewhere to sit down.) We did not eat at the hotel but rather went downstairs to the Four Seasons Hotel for a more relaxing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend - with 1 fyi”
Reviews.Author: LynnofOntario
Reviews.Content: Beautiful suite - could not have asked for more. The living room with wetbar and a powder room was great. The bedroom had a very comfortable bed and lovely decor. (The TV needs to be updated to a flatscreen, but was large and in working order.) The bathroom was heavenly - spacious glass shower, roomy soaker tub, good lighting and makeup mirror and a decent hair dryer. Also, I was on the 28th floor and had a great view of the Luxor and the mountains, very pretty. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. One FYI: be aware that there is a lot of smoke in the casino and common areas. And even though they have air filters running, you still end up taking in a lot of second-hand smoke. So if you have smoke sensitivities, bring sudafed or other pills to help you. Regarding the location, if you want to explore the strip, stay in the middle of all the casinos (Bally's is a good inexpensive and central choice) - but if you are fine with staying at one end of the strip, then this is a fantastic choice. Also, an amazing outdoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem at the end of the strip”
Reviews.Author: bonnier914
Reviews.Content: The rooms are all suites, huge and beautiful. We were in a corner suite on the 36th floor. It was wrapped in floor to ceiling glass so we overlooked the strip lit up at night. They have a separate living room and a guest bathroom, three tv's, livingroom, bedroom & bathroom and a nice bar. The Mandalay Bay beach area has a wave pool with a sandy beach, a lazy river area and several adult pools with cabanas and restaurants. It's quite a hike, however, from your room. Valet parking is included with the room. Just tip a couple dollars each time and well worth it. Our car was always brought up immediately and we drove to shopping and shows as everyone seems to have complimentary valet. There are several great restaurants in the Mandalay Bay complex, Aereole, La Fleur, House of Blues, Lupo's, Strip Steak and many more. Our favorite for a drink is Red Square which features vodka. The bar is a solid sheet of ice to put your drink on and if you order a full bottle of vodka they give your group fur coats and hats and you can go into a glass room that is 0 degrees to drink the vodka at the proper temperature. Of course there is a huge casino and several nice shops as well as a first class spa.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: Ftccotraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at THEHotel for my birthday weekend with a group of nine. Loved the layout of the room, with exception that there is no refrigerator. I liked the nice upgrades of marble, big tub, double sinks in the bathroom. The pool is not the best compared to other hotels. The cabana price is outrageous. Way worse than any other pool we've been to on thie strip. My only other issue was the resort fee. It is $25 a day-also ridiculous. I liked the THEHotel, but not enough to pay the price for a few amenities.

Reviews.Title: “13th floor...trouble”
Reviews.Author: mlinla
Reviews.Content: Our stay has not started very well. Land and wireless not working. Being here for a it convention and.needing to keep in touch with corporate not good. Then to pull back the cover on the bed and there is a stain...worse. But it did not stop there. Remote for tv in bathroom not working. Took a bath and when I was finished the water started coming up the drain in the shower next to the tub. A terrible smell. Now instead of getting ready for dinner having to sit and wait for the plumber to fix it. Not good

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms not so great service”
Reviews.Author: erevrav
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at THeHotel in January 2011 for a few nights. Coming from NY my wife had a bit of jet lag and went down to the front desk to find out some information about booking a spa appointment. She specifically told them that I was sleeping and not to disturb our room. Well they rang the doorbell to give me a pamphlet at 5:30 in the morning. They then called the room to see that we got it. When I went downstairs the managers on duty were not very helpful at all. In the end they gave us a free nights stay for the next trip if we made the trip in 12 months. We didn't get to so now we're going to try the Signature at MGM to see how it compares. I have stayed at TheHotel before and it has always been my favorite place to stay in Vegas. Maybe it got more popular or maybe I'm older and now I expect too much but I was really disappointed by how I was treated. I'm not open to staying anywhere else. The truth is, most other places have lower prices and a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Room not ready, rude attitude from front desk”
Reviews.Author: AmeliaLivermore
Reviews.Content: My husband chose this hotel for a work trip. The room wasn't ready upon arrival at 7:00pm and the hotel staff were rude when he expressed his unhappiness with the situation. Honestly expected more from "THEhotel".

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Oscar827
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at THE hotel at Mandalay Bay 2 nights in a suite that was comped as part of a five day stay total in Vegas. Our first 3 nights were at the Gold Coast. We are a couple over 50 and go to Vegas a number of times a year. We have stayed in many different places and this probably the best. We stayed 4-18 and 4-19. We arrived at around 11:00A.M. and was able to get into our room right away Very friendly at check-in and out. There was was a small line at the time, but it did not take long. We checked in at Mandalay and they put us in THE Hotel. We had to walk through the casino to get to the Hotel. The suite was beautiful, a nice living area and separate bedroom with 2 bathrooms. One bathroom with a spearate shower and tub you could drown in. Two sinks also. Flat screen tv in both living and bedrooms. It was very nice. The view also was great. It was a fun place to stay. They have a great pool area, as most people know they have a lazy river, wave pool and 2 other pools also. It was relaxing at this time not many people, and no problem getting a place to sit. We were also their once in July, and the pool area was packed. One of the best pool areas in Vegas. They have a number of places to eat, and all are very expensive. Some people do not like the location, but in reality it is not as bad as you may think. You can take a tram to Excalibur, walk across the street past New York New York to Monte Carlo and catch another tram to Bellagio and you are close to the middle of the strip, The casino is big with a lot space to move around. My wife won a good sum their the last day. The tables are all $10 and above. All the people we came in contact with was very friendly and helpful. The cost to the airport on a taxi was $13.20 without tip. We had a great time at a beautiful place. Do not let the location scare you. Lots of places to gamble and eat in the area. Most places to eat are expensive if that is a concern. Probably going back in a few months.

Reviews.Title: “Wintertime Oasis”
Reviews.Author: mohawk76
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay in this wonderful facility in January. What a remarkable complex! The rooms are enormous with all the amenities. If you want the seclusion from the hustle of the strip, this is the spot for you! The casinos are reasonably close, and the shows at this end are great. Carrot Top is a must see. We will definitely return for more of this pampered living. The staff is attentive to your every need and extremely courteous. We WILL return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms - long walk!”
Reviews.Author: JBGregory
Reviews.Content: I didn't realize how nice these rooms were until I started traveling more frequently for business. These rooms are very nice, updated and clean. The only complaint is the incredibly long walk to the convention area of the Mandalay Bay. Also, not keen on having to mix-in with the Mandalay Bay crowd but a nice hotel and beach area is fun! It goes without saying that the hotel drinks and food were over-priced but several of the interior restaurants were very yummy and the selection was nice without having to take a cab ride down the strip. I would stay here again and hope to do so in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, don't stay here if you want a pool without hassle”
Reviews.Author: Jason G
Reviews.Content: THE Hotel itself was really good, beautiful lobby areas, nice big rooms for your money. As my wife and I visit Vegas partly for a relaxing holiday rather than a gambling one, things such as the pool facilities are important to us. In hindsight now I wish I had researched the sharing with the Mandalay Bay pool a bit more. If you have no interest in using a pool while you are here then it is perfect, unfortunately we did and found the good 15min walk through the casino to get to the pool quite off putting. Then once there we were faced with having to wait for someone to leave before we could get a bed to lie on. One day we got there 15mins after the pool opened and still had to do without a bed and lie on the floor by the pool (I wasn't prepared to pay their inflated prices for a nice bed or cabana). Another day we got there 15 mins before it opened and started to join the queue - I say started as we gave up after walking what felt like an age to find the back of the queue (I am not exaggerating!). We stayed at the Trump hotel last year and whilst they have a pretty basic pool it was very easy and quick to get to and relaxing with no competing for beds when we got there. In fairness, it was the Spring Break but both the Mandalay and THE Hotel should be prepared for this. It didn't spoil our holiday as we find Vegas amazing and the hotel itself was still to a very high standard, it just took the icing off the cake for us and would certainly recommend that THE Hotel has a basic pool that its own guests can just use.

Reviews.Title: “Needs new management”
Reviews.Author: rc45
Reviews.Content: Haved stayed here four times (every other year for a convention) and very disappointed in what has happened to the running of this hotel - soiled/dirty bath robes, soiled and stained towels, maid never cleaned the wine glasses that we had used each night, pool towels had stains and some were torn. Yes, it is much less expensive than the Four Seasons at the other end of Mandalay Bay, but no excuse for these types of issues.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning!”
Reviews.Author: Nikki M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is incredible. The suites are impressive and relaxing- almost as big as my one bedroom apartment! The bathrooms with the TV and jetted tub make it easy to relax. From the moment you walk in, the lobby is so large and welcoming (and smells incredible) that you immediately feel relaxed. The casino at Mandalay Bay is one of the less smoky ones- the air system must be really great. I went here for business, and some of the amenties like the free wifi and nice desk were great to have as well. I wanted to stay in my room all day instead of going to the convention!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: racgeo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a girlfriend's weekend. I loved that the rooms have a separate living area and bedroom. As there were so many of us, it meant we could hang in each others living room without needing to go into the bedroom. The hotel is beautiful, sleek and feels quite sophisticated. We used the bathhouse spa, and the design is minimalistic and feels very zen. It is not a large spa, but seemed to accomodate us all, and remember there were 14 of us. As the hotel is attached to Mandalay Bay, you feel as though you are in a hotel versus a casino.. No neon slot machines near check in, however a short walk down a corridor and you are in the main casino area. I liked that it was separate. Taxis from the hotel were frequent and the staff were incredibly attentive. Great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “THEhotel is THEplace to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: thesugarpeachfairy
Reviews.Content: My review is from the point of view of a teenage girl so if you're planning on traveling with teenagers & are wondering if they'll like it I hope my review will be helpful. This was my first time staying in Vegas and it really was surreal. We didn't know to begin with if we were staying at THEhotel or in the Mandalay Bay itself, I would definitely recommend staying it THEhotel instead of The Mandalay Bay (although I've never been in the rooms of the Mandalay) simply because you don't have to walk through the casino to get to it but still have the access to The Mandalay's restaurants and other features. Check-in was a pleasant experience, we were checked-in by Jesus who was very friendly and helpful and then went to our room. The suite we were issued in THEhotel is honestly the best hotel room I have ever stayed in. Luxurious is a complete understatement. The beds were so comfortable and the little seating area was a lovely extra, I don't understand how people have commented about worn-down and outdated rooms, we stayed in 17808 and it was clean and modern. What was a little disappointing was the fact you had to pay to make your own drinks... The restaurants available are great with such a range of cuisines you can't go wrong. We dined in Ruffles cafe for both dinner & breakfast and both times the food was excellent. Furthermore the pool area is wonderful, very clean however very busy. If you want a sunbed, you should be prepared to get up early to get one. The actual pools however weren't overcrowded and there was a range of different types of pool depending on what you wanted. Plenty of lifeguards as well. To conclude, THEhotel is almost unfallible, and I would say to anyone visiting Las Vegas that THEhotel is THEplace to stay.

Reviews.Title: “It is THEhotel to stay at while in Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: pinkprincess03
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference earlier this month and this is probably one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. I had a standard suite and it was gorgeous!! The suite consisted of a living/setting area and a very spacious room wtih a lavish bathroom. Their were three different TVs-- even one in the bathroom so you could take a bath or get ready in the morning and still catch the news! There was also a half-bath off the main entry of the suite. No detail is left untouched in the room! If you are going to Vegas for work or for a relaxing experience, this is definitely the hotel for you. If you are looking for a wild, exciting casino vibe, you won't find it here. The casino is in the adjoining hotel of Mandalay Bay, which is very nice as well. I've stayed at both locations and I would definitely prefer to stay at THEhotel and make the walk next door for the extra activities. Overall, the hotel was VERY clean and the staff friendly. The only downfall to the hotel was the wait at check-in and check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Hambug
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at THEhotel because we were traveling with 2 kids and wanted a suite rather than a regular room. Our king suite was ready upon arrival (slightly before stated check-in time), and was spacious and clean. We requested a rollaway bed for our 12-yr old which was brought up within minutes of our check-in. Our 7-yr old slept on the couch which was plenty large for really anyone. The bathrooms (2) were spacious and clean. We were on the 35th floor, the second room from the elevator. We never heard noise from any neighbors or the hallway despite the fact that the hotel was apparently quite full. It's a bit of a hike to the pool area, but that is to be expected in any Vegas hotel. And of course the pool is worth the walk - fantastic! House of Blues served a good breakfast and the Mexican restaurant in the Mandalay Shops area was great. I'd stay here again if the price was right and I wanted a suite.

Reviews.Title: “When a reservation is not a reservation. . .”
Reviews.Author: Mom23inOR
Reviews.Content: At THEhotel, a reservation does not guarantee you a room at all, and certainly not the one you actually reserved! Be prepared to spend much of your vacation there dealing with fixing your room issues! With so many options in Vegas, there is absolutely no reason to put up with such awful disorganization and service. Copy of the letter sent to THEhotel Management Team: Management Team THEhotel, Mandalay Bay Resorts and Casino MGM Resorts International 3950 Las Vegas Blvd. South Las Vegas, Nevada 89119 Dear Management Team at THEhotel: Please remove my name from all your mailings of specials and promotional offers. There is no offer that would entice me enough to return to your hotel or to any of the properties owned by MGM Resorts International. Although I did not ever get the sense anyone cared, I will tell you why I will never return to your hotel after visiting several times between 2009 and 2011. The last time I was there, in July 2011, I made reservations for a room well in advance of my arrival and called TWICE the day of arrival to assure my room was being held, as my flight was arriving about 11pm. My room was held with a credit card and during both calls; I was assured my reservation was intact. Upon arrival, I was told that yes I had a reservation, but there was no room available for me. Never in all my travels have I ever had a reservation that was not actually a reservation, as it is usually assumed in your business that a reservation means the hotel is expecting my arrival. You can imagine my hesitation to reserve a room at a hotel and travel far from home, only to find I do not actually have a room. Since this so far has been a once in a lifetime experience, all other hotels appear to be safe from THEhotel’s definition of “reservation” and are better choices for my trips to Vegas. Amazingly, a room became available upon insistence that no, I did NOT want an available room at the main Mandalay Bay towers and it became obvious I was not leaving your front desk area. Unfortunately, the room I was given smelled of smoke (I had requested non-smoking) and was next to what must have been a machinery room, as it was incredibly loud. I was told we could change rooms the next morning and went down to the desk to start the process, and was told I’d have a room by 5pm. 6pm came and no call, so I returned to the desk and was told my room was not available until the next day. Excuse me? Lots of standing around later, we were finally given a different room. We were only staying a few days but lost a night of sleep thanks to the loud machinery noise in the first room and I spent way more time at the front desk trying to get the room I reserved than I did enjoying myself. Not exactly the vacation experience I had been hoping for and certainly not worth the money. I expect my hassles to be free. I would appreciate no longer receiving emails from THEhotel and have tried to unsubscribe with no success, and in fact now receive M life emails, too, for reasons unknown. It’s unfortunate that we no longer will stay there, as we loved when we rented a cabana and played in the wave pool and lazy river all day. The drinks and food delivered so we didn't have to leave was the best part about The Beach. Luckily, we have been able to find other places with similar offerings that understand my reservation means I expect my arrival is anticipated. Sincerely, <my name>

Reviews.Title: “Rather Stay at Mandalay Bay”
Reviews.Author: Spalaw
Reviews.Content: I’ve stayed at about 10 different major strip hotels and just returned from my first stay at THEhotel. I could compare this hotel to other hotels, but I think the real question is whether there is good reason to stay at THEhotel instead the main hotel at Mandalay Bay. For me, the answer is no. If you prefer rooms that are a bit more upscale, and a location that is more separated from the action, then you may like THEhotel. It’s definitely more quiet and low-keyed, and would be good for business travelers or people wanting less of a Vegas-style property. However, most areas of the hotel, including the rooms, are dimly lit and decorated in a dark color scheme, making the hotel feel too dark. There is a “basement” feel to this hotel that I really didn’t like, which starts with the valet area at the bottom of a parking garage. The whole place feels more like a boutique hotel near a busy airport rather than a Vegas-Strip hotel. This was also the first time in my many recent visits to Vegas that I had to wait for a room despite arriving at normal check-in time. In all fairness, this was also the first time that I was traveling with others and we wanted 3 rooms close together, but a 2 ½ hour wait for our rooms was way too long. The maid service just couldn’t seem to keep up with the check-out’s that day, which was evident by all the trash bags strewn along the halls outside the rooms. Although we had a reservation for a suite, we eventually opted to take a smaller deluxe room which was available and received a credit for the difference. The following day the maid realized our bed was actually missing the comforter. I thought the room itself was actually pretty nice and had some nice features, but the bathroom was a problem. Although a decent size, there were no towel bars and no real space for laying out or storing things. The tub-shower was also pretty cumbersome in that the edges were very high and you literally had to climb into the tub. I think that could be a real problem for some people. We probably would have been happier with a suite which has a considerably larger bathroom. Frankly, the best part of THEhotel is that it is connected to the Mandalay Bay resort, which is a great resort and the real reason to stay there in the first place. That said, I see no reason to stay at the pricier THEhotel over Mandalay Bay. Mandalay Bay has probably the largest and one of the nicest standard rooms of any 4 diamond property on the Strip. The rooms are bright, comfortable and nicely decorated, and provide more central access to the resort. Unlike THEhotel, it also feels like you are staying at a Vegas Strip hotel, which to me is the way it should be. My next stay at Mandalay Bay will not be at THEhotel.

Reviews.Title: “Need new management”
Reviews.Author: arawlins1
Reviews.Content: System failure. I checked in during the early evening and my room wasn't ready till 8pm. They graciously gave me a food credit for this inconvenience. However, it seemed like this was not a rare occurrence. The front desk always had long lines. I observed a convention group check in that looked like utter chaos. Later, I overheard a women saying that she had waited 50 minutes to check in. They need to hire more people and pull names and rooms for groups ahead of time. They obviously also need more housekeeping people to prepare rooms in a more timely manner. The hotel is very hip and modern. The living room, separate bedroom and two baths were nice. I have never had to pay for inroom coffee before....kind of tacky. The beach, lazy river set up is fun but be prepared for lots of crowds and loud music. In all we got a very good price for this hotel and had a good time. It is just sad to see a nice hotel that could be so much better with a top notch management team.

Reviews.Title: “worst experience... not worth it”
Reviews.Author: user332
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. When I checked in they said they don't have any two queen beds available even though I had reserved it so they put us in a single bed room until the next day when we had to move. Even then, they said they would call me, which they never did and they had the nerve to tell me that somebody did call me and left a message. They room was very noisy, not from people but from pipes and other hotel sounds. I had to constantly call the front desk to check on my room. The internet did not work the whole time. We called the front desk and they said someone would come up to check on it but nobody came. The bed sheets had some pizza sauce or red stains on the inside of it. We found a few red bull cans on the ground by the night stand.

Reviews.Title: “Ehhhh - Not so impressed”
Reviews.Author: trentsgal
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler to Las Vegas, for both leisure and business. Mandalay Bay is one of my properties. "THE HOTEL" at Mandalay Bay is marketed as the "up-scale, chic" version of the property. I had been curious, but never stayed in the rooms at 'The Hotel" For this trip, I had reserved a suite at Mandalay Bay, and when they offered to "upgrade" me to "the Hotel", I accepted - mostly out of curiosity. Perhaps I am not the "young, chic, up-scale, sophisticated" client towards which "THe Hotel" is marketed. Maybe all of its ambience and style is lost on a married, middle-aged mom from the suburbs. 1st, when you check in, you have to schlep your stuff ALL THE WAY ACROSS THE CASINO! I hate that. The elevators for the rooms at Mandalay Bay are right next to the registration desk, which is ultra convenient. Also - the hike to the pool - one of the coolest things about Mandalay Bay - from "The Hotel" -requires a trail of breadcrumbs and it's a good idea to pack a lunch before you head out. The thing that I love most about the rooms at Mandalay Bay are the bathrooms. They are HUGE. WIth a double sink vanity, a separate shower and soaking tub and enough floor space to hold a square dance. By contrast, the bathroom in my suite at "The Hotel" is a small closet. Really small. TIny. And disappointing :-(. The furnishings in the "living room" are old and worn. The TV's in both the living room and bedroom are old school, out dated models. I don't come to Las Vegas to watch TV, but in a 4 star resort, I expect the accessories to at least be comparable to what I have at home. This is supposed to be a "get away". A treat. A break from your everyday world. I will be back to Mandalay Bay - but I will not ever again accept an "upgrade" to "the Hotel"

Reviews.Title: “Just okay. Have had better experience at other hotels”
Reviews.Author: Tjuntist
Reviews.Content: We had a v suite. They gave us a room on the back of the hotel but we still had a side view of the strip and a good view of the mountains. The room is good. Very well laid our and the best parts would be the Tvs and the 1.5 bathroom. The most disappointing part of our stay was that the bathroom was not cleaned very well. Hair in tub, dirty sink and the bathroom amenities were not what we expected. The place is very nice and it is quiet compared to Mandalay bay but still offers good access to the casino. We had a conference to attend at Mandalay and that is why we stayed here but if we had to go back to Vegas for pleasure we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Oasis in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lgaynor
Reviews.Content: Nestled inside the sprawling Mandalay Bay complex that is also home to the Four Seasons, TheHotel is a 1200 room tower away from the convention hall madness. Opened in 2003, the property is nearing its 10 year anniversary and the suites are in serious need of an update. Still, each room is a two-room suite and very nice. The main room features a couch, TV, desk and wet bar. The bedroom is standard with a decent bathroom. A huge plus is the second guest bathroom off the main entrance. What is really nice about TheHotel is the intimacy. The spa and fitness room are both excellent. The Cafe has the among the best breakfast and lunch in Vegas (closed for dinner). The coffee bar rivals Starbucks although one is a short distance away. And the bar serves up good martinis and glasses of wine. The signature restaurant, MIX, at the top floor, is worth at least having a cocktail. Part of the bar is open with lounging couches and decent chairs to overlook the Strip. If MGM Resorts can find the money to update this property, it can regain its top status.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Stolidoli
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 5 night stay in THEhotel. Enjoyed the pool, but get there early or you will not get a chair. As a hotel gust, you don't pay to go up to Mix Lounge (at night), and you must go up there and stop in the bathroom while you're there. Just know that there is a dress code to go up there. The room itself was lovely, very modern, but the best part was having two bathrooms. It was annoying that the fridge couldn't be used without paying for the minibar, the resort fee was a meaningless extra charge, and also no ice service anywhere (had to get it by the glass from the bar downstairs) but I don't think this is unique to this hotel in Vegas so I can't really fault them for it. D learn how to use the bus, because cabs are expensive from this location. But on the plus side, we did get a good night's sleep every night and I'm not sure I could say that if we were in the middle of the strip. For on-site food, we enjoyed Raffles Cafe and Hussong's for cheap-ish eats.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Natalie A
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here in August and we loved it! Beautiful hotel. Very clean and modern. Walking in, it was quiet and no lingering smell of cigarette. It still felt like you were in Vegas, but it was so toned down. Just a short walk from the lobby is the actual casino at Mandalay Bay, it's a nice change of pace from the loud over bearing hotels and casinos. The hotel room is a very nice size. Most rooms have a living room, bedroom, two bathrooms, soak tub, large shower and two TV's. It's a lovely change of pace from the standard small rooms of hotels. Very spacious and super clean. Room service was a little pricey, but what hotel isn't? And yes it can take a little longer than usual, but again,what hotel doesn't? My only qualm was the "Do Not Disturb" and "Housekeeping" button. My sister and I are earlier risers, we left our hotel room and pushed the housekeeping button and when we returned at 3pm, the room was still not cleaned. We called housekeeping and they informed us that our Do Not Disturb button was on. This was not true, we both checked, but they did send someone up to clean the room. I love the modern feel of the hotel, and how quiet it is. But a short walk your in the casino. It's fantastic. I highly recommend this place. Best hotel on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Good upscale hotel”
Reviews.Author: MumJakeShy
Reviews.Content: Nice room, good size & decor. No coffee in room & mega line-ups at lobby cafe :( which is inconvenient. Extra charges for everything (wi-fi/internet, fitness facility etc) on top of a pricey base. Not unusual, but seems cheap on their part. There are so MANY hotels in Vegas, I'm going to look for one that includes the basics in their fee.

Reviews.Title: “What a view from a great room!”
Reviews.Author: Angela R
Reviews.Content: Nice service with a wonderful room! I love the decor and atmosphere. Our stay was so nice. I love THE HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Big Room Small Value”
Reviews.Author: GraceH33304
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay at THEhotel at Mandalay Bay, I had read many good things and I had already stayed at Mandalay Bay in the past. I had been working hard and wanted some additional pampering I was hoping this would be the place. I can defiantly state the room was large and I loved the bathroom roomy enough for two people to use at the same time in the morning and the addition of a second bathroom was fantastic. OK that is the positive. I have never stayed in a hotel that actually charged you to make your own coffee in your room or to use the refrigerator that is already in the room. I felt this was a bit like penny pinching since you are already charged an additional resort fee and resort fee taxes above the rate of the room. Time to wash the carpets and replace the office chair in the rooms the arm on mine was broken fell off every time you touched it, my call to the front desk to have it replaced resulted in waiting a day and a half to have it glued on instead of being replaced. Nor to mention when you call the front desk with issues they treat you with a less then caring manner, as if you are brothering them un-necessarily with unimportant details? Room service was another disappointment and a unique lesson in patients, after 90 minutes I called down to room service to see what could possibly be the problem only to be told there was no record of my order ever being placed which was a surprise to me since I spoke with room service for 15 minutes when I placed the order, they asked me to hold on and then I was disconnected. Once more I made the mistake of calling the front desk to complain, and was treated rudely and told there was nothing they could do I would have to speak with the Food Service Manager, I guess I should have somehow know that and not bothered them. Now it is 11:00PM still no food I call and ask to speak with the room service manager and I am told she is in a meeting OK this tells me one of two things, room service has many problems occurring and resolution is constant, or no one wants to address my problem. I am told they will take my number and as soon as she is out of her meeting she will call me back. Guess who calls me back the person I spoke with the first time when I was disconnected, she states she’ll send my order up ASAP which she did the Pizza was undercooked and instead of extra pepperoni as I had ordered I had 10 pieces ? NOT good at all, she did call back to say she would remove the charge for the pizza from my room bill as a courtesy (too little too late for me) Checking out, I wanted to print my boarding pass so I went to the FedEx office as I was directed to do sit in the chair to use the computer to print my boarding pass and guess what the arm of that chair was also broken when I went to get up I fell into the desk as the arm gave way, ok you are crazy if you think I am going to the front desk again, I go to my room pack my bags and go down to get my bill it is 4:00AM I have a 6:00AM flight I am told that my bill is not ready because the hotel’s policy is to shut down the system and run the bills from 4:00AM – 5:00AM, however if I feel out the quick checkout envelope and provide my email address they will email me my bill the next day. You guessed it I had to call the Accounts Receivable department and request a copy of my bill, I did wait 2 days. So you can decide for yourself if this type of treatment will make you feel special then check in and have a ball, because I guess everything is relative to what you are use too and this did not do it for me.

Reviews.Title: “perfect resort for fun in the sun”
Reviews.Author: jalado
Reviews.Content: fantastic pool for both kids and adults hotel luxurious

Reviews.Title: “Got downgraded”
Reviews.Author: jnue
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a conference for 2 nights. I paid via expedia for a large suite and when I showed up they informed me that the room I selected was unavailable and all they could do to compensate was to provide a meal credit. I got a room on high floor but could still hear the music from the beach pool which was annoying. On the plus side the room service was prompt and good and pricey. Overall the stay was ok, with no major gripes with the exception of my downgrade. Staff were pleasant and helpful. The door guy in particular was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: Lori H
Reviews.Content: TheHotel was much more modern than I like but we had TheSuite which was spacious and beautiful. Great storage, double sinks in bath, separate tub and shower, separate toilet room. The bed was comfortable and it was nice to have a powder room and wet bar in the living area. There was lots of lighting options some with dimmers which made the room very comfortable. We arrived at 8:30 a.m. and were told we'd get a text when our room was ready. By 4 pm no text but when I complained we were given a credit for food and drinks and a late checkout. We liked not being in the middle of the casino like Mandalay Bay hotel guests. We still had access to the pool area but it was packed so we chose to pay for entry to Moorea Beach club. It was nice and clean and there was very good service for food and bar drinks.. The guys liked that it was top optional. Obviously children and gawkers are not allowed. The cover for men increases as the club fills up. We liked the House of Blues restaurant and The Mix nightclub which has a fantastic view and no cover if you go early. We booked here because the ACM Fan Jam was on the property but would go back for number of restaurants on the property and 11 acre pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, could have been better”
Reviews.Author: samm_8608
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just came back from 3 nights at thehotel and it wasn't bad. We had gotten a really good deal on this place so I cant be that disappointed with our stay but I was expecting a bit more luxory. But let me just start from the start! Check in, this was actually really good. Very friendly front desk staff, smooth and easy check in, and when I had returned later to ask a question they were super helpful and friendly. And if they did not know the answer they asked someone else for help. Our room was nice, it was big and I didnt find it that worn down, though I do agree that it could use some updating. However that being said I saw that they are updating them in the coming year. Somethings I felt were an easier fix that could have been done, for example the light in the shower had some broken drywall around it, that could have probably been fixed before any big update they are planning. The room was clean when we arrived, the maid however did not come until much later the next day, we had to call at 3pm to ask for them to clean our room. When they did show up they did not restock the amenaties and they did not even clean out or replace the wine glasses we had use the night before. The next day (dont know when they showed up) they left a half full bottle of shampoo on the bathroom counter, I guess that was our restock? But no conditioner. The amenaties themselves werent as good as the website advertised either, the soap was regular bar soap and I didnt find anything special about the shampoo and conditioner. We didnt try any of the resturants so can't speak to those. Overall if I got a really good deal (I think we paid about $450 each for flight and hotel, three nights/4 days) I would maybe stay because I loved having the extra space and the large bathtub was great to have, but I would never pay what this hotel normally goes for.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel.... The best!!”
Reviews.Author: Kim W
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite places to stay. I love the staff and the environment. I was there in Feb. 2012 and I and going back tomorrow for a 5 night stay. Every time I stay here I am never disappointed. I high recommend TheHotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Gold and Platinum Club members, don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joe M
Reviews.Content: This was my first (and only) stay at the Mandalay Bay, and I have to say that with the exception of the wait staff at RM and the Bath house, and the nice woman at the Player's club, this trip was a total disappointment. I will stick to the facts and let you make your own decisions. The Good: Rick Moonen's Seafood was outstanding! We ordered the "Kitchen Sink" seafood platter for two, and ate like kings on our first night in Vegas. Shrimp, lobster, clams, mussels, oysters, and ceviche; By the time we finished, we were completely satiated. The wait staff at RM was outstanding-keeping both our alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks filled without having to ask, and ensuring that any sides or sauces were needed were only a quick request away. The "Bathhouse" was also outstanding and on par with the Aria and MGM Grand. Staff members were very friendly, and the deep tissue I received was probably the best I have had in Las Vegas. My girlfriend had the aromatherapy massage, and said the everything was adjusted during her session to what she felt she needed. Add to that the fact that the spa was not overcrowded like some of the other hotels, and you have a winning combination for your "pre-return home" spa visit. The Bad: I forgot to give my player's club card to the waiter on Thursday, so we stopped back by RMs on Friday to ask if they would credit our account. Both managers on duty told me they couldn't help me because the books had already been closed out for the previous day. After a little more pressure and some requests from my girlfriend, I was finally told that I would have to call the bookkeeping office on Monday to see if they could help me. Really? What ever happened to management taking the lead? In this instance, the wait staff definitely out-performed the senior staff. Because of this experience with the folks in charge at Rick Moonen's, we spent most of our time gambling at other MGM properties for the remainder of our trip. We DID decide to give hotel dining a second chance during our trip and stopped by Mizuya for sushi. The sushi was ok, but the wait for our food was lengthy. We ordered two rolls and two pieces of nigiri, and ended up waiting 35 minutes. I can't blame the servers, as they were doing the best they could. I definitely would not recommend this restaurant if you are looking for quick service. The Ugly: Kids are EVERYWHERE at this hotel. Every morning during our entire stay, we were woken by the sounds of children screaming or yelling and parents yelling at them and slamming doors. Start at 6 am and move forward until 9 am. The sound proofing in this hotel is on par with a military barracks. Don't expect to get a single good night's sleep if you stay here. When I asked a co-worker of mine about his room (he was visiting at the same time), he told me that he and his wife were having the same problem. I was hoping that the Excalibur would be the only "playground" hotel in the MGM family, but unfortunately, this just doesn't seem to be the case. Saving grace: I went to the players club to just before our departure, and the young lady there was kind enough to offer to credit my account for our dinner at Rick Moonen's (How hard was it for her to offer to do that?) Just a little effort goes a long way with me. That is pretty much the only reason I gave THEhotel 2 starts instead of one.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!! :-)”
Reviews.Author: Matsounet
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night in March and took advantage of one of the most incredible deals for a midweek stay. Price started at 88 $, so upgraded for a V-Suite (104 $ or something). I agree from other reviewers, the entrance to THEhotel is a bit "hidden", not really Grand but once inside it's awesome to arrive in a quiet peaceful place in Las Vegas! Very friendly staff a check in. Suite was not ready yet as I arrived even before lunch time, no problem as they stored my luggage for the day. On return I asked for the key and went up to ... 38th floor (above no more suites, only condo's). What a nice surprise when I opened the door ... the V-suite had full frontal view of the Strip! Actually that night I slept with the curtains open as the bed is facing the Strip! :-)) It is indeed al getting a bit dated and tired but honestly for such a rate I am not gonna complain! It's always hard to say in Vegas if I would come back again because each time there might be a newer resort, hotel, casino but I could definitely be tempted!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but pricey”
Reviews.Author: illinicheme
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas frequently (2-3 times per year) and have stayed in many of the hotels on the Strip. Lately we've been staying at Total Rewards properties (mostly Bally's) because we can get those rooms very cheap. This time, we decided to splurge because our anniversary was a couple of weeks ago. It was nice to stay somewhere higher end again, but it does cost a lot compared to other options. Our first suite smelled like pot smoke, so we were switched to a second suite with no hassle. We had a great view of the Strip from the 34th floor. The mattress was too soft for my taste, but otherwise the room was very good. I LOVED the giant bathtub. Charging $4 for a disposable coffee cup was beyond ridiculous though (fortunately I don't drink coffee, and my husband just did without for a couple of mornings). The pool at the Mandalay Bay is fantastic - probably the most fun in Vegas with the lazy river and wave pool. Since we were there in late March, it was a bit cool, but that meant it also wasn't crowded. (At the height of the summer, it's nearly impossible to get a chair at the pool.) We did experience one rude floor person in the Mandalay Bay casino. The dealers were making fun of my husband for counting his money before handing it in to color up, and the floor person said "dude - trust me!" and then proceeded to count the chips incorrectly, trying to short us at least $25. Then he refused to apologize. We ended up getting a buffet comped after complaining to his manager. It was a good thing it got comped, because it was a excellent reminder that the buffet is TERRIBLE and totally not worth it at normal prices. Overall a decent experience. We'll certainly stay at the Mandalay property again, but I'm not sure the premium for a THEhotel suite is worth it over a normal Mandalay Bay room.

Reviews.Title: “Would never recommend this place”
Reviews.Author: jennifer h
Reviews.Content: I heard so many good things about this hotel - so i gave it a shot for a conference. At check in they were not able to fulfill my reservation. Gave me 2 double beds and smoking floor, rather than one king bed on non-smoking. Room service food is TERRIBLE, and it was $45 for chicken alfredo. Waited over 45min for a bellman to bring me toothpaste - who ended up never showing up to my room - I had to leave for the conference and brush my teeth in a bathroom on the walk over. Finally got my room changed to a king bed, non-smoking - when I climbed in bed the sheets had dried blood on them. Waited 30 min for housekeeping and checked out the next morning. Price was more than double other hotels in the area - and the money i saved on the room i would rather pay in taxi fares. Would never recommend someone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience-fair review of hotel @ mandalay bay”
Reviews.Author: Jritacc
Reviews.Content: Overall good experience @ The Hotel at Mandalay Bay. Rooms were clean and spacious. We had a suite with one and a half baths which was nice. Room was quiet for the most part considering Vegas is a 24/7 city. We did hear a pipe in the walls squeak and occasionally make noise. Our guess is the pipes made noise when the guest above used their bathroom. Also the hotel is relatively new, 4 years old, yet there were some cracks In the tile of the lobby and the hallway carpet was somewhat worn. However the pros outweighed the cons. The pool was great! The Hotel is at the south end of the strip, away from alot of the action. If you are looking for the busy part of the strip would suggest staying further up. If not its a nice oasis from the strip. Also, it woud have been nice to have complimentary coffee in the hotel room. Otherwise its $3.00 a cup.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel for above average price”
Reviews.Author: JoshM1515
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at THE hotel and will probably be our last. We come to Vegas usually at least twice a year and typically stay at Harrah's properties because we get great rates due to our player cards, but this stay was to celebrate my 30th birthday so we decided to splurge a bit. There was nothing particularly wrong with the rooms, but just expected more due to the reputation of the hotel. We also requested a room on a higher floor with a view, but ended up on the 10th floor (out of 64) with a view staring into the Luxor pyramid. Also was a bit irked that the room rates I booked through M life were lower than the rates when I got to the hotel. Unfortunately, the confirmation provided through M life doesn't list the rates per night and every time we tried to go to the VIP desk to get it resolved, there wasn't anyone working there. And of course when we had to check out early on Monday morning to make our 6am flight, their computers were down. The main thing we enjoyed were all the restaurant options in Mandalay Bay, as we are avid foodies. But unfortunately, the restaurants didn't make up for the poor experience at THE hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So Nice and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: agape1026
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at THEhotel. It was our first time at this hotel and it was like we were in a different city all together after walking through loud casino and band noise from MB hotel and others that we visited. We enjoyed the fun of the city but really liked coming back to our quiet oasis. I liked having a separate sitting area so I could read and work while my husband watched tv in the bedroom. I was extremely surprised however that the coffee in the room was NOT free. And the resort fee was expensive; especially for not having free coffee like every hotel in the world. the cafe prices were reasonable - coffee was $4 but refills. :) I hope to be able to go back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “TheHotel was not TheBomb...”
Reviews.Author: Gettin_My_Travel_On
Reviews.Content: My goal is to stay at every type of hotel in Vegas, so this go round it was time for to give TheHotel at Mandalay Bay a try. At check-in the chick at the desk asks us if we've stayed with them before, our answer was no. So then she starts to tell us how much more exclusive and top of the line this all suite luxury resort was in comparison to the Mandalay Bay. I was like ok cool at 300 a night thats what I'm talking about. We're checked into a suite on the 28th floor and head on up to get the weekend started. Room was just al-rite. Bed was comfy, tub was huge, t.v. was an old school silver toned Phillips tube, what???? No HD flat screen? They need to upgrade that, like immediatly. Then it was in a cabinet that had doors that when open took up the walk space between the bed and the walkspace! I just expected more from this spot.... O well, on the the ARIA next :)

Reviews.Title: “Dark Rooms Old Modern Style”
Reviews.Author: Nucleoplasty
Reviews.Content: Wad underwhelmed by my stay at The Hotel. The rooms were dark and user unfriendly. The curtains cumbersome compared to the resort on the other end of the strip with remote control for the curtains and lights next to my bed. Outside room was narrow and I never used it as a result. My sheets were stained when I checked in. The maid told me it was just from the cleaning machines and not to worry about. Bed is below grade in comfort compared to competers of same class. Linens were college tacky from the 1990s. Bath mat frayed. Remote TV checkout didn't work. Bar in lobby "sometimes open to 2" but closed so early that it left the lobby lifeless. On the positive side, the bathrooms were great and I loved the TV in it. Glad the management is planning a renovation as it needs it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, large resort fee”
Reviews.Author: Silver54
Reviews.Content: Resort fee is 28.00 per night so be aware ahead of time. Booked this hotel thru Priceline and got a good rate but if you add on the 28 dollars wasn't so great. We checked in at Mandalay Bay checkin desk, don't do that as you will be asked to walk clear around the casino to get to the The hotel. Be sure and go around to the back side and park in self parking or valet to be able to access the hotel. The rooms were beautiful spacious, and what a bathtub. Mandalay Bay is very big so be prepared to walk alot!!

Reviews.Title: “Its time to start over”
Reviews.Author: jdrrr567
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at the hotel 6 times over the last 7 years, yes i live here, but we sometimes do a 3 day staycation. it was teh finest and best on the strip with luxury affordable, beautiful and great place to be until about 2 years back, its simply tired, run down,old looking now and the staff needs to be changed to bring back people who care, they seem to be worn out to and tired. to bad it lost what it had, its not to late to bring it back, but to ignore it and let it be will result in more and more reviews like mine and others, which in a city with hundreds of hotels, is not good for your pocket book. just 3 years back i would give this place a solid 5 star, must stay, beautiful place, now i would only suggest it over motel 6

Reviews.Title: “Escape the Turmoil”
Reviews.Author: rankin2010
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at THEhotel. I was there for a trade show at the Mandalay. After a hard day, it is refreshing to escape the din and turmoil of the casino next-door. This is the quiet side of the facility. Very relaxing. The room was comfortable and clean. Easy to get up the next day and go back to work after a good night's sleep. I was on an expense account, so the cost was not the issue as the company chose the location. It was too expensive for my pocketbook but wonderful on someone else's. Each night became more expensive as the NCAA basketball tournament began. I could and would have swung the first night. The last of three nights was well above my budget.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Kamabuki
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. One of the reasons for booking this hotel was that the suites had a separate bedroom from the living room area. My wife is an early riser so she was able to go in the living room while I continued to sleep and I could come in late at night without waking her. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The commons area down stairs are little dark but overall well kept. Its a short walk down a hallway to get to the casino area of the Mandalay Bay. A few days before our arrival, we had received an email from the Mandalay Bay, saying that the "Beach" pool area had opened for the season, we were disappointed to find that the "beach" pool had not opened yet. Next time we visit Vegas, we would probably not stay here again and opt for a hotel more in the center of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere - Terrible Service, Dirty rooms, Ripped us off.”
Reviews.Author: LLeeson
Reviews.Content: I visited Vegas for the third time for my birthday this month with my husband and our friends. The trip was not cheap and I booked Thehotel because I'd heard it was a good hotel. My experience does not back that up. When we arrived at 4pm after travelling for 15 hours there was no room for us even though check in is 4pm. We were asked if we wanted double or twin rooms and both couples said double. We were told that the maid was currently in our room and they asked for our mobile phone number and promised to call when the room was ready. An hour later, we had no call so we went back to front desk. A different receptionist said that they wouldn't call our mobile so she didn't know why her colleage had taken it but that the rooms were ready ( and had been for some time). We went to our room. It was a twin, not a double. The carpets were stained, there was a fixture missing in the bathroom and the plug hole was full of hair. I rang reception but was told they couldn't change rooms until the next day and I had to ring then. The next day was my birthday so my husband went to front desk. They promised him that they would switch our room and deal with our luggage for us. They said they would call him when it was done. He had no call so we went to front desk later that afternoon. The room hadn't been switched. The receptionist knew nothing of the arrangements and said they would never offer to move bags for us! I asked to speak to a manager and she was both apologetic and pleasant and gave us $200 credit. Our room was moved - we moved our bags ourselves. When we checked out we had mini bar charges on the bill despite never having keys for the mini bar. We also had a total of over $375 of resort fees - even though our rate with our tour operator included these. I raised this at front desk but they were adamant that fees were not included. Eventually on return to the UK my tour operator contacted Thehotel and they have now refunded the fees. However, I've just checked my bank statement and Mandalay Bay have managed to rip us off again. We purchased tickets for three attractions on their 3 for $54 deal while we were there. I have been charged 3 x $36. Mandalay Bay do not provide an email address for customers - just a US phone number or address so I either need to call international or write. I've disputed the transactions with my bank but I would strongly suggest that if you are looking for a good hotel with 5 star service in Vegas you go elsewhere. This place will rip you off and offer service better suited to a motel.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: JefferAlbuquerqueNM
Reviews.Content: Checked in on a Monday afternoon. Had a very quick and efficient check in. The staff was pleasant, but not particularly warm and fuzzy. That's fine by me, I prefer competence to a pretense of friendliness. Room was on the 30th floor with a decent view. Overall I very much enjoyed the (or THE) hotel. Hallway carpets did seem to show some wear, but they are a much lighter color that normal hotel carpets. Other than that small issue, everything was well maintained. I had absolutely no problem with the room. Well layed out, with ample amenities. The room was clean and well maintained. Bathroom was large, with upscale toiletries. My only issue is that the tile floors do get slick. But there were multiple bath mats availible. There is a television, phone and (most appreciated) a night light. Having a night light in the bathroom is a amenity that I would like to see more often. Maid service was better than I'm used to. No noise issues, even though I was extremely close to the elevator and service rooms. I particularly liked THEhotel. Peaceful quiet and classy. Competent and efficient staff. Upscale and comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Never again. Best part was checking out.”
Reviews.Author: tigerider
Reviews.Content: One would think that with THEHotel being the upscale tower of Mandalay Bay it would be a great experience. Not in my opinion. Room wasn't ready until late afternoon. Rooms are decent size, but definitely showing some age. TV in bedroom was the old TUBE version with scuffs all over it. If you want to use the gym for cardio you have two options. 1) pay $25 fee for 30 minutes on the treadmill in THEHotel tower or 2) for free trek across the Casino floor and dinning halls to the Mandalay Bay Beach Floor wearing gym clothes. Not sure how that makes sense and who actually does either. Hotel and room were clean, that was the positive take away of the experience. Too many other choices in Vegas in the same price range to be stuck at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Hit or Miss when it came to the Staff”
Reviews.Author: finchbradley
Reviews.Content: Every interaction we had away from the front desk was amazing! Housekeeping, Room Service, random staff members in general all provided the ultimate service you expect. Our first impression however, was left up to a front desk agent who did not know the specs of the room and well, made my husband feel a little stupid... and then later- triumphant lol. He inquired after the Keurig coffee machines in the room and said the rooms did not come with them. When he asked again and said he had seen them in a review online, she told him he must have been mistaken. We asked about the separate tub and shower, and were told that the suites did not have the deep soaking tubs. So we took the elevator up to our room, a little nervous since some of the very amenities we were looking forward to were not going to be there at all. But lo and behold, we entered our room and stared at the Keurig coffee machine, and deep soaking tub. Also, we had called to confirm out reservation through Mlife, and were told that we had a VIP reservation. When we checked in at the front desk, I mentioned "Oh shoot we're supposed to check in VIP." The front desk agent again corrected me that we did not have VIP check in, we only had casino rates... We later spoke to a VIP agent who told us that yes, we did have check in in the VIP lounge. It was all pretty confusing, this desk agent did not seem to know which hotel she was working at.

Reviews.Title: “Fire everyone and Rehire from the Top Down.”
Reviews.Author: viator1
Reviews.Content: After three days at THE Hotel (they should call it THE DISORGANIZATION) I could probably write a dissertation on how not to run a hotel. As anyone can tell by reading my profile or my reviews - I travel extensively and this hotel is probably the worst in customer service GLOBALLY. In terms of comfort the rooms are spacious and they have nice bedding. End table furniture is slightly worn - but forgivable. However - from the time my spouse tried to check in (she arrived 4 hours prior to my arrival) to the time we left - the concierge - the business center manager - the front desk manager failed at the simplest requests and everyone was just outright rude. All of the negative reviews here on TripAdvisor prior to my own should be taken seriously. 1) Apparently there is not one FAX machine in the entire hotel that is operable. I had changed my reservation (purchased through Orbitz) to include my spouse who was arriving 4 hours prior to my own arrival. I called Orbitz EARLY the same morning and they assured me that the reservation was changed and they would FAX THE hotel (since it was THE Hotel's policy to receive a fax to confirm the change) and my spouse would be included on the reservation. Upon my spouses arrival at THE Hotel - the fax wasn't received. I called Orbitz again - and THE Hotel's front desk manager wasn't in receipt of the change in reservation FAX and wouldn't let my spouse check in. The make a long story short - Orbitz insisted they sent the fax five times - THE Hotel was never in receipt and so I had the Front desk manager call Orbitz and three hours later they finally gave my wife a room. No apologies for holding her up - no acknowledgement that something was amiss - nada from THE Hotel's management. 2) Believe me when I say this - everyone was just unbelievably rude. Example - My wife asked the concierge if there was a shuttle to the Fashion Mall - while rolling his eyes - he said "...no...but...you (she) could take a city bus down the strip." He didn't mention that there was a tram that would take her as far as Excalibur or offer and other alternative - not even a cab. Obviously her only option would be the city bus. Same attitude was demonstrated by the Front Desk staff, bell hops, and just about everyone you came in contact with at THE Hotel. 3) The business center. The Orbitz FAX was one incident. In separate instances I had two contracts that were also FAX'ed to THE Hotel which I HAD NEVER RECEIVED. One of the sending parties even confirmed the number twice with the business center and at one point the front desk gave them a second number - TO NO AVAIL !!! Needless to say I never received my contracts. I can only assume that even though THE Hotel requires FAX confirmations for reservation changes - there is not one FAX machine in the entire hotel that is operable - and when I complained - of course they blamed it on me -and I quote - "...(sir) apparently you gave them the wrong FAX number." Really - multiple times ? The front desk manager actually inflected his voice implying I was an idiot. Simply put - this really was one of my worst experiences in 23 years of business travel. I could have given this a "poor" rating - but this was just downright "terrible". The management of this hotel should be fired and they should restaff from the top down. Avoid THE Hotel - you will be doing yourself a disservice if you stay here - the staff is awful - this is not a hotel for business travelers. If you are a tourist and want to be treated like crap - I insist you should stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Facilities getting tired, service worse every year”
Reviews.Author: 77G0rd_T
Reviews.Content: Have been going to theHotel for over 5 years, with a short break to other facilities because of the service deterioration. Was back for a weekend Nascar trip with customers. I would rate this place as mediocre and boring. It is run for the pleasure of theHotel not the pleasure of the guests. No excitement here. From the 3/4 empty "theCafe" refusing to seat me because not all of my guests were down for breakfast at that moment to wanting to us to pay to have some cutlery in the room to the 25 plus 3 dollar mandatory charge for very weak internet and other useless "included" services. Called down to the front desk to talk to the hotel manager to be told "they" were in a meeting. So requested a call-back which of course never occurred. While there were some occurances of acceptable service the general rule here is that they do not care. Spent a lot of time in the casino, but it lacks the excitement you look for in Vegas.
