Went to "the Mix" nightclub and they decided to close early on a Friday night because they did not have enough patrons and hence the liquor sales were not satisfactory to them. I regularly go to Vegas several times per year and have continued to give theHotel another chance because I like the suites there but considering the above and the fact they are a little way from where the action is on the strip I don't think I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined the trip we'd been planning for 2 years!”
Reviews.Author: msq_12
Reviews.Content: Would give this ZERO stars if I could. We planned this trip for 2 years for my daughter's 21st birthday. We PREPAID two SUITES, one for my husband and daughter, one for my brother-in-law. They arrived to find the hotel was overbooked and all they had were two regular rooms. Went to the rooms and found 1 king bed for my husband and 21 year old daughter! After complaints & time they sent up a "free" roll-away bed! I DON'T agree with over-booking reservations, but how do you over-book PREPAID rooms? Pre-paid means the room should sit empty if I don't show, because I've already paid for it! Essentially they took the room I paid for and gave it to someone else...and charged them for it too! After much complaining, they offered a small amount which didn't even cover the difference in room rates!!! Ridiculous! Apparently at one time this was a nice hotel...better check the RECENT reviews for customer service. There is also a mandatory $25/day fee for internet & newspaper...on top of the astronomical room rate! Seems like they're trying to hide this in some way since you can't pay it through your travel service, etc., have to pay it at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: WJG-PR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and has an upscale feel. Room accomodations are excelent.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service-Loved the Suite!”
Reviews.Author: Katrina R
Reviews.Content: From the minute you walk through the door you have a staff member greeting you with a smile. Rooms were SUPER HUGE, clean and comfortable. Floor to ceiling windows give you an amazing panoramic view of the city. If you are looking for a huge suite and great service in Vegas, I highly recommend THEhotel at Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: emdpetey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a Friday and Saturday night in early March. Got a great promotion online paying only $84.00 a night plus daily resort fee and tax. With the plane arriving late at night and checking in at 1am I was kind of worried I would either get the worst room or whatever but I was totally wrong. At check in the wonderful front desk girl stated she ran out of rooms and was upgrading us to a penthouse suite for the same price. What a nice surprise!!!! The room was the hugest I have ever stayed in, in fact larger than my condo!!!! The room or I should say rooms were well appointed with a dining area, 1 and 1/2 bathrooms, a bar, 4 flat screen tvs, and a stereo system with speakers in the ceiling in every room. The full bathroom was enormous with a jacuzzi and a walk in shower. TheHotel is in its own quiet world with its own check in and valet but very close to all the casino excitement of Mandalay Bay. Although the daily resort fee includes the use of the gym, TheHotel guests have to use the Mandalay Bay gym which is a far walk through the casino. TheHotel does have a gym on the second floor but it is not covered under the resort fee, apparently it cost $15 a day if we want to use that one. The resort fee also included use of the Mandalay Beach area but unfortunately the main part of it was closed until later March. I must say everything about this hotel was top notch including the exceptional customer service from every employee I came in contact with. At checkout they even gave us free bottles of water. As many have said if you want the crowds and the noise stay mid strip but if you want a great, quiet all suite hotel close to an awesome casino this is the place for you. Dont let the south strip location of the hotel fool you, yes it is pretty far from the center strip area but there is a tram that runs from Mandalay Bay to Excalibur which runs to 1030pm on weeknights and later on Weekends. Will be definitely staying here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One night stay, not impressed”
Reviews.Author: corp4ever
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week for one night, came in for a business meeting arrived fairly late and was looking for a comfortable night sleep. However the bed was not comfortable at all. The TV's in the room were not HD, heck you can stay at a Hampton Inn and get HD tv. In fact TV in bedroom was not even flat screen. They charge $4 for a cup a coffee from the in-room coffee machine, what a rip off. The arm to the desk chair was broken, noticed this when I sat down in the morning to do some work for my morning meeting. Overall I was not impressed with this room at all. I know most people are not in Vegas to be in there room however I think when they are it should be a comfortable stay especially at the rates they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Truly is THE hotel to stay at in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler009
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights during a conference and have nothing but wonderful things to say about this lovely hotel! The suite was gorgeous, very clean and tastefully decorated with one and a half baths, an incredibly roomy sitting area, a huge master bath, comfortable mattresses with high quality bedding and I very much appreciated the free wifi! The in-room coffee was $4 and that was the only negative comment I have. THEcafe was great for a quick breakfast and the staff throughout the hotel were all welcoming and helpful. I also enjoyed an evening in their fabulous Bathouse spa. THEhotel completely won me over and is my new favorite place to stay in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Sanctuary!”
Reviews.Author: Goteed1
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I'm not a big fan of hotels on the strip, they are just too noisy and crowded. When I stay on the strip, I'm looking for a hotel room that is quiet and comfortable but still has all the amenities and choices I want and The Hotel fit the bill perfectly. The suite was excellent, as others have mentioned, the rooms are large and comfortable. Love the bathroom and especially appreciated the roomy and comfortable bedroom. I arrived early and they had a King Suite with a strip view available, so that was a nice plus. Front desk service was extremely friendly and personable. HOWEVER, they do have that annoying check in service where there are no designated lines, so if there are alot of people waiting it gets a little chaotic. There was an employee helping to direct traffic, but he seemed kind of useless. Besides the quiet comfort of staying here, I also appreciate that I never had to wait in lines for food or elevators etc, just what the doctor ordered. I did take an afternoon in the Bathouse for a workout and use the spa. It was nice, but not as opulent as I was expecting. Nothing wrong with this place at all, but just a little small for a major Las Vegas spa. This place hit all the right notes for me, but the only thing keeping this hotel from a full five star rating is the silly resort fee. It's really dishonest. It was totally disclosed and I agreed to pay it, but I'm just really tired of being nickeled and dimed to death in Las Vegas. As much as I liked this place, I probably won't return here until they stop with this nuisance fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, a definite must try on the strip”
Reviews.Author: TeamLR
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I stayed at this hotel in April of last year. We booked 6 months in advance so got an amazing deal on our package. The rooms are just as pictured, very spacious, and love having the 2 bathrooms and separate bedroom. We enjoyed manicures in the Spa which was lovely and enjoyed some sun by the pool which was very crowded. We had the best lunch ever @ Verandah (Four Seasons). Over all, check in, check out, everything was smooth, no issues. The only reason I wouldn't stay at this hotel again would be location on the strip, which many other reviewers have commented on. It is not a big deal having to do some walking, but at night after a show or meal, you just want to get home to your room, and getting a cab sometimes requires a wait. We did use the tram between the Luxor which saved a bit of walking time, but our next visit we will definitely stay somewhere a little bit more centre strip. If you don't mind walking and are super organized with bus times etc.. then stay here, you will enjoy the calm from the hustle & bustle of the centre strip.

Reviews.Title: “Understated but elegant, courteous staff, a bit pricey...but that's Vegas for you”
Reviews.Author: luvNY94
Reviews.Content: (Actually, I'd give it about 3.5 stars.) The suite was great--2 queen beds with a master bathroom (loved that one) and a separate living room area with a smaller bathroom. It was very clean, both in taste and actual cleanliness. Hard to believe you have to pay for in-room coffee (but again, I guess that's Vegas for you), so we just went downstairs to Starbucks and enjoyed our coffee in the casino. The website I booked the room with charged us a "hotel-imposed fee" of $20, which to my understanding was the resort fee (as stated by the website itself), but then I saw that another "resort fee" of $25 was charged upon checkout (?). Staff was courteous enough. There was one nice bartender (we couldn't decide what new drink to try, so he offered to make us something he thought we'd like, and if we end up not liking it, he'll just scrap that order and make us what we want--he ended up making us a good one, kudos!). One slot machine attendant was curt with us and slow in getting our orders, and our server in the Red, White, and Blue restaurant was not friendly at all. Bottom line, the suite itself is very nice, but I believe some of their staff members could be a little bit friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “Suite was awesome”
Reviews.Author: Benlop
Reviews.Content: We had a nice suite on the 38th floor. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Bigger suite than the Venetian and cheaper. The private entrance to Thehotel was nice. Staff was nice. Rooms were very clean. The only bad thing was, it was way down on the strip. The Monorail was nice and helpful. Overall it was great!!!.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay--highly recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: KrisinKennewick
Reviews.Content: What a hidden treasure! The room was absolutely beautiful! And, the biggest bonus--you didn't have to walk through the smoke filled casino to get to your room!!! It was like a private get-away--Quiet, clean, updated, and comfortable! I found my favorite place to stay in Vegas!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in a Penthouse if you can! Great Views from this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JoeyDunne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days in August 2011. We asked to upgrade to a jacuzzi suite and all they had was a penthouse. The room was massive! We stayed on the 62nd floor and could see Mix next to us and had a clear view over the airport and part of the strip. We were able to enjoy all of the pool amenities that Mandalay Bay had to offer, although it was somewhat of a commute to the pool area. And we also enjoyed the jacuzzi tub that also has a view of the strip and steam shower!! The accommodations were fantastic, service was extremely helpful and I would recommend staying here, especially in a penthouse suite!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but Threadbare”
Reviews.Author: Joanne C
Reviews.Content: I chose The Hotel from the listed offerings for my convention because I was to spend a full week in Las Vegas and decided a suite would be more comfortable. I was very disappointed to find it dark, stuffy, and in need of new bedding and carpeting.The "mountain view" was in the distance while the view was really of the concrete roof below. It was also the second most expensive of the 5 hotels offered. I was first given a queen room with the promise of being moved to a king the next day. After multiple promises, I was finally moved on the 3rd day of my stay. It was very disgusting to see stains on the bed covering and tears on the bed skirt. The bathrooms were the only saving grace; spacious with nice amenities. I would definitely not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Kay P
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another trip to my favorite playground. I have stayed at the Mandalay Bay hotel before and decided to stay at Thehotel at Mandalay Bay this trip. I must say it was very peaceful and relaxing. The staff was professional and nice upon check-in. The room was nice, but some of the furniture does need an upgrade. A small room fridge would be a nice addition to the suites. It is located at th end of the strip, so if you don't want to walk you will need to catch the tram before midnight or take the bus. We normally don't return until the evening anyway, so the distance isn't really a big problem. I would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ScubagirlWisconsin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for my husband and me because we like a quiet place to relax after the loud, craziness of the strip. There was no casino noise in the reception area of the hotel all the way to the elevators. Our room was beautiful. It was really spacious, there was a lot of room for clothes. There were two bathrooms and 3 TVs. I loved the robes and slippers that were provided. We had a view of the airport, which was great for us since we love to watch the planes take off and land. The bed was soft and comfortable. The sheets were soft, and the blankets were warm enough but not too heavy. The master bedroom bathroom was beautiful. The tub was deep, and there were two sinks. The living room was really comfortable. The couch and chair were both comfortable. The staff were super nice and respectful. Check-in and check-out were a breeze. The only complaint I have about the resort is the very small workout room and not enough equipment, but that is minor compared to the rest of the amazing place!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet property”
Reviews.Author: Trevor-EDM
Reviews.Content: Before staying at THEhotel you have the realize where the property is situated. It's at the far end of the strip and while there is a tram (which only runs during certain hours) it's still a distane from all the action. Whether this is good or bad is really up to you and what you expect, however if you are looking to be in the middle of the action this isn't the place to be. THEhotel is a great property to relax at. Nothing is done quickly by the staff at the hotel (which is good and bad). You never get the feeling of being rushed and you never get the feeling of people rushing for you. The property is beautiful and feels upscale. The room was nice, however our TV was broken. Because we were just staying a night we did not request to have it fixed (as it was late at night by the time we turned it on) however when we informed the clerk at check-out about it he really didn't seem to care. Hopefully he made a note after he finished checking us out to have it fixed for the next person. Other than the TV issues the room was just as you would expect out of a property of this level. While it is a little older than Encore, Cosmo, etc... it still provides you with a great room. We had breakfast at TheCafe and while it was good it did not stand out over any of the other hotel restaurants we have ate at for breakfast in Vegas. What stood out was that you weren't right in the middle of a casino gaming floor while eating and it was nice to have some quiet time to relax and chat. Mandalay Bay was a short walk from THEhotel (all covered) which gave us access to more entertainment/gaming options and the tram. With the weather being reasonable (spring time) the walk to neighbouring hotels, such as the Luxor didn't feel that far. Because of the hotel being at the far end it seems like it is a little deceiving, that you are expecting it to be farther away from other hotels than it actually is. THEhotel is perfect for those who are looking for a getaway that allows them to relax in their hotel and enjoy a less dramatic gaming experience (at the Mandalay Bay versus other hotels). If you are a go-go-go person who only wants a place to sleep it does not really seem like it's for you. Get a place in the action surrounded by hotels with more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “My go to Vegas hotel.”
Reviews.Author: manyhatsforme
Reviews.Content: I love staying at THEhotel. Nice rooms, big bathrooms and bathtubs. Toiletries smell amazing. It is at the far end of the strip so you have to do lots of walking, but it's good for you, right? You don't notice after a few drinks anyways. THEcafe was good for breakfast, not many other great food choices at the Mandalay. We ate mostly further down or off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Steve D
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in Feb. for my wife's birthday. Her first trip to Vegas. We loved calling THEhotel home. Very comfortable, clean, and easy on the eyes...sorta like her! Beautiful, quiet, and elegant. We were out and about the whole time and came back tired and ready to rest. Did notice the interior walls were a little thin so if you have a noisy neighbor you'll know it, but we were lucky. Especially enjoyed breakfast at House of Blues, lunch at Ri Ra, and had a great birthday dinner at Strip Steak. Elevators were FAST and smooth, and we only encountered cheerful, helpful staff and had mostly OUTSTANDING servers. Other than not being in the center of the strip, this was the perfect base for our visit and we'd love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “What used to be great is still good!”
Reviews.Author: MadhatterFL
Reviews.Content: So, after making the Cosmopolitan my go to place in Vegas all last year, I decided to give my buddy, who is a VIP Manager at Mandalay bay, a shot. How had me upgraded to THEhotel, which is a very nice property . . . but overall, Cosmo is still more of a destination. The V Suite is very nice and roomy, and has a nice layout. Views from Mandalay are still outstanding . . . The bed was comfortable . . . nice toiletries. Not a biggie, but the Iron was broken, and the Maids never showed up when extra pillows were requested . . . This is a better quality place, these things should be easy. Mandalay itself needs some help . . . a couple of the restaurants are going through a cahnge . . . and other than Mix & Foundation, there is nor REAL club at this property. That said, the Buffet is pretty good, but the available eating establishments need to step up their game . . . If the trade show I attend was not at Mandalay, I probably wouldn't stay there, but that said, it is very convenient to the CC . . . and beats the heck out of LVH if you need to be at the LVCC. So, if you need to be at Mandalay bay CC, this is the bet, other than that, its just another hotel in LV!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mwderm
Reviews.Content: I guess i expected too much after going to to mandalay Bay six years ago. While the layout of the room was nice, the quality of linens was poor. The towels were thin and scratchy and smelled like burnt from ironing. Sheets barely satisfactory the desk chair was cracking and the sofa no support at all No turndown service The whole hotel was dark. The hotel food served at my conference was not good. At least room service hamburger was good but not much of a menu Casino smoky. Subpar mini-bar. No beer? No red wine? At least the staff from checking to servers were all friendly. That's a big plus. Having stayed recently at mandarin oriental (heavenly) and Wynn and Wynn encore. This was a big step down.

Reviews.Title: “The best in 41 years of going to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: WWLL
Reviews.Content: I was in Las Vegas for a couple of days last week. I won $50 gambling. The highlight was the stay at THEHotel at Mandalay Bay. See the pictures. I usually go for the cheapest place to stay in Las Vegas. All the low-end places are about the same, clean, utilitarian and without character. But that is all I need. I have also tried the high-end places, Wynn, Encore, Caesar's Palace, Bellagio etc. THEHotel at Mandalay Bay is my best hotel experience in 41 years of going to Las Vegas. THEHotel at Mandalay Bay is a separate tower. The casino, restaurants, pool etc are in the attached Mandalay Bay. So THEHotel at Mandalay Bay is very quiet and relaxing. My suite is a living room and a bedroom, over 700 square feet. I have three televisions, a DVD player, an iPod dock, two toilets, a shower and a deep bathtub. The resort fee included internet. When I complained the internet cable was half broken, a technician came within 10 minutes to fix it. The internet connection was fast and reliable. I really like the lighting here. I usually complain about the bad lighting in hotel rooms for reading. I paid $105 per day including taxes and the resort fee. For that I might not even get a hostel in Hong Kong. The trouble with such a nice room is you don't want to go out and win money!

Reviews.Title: “Must check this out!!”
Reviews.Author: hawk1tdh
Reviews.Content: We stayed for Superbowl this year and attended the Super Bowl party!!! What a fun time. The Hotel at Mandalay Bay is awesome!!! It is very relaxing as it is off the path to some private time for relaxing....(What happens in Vegas stays on facebook forever :) Any way the room is very nice and very comfortable! It was a 1 bedroom suite with a bath and a half!! A wet bar and fridge stocked with some "good stuff"! All the people are so awesome!!! This is a place you will want to check out for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Better than most, but a little dowdy and in need of updating”
Reviews.Author: jncd2000
Reviews.Content: It may sound hypercritical, but this hotel has been around for 6 years as a separate hotel and is now showing it. I stayed at it for the first time about 4 years ago and it was up to date and showed well, but this recent stay was surprising for a number of reasons: The smell of smoke was pervasive throughout the hotel, something that seems to be ameliorated at other, like, hotels Carpet in the hallways was worn and soiled There was no turndown service My first room had a lamp that had been torn off from the desk initially and was on the floor My first room had two non-functioning remote controls Room service used food items were left for over a day in the hall The TV in the master bedroom is about 7 years old (a tube TV that is flat screen, but not up to date) The spa is sparsely appointed and depressing, with little or no food to go along with the $25 a day charge Check in at the front was often backed up 1/2 way down the hall No free Wall Street Journals for guests (they do offer USA Today, however) If they are trying to compete with the Wynn/Encore and Venetian/Palazzo, they need to step it up a notch and redo/renovate these areas. I was there for a meeting and it was fine (after my third room), but had I been paying for it I wouldn't have been too happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cadillac5549
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December with a convention, it was wonderful! Loved having a bath and a half. Check in was easy and friendly, rooms were spacious, modern and very clean. Great toiletries! Lots of closet space. Bring comfortable shoes if you are attending a convention, it is a long walk to the hall and the ballrooms. This hotel has become one of our favorites in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place overall.”
Reviews.Author: shane560
Reviews.Content: My wife and my two daughters stayed at The Hotel for 5 days. I think the rooms are all suites which I liked very much. The service was very good from everybody. We ordered room service twice and it was always quick, food was good, and great service. The casino is a short 2 min. walk from the room. The casino was nice and much more quite than many other of the casinos. If your looking to party or just hang in the hotel there are some great bars in the casino that are alot of fun. Negatives:The hotel is at the very end of the strip so if you want to get anywhere you have to take a taxi or expect a long walk. My feet and legs were tired from walking on most days. Our shower was horrible. The temperature would go from very cold to very hot. We could not get it to stay on one temp. during our entire visit. Overall: Although we had a great time and the rooms were great overall I would probably stay somewhere else on the strip only becuase after walking around there are alot of great looking hotels and I would want to try something different. Bellagio, Wynn, and the Aria are on my list to try.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Alternative in the Home of Mega-Hotels”
Reviews.Author: insecret9
Reviews.Content: With our usual spot, the Four Seasons, sold out for the Super Bowl, we booked through AMEX and they recommended The Hotel. It has been several years since I stayed there, but it is still pretty chic and a credible alternative. The AMEX Select Hotels programs gets you a a few perks, $100 food credit and an upgrade. We arrived early on Super Bowl Sunday and after a bit of begging the receptionist got us in to our rooms early. Excellent service. V Suites are ample sized and well-appointed. Bar- The Lounge- has a very good evening vibe. Only complaints- I noticed room service left outside multiple rooms for several hours and the work out room was as expected a bit small. Overall the hotel is more romantic and intimate that classy. Felt a bit odd for a guys Super Bowl trip, but would go back again, only next time with my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: mark c
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal (booked from LA for sun-wed at short notice) the Hotel is a boutique self contained part of the main hotel. Huge room, stunning views but whilst its on the strip, it's bit of a walk to the main action. All the resort facilities of the Mandalay Bay make it worth it though. Especially the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ABCC64
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation at Mandalay Bay and upon arrival very late Thursday night, they could only offer my husband and myself a room with double beds due to a convention that had been going on during the week. The receptionist quickly offered us a room with a king bed at THEhotel for a $20 per night upgrade, which we accepted. We were amazed at the size of the room upon arrival. We had a corner suite on the 14th floor with a view of the strip from the bedroom and a view of the airport from the living room. (Room 14916 I think) Each room was very spacious, clean and well maintained. The suite had 1.5 bathrooms and there was a television in each room, including the bathroom. Absolutely no complaints with the room. In hindsight, we probably would not return to this hotel complex ONLY because it is so far away from the rest of the strip. We spent a lot of time taking the tram and monorail to get to the places we wanted to go. There was still a lot of walking to get between the tram and monorail. I love to walk, but I was tired! We are not really gamblers, so we didn't thoroughly check out the casino. We only walked through. Since we stayed in February, the pool was closed for the season. Truthfully, we never even saw it. I hear it is amazing. We used the spa at Mandalay bay, which was very nice. We had a fabulous long weekend and were blessed with warm sunny weather. We had not been to Las Vegas in probably 9 years and it has changed a lot. Saw the Elton John show at Caesar's and O at the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality was lacking at the front desk.”
Reviews.Author: Ambibery
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend here for a friend's bachelorette party. I couldn't be more disappointed with the service by the front desk. We had a reservation for two suites that were booked months ahead. Checking in, they first tried to ship us to two non-suites at Mandalay Bay because they were "overbooked." 2 hours after check in started. Despite the fact that half of us arrived at 9:30 am, checked in bags and were told they would make a note we had arrived and "link" the two rooms. Once they had sufficiently stressed out our bride, they came up with two suites for us to stay in. 15 floors apart. The "non smoking" suite they gave us smelled like three cartons of cigarettes. I'm asthmatic. So is my best friend. We called back down to the front desk to ask if there was anything they could do. They promised an air purifier, they sent a man with a gallon of aerosol air freshener. Pretty sure he emptied the whole can, even when we started pleading for him to cease and desist. This stuff was so potent you could taste it when you breathed in! We asked to move rooms and got the "overbooked!" line again. We asked them to bring the ion purifier contraption they originally promised up to the room while we were gone, and though we were assured they would, they never did. We gave up. So the whole weekend we had the luxurious smell of cigarettes and weird orange-y air permeating the room. Hooray for problem solving? Hands down the best decision of our stay was to book a cabana by the lazy river. It came out to about $60 a person for a group of 8, but it was worth it to have a spot reserved by the pool all day and not have to stress about it. Also the server who was in charge of food/drink orders for our cabana was delightful! She was far and away the friendliest and most efficient employee we interacted with all weekend. They should send her to teach the front desk a thing or two. Or five. We left her a very large tip. The other positive: We were given day passes to the spa when we asked how they were going to make amends to the ridiculous start to our weekend, and the spa there is amazing. We went there post lazy river, pre night out, and it was so relaxing. Plus they had everything we needed to shower and primp after, so it saved time from trying to have 4 people get ready back in our rooms with one shower. I also do like the Asian-influenced design aesthetic of the hotel. But with so many hotels on the strip, I can't say I'd be very inclined to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you are attending a business convention at the Mandalay stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Blackjack4949
Reviews.Content: My company was attending a convention at the Mandalay bay after doing a little reading about the Mandalay i came across a few reviews about "The Hotel at Mandalay Bay". Which is essentially a monster boutique hotel which is attached to the Mandalay Bay. It has more an adult feel. The rooms are contemporary and little over the top. I believe they are all suites. I had a TV that was embedded into my bathroom mirror. I did not see any kids on this portion of the hotel. It does however share the pool facilities w/ the Mandalay Bay where you have the option of an all adult or the family pool. Everything here was top notch and it's located right on the strip. My colleagues loved the suggestion. Top notch all around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at the end of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: sibi4
Reviews.Content: I was on the 11th floor, in a suite facing toward the airport. The room was large, with a separate living area and 1 1/2 bathrooms. Even if it was close to the elevator, the noise from this could only be heard in the living area, and actually very little of it, no noise at all in the bedroom, thanks to the heavy door separating it from the living room. Nice ample bathroom, with separate large bathtub and shower. Nice amenities provided (bathrobe, flip flops, soap etc. The room service was good, but quite expensive charges for each meal we had (a small dinner and breakfast the following morning). The food was relatively expensive but what added to the total amount were the service charges added on to it. The overall quality of the food, the speed in which it was delivered, and the staff attitude were excellent, nothing to complain about it. The check in/check out was fast, same as for the response to some telephone queries. I would definitely recommend it and return to this hotel when during to spring/summer, to enjoy the large pool/beach area which was closed because of the winter season, with only a smaller pool open. The drawback is the position, at the far end of the Strip, but it's not too much of a problem if you don't mind taking a cab/local transportation or just walk.

Reviews.Title: “Classy & Glamourous”
Reviews.Author: NYHokie
Reviews.Content: What you imagine Vegas hotels are like if you've never visited Vegas before. The one and only downside that I can fault THEHotel for is the location of this casino/hotel to the rest of the Strip. It's at the very far end of the Strip. That's the only downside. There is a small tram available to three other close hotels. The pool at THEHotel is very nice. There's a smaller convention behind the hotel. The major convention center is not located near THEHotel. There's a penthouse level restaurant - the views on top at night are breathtaking. I recommend this hotel for any new or returning traveler to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, poor service, showing its age”
Reviews.Author: S3CR3T3X3C
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at THE Hotel for a business trip. Let me start off by saying that I am not a Vegas type guy. Slot machines? Naah. Gambling ? Don't care. Smoking? I hate it. This already tees me up as someone who is not going to have a lot of fun in "Sin City" so caveat emptor. I was actually looking forward to staying at THE Hotel because the web pictures show a sleek, modern, Asian type esthetic which I find appealing. I also thought that its South Strip location would be plus. I looked forward to the spa. What did I find? Well.. THE Hotel is well-designed. It does have a sleek, modern vibe which is refreshing compared to the Vegas Liberace extravaganza. Overall the look of the place was that of a lower end Asian 5 star hotel. My experience quickly went South the minute I checked in and the sullen guy at the counter told me that my room would be smoking (did I tell you I hate smoking !). He claimed that hotel was 100% chock full and I had to accept his offer of US $150 in hotel food and beverage credit (wait for what happened there when I checked out). I liked the size of the room I got (THE Suite) and the bed was OK. I did notice that the hotel is starting to slowly fray a bit (the sign in the lobby reads "O B B Y") and the furniture in the room is starting to show its age (dings, scrapes etc). The room amenities like toiletries etc, were standard, lower-end unbranded stuff & nothing to write home about. The minibar was stocked to the brim with liquor but surprisingly there was no chilled water or nice non-alcoholic choices (only Pepsi, Sierra Mist and a plastic bottle of Minute Maid OJ). I expected a little more choice. The room climate control was surprisingly weird and the room would never quite get cool enough even though it was probably in the 40 degree F range outside. The shower had a harsh flow-limiter installed and it dribbled out in a miserly, weak stream. The TV was a CRT in the bedroom and this is crazy for the kind of hotel that THE Hotel seems to position itself as. I did use the spa and if there is somewhere really cool at THE Hotel, the spa is it. The facilities were nice but very undermanned and low-service. The food in the hotel was terrible (it tasted like airport hotel food: greasy cold "home fries"...), sour coffee. I really disliked it. The service at the hotel was what took this review from 4 to 3 stars: it was just terrible. Mostly it seemed like THE hotel hired disaffected minimum wage types who are inured to the masses that flow through the hotel. Not once did I see the glimmer of graciousness or anything that would remotely be described as warmth in the service staff. They knew this is the one and only time they'd see you so who cares? Maybe that's just Vegas... When I checked out, I was surprised to find that the food and beverage credit they gave me for staying in a stinking smoking room did not apply to alcoholic beverages and if I had spent it on drinks for friends I would have been out of luck. Thanks THE Hotel for not telling me that ! Grrrrr. Overall this place is MEH. It is OK. It is like lukewarm oatmeal... It'll do. Whatever. I don't think I would ever voluntarily stay there and spend my own cash. It certainly is NOT anywhere special unless you like sullen staff, poor food, the smell of stale smoke covered with air freshener. When I left (and this is probably a Vegas reaction rather than a THE Hotel reaction) my primary feelings were of relief.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, wow, wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: loz74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for my 50th birthday at the end of November 2011. It was magnificent. There was nothing we could complain about, other than perhaps the mini bar was excessively expensive but we just didn't bother with it. We loved the fact that it was right at one end of The Strip and as we were on the 30th floor the views were amazing. Floor to ceiling windows in lounge and bedroom, fabulous comfy bed, huge floor area in both bedroom and lounge area and bathroom was great too. Check in and check out was quick and easy; about 5 minutes on both occasions. Ice bar was a great place for drinks and House of Blues was a great place to eat; neither too expensive. It was simple to get around from the hotel by catching the tram to the Luxor and then walking along the strip from there. The Mix bar on the 64th? floor is not to be missed; it's a beautiful bar with the most amazing views and although expensive, don't miss going there for a cocktail on the outside glass balcony. Although there is no casino in TheHotel it is merely a walk through the lobby area and you arrive at The Mandalay Bay casino so it was no problem at all. We had an amazing time and fell in love with Vegas and are already saving to go back and will definitely go back to TheHotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'm trying and can't really say anything bad about the place”
Reviews.Author: Mikebrez
Reviews.Content: The rooms are all suite size/amenities. the level of suites differ and are not that much more per. I did my fair share of time at the tables and they were all comped and it was my first time gambling under mgm. The pool is very nice and and laid out well sometimes when the desert winds picks up some pools like belagio will shut down because its so windy. The place is not the belagio or the venetian but its a great half step down

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great rooms, AWESOME bathroom”
Reviews.Author: montcalmharls
Reviews.Content: Great hotel.. Service was excellent, however, the pricing for all the extras are quite pricey. The internet alone was $14.95 per day. I loved my room, the spa was fabulous, the pool was beautiful. The bathroom in the room was expansive and lovely.. A real WOW! All in all, I adored staying at the property and certainly will again. This, as most of the hotels in Vegas now, seem to be nickle and dime-ing the clients these days, however, that wont stop me from visiting!!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the din of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Alan O
Reviews.Content: The Hotel at Mandalay Bay is non smoking and non gambling i.e. the lobby isn't filled with slot machines, gaming tables etc. There's plenty of that just adjacent at the Mandalay Bay hotel which means that at The Hotel you can enjoy the peace and quiet and still be close to the casino if that's what you're looking for in a Vegas hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beachseeker14
Reviews.Content: Great experience overall. Very comfortable room, nicely appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Zen experience”
Reviews.Author: TLC277
Reviews.Content: For those who want a zen calming hotel experience in the frenzy of Las Vegas try the THEhotel at Mandalay Bay. From the moment you enter the lobby the lighting is mute and a quiet relaxing atmosphere is present. The flowers they have throughout the hotel were exquisite. We were met by a friendly professional front desk person and were settled into our suite minutes after our arrival. The hotel is non-smoking and is an all suite hotel. No detail was overlooked with the plush bedding, comfy robes and bath amenities. Granite and marble in the large baths as well as the wet bar. There were three tv's and a separate bathroom (toilet) as you entered the suite. Suite very quiet and did not hear noise in hall or other rooms. We took advantage of a promotional THEHotel was running where you received a credit on your bill that could be used at their Spa or the shops and restaurants in Mandalay Shops. We used it in the cafe and also Ri Ra Irish Pub (great food and music!). Using the credit worked flawlessly and the bill was correct. We used the drop express check out and within 2 hours after we left they had emailed a copy of my bill. Treat yourself and stay at THEHotel. You'll return home relaxed and find yourself looking forward to your next Vegas getaway at THEHotel!

Reviews.Title: “Met Expectations”
Reviews.Author: mnmel1997
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights on business and extended stay for two nights. I requested a "high floor room with a strip view"; I was on the 26th floor overlooking the airport. You could see the strip if you craned your head from the window or looked at the reflection from the adjacent windows. Not sure how they "number" the floors as there was a big gap eliminating many floors on the elevator buttons aside from the MIX bar/nightclub which is on the 64th floor. One my first night's stay, there must have been a party/event above me as I heard "boom boom" bass sounds until 2:05am; the other 3 nights were quiet. Obtaining access to "MIX" despite may be difficult (despite being willing to buy a $$$$ drink); due to private parties booked earlier in the night but is well worth the effort as the "Strip View" at night is amazing! Try going before 11pm before the "party police" selectively admit patrons. Best bet would to be visit between 8-10:30. My room was clean and spacious; the daily service was very good! There was a large "soaking" tub; too bad that there were no jets!!! Guess they want you to visit the spa! Hotel staff was personable.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING - so amazing you wont want to leave”
Reviews.Author: pinkcamelno9
Reviews.Content: THE Hotel is lovely and less tacky (and smoky) than the other Vegas hotels. We had a suite which had a lounge, a HUGE bath (not like the standard extrememly small ones you get in America) and a wonderful room with floor to ceiling windows. It was incredible and if you book far enough in advance, you can get a good deal as rates vary significantly. THe only problem was, it was so amazing, we didn't want to leave so if you stay here, make sure you have time to enjoy the suite. I chose THEHotel after seeing a review in the Telegraph. You can get rooms for as little as £68 a night but ours was $240 (including tax) but it was well worth it - one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. Only niggling thing is that I was charged for an item from the mini bar which I did not use and there was no email to contact and let them know they had made an error. If you have the opportunity to stay here and it isn't on one of the expensive/peak nights then do so - definately a luxury - esepcially for couples. It is a bit off the strip but you can walk from the other end of town or use the Vegas buses. Definately more for couple and less for stags. Would go back again just for he hotel. It is much quieter as it is off the strip a bit, there is a parking lot right by the entrance - dont use the valets - an uneccesary cost. INternet I think, is provided at this hotel, but a lot of hotels in America charge you for this serive (around $10)

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Deal”
Reviews.Author: tamaracedre
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate at THEhotel at Mandalay Bay during off season on our way to the Grand Canyon using Priceline. We received a dining credit that sweetened the deal even further. This was our second time in Vegas and overall, we enjoyed our stay very much. The front desk staff could have been a little more conscientious with checking us in and informing us about the hotel layout (THEhotel is part of a large complex of 3 hotels in one and a bit overwhelming), but we were so pleasde with everything else that we can't complain. We'd definitely stay again! Pros: AMAZING, LUXURIOUS TUB and SWEET BATH AMENITIES GREAT DINNER OPTIONS (Burger Bar! Mmmm!) CHIC DECOR IN ROOM FUN SHOPS Cons: SMOKEY CASINOS (general smokiness is standard Vegas I think) ROOM CHARGES AND RESORT FEES (nickel and dimed on everything from in-room coffee to using the fridge, also...resort fees and weird deposits) DO VALET; SELF PARKING IS A BEAR TO FIGURE OUT

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room!!”
Reviews.Author: golsch
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the beginning of December and really enjoyed it. We have stayed many times at the Palazzo and I assumed this hotel would be similar but I was pleasantly surprised at the 1 bedroom with separate living room and 2 bathrooms. I don't think you would need 2 bathrooms most of the time but it came in handy when our friends stopped by. They stayed somewhere else but didn't want to go back to their hotel after seeing ours. It is a bit of a walk to get to the front of the casino but definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodations but the service... not so much”
Reviews.Author: AK_foodie2010
Reviews.Content: I'm not a stranger to Vegas and when I find a good hotel, I tend to stay there. I decided to try THE hotel since I received a nice deal through the hotel. However, the good price wasn't enough to make up for bad service. Valet service was slow and illogically set up. THE hotel provided one of the absolute worst check in experiences - the woman at the front desk was abrupt and generally unhelpful. I was rudely notified that the room I had booked was not available and I had a choice of a smaller room or a smoking room (I'm allergic to smoke) and she refused to guarantee a room change for the following night. The room (though not the one we booked) was quite nice with the exception of uncomfortable beds and very thin walls. The following morning we were grudgingly moved to another room after pointing out we had to call the front desk the previous night about noisy neighbors. The new room was definitely nicer featuring a more comfortable bed and was overall less careworn. The bathroom was fantastic with a large soaking tub, a shower large enough for two, and plenty of vanity space. Unfortunately, the issues with the front desk didn't end. We called down to inquire why we were unable to access pay per view and express check out and were assured it would be fixed... three times (the problem was never resolved). Few notes about the property: Both rooms were incredibly clean and the bathrooms were fantastic. Skip room service, compared to other major resorts it is rather expensive and a poorer quality of food. If you want to enjoy alcohol in your room, stop at THE Store in the lobby - they feature more variety and lower prices than either room service or minibar. The casino drink service was quite slow both at the bars and while playing with the exception of the sports bar. Mandalay Place's shopping is minimal but I highly recommend Burger Bar and the Irish Pub for good food and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Love the size of the suites”
Reviews.Author: soloann
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, the suites with 2 rooms and a bath and 1/2 were great. However the furniture could use a little updating. There is a coffee pot in the room with $4 set ups, kind of a ripoff. The housekeeping staff could not be any nicer. I would stay here again. We were there for New Year's Eve but couldn't see the fireworks too far back.

Reviews.Title: “THE Average Hotel.... losing a bit of its lustre”
Reviews.Author: network55
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for... albeit the resort fee @ $20.00 has to be added to whatever advertised rate. Unfortunately, when we checked in for a four night stay, our prepaid room, a V Suite, was not available. They offered a standard suite for the first night and move to the V suite the following day. Not the welcome you need after a day of travel. Making our way to the room I noted the carpets had not seen a vacuum recently and empty drink glasses left along the corridor. It's the detail you see that makes you wonder what about the stuff that is not as obvious. One more disappointment, the non smoking room had a previous guest who chose the second bathroom as the smoking room. A couple of points worth noting.... * The fitness centre that is included with the $20 resort fee is at Mandalay Bay. Not the gym that is in THE Hotel. It will cost you and added $15 * Try to get a higher floor facing north towards the strip for a better view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel....once again”
Reviews.Author: Coops14
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights, having 3 nights comped. The check in clerk was very helpful, the hotel was 98% full the day we checked in, however they still managed to locate a suite on a high floor overlooking the strip. The suite was great, no signs of wear and tear as others have reported in reviews. The wet bar with the coffee machine was good, however expensive. We like a coffee in the morning before we leave our room, however at $4 a cup, we thought this was a bit steep. We went to Whole Foods, however they don't stock the required pods. We found the pods for the machine in a shop called the Kitchen factory which is located in Premium Shopping Mall South. There were so many pods to choose from we were spoilt for choice. We also bought two mugs at a dollar each and used our pods and mugs every day. The suite had three televisions, one in the bathroom, one in the lounge and in the bedroom. We loved watchmg the weather channel, so entertaining. The bed was so comfy we slept really well. There was lots of storage space and dressing gowns and slippers. The bath was huge we could both get in it at the same time!!! The shower was great too. The suites were really quiet and because you have to walk though the lounge to get to the bedroom you never hear anyone walking passed the room while in bed. We ate at The Cafe for breakfast, great food and huge portions. We went to Raffles cafe, food ok, probably would not bother going there again. Ate at Red White and Blue, again the portions were huge, the food was great and the service was awesome. We visited both Starbucks and the staff were very friendly. We to Yoghurt In a few times, where you select your own yoghurts and topping to choose from...we loved this. We visited the swimming pool and the only area open was the Moorea are as we visited out of season. The pool and hot tub was enough for the people wishing to use the pool. We loved staying at THEHotel and will return next year.

Reviews.Title: “A couple of niggles but overall, a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Zeva2010
Reviews.Content: I checked in mid week during a very busy week. Check in was smooth - the check in desk is very nice and wide and the staff were friendly enough. I was placed on the 6th floor in a corner suite. As I walked down the corridor I noticed I was on the same floor as the hotel's conference rooms. I did think 'great!' - this will be nosy in the mornings, because they not only had their conference rooms but the rooms for F&B preparations (like a small kitchen with dumb waiters etc). I forgot about it as soon as I entered my room. BLISS. VERY impressed and I haven't been as impressed seen I stayed at the Red Rock Resort (in Las Vegas also). It was like a mini apartment, you walk in and there is a single restroom area away from the main bathroom. You have a lounge with a desk and chair and sofa - but I didn't really use this area much, but it was great because it made the room so much more spacious and homely - a nice touch when you're away from home. The bedroom area was nice a spacious - not too big but not too small - it was just right. I was solo but there would have been plenty of room for two people. The bed was nice and comfy. The view was medicore - I was on the 6th floor so could see nothing but a bit of the Mandalay Bay and then if I looked down the a blanket of white buildings (perhaps the roof of the lower ground floor?? and fans). It was noisy I must say. Wifi is chargeable (in the resort fee) and the wifi was SUPER fast when I stayed on the 6th floor. But after a couple of nights I moved to another floor because the noise from below was getting too much. They moved me no problem. The rooms were similar, perhaps the bedroom was a bit smaller but only ever so slightly. The bathroom layout was a little different too. I was higher up this time. On the 27th floor and the wifi was just no existent. It just would not work. Apparently, the higher up you go the wifi knocks out. I might have stayed where I was if I was told this before packing all my stuff and moving. On check out they removed the charges so this was fine. The room was nice and clean (except for the first room, where I saw something that looked like popcorn on the sofa in the bedroom). Bathroom was clean. I didn't have much interaction with the staff here but they all seemed very nice and friendly - hence the average rating on service. On another note, I have stayed at a few hotels in Las Vegas and none have ever given me coupons or voucher books - I was shocked to find out some of my colleagues received them - not sure what that is all about. Through to the bathroom

Reviews.Title: “A once shinning star now diminished”
Reviews.Author: Ghostrider5408
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for years and always considered The Hotel as an oasis in a sea of casino hotels, smoke and loud noises. The rooms were always fresh well done with soothing darker colors, which made a stay in the hot months more the better. With a bar (no smoking) and breakfast/lunch spot away from the crowd even better. Now the carpeting in the hallways are showing their age, stained, rooms are in need of a makeover and a lot of apparent deferred maintenance everywhere. So sad.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at THE Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LuvAirShows
Reviews.Content: First off, I have to say that I'm out in Vegas sometimes 3 to 4 times a year for work. So, with that, I have stayed at Bellagio, Venetian, Palazzo and MGM. Last three stays I have been at MGM. This trip was for a meeting at Westin Casuarina hotel, originally I had book my rooms there until I read the reviews. I had once stayed here five years ago and it was nice, but let me tell you ...PASS on Westin. Reviews were spot on about the smell in the lobby. **I didnt go in a hotel room, just meeting space**, also they have a tiny casino. Back to THE Hotel. I booked this suite a week ago and was very surprised on how NICE the suites are. I had a two room suite with two restrooms. Room was very clean, beautifully decorated and very confortable. I loved the fact that I can work easily and in comfort. My room was 36914 (strip and airport view). Yes, this was a little pricey, BUT Westin was 20.00 more a night! SO, this was a better choice by far. I also like the fact that THE Hotel is NOT a casino, short walk and you are in the casino for Mandalay Bay. Which is a plus. Nice quiet bar in THE Hotel in the lobby which was nice too. Free internet in rooms (covered by resort fee). New thing for MPlayers, all rooms fees and restaurants in Mandalay Bay count for your credits! VERY NICE! I would seriously recommend this hotel and I will be a frequent guest for now on. This is a great place to visit Vegas. Only down fall is the location to convention center was far, but a quick tram ride then walk to MGM you can catch the Montrail and ride for 12.00 for 24 hours. I hate waiting for cabs! One more thing, the staff at the hotel were very kind and helpful to any question. Kuddo's!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Vegas our kids!”
Reviews.Author: TravelAddicts05
Reviews.Content: When traveling with young kids, it's always seems a question of do you get interconnecting rooms or spend the money and splurge on a big suite. Once we looked at the pictures on the website for THEhotel and Mandalay Bay, it seemed a no brainer, particularly when we looked at the pools. By staying here, it meant we not only had access to all of the amazing facilities at this hotel, but ALSO at Mandalay Bay. This all suite hotel was a perfect choice for us and with the large separate lounge room, it meant my wife and I could enjoy some TV at night whilst our boys slept (when we weren't out and about). It was very reasonable for what we got and we'd definitely stay again! Upon check in, we were a little disappointed to find out that our room did not have a view of the Vegas strip (as requested). However, after raising this point, the staff looked into it and made arrangements for us to be swapped over the following day. To help us out (with baby bottle steralization and baby food being heated up), they also brought a microwave up to our room for no additional charge. The room itself was fantastic. We had a spacious lounge room and a nice size bedroom. It had one very large bathroom (with the biggest bath I've seen in a hotel room) and an additional powder room. The kitchenette was small but manageable. All in all, a great room and we were really happy! I went to the gym a few times whist there and it was a decent one, although perhaps not quite what I was expecting. I think there is another larger, fancier and more exclusive one that you can pay money to access but I chose not to bother. This was attached to Mandalay Bay and took a little while to go to (as you had to go down to the lobby, cross the casino floor which was not a short journey and then find it from the Mandalay Bay lobby area). Still, this became easier once you found your way the first time. This was also the case for when you wanted to go to the breakfast buffet and the pools. On that note, the breakfast buffet was certainly worth it and there is the typical overload of choice, so much so that we could not possibly hope to try everything in the 4 days we were there. The pools were indeed fantastic. There were several to choose from although the wave pool was not able to be used by our kids due to the age restrictions. Our boys did not seem to mind as the lazy river, the other pools and the sandy beach all seemed to keep them very entertained. The only hassle with the pool area is that there is not too much shade around so you either need to get there early to secure a shady spot under a tree or pay the money for a cabana (typical in Vegas - and expensive). The pool area was one of the main reasons we chose THEhotel and it did not disappoint. The pools alone make THEhotel (or Mandalay Bay I imagine) a perfect choice and totally worth it. It is at the far end of the strip so it depends how much you like walking to and from as getting up the other end takes a LONG time, although the monorail helps somewhat with that. Nice and close to both Excalibur and The Luxor and not so far from New York New York and the MGM. A great choice for families with kids of all ages, couples or singles! Not sure when the next trip to Vegas will be, but we'll be certainly considering THEhotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Suites are amazing”
Reviews.Author: ergo1727
Reviews.Content: We got a suite as part of a sponsorship package so I have no idea how much they cost. The rooms were amazing and had everything you could ask for. Extremely high quality on everything except the chair in the office. It was Asian crap! I love this property. Only drawback is it is so far down the strip.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, OK staff”
Reviews.Author: Charlie3446
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a great all suite hotel. The rooms consist of a living area with a very large built in TV and a very comfortable sitting area and a half bath. The bedroom has another large TV with great beeding and super mattress. There is a full bath off the bedroom with a soaking tub and a huge walk in shower. There is a smaller TV in the bath. The toilet is in a seprate room with a door. Everything in The Hotel is marked including a small sticker on the toilet paper that said "The TP". Both rooms had floor to ceiling windows and my room overlooked the Luxor. The Mandaly Complex is at the far southern end of the strip so to get to the other casinos take a little effort but it is not that big of a deal with the monorail. I was there is the winter so I can't comment on the pools or outside activity, but the casino is the normal Las Vegas huge and the attached shopping area is normal for a amjor Vegas Casino. There is a House of Blues on site as well as the production of Lion King. The staff was a little lacking at the front desk, they didn't seem to really know about the hotel. They told me my room would be ready in 30 minutes which turned into two hours. They even gave me wrong directions to the bell stand. Other than that it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Thehotel is still going strong”
Reviews.Author: sanderson421
Reviews.Content: It had been 5 years since I had last been at THEhotel but it is still an excellent value. Some of the furniture getting old. The desk chair had a broken arm and stained seat. But overall the suite is very nice and the staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and contemporary suites”
Reviews.Author: preciousgemcrystal
Reviews.Content: My prior visit to Las Vegas was in July 2011 when I stayed at Mandalay Bay, which I quite enjoyed. I stayed here for the weekend of New Year's Eve to experience the madness just like millions of others did. It was just myself and my best friend. I've become quite a hotel snob. I refuse to stay somewhere if I don't find it visually and physically pleasing. What I had found when I opened the door was a spacious (keep in mind, two people in one room and that's it) and lavish suite. The colors were a calm blend of deep plum, brown and beige. I usually opt to stay at The Palazzo, but I needed something that would agree with my wallet for the weekend and this suite was an absolute STEAL! What I appreciated the most was that the casino and lobby at Mandalay Bay gets quite noisy and rambunctious which isn't a HUGE deal for someone who just entered their 30's. But, after a long day on your feet (no car rental!) sometimes all you want is a nice drink and some quiet surroundings. Every time we entered the transition walk way from Mandalay Bay into THEhotel, it went from noise all around you to pure silence with some enjoyable jazz in the background. The staff were extremely busy with such a heavy weekend ahead of them and yet we never ever ran across someone who made us feel we were an imposition. The only thing I could find to complain about was the lighting in the rooms, because of the tinting on the windows which I'm guessing is due to the gold paneling on the windows makes the room terribly dark. However, I already knew this prior to booking since I had stayed at Mandalay Bay. Don't let the location on the strip scare you away, there are trams all over the place that help you get to where you need to be faster than taking it by foot only. I will be back and I look forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “THEhotel”
Reviews.Author: azrizza
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable and spacious. At the last minute before our check-in our 22 year old daughter decided to join us in Las Vegas. The 1 bedroom suite did not have a sofabed so we had to pay extra for a roll-in bed. That was the only downside to our stay. Mandalay Bay is a great resort, although the most distant from the strp hotels. However the monorail to the Luxor and Excalibur was a plus. Overall I would rate this among the best we have stayed at in Las Vegas, exceeded only by the Wynn and the Signature a MGM Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Kkgriff
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel. Felt like I was near all the action with connecting casinos and other resorts, but also at a luxury hotel that was not noisy and more zen like. I would definitely book this hotel again. The only downfall is that you will need a cab or major walking shoes to get to the Bellagio. Otherwise, there is so much to do at this end of the strip especially with kids. I like the way all the hotels are connected either through cross bridges or tram. I have stayed at the Venetian which is a great hotel also, but it is noisier and harder to get around in the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: xRachelBx
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for good value for money. Rooms are great, very nicely decorated with plenty of space and lovely views of the strip if you get a high level floor. Bathrooms are equally as nice and spacious. The only negative comment I have about this hotel is that we found some of the staff unhelpful and not exactly friendly. Despite this I cannot wait to return to Vegas and this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Oasis”
Reviews.Author: pygar2007
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days, 3 nights here. A group of 5 seasoned traveler's and we were all quite impressed. From the moment we stepped into the hotel it was a sea of calm. Beautiful lobby, flowers and art. Check in was quick and easy. The suite was perfect. Large, clean and comfortable. Wonderful bath (one felt so guilty using so much water in a drought state) but hey, it was there! Service was exceptional. So many others seem to note problems, but we had none. Our morning room service coffee always arrived within 15 minutes. The lobby lounge was quiet and relaxing--you could actually have conversations. A special treat was having cocktails on the balcony at Mix lounge atop the hotel overlooking the strip--very memorable. if you want action it is a 2 minute walk to the casino at Mandalay bay. Was so nice to return here after the crazy madness of the strip and everywhere else. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Basically the same as Mandalay Bay but quieter and larger rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Superguy1221
Reviews.Content: Thousands of people, including myself, have reviewed Mandalay Bay. I've stayed at both and found the service and facilities to be the same. The difference lies in the common areas, which are quieter and not smoky from the casino. And the rooms, which are larger, but the same in essential details like beds, bathrooms, and furniture. But if you're looking for a good room at a large hotel, it's a good value. I think this place is great for Vegas first-timers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at TheHotel”
Reviews.Author: GreeKid
Reviews.Content: Stayed at TheHotel in September of 2010. The suite was very nice. Mandalay Bay is expensive but what casino/resort on the Strip isnt? Restaraunts were very good. Ate at Stripsteak and it was delicious. The mashed potatoes there are amazing. The resort is located on the way south end of the strip, so if youre looking to be in the middle of everything, this hotel may not be for you. Wave pool / lazy river were awesome....highly reccomended for families as well. Make sure you pack an innertube or you will be overpaying for one when you get there!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary design, clean”
Reviews.Author: Kjr18
Reviews.Content: Pros- contemporary design, nicest of the casino/hotels on the strip, clean, friendly staff, included robe & slippers, huge bathtub and bath salts, hair dryer, scale, 3 TV's, living room, 2 toilets, Cons- walls are pretty thin- you can hear what's going on in the hallway and cars honking (we were on the 25 floor), no microwave, $20 resort fee, expensive wet bar, no discount at the spa, Overall, I liked the fancier, more upscale and clean feel of this hotel & Mandalay casino compared to the other more run-down places on the strip. A couple of the other casinos were either too smokey, or smelled stale. I felt the service at THEhotel was good, the night gift shop lady was so sweet, the concierge was nice & knowledgable, and we were stopped by a bellman to see if we needed help with our luggage. Housekeeping did a thorough job everyday, and the wetbar service also checked in every afternoon. I would stay here again. Even though THEhotel is located on the very south side of the strip, there is a free tram that takes you from Mandalay Bay to the Excalibur and the Luxor. Then you can buy a day or 3-day tram pass to cut down on more walking. Don't go to Vegas and not expect to do a bit of walking, though. Leave your 3" heels at home, or take them off while you walk through the buildings! Places to visit: Bodies exhibit, Blue Man Group show, fountains at the Bellagio at night (free), Eiffel Tower, Burger Bar, Tacos N Tequila, and don't forget all the people watching to do! One note- I'm not planning on ever bringing my kids to Vegas. Leave this for a couples only trip. It was so sad to see the babies in the casinos at midnight, and the little kids being exposed to pornographic pictures at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with very large rooms”
Reviews.Author: K15hy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at THEhotel at Mandalay Bay- I was initially given the wrong room type but on returning to reception this was quickly resolved. The new room was fantastic with huge amounts of space (including lounge and desk area) and a fantastic view. I had the opportunity to use the bar areas, the restaurants and the coffee ship and the quality of the food & service in all of them was exceptional. 2 things to be aware of for this hotel (not problems, just FYI's) THEhotel itself has no casino - the Mandalay Bay though does and is not more than 3 minutes walk away. Also the Mandalay Bay is at the very end of the strip- be prepared to walk a lot or take a lot of taxi's if you want to see more of the strip. Overall this was a very nice hotel and I would be happy to stay here again if the opportunity arose.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, elegant ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Georgia L
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay. It has a very quiet, dark and Asian feel to the lobby and public areas. Definitely a far cry from most Vegas hotels. My suite is beautiful and big. The only thing I miss is that my room at Mandalay Bay had a jetted tub.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SurferPete
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at TheHotel at Mandalay Bay. The rooms are exceptional. All suites with a large amount of space. Seperate living room and bedroom, oversized bathroom with huge bath & Seperate shower. Luxury towels. Additional guest toilet. 3 televisions. Luxury bed linen. Very clean. Only slight disadvantage is the location. It's right at the end of the strip so a fair distance from many of the iconic casinos such as Belliago, Paris, Venetian etc. but there's a tram from Mandalay Bay to Monte Carlo. The other down side is the "Resort Fee" of $20 per day - this is just a rip off and should be included in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel, Great Vaca”
Reviews.Author: travelingbunny16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at THEhotel at Mandalay Bay in October, 2011. The hotel was clean, the staff was professional and polite. There were 2 of us and we stayed in THESuite and it was the perfect size for us. There was a very nice living room with flat screen TV and a very 'executive' looking desk and chair, half bath, a large bed room (king bed) with another TV and plenty of closet space. The full bath had double sinks, an very cool deep tub and separate glass shower. The decor in the room and the hotel overall was very chic and modern. Great color palates and the room looked and felt very upscale even though we were paying a very reasonable price. We were pleasantly surprised to find 2 robes in the room along with 'his and hers' slippers individually wrapped in plastic and a THEhotel bag. The room was very quiet and we got a good night's sleep. A big reason we wanted to stay here was because of the 'beach' at the hotel and the wave pool. The beach was definitely a very unique feature. It was an EXTREMELY long walk to get there from our room. We walked through the casino in our bathing suits and cover ups with our beach gear which felt very strange every time we walked through. If you have kids be sure to bring a stroller if you want to spend time at the pool and you're staying in the 'THEhotel' side. It's definitely a very far walk. oh - and there are snack bars at the beach/wave pool. We went to that beach several different times during the day and never saw those snack bars open. Get food before you go to the beach or bring food with you! The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful throughout our stay. The 'doorbell/do not disturb/room service' button stopped working on our door part way through the trip and someone was upstairs to fix it within 30 minutes of me calling downstairs. We ordered room service (late night snack) one night and we were very surprised by the presentation and how upscale the service was. The food arrived on it's own table with a fancy table cloth and the food was heated/chilled in compartments below the table. This hotel is at the very end of the strip and we found it was not quick to get from one place to another. Buy a bus pass and take the bus. They come often enough and they are very good about saying the stop coming up next and there's an electronic board so you can see the next hotel stop too. Check out the lion feeding at MGM Grand while you're there (around 5PM daily), the fountain show at the Bellagio (best at night), the view from the Stratosphere and the gondolas at the Vinetian. Oh and bring your walking shoes. This definitely is not the place for your 4 inch heels! If you take a right out of the Mandalay Bay entrance and walk for about 1 mile you can see the famous 'Welcome to Las Vegas' sign. Also there's a small store across the street from the Mandalay Bay entrance and to the right a little. If you're going to buy alcohol by the bottle get it there - it's cheap and the same stuff the hotel is selling at a much higher price. Also The Lion King the play is in Mandalay Bay - it was awesome, check it out if you can. Go down the street during the day and there's a booth that sells half price tickets to shows. We got a great deal on tickets to a couple of shows. Overall this hotel was a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very rude customer service”
Reviews.Author: momocalifornia
Reviews.Content: I stayed THEhotel last weekend. When I checked in, I requested 2 queen bed suite, however when I went into the room, I found the room was one King. I called the front desk, they said I had to come down to the front desk to change the room. I went back to the front desk and there was a line, they said I had to wait in the line. I waited and got another room, they said this time it is 2 queen for sure. I went to the room again , and found the room was one King again. I called them, they said I have to go back to the front desk. I did so. I had to wait in the line again, and got the key again. . I had to carry my luggage whole time up and down again and again. At the midnight, I went back to the room, and found the room key was not working. I went to the front desk, and there was nobody working. I waited to someone come out, and told her the key was not working. She said because I kept the key in my purse next to my cell phone, the key went bad and didn't work. She gave me a key again and I went to the room. It didn't work. I had to go back to the front desk, and there was a line. I had to wait in the line. I talked to the lady at front desk, she said she would send security to open the door for me, so I had to wait in front of the door. I waited.... 10 min later, the security showed up, and she couldn't open the key. She said she would call an engineer to fix the door. I was really mad, and asked her if we could get another room while the door was fixing. They said no, I had to wait in front of the door. After 30min, the engineer showed up and he tried to fix the door. I waited and waited. Finally they opened the door and I could go inside. This whole thing took me 2 hours. I asked them refund of the night, they said no. Because it was my fault. They said I closed the door very hard thats why the door was broken. It was really worst experience. I would never recommend this hotel. Do not stay. Never. At midnight people were waited in the line, and only one person is working. No manager, nobody else. It was my birthday trip, and I only had bad memory...

Reviews.Title: “Read this......this will give you the real deal”
Reviews.Author: BethelInsdr
Reviews.Content: I travel alot for business so I don't have unrealistically high standards as some of these lower reviews suggest but I know a good property from a bad one. This was a good one.....so lets go thru the pros and cons Pro AND Con: Room size: The rooms are very large for the price (paid 105 per night on the weekend - it was a slow weekend) but it is really more room than needed. If you are staying with another couple (in another room) or with children - it would be nice to have that extra room and space - otherwise a standard hotel room is fine. For the price and time (weekend) it was more than reasonable for the price - rating excellent. Pro AND Con: Room selection: Even though we asked for a King they gave us 2 queens - no big deal - but not what we had asked for plus they stuck us on floor 3 - no view or anything - - just a view of the A/C machines........bigger deal.........Request a better floor room and they will seem to be willing to move you......but at 105 a night it was just as nice and the same price as any Marriott . Was it 5 stars.....no but it was fine. Rating Fair Casino: A Casino is a casino is a Casino........but they did have friendly and attentive staff serving drinks.....so I'll give them a very good Main Lobby - Very nice.......for those that are particular (like some of these reviews) it does have its entrance from a parking garage..... Very Good Fees: Poor.....but this is true of ALL of the upscale hotels in Vegas. The useless "resort fee" of 20 a day (plus tax)should be done away with or just add it to the price of the room rather than gouging you for an extra 22 a day for nothing (yes you get the internet - which was fine in terms of speed.....no newspaper, which supposedly was included - it might have been at the front desk for free - I don't know). Be smart and DO NOT use the mini bar.....really pricey Gift shop........try to avoid......pricey but the staff was very friendly Check - in/out very fast and efficient and staff seemed nice. We checked in late Friday night and out on Monday morning - so we were not checking in or out during peak times - but I would rate this very good - except that they gave us a lousy view. Dining - Went to the buffet - standard mediocre buffet......20 a head.....I have been to other "superior" buffets like the Wynn and the Bellagio - they are better but I don't think you ever get what you pay for at any buffet. Fair Safety - no issues Cleaning staff - no issues - they seem to keep the hotel in good condition Nice bedding, room condition was good........maybe not perfect as some complaints suggest - but the room we were in was in good condition. TV's were large tube tv and a large flat screen. Bathroom was nice with a large tub and shower and nice toiletries......ok robes to use....little worn but fine. Service.......I found everyone to be helpful and attentive as needed.
