I am a pretty self sufficient traveler....so these reviews where people felt slighted or felt that they had bad service are people that are probably more "particular" (aka whiners or typical complainers) than normal. Everyone responded to my requests as quickly as possible and did so in a friendly fashion........ Overall.....if you are looking to stay in a 5 star joint this is probably not the place but the simple reality is that all of these people that are complaining about the hotel have unrealistically high expectations........5 star hotels charge 5 star prices (400-500 a night - even during non peak times) this place charges 120-190 a night (except for big conventions - then expect to pay more). It is a solid 4 star though.....

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel with some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Chris75
Reviews.Content: THEHotel at Mandalay Bay is a very classy hotel with a nice atmosphere. The entrance is inside Mandalay Bay hotel. It's a non-gaming hotel, but if you want some action and good restaurants the choice is absolutely fantastic at Mandalay Bay (Lupo, an italian restaurant, is very good). I also recommend Eye Candy (bar lounge and nightclub) and Mix Lounge with fantastic views on the 64th floor. Good breakfast at the Cafe. My suite was large and comfortable. However I was disappointed as on the lower floors (I stayed on the 6th floor), there is no view, and even worst, view on a wall! As a result the room was dark at any time of the day, it was always necessary to turn on the light.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: prnewman
Reviews.Content: I had no idea I would be staying here, but the suite at THE Hotel was amazing. We faced north so we saw the whole strip. This luxurious suite was decorated very nicely and the staff were friendly. There was a button by the door that told the staff that we were still sleeping or if the room could be turned. I can't wait to visit again. The lobby was gorgeous, the suite was amazing and I can't speak highly enough. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Solange19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at THEhotel for a week for New Years Eve. The rooms are amazing! A suite with even half a bathroom a bathroom next to the front door. The city was really full from all the people spending New Years Eve there and every time we walked in our hotel we felt like we got out of the craziness and into a place we could relax and rest. For a family with children is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a good property.”
Reviews.Author: azcap
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at TheHotel for a business conference at Mandalay Bay. We normally stay at the Trump but wanted to try something at or near Mandalay Bay this year so we would not have to drive over. TheHotel is the closest nicer hotel so we booked it on some discount site and got a TheSuite for around a $105. I have to work while traveling and several reviews said the wireless internet access was crappy but I got a good signal in our room at 7.4M, plenty for work. The room was very nice, bed was excellent, bath was excellent. If you care about views make sure and ask for a Strip view as the mountain view is mostly freeway and industrial park (we didn't care) TheHotel was very convenient for for our conference at the Mandalay Bay convention center. There are plenty of nice dining options on the property and the staff was nice. As soon as you enter the hallway from the Mandalay Bay casino into TheHotel it gets quiet and posh quickly . They do a nice job of having an upscale hotel so near the casino and conference center. We will stay again. My only complaint is the stupid resort fee, which is more of a complaint against the whole industry. If you want $20 more for your rooms just charge it and stop trying to game the system. It is petty - shame on you TheHOtel, Trump, Wynn, Venetian, Aria etc etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room,Huge Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brigette
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in october 2011. We had a huge room with seperate sitting room. When you first arrive everything seems so spread out,but you soon get to grips with finding your way around. The beach area gets really busy & the sun loungers are packed together,so you get quite friendly with your neighbours. Was easy to get to mid strip using the free monorail. Good choice of restaurants & loved the fact they had a starbucks for my morning coffee fix. Very friendly check in/out staff on reception. We did go up to the nightclub one night,but drinks were very expensive & it was very crowded.If you wanted to sit outside to admire the view,these had to be pre booked as VIP areas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but needs some fine tuning”
Reviews.Author: Kim H
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on Dec, 24 and 25. Hotel was very quiet for the holidays. My room was on the third floor, I was surprised to see conference rooms also on this floor. There were no conferences in session...but I would not want to stay on this floor if one was in session. Room was exactly as pictured in website. Small living room...nice bathroom. Mirrored closet doors were dirty...not something I would expect for this type of hotel. Furnishings were getting a little worn. Room was dark...need to turn lights on even during the day. Casino is directly connected to theHotel. I would not pay top dollar to stay in this hotel. There are other hotels which are much nicer for the price.

Reviews.Title: “What a Beautiful Pickpocket - their hand in your pocket at every turn”
Reviews.Author: gregdgreg
Reviews.Content: A beautiful place – IF you can accept the extra fees that start at arrival and after room was booked and pre-paid for…. Added $25.00 daily service fee (newspapers, extra water and access to “services”) Every Service Item has a fee. You Make in-your-room coffee; $4.00 ea Bag of M&M $5.00 ea Bottle of Water $5.00 Use the FedEx office computer” Service” @ $1.00 a minute Print a web page; 50 cents each (Don't get me started on $15.00 tuna sandwich and $3.00 glass of soda) Place was nice - but I'll never go back. There are plenty of other nice places in vegas

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hardware, Not so good Software”
Reviews.Author: Bangladesh
Reviews.Content: The good : The rooms are nice and big. We got the V suite (all rooms in this hotel are true Suite) and it had amazing view of the strip. The room has a 1 bedroom with a huge bathroom and a living room with another half bathroom. Beat that!! It had 3 TV, very nice decoration and fit and finish. Very spacious and quite. The Bed is a heaven and the pillows are plenty if not all to my liking. The hotel is not part of the casino and have a separate entry which is smoke free and glitz free. So you can really be in Vegas without the crowd and noise and sleaziness. The bad : The entrance to the hotel is very bad. You do not see the check in till you are at the end of the hotel. The check in crew and the rest of the folks were extremely unfriendly. We had two kids and two suitcase and no one came to help us with our bags. There is a free valet but the entrance is very confusing. The room service take hours to pick up and then does not go through your request. All in all, do not expect much of a service from these folks and you will be ok. The hotel is all the way at the end of the strip so to go to any place you need a taxi/car/train. Even though its a negative, I liked it as the main hotels in the strip central got so damn crowded when I was there that I truly appreciate it. I literary had to fight and push other people for check in at the bellagio or at Mirage.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: winslip33118
Reviews.Content: Loved The Hotel. The suite was great. The service was the best. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “THE HOTEL IS EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: Cesario0
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is one of the best hotel in las vegas, is quiet, excellent beds, the rooms are big and the quality is excellent. The service in every aspect is excellent, the best in las vegas, is you go to las vegas first time o more than 10 times, stay here and compare to your other visits and you will see. I booked 3 suites, they here great, the staff super friendly. This is my 8 time here. You can't go wrong staying here. I recommend....

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for a change”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryTraveler07
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Vegas Christmas day 2011 until the 28th - Vegas was insane! Room is outstanding - housekeeping staff - very friendly and willing to accommodate your requests - do an outstanding job of cleaning the rooms - all staff in fact were more than pleasant and helpful - the CASINO was waaaaaay tooo smoky ?? no ventilation or just couldn't keep up? But plumbing noise is crazy loud - you would think that in this day and age they could insulate a building from noise like that. Had dinner at Lupo(I think is the name of their Italian restaurant at Mandalay Bay) FANTASTIC - Had fun in the casino and sports book and of course literally shopped til I dropped (or the feet gave out first:)

Reviews.Title: “Average Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjthekid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at THEhotel for one night on the back end of a desert vacation. THEHotel was mediocre. The rooms were dark and in dire need of upgrading. The service was nothing above adequate. When you check in you give your bags to a bellman who gives you a ticket and then you have to call down to have them sent up. Someone must be in the room to collect them. I don't know if this is standard in vegas, but I found it to be pretty annoying. Are they maximizing tipping opportunities? Why can't they just bring the bags to my room based on the name I give them like every other hotel? Like everything else in the hotel, the bathrooms are fine. Nothing special. The robe provided had a stain on it. The beds were not particularly comfortable and they offered only two pillows. Our room faced the airport and as a result we heard airplanes all night. If that noise wasn't enough the plumbing creaked and wooshed like an old man sitting in a rocking chair on a sinking raft. Giving this hotel 3 stars is generous but I'm not quite ready to call it poor. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, very luxurious”
Reviews.Author: sheffchick
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel indeed. Public areas are a step away from the noise and bustle of the Mandalay Bay Casino (and that isn't a very raucous hotel in any case). Check in was quick and friendly, after a bit of a queue. There were no issues regarding booking through a third party (expedia). Suite was large and more than enough for our needs. We did not take advantage of the mini-bar, though I am sure it is as costly as they all are! Our room was a mountain view which was fine although be aware that even on the 31st floor there is some noise from the motorway and the air coditioning ducts below. To be honest we tuned this noise out after a very short time. Our room was connecting (I forgot to request otherwise at check in) and we did hear some noise from time to time, but as the bedroom is separate, this did not disturb our sleep. The only noise which did disturb us was the air conditioner kicking in, but I solved that by switching it off. As we did not have a Strip View we compensated by having Christmas Night dinner at Mix on the 64th Floor. The view from the adjacent bar is absolutely fabulous. Dinner was very good (if pricey), but if you can't splurge at Christmas why bother going away at all?

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not Amazing”
Reviews.Author: ItsOnlyMe5
Reviews.Content: We travel to Las Vegas at least 2-3 times per year and usually stay at the Four Seasons. This time I was offered an excellent casino rate at THEhotel and decided to try it out. Both hotels are part of the Mandalay Bay resort. Overall, THEhotel is a very nice four star property. I think I am unfairly comparing it to the Four Seasons (a solid five star hotel); really they're two very different properties at different price points. Still, given that they're both located within the same resort, I'm sure many people will at some point be looking to decide between one of the two. I did enjoy the very large size of the rooms at THEhotel. Even the standard rooms are large one bedroom suites. The bathrooms are enormous. The decor was a bit dated, but not terribly so. One thing I found odd was that the rooms do not have flat screen televisions in the bedrooms. There was a large flat screen TV in the living room and a very small one in the bathroom (a nice touch), but the TV in the bedroom was an old CRT model from several years ago. It didn't fit in with the rest of the room. Perhaps the biggest different that I noticed between the two hotels is the service. The service at the Four Seasons is spectacular. It truly is a five star hotel. All guests are made to feel special and welcome. No one was ever rude or unhelpful at THEhotel, but they didn't really go out of their way to try to help us with anything, either. I wouldn't complain about the service there at all, but it just doesn't compare to the Four Seasons. Again, I'm probably being unfair by comparing a four star hotel with a five star hotel. You are going to pay for the superior service at the Four Seasons. One negative issue was the noise level coming from the Mix nightclub located up on the top floor of THEhotel. I was really bothered by the music and noise emanating from the club even though we were located many floors below it. The noise came through our windows. The front desk admitted this can occasionally be a problem. It self-resolved at 2 AM when they close, but it was difficult to sleep until then. Still, this only occurred on one out of four nights. My bottom line suggestion: If you want a large one bedroom suite, or if price is the deciding factor, go with THEhotel. If you want fantastic service and top notch amenities in beautiful and classy surroundings, stay at the Four Seasons. One last tip: If you stay at THEhotel, don't buy sodas from the various sundry shops around the property. They're never cold there and you will pay over $3. Instead, there are vending machines on every floor of the hotel where you can get an ice cold soda for $2.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for at concert at Mandalay Bay”
Reviews.Author: Crushr99
Reviews.Content: Didn't leave the property all weekend. Awesome suites, very clean, nicely styled. Short cab ride to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Virginiabellarella
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas and we stayed at both the Venetian and THEHOTEL at MB. By far, The Hotel was the best. Our room was up high (thanks TripAdvisors for that tip). I liked that the suite was two separate rooms. So if one us woke up early (which happened alot with us being from the east coast), one could go into the living room area, shut the door and not disturb the other. The beds and pillows are very comfy. While the hotel is off the beaten track, it was nice to get away from the craziness of the strip. It was a quick cab ride to anyplace else we wanted to go. My only beef is that the hotel common areas, especially around the elevators, are extremely dark. I really preferred the restaurants at Mandalay Bay over those at the Venetian. The staff was pleasant and room service got our meal up to the room and it was still hot! And there are plenty of waitress to take your drink order at the casino, unlike at the Venetian where you could die of thirst at the machines.

Reviews.Title: “Smart Looking Rooms”
Reviews.Author: cliu
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd time only staying at The Hotel and this time around, it was not by choice. We actually used priceline and got a room at Mandalay and at check in, we asked for a complimentary upgrade to a larger room with 2 beds. the front desk clerk, Alex, was very helpful in giving us this complimentary upgrade to The Hotel on the 27th floor with strip view. The check in process was quite long as we had to wait in line for about 40 minutes since there were only 2 agents doing the check in. Having the extra living room really helps because we are 2 adults and 1 teenager so the extra space came in handy. The beds are comfy--on the softer side, 3 tvs altogether--one in the bathroom, one in living room, and one in bedroom. The room is quiet as we don't hear any of the noise from outside and the air conditioning works well--however, i find the room's air to be very drying. I must pre-warn you that the INTERNET in the room is extremely SLOW--actually it's like snail pace. After self park, you don't need to walk through the casino to get back to the room as you just walk 50 yards to get to The Hotel...very convenient. each bed comes with only 2 pillows so for someone like me who likes a fw more pillows, we had to request them. there are also 2 bath robes, safe, walk in shower, 2 sinks, with very limited amenities like soap, shampoo, and conditioner only. the last time we stayed in these rooms, they were so dark that we can barely see but they must have added more table lamps to the room now as there is sufficient lighting. the room is very comfortable and i would definitely return and do it the same way. book it on priceline and then upon check in, request to the The Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, needs a bit of fine tuning. . .”
Reviews.Author: nanster93
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at The Hotel, and we decided to try the V suite, instead of the standard suite. Pluses: Amazing views, and gorgeous layout, very comfortable bed, fairly reasonable wait time for room service; friendly housekeeping and room service staff, definitely not the case with the front desk clerk! Some minor inconveniences which need to be worked on: no robes in room until we called to have them sent up, and unfortunately, no coffee, either, which we didn't discover until the next morning, when we needed it! Bath towels were somewhat old and sandpapery, which is definitely not what you would expect in a hotel of this caliber. Since they have an early check-out, (11:00), we requested a late checkout of 12:00, but were told that they could not accommodate us, as they were fully booked. Overall, we still had a very pleasant experience, but a little fine-tuning would make it better! One last thing--definitely try the Lobby Bar, good service, excellent cocktails, although a bit on the pricey side--lovely atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the south end of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Spankytoes
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the good... -South end of the strip, which makes it very easy to get to and from the airport -Rooms are huge with a separate living area and oversized bathroom -Quick check-in/out -Very clean hotel Now, the bad... -Self parking is very hard to find. It's not clearly marked where you are supposed to go. When I finally found the entrance and parked, I found out that it was for the casino and not the hotel. I had to haul my luggage for what seemed like a mile to the lobby to check-in and another mile to my room. Worse, I saw another parking garage en route to the hotel elevators that would have been much more convenient for me. -While convenient to the airport, the hotel is far away from the action of the strip. I'd like to park and forget my rental car while in Vegas. Unless you want sore feet or lots of cab rides, that's not possible to do staying here. -Bedroom TV is not HD. I know that watching TV is not a must-do in Vegas, but it would be nice if they modernized them. -Resort fee is ridiculous. I got this hotel off of Hotwire and it wasn't disclosed to me until after my purchase. Just set one price so that I can pay for everything at the same time. Resort fees are nickel and dime...especially since I can't use your pool or cabanas in the winter and have no use for the spa. Now you're just a "hotel" as these amenities are useless to me. All in all, it's a very nice hotel. For my business purposes, it suited just fine. However, if I were going to a leisure trip, I'd probably look elsewhere. For the rack rate price, I can book something more central to all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay for Christmas”
Reviews.Author: Pohocat
Reviews.Content: First, a disclaimer: I have never been to Vegas for a vacation. I have always been here for work, so this was a first. We stayed at THEHotel at Mandalay Bay for Christmas this year. We reserved a VSuite, and were very pleased with the layout of the room, and the amount of space. The full bath is very spacious, with a great shower. There is an additional half-bath in the living room which is convenient. Our room was on the 32nd floor and was a corner suite, affording us a direct view of the Luxor and the strip. As others have noted, this is on the far south end of the strip which makes it pretty far from the "action," if that is what you are after. Still, between the monorail from the MGM Grand all the way to the Convention Center and the free trams between the Mandalay and Excalibur then moving on to the Monte Carlo all the way to the Bellagio, you really can get there without too much trouble. We appreciated the Trip Advisor reviewer who mentioned the Keurig coffee maker, so we brought our own. THEHotel charges $4 for a foam cup with a K-Cup inside, so we not only saved a bit of change to lose in the casino, but we got the coffee we liked. Staff at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived, so they gave us drink tickets for the bar and called us when our room was ready - about 20 minutes. The bartender (Ro) was awesome and fun to talk with. I would rate this hotel right up there with a Westin or Fairmont for quality finishes and comfort. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “I love THEhotel!”
Reviews.Author: jucogjct
Reviews.Content: I had booked Mandalay Bay for 2 nights and when I arrived was upgraded to a suite at THEhotel! It was a 1 bedroom suite with 2 queen beds. Everything was fantastic! It has a huge bathroom with separate shower and huge tub! The bed was really comfy! We had robes laying out for us the 2nd night although they were not there the first night. We loved staying there. Some people don't like being so far south on the strip, but we don't mind. MB and THEhotel have so much to offer. We ate at Hussongs and enjoyed the food. We also ate at Raffles Cafe. The food was great and our waitress was very nice! We went to Minus5 Icebar. It was COOL! and the drinks were good. I had coupons or restuarant.com certificates for all of these places!

Reviews.Title: “Never Disappoints”
Reviews.Author: lv2trvlevrywer
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas every year and stay at THEhotel. It's nice that the hotel is set apart from the casino and away from all the hustle and bustle. The suites are huge and the 1 1/2 bathrooms is a plus when you travel w/ family or friends. It's also a plus when reservations are made thru Amex's FHR program. The only negative is the pool/beach area where they ask you to pay for a lounge chair. Guess nothing is free in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “stay home”
Reviews.Author: anubis10
Reviews.Content: ARTHUR L. FINN Dec. 23, 2011 RE: Room 15810—Dec.18,19 Chuck Bowlinz, Gen. Mgr The Hotel @ Mandalay Bay 3950 Las Vegas Blvd. S. Las Vegas, Nv. 89119 Mr Bowlinz: How lame and without dignity is your hotel? Let me count some of the ways. You close The Café in The Hotel cavalierly making Raffles a place to avoid because of the crowds. The reception at Raffles, one Blanca, who for me, represents your uncaring hotel, is as unwelcoming and unprofessional as possible. You have too many people looking to say no to guests. Your valet service is obnoxious. Do they really work on tips? Some of your phone people are intimidating and silly. When I asked for a newspaper delivery one asked if I had a butler. I told her I left him home because I was going to a luxury hotel. Your “resort fee” says it includes a newspaper; it does nor say it is the free USA Today and one has to pick it up. PETTY. Getting amenities and things done by your housekeepers is a challenge. Too much of The Hotel’s service is handled by Mandalay Bay. Not a good thing. I save the best for last. I told the front desk on Monday the 19th to check me out Tuesday morning. I got my bill, which was wrong on Tuesday at 2 PM and requested a bill be e-mailed. Being forewarned on just how terribly inefficient, untrained and cavalier your people are I checked my bill today. Of course, you charged for Tuesday night and made some other overcharges. Your Margaret in unaccounts immediately informed me to prove I checked out Monday. After a long harangue by me she was willing to credit Tuesday. She still could not or would not tell me what the final total was . After spending about 30 minutes with Margaret teaching her arithmetic 101 she digfned to transfer me to her SUPERVISOR,after another 5 minutes I was transferred to Christina who was going to transfer me to the front desk. Remember them ? The people who messed up my incredibly complex checkout. I was not about to spend any more time with the inmates of your asylum. I will deal with your lame , cavalier inefficiency through AMEX. I have been in hundreds of 4 and 5 star hotels in my life. Never have I been subjected to one as totally customer unfriendly as yours. Strong letter to follow. Arthur L. Finn

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Class instead of glitz”
Reviews.Author: Lise B
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice option for travellers to Vegas, who prefer service over the novelity. Very nice rooms and you still get to use all the amenities of Mandalay Bay if you wish.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: aremy
Reviews.Content: My first experience at Mandalay Bay was fairly poor, but after spending some time in the property since my last stay, I decided to give it another go with the TheHotel. First off, the check in line at TheHotel seemed perpetually long, so I walked over to the check in at Mandalay Bay, which was a ghost town, and checked in there for TheHotel without any issues, was given my keys, and beat the long line at TheHotel (travel tip: Do that). The room itself was not ready because I arrived before check in, so I killed some time in the Mandalay Bay (Ri Ra Irish pub is a great place to relax and grab food/beer. Relaxed atmosphere, and an amazing staff, especially at the bar). I am growing more fond of Mandalay Bay, primarily due to its seemingly inconvenient location. It is on the farthest end of the strip, and therefore, seems to be out of walking distance for the drunken mid western tourists (the tucked in Hanes white T-Shirt accompanied by the Camouflage hunting cap crowd. Stylish, I know) who stumble down from Circus Circus with their plastic yard long mixed drinks screaming "Woo" every eleven steps. The hotel eventually contacted me on my cell phone to inform me that my room was ready. Upon first entering the room I noticed, as many have pointed out, that it is fairly dark inside. However, it was very clean, the furniture was in good shape, absent of the typical battle scarring most Vegas hotel furniture has, and had a guest bathroom and separate living area. Definitely not bad for $47 per night through the Mlife. Our stay was quiet, there was what appeared to be a party going on next door to us, but we never noticed in our room. Only real negative was the remote control for the bathroom TV was MIA and the king size bed only had two pillows. Minor gripes, as both could have been resolved by a quick call to the front desk, I however, was too lazy to bother. TheHotel has definitely shown me the light of the Mandalay Bay and will most likely be my new "go to" Vegas hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not so solid this time”
Reviews.Author: BDH1919
Reviews.Content: While planning to go see the new michael jackson cirque du soleil show housed at Mandalay Bay we figured we would just stay there. 60th floor of THEhotel is amazing, we had a suite that ran almost the length of the whole floor ( I have stayed in it before if you want to read my past review for specific details) the only down side I noticed this time that I didn't last time was the blaring music from Mixx right above us on floor 63. I didn't notice it last time due to the amount of Patron I had consumed that night but thankfully this last trip was no replay. We ate at Strip Steak as we always do while in Mandalay and unfortunately it was less than stellar this time, over an hour for 2 steaks and some sides, when food came it was warm at best and was we were never asked a drink -I had to get them at the bar. Just a quick note on the Michael Jackson show- What a letdown, a serious disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: CAvegasfan
Reviews.Content: In the last 12 years, we stayed at Bellagio as very regular customers and while it is still lovely, we decided to move on to another MGM property because of crowded conditions and casino action. We stayed at The Hotel twice and both times were extraordinary with regards to service, the rooms, the play, and restaurants. We don't feel as if the hotel is far away from the action, in fact, valet at The Hotel and check-in was easy. We stayed in very large suites and one of the regular "rooms", both were delightful. I can't find much fault here because we don't walk the strip, we always call and let room service know when we want our room serviced, we tip well, and we don't worry about whether there is coffee in the room or how much it costs to order room service. Bellagio is crowded and the action is better here; we love it!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Hotel in hectic Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Stephen C
Reviews.Content: A welcome relief from the other noisy hotels. Spacious suites beautifully decorated. Great comfy bed. Friendly service. No complaints at all. Be prepared for a bit of a walk if you stay here, as it's right at the end of the Strip. But there is a bus stop not too far, and plenty of taxi's. Excellent value as I booked through Experia including flights.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vegas trip ever!”
Reviews.Author: DBonna
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to Vegas for my birthday and we wanted to stay somewhere kind of "swanky" so we chose THEhotel. I LOVED it here. We had a corner suite on the 26th floor that overlooked the luxor from the bedroom. We had a living room and 1 1/2 bathrooms which was perfect for us because I tend to be a bathroom hog in the mornings. I can't say enough good things about this place! The hotel smelled awesome, everyone was very friendly, and they provided robes and slippers! The only complaint I have is that the coffee served everywhere (except starbucks) is this awful instant coffee. We used to use this same type of coffee in the place I work. It tastes like it's made from soy juice. There is coffee in your room but it cost's $8 a cup which is absolutely not worth it when starbucks is right downstairs. Just so you know, it is at the south end of the strip so it's kind of far from all the action. There is a free tram that runs from Mandalay Bay to Luxor and Excalibur. From there you can catch the bus in front of the MGM and it will take you the whole legnth of the strip and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good Alternative”
Reviews.Author: Mysticyat
Reviews.Content: I actually had reservations at the Mandalay Bay for a convention, but when I checked the only rooms that the Mandalay had available were "smoking optional" rooms - apparently no one ever opts to NOT smoke in these rooms because they were horrendous. When I refused to take a room reeking of tabacco smoke, they put me in THE Hotel where they had non-smoking rooms. Turns out that was seriously to my advantage. Nice, well appointed room. Staff and service was good. Room rate was not bad for a major Las Vegas resort, and I had all of the restaurants and conveniences of the Mandalay Bay complex. But the cost of everything else was outrageous. $4.95 for a single cup of Keurig coffee with powdered "coffee whitener" in the room. I tried to order room service on 2 separate evenings and was told both times that the wait time for delivery was 2 1/2-3 hours. A friend who was also moved to THE Hotel had $290 in charges for room amenities on his bill that he had to dispute. He was looking at the ridiculous "amenities" in the room - he picked them up and looked at them, but DID NOT open any. But just lifting them to look had triggered the weight sensitive sytems and they were charged to his room, so be careful what you pick up to look at.

Reviews.Title: “THEhotel at Mandalay Bay: A solid 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: KCORLANDO
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Las Vegas for a conference. The conference hotel booked up very quickly as there were over 7000 attendees. I was able to get in at THEhotel for a very reasonable room rate. When I first arrived, I was told the room I booked was a smoking room, though I requested a non-smoking room. The front desk clerk was gracious enough to offer me multiple solutions to resolve this issue. I could opt to have the air sanitize or upgrade for a small fee. I went to the room, which was one of the few rooms in the hotel which was not a suite and I found the accommodations to be more than adequate for a business trip. So, I opted to use the ozone machine which was supposed to purify the air, as I was traveling for business and did not want to incur any extra expense that my company was unaware of. However, I am asthmatic and I began to experience some breathing difficulties. I call down to the front desk and I was upgraded to a suite for an additional $20 a day. I found this to be a reasonable solution and I was very pleased with the suite. The rooms are well-appointed and spacious. The service at THEhotel was excellent. Room service was prompt and hot. The room was cleaned relatively early daily and the front desk staff was courteous and informative. I've read some complaints about the resort fee, but the fee covers your daily internet access and parking so I find it to be very reasonable. Though Vegas is not my favorite city, if I ever return to Vegas I would stay at THEhotel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of choices on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: Idontstayhome
Reviews.Content: I have been to all the major resorts in Vegas. The Hotel is just average nothing about the place was great . With so may choices out there I would consider a center strip location. The location is at the far end of the strip and every other casino becomes a trip in it self to get to. The convention center and pool are the highlights but unless you only going to a convention I would try another resort .

Reviews.Title: “Use to be awesome. Not so anymore.”
Reviews.Author: Dkasen
Reviews.Content: I was excited that we were returning to TheHotel last weekend. It use to be my favorite hotel in Vegas. The layout of the room is perfect. Two separate rooms and beautiful bathroom. That's where the wonderful ness ended, we got upgraded to the corner suite, so we thought yippee, but we were disappointed that the view was of the Luxor. The worst part was the bed. You could actually see the dips in the bed which made for a horrible night's sleep. The bed linens were scratchy and not at all like they were in previous stays. At 6:00 in the morning we were told that room service would be at least an hour. It was at that point we decided we were too tired and sore from the non-sleep we had and changed our pane reservations to come home early. When we checked out, the agent asked how our stay was, we told her, and she didn't see overly concerned. We had made our reservations through American Express platinum, so we lost out on the free breakfast and spa credit. I was not happy.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice once we got settled”
Reviews.Author: YukonQuirm
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Mandalay Bay and this time we were able to get a good deal for THEHotel. Our initial impression as we walked to the reception was a bit "meh". The floor has started showing its age with cracks and the reception area is extremely underwhelming with the most bizarre blue mess of paint behind the check in - it is a seven dwarfs painting that looks as though cans of paint have been randomly thrown at it to cover up the dwarfs - very unfitting for a place that is meant to be 5 stars. The person at the check in was very helpful despite some mess up with our reservation which showed us arriving a year from the date we actually showed up. The hotel was very full but he did manage to find us a suite with a promise of being moved the next day to a higher floor. He also gave us some credit to use toward the room. The next day was a bit of a joke. We had to cart our luggage around and store it as the room wasn't ready. We went out and came back at 3:30pm to find they still hadn't assigned a room. When they finally did assign a room they gave us back the original one - we pointed this out and after some wait they did give us a room on the 32nd floor. We went up to the room to find that it was occupied - then back down again to find another one. Once again they gave us one on a lower floor. We asked again for one on a higher floor and did get a room on the 34th floor - "the last one we were told". At the same time another couple came back down quite furious that they had been given a room that was in a disastrous state and hadn't been cleaned. I understand there was a bit of a problem with the computer system that day (perhaps a user related problem I suspect). For our troubles they did provide us with some credit to pay for a meal. We also had to make phone calls to the booking agent as they were unwilling to provide us with the buffet vouchers that were part of our booking - this was likely due to the fact that the hotel put us in for a year different than our actual visit. Now all of that run around was a bit of a pain but really not such a big deal. The room was lovely and gave plenty of space for our family of 4. The bathrooms are very spacious and the bath products are excellent. I have really long and thick hair and it was nice to have enough shampoo and conditioner and to be able to pour it out without fighting with the bottle. It was also nice to walk out of the busy"ness" of the Mandalay Bay and into the relative calm of "TheHotel". There is a lot of closet and drawer space for putting your clothes away and fabulous robes. As other reviewers have said, make sure you ask for a room on a higher floor as the lower ones look out over the "works" of the building. We did tip at the time of check in and it made a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and affordable option for business”
Reviews.Author: Dzf3yy
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for business travelers who are at the mandalay convention center. Still a large hotel...but a small hotel feel. Beautiful suites. I have never had issues with accommodations. Love the separate entrance from casino. Hotel is at end of strip...so when you are there...it is your destination. Great dining options in Mandalay...and. Everyone has happy hours from 4-7 with food and drinks ($5). Some suggestions...The Hotel charges a $20 resort fee...but that doesn't include the fitness center (you can use mandalays). There is an extra $15 charge for hotel gym. The rooms have keurig makers...but want $6 for the k-cup from the minibar...bring a few from home! If you are going to Mandalay restaurants...use the shortcut through parking garage. Also...turn housekeeping light on when you leave for the day...otherwise your room won't get cleaned until after 3.

Reviews.Title: “A great Las Vegas upscale hotel!”
Reviews.Author: colony
Reviews.Content: This is at least the 3rd time i have stayed at this hotel. I like it mainly because it is an all suite hotel. Service is impeccable in the hotel and in the restaurant and lounge areas. If you plan to stay on business or on a leisure trip gamble in the casino shared by Mandalay Bay Hotel this is the place for you. If you don't take the tram it can be a hike to other hotels and cabs have really gone up. Expect to pay anywhere between $12 - 25 for cab rides. Food is a little on the high side for Vegas but always delicious. The House of Blues located off the casino area has some great shows and good soul food. The Lion King is playing in their theater and so is the new Michael Jackson show.

Reviews.Title: “This was always my base hotel in Las Vegas until now.........”
Reviews.Author: Diveplan
Reviews.Content: Yeah the rooms are pricey but that is what you pay for with a hotel that is known for its service. I have stayed at this hotel for the last five years every time I go to Vegas. When I travel with my friends from the same town we all stay there. When I meet my family in Vegas we all stay at THEhotel. I think I will be looking for a new base camp for when I am in Vegas. A few issues are: Sunday night of the ROCKNROLL marathon they jammed part of the 44,000 runners with the outlet of the COwboy Christmas convention until everyone was jammed in the hallway to the convention center. You could not move, you were trapped shoulder to shoulder, anxiety started to set in. As if the above wasn't bad enought they did it again later that night with the poor tired thirsty runners returning and the Mandalay Bay grand opening of the Michael Jackson Immortal tour. Once again it was wall to wall people, you could not move for 20 minutes, wall to wall people, jammed in the walkway trying to go opposite directions. In both of the above instances there was no crowd control. I was shocked Manalay Bay put so high a regard for multiple events over people's safety. As far as THEhotel, I called three nights in a row for a wake up call, no answer. I waited Sunday morning two hours for room service. I waited Saturday night two hours for room service. My message light went on three different times alerting me to a fax. Three times I go downstairs and they could not find it. I lose 700.00 in a slot machine, took me about 40 minutes, not once did someone come by and offer me a drink. I called the concierge desk twice, no answer. I went down to find the concierge and was pretty much brushed off on finding about future events. I told the bellman when I arrived at THEhotel, that it was like "coming home" for me, because I stay there when I go to Vegas. It sure did not feel that way when I left. Very disappointed in the whole stay.

Reviews.Title: “A respite from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: Eve G
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at The Hotel and really enjoyed my stay. The rooms were well designed and spacious. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom large. The hotel is close enough to the action to be convenient but far enough away to escape when necessary. Everyone I me was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: HideawaysSouthDakota
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property Dec. 1st thru Dec.3rd of 2011. The rooms were great. I liked the fact that the living room was separate from the bedroom and the 1 1/2 baths were a big plus. It could have been cleaner for me as far as the bathroom goes, but that is a big issue I have with motels... And yes some of the furniture is showing some scratch marks etc. But, we didn't find it a problem for us.We used the valet parking which was great too. I highly recommend renting a car while in Vegas and using the valet parking where you go. The location of "Thehotel" as far as being down on the strip wasn't a issue either with us as we had a car and my husband knows his way around to drive. Our room was very quiet, we were on the 12th floor, didn't get a strip view but to be honest we don't spend alot of time gazing out the windows, lol! We also didn't have any trouble with check in or check out as some have in reviews. I would highly recommend THehotel for a nice stay in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Joy of THEHOTEL”
Reviews.Author: josephone
Reviews.Content: We just completed a terrific stay at TheHotel. We were delighted. Our last stay there the rooms were dark and not particularly clean. This time they have increased the lighting brightness and it is a joy to stay there. The big plus for me was the marvelous new bathrobes. I even went and bought one. The folks who clean the rooms are amazing! You could have eaten off the floor LOL. The bathroom was gorgeous. A highlight for me who likes noise was all three tv's playing the same show!!! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great rooms, good value”
Reviews.Author: Bartje83
Reviews.Content: Three years after my previous visit, I feared THEhotel wouldn't amaze me as much as it did the first time (after all, nothing is going to beat the Encore) and it didn't. It is however, still an amazing hotel. The lobby and common areas look very nice & stylish, the rooms are pretty large, well appointed and well maintained. Floor to ceiling windows give great views of the Strip. Housekeeping is good and never disturbed us. It is connected to Mandalay Bay and shares all the amenities with that hotel, like the great Mandalay casino and the pools. in November only Moorea Beach Club was open. Very nice pool, beautiful area and I would certainly like this pool when it is an adult-only pool like it is in the summer. The large jacuzzi just isn't that relaxing when there's children screaming and climbing over your shoulders.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity and style in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: ppbcup
Reviews.Content: Taking the walkway from Mandalay to THEhotel you notice the noise level going down, the surroundings are beautiful and elegant and you feel like you stepped into a spa. One of the great things about THEhotel is the calm and serene surroundings. No party people running down the halls making noise or a ton of people walking around but the beauty is that once you have recharged you walk through the walkway and the excitement and fun of the casino, restaurants and clubs is all right there! The Suite was amazing. A comfy living room, spacious bathroom and bedroom. We had a view of the strip and could see the Cosmopolitan and Aria from our room. I would definitely come here again when I hit up Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Large hotel with well appointed suites”
Reviews.Author: Annie3974
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November 2011 as part of a Virgin fly drive holiday. THEhotel is connected to the Mandalay Bay Resort and Casino, and it is possible to check in at either, as we discovered arriving at the wrong reception area after self parking the car. The suite wa s extremely well appointed. The resort had numerous restaurants, we ate in the House of Blues and Red, White and Blue, both of which were good, and breakfasted in Starbucks. It was possible to buy cereal and milk in the shop at THEhotel which was also good for breakfast. The location at the south end of the strip meant that it seemed a bit quiter, although it was still busy by the standard of hotels elsewhere. I would recommend THEhotel for anyone visiting Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: taliaa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days during a conference at Mandalay Bay this month. Upon arrival, we were disappointed to see this bizarre entrance under ground - the only way to access the hotel directly other than walking through Mandalay Bay itself. The interior is very boutique-y, I liked it but it is a darker than some other hotels on the strip. Check-in was fine. We are travel agents so I thought we would have had more of a description of the property, but it was pretty quick. We checked in early and they had a room, but it was mountain view. The girl at the desk said 'she' likes it better than the strip view rooms since its more serene although I feel like she said that because she wanted to give us our room rather than waiting for a strip-view room. When we finally got up to our room on the 33rd floor, we saw a highway and small buildings and the mountains in the distance. Sound wasn't an issue. Helicopters and hot air balloons were visible which was nice. The view was still nice but not the strip. The room itself was just alright - same as the pictures you see online (we had a queen room = 2 queen bed), but the room was visibly worn as others have mentioned. Marks and scuffs, stains on the carpet and duvets, even large tears in the bedskirts - it was clearly not cleaned properly. There was broken glass in the corner in the bathroom and a whole bunch of smashed raisins and M&Ms on the carpet when we moved a chair over a slight bit. That was disappointing. The shower head was pretty gross too with all the calcium/lime scum built up on it. Just didn't feel as clean as I had hoped. There were two TVs in the room and one in the bathroom. The one in the bedroom was an old flat screen and it buzzed like mad when it was on. Super annoying. Beds were very soft, had to call for bed boards. They only brought one and said they had none left. Hmm. Suspicious. Either way, don't expect a Heavenly bed or anything too fancy. Sleep was just okay. The room was exceptionally dry (of course, its winter in the desert!), so we were super statically charged and it was COLD outside! Check your weather reports before you go - people were nearly half-naked, men included and I had a scarf and gloves on at night. The room next door was smoking up a storm despite it being a smoke-free floor and even smoke-free hotel, if I'm not mistaken. There was also a nasty smell coming from the drain, mildew or something so we just blocked the drains so we couldn't smell it anymore. We didn't complain about anything as we literally had no time, but it was definitely noted. Some of my higher-end clientele would NOT be pleased with the state of the room. Perhaps this would have been remedied by a room change or a good cleaning, but it just shows it is getting old in there. We didn't have time to deal with all of that as we were there for a conference not for pleasure. They really could do a few small things and spruce it up. We enjoyed Mandalay Bay and the amenities in general. Food was good and not too over priced although $4 for a Keurig coffee is insane. Perhaps bring your own and see if it will work in the room! You can get a full-day meal pass at Mandalay Bay Bayside Cafe I think it was called for $43 per person per day, might not be a bad option if you're in one spot all day. Variety was decent and dessert was great. To get to the strip, you have to take a monorail (free) to get to the Excalibur hotel, then walk. Its a LOT of walking. Bring blister strips from home to save you a trip to Walgreens like so many others were doing including me! After visiting some of the other properties on the strip, I would have to say location wise, THEhotel is not great unless you're okay with spending lots of money on cabs (if you're doing the strip shopping and dinners). Next year, our conference is at the Palazzo and we actually agreed before that was announced that the Palazzo or the Venetian hotel are perfectly situated and would be much better in terms of location. I can't speak for the rooms of any of the other hotels this visit, but location alone would make me move hotels for my next trip. Pros: Location, Boutique-style hotel, no casino in actual hotel building, decent sized rooms for a regular non-suite room. Cons: Location, dark hotel, dirty, worn down room, lots of walking required

Reviews.Title: “suites with a view”
Reviews.Author: collieperson
Reviews.Content: AMEX plat when I needed to change hotels suggested this property. I have now stayed there four times. We have had a corner suite each time. The living room and the bed room are as good as it gets. We get a great rate and $40 toward breakfeast each day is included as well as a one time spa credit of $100. There is no valet fee for the car. The food in the hotel is excellent and we took 10 people to the Irish pub and the variety of the menu was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great service, close to action or needed privacy....”
Reviews.Author: runtoregon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a V suite-corner 1 bedroom with great views-ask for a high floor. Clean, modern and big tub to soak in after the days of walking. THEbed was excellent. Great restaurants and entertainment at Mandalay and Mandalay Place. Poor security and set-up for Michael Jackson Immortal but otherwise Mandalay and Thehotel will be a top choice on my list for LV strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “You Will Not Be Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: yesnomaybe213
Reviews.Content: Okay, let's get 'location' out of the way. Mandalay Bay is not mid-Strip, and therefore you have to do a combination of walking and trams to get to City Center and mid-Strip destinations. Having said that, there's nowhere else I'd rather stay in Las Vegas. The walk is completely flat and you get a decent workout going to mid-Strip and back. THEhotel at Mandalay Bay, an all-suite property at the main Mandalay Bay Resort, boasts the most well appointed rooms for the money you will find almost anywhere. Each room is a suite, and you get 1.5 bathrooms plus a 2Q room with a living room that has a pullout sofa. That's a pretty sweet deal, and there's plenty of privacy if you have 3 or even 4 guests sharing. Every suite is decorated in rich earth tone colors and there is plenty of closet and storage space. The master bath has twin sinks set in beautiful granite, a large walk-in shower, and a soaking tub. The beds are super comfortable. I sleep on a Select Comfort bed at home and I am a princess when it comes to hotel beds. This place knows good bedding. And now for my favorite feature of this hotel. The minute you leave the casino and walk into THEhotel, an incredible transformation takes place. The casino is huge and filled with people, but when you walk the 100 yards or so toward THEhotel, it's like you've gone into an oasis of calm. I love this... you can have your cake and eat it, too. Action is less than a football field away from the lobby at THEhotel, and yet you know when you cross that threshold you have reached peace and quiet that feels like home. THEcafe at THEhotel is awesome. Unfortunately, it is only open for breakfast and lunch. Aaaaaaaahhhhhhh, but what an incredible menu they have both for breakfast and for lunch. I've been all over Europe and to some of the best restaurants on both the east and west coast of the US, and NOWHERE have I had a better omelet. The staff are friendly and exceptionally skilled, so you will never want for anything. Also they have the best Bloody Marys I've ever had. Check-in and checkout at THEhotel are a breeze. The on-site concierge service is outstanding. And I would be remiss if I didn't mention that the Mandalay Bay property has the best collection of restaurants in all of Las Vegas. Mandalay Bay is home to award-winning Aureole, Fleur, Border Grill, and RM Seafood. In closing, if you want the more classy and sedate place to stay in an otherwise raucous city, then THEhotel at Mandalay Bay is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing surprise on luxury and isolation”
Reviews.Author: MrPKI
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the room suites are luxurious, well decorated, quite and furnished better than could be expected. Having a living room and extra space made the hotel a pleasant stay in a very crazy city.

Reviews.Title: “Tips for the business traveler staying at The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ptbrk
Reviews.Content: Frankly, I subconsciously avoided this property because of it's lame name. When having no other choice, I was extremely gratified by how easy and pleasurable it is to stay here. If on business, I'd recommend opting for the V Suite accommodation. They are out of the way at the end of the hallways and kept from the noise. The bedroom's suite is so peaceful and the view so calm it's hard to get out of bed. Desk has both wired and wireless connections, easy to find plenty of plugs and the chair is ergonomically correct with many adjustments. Internet connection is fast and flawless. Avoid the valet if you drive your own car. The best and closest parking lot can be access through Frank Sinatra drive (frontage road between hotel and freeway). Make an immediate left onto level two and go all the way to the end. I was able to always find parking, take one light of stairs, walk to the entrance, catch the elevator and be in my room in about 3 minutes. The concierge was knowledgable and helpful and the multilingual front desk staff was fast and to the point. No, it isn't the Wynn, but it is cheaper and definitely makes the cut.

Reviews.Title: “general all round alright”
Reviews.Author: rosie181818
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September for a conference. I thought it was good and everything was up to scratch, but it isn't centrally located on the strip, and the rooms are a little bit dreary. When I went to other hotels and apart-hotels on the strip they had a bit more of a "wow" factor. That said, the mandalay bay has an awesome pool and a beach, probably the best pool in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BC_Travellers123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at TheHotel for three nights while participating in the Rock & Roll Marathon. The location was great as the race started at Mandalay Bay, but be prepared to walk a bit if you like to explore the strip (the only reason I gave the hotel a four instead of five). The suite was beautiful, nicely decorated and very clean. Lots of room for clothing and a very spacious bathroom. Front desk service was fast and helpful. We were pleasantly surprised that they checked us in early (at noon) on the day that we arrived. Great restaurants at Mandalay Bay - especially recommend the China Grill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ted H
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have ever had the pleasure of staying in, the staff was helpful, the hotel was beautiful and the perfect relaxing end to a crazy day out on the strip. Only a five min. walk to the mandalay casino where you can have a great meal at the house of blues (breakfast at the bar is the way to go). Best stay I have ever had in vegas and I will be staying with them again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Lisasilver
Reviews.Content: From start to finish an awful experience. Check in took over an hour, every time called operator was put on hold at least 15 minutes, cleaning of rooms occurred at 4pm and after complaining they said this was acceptable, walls so thin heard the howling dog in room next store, room served took over hour and delivered cold, I could go on and on but bottom line much better hotels, less expensive and not as far away from everything

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: glen c
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very nice - it would be so much better if people adheard to the non smoking policy on our floor - what can you do. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Room was clean. The pool was closed which was disappointing. All in all we had a great time in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: w81minute
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at The Hotel and we did enjoy ourselves. Service was fast and friendly, we waited maybe 5 minutes in line before being efficiently checked in. The room was on the 29th floor, spacious and offered a nice view of the city. The Hotel is a elegant and seems to be tucked away from all the chaos that is Vegas. Once your done for the evening the atmosphere is quiet serentiy. Housekeeping was not as thorough as previous visits and the rooms are starting to show age. They seem to be loosing a bit of the "sparkle" of previous years.

Reviews.Title: “Third Stay, Still One of My Favorites in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Ellenwood
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at TheHotel (the first being four years ago) and it remains one of my favorite places to stay in Las Vegas. The suites look and feel of sophisticated high-end apartments (down to the doorbell). The suites have held up well as they had the foresight to have custom cut glass tops on most of the furniture resulting in very few nicks. Everything was very clean with few signs of wear. Rather than the sameness of materials in most hotel rooms, the suites have different wallcoverings and artwork in each room, different furniture styles and carpets in the bedroom and living room, and even a tiled entry foyer. A DVD player is included in the living room, and a Ihome Ipod clock radio is included in the bedroom. On a more practical note, easily accessible electrical outlets are by the bed and desk areas, and the large bathroom includes shelves as well as cubbyholes for personal items. The bathtub is very large(and deep) and you can see the bathroom TV from both the bathtub and the shower. Ample storage space is included in the bedroom in a storage unit that includes two closets, a number of drawers, a safe, and a 42 inch television. The hotel is quiet. The dark colors fell more masculine than most suites. All of the above is probably why I have spotted athletes on each of my three stays (and celebrities on one). Downsides: The room was spotless but it did not look like the hallway was vacuumed either of the four days I was there. The TV is not HD (minor point), the $22 resort fee which includes access to a matchbook sized fitness center located in Mandalay Bay, a USA today Newspaper, local calls, and internet access. I would imagine most of their guests would pull up USA today on their cell phone or Ipad, make calls on their cell phone, and walk the strip for cardio, so the only useful thing you are really getting is internet for $22 per day

Reviews.Title: “I gave it only a 4 because of hidden fees”
Reviews.Author: fndlair
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice first class hotel. The staff (excluding the phone agents) are very nice and accommodating. Just beware of the hidden fees.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Gary W
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at THEhotel. We had difficulty locating the reservation desk which was unexpected. The attendant at the reservation desk indicated that lack of directions was intentional, to keep it more "exclusive". (That does not bode well for a first time visit.). The coffee in the room comes with a $4 charge per cup Private Bar fee. The coffee maker in our room was defective and failed to heat the water. I called the service desk and reported the problem as was told they would be up to correct. No on showed up! We left for the day after waiting an hour for them to fix the Coffee maker. That nite after returning, I noticed the Coffee maker was still broken (still had my cup in the machine). I called service again and reported the issue and inquired why it was not corrected. They did not seem to know, so I indicated that I wished to insure they would not charge me for the failed attempt to use the coffee maker, or I would be upset. They assured me I would not be charged. I WAS charged. I will not frequent this place again. We stayed for two week days, so perhaps they did not have their finest crew working.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want.”
Reviews.Author: mrhume
Reviews.Content: We stayed at TheHotel the weekend before Thanksgiving for a weekend getaway. TheHotel was nearly perfect in every way. Check in was quick and easy, we arrived at about noon on Friday and were immediately checked into our luxurious two room suite. We found all areas, both in the room, and in the common areas to be spotlessly clean. On Friday night we ate at the Burger Bar in the mall adjacent to the hotel for great hamburgers. On Saturday night we ate the Mix Restaurant, where my meal was one of the best I can remember. I had the shrimp cocktail that was more like a shrimp salad that tasted amazing. For dinner I had the filet with bernaisse sauce and fork mashed potatos that was perfectly prepared. Service was excellent and our restaurant.com certificate was gladly accepted. The view of the strip from the elevator ride up, as well as from the restaurant and adjacent bar was great. We enjoyed using the Starbucks like coffee bar in the lobby (there is an actual Starbucks at the entrance to the casino if you prefer that) and The Store a convenience store in the lobby that was open 24 hours on the weekend and sold beer wine, snacks, and pharmacy type items at prices substantially less than the expensive minibar items. The casino is about one minute away from the hotel lobby and the atmosphere was friendly and fun. We saw Katy Parry in concert at the Mandalay Bay Events Cener and she put on a great show. We had no complaints and were treated well by all of the hotel personnel. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel with great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: as_1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nts between 5-12 nov and loved it! Have been to Vegas 9 times and this is by far one of the best hotels. You get to get away from everything as is away from main hotel yet close enough to take advantage of the amenities of Mandalay bay. Rooms were clean and spacious, only negative is we were on 37th floor and could hear the club at night. I did complain about this and was sent up earPlugs! Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Here's the pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: MarioSD
Reviews.Content: I Stayed through thanksgiving weekend. Let me start by saying that if you’ve never stayed here you’re in for a surprise. Unlike most other resorts, TheHotel has an ambiance of tranquility that I have yet to experience anywhere in Las Vegas. No loud music, drunks, slots, crowds, parents running around with kids, etc. From the valet - front entrance you are just steps to the main elevators, which was perfect because I was traveling with my parents who are seniors and have limited mobility. The morning coffee place is right next to the elevators and was never crowded when I went (major plus). There is a very nice small bar in the lobby, a small convenience store, and restaurant nearby. I saw very few people in the lobby and the valets were excellent. The way this place was designed is brilliant because it’s a hotel connected to the Mandalay bay casino but away from the crowds. So, you have everything you need in a short walking distance from TheHotels’s lobby. I think it took me about 5-6 minutes to walk from TheHotels elevators through the Mandalay bay casino, to the tram which takes you to Luxor and the Excalibur. Also, NO CIGARETTE SMELL ANYWHERE at TheHotel. Now to the rooms and what I liked. The suites are very well appointed with everything you could possibly need. There are several electrical outlets to charge your things, and I really liked the location of the safe. The bathrooms are huge and very convenient – just as big as the Venetian but much better space distribution. You have three TV’s , a very comfortable couch, a wet bar, two bathrooms, two A/C controls, floor to ceiling windows, a big desk, high speed wireless internet, sufficient closet space, and very comfortable beds. I also want to add that all the staff I encountered were very attentive, polite, and professional. What I didn’t like. The first room had a view of the airport so I requested a change to a strip view which they happily accepted. However, while looking at my first room, I noticed that the carpets were noticeably stained and housecleaning forgot to remove some taped on streamers on the walls that were left behind by the previous guests. My new room was cleaner. Yes, some of the furniture is starting to show light chips and scratches. In my room the shower head looked gross - full of calcium deposits, I had to request extra towels (only two were provided), the walls are thin so if you have noisy neighbors you will hear them, and I noticed that the outside windows were dirty. Also, I did not see any security at the elevators at night, however, on the positive side there are cameras everywhere, and I did see security roaming the halls at night. Overall, I wasn’t expecting much but I was impressed by the tranquility and subtle elegance of the place. If you’re looking for the 2 mile trek from the valet to the elevators (the Mirage-wink) or if you want casino chaos and loud music this may not be your place. This is a classy quiet hotel which is perfect for someone who wants to be really close to the casino but away from the pandemonium. I highly recommend this place to business travelers, seniors, couples, and those who want to leave the casino experience at the casino. Well worth the money you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: THEhotel was our choice for the Thanksgiving week because I had a good experience several years ago at the Mandalay Place already. This hotel has a great view over the strip. Our room was on the 33rd floor. The rooms are smaller suites with King/Queen beds and a couch in the living room, which is not a bed couch (!). The brochure says "sleeps 4". But that does not mean 2 in the bed room and 2 on the couch. Either you have 2 Queen beds or you consider the couch as extra bed. The staff at the reception is friendly and they offered us a rollaway bed for free (usually a charge), if the couch does not do it. The bathroom is spacious and like the rest of the room in excellent shape. However, the cleanliness was a bit ambiguous. There was an open shampoo bottle on the somewhat sticky countertop. Glad we are not too picky, because the rest was clean. All in all a great place to go. A lot of food choices in the hotel and the adjacent Mandalay Bay, quite some activity and a bus stop in front of the hotel - if you want to preserve energy for enjoying the inside of all the other hotel locations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Idea, touch small for a suite”
Reviews.Author: Danno_99
Reviews.Content: THE hotel is an all-suite hotel - I was in the basic suite. Lounge - very nice - sofa, couch, 60" (?) TV with a DVD player, desk, good chair, floor to ceiling windows. Also a (guest) toilet and a minibar with a small sink. Wired internet connection at the desk worked well - and fast. Could not get the wifi connection working. The bedroom - nice bed (too many pillows), plenty of storage space. The bathroom scores highest - oversized tub, separate shower, and a small adjoining toilet. There's a small TV opposite the tub. Two sinks (his and hers...). Quite good toiletries. Housekeeping did a good job. Two (electronic) thermostats - temperature can be set for the bedroom and the lounge separately. Guest services responded quickly to calls - and were always very helpful. I do feel that this is as small as a suite can get - the bathroom was very large, but the lounge and the bedroom felt as though it would have been a better use of the space to have one large room instead. There was a stylish capsule espresso coffee machine in the minibar - but unfortunately you had to buy a plastic cup + capsule for $4 to use it. Not so stylish. The casino is good, the buffet OK - fair variety and OK quality. Chairs in the buffet are uncomfortable, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, poor service”
Reviews.Author: lmlmlm
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about the hotel, except for the service. Very poor front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: VegasBlondie
Reviews.Content: THEhotel is te all suite tower of the already very nice Mandalay Bay. Very classy, super comfy beds and a lot of pillows. Nice tvs and ipod hookups. Best bathroom ive had, seperate very nice tub and shower with a tv on an adjacent wall, seperate toilet room, and there's 2 toilet room. Service was excellent! Stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tucker42
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in Vegas staying at The Hotel. It feels like a very "exclusive" property. The staff are very courteous. The suites are well appointed. In particular, the beds and pillows were very comfortable. Compliments also to the air control system - there was a thermostat for both the bedroom and living room making it easy to keep the temperature comfortable. My only complaint about The Hotel was how dark all of the common areas are. While this certainly seems to be a trend in upscale hotels, it's simply irritating.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every dollar”
Reviews.Author: Brenda V
Reviews.Content: So if you're going to Vegas, most likely you're not going to be sitting in your hotel room the entire time. Especially on the weekend. But in case you need to be a party pooper or end up getting sick somehow, the room will definitely make you happy. We stayed in the V Suite. Extremely spacious, clean, comfortable and we had a good view. Everything is just a short walk away(don't be lazy) and you can easy head shopping, go eat, see a show, gamble, party, or walk the strip. I would definitely recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Room in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: AnandPhoenix_Arizona
Reviews.Content: Best room in Vegas. The rooms are 2 room suites with full living room, with its own separate bathroom, allowing you to host people, or just be able to have an extra when the other is occupied. Room entrance is into the living room (unlike the Encore where it opens into the bedroom) Room service and guests can enter without having to go through your bedroom. Because there is no gaming in this tower (although its a short walk away) there is less smoke and commotion that you find in other hotels. I have not stayed this far south on the strip before, and have to admit it was enjoyable, if for nothing else it is very close to the airport. The decor is modern and classy, and the service was excellent. I typically stay at the Palazzo, but have stayed at all of the other top level hotels on the strip, and must say this ranks at the top. As a bonus the shops at the Mandalay have some very trendy boutique clothing shops that had amazing stuff! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with the room”
Reviews.Author: Robert P
Reviews.Content: Stayed November 9th-13th. I travel to Las Vegas about 3 times a year and only ever stay at either the Bellagio of Palazzo. I received an invitation for tickets to the Latin Grammys along with a couple nights stay at The Hotel so decided to give it a try. I was pleasantly surprised at the size of the room and layout. Unlike other reviews I did not find my room had a lot of wear and tear or feel that it was dated. Loved having the one bedroom as in my case it allowed me to sleep later than my other half. Check in was a breeze and was able to get into my room at 1:00 pm even though check in is 3:00 pm. The express check out wasn't working on the TV but there was no waiting at 9:00 am at the front desk. The one negative that was huge for me was I could hear the music coming from the Mix club on the 64th floor of the hotel. I was on the 37th floor in the opposite tower and it was just like someone was partying in the room next door. Not good if you are a light sleeper since it goes on until the early hours of the morning. I suffered through it because I carry ear plugs and didn't want the hastle of moving after unpacking. Bottom line I would absolutely stay here again because I like the one bedroom layout but would make sure that my room faced away from the club.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service and a really fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: Faye A
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels on the strip (Wynn, Encore, Bellagio, Venetian, Aria, and Cosmopolitan) but The Hotel surpasses all of them on customer service. My husband and I felt so welcome and all the employees are very attentive from my casino host to the housekeeper, front desk, servers, security people, etc.

Reviews.Title: “THEHotel”
Reviews.Author: tkfried
Reviews.Content: Room is very nice. Hotel a little far being at the end of the strip. Did have an issue one day when I came back to the room with housekeeping still inside. I walked in to see how much longer they would be and found the housekeeper going through one of my bags. She of course denied it. Went to the front desk and was disappointed how it was handled. THe manager deferred me to the houskeeping manager who met me at my room and removed the housekeeper. No offers of anything to compensate me for the violation of my privacy. Had one more night left at the hotel, so we left the "Do Not Disturb" on and didn't have the room serviced.

Reviews.Title: “Why does every little thing have to cost extra?”
Reviews.Author: sgordons
Reviews.Content: Booked a V suite, but ended up on the 3rd floor looking out over a large concrete wall, what is the point? The room was extremely noisy at 4 am, when someone was filling up a bath either above us or next door. It sounded like it was right next to our bed. The towels stank of some sort of oil, diesel or gas. Yuck. Even the instant coffee in the room was charged at $ 4 a cup, which was more expensive that getting a fresh cup from the coffee shop in the reception area. The gym had to be paid for as well, though most of the time (i.e. 90% of the time) there was no one around when you wanted to sign in or ask a question. Overall feeling: "charge for everything possible but supply minimum service". I don't know if this is the prevailing strategy in Las Vegas, but I would hope not. There must be better places around.

Reviews.Title: “Large, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: dlf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in early October. Check-in was a breeze. The rooms--all suites--were large and well-appointed. Probably the nicest set-up for rooms that we have stayed in Vegas. The pools were great and not as far of a walk as I read about in the forum. We ate at the seafood restaurant in the hotel and it was excellent, but a bit expensive. The only drawback is the walk to the main strip. The monorail between Mandalay Bay and Excalibur helps. We also walked to the outdoor mall. It was about 1.5 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jokell
Reviews.Content: I had booked a family room (2 double beds) at the Mandalay Bay but when we got there they had just booked us in a double room (2 adults, 2 kids) so they upgraded us at no expense to a suite on the 33 floor of THEHotel at Mandalay Bay and it was amazing, plenty of room, excellent decoration and fittings and the most amazing view, the wave pool and lazy river were just what the kids needed to chill out for a few hrs - the resort itself offers you everything you could want from a Las Vegas hotel, huge casino, plenty of restaurants (the Buffet has wide selection of food and The House of Blues does a knockout breakfast with great service) plus you can easily walk via a walkway filled with numerous shops and eateries into The Luxor and if that's not enough you can take the monorail (free) to The Excalibur! There is a huge amount to do and see and that's without going out onto the Strip! This is an excellent all rounder hotel for single businessmen to families (our children are 8 and 12) and would recommend to anybody. Just a note: this hotel is at the southern end of the strip next to the airport but don't be put off there was limited noise from aircraft and it was an amazing sight watching all the planes and helicopters taking off and landing - also by the time you taken the monorail to The Excalibur your a good third way up the strip anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Splurge on a V Suite!”
Reviews.Author: AuburnAlum97
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I have stayed here a few times and enjoy it. On this trip we had just a regular room, and they are nice, but if we stay again we will again splurge for the V Suite. Those suites are corner rooms with windows on both corner walls so you get amazing views.
