Reviews.Title: “Massive!”
Reviews.Author: VW2803
Reviews.Content: Fabulous suite, TV in the bathroom, phone in the loo. Felt like royalty. Bath so big all 3 of us could fit inside, and lovely and deep. Don't let the location right beside McCarron international airport put you off staying here. Fab views of planes taking off, but not the merest sound! The pool area is awesome, the wave pool is great fun and the lazy river, although it gets quite busy, is so relaxing. Take a few moments to get your bearings when you arrive, so you can navigate the casino and slot machines. The signage isn't great but you'll soon get the hang of it.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel”
Reviews.Author: angel5353
Reviews.Content: nice hotel but we got charged for something in the mini bar and didnt even open it wave pool is great but it gets busy, loved the monorail to excalibur again it gets crowded

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at the bottom of the LV strip”
Reviews.Author: 12Knocksinna
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at THEhotel many times over the years and always enjoyed the style and setting of the hotel. On this occasion I was given a suite on the 62nd floor and found myself with so much space that I was rattling around like a stone in a box at times. Seriously, the suite was just excellent and I was able to use it for a number of business meetings without compromising the privacy of the bedroom. Speaking of the bedroom, the bed used by THEhotel is comfortable and I always get a good night's sleep. Service is delivered in a manner that resembles some of the better hotels in Singapore. I don't usually eat in the restaurants or use the bars, apart of course for breakfast from the grab-and-go coffee bar in the lobby. All in all, recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooftop restaurant”
Reviews.Author: tman1107
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a recent concert trip to Vegas . Love being at the end of the Strip! Must say that the reservationist was extremely helpful with lowering the rate of our suite . Love our suite . Staff was excellent . Bette was amazing! Won 2000 in the casino first 20 minutes there. Spectacular trip. We cannot wait to return next spring! Thanks The Hotel. For us You ARE THE place to stay in vegas. Rooftop restaurant AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel BUT....”
Reviews.Author: Niyah222
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a nice hotel as far as the suites! Our service was great and the rooms were clean! However, Make sure you're fully aware of the resort fees and also the 100$ a day room deposit if you are using a visa card linked to your checking account! When we checked in we had accumulated an extra 400$ over the 912 dollars for 3 nights because we used our debit card! The hotel managment stated that we will receive the 300$ 3-5 business days after we check-out! Hmmmmmmmmmmmmmm! Overall, the HOTEL was great, and if you decide to stay in this particular hotel, or any hotels on the strip make sure you ask about the hidden fees! By the way, cabs are kind of pricey of you're not renting a car... So if you're looking to do lots of touring and walking on the strip, pick the hotels towards the middle... i.e. Bellagio, Planet Hollywood, Ceasars Palace, NY NY... to name a few! BUT these hotels will save your bunyons!!! Have Fun Win Big, hope this helps!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Very Nice... Reception in suite not so much!”
Reviews.Author: Jedizave
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite months in advance for our wedding night since we were getting married on their beach. We also had an in-suite reception. Got to hotel for early check in but guests hadn't checked out of suite yet. Offered us an upgrade but the view was crappy and I specifically wanted the other suite due to its vegas strip view. Had to wait till 4pm to check in cause staff would not "kick out" other guests. Finally they did after I'm crying and causing a scene. I had 3 hours to get ready for 7pm wedding and set up for a reception afterwards. We made it work and it all worked out but so much for less stress (which is the reason we went that way in the first place.) Also, it was an entertainment suite with a huge sound system, which we were playing music on and dancing, to accommodate for 30 people. Security was called 3 times on us even though we are on the top floor and in 2,000 sq. feet of space.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, Dirty and Uninspiring”
Reviews.Author: J B
Reviews.Content: THEhotel has a reputation as a top end hotel in las Vegas, rated 4-4.5 on the travel sites. I will try my best to give an objective analysis of THEhotel: Firstly, the rooms were probably very nice when they first opened 10 years ago(?). The decor is somewhat modern but it has seen has since worn through; the carpet is stained and frayed, the mattresses wouldn't pass any Hampton Inn or Marriot level. Even pulled the sheets back and saw this cheapo, sagging, springy mattress. I was offered a 'plank' to put over the box spring which would not solve the problem and it is obvious it has been commented upon before by other guests. MGM are you listening? This is not acceptable in a hotel of this level, even several levels lower, the budget motels are stepping up their beds as that is one thing that is very important to a traveler. The overall dirtiness of the room was totally unacceptable. These rooms are cleaned poorly as there are crumbs and general filth on the desk, tables, and bathroom. The towels in the bathroom are thoroughly worn out and yellowed, and of very average quality to start with (are you serious MGM?) again, this is not acceptable. There is a tube TV in the bedroom which needs to be replaced with a flat screen. Don't get me wrong because there is nothing wrong with the TV - You just need to have a flat screen at this 'supposed' level of hotel. The entrance of THEhotel was even less impressive than I imagined from previous reviews. VERY UNIMPRESSIVE - basically just a loading zone with sliding entry doors - nothing else at all. If you were polite you might say it's discreet but this was very disappointing in my view. There are no signs for THEhotel once you get into the garage. Fine for everytime but the first trek but we walked all the way through the Mandalay Bay Casino (at least felt like it) before we found out it is 'that set of doors in the corner of the parking garage" - No signage The Lobby was very unimpressive as well, showing its age and lack of quality as the rest of the hotel - the Mandalay Bay has a nicer lobby. Cracked, dull, black granite and white marble. Poor signage. The desk clerk was efficient but had a poor attitude and vibe. At first he said ‘hold on I need to switch to another computer – this is fine but said it in a hasty, negative way while looking down. Great service indeed… Asked intrusive questions Not friendly at all - obviously an awful first experience of the hotel but I was willing to look past that as a isolated incident. Well unfortunately not, this set the tone for the whole hotel. The room itself smelled of stale smoke which we called any complained about and were given keys to see another room - same issue. Would have like at least an apology for this - somewhat rude and apathetic manager we spoke too. Outside the elevator there were dirty towels that had been laying there for about 36 hours and there were a pile of dirty towels outside of our room for a few days amongst other trash - I finally picked up the phone outside the elevator and complained to the operator. Next time I was there they were gone. Should guests have to do this MGM? The response from management confirmed our poor view of the hotel. After complaining about cigarette smoke, refuse in the hallways for days, springy and lumpy mattresses, very dirty rooms, etc. we didn't receive as much as an apology. These people don't care they just view their customers as cattle and no matter what new ones will keep coming. Well I'm helping to get the word out that people shouldn't stay here until these things are fixed. This hotels lobby, rooms, and staff all send off a negative, grungy vibe. As a friend of mine who was staying at a hotel of similar vintage but had actually been kept up said, it feels like a 'dive Hotel'. I couldn't agree more. Only one positive unfortunately, which was its proximity to the parking garage that came in handy as I do not enjoy strangers having access to my car and valuables that are kept in it. Also, all of the restaurants shut down very early and the only place open I could find was the gift shop for a $5.00 bag of Gardettos. This is a casino, people want to eat late, which you can for example on Fremont street but the only places open were bars with the typical corny, wannabe 20 something crowds – no thanks. Would not stay unless it was a very cheap rate - as they tack on a $22 resort fee which is too much. If this place had good customer service I might consider staying there again if the rate was dirt cheap but with the nasty, apathetic attitudes of the employees I see no reason ever to stay there or visit again You know where else to stay so just do it. This place needs some serious updating and emphasis on customer service to make up for it's numerous deficiencies. I know this review will probably never get read by anyone at MGM and I doubt they would even care. But I am among a large legion of travelers nowadays who are not impressed with these supersized hotels with bad attitudes, $20 drinks, and faux luxury that has been dated and worn without updating for 10-15 years. MGM feel free to contact me because you guys need help as you and all of your ‘older’ properties are becoming relics and CityCenter is on its way to becoming the same thing.

Reviews.Title: “Just as nice as the first time we stayed.”
Reviews.Author: lesfonts
Reviews.Content: The beds are very comfortable, my #1 priority. The room has two bathrooms, one full size (tub, large shower, double sinks and toilet room), and one half bath. The living room has a couch, couple of chairs, a bar, a desk and a large flat panel TV. The bedroom also has a large flat panel TV. It's very quiet and we were quite close to the elevators. We did not like gambling at Mandalay Bay, too expensive. But they have some great restaurants, expensive of course.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: flipfloptm
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days in late October and was very satisfied with the overall property and also the experience. After a not so smooth check the stay was very enjoyable. My wife and I arrived at 1:00 pm and didn't get a room till 4:30. I did ask for a strip view, so that may have added to the delay. BTW, the strip view room didn't exist until I brought out a $20 for a second look. The room was beautiful, Very nice bathrooms with a TV in every room (including the bath) Elevators are fast, secuity was good. Parking was free and super convenient.The strip view was amazing. There was a nice coffee house in the lobby. Short walk to many good dining options. Happy hours from 4-7 in most bars and restaurants. Pool was definitively a winner. Really close to airport, you never need to leave the property for any reason. Housekeeping was not friendly. When the door locked behind us with our key locked inside the room, the same maid that had busted in on us several times during the stay, suddenly didn't have a way of helping us unlock the door. That cost her a $20 tip. These minor problems would not deter me from staying again. The overall experience was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the Price of Admission”
Reviews.Author: vrlong
Reviews.Content: We booked a package of flight and Hotel through Expedia. upon arrival, everything went well. On our third day of a 5 day stay, the room never got cleaned. We were offered a $20.00 credit off our stay, but because we prepaid through Expedia, could not receive that credit according to the check out people. I left early every morning to play golf, and could not find anything open to get coffee or breakfast. Breakfast starts at 7:00 am we found out. THE Shop opens at 7:00 as well. Overall the room, which was a nice suite, just was not up to our standards. The view was of the Luxor Hotel, and the room appeared to need a good cleaning and some updating. We have stayed at many of the hotels in Las Vegas, and this would be very low on our list for a return visit for this price.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: Holly P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at THE Hotel for 5 nights. It was amazing! The bathroom and the soaking tub was great, the bed so comfortable and we have an amazing view of the strip! The staff was incredible always willing to help us and book dinners and accomodated everything we need. I wish the hotel had a better "front" as you enter the hotel through the garage. The pool was magnificent! lazt river was fun and relaxing for the most part, except they allow kids in there without tubes and it got crowded! The hotel is top notch and I would recommend this to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “dramatic boutique hotel from old Hollywood design”
Reviews.Author: garymiller
Reviews.Content: you enter THE hotel thru the garage, and come into dramatic black and white hallways with huge floral designs, all in white, lilies, orchids, all beautiful. Rooms are large, 725 sq ft, and suites, first class, view of strip is best. join their M Life casino club for preferred and lower rates, but beware of $20 resort fee to cover internet, local phone, newspapers were only available in store downstairs ,and coffee is sold in your room for $4 per cup, wow. But the Fleur restaurant there in the beautiful complex was excellent, and happy hour a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Luxury”
Reviews.Author: travelwriterwannab
Reviews.Content: We often stay at TheHotel when in Las Vegas. Its an all suite property with a separate living room and powder room/wet bar, large bedroom and luxurious bathroom with separate large 6' long tub. 3 tvs (one living, one bedroom and one bath), dvd/cd player in living area. Very nicely decorated with neutral colors -- very modern. Hotel itself is non-gaming but Mandalay Bay casino is a short walk. The entrance to the hotel is via a parking garage, so there isn't a grand porte couchere type entrance like other resort hotels in las vegas have. There is a cafe, bar and a coffee bar on site but many many dining options at Mandalay Bay resort. Use of all pools at Mandalay but be sure you take everything you need with you to the pool because its quite a long walk back to your room. TheHotel is well maintained and the staff is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Virtually closed at midnight + $22 RESORT FEE”
Reviews.Author: retiredtravelagent
Reviews.Content: Great rooms but everything in the adjacent Mandalay bay closed at midnight on Sundat night, except the raffles cafe that you were forced into using if you needed food. We waited 25 minute for entrance to a picturesque room for a light snack, followed by 10 minutes for a server at which point my wife and i at 1AM gave up. The picturesque room had about 30 people and around 4 staff, what a bad joke waiting that long. Resort fee is for internet in your room that most places give for free that i stay in these days, plus local calls , and pretty much nothing else. I felt this $22 was a big rip off. Plus in the rooms they left paper mugs and wanted $4 to use them. Looks to me as if its all about more money from less people.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, but awful service”
Reviews.Author: jlee428
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas this past weekend (10/14-10/16). We had booked a suite at THEhotel a couple months before our trip. I had gotten a email from Mandalay Bay with a great deal, so we decided to book a suite for the weekend. We paid our deposit and got a confirmation for our room. We were driving out on Friday after work, so our ETA was 11pm. I had called at 6 to let them know we'd be checking in later that night. I was told it'd be no problem. Once we arrived at around 10:30, we were told they ran out of rooms at THEhotel. They could offer us an upgrade to a penthouse suite at Mandalay Bay, and then they would move us to THEhotel the next night. Felt that was a great deal. While I was at the front desk, I could hear them offering this to other people as well. Sounds like they totally overbooked THEhotel. A few minutes later, the front desk lady comes back and tells me they are out of penthouse suites at Mandalay Bay too, so they only thing they can offer us is a regular room at Mandalay bay with 2 queen beds (we had requested King). And they can move us to THEhotel the next day. They also compensated for our inconvenience by giving us $150 credit for drinks and food at some select restaurants. It was late, and we had a long drive, so I didn't really want to fight it, so we took our room and went to bed. Wasn't our ideal room, but I didn't want to get into it at 11pm when there were a ton of people in line behind us. The next morning, I looked at the card they gave us telling us where we could spend our dining credit. I'm pregnant, so I can't drink, so I figured I can at least use it for food, but it turns out we could only use the credits at their cafes/casual dining places. I have no idea how we were going to spend $150 at these places if we weren't going to be drinking, plus we already had plans to meet up with friends at other restaurants. We went back to the front desk and tried to get our room at THEhotel. Of course they still didn't have any rooms available that early. We told them we don't want the $150 dining credit, we'd rather get a refund. The guy agreed to comp our first night, then proceeded to tell us there is no guarantee we'd be getting our suite at THEhotel for Saturday night. Irate, I told him we made reservations, and put a deposit down for a suite at THEhotel, that's where we want to stay, comping us one night and then keeping us at our regular room w/ 2 queen beds is not going to do, especially since there should be some sort of rate adjustment. The guy told us it's the best he can do, maybe he could adjust the Saturday night rate by $30, but that's it. I asked him if that's how much it'd cost to upgrade from a Mandalay bay room to a suite a THEhotel for that night, he said likely not, since it's sold out and the suites are going for $400 a night that night. So I told him $30 rate adjustment is not going to cut it. I asked to speak to his manager. The manager was nice enough to immediately guarantee us a room switch to THEhotel as long as we return to the front desk by 3, AND she will still comp us the first night, AND she will still adjust our rate for Saturday night by $30. I was satisfied with this, so we finally got the issue resolved. We returned to the front desk at 12:30 and got our suite at THEhotel. What a LOVELY room it is. Worth the hassle? Not really, Vdarra and Aria's suites are still nicer, newer and more high tech, but we were glad to be out of the old, slightly run down Mandalay Bay room we were given the first night. Being treated the way we were treated as a first time customer has turned me off to Mandalay Bay forever. Not honoring a reserved room with a DEPOSIT on it just so they can take advantage of the suckers who booked the room for double the price is just poor customer service. Don't let them take advantage of you. If they overbook and won't give you the room you RESERVED...fight for it. They are counting on people to just be ok with it.

Reviews.Title: “Great view!”
Reviews.Author: aks120LasVegas
Reviews.Content: We originally were given a room on the 4th floor with a view of a wall! A quick phone call later and we were on the 23rd floor with a strip view. The room had a bedroom and separate lounge - and the bathroom had one og the biggest tubs i have ever seen! It is quieter than the Mandalay Bay and does not have a casino downstairs but you are just a short walk away from one.

Reviews.Title: “It should just be called "Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: SUNandSANDLOVER77
Reviews.Content: The word "The" in front of Hotel is not necessary. There is nothing really special or spectacular about this hotel. I was excited b/c it got pretty good reviews and the pictures looked nice. Unfortunately while we stayed in a 700 square ft suite with 1.5 bathrooms, which sounded great, we really were not wowed. Maybe its because we had just come from the Cosmopolitan Hotel in Vegas, where the regular rooms are absolutely amazing, but this was a major let down after that. The Hotel is dated, the furniture was scuffed and it just felt like it had seen better days. It wasn't horrible by any means (I did like their amenities) but it certainly was not spectacular, and I would have rather stayed in my "Standard room" at Cosmopolitan (there was nothing standard about it compared to The Hotel) then have moved over to The Hotel at Mandalay Bay. Also, Mandalay Bay's location on the strip is not so great, and their pool for hotel guests, despite being voted among the top in Vegas, was cheesy, the chairs were horrible and it felt like an amusement park, kids running around screaming, etc (I would not say the same for the Moorea beach club pool, which was actually really relaxing and nice, we were there on a Thursday so it was not very busy, I'm not sure what a Friday, Saturday or Sunday might be like). Overall, I would not stay at Mandalay Bay again, I was completely underwhelmed by The Hotel, the Pool, and the casino/public areas. Kind of a let down...They also charged $8 for a cup of coffee (Keurig) in the room, they seemingly justified this by letting you keep the mug as a keepsake, right b/c I want more crap to take home with me in my suitcase to remember this underwhelming hotel by? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best”
Reviews.Author: jdteeth
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a lot of excellent hotels around the world, THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay might very well be one of the very best. Everything from top to bottom was first class. I cannot think of one single thing that did not exceed my expectations. You have a lot of choices in Las Vegas. I cannot think of any better place to stay than THE Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the price paid.”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl02
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed here recently on a sunday and monday night and got a very good price. Stayed in TheSuite and found it very comfortable. Enjoyed the sitting room and even having an extra half bath was nice so no waking the other if staying up later or getting up earlier. We didn't use the pool but did take a look at the beach at Mandalay Bay which we could have used and it was very nice. We did use the cardio center and it would have been nice if there were at least some free weights included. Beds were comfortable, bathroom large and nice to have a soaking tub and separate shower with two sinks. Would definitely come back here if offered the same pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Good fun adult and teens”
Reviews.Author: winterson66
Reviews.Content: Been in Vegas many times. This time with wife and four teenagers. TheHotel is classy and well run and the poolside area at Mandalay Bay is great. Other than the now destroyed Sands (yes, 1996!), this is the best Vegas Hotel I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “FuntimefromOhio”
Reviews.Author: HappytobMarrytohim
Reviews.Content: we stay at this property for my 50th birthday and was very happy our room was ready at check in 1030am, speedly check, lovely hotel room was very nice. Wish it was it was a little closer on down the strip however my husband and I made it happen and it was very relaxing would stay there again had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: valor155
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay here for pleasure for a couple of days. This is probably my favorite "high end" hotel in Vegas. Our room/suite was great, with comfy bed, great view, a couple of huge flat screen TVs, and another smaller flat screen. REALLY liked the room a lot. For the price paid, a bargain compared to lets say the Bellagio's standard rooms. I'm not a huge fan of the casino or its target audience, but there are a lot of fun things to do here, including a cabana at the pool. And the pool is of course, outstanding. Probably one of the best in Vegas. I like it better than the Mirage pool. Hard Rock pool has it beat for people-watching, though. I would definitely stay here again for pleasure (or business).

Reviews.Title: “Much better this time”
Reviews.Author: dtek
Reviews.Content: After alot of calls in Nov & Dec/10 re the missing items, I finally reached a department that cared. He said their were working on improving their staff training and offered us 2 free nights. We used them Sep 16 & 17 and had a much better experience. I can now recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Suite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyMichigander
Reviews.Content: Check in and out was very easy. No big lines like some strip hotels. For kids, it was great being connected to Mandalay Bay with its awesome wave pool and shark reef. You are at the south end of the strip, so it is a hike getting to some of the other casinos. The Hotel is nice because it is quieter and more slow paced than all the action of the casino. Rooms were well designed and comfortable with plenty of space. It is a very good hotel, but just not as spectacular as the last 2 hotels that I reviewed.

Reviews.Title: “Meh Thehotel”
Reviews.Author: rogersgrac
Reviews.Content: Over priced and more difficult to reach than mandalay bay the cheaper property. Basically impossible to walk here to other properties as mainly driveways and this forces you to walk through the casino. Nice room decent size however lacked artistic direction as a bit beige for me. Sensor fridge beware dont touch or youll pay literally. Nice pool mimics the ocean. Check in is like an airport and also confusing as everything looks the same. Also gave us bag tag as we were early and told us to use phone to ring to have our bags delivered this took about 5 mins including call waiting when other hotels just delivered the bags with no fuss. Not worth the extra money just stay at mandalay. Actually travelled april 2010

Reviews.Title: “Great suites!”
Reviews.Author: BedBuggin
Reviews.Content: If your are looking for a great place to stay in Vegas this place is a good one! Unlike other casinos, The Hotel is Mandalay Bay's all suite only hotel that offers luxurious accommodations. It is away from the casino floors which keeps it quiet unlike your typical casino lodging. Its very clean and spacious with a separate bedroom equipped with a separate television from the living room area. It has two bathrooms one walk-in and a half bath, mini bar and an executive desk. The tub is big with a separate standing shower. All in all it is a great place to stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!! An oasis on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: deanvalens
Reviews.Content: LOVED IT!!!! the room decor was simple and chic, the bathroom amenities were awesome, the room was clean and comfy (I had left a bunch of t-shirts on my unmade bed, when I came back the bed was made and my shirts were folded) and the staff was very professional. I am a huge fan of the boutique/unique hotel experience and was pleasantly surprised with my experience at THEhotel... it offered the aesthetic of a small boutique hotel with the showstopping (yet subtle) Vegas glam... As I am trying to figure out a way to describe it I am pulling a blank, the only thing I can think of is the floral arrangement at the entrance... simple, chic, architectural and stunning... and it just flowed from there. When you walk in to the lobby you automatically realize you are not at a big 'theme' casino/resort. It feels like a luxury boutique hotel... cocktails at the bar were great (multiples enjoyed in an effort to provide a fair review), I heard the restaurant was good (I was on a liquid diet so I can't offer a first hand review), the service was just spot on from the people I encountered; professional, friendly, efficient and better than I have received at other LV hotels. Fair warning, if you are looking for a hotel that is 'in the middle of the Vegas action' go somewhere else you are gonna be in the south part of the strip and a fair hike from the new casinos... if you are looking for 'a party hotel lobby', yeah... no... not the vibe here (at least it wasn't while I was there)... if you are looking for a cheap Vegas getaway... not so much... only if you luck out on an amazing deal... I would recommend the hotel to: - The business person that wants to enjoy Las Vegas but also has to work from the room, get up early for meetings, etc... - The couple looking for a romantic weekend. It would be easy to spark the romance candle here... - The group of friends that have already been to Vegas, want to have a good time but do not want to be surrounded by 21 year olds and newbies... - Anyone that appretiates good service and lush surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous suite in a really classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: CornwallS
Reviews.Content: Everything babout THEhotel was a dream. Our 2 room suite was uber-chic yet also really comfortable, and we even discovered an extra bathroom on the second day. The bath was almost as enormous as the bed!

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: MANDY082
Reviews.Content: Treated ourselves to 1 night here in The Suite and wished we could have stayed longer what a fabulous hotel - plush, trendy and totally amazing! Staff very friendly and you can use mandalay bay pool with beach! also best buffett i have tasted in vegas - its also woth buying the 1 day buffett pass as its worth it Book early and you can get good deals even on the suites

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful suite, great service, but disappointed in the pools”
Reviews.Author: tripgirlMichigan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 days in a corner suite of THEhotel at Mandalay Bay. I completely agree with a previous reviewer that the lobby and public areas of the hotel are exceptionally dark, but our room was nice and bright and open, with floor to ceiling windows on two walls in the bedroom and one wall in the living room. Likes: Overall, the room was very spacious and comfortable and they did a great job cleaning it. I did notice that some of the furniture is getting dinged up -- I would imagine suites in Vegas live a hard life! The bathroom is huge and the double sinks came in handy, as did the additional half bath off the living room. Room service had great food and was very prompt, with the exception of our second morning when breakfast was 20 minutes late. Dislikes: After touring many of the other resorts on the strip, the lobby here doesn't really stack up at all with the grand lobbies of places like Bellagio -- honestly, the lobby wasn't even as nice as your standard Renaissance. Also, we didn't like how far we were from the pool -- close to a 10 minute walk, although all inside. The pools themselves were very disappointing. What they call a "wave pool" is really just one mild wave every 5-10 minutes or so. The wave pool I grew up with had about 5 minutes of pretty intense waves every 15 minutes and that is what I was expecting here. Also, the "sand beach" is really just a relatively small plot of sand that some of the lounge chairs sit in; it doesn't go up to the water. The lazy river was much shorter than expected, though it did move faster than the typical lazy river I've seen at numerous other hotels. A final disppointment is that they say you can rent umbrellas, but there is actually a separate section with lounge chairs that have umbrellas -- if you want to stay with your family, everyone has to pay to go into that section, even if some people don't want or need an umbrella. The room was wonderful and the service was very good -- everyone we talked to had a good attitude and were very helpful. However, the rest of the amenities do not warrant the price when there are so many options in Vegas so we will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Flapjack_10
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried by the mixed reviews that I read on here after I booked THEhotel, but found there was no need to worry! We booked THEhotel because we were going to a wedding at Mandalay Bay and the bride and groom had booked in at THEhotel, so we thought it would be for the best if we booked there too. On arrival, the front desk were very pleasant and friendly. When she requested what kind of room we would like I completely forgot what I had read on here, so just said, "What ever you think is the best - you're the expert!" We were given a room on the 34th floor and the view was amazing! We could see the mountains and the Palms hotel - great view. Other guests we were staying with had views of the pool/ beach and they were pretty impressive too. The suite was spacious, clean and stylishly decorated. Loads of room for clothes and the air con was a god send (and great we could adjust it). THEhotel is part of Mandalay Bay and a very short walk to the casino, restaurants and shops. Mandalay Bay is a great place too, although different decor to THEhotel - more old fashioned. The restaurants are fab - can recommend Shanghai Lily and Lupo. The service at THEhotel was excellent. On the morning of the wedding my husband had realized his suit was creased and needed pressing. He rang down to the desk at 7.30am, put an express order on for it to be returned by 1pm. The guy was at our door in a matter of minutes and back at 11.30am - all pressed and ready! We also had room service, which was very prompt and plentiful! Can't fault our stay at THEhotel and the wedding at The Valley of the Falls in Mandalay Bay was awesome - especially because Roland August officated the ceremony, highly recommend him! Actually the only downside to THEhotel was the amount of static shocks we were getting, but I think that might be a whole Vegas thing to be honest!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: pletzkeb
Reviews.Content: My first impression of The Hotel was that it was fairly plain, although tastefully decorated, and very dark. Since there is no casino in The Hotel, it seemed like they were making the statement “we are not a casino hotel”. It is a short walk to the Mandalay Bay casino. The Hotel is all suites. The bedroom of our suite had two queen beds with a large dresser/closet combination, flat screen TV, and safe. The beds were comfortable with nice linens. The bathroom was roomy with a large bathtub, separate shower, double sinks, TV, and separate room for the toilet, all done in marble. The living room was furnished with a couch, chair, coffee and end tables, desk with chair, wet bar, floor to ceiling room length window (also in the bedroom) with a view of the mountains, and large flat screen TV. There was a powder room in the entry way. Housekeeping was efficient and hotel staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel, Mandalay Bay”
Reviews.Author: twilightnightzz
Reviews.Content: Great room. Very clean, very big. I felt it was in good l;ocation. Easy to catch city bus. It was alot quiter than main casino. Toby was great help. Would stay there again. Lion King was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Average”
Reviews.Author: Lorrie56
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights & found the rooms to be very large, very nicely decorated (I call it a "metropolitan" type decor....like you might see in an uptown apt) & very clean. I think what I liked best was that you could go from the garage to your room without having to go through the casino. There were flat screen TVs in the living room, bedroom & bathroom. The suite had a 1/2 bath off the living room & a full bath off the bedroom. The food, including the buffet at the Mandalay, was all very good & the staff were all very nice. The view from the room was nothing special & the housekeepers had an annoying habit of yelling through the halls at 9am....in Vegas, some people dont even get back to their rooms til then! Also, don't even try to call guest services as they DO NOT ANSWER the phones. I finally ended up calling from my cell to the hotels main switchboard after I got tired of waiting on a recorded "please wait" for (literally) 18 minutes one time & 22 minutes the second. The pool area (which is shared with Mandalay) was packed...I would hate to see it mid summer!! And there are no umbrellas by the pool unless (it was 102 degrees) you want to rent one (2 chairs & an umbrella was $100..we passed). The rooms tended to be too dark & while it was great that there are Keurig machines in the room, there is a $4.00 charge per cup of coffee. The location is at the very beginning of the strip which is a plus for some (less traffic & congestion) & a minus for others (you have to take a cab or tram to get to the main part of the strip if you dont have a car). I would probably stay there again because I really liked the room, especially for the price (midweek) but you have to take the good with the bad.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Las Vegas stay”
Reviews.Author: LauraTexa
Reviews.Content: Found staff rude and generally unhelpful; here with group meeting bad food; dirty rooms; minibars unstudied; checkin and out nightmarish; hallway carpets filthy; several members reported stray dark hairs on bedding; worst business center; only positive contact was young woman at concierge that assisted with show tickets!!! Overpriced bad service

Reviews.Title: “Check it out First”
Reviews.Author: DAH51
Reviews.Content: Our experience at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay was quite frustrating, when we arrived at the hotel the parking lot was taped off for the removing of a roof top air conditioning unit. There was no signage idicating where to go, so we drove to the valet parking at the front of Mandalay Bay where we were told that there was no room for anyone that was headed to The Hotel, only Mandalay Bay. We finally got to the parking lot after being directed by a security officer that was working fot the Barret/Jackson auction group. When we checked in at the desk (the staff were unaware of the parking situation, and did not really seem to care) we were assigned a room on the fourteenth floor and when we got to the room there was luggage and other personal items in the room already. We noticed that the hallways were filthy and mentioned it when we went back to the desk to get another room, we were apparently "upgraded" to a nicer room on the tenth floor, the room was okay, but that floor also had filthy hallways. We told staff as we saw them, but during our five day stay the halls were never vaccuumed (we watched many pieces of paper and dirt day after day hoping that we would see them disappear, they were still there when we checked out). The lobby and the casino areas , as well as the convention area were very clean, we wonder if that is where the money is being spent. Overall, our stay was just okay, not what we expected. We have stayed at the Aria and it was much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Very good - huge rooms, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: JonOfEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at THEHotel in mid September during a two night stay in Vegas, whilst driving around the Western US. We were impressed with our suite, which was well furnished and with an extremely comfortable bed. The bathroom was large with a rather luxurious tub. We were on floor 38 with an impressive view out on to the city. There were a few negatives; the pool is nowhere near as luxurious as it looks on the website; the rooms are quite dark; and the hotel is connected to the smoke-filled casino and the shopping mall (which is also a positive - but it does mean that it doesn't get the 5 out of 5 luxury score from us). The price seemed fair, although slightly annoying to get a $20+ resort fee each night - and the coffee in the room was stupidly expensive ($8 because you have to buy their souvenir mug to use the coffee machine). But compared to the other hotel/resorts we passed through whilst there, we were certainly glad we were staying at THEHotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room was broken into, DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: legaljacket
Reviews.Content: This hotel used to be my favorite hotel. I've stayed here many times and it used to be tops. Went for Labor Day weekend and took my entire staff, 8 rooms between Hotel & Mandalay Bay. I stayed in The Hotel. We arrived on 8/27. It took over an hour to check in. They had my reservation wrong even though it was handled by a Hotel employee at my last visit on Memorial Day (yes I stayed at this hotel a lot!). While my wife went to the check in line, I waited with the car for a bellman to get my bags. Because of my experience with this hotel, I knew there were problems in the garage area so I pulled my phone out and set up a stop watch. It took an attendant only about 30 seconds to come to me and give me a valet ticket. He then called for a bellman. 5 minutes later, another valet came over and asked me what I was waiting for. Told them a bellman. That valet walked over to the bell desk and went into the room and pulled someone out. At this point, I should have taken the hints and stayed elsewhere. Since this was both a business trip and pleasure, I asked to have flowers in the room and a cupcake. Getting that set up with concierge in and of itself was a hassle but I thought I had. I had a confirming email from concierge that it would be set up and waiting. It wasn't. To make matters worse, they charged me for it. I am disputing that charge. The rest of my 10 day stay was mixed with good and bad. The towels given by the maid serve had HOLES in them. I sent pictures to a manager but he didn't seem to care. Even with all that, the stay would have been okay had it not been for a break in that occurred Tuesday night, 8/31. While we were sleeping, someone broke into our room and stole my computer, my wife's phone and cash. When we woke up the following morning, we realized there had been a break in. Called down to security. Told someone would be up soon. After 10 minutes, called back. Told same thing. After another 10 minutes, my wife went downstairs to get someone from security. I called the Las Vegas police. Even though the officer went to the wrong hotel first, he arrived less than 5 minutes after hotel security. Making matters worse, hotel security sat at the desk where my computer was and contaminated the crime scene. It turns out our door was defective. The door did not latch when it closed. Of course, this was shown to hotel security. Did they get it fixed, of course not. When we returned that afternoon, it was still broken. Called down and finally got a repairman up there. Took all of 3 minutes to fix. Now, you would think a hotel of this level would have made arrangements for us and tried to do something for us. Instead, we were told that there was nothing they could do. It wasn't their fault. We received cold shoulders from all other desk staff and told they were not allowed to talk to us because Risk Management was investigating. The next night, I heard a noise outside our door. I go outside and a hotel employee is trying to get into my mother in law's room (we had connecting rooms). Luckily she had on the security latch that deactivated the cards so he could not get in. When I questioned him, he played dumb and said he was told to come to this room for a room check. He even showed me the text telling him this. After questioning him, he called back down to someone and they said he was at the wrong room. Was this another break in or an innocent mistake, I do not know but it certainly did not make us feel comfortable. Add to this mess ups at concierge. My wife got 4 tickets for a musical at Luxor. Luxor is another MGM/Mirage facility. We were told she could pick up the tickets at The Hotel concierge. When she went to pick them up, she was told by concierge that they could not get the tickets there, they had to get them at Luxor will call. I was later told by another concierge someone made a mistake and we should have been able to get the tickets at concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Business for hubby..pleasure for me..shop til ya drop!”
Reviews.Author: April D
Reviews.Content: LOVED my time in Vegas! Our suite at The Hotel was amazing..two bathrooms..three tv's..AWESOME. Nice quiet lobby and contemporary decor. Dined at both Aureole and Mix..wonderful restaurants with great atmospheres.

Reviews.Title: “V.Good”
Reviews.Author: Stevie0121
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a suite for 5 nights during September 2011. Very comfortable, spotlessly clean and well equipped. The hotel itself had a good choice of restaurants and a range of available facilities. The beach area was nothing short of fabulous (except opening hours - see below). Only issues (although relatively minor) were - Wireless internet connection was a little slow - $65 for a three day pass to the SPA was excessive and when paying almost $300 for the suite per night...surely should be included - No access to any pool facilities beyond 5pm (Four seasons hotel has a pool accessible 24 hours a day) All in all however, had a lovely stay and would return

Reviews.Title: “Our New Favorite HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: GOmaha
Reviews.Content: We enjoy staying at the Mandalay when we visit Las Vegas but we decided to avoid some of the crowds and move over to THE Hotel this time. We stayed 4 nights for a business meeting in the quietest hotel room I have ever been in. Check-in took only a few minutes on a Sunday afternoon. It took only a few minutes to notice that there was no hallway noise, no doors slamming, no kids running, just sublime silence. The suites are spacious and having 2 bathrooms was an unexpected plus! It takes a few extra steps to get to the Mandalay Pool and the casino floor but the room more than compensates for the added distance. THE Hotel will be at the top of our list from now on!

Reviews.Title: “HUGE complex - NOISY room”
Reviews.Author: Bruce_411
Reviews.Content: Like all Las Vegas resorts, THEhotel is HUGE. You walk forever between the actual room and whatever destination you might want to reach. We drove there from the airport (we actually DID need a rental car to visit nearby family . . . ), and there are NO SIGNS ANYWHERE suggesting which way to go for THEhotel vs. the "regular" Mandalay Bay hotel. So, we walked a LONG WAY the WRONG WAY to check in. At night, in the summer anyway, Mandalay Bay hosts huge name acts in their pool stage, so you hear VERY LOUD concerts all night, well past midnight. So, if you have any reason to want to sleep before, say 1:00AM, do NOT stay here. We traveled there for a wedding with our 7 year old twins. While it was a great place for the wedding, NOT SO MUCH for a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Try somewhere else instead!”
Reviews.Author: phil5466
Reviews.Content: Reached THE Hotel after a 31 hour transit from China, looking forward to a wonderful stay at a luxury hotel charging $340/night. Upon entering, it took 23 minutes on line waiting to check in. Reached our room 7815 which smelled of smoke and reaked of sanitizer. Called front desk and was told we would be moved to room 8916 and a bellman would bring up the keys. Waited in the hallway for 14 minutes for bellman who did not show up, and then returned to the hotel front desk area. After speaking with a disconcerned concierge who suggested we wait on line again for room keys, I finally obtained them for room 8916. Upon entering the room, my wife noted the stains and creases on the bedspread and used towel in the bath which led to finally obtaining room 8917 across the hall - some 2 hours AFTER we had arrived at the hotel. Room 8917 was dusty, with carpet stains, worn furniture and a shower and shower head that needed descaling desparately. Just disgusting. Between the indifference of the hotel staff (attributing the room conditions and attitudes to being completely sold out that week-end) and the hallway noise, outside window noise from the highway and slamming doors which continued throughout the night, there are MUCH BETTER PLACES TO STAY than this overpriced $340 night suite hotel. While this hotel must have been lovely when it originally opened, it has not aged well, nor been maintained any better than a one star property off the strip. Allowing a nine minute time slot for a room to be fully serviced, and spraying lots of sanitizer - does not create a luxury room. Please be forewarned and consdier alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “My All Time Favorite Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Newssss
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a V Suite when we got married at the Mandalay Bay a couple of years ago. We returned recently to celebrate our anniversary and my birthday. It was fantastic as usual. Although our view wasn't as great as last time, the suite itself is great. The pool at Mandalay Bay is the best on the strip. We've tried some of the newer Vegas hotels, but nothing really lives up to THE Hotel. The flat screen tv's in the bedroom, bathroom, and sitting room are great. The large bathroom with stand up shower is excellent. The rooms are very quiet. My only complaint would be that the housekeeper kept knocking on our door early each morning even though we lit the Do Not Disturb sign at our door.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: malvlover
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Mandalay Bay several times but never Thehotel before. I was very pleased. The walk back to THEhotel was a little bit of a hike when coming from the casino, but the separate valet and the entry when coming from outside was convenient. The room itself was nice, some of the furniture had seen a bit of wear but was comfortable. Having the bedroom separate and away from the hallway door was nice, no hallway noise! Bed was so comfortable I almost overslept my check out day! Curtains overlap and fit the windows well so there was no outside light to bother me. Bathtub was very deep (and clean), water nice and hot. Separate shower but the water pressure was a little low. Another reviewer mentioned a shower curtain liner being grimy...there are no shower curtains in these rooms! Glassed in showers....not sure where dalcy3 was as I am sure none of the rooms @ THEhotel have shower curtains. Half bath in the entry (never used!) and full bath with double vanity and plenty of light. Very nice decor, dark woods and black marble tile on the walls. My only "complaint" is that the water closet door opened inward...just a tad inconvenient. Planning to stay again on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: gp171080
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at THEhotel, although we struggled to find the checking in desk but I guess that is due to the size of the hotel! The room was very clean and VERY spacious, with a separate living room, and 2 toilets! This appeared to be the standard room at THEhotel. One of the reasons we picked THEhotel was due to the swimming facilities and these met expectations. The beach area was great along with the lazy river. Although it was difficult to get a sunbed if you went to the pool area after 1pm. The only downside to this hotel is that it is at the very beginning of the strip, so you have a long walk to say get to the Bellagio. We found ourselves taking a cab when we went out in the evenings. Overall a really nice hotel and really good value when compared to the Bellagio, Venetian or Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Very much enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: sbenus
Reviews.Content: Though the trip was mainly for a two-day conference, I flew out a few days before to make the most of the trip to Las Vegas. They gave me the good group rate even for the days before the conference so I think I got a good value. Service at the hotel was excellent especially the bell desk. They were extremely friendly and always helpful. My only 2 interactions with front desk were check-in and checkout but they both went smoothly and I never had to wait. Housekeeping was always good as well. The suites were very nice and had everything you could need. I especially liked having a doorbell so people don't have to knock and also having a button inside the room to activate a do not disturb/housekeeping light outside the door, instead of the traditional doorknob hanger. The room decor is mostly dark browns and earth tones which isn't exactly my cup of tea but this is a matter of taste and I can't fault the hotel for that, especially a higher-end product such as this. It was very elegant, nonetheless. Room service took between 45 min. and an hour each time though they did warn me it would be that long and they were right. The food was good and priced at about the same as most hotels though they did have some less expensive items on the menu which was good. Some people fault them for their location at the south end of the strip but aren't you aware of this before you book? I marked it 3/5 on my location rating but I cannot unfairly criticize them in my review since I knew beforehand. Also, I chose to stay here because my conference was at the Mandalay Bay convention center so it was convenient. It was a little bit of a walk to get from our tower to other areas of the Mandalay but with Las Vegas properties that is kind of to be expected. We went to Mix lounge at the top of the tower and it was great. Because the hotel is at the end of the strip, the view is simply spectacular. On my next trip to Vegas, I will probably stay at a different property just to try a different flavor. So far I haven't repeated anywhere. Don't get me wrong, I would have no problems staying here again and would definitely recommend this hotel to others, I just want to see what else is good on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Sparky2511
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights here on recent business trip to Vegas, have to say the only reason stayed was we got great rate as part of conference deal. Standard room, which is suite, is huge and well furnished, spotlessly clean and staff are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fun but pricey!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly S
Reviews.Content: Overall, the room was great with modern decor and a comfortable bed and couch. Great features include 2 bathrooms and a separate bedroom from the living room. However, if you decide to stay here, ask to stay on one of the top floors; we were on the 3rd floor next to a conference room and it was very loud in the morning while they were setting up for a conference. Also, be prepared to spend a lot of money on food and beverage. For example, if you drink the cup of coffee provided in the room, it will cost you $7; the bottled water was $8. They should consider at least providing each guest with a cup of coffee and bottle of water per day, on the house, considering the cost of the room and food. Next time go, we plan to stop at the liquor store before we check in to buy beer and water and stock the fridge. The best restaurant we ate at was Red Square, it was AWESOME! The service was great and the food was the best we've ever eaten! Food was good at Border Grill but the service was terrible. Food and service was great at Lupo. Overall, great place to stay, we were just a little sticker shocked.

Reviews.Title: “No smoke”
Reviews.Author: carolineSeattle
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Thehotel every year for 10 years now. The staff is always courteous and the hotel is a nice refuge from the madness of Vegas. The fact that there is no smoky casino downstairs to hit your senses early in the morning is a plus. The one issue we have had with them is housekeeping. As a whole i would give it a C. For a hotel of that standard you would expect more

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: adisneyrental
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Vegas every year for the past 10 years and THEhotel is our favourite, by a landslide! The rooms are amazingly huge!! Each room has a separate sitting/living area with a wet bar, a desk area and a powder room. The bedroom is a separate room off this main living space which is really nice since you can entertain people in your room keeping the bedroom area private. The beds are very comfy and large. They provide robes which are delightful. The main bathroom area is huge. There is a separate shower area and soaking tub and two large his and her sinks. It is amazing. The whole area is very tastefully decorated and the service was wonderful. THEhotel is a little far down the strip, but we were OK since we always rent a car. We will definitely stay here again. The best rooms we've stayed in by far...And thebathhouse spa was amazing. It was so relaxing and the special they offered was a no brainer! My friend and I spent the afternoon at the spa while the guys played poker! we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great classy suites hotel without a casino feel.”
Reviews.Author: KTinPDX
Reviews.Content: THEHotel is a great place to stay if you're trying to avoid the "casino hotel" feel. It is classy, quiet, and elegant and offers large, two-room suites for about the same price as a standard room in most hotels. The standard suites have large marble bathrooms off the bedroom with oversized tubs and separate glass showers. Plus, there is a separate half bath near the front door in the main living room. The check-in line was very short for us at 8PM on a weekday, but we saw long mid-day lines on the weekend. We asked for and received a room with a strip view for no additional charge. Pool was extremely crowded, as expected. For us and another couple to get 4 seats together we paid $25/ea for padded reserved lounge chairs, which the attendant sets up with towels for you. They also provide a bucket of ice and bottled water. Very worth it. (An umbrella is $50). The next day we paid $425 for a cabana. The shade was nice, as were the table & chairs at lunch time, but otherwise, I'd save the money and stick with the $25 padded chairs and spring for an umbrella.

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced for the service.”
Reviews.Author: CalleyBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We generally receive excellent service travelling through the USA but not here. We arrived for our check in 30 mins early and our room wasn't ready - no big deal as the front desk would could us when it was. 2.5 hrs later - no call and no room charging whilst we waited, despite being given a card with approval for this. When we got to our room we found that coffee in the room would cost us $4 each cup (despite the fact that we paid a resort fee for services we wouldn't use). Our disappointment was echoed by other guests at check in - 2 different parties both requesting some type of compensation for their poor experience. We won't stay here again. Terrible service and over-priced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, awesome pool, but a hike from the rest of the strip”
Reviews.Author: mrssmall23
Reviews.Content: We just got back from THE hotel and had a great time. Our friends were staying in Mandalay, so it was nice to compare the two rooms :) I actually liked the design of the Mandalay rooms better (brighter, funkier) and the standard rooms there are huge. It was nice for us to have the two-room suite, since there were three of us, but it was kinda cramped. We had a room right near the elevator, and the only noise we ever heard was the in-room air conditioning, which thumps on really loudly. Never heard another person on the floor though! I was expecting a long line to check-in when we arrived (as we've seen at other Vegas hotels) but when we got there, there was no line at all and we were checked in in minutes. Super fast elevators and never any lines (yes, there were lines to get onto the elevators at Mandalay!). The bathroom was HUGE and just SPECTACULAR. Loved the big huge bathtub!! Apparently early Sept is the perfect time to go to the Mandalay Pool, because we didn't have any trouble finding seats and there seemed to be plenty of empty chairs. Not a lot of kids or college kids. We tried to get a cabana on Sat and were told they were sold out, which is pretty impressive if compared to the lack of crowds every other day. Turns out the weather was crappy that day anyway, and they were going to charge us twice what we paid earlier in the week! We got cabanas on Thursday and Sunday - ours was in the West Lagoon pool - plenty of room for the 6-8 of us to relax, and cabana service was great. They could use some padded chairs with their cabanas - we went to the Mirage at the end of the week and their cabanas were SOOOO much nicer! But it was great to have a place to lock up our stuff, eat, and chill out in between pool runs. We brought our own tubes, which they blew up for us, but the cabana also came with tubes. Definitely worth the $300-400 that the six of us paid. My husband ate at the cafe downstairs and said it was really good - way better than the red white and blue restaurant in Mandalay that we went to earlier (just average and overpriced). Room service food was average - nothing to write home about. I usually stay more center strip, so the biggest difference with THEhotel is that you wind up taking cabs everywhere. We did take the tram to Excalibur a few times, but that only gets you so far. Not sure if I'd stay here again, just based on the location. But if you're cool with spending your money on cabs, the pool is definitely worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Good property, super crowded pool and bad restuarant service”
Reviews.Author: VitaminM
Reviews.Content: Vegas baby, Vegas. I'm going to shoot from the hip and be honest, Vegas has lost its magic. The straight up reason is while other places have improved, Vegas remains the same. It's kind of like the vivacious Venezualan bombshell that you oogled at in Statistics101 in colleage was simply magical ten years ago, but now with age and overweighted reliance on genetics, she's just kind of good to look at. While time took its toll, some forward thinking, yoga/pilates practicing, second tier lookers have now taken over as they had the vision to peak later in life. Anyhow, an aspect I can share is that I just feel that for the US to have practically invented 'customer service", the dearth and death of customer service in Vegas anchors itself in irony. So, stayed in TheHotel for four nights. Great value on the suites and great view of the pool. Comfy bed with good sizeable bathrooms. The place is relatively new, so that's always a positive. Things to work on: CUSTOMER SERVICE ! - Check in was slow, not snail paced, but slow enough for you to finish a few rounds of angry birds. The front desk never really once smiled, in fact, they looked like they had some sort of perpetual " I'm too cool for school" face. Maybe its their game face? Room hygiene - The sheets had some stains holes in it, so they volunteered to change the sheets and have housekeeping double check everything. It's kind of like they expect this, so their somewhat robotic answer will be, "oh, we're sorry, we can have housekeeping replace the (fill in your room hygiene or missing amneties issue) and for this, we will offer you $25 dollars of food & beverage credit to your final bill". So whatever, let them be robots and take the 25 bucks. The pool - Man, it's a huge pool. Not the best in Vegas though. You'll feel like a sardine amidst the sea of sweating human beings trying to find an emtpy poolside / beachside chair. If you want quality adult pools with a party atmosphere, you will have the Encore, the Palms, and other notable hotels to choose from. Housekeeping - This is no 4/5 star Asian hotel group, so if you need slippers, toothbrush, extra towels, you will have to explicitly as ask and wait for 20 minutes+ so it's delivered to your room. The restuarants - you will likely venture over to the Mandalay Bay Property and you be lining up to get in. Almost feels like getting into the restuarant is akin to being part of a line for the Apple iPad2 launch. The thing is, there will undoubtedly be empty tables and seats. It's either that the Maitre D is chatting with his/her fellow colleauges on their nails/car payments/facebook updates and they can't cater to you OR guess what, "they aren't enough servers in the restuarant to serve the tables, so please be patient" . And this is at 1PM. To be fair, the hardware of the property works. The software / the people? Not really.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Handman
Reviews.Content: All suites hotel which is first class. We had a room with great views of the strip and surrounding mountains. Large suite with huge sitting area and 3 TV's! At end of strip, but there is a free train to Luxor and MGM. Beware of bar items - coffee $4 a cup, game boxes for $30. Leave them on the bar area or you'll get charged!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel at Mandalay Bay - Perfect spot for a wedding”
Reviews.Author: 2at50plus
Reviews.Content: Our son and his wife were married on the May long weekend this year in the Shark tank in the aquarium at Mandalay Bay. The service, minister and general organization of the event went off without a "hitch" and the staff was not only polite, but extremely attentive to all of our needs. We also stayed at The Hotel and spent several memorable days at the "beach" including one day renting a family sized cabana - great way for both of our families to come together. We can't say enough about the service and quality of the rooms. We will be back to the Mandalay Bay property soon for another (our third) visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!!”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrskb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at THEhote from September 5-11. My wife did the check in process and ended up getting an upgrade to a V-Suite which I believe is on the end of every floor. She did tip $20. We went up to the room and it smelled badly of smoke. My wife called down and had another room arranged. A hotel employee brought up the new keys and we had another room one floor up. The room was located on the 25th floor and overlooked the Luxor hotel. The room was very nice. It is showing some wear but that is to be expected. We had a couple of issues but they were minor. We ended up getting locked out of our room when our keys were turned off. It took about 30 minutes to get our room unlocked. The maid came in with the Do Not Disturb light on. I really do like the light for the Do Not Disturb instead of the flimsy Do Not Disturb sign. This way no one can say it wasn't on the door. This is the first hotel that I've seen that had this feature. We will definately be back especially since it is a pet friendly hotel now. We have stayed at the Four Seasons, Bellagio, and Ventian before and put this hotel in the same class.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel - modern rooms and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: MelissaMC22
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel b/c the rooms are of modern decor and I keep coming back. The bathrooms are terrific in both the larger and smaller rooms. The desk service is great. I like how it is connected to Mandalay so you get all the benefits of a large pool and casino but you can enter and exit without having to go through the casino. Its nice to eat at their restaurant which is quiet and away from the casino. The gyms and spas great at this hotel. My only complaints are that room service is extremely slow and the conceirage was more interested in recommending other Mandalay properties rather than spots that fit what we were looking for and were appropriate for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with kids”
Reviews.Author: NLPColorado
Reviews.Content: Stayed at THE hotel for 3 nights (Thurs-Sun) and loved it! We were with our two kids ages 10 and 7 and it was perfect. The standard suite was plenty big and having 2 rooms with a door in between was so nice. Amazingly quiet at night. The pool area was plently big and not overly crowded. Chairs were available throughout the day, but more so in the morning. Spent 2 whole days at the pool and my kids were never bored. Did break down and have a gazebo one day which was quite nice. Ate breakfast every morning at the Red, White and Blue restaurant which was fine. Would definitely stay here again with or without kids.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant & Quiet & Smells Really Good!”
Reviews.Author: SunMonkey61
Reviews.Content: I thought that staying in Mandalay Bay's The Hotel facility would bee too far off the beaten path, and a long trek to the casino and amenities. Not at all! Pkus it has the feel of a small elegant boutique hotel. And the lobby, etc. smells really good. Hahaha! I'm serious. Aria pumps in scent too, but theirs is a little cloying and overwhelming. And that is a hotel you need hiking boots for. Too sprawling for my taste. Anyway, The Hotel is gorgeous, convenient, luxurious and is a calm oasis in the midst of, well, you know how chaotic Vegas can be. Good food, very nice people, check in is very close to the entrance, as are the elevators. Our room was lovely too. Mandalay Bay has a great pool, btw. It has a wave-maker, and a lazy river too. Spent a lot of time there. But if it's hot out, get up early because chairs are hard to come by after 9am.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent on most accounts”
Reviews.Author: newyorker7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early Sept 2011. Very good housekeeping, everything very spic and span. Suites are a good idea as you have room to spread out. Ask for a high floor facing away from Mandalay Bay. The east side facing Mandalay bay on a low floor gets noise of casino vents and view of parking lot. No turndown service but prompt response for more towels.Hotel coffee bar and breakfast/lunch restaurant a tad above Mandalay's (and no lines). Pools shared with Mandalay. Have to pay for shade unless you can keep moving with the palm tree shade. Too hot to stay past 11 AM anyway.Bring your own tubes as they no longer rent and you have to buy the tube for river pool. And I still don't know what the resort fee covers.... just an add on charge. The beds are very hot, as in the pillow top really heats you up, which made sleep uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Thehotel is a great hotel, added bonus being attached to Mandalay pool”
Reviews.Author: dbrianf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Thehotel over the July 4th weekend. The rooms and amenities are impressive. We've stayed in a half-dozen Vegas hotels over the last few years and this one is up there with the Wynn/Encore and a tier above Bellagio or Palms. Rooms are well laid out and inspire rest, a good thing in Vegas. Being attached to the Mandalay pool is great as well. We visited both the standard pool and the European pool. Standard pool cabana is generally worth it since every seat seemed to be taken. European pool was couple's friendly and generally relaxed. The only real downside to Thehotel is that the Mandalay gaming section leaves something to be desired. If you're going to plan on gambling, expect to take a taxi to get to the best action. The restaurant at the top of the hotel (Mix) is great as well, tremendous service from our server (though the French maitre'd was a bit snotty).

Reviews.Title: “If you want something Grand, then Mandalay is the place to be in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Mannie G
Reviews.Content: Me & my friends stayed here during the Miss Universe Pageant of 2010... sorry, I forgot to review this last year - Aug 2010. It was good thing we did because we got 50% off the price for the pageant itself. It was a reunion for me & my college friends & made new friends as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: travellingmommy99
Reviews.Content: THEhotel at Mandalay Bay was great. It was really nice because although the complex is on the strip, THEhotel is on the back of it so it was really quiet. The pool was spectacular! Staff was super friendly and we were randomly upgraded to a massive penthouse suite. I would recommend this for someone who wants a very clean, comfortable and quiet retreat from a long day (and night) in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business trip”
Reviews.Author: Cravini
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights, third year in row. Love staying at Mandalay Bay. Has everything you want and need. Only bummer is at far end of strip so it's an expensive taxi ride evertime you go out. Rooms are great. Big with cool mod finish. All suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Check-in/Check-out was the WORST!”
Reviews.Author: buffaloMT
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at this hotel, we again enjoyed it. The only problem which we experienced both times is the check-in/ check-out. Seriously even with out a line this takes FOREVER! I was unable to check-out through our TV so I went downstairs to check out. One person in font of me and about four guests being helped. I stood there for 25 minutes and neither the guest in front of me or the ones being helped moved! I was then forced to leave w/o checking out because I had to get to the airport. They need to do something about this because it is beyond ridiculous!

Reviews.Title: “Oh wow!”
Reviews.Author: JamieMK
Reviews.Content: After having a horrible experience at Ravella at Lake Las Vegas I brought my out of town guests here. OMG, seriously the experience we had was over the top good! The front desk staff was able to help us get last minute tickets to Ka! without fuss! And the view we had was stunningly good. The rooms were clean, properly stocked, and we had no trouble with the cooling. The rooms were clean enough that nobody had their allergies triggered. But back to the staff....ask and they respond. It's called service with a smile....you will find it here. When we needed transportation to go check out the strip they arranged it promptly. In short...it was an awesome experience for the seven of us! We upgraded from Mandalay Bay to The Hotel....it was a good decision!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: JB1962
Reviews.Content: Stayed - August 28th to September 2nd Check-in was a breeze and we were allocated a suite on the 31st floor with a strip view. Room was stylish and very comfortable and exceeded our expectations in every department. THEhotel was a very welcome oasis of calm amongst the bustle of Las Vegas. Can honestly say when we go back to Vegas this will be where we choose to stay once again.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: moweryteach
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful place to stay. Since it is behind the casino in a seperate building, it is far more quiet than the regular hotel/casino and less busy. There was easy access to the pools and restaurants, since those were in the back of the main building and this connects through a walkway. It was also a quick connect to the walkway/mall that goes to Luxor and onto Excalibur and New York, New York. These 4 hotels/casinos pretty much have everything you could need from shopping, to spas, to casino, to restaurants, to night clubs. The spa was fantastic and very relaxing, but we didn't know that you could spend time there using the facilities once you're treatment was over. That looked relaxing, they had a pool, jacuzzi, sauna, etc. We ate at the Aureola Wine Bar, Wolfgang Puck's Lupo, and the Border Grill and enjoyed them all. The Wine Bar was expensive, but cool to watch the flying angels get your wine. Lupo (italian) was more reasonable and the food was fantastic! The Border Grill had a tapas type breakfast, very neat, and reasonable. The beach pool was very busy, but they had an upstairs one called the lagoon that was much more private, peaceful, relaxing, and less crowded. Even though it is down at the end of the strip, it was a beautiful place! I highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Hell was all booked up, so.....Vegas in August”
Reviews.Author: HogFan1
Reviews.Content: THEhotel at Mandalay Bay all suite hotel was everything that I was told it would be. Room w/ strip view on the 35th floor was great. The Luxor lit up at night is a pretty darn cool sight. Service was fast and friendly whenever we called. Check-in was quick and accomodating. Valet parking was no problem and getting a limo when we wanted it for the 6 of us was pretty much immediate..."thanks Chris and your pumped up Escalade!" Coffee shop downstairs had intermittent trouble w/ their espresso machine. But the coffee was fine. The breakfast downstairs was delicious and we even saw Pete Rose eating there also! We had friends staying at the Four Seasons at the same time so the 6 of us used all the pools and found the Four Seasons pool to be the most relaxing w/ the best service. Mandalay Bay Pool was crowded loud and not much of a pool really...more like a wading pool w/ a wave. The lazy river was so crowded there wasn't much laziness to be found. The Beachside Cabana we rented was def. not worth the 600$ for the day and probably won't do that again. I have had better cabanas and cabana service at every other hotel I've been to in Vegas. You CANNOT put any of that off on THEhotel though...whole other animal. If pressed to find something to whine about...I guess I would say the beds are a little too hard...kinda like a trampoline....but if you're into that kinda thing! :)

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the desert”
Reviews.Author: TravelEatPrayLove
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas multiple times, each time staying in a different hotel. This was BY FAR my favourite, as it doesn't have a smoky casino attached to the lobby and it's very quiet, yet still in the heart of the party chaos. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a "honeymoon suite" (and we weren't getting married) which was nice because of the separate living room and extra bathroom. Very clean, modern and comfortable. Ask for a late check out if too many cocktails keeps your from typical check out time - we didn't have to leave until 6 pm, which was perfect, as our flight out wasn't until the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine why you would not stay here rather than Mandalay Bay”
Reviews.Author: MerrimackMrs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Mandalay Bay earlier this year and I can't imagine why, for a few dollars more per night, anyone would not stay at THEhotel instead. The absolute best part of this room is the room configuration. It is difficult to get a hotel room in Las Vegas where you are not constantly being woken up by noise in the hall at all hours of the night. Because of the suite configuration at THEhotel you are able to have a quiet, comfortable night's sleep. The door to the room opens into the living room area rather than the bedroom. At night you can just close your bedroom door and have a peaceful sanctuary in which to sleep. My DH thought that the mattress was too soft, but I swear he likes to sleep on a cement slab! The bed does jiggle quite a bit whenever there is any movement. LOVED the fact that the suites have 1 1/2 bathrooms. Also appreciated that they provide slippers. Seems that most high end hotels no longer provide slippers. The room seemed very clean. No complaints in that department. The only minor complaint I have is that the first night we asked for additional pillows and it took almost 1 hr. for them to deliver to the room. Also, for some strange reason the decor just wasn't appealing to me. I can't put my finger on it but there was something about the colors that just didn't do it for me. We stayed at THEhotel because my DH was attending a conference and I did not want to stay at Mandalay Bay again so THEhotel was a wonderful alternative. My favorite hotel in Las Vegas is the Palazzo, but I wouldn't hesitate to stay at THEhotel again if I needed to attend a conference at Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice nice”
Reviews.Author: Griffhead
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay. Both stays were very enjoyable.
