The rooms are very nice, the staff was great when we needed something and I enjoyed the Mandalay Bay properties. What I didn't like was the hidden "resort" fee. We ate at several restaurants and they were very good though a bit on the pricey side, but it seems like all of Vegas is becoming that way. The pools are great with several options including a wave pool, lazy pool and several standard ones. Get there early on hot days though! It's a nice a property on the south end of the strip and I would certainly stay here again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms but need updating”
Reviews.Author: elynchking
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at THEhotel a few times several years ago when it first opened. I'm in Vegas once or twice a year on business and have stayed in most of the nicer hotels. This still has one of the best room setups as it's a true suite without sacrificing the bedroom size. What I liked: Room setup Easy in and out through THEhotel (as opposed to Mandalay Bay with its huge taxi lines) Comfy beds What I don't like: Needs its own pool. The Mandalay Bay pool complex is fun but it's pretty downmarket. THEhotel should have its own pool like the Four Seasons Room carpet and soft furnishings have seen better days. The chair in our living room had a big hole in it and the carpet is just nasty.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay-wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thinair303
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here Aug 26-29 for sister in-law's wedding. We had reservations at the Mandaly Bay but just happened to walk over to THEHotel to check it out. #1, much newer and nicer than the Mandalay Bay. Much quieter as well. You don't have to walk a mile to get to your room. Front desk was less crowded and they were much more accomodating. We were able to transfer the reservation from the Mandalay to THEhotel without any issues. Food at the downstairs cafe was excellent for breakfast and lunch. The Mandalay Casino was great and the restaurants were excellent. we had meals at Aureole and Le Fluer. My kids loved the pool Again, THEHotel had the excitement of the Mandalay Bay without the congestion and craziness.

Reviews.Title: “Pristine !!!”
Reviews.Author: david-gee66
Reviews.Content: The Hotel at Mandalay Bay is one of only two 5 star Hotels in Vegas , coffee and cream colored modern decor is very appealing . Flat screen tv's in livingroom,bedroom and yes , the bathroom... right in front of a luxurious and spacious tub.The entire Mandalay Bay experience is awesome from the beachlike pool to the shark reef , dining , casino, world class spa , oh and did I mention The Hotel at Mandalay ? We loved this place so much , we're returning at the end of September 2011... Worth every penney ! We've stayed everywhere in Vegas( just a short drive from L.A. )but this is the only place we've ever booked twice ...Not to be mistaken with Mandalay Bay Hotel,which is great also ... This is The Hotel at Mandalay Bay !!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: CWH_hols
Reviews.Content: We stayed at THEhotel at Mandalay Bay for 6 nights for our honeymoon in March 2011 and we had the most wonderful time! The suite was fantastic. The bathroom was spotless and spacious. Thick, plush towels and great lighting. The bed was really comfortable and there was plenty of wardrobe/storage space and lots of clothes hangers. Hotel facilities were great, all communial areas were exceptionally clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. Our best bits... * Would specifically recommend strip steak. Amazing restaurant with great food! * Bootleg canyon zip wires - FANTASTIC! * Penn & Teller at Rio - loved every moment! * Helicopter trip with Maverick * Drinks on the balcony of Margaritaville Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice with the type of service you would expect for a couple extra dollars”
Reviews.Author: AmandaMaxwell
Reviews.Content: We ended up having four people in our party stay at THEhotel. I was quite nervous that a single room would accommodate us all. But, it did nicely; (however, the couch is not a fold out.) I would definitely go back. We did not have much of a view, but the bathrooms rocked. We loved the 1.5 bath, very accommodating. The service was also superior. The staff was courteous and answered all questions without any snobbery. THE hotel is a bit of a walk from the other hotel attractions, but it does have a nice walkway from the garage. The distance also keeps it quiet and subdued. I picked Mandalay due to the great swimming pools. Unfortunately, they were just too crowded for us to enjoy. If you want the pools, considering shelling out the dollars for a cabana. Warning: they are EXPENSIVE!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Turkeymil
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews for hotels you always head to them hoping you made the right choice and this was a very good one for us. We liked the hotel and the location. The Hotel feels like a boutique hotel on a Vegas scale. Our room was a good size and had a great view over the Luxor towards the strip. Plenty of restaurants, a good casino and the children loved the aquarium, but of course their favourite was the pool and lazy river. A couple of pointers would be that the pool is very busy so get there early and the regular beds don't have shade (my only criticism and cost a star!), unless you find a tree. You can hire a cabana or upgraded red bed, but there is a charge of $500 for the cabanas depending on the day. The pool is also a 5-10min walk from your room, but that didn't bother us. We had a 5 min wait to check in and I have seen some comments on this, but due to the scale of the hotels I doubt this can be avoided, when we visited the Venetian the wait looked more like an hour!! We had the unfortunate situation of my 9 year old getting very ill while we were here, the hotel staff and paramedics were excellent and despite this we all loved Vegas and hope to return. If we do, then my guess is that it will be at THE hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive and Relatively Refined”
Reviews.Author: rkf211
Reviews.Content: We just spent four nights at THEhotel at Mandalay Bay. My husband and I were travelling with our 3 1/2 year old daughter. So, cleanliness, quiet and space were all very important. It was those qualities and the Lazy River that brought us to book at THEhotel at Mandalay Bay rather than the conference hotel where my work was. So, first to review the hotel itself: Overall, it was a good hotel. The lobby was attractive and relatively calm. Elevators were quick and efficient. Our suite was attractively decorated and had some very nice amenities including a second 1/2 bath, an enormous bath tub, and quality bath products. We were really impressed that the room was so quiet. We went to bed early and were never bothered by noise from the hallway or the adjacent rooms. It was impressive. The room was showing it's use and wear a bit. There were scratches, dents, etc... in another year this room will be looking pretty bad. We found housekeeping to be lackluster-- the bath wasn't wiped out each day, the floor in the living room wasn't vacuumed, etc... But, these were all minor. Our only real complaint is that the beds were cheap and not comfortable. Every time someone got in our out of bed, the whole bed moved, the mattress was unbearably soft and the bedding felt cheap and scratchy. More what I would expect from a 3 star chain that a higher end hotel. We did LOVE the Lazy River at Mandalay bay-- it was lots of fun playing there. Since we mostly went first thing in the morning or early evening it wasn't unbearably crowded. Thanks to previous reviewers for the tip on bringing our own tubes-- it was great advice. Saved us some money and also made sure we had a good size one for two people (parent and daughter). I read in some review that tubes were supposed to be the same size or smaller than what Mandalay sold, I didn't notice anyone supervising that aspect of things (or supervising anything but that's a different story...) the only rule I saw was not rafts.

Reviews.Title: “Son just turned 21”
Reviews.Author: hinesda
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with "The Hotel". The room was large and very clean. The room had a separate living room that had a small bathroom, but the main bathroom in the bedroom was huge. For the money, this hotel was really a good deal. Also noticed some people with small dogs. I guess they must allow pets. I real definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at THE Hotel rather than Mandalay”
Reviews.Author: RZPhyxit
Reviews.Content: This Hotel/Mandalay is located on the most south part of the Strip. This makes for ease in arriving from LA as it avoids having to drive the congested Strip traffic. The amenities for the bathroom and spa slippers provided at THE Hotel with its modern room decor makes us prefer the Hotel over Mandalay. The lobby level coffee shop is convenient for quick breakfast and they have healthy selections. The spas are very different in decor: Mandalay very Mediterranean elegant, THE Hotel sparse, zen, ultra modern. We have been to both and enjoyed them each individually but the estheticians have a rivalry between the 2 venues. Haven't been to the pool yet, but I hear it is the bomb! We usually go golfing at Wolf Creek or Primm after competing in the WSOP.

Reviews.Title: “Good for kids”
Reviews.Author: IsraelSue1971
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel for families. The suites are a good size. The beach area and wave pool and lazy river are fantastic for children. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Is this place for real”
Reviews.Author: mjm431
Reviews.Content: Let me begin this by saying I have never written a review for anything in my life, but I felt so strongly about this I just had to. Let me give this hotel one positive review by saying the rooms are spacious and are actually very nice including the bathroom but there is were it ends. This hotel is like a good looking person, beautiful on the outside hollow on the inside. To begin with upon entering the magnificent hotel lobby you wait 30 minutes to check in. A line of people standing there with all there luggage awaits. you. We booked to hotel rooms five months prior in which we requested ajoining rooms. They stated this wouldn't be a problem but we could not have those two rooms until the next day. So off we went on separate elevators they were on floors 2-16 I 17-34 I believe which meant to see each we had to to switch elevators. What I didn't know is that this is where the true nightmare would begin. To get on the elevator at any different time any different day was a 20 minute wait. Let me repeat 20 minutes. People were always in line for elevators some with there luggage. You would wait twenty minutes one would show up and be full. One day we waited so long my girlfriends and I walked the 20 flights of stairs. A trip to get a coffee in the lobby was a 45 minute affair. Lets move on to getting the front desk or room service on the phone another you guest it 20 minute wait. THIS HOTEL DOES NOT CARE ABOUT CUSTOMER SERVICE YOU ARE A DIME A DOZEN. How about the gorgeous pool area. Well lets begin with the fact that as a hotel guest your bag is checked like you are at an airport or amusement park upon entering. Better yet, did you think you be entitled to the use of a lounge chair at the pool. Well Im sure you did seeing as you pay a $20 resort fee each day let me tell yah it ain't happening unless you are there before 8 AM. In all actuality there are a few lounge chairs to sparebut only if you have rented a $500 pop up tent, oh excuse me Cabana that is, may you use one. The pools are overcrowded as are the lazy river which is packed full of kids yes you heard it right kids. We all have them, including I, we spend 364 days a year with them, as do is Vegas the place for them probably not. How about the Sp?. Which like all of them you are told to arrive a half hour early to use the amenities. Well we got there a half hour early and what did we do WAITED! Yes just like everywhere else in the hotel. We waited at front desk to be checked into until five minutes before the appointment. As you can see throughout this hotel the theme is WAIT and then be treated like [...] the rest of the time. Did I tell you all that it was my birthday while I was there and my husband had sent me flowers. Well he did and not only did they not call and inform me that they were there ,but when I very nicely asked if they could bring them up (of course I would have generously tipped whomever had) they informed me it we cost me $15. Honestly can you imagine?. By far the last day was the best. It was a Friday everyone had there luggage waiting for elevators then squeezing in on top of each other. People were exploding swearing there heads off making a scene. I felt the need to go up and speak to a supervisor. I was sweating, cranky and fed up. I told her they did not have the enough personal to accommodate as many guests as they had and that the gosh darn door to the stairwell on the 17th floor locked. I told her that if there were a fire there was no way they would be able to get everyone out of the hotel. She informed me that if I did not lower my voice she was calling security. I said not a problem Im leaving I will just call visa and put a stop payment on my credit card. I've never even not paid for a bad meal before thats how fed up I was though. Please please consider what I have told you before staying here. Its beautiful it has the potential ,but needs some work on its soul first. Because just like human beings its the inside that counts, Right? Then again it's Vegas we're talking about .

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: MarDeeS
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay. Staff good. Only complaint is housekeeping. One day we had no towels after our room was cleaned. No wine glasses after the first day. Supplies not replenished after use. At the end of the strip. We did not mind that. The 11 pool/beach was great and so was the lazy river. Overall experience was good and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “They clearly dont care about their guests”
Reviews.Author: sexidaddy
Reviews.Content: this was my 6th or 7th time staying here and every time it seems to slip a little more, less service more shopworn! After 20 min at the front desk, not in line but trying to check in, I was told there were no rooms available because housekeeping staff was.at an event and rooms were not ready...this was at 11pm. Then they wanted to move us to MB instead for a night kf a 3 night stay, after my refusal, the promised a room in 45 min. Its been over 1.5 hours and im still waiting. Its 12:30am. Wynn here I come. The Hotel has become The Worst.

Reviews.Title: “ok so far”
Reviews.Author: travelinrika
Reviews.Content: the room is beautiful. amenities are few. opened a $4 coffee to find that the date had expired. i would have preferred to just have a coffeepot. as in a lot of vegas hotels, payperview does not pause.

Reviews.Title: “THEhotel is THEchampion of mediocrity”
Reviews.Author: jonathan e
Reviews.Content: Arrive to thee people checking in 20 on a Tuesday night. I wait longer than it took to get to the hotel form the airport to get to the front of the line. Then I must wait there for another five minutes while they jockey around my reservation. I arrive at my room at 10pm to a three person cleaning crew still in my room. Hungry I figure I will hit the mini bar... whoops they forgot to give me the key. I decide I will call room service and proceed to listen to a recorded message letting me know how important I am over and over again for 15 minutes. I place my order and am informed the side I have selected is not available with the entree I've selected. The room is nice, but the service leaves mush to be desired. Fail.

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill”
Reviews.Author: avelautham
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times in the last few years and I can only tell you that it is on a perilous slide. It progressively gets worse every year and unfortunately it stems from the poor cleaning. The last time I stayed here there was cigarette ash in one of the drawers [actually on top of the bible]. This time I had an issue with a horrible smell coming from the vents just outside my suite, they sorted it out after I complained but no apology from anyone. Even worse finding out that the body lotion had been used and was not a new bottle. Guys sort this out - don't skimp on the basics. The communal areas are maintained as one would expect very well. I did try out the bathhouse which is their spa - not as good as the Mandalay Bay Spa so if you are angling as to which spa to choose go with the main hotel. Again, that goes for the fitness facilities too. Generally the hotel rooms in Las Vegas age with the hotel, there is very little done to refurbish the rooms but they are clean. Over here they have cut costs in the wrong areas. In the current climate I think you can expect more for your money - think about choosing a higher end hotel with a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Cant wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Jo2008Uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights as part of our honeymoon trip to the USA in August 2011. Stunning hotel and our suite was amazing. At check in we asked if there were any upgrade rooms available and were upgraded to a VSuite.. a corner suite in THEHotel, it was HUGE, beautifully presented and very luxurious. Perfect for a honeymoon couple! There was something for everyone at this hotel, there was time to chill by the pool, grab a starbucks, eat gorgeous food (we sampled Shanghi Lily and loved it), i dislike huge portions of fried food and there was plenty of fine dining experiences available at Mandalay bay. We sampled the roulette tables but found our part of the hotel much quieter and more chilled than Mandalay bay...just what we wanted. During our stay there were some stand out service experiences - reception were great a were the guys in the casino, the shanghi lily staff and the pool staff were also fabulous... some however could have undertaken a little training in how to treat your customer. in particular we found the staff in the Minus 5 Ice Bar quite honestly vile..we were so excited to sample this bar but ended up walking away due to the rude staff members there! I wouldnt recommend going there... infact they have the same bar in the Monte Carlo...they may be more friendly :-). The facilities were overall fantastic - the fitness suite was really well equiped, choices for food and shops were plentiful and there was tons of space around the pool... if you arrived at 8am you could have your pick of the best spots, this was great for us as I love being by the pool all day. not so great if you arent an early riser as it got busy. overall we had a wonderful experience with this hotel and we were gutted to leave, im already pricing up for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing 7 Days in Paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: KatH2Os
Reviews.Content: My husband I were married at The Mandalay Bay in August 2008 and decided to go back and spend a week at THE Hotel for our anniversary. We had an amazing time, loved our room (we were in the V Suite) and we will most certainly return. This was our first time staying in THE Hotel, we typically stay in Mandalay Bay. Unlike some other hotels, our hotel’s separate tower was very accessible to Mandalay’s casino, restaurants and other attractions. The only time we had a more considerable walk was when going to the beach. Otherwise, we felt just as connected as if we were staying in the main hotel, only with fewer crowds, hardly any elevator waiting and a much more relaxing atmosphere!! Check in was a breeze (however there were short lines depending on your arrival time) and the service we received from everyone we encountered was simply fantastic. To top things off, we received a very lovely “Happy Anniversary” gift our first night, which included a bottle of champagne, chocolate covered strawberries, cheese & crackers. We were totally surprised and flattered by the gesture. During our stay we enjoyed the pools and rented a cabana at the more upscale South-Beach styled Moorea, the adult only pool ($10 for women and $40 for men). We opted to go to Moorea both days and felt it was very worth the extra fee (you can sunbathe topless if you choose, there’s always a great DJ creating an amazing vibe and there are no children. The main beach area can become very overrun with children carrying floating rafts for the lazy river… very cute but not our style). In general I would say Mandalay Bay and THE Hotel are excellent choices if you’re going for highclass but still want a chic, relaxing vibe (The Bellagio was a little to stuffy for us and was SO highclass that it was hard to find truly casual things if you wanted them). Keep in mind that you can always walk from Mandalay Bay to the Luxor and Excalibur for food-court options and shopping. All three resorts are connected so you can easily walk from one to the other (or take the tram) if you find that Mandalay doesn’t have what you’re looking for. RESORT FEE: I heard a lot of people complaining about Mandalay’s new resort fee. Personally, my husband and I loved the fact that we were no longer being charged ala cart for items we typically use (wireless internet in the room, gym etc.). However, if you’re not going to use the Internet or the gym, I could see being frustrated by the additional fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: oscarWoodbury
Reviews.Content: We were able to get to the reception desk quickly at the HOTEL. Later in my trip I saw the lines at the regular Mandalay Bay-long......I had asked for 2 queens, but this was not available so I had to settle for a king. Of course they said they would be able to move me the next day, but I knew once we had settled in, it would be too much of a hassle to move. I asked for a roll away for my 27 yr. old son which was quickly provided. It was a clean and beautiful suite with 2 bathrooms. More towels could have been provided daily. I usually just take some from the maid's cart- easier than asking. I really loved their shampoo and conditioner. I wonder if it's sold anywhere. We were on the 33rd floor and had no difficulty waiting for the elevator. I know that the Mandalay Bay's elevator is crowded and slow because my husband was confused and took their elevator to the 33rd floor. We did not use the coffee machine nor take snacks or drinks- very expensive.I would say the HOTEL is a great place to relax and view the strip. I was disappointed in the pool area. I brought my own tube to ride down the Lazy Man River since I had read they charged a $30 rental fee. The pool was terribly crowded with people pushing, bumping, and going beneath you. It was not relaxing- stressful. You don't need a tube to go in ,so many were in the river. The wave pool was ok, but not my thing. The small regular pool was the best, but it was very difficult to find a chair. The area is too small for 2 hotels. People line up before 8 so they can get a chair. There were many great restaurants. The risotto at Lupos was delicious. I kept stealing from my son's plate. The buffet was decent. One can stay inside and go to the Luxor, the mall area and even on to Excalibur for more restaurants. Excalibur has many chain restaurants like Pizza Hut. One can travel to other parts of the strip by taking trams. there still will be much walking so wear comfortable shoes. We visited the Bellagio and saw their water show and viewed their amazing decor inside. Gambling is there for the gamblers wherever you look. Shows of plentiful although Best of Vegas messed up on my tickets to KA and we ended up missing the the first 10 min.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: neelleyfam
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite here for a one night stay in August. I had my kids ages 14, 11 and 7 with me. The room was gorgeous. Plenty of space, beautiful bedding, a large sitting area & desk and nice views from both rooms. The best feature was the bathtub. It had a waterfall and you could watch TV from the tub...my kids all enjoyed this feature. The bedroom has tons of storage space unlike most hotels. The beds are super comfortable. The hotel is low light and modern. It gave me a very peaceful feeling after the Vegas sounds and lights. The main reason I chose to stay here was the pool at Mandalay Bay. If you do not arrive by 8:30 am good luck getting a chair! The pool area is packed. There are numerous pools to chose from but all are crowded. There is little to no free shade. If you want an umbrella you need to rent one! In this day and age I think hotels should offer shaded areas free of charge since skin cancer is a killer. Not here! The drinks and food are pricey too. We paid $6.50 for a breakfast sandwhich at the pool and I could get it for a buck at a gas station. $10 for a yogurt parfait seems crazy to me! To rent a tube by the pool is like $23 ! They will only give you one pool towel per guest. The towel hardly covers half of the chairs which were always dirty! But my kids did enjoy the wave pool and lazy river. The pool had a nice mix of couples and families. So I cannot complain too much. We had a nice dinner at the House of Blues. The house band was really good and entertained us! The shrimps and grits entree was out of this world! The casino was the nicest I have seen in Vegas. My husband really liked the poker room too. Overall, the quality and service have surpassed all other hotels that I have used in Vegas. Worth the money to experience this level of quality.

Reviews.Title: “What a fun weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Ilovetotravel008
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed at THEhotel before. We had no idea what we were missing! The hotel is awesome. From checking in at the VIP area, to finding our way around the hotel, everything was easy. Hotel is clean, modern and doesn't give you the big casino" feel. Our stay was pleasant! The room was large (one studio with living area) and relaxing. We walked to the Pool area at Mandalay Bay and had a great time at the wave pool and the lazy river. Will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Management unable to deal with party and loud music in adjoining room.”
Reviews.Author: SDPilot-7
Reviews.Content: Although most hotels can shine when there are no guest experience problems to deal with, good management teams can effectively deal with problem situations that inevitably occur so that their guests still have a positive experience. Unfortunately, management and staff at THE Hotel in Las Vegas would not or could not deal with a small but increasingly irritating problem that culminated in a member of the hotel's security staff hanging up on me. As you can see from the rankings, it is a gorgeous, huge property that is well maintained with many professional staff members. But like Mexico, where things are great until something goes wrong and you need help, I would say beware of The Hotel. Below is a letter I sent to the General Manager, which he never responded to: The General Manager, We recently stayed at The Hotel and, while some aspects were good, we had a very negative experience which I'd like to make you aware of.   We stayed just one night, last night, and checked out today and stayed in room 61907. First, upon check-in we were informed that the room type we had confirmed with twin beds was not available and that we would be downgraded to accommodate the need for two beds.  Although the room rate was appropriately reduced, this was our first (and negative) experience.  We selected the hotel partly based on room size, room amenities (I.e. Flat screen, upgraded, etc.), and if I had wanted less I would have booked less. Second, and most importantly, the hotel staff and mgr on duty did not satisfactorily handle loud voices and loud music coming from the room next to us at a very late hour. At about 12:30 am, I called to report the increasingly loud music and was transferred to security who said they would send somebody right up to address the situation.  I called back about 15 min later and was told that nobody had been immeadiately dispatched but that they had now. I called back about 10 minutes later, irritated that the loud music was still going on, only to be told (by a male staff member this time) that they were on the way. When I started to protest that I had already been told twice this had happened and was skeptical that somebody was on the way, he hung up on me.  I then called and asked to speak with the mod, who said that she would talk to security.  After no relief from the loud music, I called back and spoke to the mod (I was done with your security staff) who told me security had been preoccupied with a medical emergency and that was why they were late in responding, but nevertheless they should have shut the party down by now. I asked her to call the other room as an interim step and asked them to turn it down which she did.  However, 5minutes later music back on loud and so I had to call the mod a third time. I'm pretty sure they finally sent security because finally things got quite. The next morning, the front desk manager indicated that he had heard about an incident where security had been sent three times and the guests had been removed, but had not heard about any medical incident that would have pre-occupied security.  I don't think this was my situation as we never heard security knock on their door or have an interaction with them until the end when the music shut down. I realize this is Vegas and people are there to have a good time. My concern was how your hotel staff dealt with me and how long it took to resolve.  I'm most upset by the security personnel and being hung up on.  I realize they have a tough job dealing with all the crazy people, but really, they should not be interacting with behaving guests, should never treat someone like me as the problem when they've dropped the ball.  I assume you tape the calls and can listen to the audio. I got the feeling they are in their own vertical, not accountable to the hotel manager responsible for the guests' experience.   Medical emergency or not, there should be enough of them to handle more than one situation, they should be geographically dispersed so that response times are not so long. All pools cloosing at 7pm and only allowing one pool towel per guest were additional minor annoyances that will most likely result in us staying elsewhere on future stays. I'm not looking for any future consideration; I think the front desk supervisor took something off the bill.  To calibrate, I've never had a situation like this, not really a complainer, but as you can see from this note the whole experience was upsetting, and if were the GM I would want to know this happened, and to know it from the guest's perspective.   The Guest

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but housekeeping needs improvement.”
Reviews.Author: starbunker
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with great decor. THE hotel is quieter than Mandalay Bay Hotel and has a more upscale design. I paid for a suite which was tastefully decorated and had flat screens in all rooms. Staff at check-in was neither really nice nor rude...just mediocre. I was not given a free upgrade - I paid FULL price. All was good with the hotel until I noticed the floors in my suite were not being cleaned (neither vacuumed nor swept) when house keeping came. Maids were only doing the obviuos (making beds, straightening pillows on sofa, cleaning toilet, etc).I stayed for 5 nights and the foors in the bathroom remained uncleaned the entire time. I finally wiped them with a damp towel and soap myself. For the price I paid for a suite, I expected it to be well-cleaned dailey. Also, one day the sheets on the bed smelled sour (from sitting wet in a washing machine too long) so I called and requested fresh sheets for the bed. Maids delivered them to us folded in a stack and we had to change the sheets on the bed ourselves....not cool due to the price per night I was paying. It is my opinion that when you call yourself THE Hotel you better make sure everything in the hotel is top-notch especially housekeeping. I will not return to THE Hotel in Las Vegas. There are too many other nice hotel/resorts to choose from who keep the guests rooms well-cleaned - from the floors up.

Reviews.Title: “WOW !! BEST MOMENT EVER !”
Reviews.Author: Marc-Andre B
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone, just to confirmed we been in MAY 2010 with (7 friends & girlfriend) We booked at the Mandalay Bay for 5 days and 4 nights. But finally i decided to upgrade once my arrival. I was wondering what best upgrade i can get for less than 50-40$ a night and finally we got the best deal ever with a suite on THEhotel section. THEhotel section is rich, clean and class !! The 5 stars is everywhere, restaurant was great, and casino area was far away to be quiet sometimes (Casino area in the Mandalay Bay section). Stay @THEhotel let you the possiblity of getting access to the fabolous beach and wave pool wich is amazing for everyone. Unfortunately becauase we went in May the casino on the beach was not opened yet... We found the hotel a bit far from the Strip but when you go to VEGAS one way or the other you will walk a lot !! There was a Moorea poolside wich i wanted to get access but the access to that pool was not free, Next time i return in setptember, i will definitly pay this $$ required. The staff was great all entire the hotel (Mandalay Bay & The Hotel). We will GO BACK !!!! that was one of the BEST TRIP of our life !! THANKS THEhotel for those beautiful moment !! Mark

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Money”
Reviews.Author: Y00perGirl
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a spacious suite, this fits the bill. THEHotel is connected to the Mandalay Bay Resort but to get there you have to walk through the very smokey casino. I made a reservation for a nonsmoking suite with a king size bed. When I checked in I was informed the only rooms available at check in were smoking rooms. I was offered a nonsmoking room with two queens instead--not what I reserved and not what I wanted. The front desk staff was very chilly. The room was dusty and the carpet had a few big stains on it. You can tell that this used to be a very nice place when it was new, but the furniture is scratched and shabby--time for an update. I was very disappointed to find that the pools close at 6pm--just when business people would like to unwind poolside with a drink. During the day the pools were packed with children. The restaurants are all very expensive, even for breakfast. Eating in the hotel facilities cost me double my per diem. If you're looking for a hotel that caters more toward the professional, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vegas and Unbelievable Pool”
Reviews.Author: kvarie05
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. As with everything in Las Vegas, THEhotel at Mandalay Bay is spectacular. For the little extra you pay you get a whole lot more hotel. The rooms are huge with 1.5 baths, big shower and Jacuzzi (t.v. in the bathroom also). Separate bedroom from main space makes partying very easy. The pool is really the selling point. If you like the beach then this is the place to stay. A giant wave pool surrounded by smooth sandy beach and a lazy river. Waitresses everywhere to take your order and make you feel like your a high roller. The grill by the pool offers good food. The only downside of Thehotel is that the walk to casinos, restaurants, pool and the strip is about a half a mile. I will only stay at THEhotel.

Reviews.Title: “Platinum Card Fine Hotels not taken seriously....”
Reviews.Author: Reasonable50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one night at the end of July. We used the Amex Platinum Fine Hotels and Resorts program to book our room. We had quality room locations and upgrades in the past with hotel bookings with Amex. This was not to be the case at this location. We checked in at 4 PM (BTW, the entrance is in a parking garage.... imagine yourself going shopping at Macy's). Our original assigned room was a corner "upgrade" on floor 13 (of 64) over the highway and massive air conditioning units. We had to go back to reception...the room was very noisy and unacceptable. We asked for a smaller room this time....not over the highway. We were trying to be reasonable. We watched, as the manager, asked by staff if this was possible, shook her head fervently .."no.." Really.....did we need to see that? Well, after some key punching by the staff, we were placed in the corner on floor 28... this time not over the highway but looking at the Mandalay main building . It was a better room.....but a lot of work....a lot of effort....especially after we paid a premium with Amex. Well, after a good dinner ( Strip Steak....really yummy) and good night's sleep.... my husband the next day discovered that the staff had not programmed our room card for 4 PM check out. I was in the spa pool area when he called me to tell me he was locked out... and of course...I was promptly chastised by spa staff for answering my phone. To remedy the room key fiasco, reception told my husband to go to floor 28 (he was standing at the reception desk in his wet swim trunks) and wait for security to let him in. Of course, he did not do this. This was not a good stay. Management did comp us some for our troubles.....but really ....we would not stay at THEhotel again.

Reviews.Title: “WORT PLACE EVER”
Reviews.Author: andy90028
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place ever where you can stay. We made a reservation thru their website the did not honor it. The rooms are not worth of what you paid for night. The customer service is the worst customer service ever.... The bed was made around 4.00 oclok... We complained with the supervisor and his answer was " well if you dont like the place then you can move out and we will give you your money back but, we will charge you a fee" We felt very discriminated because we are hispanics and I think they did not like the fact that 2 of my friends were gay they did look at us with discusting faces....

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Convenient To Convention”
Reviews.Author: IL2TRAVEL_11
Reviews.Content: THEhotel is a "Boutique" type Hotel, that I am learning is very modern and somewhat dark, meaning color scheme and overall lighting. We checked in late on a Friday evening, and received a nice upgrade to a bigger suite. We were attending a convention, so the location was very good. For a five star hotel, I was surprised that there was an in room charge for coffee; however my roommate told me that is pretty standard for Vegas. Left the maid a $5.00 tip, with a note for extra towels. The money was gone, but we did not get the towels. The pool area is shared with a few properties, and was a bit tired looking, in comparison to newer properties. Overall, it was a nice roomy stay, with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Most, But Needs Work”
Reviews.Author: GlobalBizMgr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a major industry convention and was shocked at how ill prepared the hotel was to provide basic services. OK, you know you're going to have a full hotel over a certain period, so how does it take 1 hour 40 minutes - I'm not kidding - to get breakfast. I've heard lots of tales about Vegas being in hard times but come on, how far back do you cut service until you become a second rate hotel. There were other cracks in the veneer also during my stay, like unreasonable charges for meeting space or an extra chair in my room for a meeting, etc. To be fair the rooms are certainly nice and reasonably priced. The staff seemed friendly and accommodating, although stretched. And I do like the Out of the Way ambiance of this hotel over the more hectic feel of other hotels on the strip. So, overall, I still rate this as one of the better experiences in Vegas. However, it seems this hotel is an eyelash away from just being a slightly nicer version of the Mandalay Bay. Four Seasons here I come.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and i would go back each yr when i return here”
Reviews.Author: AmishShah
Reviews.Content: The checkin was the smoothest i have ever had in Vegas where most hotels make you wait. They had a lovely suit for me on the higher floor. The suite was large as expected with a large bathroom. I was there for over a week and it was a very comfortable stay. The best part is how fast you can get a cab no matter what day or hr of the week. This is the best part of my stay. I never waited more then 7 minutes for a cab and that is high. The massage was very nice and the gym is good. The restaurant downstairs was very nice and made me for my dietary restrictions and made me a meal every day that suited the same. The bar on the 65th floor is lovely in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Suite at Great Price”
Reviews.Author: ATLFamilyofFour
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (kids age 12 and 9) stayed here on 7/25/2011 in a THEHotel suite. Room was beautiful and bathroom was amazing. Incredible value overall. Location is okay, not great. Tram to Luxor/Excalibur helped get us closer to hub of Strip. Pool was slight disappointment. Lazy river is fun but shorter than anticipated. Wave pool was also fun but got old quickly given how crowded it was. Strangely, there were 2 used drink glasses that remained outside our door for 24+ hours, despite numerous housekeeping folks walking by ... Very minor issue but just odd for such an incredible facility. If you're looking for great room and beautiful facility at terrific price, then this is very good option. If you want to be in middle of the action, then I'd consider the Bellagio or Cosmopolitan.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but maybe too nice”
Reviews.Author: carlinsmom
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, nicely decorated and very contemporary. I appreciate nice things but perhaps this was a little too stuffy for my liking for a Las Vegas Hotel. My aunt booked a very nice suite for her birthday celebration so I had no idea what the hotel was like. It was very impressive but had a "cold" feeling to it, and THERE WAS NO SMOKING OR A CASINO IN THE LOBBY! I have never been to a hotel in Vegas with no casino in it! It was a short walk to Mandalay Bay though. When I went down for iced tea and a croissant, they had no croissants left, didn't have unsweetened tea (so I went to the bar), and the gal working the counter was pretty grouchy, not happy about that! Overall, it was very nice but I would not choose to stay there again, but I would love to stay at Mandalay Bay next time!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms, (although a little "tired")”
Reviews.Author: JeremyKingsbury
Reviews.Content: Opted for the two room suite offered by The Hotel for our arrival in Las Vegas and stayed for the first three nights of our trip (ideal set-up for adjusting to time differences). Be aware, if you are driving, navigating the car park is not that easy. Check-in was very smooth, pleasant, polite staff who were very helpful, the room was really nice, an excellent size and good facilities, my only negative comment is that the room we had was showing its age with wear and tear, not something I expected with carpet and upholstery stains etc. The Hotel is a very short walk to the main Mandalay Bay complex which we thought was excellent, there are plenty of eating and drinking options, the House of Blues is a must, (that said, I would avoid the Gospel Brunch at all costs). The pool complex gets extremely busy and unless you get there early you may struggle to get a sun bed, my wife ended up paying $100 for a reserved area lounger as everywhere else was taken. Although the Mandalay Bay is in a bit of a remote location, it is not really an issue as the free mono-rail service to Luxor, (an easy walk through the shops), and Excalibur takes you closer to the action. I had always avoided staying here previously because of the location, however, I would not hesitate using this Hotel again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Not as posh as they want you to think”
Reviews.Author: seeksfun
Reviews.Content: We were" upgraded" from the MANDALAY BAY to this hotel. Did not request this suite, although we had reservations for a suite. If you get switched to a different hotel, after you have left your bags with the valet at your original distination, make sure the check in desk notifies the valet promptly. We had to wait over an hour for our bags to be transferred, so we missed out on the numerous happy hours offered at the hotel. Ask for a room as close to the pool, it is quite a walk through the casino, out to the valet area and then in and around the Mandalay Hotel restaurants before you get to the pool. We brought our own wine and froze some water bottles from home, the water in the room bar is $4.50 a bottle. Snacks are $5.00 at least. They did have a fancy coffee maker with the room, but the coffee cost extra also. Ask for a view of the pool or the front of the strip, the back parking lot is not fun to look at and the big turbines across the street are noisey!

Reviews.Title: “Very easy to like”
Reviews.Author: USVItravel
Reviews.Content: good design, clean cut architecture (transitional modern), attractive small suites, THE HOTEL is an excellent value and very easy to like. i found it to be precisely what i expected, and have stayed here several times (and recommended it to friends). you can make that reservation without reservation. MANDALAY has excellent amenities.

Reviews.Title: “High roller hotel at a blue collar price!”
Reviews.Author: Sucurro
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are very very nice. They are the most spacious rooms we have stayed in here. I knocked the hotel down a little bit for being at the far end of the strip, but there is a free tram that helps out a but. Every employee at this hotel was professional & they made out stay pleasurable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: lindsaylittlejohn
Reviews.Content: Likes: seperate living and sleeping quarters, 1.5 bathrooms, quick elevators, friendly staff, price (based on a internet special), location in reference to the rest of the strip and Mandalay. Dislike: attention to detail on the cleaning (dirty wallpaper in the bathroom, small holes in the hallways, not having their own private pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay but where's the customer service?”
Reviews.Author: ntaormina
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the weekend with my kids ages 6 and 10. The Wave Pool and Lazy River were a hit but the $100 per chaise chair and $100 per unbrella was ridiculous. Unless you get to the pool by 7:00 and "save chairs" which says is forbidden getting a good chair is almost impossible. We were there Friday, laid our stuff in a bag on a chaise and went to the Wave pool. Twenty minutes later, when I came back my bag had been stolen. They later found the bag minus our i phones, room key and the $200. They left my husbands drivers license and credit card. After filling out all the forms, we called down to the front to inform them we would have to use their hotel phones to cancel our phones, etc. Upon check out we were hit with $75 in phone charges for the 3 phone calls I made to cancel all of our things. After 20 minutes waiting, they finally agreed to take charges off....gee thanks! The rooms are nice size, great to have 2 queens in the bedroom which makes taking the kids easier. Staying at TheHotel is quieter than The Mandalay even though they share the same property. They built a walkway between Luxor and Mandalay with stores and restaurants and that's nice. The $20 per day resort fee is a joke. I don't think you should have to pay it unless you use those services. They said its mandatory. I say if it's mandatory then put it in the price of the room not separate. Overall we did enjoy the stay and would be back, just more cautious.

Reviews.Title: “solid choice in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: vinnyjake
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times and like the rooms and solitude of the hotel. I get more for my money than at hotels more centrally located on the Strip. Keep in mind that you really need a car to get to most shows and attractions along the Strip because this hotel is at the far South end. I will return!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm, just steps from the strip”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend picked this hotel for a weekend romantic get-away, and it couldn't have worked out better. The rooms (all suites) are elegant, spacious and stylish. There's something very pleasant and peaceful about staying in a place that doesn't have a casino in the lobby. Mandalay Bay is just down the hall, but somehow you feel insulated from the bedlam. The restaurant on the top floor was wonderful for an elegant dinner, and the attached club next door may have the best view of the strip (with the Luxor pyramid at your feet). if we'd discovered this club sooner, we almost certainly would have made a return trip. We were a little daunted by the crowds at the pool, and in the end, decided we had better things to do. Still, it's an impressive facility and would be great for families. The hotel has it's own quiet lobby cafe and bar, we had our morning coffee there a couple of the mornings. There's also a small 24hr convenience store that sells booze. Don't waste your money on room service (45 min wait) or the mini bar, haul your bones to the lobby and save a buck. In terms of Vegas in general, you have to see Cirque's "O" at the Bellagio. It will blow your mind. For sheer enjoyment and entertainment, blue man group is hard to top. I realize most people saw these two shows eons ago, but if you haven't...you should.

Reviews.Title: “The suite was sweet”
Reviews.Author: Lobstah1
Reviews.Content: Ahhh, "The Hotel" at Mandalay is a separate building from the Mandalay with a separate entrance and check-in. Quick elevator ride to floor 17, down the hall, open the door, "it really is a suite" says my wife. Not disappointed. Comfortable king size bed (where was my wife under that big comforter?), spa tub, glassed shower, 2 toilets ..hallway and bathroom. Always enjoyed returning to the room late in the evening .. "so comfy feels like a house" says my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great pools, great stay; here are the pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: redwingsfan68
Reviews.Content: THEHotel at Mandalay Bay spared no expense in building this massive hotel. This hotel is top notch in elaborate decor, unbelievable pools, the beautifully landscaped grounds outside, the well-appointed interior walkways, the wonderful rooms, the extremely attentive staff, the 5-star restaurants, flashy casino, and even the pleasant aroma when you walk inside this multi-billion dollar Vegas palace -- but be prepared to pay for all the extras if you're not careful. My wife, our two teen-agers and I stayed here for 6 nights in mid July and we loved our stay. Here is a complete review to help you have a more enjoyable -- and possibly less costly -- stay at THEHotel, especially when traveling with kids. Check-in: we arrived about midnight on a Friday and our check-in was flawless, quick and easy. Cab ride from the airport was $20, bellman quickly took our bags to the room and we had a rollaway bed delivered 5 minutes after we got in the room (charge was supposed to be $20 per day, but they didn't charge us for it in the end!!). Suites: At 750 square feet, this was large, comfortable and elegantly decorated. Two rooms with each having room-length, floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the airport and Vegas strip from the 37th floor (other rooms overlook the strip and mountains or the mountains and pool). Room had 1 1/2 baths, main bath was extremely large with a deep bath tub and glass enclosed shower. A flat screen TV was in the bathroom, which had double sinks. The two queen beds were extremely comfortable and a large TV was in the room with plenty of drawers for our clothing. The living room had a large, comfortable sofa (NOT a foldout sofa), desk, and sleek entertainment center with a large flat screen TV and separate DVD player. The room had a sink and bar area complete with glasses, wine cork screw. The refrigerator cannot be used for personal storage as it only contains items for purchase. You cannot take out items from it or you will be charged for those items (even if you intend to replace them). Instead, you can rent a refrigerator for personal use at $20 per day, which we did not do. The coffee maker is a single cup, Keurig coffee maker that you have to pay $4.00 per cup if you want to use it. If you want any utensils, you have to pay for them; if you need a bottle opener, it is $1.50 from room service, plus tip. My suggestion is to bring your own utensils here if you plan on eating in the room and coffee singles packets, plus your cream and sugar. You also pay a resort fee of $20 extra per night, which includes use of the internet (which was very reliable for our laptop, but not our iTouches), plus the pools and large, modern exercise facilities. Ask housekeeping for extra towels, pillows or shampoo if you need these items (no extra charge). Housekeeping was very good. The elevators in the massive structure were fast and efficient. We had no issues and never had to wait long, no matter which time of day that we rode them. The pools: the pools are large, beautifully landscaped with shrubs, palm trees and other tropical plants and very refreshing. The lazy river was a good speed, a little crowded (but not excessively); the wave pool was large, but our kids complained that only one wave would come out at a time spaced about a minute apart, so they got bored of it quickly. A warm, shallow pool was next to the wave pool and a large, sandy beach faced the wave pool. Our challenge each morning was to find chairs that were in the shade, but they are limited. If you want a chair in the direct sun, you'll have your choice (but laying out in 105-110 degree temps for 3-4 hours was not our plan). So to get a chair in the shade, get to the pool when it opens at 8 a.m. and you'll have your pick. Reserve a chair by placing a towel and personal item like a book on it. For the lazy river, bring your own inflatable tubes or you will have to pay $25 per tube at the pool (we picked up 4 big tubes for $10 each at Walmart). Pool attendants will fill up the tubes for you for free. If you don't want a tube in the lazy river, the lifeguards allow you to float or walk in it without a tube. The lazy river is long and VERY nice. One towel per guest when you enter the pool area, however, just go back again to get additional towels. There is a large open aired bar where you can get drinks, although expensive at sporting event prices ($8 for a 16-ounce beer and $15 for a frozen daquiri). We had no issues with any ``drunk'' people at the pool area. Everyone was well-behaved. Having two teens with us, we kept an eye out for anyone out of control, but -- as expected -- did not encounter any problems. The trek to get to the pool is long. From our room it was a 10-15 minute walk. From THEHotel, you can go the long way through the casino and restaurants to the pool, or you can take a shortcut through the parking garage to the restaurants area then to the pool(this is definitely the shortest, fastest route). The restaurants in Mandalay Bay are top-notch and very expensive, whether you want breakfast, lunch, dinner, snacks, ``just drinks,'' or appetizers. Expect breakfast for four, with tip, at $60 minimum; lunch $70-$80 minimum without alcohol, or $80-$140 for dinner without alcohol ($90 for 4 burgers and 4 soft drinks at the Burger Bar restaurant). Having been pre-warned about the expensive restaurants and eateries, we planned ahead......For our family of four, we took a cab ride on the first day, bought $100 of breakfast foods, fruit, coffee, snacks, soft drinks, beer and booze (for my wife and I) and probably saved $500-$600. Breakfast alone at a restaurant here would have been minimum $60 per day X 6 days. Sure the casinos give you ``free drinks'' when you are gambling, but my wife I were not in the casino much to really take advantage of that option. Even when we were, wait staff taking ``free'' drink orders seldom came around. When they do come around, order 2 drinks at a time. So we often just took drinks from our room when going around the resort or walking the strip (remember, this is Vegas so you can take your booze anywhere). The problem with the restaurants here -- in my opinion -- is that you are limited with ``expensive,'' ``more expensive'' and ``super expensive'' categories. Because of that, with Mandalay Bay being so far from the rest of the strip, getting to a less expensive restaurant (even Hard Rock Cafe, Rainforest Cafe, Cheesecake Factory, Margaritaville) becomes a monumental task and potentially even more expensive if you get a cab. That said, I would recommend Hussong's Mexican restaurant in the attached Mandalay Bay mall that connects to the Luxor. Very good food, excellent service and reasonable (we used a $25 gift certificate that we purchased on Restaurant.com). Many of the restaurants at Mandalay Bay have gift certificates on restaurant.com, but they are still very expensive. A drawback with Mandalay Bay is that because it is at the far end of the strip (next to Luxor), it is a long walk/tram ride/taxi ride anywhere on the strip. Getting to the free tram that runs from Mandalay to Excalibur and Luxor is a 10-15 minute walk from the room. The tram ride is quick. The good side, however, is that the hotel/casino doesn't get heavy foot traffic from people walking the strip (they usually stop at MGM Grand or New York New York). Mandalay Bay had noticeably much LESS foot traffic than the other hotels. If you don't have a car and you don't want to walk the strip or ride the tram, a cab ride is anywhere from $10-$20 one-way to a location on the strip (depending on the distance). Overall THEHotel at Mandalay Bay was excellent and we would definitely stay here again. The room was a great value -- with our air-hotel package it averaged to $120 per night for four. Really no complaints from my wife and I, except the expensive food and drink prices here. The room was excellent, staff was very helpful and great, the pool area was awesome, and the look and feel of the entire resort was 5 stars out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Roomfreak
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 7 pm and HAD TO WAIT for a room - 7 am maybe but not 7 pm. This hotel has the least impressive entrance that I have ever encountered - through the carpark! Room was great - large and well equipped but we were in a V Suite on the 6th floor with mountain view AND a great big airconditing plant across the road that resulted in a constant hum in the room. Just drank more to get to sleep. Had 4th July dinner at Mix restaurant (top floor) and it was great - but you do not have to stay at hotel to appreciate restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay at a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: IndianaJBo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay for five nights. We had a wonderful time. The hotel is beautiful and clean. All the rooms are suites so you have a powder room and a living room with a flat screen t.v. The garden tub is lovely too. We loved the fact that The Hotel doesn't have it's own casino so it is quiet. We were able to use the pools at Mandalay Bay and they were beautiful as well. We will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelDudeMike
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels in vegas for your money. Trust me I have been to vegas over 20 times and have strayed in most of the hotels. Pros: The rooms are all suites and include a second bathroom and having the second bathroom (toilet and sink only) was an important benefit when having 3 in the room. The room was furnished beautifully with a 42" tv in the living room as well as a wet bar in the living room. Access to the Mandalay Bay pool area which is the best pool in vegas hands down. Note water is heated to 80 degrees which makes the pool usable in the fall months like Sept, Oct. Cons: Walk to Mandalay Bay pool area is very long and requires you walk through the entire Mandalay Bay Casino. Also when busy they only give each person a single towel which is ridiculous for a 4 star resort. You end up going back and forth to get a resonable # of towels for the day which for me is 3. ( 2 to cover chair and one to dry with). Dinner buffet at $29 on a Saturday was not worth the money. Prime Rib was rubbery and other meats were subpar. Breakfast and lunch buffets at $20 are just OK. Tip: The Luxor next door has a dinner buffet that is only $20 and has much more variety and better quality of food. Evlevators are noticabley noisy and seem like some maintenance is in order Overall a great hotel if you can get a deal on the suite rooms at $200 or less a night. I highly recommend TheHotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here twice! Beautiful hotel! Amazing POOLS!!”
Reviews.Author: MissaGrrrl
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at THEHotel at Mandalay Bay twice. Our first stay we were getting married and had a an entourage of people with us. We got upgraded to a corner suite on a very high floor. When you opened our bedroom window you saw the amazing lights of the strip and the Luxor which is right next store!! This was a amazing seeing it was our first time EVER in Vegas. Our first trip we asked if we could get an upgrade but it wasn't offered for free so we decided to skip it. We still had a nice room with a nice view. The rooms are BIG and decorated so nicely and very modern. Our room had a seperate powder room and living room space. This was nice! The tub is to die for. I used it a few time on both stays. We stayed away from the mini bar cause the price was ridiculous. We did order room service on both stays and the breakfast was AMAZING! Everything else was just so so. Our second trip they ended comping our room service because we gambled so much! The pools at Mandalay Bay are amazing. There is no other hotel that offers anything like it. They have a wave pool- lazy river and all set in a lush "resort-like" setting. There are chairs everywhere and we always found a seat. The drinks are, of course, crazy expensive, among everything else. The food at the grill is pretty good though- and you get A LOT of food! Speaking on food- the buffet at the hotel is ok. Really expensive and large but I wasn't overly impressed. I also was not happy with any of the meals we had at The House of Blues. It's such a cool looking place but each meal came out cool and blah. We didn't try any other resturants in the complex. I loved that it's hooked to the luxor! You can take a tram or just walk through their "mall" and get to the other hotel. They have Urban outfitters and all other kinds of stores in the mall. They also have a FAT TUESDAY's. There is one of them in Philadelphia and we LOVE their slushy drinks! Good buy- get one of their large cups and they refill them anywhere on the strip for a fraction of the cost!! And there is a lot of FAT TUESDAY's up and down the strip! Over all we were happy with our stay both times we were there. Yes, it's far from the strip but we didn't mind! I think when we go back we might try another place but only if we can find a place with a comparable pool!! You can't beat their pool!!

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas price gouging at it's finest”
Reviews.Author: 2deep4U
Reviews.Content: $4 for the disposable cup to make coffee in your room. Buy or provide your own tube for the lazy river $20 for small tube or $30 normal. Love the extra resort fees, they said it includes WiFi, paper, health club... and good luck connecting your mobile, what paper and the gym is a convenient 6 minute cross hotel power walk, unless you want to pay extra for the gym at the SPA on the 2nd floor of the same building for at $15 per day. Overall beautiful hotel, the beach and pool is great fun, just be ready to be nickel and dime'd at every step.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it -- beautiful rooms, great family pool too!”
Reviews.Author: rocsmom0304
Reviews.Content: We took a staycation for two nights and stayed at the Mandalay Bay -- to our surprise, we were upgraded to the all-suites THE Hotel at Mandalay! The check-in lines were ridiculously long, but we did check in at 10 AM as we had a special "early check-in" rate. We snuck into the prefered/invited guest line and they assisted us without question. THE Hotel is a little further of a walk, but the rooms are beautiful and bigger . . . The "living" area separates the bedroom from the rest of the room which is nice for kids, so we don't all have to watch SpongeBob! The beds were very comfortable, but the A/C exhaust flap (according to my husband) kept us up throughout the night. Luckily we were tired enough from our time at the pool that we weren't too bothered by it. Now the pool - the reason we LOVE the Mandalay Bay - is so much fun! My girls are 7 and 8 and had hours of fun riding waves and floating along the lazy river. We even enjoyed the pool to the side (near the tube desk, behind the bathrooms) as it was a lot less crowded most of the time. Kids need to be 48" to swim in the wave pool and my 7 year old just made it thankfully!! A great weekend family stay-cation!! We'll definitely do it again!!

Reviews.Title: “Like it , but come on...”
Reviews.Author: artieboy
Reviews.Content: In my last review I mention I travel from the east cost with a coffee maker to Vegas. How happily surprised I was to find a Keurig coffee maker. Oh wait it gets better! They put the coffee pod in a sealed Styrofoam cup and charge $4.00 "Coffee Kit" Really! You lose a point for that one folks as well as the worthless resort fee. However the place looks and smell great.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the desert”
Reviews.Author: Rnisogi
Reviews.Content: theHotel is top notch. They went out of their way to accommodate us. The amenities were so nice it was hard to leave. We loved the swim pool and Evening Call (best frozen drinks around!). Thanks for the wonderful family trip, we can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Fun times with best friends!”
Reviews.Author: MMP522
Reviews.Content: I made a trip out to Vegas to reunite with my dearest friends who travelled in from London, LA and Paris. We stayed at THE Hotel and loved our time there. The spa was spectacular! Private, modern, and full of little extras that make me appreciate the detail.For a group of 40 something women who have travelled extensively and have high standards, this place hit the mark. Being a holiday weekend, it was maybe more crowded by the pool than normal, but the pools were worth the crowd. The hotel rooms were very clean and spacious. The towels and robes were fluffy and clean. This was my first time to Vegas, but others had been before and said they preferred THE over MGM or other hotels they've used. I would go back and stay here...service, quality and luxury all wrapped up in one good time!

Reviews.Title: “More hassle than needed”
Reviews.Author: Mom23inOR
Reviews.Content: We were going to arrive about midnight so I called the hotel about 4pm to let them know we would be arriving late and they said no problem. I asked for a room with a strip view and they said they could not guarantee it since they assign rooms as people check in. We got there about 11:30pm and when we checked in we were told that they were sold out and they could put us in the main Mandalay Bay hotel. Ummmm NO. Reservation was for THEhotel and that's why I CALLED earlier. That is exactly what I told the girl at the desk. Then I was offered a "smoking/non-smoking room" (doesn't that just make it a smoking room??) although I specifically requested non-smoking. At this point I just stared at her. She finally said in the morning they could switch rooms and offered to comp some room service and a small rate reduction of the first night. I was fairly peeved. The room did smell like smoke but at that point there wasn't much choice. Super loud thumping of some machinery every few minutes, too. We went out for a drink because at this point, we needed it. Awful sleep with that thumping noise and in the morning I went down to the front desk where I was assured that we would have a room on the 37th floor by the afternoon and they got my mobile number to call and let me know. We went out and about all day and by 5pm, still no phone call. We went back to the front desk where they had no record of a room change (??) and TWO people worked for about 15 min typing and looking at their computer. I got so annoyed I left to walk around and let my friend handle it. When I came back, they had given us a room on the 22nd floor--a corner unit, non-smoking. The room turned out fine and the rest of the nights were better, but what a freakin' hassle for what I should have had in the first place! I've always stayed at THEhotel for my Vegas trips, which I do a few times a year. I cannot say I will be back again, though. Other hotels are just as nice and similar pricing and I'd prefer to avoid the hassle on a VACATION. Note to management: I understand wanting max occupancy for revenue, but if a guest reserves a room and has paid a deposit, make sure you actually HAVE a room for them when they arrive. The one they requested. And that they called ahead for to assure would be held for them. Pretty basic stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: livetwotravel
Reviews.Content: It was nice to stay in a more secluded area of the Mandalay Bay resort. We found theHotel to be a very chic and nicely appointed property. Our suite was beautiful and comfortable. The lobby bar played host to classic drinks and wonderful service. The casino was lively and it was nice to have easy tram access to the Exclaibur. We weren't too impressed with the buffet and the Mexican restaurant was only a little better. House of Blues was pretty good for breakfast. Overall it was a nice place to stay, but a bit far away from the action of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “awesome pool”
Reviews.Author: tlaccord
Reviews.Content: mandalay bay is my favorite hotel in las vegas. I stayed there 3 times. I love it because of the beach pool, lazy river and the quality of the hotel. the views are great looking over the pool or facing the strip. you might get lost for a few hours not knowing your way but you will get the hang of things. I believe it has more then 3,000 rooms. luxury hotel but not the price if you will get a hotel and air package joey ; )

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are still tops for space but room for improvement...”
Reviews.Author: spaeatsleep
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd stay at THEhotel and I've always loved the rooms for the layout/space. Even thought the sq footage is similar to Encore, I prefer the layout at THEhotel where you get a true suite with a door between the LR and BR and the second half bath is a luxury not found elsewhere for a standard room category. We were 2 females sharing a double room and having that second bath was primo for getting ready. Room temperature was great and I like that each room of the suite has it's own thermostat. Plenty of space and 2 flat screen tvs (1 in each room) plus a baby LCD in the main bath. The tv is in the right spot in the bath so you can even watch tv from the shower or tub! Now the cons: while I appreciate the sexiness of the dark furniture and low lighting, the lighting should be on a proper dimmer switch so you have the option of actually seeing well. They have a dimmer but your choices are dark to dim! The very low lighting isn't great for getting ready but since they have a lighted makeup mirror on an arm in the bathroom, I'll forgive them. Second, the room was looking a little shabby: the bed skirt had a tear in it and the lampshade on the night stand had a big rip in it. Overall, I love the ambiance of THEhotel and I like how it is a different world from the Mandalay Bay annex. We did have a hiccup at check in. There were 3 of us and one woman had her own room. We requested that we have our rooms at least on the same floor and hopefully near one another. We had requested 2 beds in our room. At check in, the agent said that the hotel was completely sold out and that she couldn't grant us a room with 2 beds, nor on the same floor. We were on the 37th floor and our friend was on 28. The agent recommended that we call the front desk the next morning since many check out on Sundays. We knew it would be a hassle, but had no choice and would hope for the best in the morning. We got to our room and it immediately reeked of cigarettes even though we were in a NS room. We immediately turned around and went back downstairs to the front desk. I spotted our original agent, Gigi and explained. She apologized and said she would go in the back and see if she could work some 'magic'. I decided that if she came back with good news, I would tip her $20. Sure enough, not only did she now miraculously have a room with 2 beds, but also on the same floor as our friend! How so? We didn't care and all that mattered was that we got what we wanted! I gave her the $20 and thanked her for her efforts. When we go to the room, we were pleasantly surprised that it wasn't smokey. We visited the Spa at Mandalay and while they had all of the typical amenities, I prefer Bathhouse at THEhotel. The Spa at Mandalay was dated. We dined at Border Grill which was very good and saw The Lion King which was excellent. Gambling was so so at the casino. Resort fee now includes wifi. The Cosmopolitan is still my favorite Vegas room, but another stay at THEhotel wouldn't be too much of a compromise. Yes it is on the far south end of the strip, but for the right price, I'd take it.

Reviews.Title: “The real problems began at the front desk....”
Reviews.Author: ronu2
Reviews.Content: First impressions are very important. You learn this early in life. My first impression of THE Hotel was ambivalent because the nasty taxi from LAS to THE Hotel smelled horribly like smoke and body odor, and when the taxi dropped us off in the lobby of THE Hotel, which is an oven in an old parking garage, it didn't feel very luxurious. My wife does marketing and business development for a professional business and dumped a lot of money into this hotel for a four night stay.........thousands of dollars........and we hadn't even arrived yet. So knowing that THE Hotel is the luxury, upscale hotel at Mandalay Bay, I expected a bit more. Last year we stayed at Palazzo, the upscale, luxury hotel at Venetian, and it was very accommodating. This trip....not so much. The real problem began at the front desk when my wife asked for room with a view of the strip. Jimson, the clerk at the desk, told my wife that THE Hotel was sold out and other rooms were not available. Upon hearing this, after I was able to stuff my eyeballs back into their sockets, I leaned over and read his name tag and said, "are you sure about that Jimson?" Jimson replied that actually there might be a room available later, but because we were checking in at 1:00pm, mountain view was all that was available. My wife explained that we could wait for a strip view room if that was necessary. Jimson picked up the phone and talked to someone, and then told us there was a strip view room available. (Remember my wife had spent thousands of dollars already!) He gave us the key and when we got to the room, it was a view of the airport and if you leaned over really far and stood in the corner of the room, you could actually see Luxor Pyramid. (Remember my wife had already spent thousands of dollars for our four nigh stay!) Before we arrived, I pulled up THE Hotel's website to see what the room rate was and was surprised to see it was about $70 for Weds, $80 for Thrs., $120 for Fri, and $290 for Sat. We paid $200 a night, months in advance, because of the conference. My wife called the front desk from the room and asked to speak to Jimson's manager and explained that she had made a simple request, and was lied to by the desk clerk (hotel was sold out). The manager was Tess, and Tess assured us that THE Hotel was sold out for Thursday (even though the rate on THE Hotel's website offered rooms for Thrs. at a whopping $80). Tess said if we were willing to wait, she would get us a room with a strip view. We tried not to laugh too hard at this point and my wife pointed out that we already told the front desk we would wait. Tess told us she would call us back, but never did. At 3:00pm, we went back to the front desk. The front desk clerk had no idea what we were talking about, but was able to check us into a room with at strip view. We went to the pool and had two drinks at $14 per drink....... I'm tired now......but will finish this later.

Reviews.Title: “We hit one of their "off" days..”
Reviews.Author: Sillymeow
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at THEhotel several times and always enjoyed it. Unfortunately, this last time we hit one of their bad days where they had overbooked and therefore did not have the rooms available that we paid for and we ended up in a customer service nightmare. The staff helping us did not understand that this was our much needed time off and we just needed them to make it right. We had to speak to several managers before the situation was resolved. It took 24 hours to fix the problem, and after that everything was fantastic, but it was so awful to deal with I dont know if I will stay here again. Their lower level managers need some training.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed and overcharged”
Reviews.Author: whitt1travels
Reviews.Content: We came to Las Vegas on business and expected to stay at the Mandalay Bay, but upon arrival found that we were actually at THEhotel. We arrived late, and upon checking in found that the non-smoking room we had requested was not available. (Sorry about your luck.) you know, if they are going to charge you $200+ per night, you should get what you requested. They told us they would ozonate the room, but sprayed room deodorizer around instead. The hair dryer was broken, tissue box empty.... I could go on, but won't. Let's just say that the next time we have to come to Vegas we'll stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Stress free check in!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2324
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here at THE Hotel a few times and I've loved it everytime! But I must mention something very important that stood out to me this time. The check in is so stress free! A nice small relaxing lobby, and a cool lobby bar for everyone to hang at before, during, and after checkin. There is a little coffee shop, a cafe for breakfast and a lobby store, so all your necessities are nearby. And then a short walk away is the Sports book at Mandalay Bay, and then the main casino. Also there aren't as many rooms as large casinos so the hallways don't go on forever and the elevators are relatively fast! After checking in recently at the MGM, I REALLY appreciated this super nice unstressful check in at THE Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best of Vegas -- a luxurious getaway that's still totally Vegas”
Reviews.Author: traveling-bookgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoy visiting Vegas, but our strategy is to find a place that allows us to enter the "Vegas scene" when we choose, and provides relief from crowds, noise, cigarette smoke, gaudiness, etc. THEHotel is perfect for this, and it's hidden inside of Mandalay Bay.
