Luxurious and tranquil, we find the hotel both sleek, as well as rich and warm. Their lobby is smoke-free (a rarity in Vegas; in fact they even pump scented air *into* the lobby). The rooms are almost all suites and the bathrooms are to die for. And... Our first time there, after about 40 minutes in the room, we discovered a second bathroom and a third TV! Additionally, it has many fewer rooms than other hotels so it feels more intimate and is definitely quiet. Downstairs, you've got your own bar, lounge, restaurant, and coffee area to save you from the lines elsewhere. They have great lobby art and pretty darn good sales (don't pay more than $250 per night, and look for sub-$200 rates!). Finally, at the top of THEHotel, THEMix provides awesome views of the entire strip! We also really like its location at the very south end of the strip -- it's far quieter and less crowded than places like New York New York and MGM, and there is an excellent range of good and affordable places to eat, whereas we find other hotels to have either lots of bad-smelling fast food or too many exclusive luxury restaurants we can only walk by and sigh. There is a tasteful and uncrowded mall attached to it that is lit with natural light, and provides more pleasant spaces for walking and eating (try the great burget bar). The Luxor is a nice neighbor casino to walk through and prepare before you hit the insanity of Excalibur and beyond... For us, THEHotel is the best of Vegas -- it's glamorous but private, it's close to excitement but not in the thick, it retains normalcy but you've still got all the vices in reach. :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: cjuOhio
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to see this ranked so low but I assume it's because it's not exactly a value. We stayed here in July of 2010 and are going again in July of 2011. In the past we had always stayed at Mandalay Bay and loved it so we thought we would upgrade to THEhotel. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept it. Very luxurious appointments. Bathroom is huge. I just can't say enough about how much we enjoyed our stay there are are looking forward to our next stay. Also, if you are looking to save some money, we booked a flight and hotel package and it was very affordable for what you get. Unlike a lot of people, this is a once a year trip for my husband and myself and we don't worry about money for that one week. I don't find cheap hotels or buffets. Nothing wrong with that if tthat's what you are looking for. I have kids and look forward to my 5 days of just being a couple each year. I enjoy the whole experience. The spa is nice and the pool area is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay except for the odor of smoke”
Reviews.Author: theotherkatie
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant stay at THEhotel, and I would definitely consider staying there again. We stayed in one of THE Suites. The suite was enormous. It had a separate living room and 1.5 bathrooms. The master bathroom had double sinks and a very deep tub. The bed was very, very comfortable. Guests at THEhotel have access to the Mandalay Bay pool facilities. The wave pool and lazy river were a lot of fun and the perfect way to cool off after walking the Strip in the summer heat. Definitely check out the Mix Lounge on the 64th floor while you're there. It has great views of the Strip and tasty drinks. The only thing I didn't like is that our non-smoking room frequently had a heavy odor of smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Ho Hum”
Reviews.Author: lyssak11
Reviews.Content: The Hotel at Mandalay Bay was okay. For the price I would have expected better treatment from hotel staff. The room was very nice, and the beach is awesome. But, plan on walking a lot because this is a very big property and you have to walk quite far to get anywhere. If you stay here, plan on bringing some $. $14.00 for a small pina colada at the pool, and about $18 per person for even the breakfast buffet. I signed up for their players club card and trying to find out what benefits you get from that was like pulling teeth. On the next to last day of our 6 day trip we found out you can use your points to comp meals, room charges etc. Room service is the exact same food served on the buffet so... spend more for less for sure if you order room service! Also, while parked in the valet my brand new car was hit and it has been over 2 weeks and I still haven't heard from the loss prevention people who will be fixing it.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back again and the kids loved the pool”
Reviews.Author: thelegoman
Reviews.Content: Stayed there just for one day on the 21st floor - room was roomy and clean. I like that the registration area is away from the main casino / betting tables, so the traffic is much less. However, I don't like the pool to be so far away and you do have to walk pass the slot machines and many shops to get there. We were lost the first time getting to the pool even holding the map with us. And I agreed with other reviewers that the pool is crowded, but then what do you expect, it is famous for its "wave" pool! We saw people bringing their own tubes for the lazy pool and the staffs didn't disallow it. When we were there last week and the pool hours are 8 am to 7 pm. We went down to the pool the next morning at 8:10 am and found plenty of chairs available by the pool. So you really have to plan your visit to the pool accordingly. Overall, we like the place and will definitely go back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Souzaac
Reviews.Content: That hotel is great! Until today I smell its parfum. It´s a modern furniture. The room I stayed was huge, with a living and a room separated. There´s a big fancy bathroom and a litle one with a lot of amenities. Two flat panel TV bigger than 42´. Inside the resort, there are a lot of restaurants, swimming pool, a casino. When I back to Vegas, I´ll stay there again. I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Thehotel is Whathotel”
Reviews.Author: mhkmarie
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nights and witnessed what's been written. 1. a loose bathrobe belt on the wet bar counter. 2. only one robe in the closet. 3. instead of 2 sets of slippers, only one pair and a loose wrap in the closet. 4. went to vip services to inform situation and told not to worry instead of being offered to investigate and rectify the situation. the room otherwise seemd in order so i decided to enjoy the trip instead. not a major problem but left not so good taste in my mouth. usually they're very polite and willing but this man was not. at the least he assured me there will not be charges to my account on missing robe but i'll wait and see. mandalay bay has better personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: daphnebubbles
Reviews.Content: It's the second time I've stayed at this hotel and while the rooms are spacious and clean and the housekeeping very good, what has consistently let it down, for me anyway, is the reception staff. It's difficult for such a huge hotel, with so many things going on, to really connect with it's customers. I appreciate that. But the reception staff are indifferent almost to the point of being, well, European. In fact, I've had warmer responses to enquiries in French hotels. Zut alors! While other staff throughout the hotel are friendly and helpful, reception could do with a boot up the backside. As the first and last impression of the hotel, they let the side down somewhat...

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Vacation - 2011”
Reviews.Author: Wokameter
Reviews.Content: After spending a week at THEhotel in 2010 with success, we decided to see if it would work again in 2011. I can say that it was just as good in 2011 as it was in 2010. For those who complain about the pool and other areas not being family friendly, it is clear that they would prefer to find paradise on a remote island. Yes, there are a lot of people at the wave pool and it can be a challenge to find a place to sit, but if you plan accordingly, you can have a great time with you and your children (show-up early, use one lunge chair instead if 4+, rent a cabana, etc.). Also, the service is 2nd to none -- need a blanket, roll away bed, sink draining slow....all can be taken care of with a quick phone call. You will also notice that after a day of sight seeing or and evening of gambling, it is nice to head back to THEhotel where it is very quiet and peaceful. THEhotel has its own lounge with pool tables, cafe and breakfast area as well as a store with anything you could need. It is more convenient than fighting the crowds at Manadaly Bay. Key tips -- use the tram from Manadaly Bay to Excalibur when working your way up the strip to MGM/Ny-NY or beyond. There is also a tram from the Mirage/Aria to Bellagio. Tip #2 -- make reservations for the restaurants at Mandalay Bay/THEhotel/Shops at Manadalay Place or any other destination -- this eliminates the 1-2 hour wait on a weekend or when a convention is in town. We have children that are 10yrs or less in age and when asked whether they want to go to Disney or Vegas, it is Vegas. THEhotel and its convenience makes all of the difference. I would recommend THEhotel over any hotel that we have been to along the strip. If you have kids, it is a must. If you don't, give it a try and see what you think.

Reviews.Title: “Such a beautiful property, inside and out!”
Reviews.Author: DFied
Reviews.Content: We booked four suites at TheHotel for my husband and I, and our two children and their families. The entire Mandalay Resort Property is really lovely. TheHotel suites, in particular, are extremely spacious, beautifully decorated and immaculate. Every staff member we encountered was extremely friendly and professional. Everyone seemed very sincere and truly did their best to insure we had an enjoyable stay. Would we stay there again, in a heartbeat. This being said, there are a couple of issues I would like to see addressed. First, when I made the reservation I specifically asked the reservationist if the hotel had pack-n-plays or cribs for babies to sleep in. She said they had cribs and confirmed one for our infant granddaughter. When we got to our room a pack-n-play was delivered. We were informed that they only use these and do not have cribs. Yet, even in the guest room amenities book, it reads cribs, not pack-n-plays are available. Secondly, like many of the hotels are doing nowadays, a daily resort fee ($20) was added to our hotel bill. I object to this because it covers many of the things that were complimentary in the past, i.e. local and 800 # phone calls, WIFI, newspaper, entrance to fitness center. Two complimentary drinks per room, per STAY, were also included. This fee is tacky and gives one the impression of "nickle and diming" the guest. If the hotel feels the need to charge $20 to cover the exoense for these services, they should just include it in the room rate and not show it as a resort fee. Lastly, each suite comes with a lovely coffee maker, including premium coffee packets and an assortment of teas. However, this is not complimentary. To charge me $4 for the convenience of brewing myself a cup of coffee seems a bit steep!! I've read some negative reviews about the lack of beach chaises and the $20 purchase charge for the swim tubes to use in the Lazy River. Yes, even though our stay was during the week, we had to go down early to find a few chaises together. As far as the tubes, some people had their own personal tubes and there didn't seem to be any objection from the staff. They just had to be the same size or smaller as the resorts. Overall, we had the BEST time and our five day stay went by much too quickly. TheHotel is an exquisite property and I'd like to extend kudo's to the Management and their wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Solid all the way around”
Reviews.Author: BDH1919
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, great service and AMAZING ROOMS but to be fair we did have the Penthouse Suite on the 62nd floor so my review will be a tad biased. Quick and speedy check in through the VIP reception area. The room was absolutely insane, I couldn’t even begin to explain; 3 huge bathrooms, 2 huge master bedrooms, 2 extremely large living rooms, full bar area and nice office work space. Breakfast was fair at best, honestly wasn’t a fan, but lunch at the pool was great and so was the always solid Burger Bar and Strip Steak located in Mandalay Bay. Having been to Vegas 20 to 30 times and having stayed at most major hotels I would put The Hotel definitely in the top 3.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm in the middle of it all!”
Reviews.Author: FontanaBananas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at THEhotel while he was on business and I got to tag along for the fun of it. As part of the Mandalay Bay complex, THEhotel has all the benefits of the pools, casino, and shopping, but without the noise and bustle. We found the staff to be very efficient and accomodating at all times. The suite room was spacious and well-appointed, and very quiet. We didn't mind the resort fee as my main intention was to take advantage of the pool area for relaxation, which is possible to find if you sit by one of the lagoon pools instead of the wave pool or the lazy river, which tend to be over-run with families and children. Just make sure you bring a cover-up for your swimsuit, as you have to walk through the casino and convention center areas to get from THEhotel to the pool! If you do intend to use the lazy river, be warned that you have to buy or rent the floatie -- or bring your own (floaties are included in the cabana rentals, but that's an expensive way to get a free floatie). Wish we'd gotten to stay more than one night, but we would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: TN Diva
Reviews.Content: The one bedroom suites are spacious and provide that additional space when staying at the hotel. We found the housekeeping to be terrific. You have a separate living area and separate bedroom to allow you to spread out and feel at home. The bath is huge with a double vanity, glassed in separate shower and large garden tub. It's great to have the TV in the bath to catch up with the news in the morning when getting ready. It's nice to have a separate hotel away from the casino and all the traffic. Great facility and wonderful service!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: bubbadad12
Reviews.Content: The room was tremendous. The amenities were wonderful. The only problem I had with this hotel was my visit to one of its restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MarkBStAlbans
Reviews.Content: Almost at the top end of the Strip. Great rooms - really large, spacious and clean. the room had large sitting area with seating, desk, fridge, large TV, massive bedroom and bathroom. Very comfortable and spacious. rest of hotel is great and the staff are really helpful. Many of the items they say are charged are in fact free, e.g. coffee in room. Location is great as almost everything is in one direction. Bus stops right outside so you will always get a space and a great solution for going down the strip or downtown. Highly recommend the hotel. Oh and try the buffet one day - great value and incredible choices!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: James62364
Reviews.Content: THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay is great.... The only issue or recommendation would be DO NOT eat at RM Seafood...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - this place has gone down hill”
Reviews.Author: sirius69
Reviews.Content: Every time we go to Vegas we stay in theHotel, and previously I was pleased to tell everyone about this great little hidden gem, with its wonderful dark ambience and excellent staff. But all good things come to an end, and alas it seems theHotel has gone down hill big time.

Reviews.Title: “totally amazing”
Reviews.Author: lindy1958
Reviews.Content: what an amazing vacation.the staff was great. the restaurants were out of this world. the pool areas were definitely a notch above other hotels on the strip.our room was cleaned to perfection every day, and i won big at the casino.who could ask for more.oops almost forgot, the lion king was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ltaylor413
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at THEHotel three times in the last two years and have not once been disappointed. The staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are spacious and well equipped, the food options are great, and the spa is one of the best I've been to. Generally prices are more than reasonable. I cannot comment on the pool as we only walked through the area, but it seems fun although extremely crowded. Highlights: 1. For me, the location is fantastic because it is at the end of the strip and therefore the hotel is not heavily trafficked the way the middle hotels are. It is quieter and tends to cater to a more relaxed crowd as opposed to the bachelor party scene. Parking is directly next the THEHotel entrance so very convenient. 2. Mix Lounge gives free access to THEHotel guests and it is a spectacular rooftop bar/lounge. We did not eat at the restaurant, but the view from the bar area is unmatched. 3. The casino at Mandalay Bay is clean and nice, and the restaurants along the way to the Luxor are fun and not expensive choices for lunch. The Burger Bar is especially good. For dinner, China Grill, Lupo, and Border Grill are all excellent choices. 4. THEHotel rooms are all suites, very spacious, and the bathrooms are huge. Flat screens in both the bedroom and living room. Cleaning staff did a perfect job, and did not service the room too early or late. 5. The spa is gorgeous, clean, relaxing, and not at all crowded. I had one of the best massages ever with Elizabeth. Obviously at all hotels some people can have great stays and some can have terrible stays. But having stayed here as frequently as I do, I've found that I've always had a consistently good experience here, no issues. I've stayed at four other places in Vegas but as long as THEHotel and Mandalay Bay retain their level of service and the quality of their property I will only stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good!!”
Reviews.Author: Daylove
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my recent stay at TheHotel. Room was clean and spacious with a comfortable bed. The hotel is quiet and in a good location with plenty of restaurants on premises. Check in was fast and personnel was nice.

Reviews.Title: “one of the more quieter hotels in vegas”
Reviews.Author: g10betr0tter
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a THEsuite at THEhotel at Mandalay Bay in april 2011. It is one of the more quieter hotels that I have been in. NOTE, there THEhotel has separate check in from Mandalay Bay. Have to say, it isn't as new as some of the other hotels in vegas. The room definitely worn out. Don't be fooled by the pictures in the website. However, it was large, clean and mostly comfortable. The room didn't really have anything special that stood out, especially the view of the highway outside our window. THEhotel at Mandalay Bay seems to be suited for business travelers or families who make use of the pool area. Would probably stay at a hotel closer to the middle of the strip

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: tpow7674
Reviews.Content: We stayed at THE hotel for 6 nights on 22nd May 2011. We can honestly say we loved every minute of it. THE hotel is an oasis of tranquility from the crowds of Vegas. Our suite was immaculate and very clean. It had everything you could need. Any time we requested anything it was sorted very quickly. What I loved about this hotel was that once in your suite you are more or less oblivious to the partying carrying on out side. The location is not a problem although we found we gave in a few times and had to get a taxi from up strip back to the hotel. The free tram to Excalibur and luxor is handy. The pool at Mandalay Bay is stunning although we did find that the lifeguards are a bit over zealous and you are allowed to practically do nothing in the main wave pool without someone wistling at you to stop it! The kids pool is great as is the lazy river. We didnt have any trouble getting a lounger as mostly we were at the pool by 12. The Manadalay Bay buffet is great value and of good quality. Loved House of Blues also for dinner and breakfast. We were suprised at how child freindly Vegas was in general but in particular The Hotel and Mandalay Bay. In short this is a quality hotel and the lay out of the suites makes it ideal for families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and an amazing strip view!”
Reviews.Author: Petey032
Reviews.Content: We stayed at THE Hotel fir three nights and had the time if our lives! Clean and nicely decorated rooms. Stayed on the 32 floor which offered an amazing view of the strip especially at night! Would stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at end of Strip”
Reviews.Author: GCtraveller
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 6 nights at theHotel at Mandalay Bay. We have never been to Vegas before and this hotel made everything perfect for us. Yes, its a long way from the middle, but honestly we never had any problems with that at all. Our feet were a bit sore at the end of the stay but we wanted to look at everything. The hotel has a tram service which connects 3 casinos and from there it is an easy walk to NYNY and then cross the road to the MGM Grand where you can catch the monorail down the rest of the strip, so the distance isn't really a problem. It was actually quite nice to return to theHotel for a bit of peace and quiet. As for the room it was very nice. We had a bit of a problem when we arrived as our travel agent in Australia cancelled our booking for some strange reason so theHotel had no room for us. After a lot of complaining and showing them we actually had paid in full and had the voucher with us they found us a room, even though they said they were full. However, we were put on the 5th floor with a view of the carpark and an air-conditioning unit. The room was clean, very comfortable and had a lovely bathroom with a really deep bath. We were able to change rooms once our travel agent contacted theHotel on Monday, although after seeing our new room on the 38th floor we decided to stay with the 5th floor one (strange move I know!). Our reason being was that the 5th floor one was actually a lot bigger and it was a lot quieter. The 38th floor one was under the Mix nightclub which was really loud. We ordered room service and found this to be very tasty and was delivered really fast. The only negative we had was with the belldesk. When we checked out we asked them to hold our luggage. I told them that one of our suitcases had a very fragile item in it that I had purchased in Disneyland for my daughter in Australia. I made it so clear to them that they needed to lie the bag down flat. Within 10 minutes of them having the bags I realised that I had left something in this bag so went back to get it and the item was broken. They must have simply thrown the bags down. I was so upset with them that I screamed at them (probably a bit over the top but I can't go back to Disneyland to get another one). The manager of the front services was very good about it. He was most apologetic but of course it doesn't replace the article. They did credit us the resort fee. If you stay here, make sure you get your VIP tickets to the Mix nightclub on the top floor. The view is absolutely amazing. Just a quick note on the swimming pool. While it is very nice it was impossible to get a seat even at 9 in the morning. Apparently people line up at 8 to get a seat. We ended up having to hire 2 seats which cost $75 per seat plus another $75 for an umbrella. Overall if we return to Vegas we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel suites, away from the madness of the strip”
Reviews.Author: MartinoReynaldo
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel. Excellent rooms which are stylishly designed, relatively spacious with amazing bathrooms. The hotel is part of the wider Mandalay bay complex, and although it feels very different (no casino, higher standards etc) you do inevitably end up in the main complex if you want to eat/swim/gamble etc. The pool is pretty awful, with everyone cramped like sardines. Nevertheless, compared to all the hotels we checked out as part of our stay, we were really happy with our choice - and looked forward to returning there each night after witnessing the queues and crowds at other hotels. It feels like a kind of smart European boutique hotel - and although not located in the heart of the action, this for us was one of its main advantages.

Reviews.Title: “Far and away the best hotel at the south end of the stip.”
Reviews.Author: Tutshi
Reviews.Content: All right, I confess I haven't stayed in any others so I cannot honestly stay that their rooms are as good or even better, but I have walked through every one of them from the MGM south and none can hold a candle to The Hotel at Mandalay Bay. Not the resort and spa but the other part across the vast acres of slots and poker and roulette tables just past the entry to The Lion King there is a darker hallway and a rather luxe entry to THEhotel. Our room was on the 16th floor (those below the 8th or so do not have a view) with a king size bed, large and grand bathroom (the shower drain was a tad slow) and a separate sitting area with sofa, chairs, a desk and a powder room. In all, about 725 square feet with floor to ceiling windows looking north to the strip. Bed very comfortable, room service quick to respond to extra pillows, very friendly staff and efficient check out. Clean beyond every expectation and all for $100 a night plus pool charge of $20 and tax. We are definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “If you have to be in Vegas--this may give you some calm”
Reviews.Author: clarenicole
Reviews.Content: I head to Vegas twice a year for the Magic tradeshow....no, not magical wands, clothing...but thats besides the point. I have been attending this show for years. I attend a show at the Mandalay place Expo. I require a hotel that is close...walking. THE Hotel is right there. it is the easiest walk EVER. ALSO--I require some sense of calm. I hate casinos. I hate that I always have to walk thru them. But i LOVE that when I walk into THEhotel there is NO casino. Instead it is calm, clean, sophisticated. The cafe there has some decent salads and breakfast. If you have a tradeshow take the extra 30 min in the morning to sit at the cafe, have a breakfast and some coffee. breathe in before you head into the madness. The rooms are fine. They are clean, comfy and have a good bathroom. I always love a tv in the bathroom so i can take a hot bath and watch law and order. best way to chill out. Bath products are good too! so no need to pack extra toiletries. It is nice to have a mini oasis so close to the madness of a tradeshow.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at The Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bookitqueen
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at The Hotel. It was a nice change from the Mandalay Bay. Loved the layout of the suite. We had more than enough space. The room was clean and very relaxing. Especially loved the deep tub. My only complaint was the excessive resort fee that is charged each day, but we were aware of this going in. We really enjoyed the wave pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: Oddlykeen
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at THEhotel to be away from the mad crowds of Vegas. Its beautifully designed and the rooms are well appointed. HOWEVER the service is APPALLING. There are just not enough staff to cope. The recession has obviously cut a swathe through vegas hotels and staffing has been axed heavily at THEhotel. Check in took well over 30mins and the staff were surly and disinterested. On one of our days the room wasn't made up and staff are nowhere to be seen when you want them. If you want luxury in Vegas, there are far better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The place to be!!”
Reviews.Author: TabarakRazvi
Reviews.Content: We were so happy with selecting Mandalay Bay for our second honey moon. Great suite, facilities, casino and location. And excellent value for money. What an awesome experience.

Reviews.Title: “sheets not changed”
Reviews.Author: sammy0608
Reviews.Content: this is the 2nd time we have stayed here first time it was dusty and drity they changed us to another room and so was that one after the third time are room was ok not great for what they charged way over priced and the 2nd time we stayed when we pulled down bedding to go to sleep the sheets were so drity they had not been changed it took them over 1 hour to bring us clean sheets i would stay at golden nugget or plant hollywood much cleaner rooms and better prices

Reviews.Title: “Greediness had overtaken the Mandalay Bay properties”
Reviews.Author: mboag
Reviews.Content: I have wanted to stay at THE Hotel for a long time. We've previously stayed at Mandalay and the Four Seasons (all 3 properties are linked) and I thought that the rooms at THE Hotel seemed sophisticated and spacious and I also thought that having that separate oasis would allow for better service and less crowds. And the good news is that the rooms are really quite nice for Vegas. That's all the good news I have. Room service delivery took almost an hour at 8 a.m. in the morning and we waited an hour for extra towels. But the real slam to customers is the pool. This year they have 'sold out' so much of the pool that - unless you arrive at 9 a.m. when it opens on a Saturday morning, you cannot get a seat. They have private 'beaches' sectioned off, a 'topless' area for which they charge admission, they sell admission to the pool area for people not staying there, there are dozens of cabanas for sale and now - NEW - because apparently that wasn't quite enough revenue, they have roped off sections where the lowly normal guests used to get beach chairs - they threw red pads on the chairs - and now charge $100 per chair. That's on top of $15 drinks and $25 inner tubes that you purchase to float on the lazy river. It's such poor customer service - such insulting greediness - that I won't return to this property and will not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay, happy with our choice to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: getmarshall
Reviews.Content: Booked THE Hotel with frequent flyer miles so I was hoping for a really nice stay. The checkin was confusing as I was told that I can check in at the Mandalay Bay. They checked me into their hotel into a suite. So note if staying at THE Hotel, don't go over to Mandalay Bay. Very happy with our 1BD suite. Bathroom was very spacious, beds were comfy. Room was very quiet, no noise. Really enjoyed being south on the strip, we were away from the craziness of the crowds and such at Bellagio and Wynn. Pool area was very nice, but very busy by the wave pool. The lagoon pool was much quieter. Loved the shops and restaurants in the Mandalay complex. Overall it was a great stay and would definitely stay at THE Hotel again. Wasn't excited about the resort fee, but it did come with 2 free drinks and free WIFI, so at least something was received for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kellyl78
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at MB several times and really enjoyed it. This trip however was not the same. The hotel staff was over the top rude and unhelpful. I requested a late check out which I recieved but after 11am my key stopped working. I went to the front desk to get my key reset and found about 20 people in line and only 2 employees. After waiting the employee told me he would charge me for checking out late because he had no record of a late check out. The 2 men in front of me were locked out of their rooms too and this employee was so rude it was shocking. Appearntly one of the men was famous and once the employee figured it out he apologized. At one point all elevators quit working and the elvevator lobby was full of people. I asked 4 people where the stairs were and no one knew. I finally found a bell man who said no stairs can be accessed from the lobby. Really? The staff at Morea was rude too. The service is so slow at the Mix and the worst was the staff at the restaurants during late night. One of the bartenders in the casino actually made fun of my friend for ordering a Miller Lite. No in room coffee, you have to pay $4 for a k-cup. The maid service did not take out the trash. Too many other options in vegas. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “WON'T DO THAT AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: lettinyaknow
Reviews.Content: What I thought was going to be a posh room for a business stay was not ! When making a reservation keep in mind that ( news to me at the time ) these are considered only request. Even though you pay at time of reservation for a specific room that may not be what you get. I booked this 4 months in advance. The first room we were in had not even been cleaned ( even after waiting 2 hrs for it to be ). Second room was better until we found a wet stain on the blanket and there was enough dust in the bathroom that you could actually write in it . Gross !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Facility and Service”
Reviews.Author: jjpadget
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the week for celebratory trip. Very accommodating, facility well kept, peaceful, rooms quiet and roomy. Beds were blissfully comfortable. All request met quickly for extra pillows, etc. Other guests requested a refrigerator and it was supplied. Used spa and it was very nice - service and facility. THEcafe had excellent breakfast and great service. Would gladly go again and recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Strip hotel on the strip but away from the bustle”
Reviews.Author: norcalnick
Reviews.Content: I've always wondered what it was like to stay at THEhotel. I've stayed at the Mandalay Bay and that was pretty nice but the better half said that THEhotel is way awesome and after our most recent stay, I'll have to agree. During our last adventure to Vegas, I made reservations to stay here. I like how the hotel is secluded, not in terms of it's proximitiy on the Strip, but the location of the front desk and elevators. It's like, if you're walking through there, you're a hotel guest otherwise, you're really lost. When checking in, there was a long line, but every Vegas hotel has a line, so that was expected. When I got to the desk, this handsome but cocky gentleman in his early 20's checked me in. You can tell that he and the other desk agents check in hundreds of people a day so, you're pretty much dealing with a person immune to any personality that conveys the most minimal amount of genuine hospitality. You're a number, not a guest, which is too bad with a hotel distinguished with a AAA Four-Diamond rating. The elevator bank had 6-7 elevators but the cabs were quite small, thankfully they don't stop at every floor otherwise we were screwed. When we got to the room, I mean, "THEsuite," it was exactly how it looked like online. A living room area w/a wet bar and half bath; a bedroom and a bathroom with a stand-in shower, soaking tub, dual vanity and a private toilet. THEsuite wasn't elegant like the Venetian or plush as the Wynn but it was more trendy, if anything. Now I can see why the better half liked it, the decor were dark woods and clean lines. The bed was quite comfortable and the bath amenities were awesome. I didn't like however when our room was serviced, they replaced all our bath amenities which were barely used, with brand new ones. IMO, that was quite wasteful. Speaking of which, during our stay, we were in our room around 12pm when a housekeeping representative called to see if we wanted our room serviced, because we had the Do Not Disturb sign illuminated. I asked her what was the latest and she said the housekeepers go home at 4pm. What? For such a large hotel, you won't have one or two housekeepers on duty beyond that time? Really now? Beyond the little quirks in service I encountered, they're quite easily to overlook and yes, I can honestly say that I'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I would think twice before staying here. We got the scare of our lives!!”
Reviews.Author: Travlingal40
Reviews.Content: First impression was the ridiculous wait-line to register with a huge counter, and only two staff at a so call 4 +star hotel to check guests in was not a great impression. My reservation I had mad 10 days prior was not ready, despite their 3pm check in, and my 6pm reservation arrival request, and the fact it was well after 7pm and STILL NO ROOM ready for us. They offered to "store our luggage"and provide a free drink in their lounge(by the way parent's pop is over $4 each for the children), if we wouldn't mind waiting "20 minutes". We came back 30 mins, still not ready. it is almost 8:30 pm now. We were given a meal drink voucher for $100 to spend in the hotel, but keep in mind, it is concerning us now. We come back a third time, close to 10pm, and the room is ready. Room is nice, no complaints, except for the fact there is nothing included. The coffee is $8 dollars a cup if you use the in house coffee maker. Ridiculous for a near $300/night room. Internet is an extra charge. Local phone calls included. Had to contact front desk to get maintenance to tape the air vents closed, as they kept opening through the night, and waking me up. Then came the Scare of our lives....9:03 AM-someone walks into our locked room! It turned out it was housekeeping, feeling they could just come right in! That was it! I called the front desk, asked for the manager, and let her have a piece of my mind. The manager admitted it was "unacceptable", and again offered us more complimentary services to compensate for our scare. We absolutely took the offer, but I would never, ever book with this hotel again. The last note: I booked with this hotel for the pool amenities. The pool was so crowded even on weekdays, that one could not even get a lounger. To ride the "River"you had to PURCHASE a $23 dollar inner tube, or provide your own "upon approval". To rent a cabana was $275.00. drinks are $7-$15. Pool hours are so limited, closing at 7pm at night. Very far off the strip also, right at the very, very beginning, so be prepared to walk, walk, walk!

Reviews.Title: “Suite deal”
Reviews.Author: DrJonz
Reviews.Content: Walked into Mandalay Bay and told I was upgraded to THEhotel. They took my bags over for me. Posh suite. Very quiet as I was on the top floor at the end of the hall. Well maintained, but one bed was saggy so I just slept in the other. The staff is well trained and very professional and accommodating. I think their professionalism pushed the experience to the next level.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ZaiZaiLv
Reviews.Content: Let me just start out by saying that I'm a HUGE Steve Wynn girl, so I may be a bit biasedl We normally stay at the Wynn or Encore with exception of a couple stays in Bellagio, which were both disaster both times (refer to my past reviews of Bellagio). This time we decided on THEhotel because the Mr. heard good things about the beach/pool area and since it's his Bday, I let him do the picking. THEstaff: everyone was very friendly and generally very helpful. After battling a 7 hour traffic from OC to Vegas, we were pooped by the time we checked in. The nice lady upgraded us without my request. Very nice and thoughtful. Off we went. THEsuiteS (yes, two): First suite: HUGE was our first impression. Nice view from the room. Separate living room and bedroom. 1.5 bathroom. I didn't even realize the door on the hallway was a bathroom till the second night. I thought it was a closet. Planned on stashing my shopping haul in there, but obviously that wouldn't work. I have nothing bad to say about this room. You wonder why we moved? Well, the club on 60th floor was a killer!!!! We're in the higher floor and we could hear the music loud and clear as if it's coming from our room. First night, I was pooped, so I didn't hear it at all, but the Mr did. Second night, it kept both of us up all night long. When we called downstairs to find out what time the club normally closed, before we even said anything, THEstaff said, "the music is too loud?" Looks like this is a known-fact. He suggested we moved to a different tower and lower floor the next day. Second Suite: The move was smooth. By noon, they already had an open room available, so we're already in there by 12:30. We moved from one elevator to another. Bumped into another person who was doing the same thing. The first thing I noticed, even though the room looked identical, they really weren't. This one was definitely smaller. Not a lot smaller, but unless you're obsessive compulsive like I am, you probably won't notice. What they offer at the mini bar area also differed slightly... no $8 cup of coffee in this room (not that I was planning on paying for that). Honestly, I wouldn't pay extra to upgrade to the first room since this room is just as nice. No club music at night, so yay! Good night sleep finally. So the moral of the story is, yes, higher floor = nicer view. But it also means, you stay up all night listening to Black Eyed Peas boomboompowing. If that's what you go to Vegas for, by all means, but that's not what I go to Vegas for, so this is a big deal for me. Remember to ask for lower floor tower if you want to sleep. Minor comment on housekeeping: dust bunnies! gross! Thank God for slippers they provide you in the room. I wouldn't want to walk around barefoot. THEcafe: $5 for white chocolate mocha. Pretty good actually. Beats the $3 for the crappy Kcup in the room. THEbeach/pool: They open at 9AM. We got there at 8:56AM and the line wrapped around. By 9:20, all the chairs are gone. Overall, it was a pleasant stay, but most likely we will go back to Wynn/Encore next time. This place is crawling with children, most likely because of the pool.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: JulesInLa
Reviews.Content: We had a great promotional price which included an all-day buffet pass at Mandalay Bay. Let me break it down: Room: This is considered a boutique hotel and kind of has a feel of a nicely furnished apartment. I say this because you have a separate living room area, a separate bedroom, and 1.5 baths. When you have family or other folks visiting your room, this is a HUGE convenience. There is a tv in the living room. There is a tv in the bedroom. And there is a little tv in the main bathroom. Overall it's a big hotel room. Bed: They are comfy, but nothing spectacular. I had no problems sleeping as this hotel is nice and quiet. Bathrooms: As mentioned, there is 1 and a half bathrooms here. This is so awesome if you're not staying here alone. Great amenities from Gilchrist & Soames: facial bar, bath soap, shampoo, conditioner, body balm, sewing kit, shoe polish, shower cap, bath crystals, but no shower gel. Still a lot though. Main bathroom has plenty of counter and compartment space, sunken tub, shower (which has a lot of water pressure, so thankfully the drain worked fine), and separate room for the toilet. I just wished they had a small vanity chair. The half bathroom by the room entrance is great too. Service: It's kind of hit or miss here. Some of the staff were nice, and some, well maybe they had a bad day. Overall, the service at the buffet was eh, housekeeping staff is nice, the front desk staff is nice too. Location: Well, it's at the south end of the Strip, so you're not in the middle of the action. You have a bridge to take you to the Luxor, and a monorail to Excalibur. You kind of have everything you need here though. Pool: Holy cow, this place is always packed. There is a line that starts before 9am to get in. I got there at 10:45am, and I was extremely lucky to snag one chair. It's ridiculously busy. This is family friendly with a wave pool, a beach w/ actual sand, lazy river, and other secluded lagoon pools. Overall: It's a really nice hotel. If you don't mind staying at the end of the Strip and like to get a restful sleep, this is a great place to check out, especially if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great suites, awesome hotel staff, huge crowded pools, at the far end of The Strip”
Reviews.Author: puddlejump
Reviews.Content: Got The Suite, which has 2 bathrooms, 1 large bedroom, and spacious living room. Very clean hotel, good house keeping staff. View out of the windows was okay, looking out towards the airport and Luxor. The staff were fantastic, bellhops, concierge, front desk. Sleep quality was fantastic, very quiet at night up in the rooms. Wireless internet in the hotel tower was terribly weak the entire stay. Bar staff, and the hosts at Mix Lounge had a bit too much attitude. Casino action on the card tables was so-so both here and at the Luxor, however, speaking with 3 different Mandalay Bay pit bosses during my trip, all of them were extremely accommodating to game play requests at the tables, any time of day. So the pit bosses here and at many of the other casinos were great, since we were playing. The only major drawbacks to me were the location of the hotel at the very end of The Strip and the swarms of people in the pool area. We took the monorail to Excalibur, then walked to MGM Grand to catch another monorail. Of course walking and taxis are there as well depending on how tired you are and how far you are going. I was really excited to stay at Mandalay Bay for its famous swimming pools and beach area, however my enthusiasm was damped upon my first visit, as the entire pool area was packed with families and young people drinking lots of alcohol in the sun; it was like a really crowded water park that had been shrunk down in size. The Shark Reef Aquarium was enjoyable, not very large, but you can spend about 30 minutes or more in there, they have a wide array of creatures to admire.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Mibsy
Reviews.Content: After reading positive reviews and getting a recommendation from a trusted friend, I was pretty disappointed with TheHotel. Upon check-in, the room we requested was not available, so we were re-booked at Mandalay Bay - connecting rooms at a discounted rate for the first night of our trip (they handled this situation very well). We then had to move back to TheHotel for nights 2 and 3. We all preferred the rooms at Mandalay Bay. Light, fresh, clean, roomy and comfortable versus TheHotel - dark, dirty windows, cramped, non-working ligthbulbs and broken dimmer switch. We requested a roll away bed 4 times before it finally arrived (beds were comfy). The suite was poorly maintained and the decor felt a little cheap (trying just a bit too hard to be "trendy"). Common areas were nice, not quite as chaotic as Mandalay Bay. Perhaps if it were just my husband and I, the impression would have been different; but my advice for families is to book connecting rooms at Mandalay Bay for about the same price. The pool is overrated - don't stay for that reason - the pool at the Mirage is better.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here with tweens!!”
Reviews.Author: hapickard
Reviews.Content: We got a good rate through the internet and I liked the fact that you didn't have to walk through the casino. It was myself and two 13 year girls. First the lights were burned out in the bathroom, then the pool closes at 6 (that's crazy!). The valets are the rudest I have ever encountered in traveling. And they wouldn't let the girls charge to the room even with my ok so they couldn't hang at the pool and get food etc. I have NEVER been to a hotel where they wouldn't let her charge with a note in the system adding her as authorized. Nothing in the entire hotel for them to do. Don't stay here if you have teens. It is NOT friendly at all

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel to retreat to in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: fluff_astrid
Reviews.Content: I stayed in THEhotel during a recent conference trip in early April. The rooms are very large (bedroom, large bathroom, and separate living room) at a decent price. I actually felt guilty having such a large room when I spent all but 6 hours a day at my conference and other venues. The hotel is separated from the main casino by a "wind wall" and you can leave and enter the hotel through a private entrance to avoid setting foot in the casino. Helps a lot if you are allergic to cigarette smoke. When I checked in at 11AM on a Sunday, my room was ready to go. I did have a problem with my bedsheets appearing stained when I did my first once-over of the premises, so I had to have housekeeping come up and change them out. Oddly, my colleague staying in another room had the same problem. Not exactly something you want happening across multiple rooms. While at this hotel, I also experienced THEgym, the Mandalay Bay "Beach" and Mix Lounge. My pros and cons about my experience, below. Pros: - Quiet hotel. No problems falling asleep. - Can avoid casino/cigarette smoke with separate hotel entrance - THEgym is quiet and not crowded, has weights and cardio machines - Price is relatively cheap compared to other large hotel rooms - Coffee making facilities - Stylish, modern decor - HUGE bathrooms - Prompt housekeeping - Blackout curtains - Large closets and in-room safe - Prompt housekeeping - Pretty reliable WIFI CONS: - Could not decline housekeeping--despite pressing the do not disturb button beside the door every day (they do not give you a doorknob sign), housekeeping still showed up. - THEgym is NOT included in the resort fee; instead, it's an extra $!5 a day or $35 for 3 days. This is a bit annoying, since the resort fee includes the Cardio room a far walk away at the Mandalay Bay hotel (and that cardio room is like it says; no weights, very small, in my opinion not worth the fee at all). This strikes me as a bit of bait and switch. - Inconsistent sheet quality; several different nights I had experiences with odd stains on sheets, even after changed out. - Mix Lounge: this is a date scene with a great view, but not a fun club scene. Music is Gen X style. Luckily there appeared to be no cover, so you're not going to be out $20 if you don't like the atmosphere. - The Mandalay Bay Beach is big, packed full with beach chairs. I had a harder time trying to relax here than I have at other, smaller pools. Just know going in that you should go to be active (they have a nice lazy raft course) vs. go for a quiet nap at the beach. - No iron in room. Which was odd, because the Mandalay Bay Hotel rooms have irons...

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: AlexaR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is known for having great pools. They would be nice if they were not grossly over crowded and if you were not charged for things that are free at most hotels. Although there is a lazy river, you have to pay $23 to get a raft! Must pay extra if you want an umbrella for shade. Adult swimming pool is $10-$50, depending upon the day of the week! $17 to see the shark tank. These are only some of the charges, on top of the $18/day "resort fee" charged each person.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS first stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: lexclee99
Reviews.Content: Overall THEhotel was amazing! Everything about it is beautiful and the staff is very friendly and helpful. We arrived at about 7:00pm or so and there was no line to check in so it only took us about five minutes or so. We were given a room in the 34th floor with a nice view of the large pool complex and Mandalay Bay. The rooms are large, nicely decorated, and welcoming. There are plenty of restaurants (House of Blues was my favorite) and shopping readily available as THEhotel is attached to Mandalay Bay and Mandalay Place, but it is nice and quiet at night since there is no casino in THEhotel. The beds are also very comfortable and there is a second bathroom which is handy. The two minor down sides are that THEhotel is set back about a block off of the strip at the far south end so it does add a bit of extra walking to your trip, but this is not a reason not to stay here. The one other thing is that they do chrage for the in room coffee. It is $8.00 for the first cup (since you buy the mug) and $4.00 for each refill. If you are looking for a nice mug as a souvenir though, it's not a bad way to go. There is also a $25.00 per day fee to store your own stuff in the bar, we didn't do this, but it seems pretty steep. We did encounter one minor problem while we were there and the coffee pot did not work (I discovered this the day before we left). They came and took it immediately and told us they would be back with a replacement so we headed out for the day. Unfortunately when we got back there was still no coffee pot so we called and they said it would be right up. After an hour it was still not there so we called again and they said they would have it up to us at 9:3am the nect morning. It was 10:38am the next day before we finally got the replacement coffe pot which would not have been a huge deal except and check out was at 11: 00am so I never did get to have my coffee. However, when I mentioned this to them at check out and said it wasn't a big deal the gentlman checking us out said yes it was and credited us one day's resort fee ($20.16) back. I thought that was more than fair for such a minor oversight and I am sure it was nothing more than that. I would definitely recommend this hotel as it was very comfortable and relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing weekend in Vegas, Loved THE Hotel”
Reviews.Author: charlie1978
Reviews.Content: My husband & I and another couple booked this hotel through Virgin Holidays and stayed there for 3 nights. After reading some negative reviews I was really worried I had made a mistake booking it....however this turned out to be the perfect hotel for us. When you walk into the hotel you immediately feel calm and tranquil, which is quite amazing considering you are in vegas and everything is OTT. We upgraded our rooms to a large suite on the 12th floor, its was lovely and quiet and I am a very light sleeper but I heard no noise at all throughout our stay. We visited all the other big hotels such as the Wynn, venetian, ceasars etc and we felt THE Hotel was a tranquil haven away from the madness of the others. You really do feel relaxed walking around in THE Hotel. We went up to the Mix bar for drinks and the view is spectacular! you really must go and see it in the evening during your stay. If I have to be really picky my only complaint about THE Hotel was 1. having to pay for coffee your room and 2. having to pay $15 for wifi per day. These two things, in my opinion should be included in the price of the stay......also the bath towels could be bigger. But this is still a wonderful hotel in a nice quiet spot.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to all the hype”
Reviews.Author: taxat5
Reviews.Content: We planned this trip the Las Vegas quite sometime ago. It took me three weeks to research various hotel on the strip. Wanted one that would offer luxury for a good value. Let's face it, no one wants to leave a hotel and say "I paid this money for decor and did not get any amenities''. Sometimes folks stay at hotels for the status and name, and leave feeling that they over paid. Kinda like paying 1500.00 for a toothpick. However, this hotel seems to be the best kept secret. This is the best hotel for the money. My boyfriend and I, felt that we most definitely got our money's worth; and then some. The only complaint I had was that the towels were a little hard and did not have a pleasant smell, But not an offensive smell, Just not a fabric softener smell. But Hey, cant have everything. The best thing I loved out of the wonderful list of luxuries, was the door bell to our room. I'm used to nice things in life, however, I was impressed with the fact that they did not leave anything out.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bartonholm
Reviews.Content: Chose this stay for my 50th Birthday. First time in Vegas! Check in was quick and efficient, the room allocated was on floor 20. Great strip view, suite amazing. Arrived on Frid beds not changed till following Wednesday!!! Toiletries only replenished once during our stay. THIS IS NOT 5* service. However it didnt spoil the experience. Coffee shop in foyer serves good quality pastries and coffee to take back to room. Bar and restaurant prices in the complex way too high.. On one day went to the verandah lounge at Four Seasons which is a short walk from check in at Mandalay Hotel. This was fantastic and although not cheap was excellent value for money, away from noise and razzamatazz . The service here was first class. Go you wont be dissappointed. Vegas was a great place to party. We had a good meal at Olives in Bellagio and the buffett at Wynn on a Sunday includes Champagne. The food quality here is fab. Outside mandalay is a bus stop to South Strip go to Town Square from here and you will find shops in a peacefull area and restaurant called Brio which was wonderfull. Better food than any of the top restaurants had served all week, unfortunatly we discovered this on our last day before heading to the airport late afternoon. I would love to return to Vegas someday would stay at Wynn or happily return to theHotel "If the housekeeping improved" PS the Spa is amazing..The pool area is a no go area for over 30s!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, one of the best hotels in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: VancouverPimp
Reviews.Content: I would like to start by saying that I did alot of research as to where I was going to take my wife for her 27th bday. After lots of researching, The Hotel at Mandalay Bay seemed like a great pick. And let me tell you, it was! It amazes me how people can put negative reviews on this hotel. They are either not well traveled and have ridiculous expectations, they have never been to other Vegas hotels, or are stuck up, rich snobs that would never be satisified no matter where they stay. I have stayed at The Paris, Ceasers Palace, The Rio, Planet Hollywood etc and a few others, and THE Hotel knocks them all out of the park. I have been into the Wynn, Bellagio etc and they all seem very nice aswell and I am sure are just as nice. The thing that I really liked about The Hotel, was the cleanliness! Everytime we came down from our room there were 6 or more people with dust mops cleaning the floors and another 3 or 4 people dusting tables, ledges etc. This place smelt and looked clean 24/7. We could never smell any smoke and overall, this made a huge impression. I LOVE the fact you pull right up to the lobby, just like a regular hotel, so you can avoid the Casino etc. We arrived on a Thursday around 1pm....we were upgraded to a V Suite free of charge. We requested a room with a view of the strip and on the quiet side of the hotel. We were given exactly that. The V Suite is awesome, as the layout is better than the standard room as the bedroom curves around the corner of the building. The room we had was 32916 and I highly recommend this room. Nice view of the strip and corner view. ***PLEASE NOTE, if you are looking for a quiet room, make sure you request to be on the wing of the builidng that is not below THE MIX nightclub.*** As soon as we walked in the room, I knew I picked the right hotel. Very clean and tidy, seperate living room with flat screen tv (with extra bathroom) and the bedroom was a nice size, with an amazingly comfortable bed and pillows, another flat screen tv, and a view of the strip from the bed with floor to celing windows wrapping around the entire unit. The bathroom was nice and big, with a nice deep soaker tub, shower and another bathroom with a privacy door. It also had a smaller flat screen tv for watching tv while in the bath! Very nice! I have to address some of the issues that people have brought up on the review board. #1- Hotel is far away from the strip.....ok, it is farther away than other hotels but I would not say it is far away from the strip....$10 cab ride (8 mins) and your on the strip....come on people #2- The Hotel is far away from the Casino in Mandalay.....again, you come down the elevator, walk 2 mins to the left and your in the Casino....if you can't walk that far, you need help....one of the best aspects of staying at The Hotel, is the ability to have the nice clean, quite Hotel side, and then head over to Mandalay for the Casino etc. Overall, this hotel is top notch. If you have booked this hotel, you are going to be very pleased. But remeber, this hotel is less for partying people and more for the people looking to relax or have the ability to relax. It is not right on the strip so if this is an issue, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel... Casual but upscale.”
Reviews.Author: eos126
Reviews.Content: I stayed at TheHotel in March 2011 on business. TheHotel is upscale with very nice casual/traditional appointments. The suite was very nice as well... living area, powder room in the foyer, bath with huge soaking tub (no jets... yaaay!) and plenty of closet space. However, the view was not great compared to other resorts that I have stayed in Las Vegas. I received a great rate through my travel agent... I would suggest that you look for deals. Personally, I do not like the location of Mandalay Bay... too far off the strip but it is okay. I would stay at TheHotel again, hopefully I can get a better view.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel would def stay again”
Reviews.Author: Happyegg29
Reviews.Content: Really lovely hotel couldn't fault it unlike the disgaceful new cosmopolitan hotel which we stayed in later in the week! arrived after a late flight check in was a breeze given lots of vouchers to use room was lovely clean spacious and a great nights sleep. Tv in bathroom and great strip view! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, generally poor service”
Reviews.Author: njtraveler118
Reviews.Content: The standard suite rooms were very large and spacious with especially comfortable beds. One and a half baths per the room was a nice amenity. The spa ("THEbathouse") was amazing -- treatments were great, facilities were clean and the staff were friendly. Also, the pool area was great but I wish it was open later than 6 pm. I would suggest being downstairs by the pool by at least 9:30 to get lounge chairs (pool opens at 9). Towels were free and they gave you unlimited quantites but they were mostly stained and raggedy. There is a shortcut from theHotel which avoids having to walk through the casino; just ask the front desk for directions. The customer service was spotty. The bartender in "THElounge" (Max) was a bit of a jerk. Also, one of the two times we called room service, the woman who answered the phone was rude. Overall, a good hotel. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!”
Reviews.Author: gambler60
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room for Mar 25/11. We decided to use the sports lounge for our free drink ticket, the service was terrible. We had to get our own drinks while 4 waitress's stood around chatting with each other. Although the bartendter was great, we decided not to go there again. We liked the the room, the king sized bed and mattress was great. Room was very quite eccept for some party people inthe hallway at 3:00 AM in the morning. The best experience was the buffet, food was excellent. price without drinks was approx. $65.00 for both of us without drinks excluding drinks and extra tip for a very talkative waiter. Self parking is also very good, no complaints.Location is good if you have your own vehicle to get around. We called the front desk about checking out early in the morning, they said not to worry, we would get a receipt e-mailed to our e-mail address. Today is April 3/11 after 4 request I still do not have a receipt. The lady I spoke to in accounting was not friendly at all, to the point of being rude. Although she did assure me that I would receive a receipt promply. Since speaking with her I have sent in 3 additional requests for a receipt but absolutly no response. I can accept the poor service in the lounge, maybe the girls where having an important meeting. But I cannot accept the problems with getting a receipt for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Name for a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Njsa
Reviews.Content: On arrival received free upgrade to a suite so this hotel was already impressing me. The Hotel has nice clean hotel rooms with all the features needed for the business traveller. Soft furnishings are comfortable and the showers are warm and powerful. Unfortunately the noise travels up and down the hall way and into your room so it can be annoying if your trying to sleep. The lighting in the lobby is very dark and to find the front desk can be difficult for first timers. Overall I liked the place but don't really like Vegas so won't be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious stay - first class service”
Reviews.Author: fishiana
Reviews.Content: Girlfriends weekend away was spent in the beautifully appointed THEhotel at the Mandalay Bay. The large suite accomodated all 4 girls, had 2 bathrooms and a separate bedroom with 2 queen beds in addition to the main living room. We were treated like Queens for the weekend, with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries, what more can you ask for? The wave pool and sand in the Mandalay Bay were exceptional! The two hotels are connected, but there are separate lounges, and restaraunts for each. What a great complex, it made up for the fact that it was on one hand of the strip. The only thing that would have made this even more perfect is for it to be situated in the middle of the strip. Had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “No plans to stay anywhere else in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: pagriego
Reviews.Content: Recently stay at The Hotel on two separate occassions in March and both experiences were phenomenal! The Suite itself is very upscale with great beds and luxurious large bathrooms. Service is wonderful and the location is very convenient and gives you the best of both worlds, quiet away from casino if you want that, but close enough to the action to enjoy that too.

Reviews.Title: “Going back in June it was that good”
Reviews.Author: scott_cop
Reviews.Content: As I'm typing on an iPhone i will keep this brief. This hotel was lovely. Stayed in one of the suites for 4 nights 11th-15th march 2011 room 18803. It was huge, lots of space, two toilets, flat screen tv in bedroom, bathroom and lounge. Free wi Fi, lush soft mattresses on huge beds, free extra soft robes, etc etc. Very very nice. Also free parking which is always good and we hired a car to go to the canyon so that was handy. The actual hotel is a separate building to the Mandalay bay itself but it only takes a moment to walk across. Mandalay bay is where the casino and pool and most other amenities are such as restaurants, buffets etc. There are a couple of cafes in THE hotel but you are close enough to everywhere to be able to have the choice as to where to go. The hotel is on the south of the strip very very close to the airport. Infact you will be a stones throw from the hotel when you land, so very quick transfer times also. The hotel has a free monorail from Mandalay bay to the Luxor and the Excalibur which takes only a minute, or you can walk. We walked a lot of the time as the weather was lovely and why wouldn't you ? However most people over there didn't walk much and you will see clearly what I mean when you go! There is so much to see and do in las Vegas I wAs surprised and never for a second bored. We managed to cram so much in to 4 days. If you are going then the Hoover Sam and canyon are a must if you have never been before. Hoover dam by car is about 35 miles. Great pictures!! The shows are amazing!! Check out 'o' at the bellagio. Other free must sees whilst you are there include the wonderful fountains of bellagio show. Outside the bellagio hotel on the strip, it's a water fountain show to music and it's fabulous. Also, the volcano show at night at the mirage hotel is well worth 10 mins of your time. Last show at 11pm! They feed lions at the MGM grand hotel throughout the day, worth popping in for ten mins. There is a monorail that goes from the MGM grand hotel right up to the north of the strip it's 5 dollars single ride. We did it for the experience but if there are a few of you it's cheaper and faster to get a taxi. The fares are all set by the government so very fair. Back to the hotel, there are lots to choose from on the strip and some look very tacky indeed. This hotel wasn't at all. It's five star, comfortable and well cleaned with all the little luxuries thrown in for free. The only pain is the 18 dollar per room per day resort fee. They all charge it though so don't blame this hotel too much and some fees are more than this. Luckily if you book through virgin holidays for either the package or hotel only, as we did, you don't have to pay them!! I could go on about this lovely place but the phone battery is about to die. Happy to answer any hotel or location questions just send a message! Oh, don't use the mini bar it's a complete rip off, don't even accept the key from reception when they offer it!! And don't use the hotel phones it's about 10 dollars per minute for calls abroad!

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING AND POOR SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: bnj1225
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel at Mandalay Bay as my professional association was having a convention there. I reserved a room with a king sized bed, and, close to the elevators as I have a problem walking. When I arrived, I was given a room with two queen sized beds (no big problem) but, it was at the end of the hallway. When I complained to the front desk, the girl took a totally I do not care attitude. Finally, after complaining to someone else, I was moved the next day. The rooms were very worn and dated. They claim the change the bed linen every day, but do not. One day, I left a small drop of blood on the sheet when I was testing my blood sugar level. The same sheet was there the next day. The living room of the suite I had was very small. Food is horrificall expensive in all of the restaurants. At at discounted rate of $249 a night, it was certainly not a pleasant experience. I will never stay there again. Also, they want to charge you $18 a day for the Internet access, a newspaper (which I never received) use of the health care facility (which I never had the time to use) and a free drink in one of the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointing”
Reviews.Author: 2_Tosa_Travelers
Reviews.Content: Where to start.... There are so many nice things to say about THEhotel, but our room was not one of them. Upon arriving to our 5th floor suite, I wanted to open the curtains to get a view of the Strip, only to find our view was that of a very nice brick wall and the other window had a view of the convention center parking lot. We were awoke daily at 7:00 a.m. by the noise of trucks backing up and forklifts performing a load-in for a convention. Wow, I had booked this trip four months in advance and this was the best they could do? We had some very nice robes hanging in the closet for our use during our stay. Unfortunately, I did not pay close enough attention and slipped it on after a shower. When my husband was going to put on his robe, he noticed that the robes were not clean. The robes were heavily stained inside and had hairs imbedded in the fabric. YUCK!!! I notified the hotel and they eventually brought clean robes for us to use. We never did receive an apology for wearing someone else's filthy clothes. Finally, the concierge somehow screwed up inputting information on my credit card and my credit card was froze due to the credit card company thinking there was fraud. The most amazing thing is that on our way home I received a survey of our stay. I have never received a follow-up to the survey. Lesson learned, I will never stay at THEhotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, excellent amenities”
Reviews.Author: j9logan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here right before Christmas with my family. We were impressed with this all-suite hotel by the size of the room and the location. The hotel was quiet, well-kept, and had two nice bathrooms. The in-room coffee wasn't included, but there was nice bakery with coffee in the lobby. Would like to stay here again when all the pools are open.

Reviews.Title: “THe Hotel is THe Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: thinkn333
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the last few days of a week long trip. My husband and I had an excellent time here. The suites are spacious and the extra bathroom is great when traveling with a man. Easy to get from the suite to the casino floor and this great little yogurt place, YOGURT IN. We spent some time up in the bar area, MIX. Worth taking some time. Excellent view of vegas and you can sit outside, enjoy the fantastic view, stay warm and still here the music. Housekeeping was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & value!!”
Reviews.Author: TarHeelsareBest
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time staying here. One of the nicer hotels. I got a nice suite for same price as regular room at Mandalay Bay. Room was clean and had no noise issues. Highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice but no value”
Reviews.Author: dbefus
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice, upgraded to a suite, no charge, but EVERYTHING was stupidly expensive. Hot dog in sports bar $9.00, beer $6.00. Nice but no hot dog is worth that much. My holiday dollar is better spent elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Bay”
Reviews.Author: showme7or11
Reviews.Content: Went there for my b-day, had a wonderful time, hotel was nice,the service was fast, staff very friendly, and helpful......good location even though it sit at the end of the strip, its placement is at the heart of most of the action..... by far, one of the best hotel i have stayed in

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT STAY AT THE HOTEL @ Mandalay Bay - rip-off”
Reviews.Author: dwpdkp
Reviews.Content: Walls are paper thin, filthy, dirty; left message for housekeeping to replace burned out bulbs, nothing was done. Called security to handle people partying in the hall - had to call three times; resort fees; travel agent booked suite, was placed in a dingy small room; hotel management extremely unresponsive, arrogant.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great place to stay if you can get a deal...”
Reviews.Author: Caliguy227
Reviews.Content: but it's starting to show its age in some places. Wynn opened a few years ago, and they've already remodeled some rooms. MGM has billions in City Center, so I'm not sure any major renovations are coming anytime soon. Anyways, this is still a fine facility and I still enjoy my time here. It's so nice to not have a casino directly attached to theHotel. It's SO much quieter and more relaxing - yet you can walk into a casino in 2 minutes. I got the standard suite this time, not the "V" as in my previous review. Mostly similar, but I noticed one big thing - the beds are different. The "V" had the nicer bed. While it wasn't bad, it just wasn't as comfortable as the "V" bed, which I believe are pillow-top. Housekeeping is still top notch, as we spilled some M&M's and when we came back the next night, they were gone - even the ones that we saw run under the couch. Would love it if they got HD tv's - but once again, I know where MGM's money is. The staff is still excellent. What needs to be improved is the condition of the building. There are tell tale signs of wear. There are chips on the dresser doors, visible scratches on tables, bubbled up wall paper in places, and just little signs that the place is not as new as it was. I am confident these things will be taken care of in time, after the parent company can pay down its debt on City Center. It's easy for me to recommend this place AS LONG as you get a good deal - if it gets priced like a 5-star place, I'd stay at Wynn/Encore. But for the deal I got, I'm perfectly okay with it and will be back if I can get the deal again. And BTW, I hate resort fees, and they had them. But just about everyone does, now. It's a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a fair price”
Reviews.Author: Jimjamjwg
Reviews.Content: We had the basic suite which was more than adequate. It had everything you need and was very comfortable. It's also incredibly cheap for what you get so any minor criticisms are probably a little unfair.

Reviews.Title: “It Only Looks Good”
Reviews.Author: RoccoNevada
Reviews.Content: The Hotel must have once been awesome and it still has good bones, but the carpets and furniture are stained and dirty. The Guest Services staff is decent but the others are pretty bored and uncaring. Believe it or not, they charge for in-room coffee that you get free at any Hampton Inn, Motel 6 or other inexpensive travel hotel. Seems like they just want to vacuum as much money as they can.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MSandDS
Reviews.Content: The hotels in Las Vegas are SOOO large, with lines for checking in, so it was a nice surprise to arrive from the airport and walk right up to check-in. The rooms are very stylish, large, and quiet. The hotel is more on the modern side and we loved it. Staff were very nice and personable.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy & Service Going Down”
Reviews.Author: provoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at THEhotel. First they checked us in (smoothly) on the floor below MIX the nightclub. The room was accross from the service staff bathroom and the corridor smelled and due to ventilation patern, the smell did come into the room. After we had them address this we could not sleep for half the night due to the noise from upstair. The next day they moved us to a suite (free upgrade for our trouble) down on a lower floor. Suite was nice although the sheet was stained (about 2 by 3 inches) and ripped (about 2 inches). That night we continued to hear noise although not as bad. Also we were nearby the elevator but luckily the noise from people going up and down the corridor only made it into the living room portion of the suite not the bedroom section. We also booked the SPA at the mandalay Bay Hotel (Not The Hotel). From last year we noticed, the individual juices, water bottle and nuts are gone. Only ice water and juice as well as banana and apples. Not that bad BUT we the place was not heated as much, had less attendants, the whirlpool were much cooler and on the last day they ran out of towels halfway through the afternoon. So it was one towel for person but with no warnings, so when you looked for a clean one they informed you on this. It was Superbowl week end and UFC night but still no excuse to run out of towels. So while they did all these cuts in service, they also increased the price. Ate at the Raffles cafe which was ok and at something Lilly which was very good. We used to like the Mandalay (Hotel or not) before because of the non-thematic aspect and the spa. We will not stay at THEhotel again due to noise. We probably will move up the strip to CityCentre or a bit further since the spa no longer fits the bill (it was what use to bring us back there all the time in spite of the location at the very end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Service, Superb Rooms, Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: denverroadtrip
Reviews.Content: While we couldn't get into our room at 11am, they checked us in with a genuine smile, gave us some drink coupons, and took my cel number. I inquired to a bellman about an hour later and within two minutes he handed me the key to a gorgeous two room suite with the best view of the strip ever.
