We paid a mere $105/night on the Mandalay Bay website for a two bed (rare in a suite), two room, two bathroom suite, and were treated like family. Some of the furniture was scratched as reported on this website. I feel that for any rate under $250, what I saw was more than acceptable. The furniture in both rooms were high quality, beds and headboards were comfy and sexy, and the main bathroom was larger than a NYC apartment. My friend and I both noticed the finer points in the room design- for example the bathroom door that was hinged to slowly close by itself and quietly latch. The independent room AC units were the best I've ever had in a hotel. The sofa, desk chair, beds and everything else were comfortable and functional. The entire staff from the bartenders to housekeeping kept the image of TheHotel being a step above most. It worked. I would not only stay here again, I will encourage anyone I know to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice suites wounderful hotel very upscale super clean very comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: traveltimCanada
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in february. This is a great hotel with very large suites with seperate livingroom and one very large bathroom with huge bathtub and seperate shower, there is also a second bathroom with toilet and sink. The beds were very comfortable. The hotel was very clean and the staff pleasant. The location is at the bottom of the Strip but that is no problem as there is a free monorail that runs every few minutes will take you up to the Excalibur which is directly across from MGM. Had dinner at the Red Square, tried the tasting menu- 6 courses resonable price, one of the best I've every had. Would not hesitate to return to this hotel. The pool area was closwed for winter but looks very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Sublime experience”
Reviews.Author: mdillon123
Reviews.Content: Husband and I traveling with sister and brother in law for a four day fun vacation to Las Vegas. All are in our 40's. We booked THE Hotel due to the all suite feature and did not regret it. I read a few reviews here that mentioned the cleanliness issue, but I didn't find anything wrong. It is a large suite with LOTS of cubby built-in areas. Good for storage but heck on the cleaning people. I'm sure with hundreds of rooms to clean, not every cubby area in the bathroom got a wipedown, so yes I saw a little dust from time to time. It didn't bother me. The Hotel is quiet! Very well insulated. We were on the 30th floor with a great view of the Luxor and strip. What we liked the best, besides the extra room, was the HUSH that engulfs you when you leave the gambling area of Mandolay and walk back to THE Hotel. It's like an instant calming effect. The tub was wondereful! Husband and I brought our own bath products, but used them all up by day 3. Luckily their is a Lush store in their shopping area so we just bought more. Staff was friendly and cooperative. Didn't experience anyone rude or impatient. We used the guest services to check our bags and flight before we left, a free service they have at the hotel. Definately sign up for their players club card. We ended up getting over $200 comp'd to us. The card is good for lots of hotels, not just Mandalay. In fact we gambled the most at Luxor due to table limits being a little better there. Will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nickled and dimed in a $900 suite”
Reviews.Author: svGypsySoul
Reviews.Content: We booked an H suite (the largest available) while traveling for work so my husband could entertain his colleagues during our stay. Imagine our surprise when the room came equipped with only two wine glasses! To get extra glasses they wanted to charge room service rates to have them brought up. This isn't about the cost, which was small, but just about the way they treated us. If you are getting a great rate on a room, and the rates for regular rooms are great, then I understand the nickle and dime-ing. But to have to be hassled over wine glasses when paying this much for a room is crazy. You even have to pay for coffee ($4/cup) in the room. The cheapest hotels offer free coffee! Maybe this is just the Vegas way, but it put me off TheHotel.

Reviews.Title: “Almost 5 Star => Great Deal for $150 per night”
Reviews.Author: BeachMax
Reviews.Content: THE Hotel seems to be forgotton with the Cosmopolitan, Mandarin Oriental and City Center opening one after another. It's a steal at $150 or less per night for a 750 sq. ft suite with separate living room and 1.5 baths. The servicer is much better than the understaffed Wynn + Encore. The end of the strip location also lessens the traffic hastle - but a good walk to the other casinos. Check-In: Took 3 minutes - and THE Hotel was completely booked due to the Ozzy Ozborne concert - no hastle at all. Make sure to come to the separate THE Hotel entrance in the rear - NOT Mandalay Bay - or you've got a 10 mintues walk to check-in. Room: Contemporary decor - living room had sofa, side chair, desk with chair, 50" plasma with CD player, stocked wet-bar and separate half bath. Bedroom had 2 queens (or King if preferred), 42" TV, ample closet space. Master Bathroom was large - separate tubs and shower with 2 sinks. Shower had good water pressure + hot water. The did not have robes (odd) - has to request and they forgot to bring them... Casino: None - which is excellent - means no hastle getting to rooms or wandering a mile through casino! Mandalay Bay Casino is a 5 minute walk. Parking: Tons Restaurants: Lots of restarurant and entertainment choices at the attached Mandalay Bay. The concierge got a reservation at Hubert Keller's Fleur - see separate review. Pool: Next door at Mandalay Bay - a bit of a hike - but cool "beach" setting with Palm trees. Spas: 2 to choose from - premium prices - cheaper off the strip - but, okay. Nightclub/Bars: Mix: Totally cool - up on the 65th floor - panaramic views of the strip. Indoor and Outdoor seating and excellent service. Not crowed at all - relaxing. Minus 5: Waste of time for $25+ per person - tourist trap. 50 foot ice box that they try to get you to buy pictures etc. So cold (even with their flimsy winter jacket + thin gloves.) What you really need is a hat - sorry - that is an extra charge - RIP OFF!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: bubbadad12
Reviews.Content: I had a very nic etime there and loved my room. The only negative was at the W Puck restaurant. Other than that, it was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: honkoponko
Reviews.Content: This is our very favorite hotel in Vegas. Have stayed many other places but this is the best! Beautiful, swanky suites with 2 bathrooms which is a wonderful treat. The service is fabulous, couldn't get any better. Great places to eat in the area.

Reviews.Title: “THEhotel: - The legend lives on”
Reviews.Author: JSFULHAM
Reviews.Content: I returned to the THEhotel this year after a previous stay in January 2010. From the moment I arrived the staff were absolutely spot on. I stayed in a corner suite 19815 and it was huge, spotlessly clean and tremendous value. Jovan checked me in and like all the staff in the hotel, he was extremely helpful, friendly and welcoming. I noticed a real change in the attitude of the staff, or rather there was no attitude! True the suites are starting (only just) to show their age, but still very serviceable and for the price they are exceptionally good. My lounge was as big as some hotel rooms. The bedroom was huge and the bath humungous! I like to be able to relax when I am away and youcan do this in the suite very well because the lounge is separate to the bedroom and the 42" TV and DVD player were put to good use, as was the cocktail bar in the suite! In the casinos I met many locals who told me they came to the Mandalay Bay complex because the staff are so welcoming. The location is a little away from the action, but this suits me and there is a tram to Exccalibur. Also if you are taking the Downtown Express or the Deuce, these leave outside the resort. Very convenient. Also very handy for Wholefoods Market at Town Square. The resort has about 16 restaurants and bars. The buffet was poor, but all the other places I went to were excellent. Raffles Cafe was very popular with long queues, but as the Mandalay Bay is connected toi Luxor, more resturants are just a few minutes walk away and this proved helpful for late supper. The walk to the casino from the hotel is only about 3 minutes and it is nice to retire somewhere peaceful after a long night out. If you like upscale accommodations, good service and calm relaxing surroundings, THEhotel has it all. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: californiadeb
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 nights at The Hotel. Our stay was comped including the daily resort fee. We loved the suite and wish we could have spent more time in the room! We have stayed at many other hotels in Vegas including the Venetian and The Signature at MGM and felt this was just as nice. There were no stains on anything and the suite was spotless. The thing about Vegas is that you are hardly in the room except to sleep but we enjoyed what little time we were in the room. We had no service issues and had excellent service both at the front desk and bell desk. Our request for extra pillows was handled immediately. We ate at several restaurants at the resort including The Cafe, which was surprisingly good. We had breakfast there and it was excellent and the service was great and prompt. We also ate at House of Blues and Raffles and both were very good with good service. As far as the location, we had no issues. We actually like the south end of the strip better so we were happy. We walked as far as the Cosmolitan to check it out, then over to Planet Hollywood and back down. The free tram is great and gets you to the Excalibur where you can head in any direction. So overall, we highly recommend The Hotel and loved our getaway there!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel is swanky enough, but get it on sale.”
Reviews.Author: destinationsdiva
Reviews.Content: Went with a group of 10 people (5 couples) and we all stayed at The Hotel. We booked this hotel because I am a travel agent, and I noticed they were having a sale, so we all booked. Let me preface this review, as I always do, with the fact that I am picky, not high maintenance, but high expectations.The Hotel side is very nice and has a swanky, upscale feel about it. Check in was decently speedy for the line. The hotel suites were liked by everyone in the group. They are well appointed, nicely decorated, nice views, and very clean. Cleaning service was prompt. There were a couple of minor service issues on the first night, but Jenna, one of the managers, took care of the problems and compensated us, which was the right thing to do. The Hotel is connected to the Mandalay Bay resort, which is a very short walk away, and it has everything: shopping, restuarants, bars, and gambling. You really don't even need to leave the resort. Of course we did, but it really has everything. There are several FANTASTIC restaurants at this resort. We had a couple of foodies in our group, so we tried several of the restaurants in the Mandalay Bay Resort and were pleased.For morning coffee, walk down to the lobby and get a large cup of coffee for half the price,and get a delicious breakfast treat, like a muffin or sticky bun. Don't use the mini bar in the room because like most upscale hotels, everything is ridiculously priced. There is a daily resort fee, but these are common and not unique to The Hotel. Like baggage fees on airlines, everyone is trying to get in their extra fees. It's maddening, but part of travel these days. If you don't want to pay them, check your hotel policy before you book or ask your travel agent. The location of The Hotel is on the far end of the strip. We knew this going in, but we chose this hotel for the quality and sale. It is a lot of walking, but you really should expect that in Vegas if you like to see all the hotels. I have and still would recommend The Hotel to clients. The rooms were really great. I would wait for this property to go on sale before I booked because the location is inconvenient, or if you are looking for a high end hote,l but need it on sale. I will stay here again eventually, but I try to stay at a different hotel in Vegas as much as possible! If your travel agent says it's on sale, give this hotel a shot.

Reviews.Title: “alright, but expected more.”
Reviews.Author: dethman
Reviews.Content: after having stayed in suites such as the venetian, palazzo, signature at mgm, i expecte dmore out of THEhotel at mandalay bay. the hotel and mandalay bay itself is very nice, with plenty of shops, and a clean, open gaming area, definitely one of the more upscale hotels in las vegas. however the hotel room itself, despite being . decorated in a contemporary nature, felt a bit cluttered, small, and lacking in style. thesuite is over 700 sq ft but feels a lot smaller than other suites i've stayed in, perhaps due to the wall right in the middle. the furniture was stained, the toilet was not clean, and the televisions are not the new high end flat screens. bathrooms were nice, but the sheets on the bed felt terrible, either very poor thread count or a polyblend. at a hotel like this, you expect to fall into a soft, comfortable bed with tons of pillows, but this simply wasn't the case. i didn't feel like i slept that well. also annoying, the mandatory resort fees imposed by many hotels like this. such BS. the stay was okay, but unless this place was a lot cheaper than the rest, i doubt i'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sexy and fabulous atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: shopperhopper
Reviews.Content: THEhotel at Mandalay Bay is fabulous from the second you walk in. It is ritzy, classy, very modern and well put together. There are a few places to eat, but the hotel is connected to the main Mandalay Bay hotel which has a ton of options also. THEhotel rooms/suites are SO nice, everything was clean and comfortable and felt more on the luxurious side. This hotel is definitely on the classy side of Vegas. I would not recommened this hotel for little kids or for party animals looking to trash a room. If you decide to stay here, make use of perks you get by staying at THEhotel tower (wifi, drink coupon, newspaper....) and also make use of the spa, Bathhouse, it is VERY nice. We booked THEsuite and I have to say the mini bar was well stocked, the bed was SO COMFY, the bathroom was HUGE, and the view was the glittering Luxor pyramind, yay! All in all, I loved it there and really don't have any complaint.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we stayed here...”
Reviews.Author: backriver111
Reviews.Content: For my girlfriend's 30th I wanted to take her to a nice hotel in Vegas without blowing a lot of money. After much research, and so many choices, I decided on "The Hotel". We just got back today and I had to let everyone on here know, we had the best 4 days of our lives here. OK, the warnings first. The resort fee has gone up to $20 a day. So now you know. It was $15 at the time of our booking. That's about all the negative I have. People are on here complaining about things like having to pay $6 per cup of coffee in your room. Well, it took me 5 minutes to go to the lobby and buy a fresh cup for $2.75. People sometimes! So another big complaint is how far away it is from everything. Well, it's not really. You can get to Luxor and Excalibur in 10 minutes via a free tram service, and New York New York and MGM Grand in 15 (take the tram to Excalibur, then walk accross the street. So after your 15 minute walk/tram to MGM Grand, there is a monorail service you can take to virtually anywhere on the strip for $5 ($12 for day pass) So getting around is not a problem nor is it expensive. FYI- the monorail does close for a few hours late so we took a cab ride for $9 from one end of the strip to the other. I just wanted to debunk that problem people seem to always bring up on here since ZI too was worried about it. I for one loved being away from the crowds and those annoying scumbags handing out prostitution paraphernalia at every corner. Anyway, we loved it! We went to just about every casino, and Mandalay was our favorite. Slots were pretty loose too (for us anyway lol!) The spa was awesome. Service was great! Very clean and spacious rooms. I only wish we came in season when all the pools were open (there is a tiny heated pool that does stay open year round). So do some research. There's always some kind of promotion going on to save some money on rooms. Go coupon hunting for drink and food deals. And relax in knowing you picked the right hotel to stay at in Vegas. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, and was a great deal”
Reviews.Author: TropicalTraveler78
Reviews.Content: At $100 per night on Orbitz (plus their hidden resort fee) you can't beat it. A 1 bedroom apartment basically. Very well appointed and the beds were good. The couple of things I didn't like-- The entrance is in a parking garage so it doesn't feel the same as pulling up to the mandalay bay or another top vegas resort. The pools were nice but were all closed, it was too cold. Also the location is at the south end of the strip. Next time I'd stay closer to the middle where all the action is. But no doubt it was a good value and was beautiful. It was showing some wear in the rooms, like they might need to replace some chairs, etc. I'll say if I was paying $300 per night I would not have been happy but at $100 it was a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the resort fees!!”
Reviews.Author: rosiebear21
Reviews.Content: Hotel was lovely but watch out for the new "resort fees". Basically despite paying for your hotel in the UK in full they charge you a dailly resort fee for the pleasure of staying there!! Would recomend for cleanliness but quite expensive to eat and drink there and wasnt aware or allowed for the resort fees which added up to over £100 for a 7 night stay!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good but still Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Wolrdwide
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel. Whilst the complex has a casino, it is somewhat separated from the hotel making it possible to not live the LV madness 24/7. Located at the South end of the Strip, it is a little bit out of the way, but we still walked around but took a taxi back. If you want to be more central I would probably choose another place. Rooms are spacious with a bedroom and a living/office room space, a huge bathroom and an additional restroom. Style is elegant/traditional and had the flair of a business hotel. A bit disappointing was that the coffee making facility in the room cost $6 per cup of coffee, equally gym usage is an additional $15. Whilst there are various elegant restaurant options on site, we found the coffee shop for breakfast downstairs lacking. It was basically a Starbucks-type place, only difference people were eating of plastic plates. Whilst the rooms look very expensively done and the premises look elegant, still it does not have the air of a really top place. Service is okayish, and with tons of people trailing thru the ground floor and the dreadful coffee place, it does not feel like a 5 star place, but I guess this is LV. We were there on an offer of around $ 100 per night which was incredible value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pools”
Reviews.Author: Sillymeow
Reviews.Content: TheHotel was just what we needed. The kids loved the pools and the house of blues, we loved the accomadations and the tram which made traveling to the strip super convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Eh, it's alright for the price...unless you're a high roller!”
Reviews.Author: interviewqueen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for NYE for 4 nights, of course the prices everywhere are expensive for the occasion. I feel we got what we paid for. We were given two options, a king with wheelchair accessible access bath which was supposed to be the same as the other room but a shower curtain instead of glass and the other option being 2 queen sized beds. We chose the former. The only thing bad was the shower curtain was moldy, like BLACK mold in the crease of the curtain. Housekeeping took care of it the next day. THe rooms are very spacious, with one full bath and half bath, a living room, with couch and large flat screen tv. There is also a huge flat screen in the bedroom. There is plenty of closet/drawer space. Our view overlooked the parking lot so not much to look out at. we were impressed until... Our high roller friends got the T suite. WOW! never again will we go back to living in the slums. J/k. The T suite has two entrances on the 62nd floor with 4 large windows overlooking the rest of the strip. There is a formal dining table for 8 - Although we never used it. The living room has 2 couches in the middle of the room and another tv with two small couches. The bedroom has it's own sitting area. JBL speakers throughout the suite so you can blast clubbing music. The bath has it's own jacuzzi tub and separate shower and own toilet. The toiletries are upgraded to L'Occitane products. The bar area is bigger of course and they also upgrade the coffee. We also dined at THEcafe for breakfast. A bit expensive but enjoyed every bit of it. Many choices for breakfast as well as sandwiches. The omelet was good, hash browns delicious. Of course way too much food for one person, but it's VEGAS BABY! One more thing, we had a good stay because it's quiet and less people, since the casino is in the main mandalay bay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated Hotel away from all the madness”
Reviews.Author: fluffy_cat_girl
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at THEhotel for 3 nights in December and we were very impressed. We arrrived the night of the big boxing match and although it was very busy, it took us minutes to check in. The great thing about THEhotel is how calm and serene it is. Walking through into Mandalay Bay, you get snippets of how crazy Vegas is, but walking back to the welcoming arms of THEhotel was comforting. Our suite was fantastic. Huge beds and beautiful marbled bathrooms. The room is very relaxing and the separate sitting room area is a great addition. The staff were faultless and went above and beyond, to make sure we were happy. My brother is diabetic so they immediately got us an extra fridge, so that he could store his medication. I have a feather allergy, so when I noticed the pillows had feathers, new foam ones were brought up to us in minutes. If you want to escape the madness of Vegas, then THEhotel is definitely the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a second time!”
Reviews.Author: NWtd
Reviews.Content: I was there for 4 days for business and never again. Checking in went compleetly wrong. I was waiting for two hours to get my rooms. The person who was supposed to call me went home. After two flights of 14 hours that's not a great start. The room was big but not clean. Hairs where still in the bath. Take a hour to get breakfast in the morning because the restaurants can't handle all the people in rush hour. Service in the casino and restaurants was poor. Not a great Vegas experience for me!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting bed spread, poor customer service!”
Reviews.Author: gratitude892
Reviews.Content: Another reason why people should refrain from using comforters at hotels. While removing the comforter from the bed I noticed a milky white stain that appeared to be dried sieman (nasty). I called the front desk and was baffled by their response. The female told me the stain was from a liquid fabric softener. This was completely unacceptable! Housekeeping arrived to change the comforter, which I wasn't going to use anyway. I showed the manager a picture of the stain and was not offered any form of compensation for my inconvenience! Poor customer service from a hotel that comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: jdalbert
Reviews.Content: We stayed at THEhotel for a full week in December 2010. We booked in a regular suite when we made our reservation, but the front desk upgraded us to one of their "V" suites when we arrived. This turned out really well as the room they gave us had a fantastic view looking over the Luxor and the rest of the Strip from the 18th floor. The room itself was quite nice with 1.5 bathrooms, a separate living room and 3 TVs. The "resort fee" included free local phone calls and in-room internet which came in handy during our stay. The bedroom had excellent curtains which kept the room completely dark throughout the night and even after sunrise. The only negatives I can think of are that the coffee in the room costs $6 per cup, and on one day despite having the housekeeping light turned on, our room was not cleaned (to the hotel's credit, when we called at 8:00 PM to let them know, they sent someone right away).

Reviews.Title: “Great value for an all-suite hotel”
Reviews.Author: sydjd133
Reviews.Content: This is definitely off the beaten path on the strip. So if you want to walk everyplace this hotel is not for you. That being said, this hotel is absolutely gorgeous. Everything is contemporary, styled mostly in black, sleek styling, and glass everywhere including the lobby and walkways. I just went here for Christmas with my husband and his parents. An all-suite hotel for $100 per night is an unbelievable deal. The room are fabulous--true suites with one and a half bathrooms and double sinks in the main bath with separate shower and bath. There is plenty of restaurants, a nice shopping area, and the casino is not smoky. Downsides: The service kind of sucks. The staff at the Cafe was abysmal and everytime we asked where something was or the "quick way" to get to someplace, they were clueless. I asked the concierge where the closest Pandora store was and she said she didn't know what that was. Clueless. Too sum up: Spa was the best ever, and I slept like a baby every night. The staff sucks so be prepared to navigate Vegas on your own, including the hotel. Overall: fantastic!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Deli8
Reviews.Content: THEHotel has just the type of rooms we like. A suite with separate bedroom. We stayed in the basic suite and really liked the two bathrooms, size of the bedroom, comfort of the King size bed, the generous closet/storage space. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern... and Mysterious with the Dark Lighting”
Reviews.Author: AKo75
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several Las Vegas hotels on the strip and really liked moderness of The Hotel. The room we stayed was a studio that had a separate sitting area from the bedroom. Due to our late check-in, the king size bed was not available and the front desk staff put us in a suite with two queens. She did offer that we could move the next day, but we declined. I do have to say that the definition of queen seemed to be smaller than what we are used to, it almost seemed like a double bed. But overall the room was spacious, and met our needs for a brief vacation. The Cafe was closed, and not sure if it was due to the time of year (weekend before Christmas). However, there were several other venues (outside of The Hotel) that were closed, and since we were able to walk to Mandalay Bay, it wasn't an issue. Overall, with the price we paid (72-hour special) and the room and service we received, it was well worth our money.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!! Already missed this place right after leaving!”
Reviews.Author: Tigerlilly8
Reviews.Content: Loved every second of our 4 night stay in this place! The rooms are amazing, comfortable, homely, beautiful, floor to ceiling windows (a must in Vegas), massive bathrooms, more than enough TV's & toilets, large comfortable lounge & work desk, huge comfy beds, enormous bathtub that I could easily have lived in, his & hers vanity & mirrors. Reception staff were Very friendly at check-in & check-out, housekeeping, bellhop & room service were all great, professional & friendly! Price was more than reasonable and would have paid quite a bit more to stay here then what we did. Did not care at all that we weren't in a hotel/casino - in fact were relived when exploring some of the others and smelling the smoke & food throughout the casinos (and I'm a smoker) makes you fell ill after a while although the Mandalay is not so bad, THEhotel smells great, fragrance they expel throughout the vents or however is so good. To walk through to the Mandalay is less than a 30 second walk which I expected to be much farther after some of the reviews on here - no problem at all. And to walk towards the centre of the strip is around 10 minutes depending how distracted you get along the way which is easy to do. The bus also stops right out the front of Mandalay & goes back and forth between the strip all night. Every person we spoke with about THEhotel before, during & after our stay has nothing but great things to say about this hotel & I would stay here in Vegas again without even trying other hotels! One suggestion however, please hide the resort fee in the room rate, I think all it does is serve to make guests angry and if it is hidden in the room rate people will still happily pay the asking price as it is very low but wont feel ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Another Impressive Vegas Hotel - They Just Need to Change Their Name!”
Reviews.Author: CelineCeline
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at THE hotel after coming back from a short trip to the Grand Canyon. THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay is very impressive. We stayed in a suite which offered a seperate bedroom and living room area. The rooms are spacious, nicely decorated, and clean. Everything is very modern and luxurious - there's three tv's in the whole suite including 1 in the living room, bedroom, and bathroom! The beds were very comfortable, dressed in beautiful linens. One thing that we were not impressed with was the $16/day resort fee. This fee includes internet, newspaper, and free printout of your boarding pass.There's no reason why in this day and age, internet shouldn't be free. We just came from the Marriott Grand Chateua and the Best Western at the Grand Canyon, and both places had free internet, free fitness center, and no other "resort fees". What we paid is what we paid. Resort fees are just plain dishonest, things should cost what they cost, so just include it in your daily room rate if you want to charge for something. And - another nit pick - what is up with the hotel name? Alot of Vegas hotels have sister hotels, like MGM Grand - Signature at MGM or Wynn and Encore, or the Venetian and The Palazzo. But THE Hotel?....Regardless, we would consider staying here again however we do like to try out new hotels each time we come to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, good value”
Reviews.Author: mackdaddynewton
Reviews.Content: Great to have the separate living room, our two year old loved it! The living/sleeping accommodation is generally excellent. Like all Vegas hotels, everything else is expensive. room service food is extortionate. as an example, we ordered some warm milk for our toddler's bedtime - $8. The location suited us, away from the main Strip. Charging to use the gym ($15 per session) seems unreasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Great Rooms, Staff are Hit and Miss”
Reviews.Author: STYLEONTHEGO
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a very luxurious and relaxing alternative to the now very dated Mandalay Bay property. Set apart from the casino with a separate entrance, quiet lobby area, and large rooms that are all suites, this is a great place to stay if you like Vegas but need a break from the crowds and the chaos every few hours. The rooms are nicely decorated and the layout feels very much like a Four Seasons. Quality linens and bathroom amenities, plasma TV's, and tasteful decor, by Vegas standards anyway. The $15 resort fee covers a lot of ground. WIFI is reliable, fast and easily available. The cafe at the lobby was closed for repair while we were there, but it looked nice. There is a Starbucks like coffee bar serving all types of snacks all day. The unfortunately named Bathhouse spa is quite nice and again very peaceful, if not for the fact that the plunging pool/whirlpool was not kept to the right temperature and the lounge area is not very tidy. The fitness center in the Bathhouse is not worth the $15 entrance fee. The equipment is not new, the room is windowless and cold, and again, not very tidy. The only complaint I would have to register is with the staff. While they are not difficult to deal with, they just don't try very hard when there is an issue. Granted, we got our resort fee to cover more than the standard going rate when we complained about things like extra towels, room service, and the like, the overall impression is that the service runs from adequate to disinterested to borderline rude (this is especially true at the spa and the cafe). But then again, this is Vegas and The Hotel is supposed to be an illusion of a first class hotel and not the real thing, so we didn't really mind. if you don't mind being at the far end of the strip, this is one of the best choices for hotels in Vegas at the 4.5 star level.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pinksims
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very chic and the rooms are lovely. Our bed was very comfortable, with two bathrooms, three TVs and wonderful views of the strip. The concierge was very helpful to us. Great place to stay in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel rooms in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: JohnfromCaloundra
Reviews.Content: Have been to Vegas many times, and without a doubt, this hotel is by far the nicest. The only catch is the view(or lack of it... Faced the back streets/freeway) and the noise from approximately 5am to 7am from the industrial shed behind the hotel(possibly the laundry room) . This was a minor detail as the hotel room (size/fittings/amenities) was a1. Go there!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms but the service level of a road side motel”
Reviews.Author: crash905
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a Luxury Travel conference. The front desk staff were great at check in and then it basically went down from there. The rooms are absolutely beautiful and large. All are suites. The Gym is extremely expensive to use and is not really worth it if you need it just for a regular daily workout.. Lots of food options in the main casino area. Service at THE Hotel and Mandalay basically is sub par and I found myself having to ask for the Managing Director at midnight. I have never heard of a hotel NOT being able to give a wake up call when someone wants it. It seems to be policy to only except calls for the 0, 15, 30 and 45 on the hour. When I asked for another time, I was told NO and that I had to speak to the supervisor. When they said NO I asked for the General Manager. Housekeeping is great and was the best part of my room stay. The Hotel rooms are large, comfy and plus. The service is horrible!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - some strange smells”
Reviews.Author: bingoSLC
Reviews.Content: Overall a good 2 days - the 7th floor was a bit sewer smelling. Not sure why - but do you really go to vegas to hang out in your hotel room. Bartender at the hotel bar was great! and Lion King was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice large suite, good facilities, the Beach is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Feyenoorder
Reviews.Content: I should preface that I am not a Vegas fan. But this hotel was excellent for Vegas at a conference. Check in is robotic, it's such a big complex, you feel like a number, the directions invariably get you lost. The room was huge, a two room suite, massive flat screen, two large bathrooms and a very comfortable large bed that I actually never slept in because I ended up sleeping on the couch of the suite every night coming home at 5 am. Food, well, the breakfast buffet is ok. There is an American restaurant that is quite good, and the bar -5 is totally worth checking out and having a drink at, quite a cool experience. The bar in the casino, eye candy is excellent and fun. Cat House, the night club is fun for a few hours too if you get the vouchers to go in for free and guest list, makes it easier. The best thing is the artificial beach. The life guards look like batwatch characters, the beach is huge and they have artificial waves you can body surf on. Try the acai berri absolut blueberry slushie on the beack AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: MVP70
Reviews.Content: This is a great property, has everything you would expect in Las Vegas. Few complaints, the location is not great if you want to walk the strip, it's down on one end, you really need a cab to get to the centre of things. They only had a cardio room (included with your stay) which had treadmills and other machines which were very busy. If you wanted to use the 'real' gym there was an additional cost by the day or for the week. I think if you are a guest there it should be included, especially at the room prices - not cheap!

Reviews.Title: “A grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: J_Bolowski
Reviews.Content: Everything about TheHotel exudes quality. Our suite was large and comfortable and was an excellent price. However what they don't charge for the room, they charge for everything else. I guess that is Vegas for you though. The only drawback is that the hotel is located right at the end of the strip meaning you have a little way to travel to reach the heart of the strip - if there is one. Each casino is a destination in its own right. With some many places to stay in Vegas there is something for everyone. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “THEking of the South Strip!”
Reviews.Author: sloppypickle
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to THEhotel far exceeded our expectations! We booked a V Suite and our suite was up on the 34th floor on the corner with a nice view of the strip. Self Parking wasn't too bad and valet parking was effortless. Check in on a weekday was a breeze and the staff were always attentive and helpful throughout our stay. The room was spotless top to bottom and the bed was super comfy too. The bathroom was nicely detailed with marble accents and a handy hairdryer too. Our room was cleaned thoroughly every day of our stay and we even had a visit from housekeeping upon our arrival to make sure everything was ok! The walk through the connecting hall to Mandalay Bay was very convenient for gambling etc but our room was far enough away that we heard no noise at all. A couple of tips: Make sure you go to the correct parking garage West on Hacienda Avenue PAST the Mandalay Bay and Four Seasons garages on the left side. Once you get the hang of it, it's a snap! There's a covered walkway to Luxor and Excalibur The TV channels in the room are few, but do you really go to Vegas to watch TV? Overall, a lovely visit at a very impressive South Strip Hotel! We WILL be back...often!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel. Great Decor.”
Reviews.Author: sonolum
Reviews.Content: THEHotel is really unique among the Vegas Hotels. I think this place really cators to the business travelers. This is the second time I have stayed at this place. My last visit here was with my bother during our most recent business trip to Vegas. The standard room here is just a par beyond a typical hotel room in Vegas, even when compared to other 5 star hotels here in town. You feel like you can really stretch out in your "room," as if you were in an high end apartment or condo unit rather a hotel room. As I understand it, every room here is a suite. The bathroom is HUGE...I love the large tub and the separate shower (it appears to be surrounded by granite). You get 1 1/2 baths in each unit. The rooms are all profesionally decorated. Separate living & sleeping rooms (not just "areas"), Two large flat screen TVs in each room. We stayed here for three nights for close to $95 dollars per night!! What a deal,,,My only complaint is that the wireless internet service is kind of slow here, but if you don't go wireless use the LAN connection, then it should be just fine. I highly recommend THEHOTEL to everyone, especially business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Any shine this hotel once had is gone...”
Reviews.Author: flyingblowfish
Reviews.Content: The shine is gone from this once nice hotel in Las Vegas. You would think in these hard economic times that this hotel and staff would pay attention to detail and stick to its advertised services and schedule. It seems now that guest not only have to clean their own rooms but can’t even rely on the staff to provide the operating hours for services. The reason I stayed here is because they advertise the spa opens at 0600 am. I bought a three day spa pass the day I arrived and verified that the spa was open the next morning at 0600 am. When I went to the spa I was told they open at 0930am. As if this wasn’t enough, room amenities include: Dirty toilet seat in the bedroom bath, looks like dried urine Broken toilet paper holder in the bedroom bath, there is no way housekeeping could service this toilet paper holder and not know it is broken. TV screen in the bathroom splattered with some substance, perhaps hair spray. Stainless steel sink in wet bar splattered with some sticky substance, perhaps soda pop. Large patch of dry crusty substance on wet bar. Light in bedroom soffits next to the window flickers and cycles on and off randomly when the heat runs. Called three times for a wake up call (dial 0) , the first two times the phone rang 20 times and was never answered, the third time someone finally picked up. When it was answered the third time and I enquired about why the phone wasn’t answered I was “brushed off” in s very dismissive manner. This This may be standard fare when staying at a motel 6 for $19.99 a night, but when I pay $150 to $200 a night, I expect the spa to be open during the advertised hours and the room to be clean when I check in. All this in the first 12 hours of a week long stay.

Reviews.Title: “THEhotel turned out to be a great choice”
Reviews.Author: marcyro
Reviews.Content: The two room set up is fantastic, both rooms are a nice size and pretty comfortable. Our room was extremely quiet, though I was very disappointed in the lumpy mattress! If the Marriott can do it in their mid-priced hotels, why can't Mandalay Bay have a decent mattress? There weren't enough pillows (only two) or any extra blankets in the room, so you'd have to get it from housekeeping and we just didn't. We were not in our room too much, but when we were we wished it had a coffee maker that you wouldn't have to pay the mini-bar prices to use. Also, though we weren't in the room much, when we were we noticed the TVs look nice but the service is terrible. Fuzzy picture and only a few "free" channels. One of the days, it was over 80 degrees, so we spent most of it at the pool -- which I have mixed feelings about. Our friend rented a cabana -- which was great, I recommend this. However, only the wave pool/lazy river were open. The other pools were closed for the season. You pay an extra $15 resort fee per day and it is irksome when part of it is closed. Also irritating was that the cardio room is included in the room fee, but it is an extra $15 per person to use the fitness center. On the one hand, I am not big on being charged for something I won't use, but on the other hand, I had nickel and diming more.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ConnieB1135
Reviews.Content: I thought The Hotel was lovely. Clean and well appointed. Of course, charging to make coffee in the room ($6.00 per cup) is rediculous, but you are in Vegas! You pay for everything. We also went to Mix and after making a reservation to eat there back in September, we were escorted to a table behind one of the large white pods. We had no view. So, the waiter could tell I was pissed off and he sent for the manager. I told him our story and he very quickly cleared off a table along the window and we had a very nice view. I thought the prices were outrageous, but, the food was good so we chalked it up to the experience. We also ate at Aureole and that was quite good also. Once again, very high prices, but thats normal for a Michelin rated restaurant. I thought the staff was very helpful and pleasant. What I was shocked at was the prices at Il Mulino in Ceasar's Palace Forum. My husband had ravioli stuffed with mushrooms and a champagne cream sauce - it was a special so we didn't know the price - that was $46.00 when the bill came. That is absolutely rediculous! I don't mind paying the price for good food, but it was ok at best, and the most rediculous price I have ever heard of for pasta. I had penne with ricotta and that was $26.00. I can go to Becco's in Manhattan for a pasta tasting of 3 different pastas (all homemade) that are delicious and its $20.00. Don't go there - its not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Decent if the customer service was up to par, mix really brings it down”
Reviews.Author: islander91
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice, we had a V suite with a nice strip view. We didn't ask for anything while we were there besides complaining to a manager about our mix experience which was flat out awful, and the girl at the front desk had us sit for 25 min in the lobby waiting for one. When no one came, and I told her we were gonna be on our way, there was no offer of "we will call your room, or come back at a certain time." I guess they assumed everything was ok. Here is my review/experience of mix and see if you think its ok.....(its a tad long, but entertaining I promise): So you know where I stand, I have taken 5 trips to vegas and and have never ever spent less than $1000 in one night between dinner and clubs, I go to have fun. I visited mix in the afternoon on my last trip to vegas in august of 2010 and thought the view was incredible. I was on that trip with some buddies and decided it would be a great place to take my girlfriend back to. I read the reviews and looked at the menu on the web, which looked a little dismal to begin with, but with her I was more concerned about the experience. Let me say I am not a picky person, and am very easy to please, in fact I have never even written a review before on tripadvisor...but it was a must after this debacle. I requested a table with a view 2 weeks in advance. Not to be picky but if your going to eat at the top of a hotel, this is kind of a no brainer. The 1st table they seated us was behind a pole with both seats facing the interior, I could see right there I was dealing with some real geniuses here. We got moved to one with a slight view when we stood up, but sadly most of the tables by the windows have you on top of another couple where you pretty much have to wait until they are done talking to speak, otherwise you would interrupt each other. The bus boy then poured our water only half way up in each glass...and I wondered why when he had a full pitcher. We found out after he left the table....he farted. The couple next to us smelled it too..disgusting. We got over this and just decided to make the best of it. The food: Terrible and overpriced. They obviously do a lot of cooking in the microwave. We had a couple apps which probably only made us even more hungry, and were so small I think they actually had a negative caloric value if that's possible. I live on Hilton Head Island which has excellent seafood restaurants and I don't think one of them charges $39 for a piece of fish. Someone needs to contact Vandekamps and let them know this place has stolen their frozen fish stick recipe and disguised it as chilean sea bass. It was not the price, I promise. It was the value, and satisfaction. I had one of the best meals of my life at Prime in the Bellagio the next night and paid $450 for 2, and would have paid double it was so good. I told them they can have the fish back and didn't even ask to replace it. The only thing even done after that was a man(if you can call him that) came over and in one long-winded, run-on sentence all in broken English said "I will take the fish off of your bill we will bring you something on the house for dessert." He walked off immediately, maybe even as he was mumbling. No pauses, no sorry bout the fish, not even a anything we can do? By his mannerisms he was clearly afraid to confront what was wrong and if I might have had some resolution. It was hard to watch them bring me the bill for $145 as my hunger pains were pounding inside me. $145 and they even took off one of the entrees. I was hoping my girlfriend had crackers in her purse but was not that lucky. I will never set foot in this place again knowing our cat eats consistently better than the patrons of this dump. It's funny the thing right below the review asks if I would recommend this place to a friend, you have to really not like someone to recommend this place. Go to prime/or del friscos, best in vegas. I informed the girl at the front desk that I had never written a review on here before<but would if something is not done and she pretty much could have cared less. But then again, we did think she might have been high, or still coming down from the night before. Regardless, she could have cared less. When someone comes all the way from the other side of the country to visit and is only in town for 3 days, time is money and we were just wasting it sitting there for nothing. I would go back to THE hotel if I thought they at least made an effort to resolve the situation. If it does get resolved I will gladly change and delete my review for them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: Spooner101
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the V suite and got an awesome deal on it. I wanted to get a room with a strip view and was told to get there extra early for early check in and got there at 11am but they didnt have any. The Hotel overall is clean and nice. The hallways feel luxurious. The rooms...well the hang out room is ok, it can fit max about 10 people. the bedroom is nice...the bed is a hotel bed and nothing really to get excited about. the bathroom was nice as well with his and her sinks. We did the people above us a little bit but was for the most part. Do not goto Mandalay Bay check in to get checked in, you have to find the TheHotel check in and the signage sucks...just once parked in the garage you gotta find the doors that goto theHotel. Overall theHotel is nice, and affordable. PS the do not disturb signs seem to be ignored by the cleaners.

Reviews.Title: “SO far up there own Butts!”
Reviews.Author: WDxDangermouse
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks great, Chic, sexy and lots of Marble. We paid ALOT of money to stay here, and we wished we had never booked it. The room was great except it was SOO dark, they were unable to give us another room. So I asked to swap to the Mandalay Bay hotel (later review). TheHotel really trys to give an image that it is unltra cool.. IT FALLS flat on its face when it comes to Reception Staff, Bar Staff, and the waiting staff in the Casino and its Stupidly over priced drinks... 2 Bud lites.... Guess what it costs, with no Tip... 18 DOLLARS! yes 18 Dollars! 2 normal glasses of diet coke off TAP (pump) ... 9 Dollars! 1 Coffee in the room, making it yourself with hotwater etc.. 7 dollars! in the 6 days we played in there Casina ( around 2 hours each day) we were approached twice by Waiting staff, and the 3rd time she forget where we were, and we never saw her ( yes we tipped everyone well! usually 5 dollars.) In releation to the Comps we spent over 2k in there Casino alone, and we were given about 40 dollars in comps. ( Not expecting much as they have the worse comps on the strip.. Advised on many many sites ) WARNING! You must make sure you have in EMAIL or screen printer your costs for the hotel. They dont honour there prices. When we booked it was $129 Exc Tax, and resort Fees of $15 Dollars, which adds to about $150 a night......... THERE IS A BIG HOWEVER! This is NOT what you pay per night, unless you book via a holiday company, you are at the whim of the hotel on its pricing. When checking in, I was advised they were busy, and that the rate would be honoured on the first night, but on the other nights it was $189 per night EXC Tax and resort fees,,, only after a long discussion and almost being called a lier did they bother to change the rate, and even then it only went to 169 per night EXC. So Folks.. DONT stay here if you are on a budget. I have paid many hundreds of euros for a hotel per night to stay, and can afford it. But to charge so much more is robbery...Also shop around.. alot of the hotels do not charge resort fees, and the comps start at half the level of this hotel

Reviews.Title: “No disappointments here.”
Reviews.Author: FLLKevin
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at THEhotel for a conference/convention and I must say I was very pleased with the experience. Check-in was quick and effortless. The front desk staff was very friendly. My suite (a v-suite) was very roomy, comfortable and clean. The nightstand in the bedroom showed some wear (scratches) but with the number of people that hotel sees in a year and the fact that people do not always treat hotels the way they do their own homes it did not bother me. After long days working a trade show in the adjacent convention center, I found it to be a peaceful and pleasant retreat. I ate breakfast each morning in the cafe. The service was quick, efficient and attentive. I must recommend the waffle with the honey marscapone, simply delicious. I went up to Mix Nightclub on the 64th floor. The views were amazing. Cool atmosphere, friendly staff and great drinks. I did not notice any unpleasant odors as some previous reviewers noted. I found the opposite. I felt that the effort THEhotel made with scents was perfect. Not overwhelming in any way. The aromas in the public spaces were in no way offensive. THEhotel was selected for me because of the location of the convention I was attending. I have stayed at other properties located more centrally on the strip. Being at the end was not that bad. It did make the trip to and from the airport almost effortless. I will stay again on a future visit. It was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Thought Thehotel was a Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: LovesVegas7
Reviews.Content: I visit Vegas at least two times each year, and have stayed in a number of different casino hotels. Each one has its pros and cons. I don't expect perfection, but I do expect a clean room, friendly service personnel, and a good rate. Stayed on Nov. 4 & 5. Had two suites, one of which was comped and the other was at a casino rate (through the MGM Players Club) of $99 for Thursday night and $119 for Saturday. I was a little worried due to some of the reviews. I am not easily pleased and I thought the entire experience was worthy of a high rating. Every service person we encountered was friendly and helpful. We asked for more towels to be brought up to our room both days and they arrived within 10 minutes or less - each time, we received a call confirming that our towels arrived. The person bringing the towels seemed appreciative to receive a tip, didn't seem as if it was expected. At one point 3 of us were in a hallway waiting for our friends to come out of their room, and one of the maintenance guys took the time to stop and make sure everything was ok. No problems with housekeeping. We switched our light from 'do not disturb' to 'housekeeping' and the room was clean when we came back to dress for the evening. Pros: Suite was roomy and clean with two bathrooms. The size of main bathroom was great - liked having separate bath and shower. Plenty of space for cosmetics, lotions, etc. Liked the large flat panel TV in the living area. Check in was smooth and calm, not chaotic like most of the other casino hotels. There was place to get coffee, danish, sandwiches, etc. just at the bottom elevators - a HUGE plus. Distance from Thehotel to the Mandalay Bay casino was not bad. We've stayed at The Signature Suites a couple of times, and even though we really like the property, the distance to the MGM casino can be a bit of a pain. Mix Lounge at the top of Thehotel was awsome. I've been wanting to visit for the last few years, but never found the time to get to that far end of the strip. It was top priority this time and I'll be sure to do it again. Went on Thursday eve, just after they opened at 5. Was a good time to arrive as we had our choice of where to sit (we chose the outside patio). By 5:45 or so, the patio was full and the inside was quite busy. So nice to watch the strip come to life with all the lights. Cons: First place I've stayed where I could easily hear people in the hallways, doors opening and closing, people upstairs and next door when they entered their room. I expect noise at all hours of the day and night, that's what Vegas is all about, but this was loud enough that it was hard to ignore. I slept on the couch, so might not have been as loud in the bedroom, would that keep me from staying again - no. With exception to Luxor and Excalibur, takes time to get from here to other locations. We spent a good amout of our two days walking from here to there. Its not the walking for me that's a problem, its the wasted time, I only had two days : ). The lack of affordable places to eat onsite was also missed. That won't be a con for everyone, but for my weekend trip, I don't use a lot of my Vegas budget of time and money on high end restaurants and food. The lighting in the bathroom off the bedroom wasn't the best for hair and makeup : ). The smaller bathroom was better. Overall I really liked TheHotel and will probably stay there in July for our 7 night trip - Can't wait !

Reviews.Title: “Would love to return to this hotel again and again.”
Reviews.Author: Mendelssohnian
Reviews.Content: THEhotel has beautiful, modern, comfortable and quiet rooms. We stayed at THEhotel because its room size is bigger than the Mandalay Bay ones. However, both hotels share the same wave pool, lazy river, sandy beach, and other pools. We loved all the pools, especially the wave pool and the lazy river. We were told to be there first thing they opened in order to get a good spot by the pool. We went in the summer because of the great promotion that they were offering: 89.00 per night plus two complimentary drinks and one free buffet meal. The service was excellent and the best part was the bed. We all felt like we were sleeping on cloud 9! I've been to many parts of Europe and there is no way you can get 5-stars hotels like this with the price we paid for! Our children from age ten down to four all loved the pools, the room and the buffet. The only minus is that they don't have a food court so most of the time you ended up eating in a restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay but not worth a 5* rating”
Reviews.Author: yazoo2
Reviews.Content: pros: - the room was a massive suite, which we loved; - THE Hotel was at the end of the strip, so it was a bit quieter than the rest of the strip - The beach/pool area was really good Cons: - the room was really tired looking and very dark - the room wasn't very clean with quite a few stains around it on the floor, walls and for some reason the ceiling - lots of extra changes to use things, such as the gym. I asked THE Hotel when I book was there access to a free gym and they said yes. This isn't true, there is free access to a fitness room (no weights) which was a 15 minute walk from THE Hotel through the casino Would we stop again? No, we've been in hotels just as good that were much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay, and I Am Picky!”
Reviews.Author: ozmadenver
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at THEhotel, and I was surprised, since I am a very picky traveler. I generally stay at places like The Four Seasons and fully expected to be underwhelmed. But I was quite pleased. The service was excellent, the suite was nice, cleaned well. Concierge was very knowledgeable too. Room service was yummy and had an original menu. Internet was free. And best of all, the rates were killer! I think I got a better deal since I booked through AMEX Platinum Travel, but AAA Rates were similar. The mattress wasn't great, and the towels were below par, but by no means un-usuable. Friends of mine stayed at Bally's and paid a little bit less than we did for a lot less in service, style, and comfort! I threw all kinds of wild requests at the staff, and they met all expectations. I really liked too that the hotel wasn't huge, which saved a lot of walking time to the lobby etc. Finally, the biggest rap against this hotel is its location at the south end of the strip. It's actually not that big a deal. Since overnight parking is free at THEhotel, rent a car and drive yourself to the rest of the strip. Or just take the bus. Trust me, it's worth the hardship!

Reviews.Title: “restful sanctuary to a busy city”
Reviews.Author: worldwanderer75
Reviews.Content: THEhotel is very sleek, very modern and a wonderful quiet sanctuary to return to after a busy day shopping and sight seeing. The aroma of white flowers hits you as soon a s you walk into the lobby area and immediately calms your frazzled nerves. It is a little tricky to navigate your way around the Mandalay Bay property however and you need your map with you. There are some brilliant places to eat without having to leave the resort area, although many are rather expensive. The House of Blues is a great night out and well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place - Definitely will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Freeway12
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas for a conference and my husband went along. We stayed an additional 2 nights so I could also have some lesiure time. When checked in we were automatically put in TheHotel. It's a beautiful place. The room with the separate living area was very much appreciated since we were in Vegas for 6 nights. We ate at several restaurants and had very good food We also used the lazy river pool and wave pool. We had no problems with finding space at the pool but it was October (Best time of year to go on vacation since all the kids are at school). Everyone at the hotel was very, very friendly. Room was cleaned and towels and amenities replaced every day. It was quite a walk to the the main areas of Mandalay Bay and also a LONG walk to the conference center but I didn't mind. Gave me some exercise. Only complaint about the Mandalay Casino was the slots did not pay off at all. Didn't see anyone winning anything and heard alot of mumbles. Seems they should pay off a little now and then if they want to keep the business there. Had much better luck at the Golden Nugget and Freemont St Casinos. We will definitely stay at TheHotel again next time we go to Las Vegas. Thanks to everyone at THEHotel for an unforgettable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great value”
Reviews.Author: BryanBoerne
Reviews.Content: I was most impressed with the quality and furnishings of the rooms, given the price. I paid about $160-170 per night, and a comparable room in most other cities would have been two to three times higher. I would thoroughly recommend THEhotel to anyone traveling to Vegas. The only 'down'...it was some distance to the casino floor, but not overly cumbersome to negotiate.

Reviews.Title: “Thehotel still very nice, but.....”
Reviews.Author: Garydreamz
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at Thehotel. The rooms are beginning to show their age just a bit, but still very sweet. If you can get a deal you should stay here for sure, but we would not pay the listed prices for any hotel. After all its just a place to sleep, but a very nice place. The weather was not good so we did not use the pool, but it is beautiful. I suspect when the weather is nice it's as nice as advertized. Had dinner at Mix. Views are great, but only a few tables are situated to get the full effect. Food was just fair, really nothing special. We had a $50.00 coupon we paid $4.00 for. No wine and still the bill was over $100. The waiter did not add the 18% tip, as stated in the coupon, saying he did not feel he gave us the service we deserved. That was OK but at these prices, and the way they promote themselves as fine dinning, is there any excuse for not providing excellent service? Not acceptable. We gave him $25.00 anyway, but I would not reccommend this place for a special occassion. We will not be going back. Finaly the casino. It's bright and big. During the day its not a bad place to play.At night we hated it. A very loud and bad rock band was plying in the casino bar. I guss i've just grown old, but I don't understand why casinos put loud bands out so everyone has to listen to them. Put them in a theater or club, so if you like it, great go, and if not, you don't have it forced on you. Even worse is the pittiful "Party Pit." One girl dancing around to loud hip hop. I don't know who looked the most board, her or the 3 or 4 guys playing black jack. These things work great at The Palms, Hard Rock, or Planet Hollywood, but not so much here. Would definitely return to Thehotel, but would not spend a lot of time here when not in the room itself.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun for Kids”
Reviews.Author: gaucho1987
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and had a great stay with a comfortable room. My boys loved the aquarium and had a great time at the pool with the wave pool and lazy river. If you go when it's extremely hot, it's great to rent a gazebo/cabana (worth the expense if you plan to be there all day with a fan, TV, pool floats and great service). We got breakfast at the cafe to-go in the lobby (better prices and easier). Hotel staff was incredibly helpful and knowledgeable when my son got sick - he became dehydrated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but problems exist”
Reviews.Author: PhxPE
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a few times (most recently toward the end of 2008). I have always enjoyed it but this time there were some glitches and problems that just made it less enjoyable than I prefer. The problems centered around my door lock. It was showing a blinking yellow light when I tried to unlock the door. This apparantly indicates that the dead bolt is in use although I was on the outside of the room and was the only guest for that room. Facilities was contacted by the front desk at 11:20 am the first time it happened and the door was fixed at 1:20pm later that day. That night, the problem started again. I could not get in my room at 10:30pm. Security and Facilities was called by the front desk and the first response was around 11:15 pm. I was in the room by 11:30 but Facilities didn't show up until 11:45. The door was fixed by 12:15 am. THere were a couple of other issues with the room that were not as inconvenient. One is that the shower stall leaked (not at the door gasket but I think at the seal around the shower base) so after taking a shower, the floor by the bathroom door would have standing water. Not the end of the world after I noticed it the first time (by sliding on it but not falling). Finally, the bed was not as comfortable as others in town. I think it is just wearing out. There were some nice parts of the hotel experience also. The front desk people who helped me with my door issues were friendly and empathetic. Also, the casual restaurants at Mandalay were very good and staffed with friendly people. The room itself is still nice. A real suite with a nice tub (but no jets). I prefer other places to this one as I am also not a fan of the Mandalay casino. A lack of luck and dealers who are not always overtly friendly can put a damper on things. (Also, this is usually hooker heaven late at night which I find offputting.) There are better hotels on and off the strip and unless you have a meeting at Mandalay, I would try someplace else. (By the way, like many of the strip hotels, there is a resort fee (about $15) which includes 2 drinks, newspaper you have to go get, fitness center access, and wireless internet in the room.)

Reviews.Title: “Love, love the large bathtub and fragrance in the Lobby”
Reviews.Author: JRenee1212
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas with the DH for our 10 year anniversary... We enjoyed THEhotel very much. We consider the location be a bonus as it is in what we considered the nicer part of town and felt very close to everything. It takes no time at all to go from Mandalay Bay to the Excaliber three doors down the strip. The only complaint is that the tram between Mandalay Bay, Luxor & Excaliber seems to close down too early (like 10pm weekdays and 11pm weekends) which is ridiculus if you go to a late show and have to end up walking back to your hotel after a full day of exploring - but in reality this isn't the hotels fault. Loved the huge bathtub with it's little waterfall spout and the fact that we had two toliets in the suite. Bedding was nice. Decor was pleasing. The buffet was awesome. They give you a his & hers robe & slippers to wear in your room as well as bath salts for the tub along with the standard soaps, shampoo, conditioner, sewing kit, shoe buffer, showercap, and hair dryer. Hubby loved all the mirrors in the room's decor too. I really liked the fragrance they pipe into the hotel too. I couldn't place what the smell was and when I asked the front desk they wouldn't divulge the secret :) We didn't get a chance to get to the pool/beach which is unfortunate, but I hear it closes at like 5pm. That seems really too early to me but I can't complain since I didn't use it I guess. We also couldn't find it from our wanderings from our hotel but after review of the property map we realized you have to access it from the other hotel - Mandalay. I wasn't all that pleased with the view from our room but after further inspection from outside on the street level I could tell that the bigger Mandalay Bay hotel would block the view of the strip and pool so I settle for the view of the far off mountains, freeway, and view of the Rio and Palms. I enjoyed the shopping connected to the hotel at Mandalay Place. I think I visited Lush every night for bath supplies. Didn't bother to check out the ICE bar since I'm from Michigan and being cold doesn't interest me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room; appalling service.”
Reviews.Author: msc007
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to stay at TheHotel after reading the reviews here. Alas, our expectations were shattered. When we reserved, we made a point to say that we were coming to celebrate my 40th birthday, and the reservations agent assured us that this would be "recognized" at the thotel. We mentioned it at check-in (and tipped), and asked for the nicest room available. We were given a perfectly OK room, but on a low floor and with no view - clearly not an upgrade. Then, not one thing was done during our entire stay to recognize my birthday. We also had asked about the beach and pool when we booked, and were assured that everything was on full schedule in mid-October. But on our arrival, we learned that there is no longer a pool at TheHotel (or it was closed for the winter - we didn't get a clear answer to that), the Mandalay Bay pools closed at 6pm and stopped serving drinks at 5 even though it was 90 degrees out, and the Moorea Beach Club was closed during the week. A huge disappointment. Three times, we asked the concierge for restaurant suggestions. The first (a guy) was obnoxious and treated us like we were idiots to ask for suggestions at all. The second (a woman) acted like we were wasting her time by asking for suggestions or information. The third time, the same woman was there. We asked her to help us make a reservation for our birthday celebration dinner. She was extremely rude about it, but did make a couple of calls. We decided to go to Olives, and while she reluctantly booked us a table, she REFUSED even to ask them to seat us outside, and said it was "up to the restaurant." The room itself was fine - a very spacious suite with nice furniture and a really nice, big bathroom. But aside from having good space and "looks," the room was nothing special. The soaking tubs don't have jets, which would have been a nice touch. The lighting was terrible - even with every light in the suite on, it was extremely dim. The sheets very rough, poor quality, the towels felt thin, and even the toilet paper was rough and cheap-feeling. The housekeeping was spotty - some days, our bathroom amenities were only partially replaced (with no apparent logic to how), and at least one day, some of our towels and the bathmat were not replaced (dirty ones were taken, but no clean ones left). We played several nights in the Mandalay Bay casino, and on two of those nights, even though it wasn't very busy, and our table was one of the few with many occupied chairs, we waited for over an hour without a single cocktail waitress approaching the table. Overall, we felt taken advantage of at TheHotel. There was nothing pampering, luxurious, or welcoming about our experience there, and we didn't even get the most basic hospitality, let alone the level of service advertised.

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay anywhere else in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SoloTraveler323
Reviews.Content: I hesitate to give this place a glowing review for fear too many other people will "discover" this hotel and drive up the prices--but it was fantastic and worthy of a great review. I was flying back to LA via Vegas from a two week trip in Spain and just wanted a great suite to crash in for a couple of days before returning to LA. I booked a "V Suite" knowing almost nothing about the hotel except that other reviews described it as quiet, modern and chic, and that their V Suite was less expensive than similar rooms at Encore, the Wynn, etc. I wasn't in Vegas to gamble or see the shows, I was there to relax in a fabulous room & a fabulous hotel. I was ELATED with my room. The photos on the website don't quite do it justice. Every detail was perfect: the fantastic honey-orange scented toiletries (including bath salts!), the two different kinds of incredible bathrobes!, the jar of cotton balls & cotton swabs, the lights on dimmer switches, the his & hers slippers, the good quality full size hair dryer...I could go on. The fantastic bed & bedding, the color palette, the SILENCE of the bathtub draining ( I mean, totally silent!), the silent AC... The suite was large and gorgeous. And the bathroom is to die for--biggest, deepest bathtub you can imagine. I booked this suite primarily because other described the bathtub as being huge and I was not disappointed! The decor and ambience of the rest of the hotel is calm, modern, upscale, low key. The Spa is beautiful--I toured it but didn't have enough time for treatments. Next time I definitely will. The room service food was excellent (the baked gruyere mac & cheese for $8 is a fantastic deal!) and not ridiculously overpriced. Huge cobb salad for $18, to give you an idea. Drawback: it does take forever to get room service. When they say 45 minutes, they mean it. It always took 40-45 minutes, even just for a pot of coffee, even at 5:00 am! The coffee bar in the lobby area has many items like cookies, coffee, salads and sandwiches packaged to-go, so if you don't feel like waiting for room service, try there. The peanut butter cookie is the bomb! Friendly staff, everyone seemed very accomodating. If you're looking for a quiet, upscale place to chill out for a couple of days, this is it, in a V Suite. I didn't venture over to Mandalay Bay, but never felt the need. For what I wanted, this was absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: ssarmazi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at this all-suite hotel. The suite was great: comfortable bed, huge bathroom with great bathtub and shower, a powder room, big screen TV in living room and another TV in the bedroom. What more could you ask for? And all for about $150/night. I've stayed in dumps during business trips along the East Coast that cost $200+.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Long Distances to Pool & Restaurants, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: MarshBruce
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly ugly entrance in a garage best fit for a B movie chase scene. You walk thru that garage to get to the restaurants unless you wish to add a two or three city blocks to your walk. Also, as your vehicle pulls up to entrance you go over a spine hammering speed bump no matter how slow the vehicle is going. Be prepared for waiting in a long line to check it. This "fancy" hotel even puts advertisements on its room keys! The room I was first given had a soffit impinging into the space, from the adjoining wing of rooms; when I inquired, the front desk said all were that way, but that was not true, just the 701, 801, etc. There was no space to sit at the desk. Request for change, told impossible, and "maybe" for the next day. The telephone in the room did not work. Told it could not be fixed until after noon the next day, as they have no one in the hotel who fixes phones and they need to callt their outside telephone contract service group. The next day upon request I did obtain another room, very nice suite, comfortable, clean, with excellent housekeeping and turndown service. Five hours after room change I was informed by a clueless front desk person that my room change was now available. Shower did not work; repaired after only two calls. I planned business meetings in the early mornings in my suite, and requested early makeup; the first day no problem, the second day I was informed there was no one to do it until 9am, the third day I was informed there was no one to do it until 9:30 am; yep, you guessed it, the fourth day I was informed there was no one to do it until 10am. The convention information TV channel did not work; took four calls and two day to be repaired. (Also, limited TV channel choice.) The sink did not drain. Took three calls and two days to be fixed. I was told that the inside portable communication didn't work well so repair wasn't getting the message. Excellent concierge services. Be prepared for a $15/day "resort" fee to be added to your rate, which gives you the privilege of picking up, yourself, a USA Today at three designated spots in the casino/hotel. No newspaper room delivery. You get wireless internet with the resort fee. Very very long walk to Mandalay Bay convention center. Long walk to very crowded pool area where there is no service personnel; be sure to pick towels up when you walk in as there are no set-up personnel; and very limited drink service. No special pool for "The Hotel". And no shade; scarce umbrellas. Long walk to restaurants. The Cafe at The Hotel was closed all the time during my five day visit. Disappointed in Shanghai Lily's: beef in noodle dish tasted rotten. Management did not seem to be upset by this, but did replace the dish. Bayside Buffet very nice, buy Wynn's is better. Noodle restaurant good, but limited tea selection. So for great rooms suites and turndown service and concierge, this is the place. For convenience, uncrowded pool with service personnel, nearby restaurants, good hotel service, think about the Tower at Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “You won't believe how much you'll love this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: danger2909
Reviews.Content: the Hotel at Mandalay Bay is quite possibly my new favorite hotel in Vegas. This was my 5th trip to Vegas, third this year. Previous favorites included The Aria, Mandalay Bay, Luxor.
