This hotel has everything! The room was excellent, plenty of space, two big screen tvs, wonderful beds. The bathroom was spacious and well planned. The toiletries were wonderful in case you didn't bring your own. Checking in was especially nice, friendly service. The desk clerk was incredibly nice, and explained all the extra perks involved with the stay. The lobby smelled WONDERFUL! The elevators were easy to find, as well as the room. The only problem, if you would call it a problem would be the walk to the pool. The pool is by far the most amazing pool I've ever been too. We rented a cabana both days, pricing wasn't bad($350 for a poolside cabana with tv and fridge). The service at the pool was great! The food was also excellent. Checkout was great as well, did this over the phone. Cab trip to and from the airport was about 15$ each way.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: queenbt12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I actually got married at Mandalay Bay. We flew 40 of our friends and family to Vegas for the ceremony. We stayed in one of the penthouse rooms and had our reception catered by Mandalay Bay. It was awesome. The room was beautiful and spacious. The service was outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Check all the hidden costs!”
Reviews.Author: MDaman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to do an impromptu honeymoon the day after our wedding to vegas. The hotel was nice, the room was nice however upon checking out you find out that those black mugs that they have in the room that doesn't have a price tag anywhere actually costs $7 per cup. We were thorough when reading the bar prices- the mugs were not stated anywhere. After checking out we received a $200 bill for all our "free" coffee which in the end is not a big deal since we got to keep the mug, but a month later I check my credit card bill and find out that they charged me an extra $90 for late checkout- of course they don't mention that they charge for a late checkout and realistically we were charged $90 for checking out two hours past regular time?! They have a ton of hidden costs on amenities you would consider to be basic and for those reasons alone I would never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, little too fancy”
Reviews.Author: SFBee009
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, room was clean and comfortable. The pool was too crowded, the beach sand is not what it seems like on their web page pictures. There is no cheap(er) restaurant in the hotel, you have to eat expensive or go to a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the escape from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: LTR03
Reviews.Content: I just love The Hotel ... you can escape all the noise of the casino's, yet they are just a few steps away! The pool is great for families or pay for privacy at the adults only pool! The rooms are large and the staff don't bother you to clean your room --- sleep in as long as you wish!

Reviews.Title: “THEBest”
Reviews.Author: porkroll
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Quiet and upscale. My wife and I got the suite for two nights, which was very large, comfortable, and affordable. Unlike other hotels, you don't have to walk through the casino maze/madness to get out or go to restaurants. Restaurants are casual yet elegant and are largely Asian themed but all cuisines available. Catch the Happy Hour specials, especially Strip Steak for the 1/2-priced oysters (yum), steak tartare and duck fat fries. Only drawback is that hotel is at the very southern end of the strip but you can hop on a free tram to Luxor and then Excalibur and walk from there. If you must have a valet go ahead, or park in free Self-Park and cut through the parking lot at Casino level to the lobby. This was my first time to Vegas and my wife's second. She thought this hotel was the best, and I can't say I like Las Vegas but this hotel made the stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: ckso
Reviews.Content: For those who are traveling with kids to las vegas, this is a great place to stay. It's a non-gaming hotel and the elevators to the room close to the parking lot and checkin. A short walk away is Mandalay Bay for those who want to gamble or use the pool facilities. Room was a suite complete with living room, bedroom, 2 bathrooms and 3 TVs.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury and a beach resort feel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: marie8ciel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September in celebration of our 25th wedding anniversary and enjoyed a lazy river swim and Beach setting with a wicked wave pool every day of our stay. The buffet on site was affordable and had an excellent selection no matter which meal we tried there. The Casino was not too busy and you could always find a slot machine you could spend hours playing on with just a $20 investment. Best part was the free shuttle train through the Luxor and Excalibur to the heart of the Las Vegas Strip near the MGM Grand resort. Very much enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A touch of luxury”
Reviews.Author: SleepyBearSaskatoon
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Loved all the small details they put into the product like the lighting of the room, the tv in the washroom, the ipod radio, the ease of billing, and the friendly service. Great job, keep up the good work. First impression are everything and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: ResortSpaLady
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite hotels in vegas and I stay here for conferences and business most of the time. I love the modern decor of the suites and the view of the strip. There is a starbucks right out of the casino in the mall that is easy to get to. And also a very lovely cafe downstairs near the elevators that has great food to eat in or take with you. City Center is easy to access from the hotel and the bellstaff and valet are some of the best in Vegas. They have several nice restaurants and buffets but room service is outstanding in the presentation and the quality. And I never miss a visit to the spa that is worth the visit in itself. The house of blues usually have tops acts playing and it is a few steps away from the room. Don't forget to visit the MIX restaurant which is at the TOP of the HOTEL--try to get table outside so that you can enjoy the fresh air and a spectacular view of the strip. And last, but not least, I like having a doorbell on my suite ;-). With all this being said, it is expensive with internet, resort fees, etc adding to the bottom line but the experience is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Only place I will stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dbubbadog1
Reviews.Content: After many different stays in Vegas, everywhere from the old Lady Luck to Pallazo, this is my go to hotel after 2 decades. I have always had great service from the front desk to housekeeping to the bell service, never a rude individual and always prompt. The location is a definite selling point for me, far end of the strip away from the mad crowds but a short trip via tram to the heart of the Strip. All the ammenities of Mandalay but much nicer rooms and the best bed I have found ever in Vegas, even if ya don't sleep much when you do it's nice to have one this nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, absolutely loved it, will be back for sure!!!”
Reviews.Author: Richlady99
Reviews.Content: Our group was made up of 8 ladies. We booked two suites via players card so the rooms were comped. Our stay was from Sept 30 to October 4th. Check in was easy and quick. The man who checked us in was so nice and polite. He made sure to say hi to everyone in our group and just made us feel special. We got two rooms on the 16th floor (16906 and 16912). What really made our day was the first night when we got back to our hotel there was 8 chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us on the table. They were soooo good. What a nice touch!!! The rooms were clean and spacious. Huge main bathroom. The bathtub was huge and the shower was great. The water pressure was just right and the water was always hot even after 5 staight 20-25 minute showers!!! Beds were very comfortable. Distance from the hotel to the main stip was a bit of a walk, but nothing too major. There is a tram that will take you right to the Excalibur and than you have quick walkways to either the MGM Grand or to New York New York. The location suited us fine. Casino was nice and open. Didn't feel crowded at all. Cocktail service was quick and efficient. The casino smelled fresh not stale smoke. Had good gambling luck there. Pool: Best pool complex in Vegas. A nice sandy beach with a wave pool and a lazy river. Resort Fee was kind of a turn off but at the end I did need to use the internet thoughout my stay and plus you do get free drink coupons at the sports bar so in all it was worth it. Final thoughts: LOVED IT and felt so pampered. Everyone from the check in desk to the maids, were so polite and accomodating. I highly recommend staying here!!! You will have a wondeful time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Still nice but don't like getting nickel and dimed”
Reviews.Author: happytravels1212
Reviews.Content: This is still a good place to stay with access to the great Mandalay hotel pool. A medium to high end hotel where they are starting to charge too much for the extras. Every basic hotel has a coffee machine but they try to charge $8 to "use" the in room coffee machine and another $4 per coffee. This is on top of resort fees of $16 per day.We tried to get one hour extended check out time and they wanted $59. Their loss as we would have stayed at pool and had a few expensive drinks. I think they call it pennywise and pound foolish.

Reviews.Title: “Best spot on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: barn0ld05
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel I have stayed at in Vegas. While it is a part of the huge Mandalay Bay complex, it is off to the side and feels like a completely seperate hotel. You have the benefit of the casino, great restaurants, pool and other MB amenities while getting to stay in an awesome suite far enough away from the madness. I want to point out that we had a low floor suite and didn't hear one sound in our time there. It was completely quiet and serene. Highlights of the suite include - comfy bed, big shower and lots of space. The staff at TheHotel couldn't have been nicer. I also found the best rate at TheHotel among similar "nicer" hotels on the Strip. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a fun Vegas getaway!

Reviews.Title: “great rooms and excellent pool ... just a little too far away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: JTGLS
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with out two children (8 year old and 1 year old) so we did not really get to experience the "adult" facilities of the hotel HOWEVER, we were in THE V Suite which had two bathrooms, a living room and one bedroom. The bedroom was separated by the living room with a solid heavy door so we could watch TV at night while baby was asleep in the bedroom and the bedroom had great block out blinds which were great to keep the baby asleep. Pool area was MASSIVE! kids will love the wave pool and everyone will love the lazy river. Restaurants were good but we thought a little pricey for the quality of food. The only two recommendations we had was 1. Hotel was too far off the strip and because of the extreme heat most nights rather than walking back we would get a taxi as although we could handle it the kids were just too hot and exhausted. As a result of this even though THEHotel was great I would probably book somewhere more central on the strip next time. 2. We booked in for four nights one of them being Saturday night. The pool area on both the Saturday and Sunday was a little too "adult" for our children's eyes. Too many people and too much alcohol. By Monday the pool area was a lot more child friendly. However we booked knowing this so it is definitely not a complaint just a recommendation to families when booking for the first time to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: ehorsman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because during a weekend convention. We never left the hotel, since it has everything you need or could ever want. Plus we were at the auto auction most of the time, which was the main purpose of our trip. We arrived early, 8am, and the hotel "allowed" us a free early check-in. So off the bat I was happy and our room was fabulous. Like other Vegas hotels, the Mandalay complex is HUGE. It took some time to figure out where the pool area was but was ecstatic after we found it. The wave pool was fun, service was okay, but there were plenty of "pool police" to make sure where you could or could not lay or drink beer. That was kind of irritating. There are plenty of restaurant choices to choose from. We sampled Border Grill and Tratorria del Lupo, both were excellent and I would def eat at either again. The Casino was nice, all the dealers we had were pleasant and charming. You may request your table be a non-smoking table if all players are in agreement. Although we reqeusted a non-smoking room, the towels smelled horrendously of stale smoke. Plus the towels were super thin and felt like sandpaper. I know I am in Vegas, but try to keep the towels somewhat fresh-smelling. If money were not an object, I would like to stay again, but their weekend prices are a little pricey for me. This is not "old-school' Vegas anymore. I guess visiting during the week would ease the price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here,,,,”
Reviews.Author: ScottA72
Reviews.Content: I really don’t understand how the management for this hotel is thinking! Service should be the base for any hotel but not in this Hotel!!! I have been charged $ 5.00 dollars for printing 1 page in their business center, Internet is not free either! Don’t choose this hotel for your stay in Vegas...

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, disappointing facilities”
Reviews.Author: deorr
Reviews.Content: For a facility that advertises itself as a luxury hotel THE HOTEL's service and facilities compared poorly with other Las Vegas hotels and even the average Hilton. We encountered long lines to check in and out. Housekeeping walked right into our room without knocking and even though the "do not disturb" light was on. Our room's bathroom was very nice and had a large in-ground tub. However the room itself looked worn and run-down. The Mandalay Bay pool shared with THE HOTEL is also very nice, but any facility worth going to carried a hidden fee (e.g. $33 resort fee). The "cardio room" was overcrowded and offered approximately 20 machines shared among hundreds of guests at THE HOTEL and Mandalay Bay. Several of the machines were broken. A nice gym was available for an extra $15 a day.

Reviews.Title: “A Luxurious Gem to Stay At”
Reviews.Author: ten96lt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at THEhotel with my uncle to see the Barrett Jackson auto auction next door. The room was absolutely phenomenal. There was a large flat screen TV in the living room with a couch which made it great for down time and no worry about disturbing your roommate if they are sleeping. The living room had a large desk and plenty of outlets to plug in your electronics. The bathroom was very spacious and clean. Only problem was the shower always seemed to give very hot or very cold water. I struggled to get it to a happy medium, and even that was more cool water than warm. I have read reviews about the service being poor here, but that was not the case during my stay. The housekeeping staff was very friendly and attentive. The front desk was able to take care of any concerns we had and didn't make it seem like we were a both and were always friendly. It was also shocking how quiet the halls were, even with such a large event like Barrett Jackson, it seemed like were were only one of a few people staying. Overall it was a great place to stay and with access to Mandalay Bay's amenities, it's a first rate hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucian83
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable suite with 2 rooms, 2 TV's and 1 1/2 baths.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed - Poor service - Stay Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Hotelier247
Reviews.Content: I stayed with THEhotel in September for a business trip as we were having a conference at the Mandalay Bay Convention Center. Check In - When I first arrived I walked down the hallway to the front desk and assumed I would have a quick check in as there were only 2 people ahead of me at the desk. This was not the case. There 6-7 people working the desk. 2 were helping a guest, and the others were just sitting around. There must have been some issues ahead of me because both guests were there for about 15 minutes each. My check in process took 5 minutes so the grand total was about a 20 minute check in. This was completely unacceptable. Room- Room was wonderful. Very clean. The only flaw I found was some dirty around the cracks of the bathtub, and the only reason I found it is because I look. Just something I do since being in the hospitality business. Nice lay out, two double beds, separate living area with desk and three flat screens (1 in the bed room, 1 in the living room and a small one in the bathroom). I had no view, just a parking lot, but that was no problem since I wasn't there to be in my room. Service – EXTREMELY poor. I got back to my room on the second night at about 2:00am and felt a little hungry. I called down to room service and place my order; she said fine 55 minutes and hung up. I called back 2 minutes later to cancel the order because I was not going to wait almost an hour for an sandwich and she put me on hold for 5 minutes and came back on the line and told me I could cancel but they were going to charge me as they already starting making the food. I asked are you sure they started since I just called. She said “Yes and it should be up soon”. I said great and have a good night. 45 minutes later the food was still not there. I called the front desk and spoke to one of the managers. Very professional and told me I wouldn’t be charged for it and it should be there any minute. I said no problem hung up, and 20 minutes later the food came. I couldn’t complain it took much longer, it was free right? On the third night, a collage and I wanted to go grab a drink. Well everywhere you go in the casino they had out free drink coupons to their lounges. We walked into one, hand the bar tender the coupon and she said “O, we don’t take these” as she threw it back to us and walked away. We were in shocked at the attitude she had. We went to the front desk and spoke to the manager who basically sat there, nodded her head and said she would pass it on to the F&B manager. What’s the point to handing out drink coupons if they don’t do anything? Needless to say, we went outside the casino/hotel for our cocktail. Check-Out- My last night there, I called before going to bed and ordered two wake up calls 5:30 and 5:45 as I had a shuttle picking me up at 6:15. Well, low and behold my blackberry goes off at 6:30 and wakes me up. I did not receive either one of the wake up calls. Rushed to get my stuff together and ran down to check out. Clerk was rude and insisted I received my wake up calls and told me I was wrong. He handed me my bill and can you guest what was on there? Yes, the room service fee. I told him I had the issue and his night manager told me it was going to be comp’d. He again insisted I was wrong and told me I never spoke to a manager. As much as I wanted to stay there and argue, I had to get to the airport. Jumped outside and caught a cab. $20 later I was there. Also, I forgot to mention I had previously prepaid for that shuttle I over slept and missed. So it cost me a total of $40 dollars for a return ride to the airport. In summary, I feel that the service was unacceptable. THEhotel was clean, except for the hallway leading from the casino to THEhotel’s lobby, always smelt like a dirty diaper. I think it was the cleaning chemicals they used, but besides that it was really clean. Unfortunately, clean only goes so far. It is service that really matters and they completely dropped the ball. My company announced they would be holding the conference next year at Mandalay Bay and I will be staying at a different property.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms in a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Redrover2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at THEhotel at Mandalay Bay Resort for our September anniversary. We were very pleased with our experience there. THEhotel is located in the Mandalay Bay Resort and is connected to the Mandalay Casino, but is located far enough away from the casino floor to be a quiet, peaceful place to relax. The service was excellent, from the valet parking to the registration desk to the bellmen. Our suite was large, with separate living and sleeping spaces. There was a spacious master bathroom, with separate shower and huge garden tub and private toilet space. There was a half-bath in the living space. Our suite was spotlessly clean, very quiet and the bed was super-comfortable. I would suggest that valet parking be used, because the elevators from the self-parking garage open into the Mandalay Bay Hotel space, causing some confusion about where the registration desk is.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful suite -quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: cathybrisbane
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 5 nights on our honeymoon. Really enjoyed the quiet of the hotel area after the madness of the rest of strip and Mandalay bay sister hotel.the lobby and decor is very tasteful and stylish. Our suite was a great size having never stayed in one before - it was fabulous to have so much room! downsides..no robes in our wardrobe -just hangers where they should have been.the sofa was a little tired looking..housekeeping was a real let down - obviously staff arent given enough time to clean rooms thouroughy...bathroom floor pretty dirty after day 2, i spilled a little bit of lotion on duvet cover and they never changed it - even though it was noticeable! same cover all 5 nights...dirty wine glasses left in room the whote time...trays of food left in corridor from room service for days!! however i still really enjoyed the immense bathtub and tv's in every room!! other disappoinments where the pool ...obviously vegas is party town - but didnt expect to see drunk couples having sex in the pool - pool attendants looking at them and not even slighty bothered!!!! too many drunk meatheads around - oblivious to the kids and just normal fun-loving tourists like myself about...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yridian
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I went to Vegas, first time was back in 2000. We stayed at the Excalibur that time. I was disappointed with how cool it looked on the outside, only to find 'motel' room like quality with the rooms inside. So when I decided to make my way back to Vegas, I wanted to do it right. Stay in some big fancy hotel, and really live it up. Bellagio was my first choice, but when I saw the online pics, again I got the motel layout feel. And for the money they wanted, I looked elsewhere. I finally settled on THEhotel, for the price you can't beat it. I love the living room and extra bathroom. PERFECT if you're not traveling alone. Everyone needs breathing room from one another from time to time right? It's in close proximity to three other hotels (Mandalay Bay, Luxor, Excalibur) with trams and connecting hallways between them. Very reasonable walking distance to hotels like MGM Grand. But you are on the south end of the strip, walking to somewhere like the Venetian may be a bit much. So rent a car, or make use of the monorail (Nearest station for you would be MGM Grand) an all day pass will run you $12 per person. One way trip $5 per person. Would I stay at THEhotel again? I don't know. Don't get me wrong, I LOVED it. It's soooo quiet. You're less than 5 minutes away from the casino in Mandalay Bay, but there is no casino in THEhotel. So the lobby, is always quiet. Pretty much no one outside of the guests, are walking around. It was really cool to walk from the hustle of the Mandalay Bay, to the soothing quiet of THEhotel. But there are two reasons why I'm debating if I'd ever go back. One, is the cost. Again don't get me wrong, for the price you get SO MUCH MORE than other hotels are asking for their suites. But for me personally, I just need a hotel room to sleep. I wanted to spoil myself once (And I'm glad I did!), but not sure I'd ever spend that kind of money again on a hotel room. Second issue, is its location. I may decide to stay more towards the center of the strip. My two trips to Vegas had me in hotels on the south end. So if I go back, it'd be nice to be in another spot. Overall, it was an amazing experience. One I don't regret. It really is a beautiful hotel. If you're looking for peace and quiet, and don't mind being on the far end of the Strip, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointed, bad service and shabby”
Reviews.Author: nita_brett
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my daughter for her 40th birthday. We were given poor service from the time we checked in. The room was very dark and shabby ,although beds were clean , carpets very dirty and cleaners left a lot to be desired. We had a room facing the road so not very scenic. It was quiet however. We had to pay for everythin even an extra. £25 dollars for a kettle plus a service charge of 2.50. The pool was the most dissapointing as most of it was shut off in the week and the at the weekend over crouded and we were unable to even get a sun bed for over an hour , the staff were very rude and unhelpfull. There is no shade , only umbrellas which you had to pay for with a bed. at least 75 dollars for two people a day. the cabanas and gizabos were riduculas prices from 150 to 350 dollars a day. prices varied every day . better if there is a croud of you but if only two people then very expensive. Overall I would never reccomend this hotel and it is at the other end of the strip and a long walk to anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great STAY HERE GREAT PRICE FOR GREAT ROOMS you get your moneys worth”
Reviews.Author: waves92
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice and will keep coming back! You get your moneys worth you pay cheap for a great room Great food Great setting Clean Great staff big modern

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poulidor
Reviews.Content: Great service, Great food (LE café), but expensive. It is one of the only hotels in Las Vegas where the elevator bank is not located inside the gaming room of the casino. it means you are not harassed by the noise and the boosing of the gamers as soon as you leave your room. In Vegas, Silence and Style are true luxuries !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: drog3
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at TheHOTEL this past August and had a great stay and couldn't be happier. We recieved an upgrade when we checked in which gave us a great strip view out of the bedroom. The room was very clean, with a huge bathroom with a huge bathtub and glass shower. There's a seperate living room with a TV and DVD player as well. TheHOTEL is seperate from Mandalay Bay, but just a short walk down the hall in the lobby and you're inside the casino at Mandalay Bay. I'm not a gambler, so I can't say much about the casino. There's more than enough to do at Mandalay Bay. House of Blues was great, Red White and Blue was very good and there's a nice sushi place. Make sure to check out Mix though, it's pricey but the views are great, make sure to have a drink at the lounge afterwards to get the best view. The pool is a short walk through the hotel, but the wave pool is nice lagoon that is away from some of the kids and another small pool. If you want a more adult vibe, check out Moorea Beach Club, it's not Rehab or Wet Republic, but it had good music and atmosphere. Any complaining you see about prices, take with a grain of salt, everything is pricey in Vegas. There are deals like the buffet at the hotel which was great for breakfast, but you're genereally going to overpay for drinks($7 beers, paid $19 for a drink at Surrender at Encore), food, or like we did for sunblock. There are deals, we got 2 for 1 drinks at Eyecandy in the casino the first night and happy hour drinks at resteraunts, but overall expect to overapy. The one downside is the location, but it's not as bad as you may think being at the end of the Strip. There are trams to the Luxor and the Excalibur, and then if you take a short walk to the Monte Carlo there is a tram inside there that takes you to City Center and down to Bellagio, so you can go quite a distance without walking in the heat too much. Cab rides aren't terrible, $10-$17 to about mid-strip and opposite end of the strip. Overall, Mandalay Bay and TheHOTEL are both great with more than enough to keep you busy just within their hotels, nevermind everything else there is to do and see in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to have luxury and more than just casino's, this is THE place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BeckyParksfamily
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay in Las Vegas at THEHotel at Mandalay Bay, and I must say, this hotel was AWESOME! From check-in, where the attendant upgraded us to a corner room at a half-price upgrade fee, to the location (which is just a bit away from the Casino so you can actually have quiet time to sleep), to the luxurious suite hotel room it was PERFECT! The Valet is awesome because it allows you to leave your car right at the hotel's entrance and when you come to get your vehicle, it takes only moments. THEHotel is connected to Mandalay Bay, so you have full access to all of the wonderful restaurants, clubs, shops, etc that Mandalay Bay is known for. The Lion King is playing at Mandalay Bay right now, so that was definitely a trip highlight for us, as was the House of Blues and the Phoenix 80's band that was playing on Fri and Sat in one of the bar areas. And, there is no beating the Wave pool and lazy river at Mandalay Bay. What a great atmosphere for hanging out and even over Labor Day weekend, the crowds were more manageable in this complex than any of the others that we visited while in Vegas. The South end of the strip allows you to still participate in all of the casino and live action fun, but gets you away from some of the craziness that goes on further down on the strip. If you want romance, go to THEHotel at Mandalay Bay. The service, the amenities and the environment are top-notch.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Pools”
Reviews.Author: karenfnewyork
Reviews.Content: We checked in this morning with 2 young kids. We chose this hotel due the reviews that the pools were great for kids. What they failed to mention was how dirty the pools are, garbage cans overflowing, dirty towels from the entire day still piled on chairs or under chairs, straws floating in pool, cups and empty cans all over! It is a disgrace. My kids actually got out of the pool and asked to go back to the room!!! We have 2 more days here - lets see what tomorrow brings.

Reviews.Title: “Flawed, but still great!”
Reviews.Author: damonandtina
Reviews.Content: Recently drove my daughter cross-country to college on the west coast and decided to do a couple shows in Vegas on the way. Chose this hotel, which had some real highs and real lows, but on balance turned out to be very enjoyable. The pluses: -Gorgeous suites with 2 bathrooms, terry robes and slippers, and good amenities. -Fantastic tv's, including one in bathroom -Separate tub and shower, with good water pressure -Free parking -Adequate health club and workout facility -Beautifully landscaped pool grounds, with great wave pool and lazy river. Now for the negatives -Was on 34th floor, and MIX night club on 60th floor kept me awake every night until after 1 a.m. Soundproofing is HORRIFIC!!! -Housekeeping staff is ok, but take forever to get around to cleaning rooms. -Hotel is at far end of Strip and long walk from anywhere else. -Prices for pool rental equipment and restaurants are so high they're laughable. Try $18 to rent an inner tube for the lazy river,....WOW!!! All in all, I'd probably stay here again, although I'd request around the 20th floor to dampen more of the club sound. Very typical Vegas glitz and faux glamour, but not quite the Venetian, Palazzo, Bellagio or Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: JN40
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in a suite in THEhotel. The room was beautiful - so much so that I got some interiors ideas to take home with me. Really comfortable beds, lovely big bathroom, FAB view. It took us 2 minutes to check in. They found us cabs really fast. It's attached to the Mandalay Bay so we had all their facilities - most importantly the brilliant pool complex which the kids loved. Also one of the restaurants is a huge buffet - we went there almost every day because all of us could have what we wanted, and by the time we left my daughter (7) had a taste for cranberry juice and had changed her mind about never eating salmon (hurray). We also eat at the MIX restaurant on the top frloor - fantastic views, lovely staff, great food and cocktails. Really, really great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: CaliPalosVerdes
Reviews.Content: 3 friends and I stayed two nights at the Mandalay Bay in Vegas. Our rooms were very nice, and the hotel service was excellent. We ate at the Red, White, and Blue Cafe as well as Lupo, and the Borders. All 3 restaurants had delicious food and outstanding service. The hotel and casino staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “VERY nice, but a ways from the main strip...”
Reviews.Author: DHancock
Reviews.Content: Our suite at THEhotel was nothing short of absolutely FABULOUS! With 2 rooms of floor to ceiling windows that showcase the strip views, hip, urban decorating and one full and one half bath, not to mention very comfortable bedding, it was stunning. We ate & drank at several of the bars & restaurants, and although pricey, most were great. I'd particularly recomment Stripsteak; it was AMAZING. Our only real dissapointment was the fact that you are really a cab ride from the main part of the strip; to walk it would take you 30 minutes to an hour, and I'm used to being in the middle of it all. Otherwise it was great. FYI; if you rent a pool cabana, the concierge can reserve you one at Vdara, a new hotel right in the middle of the strip. FABULOUS cabanas with misters, private pool with floats and more for half the price of the pool cabanas at Mandalay Bay. We rented a cabana one day at Mandalay for $325, but they wanted $425 for Friday and $525 for Saturday! Way too much for 2 people, we got one for Friday & Saturday at Vdara for $250/day and it was newer and nicer!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!!! Will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: stemc10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over the weekend that I got married and it was amazing!! The staff was very efficient and friendly..we asked for an upgrade when we arrived, and they were fully booked due to the Miss Universe pageant, so they gave us some free spa services instead, which was much more than we expected. The room was perfect..it had 1 1/2 bathrooms, and I definitely recommend taking a bubble bath in the super deep tub (which is huge!)..the bed was also really comfortable and there was a separate living room with a bar. Our room on floor 38 had a great view of the strip. My only complaint about the room was that we found a little bit of trash under the couch from the previous guest (gross). There is no casino at THEhotel, so we went to the one in Mandalay Bay, which was my favorite of all the casinos on the strip (including Bellagio, Caesar's Palace, MGM Grand, Luxor, New York New York and more). We didn't check out many of the restaurants or anything, but we did eat at Mix, which was definitely one of the best meals I've ever had in my life. Our table had a decent view, but the best views of Vegas can be seen from the bar at Mix. After dinner we had a couple drinks and as it started to get dark we watched all the buildings light up, which was a great experience. The only other thing we checked out at THEhotel were the pools. There are several, including a wave pool, and I think I read somewhere that it covers 10 acres. They have sand so it has a beach feel, and I thought overall it was really nice. However, we had to walk pretty far to get to it, and it felt weird for me to walk through the casino and past nice stores in my bathing suit/cover-up to get to the pools. Also, we got there late in the afternoon, and it was really difficult to find 2 chairs that weren't already claimed. On another positive note, though, the front desk was nice enough to issue us 4 extra room keys. You need a key to get into the pool (1 key will admit up to 4 people), and all of the guests for our wedding stayed at Luxor (which has a much smaller pool). So we had plenty of room keys for everyone to use the pool if they wanted to. Another thing people should take into account is that this hotel is very far down the strip (it is practically directly across from the airport). This worked out very well for me because I like quiet, but if you are headed to Vegas because you want to experience the craziness and loudness and be around a bunch of drunk people being wild, then you should probably pick somewhere that is more in the middle of the action like Caesar's or Planet Hollywood. We were able to walk from THEhotel all the way to the Bellagio and Caesar's, but it was a pretty long hike. We probably could have made it the whole way down the strip without a taxi, but we chose not to. Overall, I thought THEhotel was one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at if you take into account decor, price, and service. I loved everything about the room, and even told my husband that I would like to have the exact same bathroom in my own house. The staff we came into contact with couldn't have been any more helpful, and we only paid about $120 a night for a suite on the 38th floor with a great view of the Vegas strip. I would definitely stay here again and will definitely recommend it to my friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Service has deteriorated”
Reviews.Author: VaLasVegasLover
Reviews.Content: We (myself 17, 20 & 23 year olds) spend a week at The Hotel every summer. I also ocassionally spend time there during the year. The service this year was terrible! You do not expect to wait in line for 1 hour at a 5* hotel to check in. As a returning quest you expect to get the room type and floor requested. You do not expect to call 3x in 5 hours for additional blankets. Even the spa services ( I might add several hundreds of dollars for 4 of us) were not a 5* hotel. The spa services (although the spa is smaller) at the Four Seasons was better. Overall, The Hotel itself is showing its age and the service is suffering greatly. Las Vegas needs the business and should reflect it in its service. I will recommend it, however, you can do better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing”
Reviews.Author: holidaybabe79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at THEhotel at Mandalay Bay with a group of friends for six nights. We had a V Suite which was extremely spacious. When entering the room, there is a foyer with a guest powder room, continuing down the corridor, it opens into a spacious living room with a three seater couch and arm chair facing a 42" plasma. There is also a large desk and chair in case you need to do some work. Beside the door to the bedroom, there is a small bar with a sink. The bedroom also has a 42" plasma facing the king sized bed. The bathroom was huge with a large shower stall and a separate bathtub with plenty of amenities. The bathroom also had his and her sinks and a small tv in case you felt like soaking in the tub or watching tv while getting ready. Both the living and the bed room housed floor to ceiling windows with amazing views! The rooms were also super modern, check out their website for a virtual tour. THEhotel is a separate wing of the Mandalay Bay, so there are numerous restaurants to choose from as access is for the entire premises. When exiting THEhotel, you enter into the common casino ground which is massive. Restaurants line the walls and there is also a separate area just for restaurants. There is also easy access to the train to New York, New York by walking through to the Luxor (connected to the Mandalay Bay). The pool is absolutely magnificent with Mandalay Bay having an extensive pool area. Not only do they have several large, normal pools, they also have a man-made beach which encompasses a wave pool. In addition, there is a large lazy river and many small jacuzzis. The spa at THEhotel was also amazing as was the nightlife. There is a lounge at the top of the Mandalay Bay called Foundation Room and the view is just phenomenal! I will definitely stay here again and recommend this to everyone looking for a great place to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Totally enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: MauiMakaha
Reviews.Content: First time to THEhotel and really enjoyed the ambiance and service. We are gamblers but preferred to stay in a hotel where you didn't have to cart your bags thru a casino floor and wade thru smoke. Loved the decor...elegant/hip. No bright lights, bells or whistles. Also liked the fact you could use the pool/beach at Mandalay Bay (rented a cabana, loved it!). Our suite was nicely decorated and very spacious for 2 of us. Loved having a 2nd bathroom and wetbar. We have stayed in lots of hotels in Vegas and this one rates as one of the nicer properties.

Reviews.Title: “The worst customer service I have ever seen.”
Reviews.Author: USAtraveler2010
Reviews.Content: This place is an absolute joke. Staff is incompetent, rude and arrogant! Food is horrible and the facilities are becoming out dated!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!! Going back next month”
Reviews.Author: imsofunny
Reviews.Content: My new favorite hotel! We've stayed at Mandalay Bay before and decided to stay there again in April for the pools. When we checked in they asked us if we wanted to try their sister property "THE hotel" for only $30/night more. After hearing about it we decided to splurge and try it. WE ARE SO GLAD! LOVED the room, the 1.5 bathrooms, the decor. I really didn't want to leave the room! We were there for 4 days and I could've stayed another 4! The pools were crowded with rowdy, spring breakers which was a drawback and the spa at THEHotel was being renovated so we had to use the Mandalay Spa and the walk is a bit longer (except to the parking garage, it was shorter there and we'd rented a car so it worked out great). It was decadent and we loved it so much we're headed back to Vegas for another concert and booked a room there again (6 months after our initial stay). This time we're taking extended family with us and know they will love the rooms as much as we do! I've stayed in 4 other Vegas hotels and doubt I will ever stay anywhere else, I like it THAT much!! Stay at Mandalay for the pools but stay in THEHotel for the rooms!! We also recommend doing a cabana at the pool, especially if you have a group and/or kids. At the very least do the chair rental, it can be super crowded at peak times.

Reviews.Title: “Want Twin Beds and Competent Staff - Then Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: rakibey
Reviews.Content: We arrived at The Hotel for a long weekend before we are headed to Aria. When we were booking rooms, the only reason we chose THE Hotel was because this was one of the only hotels that had Twin Beds available. Since we are two friends, we dont want to stay in a double bed together! We booked on Mandalay bays own website. When we arrived, we were told that unfortunately they did not have Twin Beds for us, but only a King bed. They also told us that if you book a Twin Bed Room, it is only a request - you cannot be sure to get it. That is something I have NEVER heard before at any other hotel - what is the purpose then by booking a Twin Room? You can never know what you will get??? We were everything but happy, but they promised to bring a portable bed to the room so we would not have to sleep together. That was 7 PM. After at dinner we returned to the room at 10 PM, and there was still no bed. We called, and they promised to bring it within 15 minutes. After 30 minutes I called and asked when they were coming. We were tired after 20 hours of travelling and 36 hours without sleep and just wanted to sleep. At midnight, we still did not have that extra bed, and one of us just had to sleep at the couch. Never experienced such incompetent staff. Why promise to be here within 15 minutes when you are not here in 2 hours? Oh my god! Too bad, since the rooms are actually really nice! But with this experience I have to give it the worse rating I have ever given any hotel in my reviewing carriere at Tripadvisor...

Reviews.Title: “Great Re-Wedding Party”
Reviews.Author: Mariamono
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very happy to make this trip from New York in honor of friends celebrating their 10th wedding anniversary as they renewed their vows at the Graceland Chapel. The wedding party stayed at THEhotel and we were happy to stay in the same place for more quality time with them. We had a great time! Except: 1. Our phone message light kept blinking even though we had no messages. After three calls to the front desk/operator we gave up. It blinked our entire stay. 2. Housekeeping skipped our room the first day and when we called down, they told us we had to call housekeeping everyday if we wanted our room cleaned. This was false and our room was cleaned everyday for the rest of our stay. Why didn't they just tell us they would send someone up! (Also, I wish they would clean the windows! Hand-prints and smudges are kind of gross.) 3. The television in the bedroom didn't have all the channels and the remote didn't work. However, this was fixed in a timely manner. 4. The pool is a long walk from THEhotel and the signage is not very good directing one there. The best parts were: 1. The pool. We recommend getting a cabana, the service is better and it offered shade which was scarce. Also, it's nice to have tubes for the lazy river. It was too bad the poolside restaurant closed before the end of the day. 2. The spas! I went to the spas both at Mandalay Bay and the Bathhouse at THEhotel. The Bathhouse was my favorite, I had the place to myself most of the time and with a treatment I could use the spa for the entire day. 3. The gym. I know, who wants to workout on vacation, but the gym at THEhotel was so nice I had to mention it. It is worth the extra fee. I like that you can enjoy the buzz of Mandalay Bay, but then escape to the peace of THEhotel (and a huge suite!) The concierge was great and set up an outing for us. We had a fun night at the Foundation Room (even though DJ P-nut was not good!) Aureole threw a wonderful reception for us, but our favorite meal of the trip was at Border Grill. It was also a bonus that we could print out our boarding passes before we left for the airport. Overall, a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “THEBest, impressive.”
Reviews.Author: CheekyChops_xoxo
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed THEhotel and cant rave about this place enough! My boyfriend and one of my best friends had come to Vegas to celebrate my birthday last year and to see Green Day. We had originally booked 7 nights in a standard room at Mandalay Bay, but upon check in, my BF asked if any upgrades were available and we were upgraded to a suite with a strip view in THEhotel, free of charge! I was so amazed! I was instantly impressed the minute I stepped foot into the lobby and into the lifts. I nearly died when I walked through the suite, firstly it was so LARGE and spacious. 1 main bathroom, and a seperate powder room/toilet. An office area with desk, and a lounge room with LCD TV and a lounge of course. Our bedroom has 2 queen sized beds. The bathroom had a seperate bath and a shower. Double vanity, toilet in seperate room, an LCD TV in the bathroom! When getting ready we had MTV on in the shower lol. You could very faintly hear the nightclub music on the top floor at night, but honestly, who is going to bed early in Vegas? It wasnt an issue for us at all. I only heard it when I was lying on the bed waiting for my friend to do her hair before we went out drinking. The strip view was awesome, I could see the Luxor pyramids next door and had a great view of the airport lol. Was kinda fun watching the aircraft take off and land. Mandalay Bay was a great resort as THEhotel is a part of it. Many awesome restaurants around, The Lion King show is fantastic and the beach was pretty great too. Took us forever to get beach chairs on the sand, it was so busy. Only thing id say was a negative was the location, its so far south on the strip, it really is a LOOOONG walk up the strip. We only ever got as far as the Bellagio before getting over the heat and wanting to go back to the room. Stopping at every hotel and casino along the way to escape the heat helped, but became tiring and hard as free drinks kind of got in the way... hahaha. Next time id stay centre strip and explore the north end of the strip, as I never made it! My only regret of the trip. Otherwise, everything else is PERFECT!!! THEhotel rocked!

Reviews.Title: “Not so family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Connecticutguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nites during our family's 1st trip to Vegas. The room was fine (although showing signs of wear but I'm not super picky). Other writer's complaints about the distance from THE Hotel to the beach/pool area are right on- it is a HIKE! when you're in a bathing suit and you're carrying pool stuff, its awkward to walk past the restaurants and go through the casino to get to your room and change out of your bathing suit. But those were not my problems with this hotel. The pool area while extensive is filled with lots of partiers age 20-30. I'm no prude but this isnt an enviroment condusive to families or young kids. Lots of VERY skimpy bikinis. Also, I think one of the bars gives out straws that look like penises. Very inappropriate to have to see that around the pool and have my tween-age kids see that. Finally, lots and lots and lots of people covered from chin to hip with tattoos (sorry just not my thing) and piercings. The staff seems to constantly have their hands out for tips even before they have performed the service for which they are seeking the tip. The hotel is nice but just not great. It would be fine for a bachelor party weekend but not necessarily for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: VisitorFromWI
Reviews.Content: This place is great - do not believe any of the negative reviews. Check was a breeze - front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. We asked for a refrigerator and one was delivered to our super clean and modern room within 5 minutes and then the front desk called to see if everything met our expectations. Needless to say, great service. MB in general offers a lot in terms of eating places - House of Blues is very fun as is Eye Candy. But most people come for the pool and it does not disappoint from the multiple pools where you can find shade to the wave pool to the lazy river. This was our first visit to Las Vegas and it is a very fun place to take the kids. Do not believe any of the reviews about room break ins either - the suite doors have deadbolt locks and a metal latch so we felt safe and secure at all times.Highly recommend TheHotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay if you want to ignore all that is Vegas for awhile”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelcritic
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August. I actually was booked at the main Mandalay Bay resort but was upgraded to THEhotel and I am glad I was. The rooms are all suites and especially for one person are gigantic. Two people would probably still feel the place was palatial since it had 1.5 baths, a full living room and a large bedroom and master bathroom with steam shower and soaking tub not to mention multiple flat screen TVs. I had a great view of the pool (avoid the 5th and 6th floors unless you like floor to ceiling views of HVAC units and concrete walls). The fit and finish was first class and the staff was excellent. It made you feel you were away from the hustle and bustle of Vegas but still close enough if you wanted the experience. The only drawbacks was the long walk to the Mandalay Bay Convention Center if you are attending a conference there and the fact that the Mandalay Bay complex is at the southern end of the strip but these are minor things compared to the upsides of the place. Great restaurants in Mandalay Bay as well!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii_traveler200
Reviews.Content: I have no idea why this hotel would get anything but stellar reviews. The rooms (suites) are beautiful with 3 TVs, huge bathroom and gorgeous views. The hotel is easier to get around in than other large hotels. And even though it's at the end of the strip, it's easy to get to nearby hotels via the "subway" and walkways. We went to Raffles for breakfast and it was awesome. Our favorite hotel of the trip!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Muncie_IN_JohnB
Reviews.Content: After a 3 day/2 night Grand Canyon rafting trip, we ended our "roughing it' period and relaxed @ THEhotel. Had stayed @ Mandy Bay once before, but with our 2 boys (14 & 17), we wanted a suite & we were not disapointed in our choice. Very nice suite - THEsuite, 1 b.r. w/ 2 queens. Nice view of the beach/pool area. A bit of a walk through the resort to the beach, but not too bad. Asked for early check in & got with very little problem. Very good price, but does jump on Fri-Sun. Quiet, as it's seperate from the casino section of Mandy Bay. Dinner 1 night @ China Grill - very good. Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill @ Caesars was excellent for the 2nd night, short cab ride from THEhotel. Very pleased with room, price & service @ THEhotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: glegly
Reviews.Content: The THEhotel (just an odd name) is the all-suite hotel companion to Mandalay Bay, and thought it was an excellent place. Rooms were nice and clean and upscale. Only knock against it (and can't be helped) is that traveling from room to pool and a loooooong walk through the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are beautiful, but....”
Reviews.Author: JK949
Reviews.Content: Scored this room on Priceline on a Sunday night (one night), which was classified as a 5 star... It is nice, but not a 5 star... I'd give it a solid 4 star.. Location - This is the last property at the south end of the strip and attached to Mandalay Bay. It is nice and isolated if that is the goal, but otherwise very far removed. THEhotel has its own entrance and valet, which saves from the hustle of the main MB valet. Rooms - Absolutely gorgeous! Dark, rich finishes, 3 TVs, wet bar, 1 1/2 baths, floor to ceiling windows.. Plush all the way. The bathrooms were oversized and luxe and so were the cute toiletries. These are two room suites and although two rooms and large, each room felt a bit narrow. Service - Ups and Downs. Front desk was efficient, but not friendly when checking in, though the agent did allow a 12pm check in, which was nice. Two free drink coupons and explanation of the resort fee, which was a plus. Bartender in the lounge was blah... he poured a crappy drink and barely said hello or thank you. One big kudo was a front desk agent willing to do my printing for me to save me the walk to the business center. Simply emailed it to her and poof, it was done! Pool - You share the pool with MB, so it is a HIKE... Followed other TA tips and cut through the parking garage. Though it saves time, it leaves a lot to be desired in the glamour department. Pools are nice - there are many of them, though good luck finding a chair! The water in the lazy river was murky, but then you could hardly see it with the sea of people in it... Wave pool was neat. Poolside service was nearly non-existent. Didn't like the whole "stand in line and swipe your room key to get into the pool" concept. Understanding that this is part of MB, but if THEhotel is co-marketing the pool and considered a 5 star - not exactly 5 star requirements. Food - EXPENSIVE!! No matter where you go, you are going to get screwed. Managed to score a restaurant.com g/c for Shanghai Lilly and had an amazing experience! Kudos to the staff and chef. Bayside buffet was delish and not a bad bargain ($15.99 for breakfast). Considering a take out sandwich at Red White & Blue is $11, plus $3 for a coffee, it is a good way to go for breakfast. Grabbed a quick happy hour bite at RM seafood... blah! Not impressed with the drinks or food. Resort Fee - I have no issue with a resort fee, especially when it includes Wifi, or other value-added services. The biggest issue with the resort fee here is the lack of a true workout facility. The "cardio room" is just that - an afterthought of a room tucked on the lowest floor in the dark corner filled (or crammed) with a bunch of equipment. No weights, nothing... blah! If I were in Vegas for work, THEhotel would be a nice property as I would likely be having more time in my room to enjoy it, but the overall vibe of MB is too busy, too crowded and leaves a lot to be desired. Will I stay here again? Likely not...

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at THEhotel”
Reviews.Author: kawititnow
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay at THEhotel. I had read a lot of the negative reviews and was getting nervous as the trip was getting closer. We had a great clean room, EXCELLENT service, and would definitely stay here again. The purpose of our trip was for a family wedding, so we traveled with our 8 month old son. For those that complain about the crying babies at 3 AM, I'd like to remind them that it's no different than people partying in the next room till 3 AM. That street does go both ways!!! ROOM - We paid for an upgrade to a V-Suite, and it was absolutely worth it. These rooms have doorbells and a button that you push for Maid Service or Do Not Disturb. You walked in with a 1/2 bath on the left, then onto the living area were there was a wet bar, couch, chair and coffee table opposite the flat screen TV with a DVD player. Further in the living area was a desk & chair. The wet bar has a mini fridge but can only be used for mini bar items. Out of the living room we had an awesome view of Mandalay Bay and the Beach complex. Walking in the bedroom had the bathroom on the left and a king bed that faced another flat screen TV. Out of the bedroom we could see the Luxor, MGM Grand, etc. The bathroom was great with a dark marble shower, sunk-in tub, 2 sinks and a TV. SERVICE - I called down to the concierge to see about getting put on the guest list for the Foundation Room (which I DEFINITELY recommend). The phone line had a lot of static and we could barely hear each other, but I was able to mess with it some and got it cleared up and didn't think much about it. Well about 30 minutes later the doorbell rings and it's maintenance and they came to replace the phone cord. I didn't even have to ask them to!!! While they were there I told them that every channel in the bedroom TV is in black & white. A few hours later they sent someone up and got it fixed. Every person that I dealt with at THEhotel was nothing but kind, helpful and full of respect. SECURITY - We were fortunate in that we didn't have our room broken into or have anything come up stolen or missing. Just a FYI for future guests at this hotel. 1) If you are turning in for the night USE THE METAL LATCH on the entrance door. The door has a deadbolt in addition to a metal security latch... USE IT. In the event the deadbolt fails they can't open the door if the latch is used. 2) If you have anything you don't want stolen while you are down at the pool, casino, or whatever, PUT IT IN THE SAFE. We put our chips, camcorder, sports book tickets, wallets, and other valuables while we went to the pool or didn't plan on being in the room for a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “3 B's - Big, Busy and Beach”
Reviews.Author: GypsyGirl21
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel, our first. Booked directly with the hotel and paid an average of $200/night for a 1 Bedroomd Suite. Have stayed at the Venetian and The Mirage on previous Vegas trips but wanted to try the South Strip and the "Beach" at Mandalay Bay intrigued me. This resort is huge - too huge- lots of walking to get to the pool, the restaurants, and a long way from the Fashion Show Mall if you are walking! We had a car which we found useful since we felt a little removed from the rest of the Strip while staying here. ROOM: Room was great, comfortable and clean, although a little dark. Had a King bed, soft, but comfy, and the main bathroom with a sunken tub and marble everywhere, was nice, so was the second bathroom that we had. Robes and slippers were a nice touch. No Coffee maker and fridge is only for the mini bar items. Small detail, but TV's were old, not flat screen....but hey, there was a 3rd tv in the bathroom! Free WiFi, free parking Resort fee of $16.35/day POOLS: There are 3 regular pools, a lazy river, the beach and of course the wave pool. All were very busy and filled with kids. This resort obviosly attracts families due to the beach and wave pool. Not our scene, especially for Vegas. Cabana prices were around $350/day, a tad much if you ask me when the room rate was half that. Renting just a chair and an umbrella will run you about $125/person per day. We ate at RM on our first night there and my husband got food poisoning, so he lost Day 2 of our vacation. Also ate at the Beach Grill, Red White and Blue and had room service. All were just OK, food is espensive, but no more than any other hotel in Vegas. I also went to the Spa at THEhotel. Had a nice massage with Roberta, and I'd highly recommend it! I wouldn't stay at this hotel again, mainly due to the location and the kids. It was a nice hotel but not special enough that I'll be a loyal customer. Honestly, I would stay at the Mirage again in a heartbeat, better overall vibe and not so big that you can't manage to get to the pool and the restaurants in 5 minutes. And it's more in the heart of everything on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “EVERYBODYS GETTING ROBBED AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: TravelSmart2010
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just left “The Hotel” because our room got broken into last night and we were robbed. My girlfriend was tired so she decided to go to sleep early. I decided to go to the bar for a drink. Someone was able to enter our room while my girlfriend was sleeping and started going through her purse. She woke up during the robbery and thought it was me so she rolled over and started to go back to sleep. When robber heard her roll over in bed he or she dropped to the floor and crawled to the opposite end of the room. My girlfriend lied there paralyzed with fear as she now knew it was not me. All my girlfriends cash was stolen. We reported the situation to the front desk they acted like it was no big deal and then we were directed to “risk management”. What a joke!!!!! They offered no answers or solutions. You would think they have cameras being a 4 star hotel in Vegas. I am a meeting planner and travel all over the country during the year working with hotel staff at various locations. This by far was the worst experience I have ever had. I researched the issue on the internet and there are so many others out there who have been robbed at the Mandalay bay and The Hotel. DO NOT SAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale at a great price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Islands0821
Reviews.Content: We love Vegas and every time we go we debate at which MGM property to stay. This was our second time staying at TheHotel. A little bit of advice when staying here --- rent a car! TheHotel is at the very end of the Strip which is fine so long as 1) you don't mind walking or 2) are willing to take multiple trams or 3) want to pay for cabs. We've been renting a car on our latest trips (we don't drink much so we don't care at night about driving) and it's worked out great for us, especially when we figured out the backroads to avoid driving down the Strip. Also we love to do other "non-Vegas" things like go up to the Red Rocks, visit museums, see the Hover Dam, etc., so the car is great. Check-in: Pretentious and arrogant... The first guy, who we tipped, was assisting us at check-in and told us that at 3pm on Tuesday (when we arrived) they ONLY had a room available on the 7th floor...facing the parking garage. Are you kiddig me? No, I'm not paying to look directly at the parking garage. Then he tried to sell us tickets to the Lion King, and although we said no thank you, he was insistent. Finally I said we disliked musicals to get him to stop. Then he insisted on booking me spa services at TheSpa. I informed him that I had already booked with Spa Mandalay, but I was willing to consider booking at their spa if I could just see the facilitiaties. I was told that "you can't just 'see' the facilities, you need to book a service there first since it's a European spa and we need to maintain privacy." Okay, fine, but maybe if the website were a bit more informative on what the spa atmosphere was like I'd switch... no thanks, I'll stick with Spa Mandalay where everyone is friendly, the spa is inviting and warm and just plainly relaxing. Room: We got up to our 7th floor room and then I turned around and went downstairs where I spoke with, I'm assuming the front desk supervisor or manager (someone higher than the original guy) because she was able to put into a room on the floor right below their villas/super-deluxe rooms. GORGEOUS view and it was during the time all the major cities turn out the lights for an hour, so we got to watch that from our room (turning off and then on). AMAZING! Room was fantastic as always. Clean, one and half bathrooms, living room, and separate bedroom. I love the separate bedroom since you can't get hallway noise from it. On the hallway side of the bedroom is the beautiful full-bath with large soaking tub and large shower and separate toliet. On the other side is the wall of the windows. Then you have the doorway to the living room, so you're completely secluded from hallway noise. I was surprised to find out they have adjoining rooms! We walked into the second room (the upgraded one) and we had a doorway in the living room to the adjoining room (which was locked of course). Only on one night did we briefly hear a group of guys either watching an action flick or playing an action video game REALLY loudly... No big deal, we came back later that night and it was fine. Watch out for... the prostitutes hanging out by the elevator banks late at night. Couldn't believe it! It was SOOO blantaly obvious they were prostitutes because we'd come back and forth within a two-hour time frame and the same woman was standing there. I finally called security and they said they'd take care of it. I understand it's Vegas and all, but really by the elevator banks in this upscale place? Don't like it at all... made it all feel a bit trashy then. It happened two nights in a row, and it happened exactly like that on our last stay here. Overall, TheHotel is an upscale place and we got our money's worth. I can't stand the arrogance that's displayed by the staff, and the prostitutes hanging out by the lobby thing its a bit much for me, so I think we'll start looking for a new place in the future. Still, if you want space and lots of bathrooms, this is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite 5 stars, but close!”
Reviews.Author: midnitebreeze
Reviews.Content: This was my third, and my husband's second trip to Vegas. We did a two part trip staying 3 nights downtown and 2 on the strip. We wanted to spluge a little at a 4-5 star stip hotel for the second part of our stay and came across a very good deal at THEhotel...a V suite for $112/night! For those of you unfamiliar with the rooms at THEhotel, the V suite is a corner suite which is a bit larger and a bit upgraded from their standard THEsuite. We arrived before check in time and were able to see an agent right away, which was great. They said our 17th floor V-suite with a strip view was ready. Great! When we got to the room, however, we discovered it was not the smoking preference we had requested. She told us they had another strip view room available, 30th floor, but it was a standard suite. We decided the slightly smaller square footage was worth having our smoking prefernce as well as a better view and without having to wait until check in time. I asked if we would be discounted for getting the "downgraded" suite upon check out and she said yes. They sent someone up with a new key right away and we were in business. Our view from the 30th floor was incredible! I could have sat there for hours just looking at all the lights. Our suite was just as advertised on their webiste...HUGE soaking tub, seperate shower, two sinks and TV in the main bathroom. Seperate half bath in the entry way and good sized living and bed rooms done in very subdued and modern decor. Compared to the V-suite, our living room was a little narrower, the bedroom only had one set of floor to ceiling windows as opposed to two, and there was a "regular" TV in the bedroom instead of a plasma. I was also a bit disappointed that there were no robes in the regular suite as there was (one?) in the V-suite. They did provide slippers, though. Nice high-end toilitries including lotion (both bathrooms), facial and body soap, shampoo, conditioner and bath crystals. Oddly, housekeeping was a bit chintzy on the towels, etc....i.e., only two washcloths provided for two people, which meant I had to shower with the same washcloth I used to wash my face the night before. Not a huge deal, but not what I expected for a 4.5-5 star hotel. On the other hand, our room was spotless both nights. One thing I really loved about THEhotel was the serene feeling of the public spaces. The lobby is quiet and classy, definitely a break from the chaos of the rest of Vegas. We had our free welcome drink in the lounge (yes, that's the name) and it was just so nice and peacful. We also enjoyed breakfast at the cafe (yep, "the" everything here), again, a relaxing experience. (Tip: the cafe is on restaruant.com. We got a $25 certificate for $2 or $3 dollars during one of their 80% of promotions....so our high end breakfast only cost us around $25, with tip, instead of $50! Actually, there are quite a few Mandalay restaurants on that site, so if you plan on eating around there, it's definitely worth checking out.) My only complaint about the lobby is the lack of elevators. I know this is not something that can be easily fixed, but it seems they should have more than 4 elevators per elevator bank for a hotel this size? (one bank serves the lower floors and another the higher ones.) More than once we actually had to wait in line for an elevator in the lobby. Checkout was pretty painless (virtually no wait), but we had to mention the discount for not getting the suite we had originally booked and paid for. They just waived our resort fee ($15/day, which DOES include free in-room WiFi), so we thought that was fair enough. While we were there, we did go to the famous Mandalay pool complex. It was neat, but quite crowded and LOTS of kids. I'm not necessarily one of the "don't bring kids to Vegas" types of people...but it did get annoying at times...the lazy river was more an exercise in avoiding getting splashed and hit by wayward rugrats in inner tubes than a relaxing float. I also thought it was a bit odd that the wave pool didn't generate more than one wave at a time? It was like one wave every few minutes rather than a series of waves as I've experienced at water parks. Tip: (that I learned here on TA)...cutting through the parking garage to the pool will save you a long walk through the casino. Basically you go out through the main THEhotel doors into the garage and over to the Mandaly entrance. This will put you by the restaurants. Follow the signs to the convention center and take the escalator down. At the bottom of the escalator you can go right outside into the pool area. Also, if you haven't seen the Lion King show, I highly recommend it! The showroom is right outside the casino entrance to THEhotel, so you don't have to walk far at all :) Hubby and I both loved it. Also, if you're going to Vegas before the end of August, use the promo code ZOO40 on ticketmaster to get 40% off! We got great seats in the front and center section (section B). Overall, our stay was very, very good...just a tad short of perfect. For the price though (less than $100/night!) I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel. Great Value”
Reviews.Author: jammieroo2
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a few hotels in Vegas and this was by far the most impressive. The hotel was beautiful and doesn't suffer from the usual Vegas traits of being a casino first and a hotel second. The casino is in Mandalay Bay, but THEhotel does not have that "in your face" mentality. Check in and out was simple. We were seen immediately in both cases. The suites themselves were very stylish without being too opulent. There was a living area and a sleeping area. The bathroom was also very impressive. It had a separate shower and the biggest bath I have ever seen! All in all we had a great stay and would definitely go back here when we visit Vegas again. The only down side was the location. It is on the far side of the strip, but there is a free tram which takes 2 mins to get you nearer the action. Go there. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Tipping works”
Reviews.Author: ajern
Reviews.Content: Our reservation was for a regular room in the Mandalay. I asked the desk person if they could receive tips she said of course. I then asked if there were any upgrades available. She said they were booked. I went to the ATM got a twenty and put it between my DL and CC and gave it to her. We were immediately booked into the suites at The Hotel with a great view. The Hotel is nice but isolated at the end of the strip. The tram stops way to early. As long as you don't want to leave the hotel you will love it. Otherwise put on your walking shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Very sad experience”
Reviews.Author: colleenSkoglund
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is beautiful...the rooms are nice but no view... that in itself would have been ok , as we were not in Vegas to sit n the room, What was really sad was that we were there as an extended family for a combination 50 th birthday and a wedding. On the last night my sister ( the mother of the groom and also the 50th birthday was robbed as she slept in her room. The hotel was very lame in it's response.... advising her not to call the police... they would take care of it. Sadly she saved for a very long time for this trip and now is a victim. The hotel is denying any responsibility even though we can prove that the door closing mechansim was broken and some one entered the room while she was sleeping on the sofaand robbed her

Reviews.Title: “amazing heat!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: josh2639
Reviews.Content: amazing pool with a huge room and amazing restraunts

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as a year ago”
Reviews.Author: Saweet
Reviews.Content: We were slightly disappointed with our stay at THE hotel this time. First off, we needed two queen beds and they only had a king room available, even though we were checking in right at check in time. So they sent up a roll away which was TINY. Not comfortable for my family. Now, secondly, I know this is Vegas, but can't they have a better way for my kids to get to the wave pool without having to walk through the casino that now features a dancer in the middle of it all at 3pm?? This feature is new, and I was disappointed. We usually stop here on our way to Cali. No more. I don't think Mandalay Bay should be ranked #1 for kids with families anymore. No biggie, Mandalay Bay, you can have your middle of the day dancers all you want, but you just lost our business, and I bet quite a few more travelers with kids will be disappointed as well. P.S. other trip advisor participants PLEASE do not send me a message about how this is Vegas, blah blah blah...I KNOW. I'm just sayin', this is a new feature and we were disappointed. I would still recommend this hotel to people traveling without children, although the rooms are becoming worn down, very fast.

Reviews.Title: “Not as close to the Strip as we thought”
Reviews.Author: jasonpatricklim
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was amazing. Everything was clean and looked great. Our only problem was that it was our first trip to Vegas and to get to the "Strip" was quite a walk or a $15-$20 taxi fare one way. If you are going to just stay at this hotel or maybe venture over to Luxor, I definitely recommend. But, if you want to get to the center of the strip, you are further than I thought.

Reviews.Title: “A suite experience”
Reviews.Author: bubbafb
Reviews.Content: This “boutique” type hotel that is part of the massive Mandalay Bay emits a small hotel feel within one of Vegas largest resort complexes. First thing of note is the ease of getting into this hotel. There is a separate parking garage for The Hotel that has valet service (no charge, just tips) and allows easy access to the lobby. The lobby is hip and modern and has a relaxing feel (and smell). A small café and bar adorn the lobby and the check-in was quick and simple (unlike a previous experience at the Mandalay Bay main property). The rooms are all suites (not large studios but separate bedroom suites). The décor follows the feel of the lobby with 1 ½ bathrooms, TVs in the living room, bedroom & bathroom, a couch and work area in the living room and plenty of space for clothes. Very nice all around. Other than the café and bar, there is Mix lounge and restaurant on top of The Hotel with stunning views of the strip. For the bulk of the nightlife and dining, you can take the short walk to the connected Mandalay Bay and Mandalay Place. We had some great small plates at Aureole but there are tons of choices in the complex. You can also take a walk (or tram) to the also connected Luxor and Excalibur for more dining. We enjoyed Tender, Luxor’s steakhouse for a nice dinner (although I enjoyed my tuna more than my wife enjoyed her prawns). The kids liked the food court over in Excalibur and the frozen yogurt shop in Mandalay Place. Nightlife is also abundant. We loved Minus 5 in Mandalay Place, an ice bar that is kept at 23 degrees F (minus 5 degrees C). The Foundation Room is real nice and has spectacular views of the strip from atop MB. Gaming at Mizuya Lounge and watching a nearby band was fun. The pool complex is like a mini-water park with a wave pool, lazy river and regular pools. In the summer, get there early to get a chair in the very little shade that is available. NOTE: a fairly good walk from The Hotel to the pool. With as much to do, not much reason to leave the resort and venture into the summer heat. Definitely worth a few extra bucks to stay at The Hotel and beat some of the hassle of the standard Mandalay Bay tower.

Reviews.Title: “You don't want to leave the room!”
Reviews.Author: LauraLatte
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant about this hotel because of some negative Tripadvisor reviews, but I was here with a larger group so I didn't have a choice. Well, I'm so glad I got to stay here!
