I was able to check in right away (at 10:30 AM), which started the trip on the right foot. The room itself was huge, spotless, and quite luxurious. The bed was very comfortable and all the amenities were in great condition. Some people in my group had trouble finding the electronic "Do Not Disturb" button (and housekeeping starts early!) and others didn't have bathrobes in their room. Negatives - No HBO on the TVs, which I thought was odd. Also, the hotel's elevators were very slow and often seemed to stop on every floor. It often felt time consuming just to get back to the lobby. THEHotel shares facilities with Mandalay Bay, but definitely had its own feel. We did have issues with cab drivers delivering us back to Mandalay instead of THEHotel, but it's a short walk. I'd stay here again. It was a great introduction to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel- Putting Profit before People- Las Vegas Style”
Reviews.Author: maxinek
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five day stay at The Hotel with my sister, neice(18) and daughter (19), and would like to review both good and bad. The heat was quite overwhelming this past week and there is barely any shade around the pool areas. We inquired about a small section of umbrellas and chairs and were told it was $75 per umbrella and $50 per chair. The next day (Friday) the p rice went u even more. This is really despicable. The sun was so strong,it was sickening and we ran into others looking for any shade at all. The trick is to be by the pool at 8am ,find a spot where it will be shady until 12 and try to move again. (seemed all the shady areas were taken u by then. Cabanas ran from $500-$1600 a day. Shame on them for not providing some umbrellas along the pool area. Lazy river and wave pool were fun. West lagoon pool turns into a party pool by 3pm , plenty of drinking going on. East lagoon seems quieter. Restaurants-Border Grill- Great Food, Reasonable prices Raffles-Horrible, and a bit expensive for what it is Room- Clean, very comfortable beds Staff- Seemed shorthanded- esecially in pool area Nice stay, but shade issue a real concern.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel really is "The" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlo999961
Reviews.Content: What a great time we had. Took the kids on a 4 day trip and were somewhat skeptical of the Vegas scene. But after checking out the pools at Mandalay the vacation was on. The kids were pumped to get in the waves. Looked forward to cruising around in the lazy river. Could not wait to get a great view of the strip and a sweet stay in the suite. As soon as we got there it was awesome. The front desk guy--really worked with us--got us an upgraded V suite same price and on the 27th floor. When the kids opened the door they were just excited as all get out. Room was awesome, 2 bathrooms, and enough TV's for all of us. The pools were awesome as expected and the view was super. The only draw back to this hotel is the location, for gambling around the strip, its not the best, but taking cabs is easy. I didnt say they were cheap or safe, but they were easy to get. Im not a VIP member and didnt really spend a lot of money in the casino, but I was polite and patient and the staff treated me better than a VIP. THANK YOU!! This is a place I will try and get back to as soon as I can.

Reviews.Title: “the lap of luxury”
Reviews.Author: ScratchBostonMA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were overwhelmed with the spaciousness and luxury of this fine hotel and the room in which we stayed. Every need and want was there and we wished we could transport our wonderful room wherever we travel in the future. Definitely a A++

Reviews.Title: “Consider this your warning!!”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior1020
Reviews.Content: My friend and I are vip Players Club members and generally stay at the Four Seasons on the Mandalay Bay property. I received an offer for a seriously discounted rate and various other incentives to stay at The Hotel. I'd stayed at The Hotel in the past and had fond memories of my experience and staying at the Four Seasons I know how wonderful the pools are. Now the reality, when we arrived the rates/packages for both room were way different from what we had been quoted when we booked (note two seperate reservations, two seperate rooms and both reservations with issues between the quoted rates/packages and the actual rates and packages), after 45 minutes of back and forth with the front desk staff (who wanted us to just check in and then go see the casino host to sort it out) and the casino host (who was a MASSIVE jerk and didn't want to be bothered with us at all and basically accused us of lieing) the host promised us both a food and beverage credit which they did not follow through on (guess what, the gambling starts when you book your room/check in.) I felt sick, it wasn't the money, I geniunly feel like we were taken advantage off. Already upset about the terrible kick off to our girls weekend away, we get to our room...on the ninth floor....with no view (once again, I'm feeling the love and am so glad I'm a vip member...whatever) and the room is FILTHY...I mean turn your stomach, hope you have your Hepititis shots...holy cow did they film Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas in this room....disgustingly dirty..something was splattered across the TV screen, all I know is it was brownish, their was some sort of brown stain in the middle of the sitting room carpet that I am really hoping was left by a dog and a giant stain that looked disturbingly like vomit next to the bed. The bar sink was backed up with what looked like coffee (I'm hoping.) Yeah, so we're really not happy at this point....and this is just the beginning of the good times, at night the room next to us no joke sets up dj equipment and throws freakin' all night parties?! Security comes up everyonce and a while to tell them to quite it down...you can imagine how that goes. The pool is great....I never win at the casino...the staff is outrageously bad.....and the hotel is nasty. If you can get past staying in a dirty room, not knowing exactly what you'll actually be paying/getting until you show up (and maybe not even then), dealing with total jerks and not being able to sleep at night you can get a pretty cheap rate here and the pool area is fantastic.....I honestly would not do it though.....oh and probably the worst thing.....it'll be months before you stop hearing the damn music from the Lion King in your head :P.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissWhitey
Reviews.Content: This was the last hotel of many throughout our mini road trip, and the best hotel we've ever stayed in. Our suite had 3 tvs and 2 toilets! Floor to ceiling windows, housekeeping about 4 times a day. We loved THEhotel as it is away from the casino but near enough to reach everything easily. The beach was great, but so many sunbeds you are almost lying on top of eachother, and no shade unless you go and sit at the bar. There is a free tram to the Luxor and Excalibur but it did feel a little too far away from everything at times. Taxis are easy to come by though to get you down the other end of the strip. Recommendations for Vegas: Burger Bar @ Mandalay Bay great burgers. Samba @ The Mirage great Brazilian bbq with all you can eat meat. Go and see Love (Cirque Du Soleil) if you like the Beatles music. Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel room and night's sleep in a long long time”
Reviews.Author: chamdex
Reviews.Content: We arrived a bit early and were given an upgrade to a corner room on the 37th floor. Amazing views overlooking the Luxor and down the strip. Room was spotless. At this point I'm seeing little reason to leave the room, but we do. We ate at Mix and Fleur de Lys (Chef Keller's restaurant is preferable). We tried almost every pool save the European one. And yes it was super crowded. We actually preferred the south lagoon pool (I think) that is almost outside of the other pool areas. Not as crowded. It's a long way from the room to the pool, but no matter. On a side note- my lovely husband LOST my license at the pool. (This is after he assures me he has a zippered pocket and it can't get lost). So while I"m going crazy (we fly out the next day)- the awesome security staff has strict procedures that they followed and I got my license back within an hour. Security there is extremely tight and thorough. Also I personally kind of like that it's at the end of the strip. In addition I requested and they granted us a late checkout of 2pm. One of the most important things is we honestly were so comfortable sleeping in their bed that it was almost like our own. We'd definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: ledj2
Reviews.Content: Room Great, Pool area Fantastic. Front desk service the worst I have ever encountered & cold service from all employees. I felt once I checked in THE HOTEL STAFF didn’t want to know me. Everything I was offered I either had to fight for or I never received. If you read my other hotel reviews you can see I rarely complain. We checked in in the middle of a busy weekend & requested 2 queens, non smoking, high floor with a view. They gave us 2 queens non smoking on a low floor with no view & said we have put a note on your reservation that you would like to move the next day to a room on a high floor with a view down the strip. We were told to call at 11am to see when our new room would be ready. We called back at 11am the room wasn’t ready but to call back before 2 or they would give our room away. We called back at 1pm & was advised we didn’t have a room & couldn’t move. We then waited in line for an hour with everyone else checking in to see the person who checked us in the day before. He tried to ignore our complaints & told us he would call us when a room was ready. We’ll wait right here until our room, you promised us, is ready. Amazingly one came up. Great View. Had the same problem when requesting a fridge. Waited 2 days & after talking to a manager was told they were for medical emergencies only. Why not tell me this at check in. I will not stay here again & I will not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What Happen to Mandalay bay”
Reviews.Author: illv3
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here ever year for at least the past 6 years, this year however the place took a turn down ward. The hotel limo was over an hour late picking us up and it took three calls to the hotel. The people I spoke with were less then helpfull. We stayed in a H suite that was in desperate need of updating as well as many of the common spaces. The european pool was no longer topless even thought it was on the web site as being so. The many pool was full of kids and very crowed. The reasturants services was also slow. Unforantly this went from one of my favoraite hotels to one I would not stay at again

Reviews.Title: “good for business trip, pool overrated”
Reviews.Author: artcat58
Reviews.Content: This has a modern, dark, guy inspired interior. Think anti-glitz. The room was comfortable and quiet. The suite with desk was great on monday when I had things I had to get done. The bed was fab and the room was clean. The Mix bar upstairs should not be missed for sunset and drinks. The drinks coupons don't work up there. The aquarium is lovely. The pool was so crowded it was hard to find a chair and the "beach" was kid chaos from hell. The location on the strip is very far south and if you don't have a car add 5-10$ in cab every time you want to go anywhere else. I have heard so many horror stories about Vegas Hotels that I feel like this was fine all in all. I wish I had booked the Venetian or Ceasars instead but were were staying down at this end for other reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but NOT clean”
Reviews.Author: Karkies
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights (July 4-8). The hotel is definitely a quiet escape from the chaos out on the strip. Unfortunately, they seem to have quite a few housekeeping issues. We are not picky and rarely complain about hotel rooms...as the saying goes "it all looks the same in the dark". However here are the issues we encountered upon arriving in our room: Two lights burnt out in the bathroom, one light burnt out in living room, empty water bottles and dirty socks from previous guests under the couch, nasty fecal matter all over the handle area of the toilet, phone unplugged in livingroom, safe locked and had to get maintenance to come unlock it, batteries missing from remote control in living room. About half of these issues were not resolved even after 4 days of talking to the front desk. Barely 4 stars in my opinion. Overall, If you can get a good rate (like we did, less than $100/night), give it a try, just be prepared for some issues.

Reviews.Title: “Showing it's age, showing service cuts due to economy...”
Reviews.Author: skipnatl
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed 4 nights at Thehotel over Independence Day weekend. It was his first time at this property and my second time. It's been a few years since my stay and I'm sorry to say I do not think many capital improvements have been made recently. I want to love this hotel, based on my first experience, but I'm afraid I'm a bit deflated, especially when I made my pro vs. con list. First, to start with the positives: 1) The rooms are all suites, with powder rooms. We had a V Suite, and we loved having two views from the corner. While a full Strip view would have been preferred (I was told it was not available), we had a good view of the pool facilities and some of the south end of the Strip. 2) The bathroom is spacious with double sinks, a WC, and a deep tub. 3) The pool area is fun if quite crowded. We splurged for Moorea on Saturday to get away from children and met some great people. 4) We got a great deal via text from Mandalay Bay. It was a great daily rate over the holiday weekend, however not a huge savings over the Wynn or even a late breaking 4Seasons package (hindsight...) 5) Housekeeping cleaned the room in the morning so by lunch it was in good shape (but more down below). 6) The food around Mandalay Bay is pretty decent. The not-so-good: 1) The duvet had stains. The decorative pillows had stains. Time to recycle the bedding - preferably ones without Vegas all over them. DISGUSTING. 2) The seal in the shower was hanging down. Certainly housekeeping has noticed this, but it seems nothing has been done. 3) Dust was everywhere; very noticeable around the bar area. The cleaning turns is lightening quick, but not complete. 4) The spring on one side of the bed was busted. I called at 9:30 am Saturday to report it. I did not hear back until 6:30 pm as we were eating dinner asking if we wanted to change suites. We were in no mood to pack up and move on Saturday night. Why does this take 9 hours? 5) There was something on the wall of the WC that we had to clean. I do not want to know what that was or why housekeeping didn't notice it when the turned the room. 6) The furniture is nicked, scratched, and looks like something in a dorm room. 7) TV stations are horrible. There are so many hotel choices in Vegas that I would suggest somewhere else. You can find great rates at the 4 Seasons website, and while the rooms are smaller (except suites) and it's a bit more expensive, it's in another league. They Wynn properties are great and the Palazzo much more refined. I'm pulling for THEhotel, but until there is a returned focus to cleanliness, service, and new finishes, I can not recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: ckgirl1967
Reviews.Content: We stayed from June 16-21 and had a great time. The hotel was very pretty and quite. I am really glad that someone had posted the shortcut to get to the pools, just go through the parking garage, it saved alot of time. My only complaint is that they need more reasonable priced places to eat. We went alot to Luxor, Excalibur and NYNY. I guess they figure you are spending that kind of money to stay there, you can afford it. But seriously, $4 for a bottle of water??? But, If you don't mind staying on the end of the strip I would recommend it, pool is great and there were lots of kids when we were there. We also got a bus pass and that helped us get around alot !!!! Can't wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Rufus100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here many times now, enjoy THEhotel every time. The value compared to Wynn or Palazzo is great. For the same size room, THEhotel charged $118/night compared with Wynn at $350 and Palazzo at $220. Then we were upgraded to a 2000 sq ft penthouse for only $200 more/night. The room was amazing, but did require some updating. The couches were a little old and the floors were scuffed, but the sheer size of the room made up for these minor details. There were at least 5 separate sound systems and 4 large tvs. Aside from the great rooms they have, THEhotel has an amazing lobby and its quiet and peaceful. You can walk to Mandalay which is only a minute or two stroll through the long hallway. The restaurants do not compare to Wynn but they are decent and they do have Fleur D Lys, which is a good bet. The pool area is cool, loved gambling outdoors, and hanging at the European Club. All in all, a great choice for LV.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but get the coffe makers in the rooms already”
Reviews.Author: artieboy
Reviews.Content: Have stayed several times and it's lovely. Would be higher rated if I didn't have to pack my own coffee maker. The east coast time traveller shift gets you up hours before starbucks opens.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 Star Hotel--Not what I expected; Mandarin Oriental next time”
Reviews.Author: Dmalw
Reviews.Content: Maybe my expectations were a bit too high. Maybe I am a bit too spoiled...maybe I expect too much. I travel extensively but have somehow skipped Las Vegas and was really expecting something different. So, I was a bit disappointed in The Hotel. The Hotel is a nice property but is definitely not in the 5 star category; a 3.5 at best. The rooms are spacious and appear grand but the cleanliness leaves much to be desired. I get the impression that at one time The Hotel established itself as a cut above but has lowered its standard in order to survive the economic downturn. Now, I understand that they turn over the rooms quickly so there is not much time but the room was not inexpensive--not outrageously expensive but for the price I expect a higher level of cleanliness. The bathroom had hair on the floor (not ours) and the drain in the shower looked like it had not been cleaned in ages as you could see the build-up of hair in the drain plus lots of mold/soap scum on the shower. The amenities in the bath were meager; no robes--that surprised me. Very little in the way of shampoo/lotion etc.. the bare minimum. Sparse towels in terms of number and luxury. We had V suite which was spacious enough and had a good layout. BUT-- the upholstered headboard had stains which I don't want to speculate about --you can only imagine. The room was dusty and just looked like it needed a good deep cleaning. As for the rest of The Hotel, I have to admit I was a bit put off by the overall behavior of many of the guests. Again, perhaps I was expecting too much from Vegas. I was rather shocked to see so many extremely intoxicated people, drinks in hand and behaving badly (foul language etc...) roaming through the lobby and the hotel. Again, it is not what I expected. The pool area was attractive--but PACKED. On the positive side, the Concierge was very helpful in securing tickets and reservations for us. I appreciated that. Also, the food in Aureole was very good and the service top-notch. I really believe the property has incredible potential if they would put more emphasis on cleanliness but maybe they don't have to do that--maybe I should find another property that fits my demands. Next time I would choose the Mandarin Oriental a little quieter crowd etc...Maybe I am just getting too picky in my old age.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit in 30 days, as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: nevdestine
Reviews.Content: THEhotel is now our favorite place to stay. Very, very clean. We travel a lot and that is the first thing we look for is how clean is the place. The bathroom is white tile so that would show any dirt and there was none. Very quiet rooms. Never heard anybody shut a door or in the hall. Regular suite is 2 large rooms 2 baths, 3 TV's, one in bath. Large soaking tub with tons of hot water. Marble shower. Desk with paper and envelopes. Very comfortable beds. IPOD station. Huge TV's with surrond sound dvd player. The elevator is right there and there is great coffee shop downstairs. NIghtly live music and billards in the bar. Check in was quick with a full manned clerk counter and a concerciage asking if your need help. Also a bell hop at check in to take bags. Top notch service. Valets know the city street and easiest ways to get around. Taxi's were cheap to go to the couple of blocks to Ceasers or just take the free tram down to MGM. The coffee shop was very tasty with huge portions.

Reviews.Title: “FIRST TIME IN VEGAS AND NEVER REGRET IT”
Reviews.Author: GO_2TravelNow
Reviews.Content: When you go to Vegas, you don't really spend a lot of time at your room, nevertheless, I think that the hotel you pick is part of the "being in Vegas" experience. There are so many options to stay at, that it was a though decision ( I didn't knew TripAdvisor back then) At the end I stayed at "The Hotel" and I don't regret it at all. I had a very good experience overall. Here are my initial thoughts: SERVICE: The service was really great. Even when we didn't spent a lot of time at the hotel, the personal was very amaible all the time. FOOD: We had dinner at China Grill, the food was excellent, but what I loved the most about this restaurant was its decoration! INSTALLATIONS: As all the hotel in Vegas, The Hotel is stunning! It's a very modern and elegant hotel, I l-o-v-e-d the installations. Our room was really big and confortable. The bathroom was spacious and the amenities were just great. Make sure you got a map of the hotel, it's really big (considering it's inside Mandalay Bay) and you can got lost. LOCATION: The Hotel is a little bit far from the Strip. Nevertheless there are so many ways to go though the hotels, that it wasn't a problem for us. PRICE: I can't say it was a bargain because it wasn't, but I think we paid fair for a AAA category hotel. I would definitively go back there, but there are so many options that I should accept that I feel curiose to try something new.

Reviews.Title: “Family trip”
Reviews.Author: bidder5000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel for the second time for a family vacation. We had a big group. here's some observations. 1. Room is nice because they are all suites so you have a separate area from the main bedroom, which is nice. However, these are not huge rooms. 1 1/2 bathrooms which is always a plus with kids. The coach does not pull out to a bed, however, you can ask for extra linens and make the coach into a makeshift bed if needed. 2. The rooms at The Hotel are not extremely clean. They are clean enough, but not super clean. My husband looked in a panel of the TV and it was so dusty, obviously never cleaned. The tile in the bathroom was also dirty. Just wear your socks. 3. The Pool. this is the main reason you stay at MB or The Hotel, right? Anyhow,they have added a whole new section of "paid chairs" so if you want to pay for a chair to sit on, then you are happy. If not, that means a whole lot less lounge chairs for our use! Here's the deal, if you want to pay for a chair, get to the pool at 8am to get a paid chair and to pick which one you want. If you DO NOT want to pay for a chair and cannot find one. Seek out a pool attendant, they will find you some lounge chairs for a TIP. Show the cash and you are in business. As for Cabana's, reserve WAY in advance if you want one. The day of the cabana prices go up depending on availability. This past weekend they started at $925, LAME! Other than too many people being at the pool all the time, the pool is fun and anyone can enjoy this pool/wavepool if you know how to get around what's going on. 4. Where to eat/drink. There are several Starbucks on the resort property so that is good since they do not provide a coffee maker. The Cafe in the lobby area is really good but also really expensive. The Coffee bar has sandwiches, salads all around $10 each, they are in togo containers which makes it convenient to take to the pool or eat in room. Border Grill was excellent for food, they have coupons on restaurant.com Raffles is a coffee shop, the food is fine. They also have coupons on restaurant.com There were several happy hour specials going on while we were there, inquire upon arrival and get the happy hour booklet. House of Blues had 2-4-1 drinks and food items. As I think of other things, I will add them. Please feel free to ask any questions. 5. Free nightlife in hotel Rumjungle is a free club on the main level. they have top 40 dance music. It's fun if you go with a group. Mixx is on the top floor of The Hotel, it's gorgeous, what an awesome view. It's free to get into. It's a beautiful lounge, bar. The Foundation Room is on top of Mandalay Bay. Free for women, $10 for men.

Reviews.Title: “My Birthday”
Reviews.Author: VegasPaul
Reviews.Content: Arrived at TheHotel on Friday June 4th after a 10 hour flight that was delayed for 1 hour 30 mins at Gatwick.Explained to clerk on desk it was my Birthday on the Sunday.She upgraded us to a V Suite on the 14th floor.We also had $25 resort credit.The room was slightly bigger than a normal suite.I would not pay the extra for this room as the standard suites are lovely.I took it only as we were upgraded.The only difference i would say is a double window in bedroom with a full size Plasma tv between these windows.Over this weekend Las Vegas had a weather warning.It was about 110 degrees.Almost 20 degrees over the normal.We did walk to Mandalay Beach area but it was too hot for us Brits. Service was excellent.Love this Hotel.This hotel now charges a Resort Fee.

Reviews.Title: “3rd Time, and I still love it!”
Reviews.Author: fendi_boy
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed at THEhotel and I still really love it! I was here for 1 night on a friday, as I had been comped at Bellagio for the 4 nights before, and I couldnt afford to stay there an extra night! We arrived just after 11am and got checked in and into our room straight away, which we were not expecting! The room was clean and big and everything I remember, and he had a great View of the strip for no extra charge. A lot of people complain about the location but I like that its a bit further out, you dont get the contant crowds that you do with Bellagio. We used the Valet Parking service which was quick and easy. Every member of staff was friendly. Once again, a perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Party in Vegas with class without breaking the bank”
Reviews.Author: Asteri88
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Mandalay Bay when I'm in Vegas. It's a pretty hotel, decent food options, and it's not super expensive like the Bellagio, the Wynn, etc. It's at one end of the strip so you'll need to take cabs. But it's always easy to find one there. You're better off saving money by staying here and spending it at the clubs or the tables.

Reviews.Title: “Few days in Vegas with teens before going to Grand Canyon”
Reviews.Author: MomWithTwoTeens
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Vegas on Sunday of Memorial Day Weekend. We rented a car from the Las Vegas airport. Finding the THEhotel self-park was easier than we thought, but there was not enough signage in the parking lot to direct us quickly to the hotel entrance. Check in was easy. There was no line when we arrived after 7:30 pm. Our two-queen room on the 26th floor was ready when we arrived. As other people had mentioned, no in-room coffee... only expensive mini-bar food. One of our pillow shams had a stain which we left a note for housekeeping the next day and they replaced. Nice-quality TV's and TV in bathroom. Smaller than expected living room area, but it had a door to separate it from the bedroom. The sofa is NOT a sofa-sleeper, btw. After sharing a room with the kids the first night, we had already booked a second king-room for the remaining two nights. The first night we had to pay holiday rates ($$$) for the one room, but the room price was significantly cheaper Monday and Tuesday. We recommend that people sign up for the MGM Player's club to receive notice of extreme discounts (we got our weekday rooms for $96 each and that included our resort fees.) The resort fee also covers wi-fi which is important to our iTouch plugged-in teens. The signs leading to the pool are not clear from THEhotel lobby. Even with a map, it took us several tries until we found the "easiest way" that did not include parading through the casino. The pool was busy, but we went later around lunchtime and some chairs were available at the wavepool. We purchase our own inner-tubes at a Wal-Mart which the guy at the Tube rental desk happily filled for us. We had some beers by the pool which were $7 each plus tip. We ate the buffet breakfast one morning ($25 per person), not worth it. The second day, we walked to the food court at Excaliber where we ate McD's, Starbucks, and Krispy Kremes. We ate some sushi one night in the casino, and it was very good. Also, we ate at the Mexican restaurant that was near the pool and that was very good, too (nice outdoor seating on a balcony level overlooking the pool area.) Otherwise, we ate elsewhere. When we ventured to The Venetian for a show, we drove. Since parking is free, it was the cheapest was to go. We were able to use the side streets that run parallel to the Strip to avoid traffic. Since we were at the far end of the strip, it made it challenging to walk in the heat to the middle or other end. We use our TV for check-out. All of our charges were clear and accurate. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: CCaruthers
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on orbit so I thought the room would be a dump. However, I couldn't have been further from the truth. We had a one bedroom suite with two queen beds, a living room with sofa and LCD TV, and one the best bathrooms I have ever seen - there was even a tv in the bathroom. Everything was clean and the beach area was awesome. You must try the food at the beach cafe - wonderful and very reasonably priced. Our stay was great! Go and have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay but bad housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: EC_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at THEhotel for 4 nights for a business conference. I was impressed by the room layout and amenities. I was not impressed by the housekeeping. When I checked in I was treated very professionally at the front desk. When I got to the room I was surprised to see the amount of trash on the floor. Coins, Lion King ticket stubs, receipts, etc. It was as if they never looked at the carpet. There was a bobby pin in the middle of the "living room" that I left for the duration of my stay to see if it ever got picked up. It did not. The other disturbing thing I witnessed was when I returned to my room at mid-morning during a break at the conference. I walked by a guest room and saw a maid sleeping on the sofa in a guest's room. I don't mean to be totally negative but for the price you pay you should expect Hi-def TV and good housekeeping. On the plus side the business center offered free access to a PC to print your return boarding pass. In these times every hotel should offer free Wi-fi in every room. This hotel did not.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic suite”
Reviews.Author: Samiloupepperell
Reviews.Content: We arrived here early afternoon and were allocated the "V" suite that we had booked, we then enquired as to whether there was any chance of an upgrade, to be told that the next suites up, the "H" suites were all full, which was a real shame but the receptionist then said for an exra fee we could take a "T" suite, whatever that may be, we decided to pay the extra and go for it, we were here to get married and wanted to make our stay a little bit special. Well special turned out to be an amazing 2000 sq ft suite with floor to ceiling views of the Strip, sitting areas, guest bathroom, dining area, bar area, office, 3 huge flatscreen tvs, huge bedroom suite with separate dressing area, bathroom complete with jacuzzi, steam room/shower.etc etc. It was amazing and perfect for entertaining our four guests for drinks on our wedding day. The hotel itself has all the usual facilities expected, shared with the Mandalay Bay hotel. We had breakfast included so ate at "The Cafe" everyday, you can take breakfast up until 3pm, so we usually chose to have a muffin and coffee early from Startbucks and then eat at the cafe for lunch. The service around the hotel was excellent generally, we did come across a very grumpy waitress one day, but aside from this no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and views”
Reviews.Author: TigersOR
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay-the best hotel room I have ever stayed in, and we have been in some nice places in Florida, and Oregon/Washington. The room was huge,peaceful and service fantastic overall. We had a great view of the strip and really enjoyed our stay. Our trip included 2 free tickets to Elvis Cirque Du Soleil at the Aria. This is an amazing show which we highly recommend. The pool area at the Mandalay Bay complex is fantastic, and we loved the pool area. Plenty of sun,water and a beach too. The Buffet at the Mandalay Bay was excellent too. If you are planning to go to Las Vegas,I think this would be a great hotel. The only drawback is the far south location on the strip but not a real problem as no need to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great "home base" hotel for a vacation in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Wokameter
Reviews.Content: Stayed the week of 5-22-10 with spouse and 2 children ages 7 and 9. The rooms were great and check-in was fast and available early (2pm). Received a small fridge and a rollaway bed for free. Rooms were spacious and clean. The pool and beach area is great for the kids and adults. Renting a cabana was expensive, but worth it based on the service. The casino had plenty of tables available and drink service was frequent. Went through Bellagio & Venetian one evening and don't know how anyone can find a table. If you like to gamble at decent priced tables, you'll want to stay here. The location is at the end of the strip, but with the tram that goes to Excalibur, access to MGM and NY,NY are a short trip away. Also, you can walk from THEhotel/Mandalay Bay through Luxor to Excalibur without going outside. The restaurant and bar selection of THEhotel and Manadaly Bay is large enough that you could eat there for a week and try something new. Food and servoce were very good and price was what you would expect in Vegas. I researched this website and saw a lot of negative comments prior to booking my trip at THEhotel. I don't know what the negative people are thinking, but after a week in Vegas, THEhotel was by far and away the best and most economical place to stay for a family. It was our first trip to Vegas as a family and I hope to be able to do it again next year. I recommend it highly to anyone who likes to stay at a fun place.

Reviews.Title: “Large, Very comfortable king suite”
Reviews.Author: lakohls
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on a recent business trip. Was given a comp upgrade to a very nice suite. Bed was very comfortable, huge bathroom, very clean. Room service was prompt. Cable tv selection was poor - but I guess they want you in the casino/shows etc not up in the room! While I was there I still had the option of paying $15/24 hr period for internet access, but I noticed later this year they are planning to add a $15/day fee to all stays to cover the internet & several other "amentities". I hope they disclose this at time of reservation - I will not be happy to find upon arrival that my room cost is actually automatically $15 more each night than what I booked. For the purpose of my business trip proximity to the convention center and plenty of dining choices was perfect. Walking through the casino was very entertaining as well. For someone wanting to visit & walk "the strip" it is a little long as it is basically at the far end. Would stay at THE hotel or regular Mandalay Bay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms TERRIBLE Pool - Stay @ The Four Seasons for the same price..”
Reviews.Author: callmeq
Reviews.Content: THE Hotel at Mandalay has fantastic rooms, but the pool is awful. THE Hotel does not have its own pool, so you have to walk a mile to use the pools for Mandalay Bay, that in of itself is reason enough to stay at The Four Seasons. To avoid having to use the pools at Mandalay Bay and the gaggle of kids, we decided to pay to use the Moorea Beach Club. One would think that paying a premium for an adult pool would afford us some peace and quiet to enjoy our day in the sun. That was not the case. When we arrived to the pool at noon the music was already booming, and not in a good way, rather like the annoying people who drive by with the bass and volume so loud it makes your car vibrate. To top that off they were playing "Gangster Rap". I have no problem with rap music but "Gangster Rap" is whole another ball of wax. After about an hour of "[--], [--], and Ho's suck my [--], I had enough and went to ask for the music to be changed. When nothing happened I went back to the front with another guest asking for the manager of the pool. He was aggressive and argumentative about the music and how the Moorea Beach Club was attempting to provide a "club like" environment for its guests. That's a legitimate argument, however, at noon on a Tuesday when the average person at the pool is over the age of 40 and half of them being women, the music was offensive and over-powering for those of us who wanted to relax by the pool. For an establishment that tries to pride itself in catering to a "higher" class of clientele neither the service nor the atmosphere lends itself to either. I recommend staying at The Four Seasons or the newly opened Mandarine Oriental. For about the same amount of money you will save yourself alot of headache and a much more enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “elegant suites”
Reviews.Author: Miker422
Reviews.Content: Here as part of a convention and decided to stay at a different hotel then my usual haunts which are Venetian, Ceasars. I'm glad for the change. TheHotel is a very nice suite very a pleasant bonus of having an extra half bath in the hallway. Travelling sometimes with my wife and two young daughters, thats a huge bonus. Service at the front desk and valet was very professional and courteous. Thehotel is connected to Mandalay Bay hotel and Casino as is the Four Seasons. My other problem with the place is that on my first visit trying to find Thehotels valet area on a busy weekend night was taxing. Also for those who are new to Vegas, The Hotel is not Centrally located on the Strip is a little walk to the four corners of MGM, NYNY

Reviews.Title: “A classy hotel with a few flaws!”
Reviews.Author: MindyinMo
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to Vegas (last trip was July 2009). PLEASE never go in the summer if you are heat sensitive. Going in May was a delight...the weather was wonderful. I will be comparing this hotel with The Venetian as that is where I stayed last July. I expected the cab ride from the airport to TheHotel to be cheaper then when I stayed at The Venetian because of how close it is to the airport. Well, it still cost about $15.00. Be prepared to pay approx $20.00 every time you take a cab anywhere on the strip. I'm just warning those who are not used to riding in cabs or how fast a fare can add up. Be prepared and don't let the shock factor ruin your mood! When the cab pulls into a parking garage and up to TheHotel don't be alarmed and think you are being dropped off in some back Vegas alley. It is strange that you have to travel into a parking garage to get to the front of TheHotel but I noticed several hotels in Vegas have shady looking entrances (Imperial Palace). The staff are VERY friendly and TheHotel was very classy. It is easy to find the registration desk and you don't have to maneuver through a casino to find it. Very quiet in the lobby if that is what you are looking for. If you want the excitement of hearing the casino when you get to your hotel go with most of the other hotels. The front desk upgraded me to a regular room with a view. He said usually it is a forty dollar upgrade. I said "yep, ok" not getting too excited. WELL...the room was on the 36th floor and had an awesome view of the strip. I could lay in bed and just gaze at the Luxor and its lights and the strip. If a view is important to you please pay the $40.00! When you walk into the room there is a half bath and then the living area with flat screen tv, couch and desk. You walk through a door and into a beautiful bedroom and a bathroom with a seperate toliet, large soaking tub (not jetted) and a shower. The door seperating the rooms is wonderful if you are with people that like to watch tv late and you just want to hit the bed. BIG COMPLAINT...the walls are paper thin!!!! I could hear babies crying, music, chit chat and tv from the rooms next door. If you have trouble falling asleep and staying asleep DO NOT stay at this hotel!!! If someone tells you any different there were lucky or they fall asleep and stay asleep easily. At The Veneitian I had no trouble with noise. Beds at both hotels are very comfortable. Also, there was no security keeping non-guests off the elevators and in the hallways to the guest rooms. I saw several people wandering around to just see what the guest floors were like. At The Venitian there is security at the elevators that would not even let you on the elevator to the guest floors without showing a room key. I took joy rides on the elevators at Luxor and wandered around the guest floors (just FYI - in case security is important to you). I liked the regular rooms at The Venetian better because the bedroom and living room was connected - one big open space - the living room was sunken and had a huge L shaped coach. I was not with anyone that wanted to stay up late watching tv that time so a seperate closed off living area was not important to me. If you are with a large group and would like to have drinks together or just chit chat the L shaped couch at The Venetian is hard to beat. WARNING...TheHotel now has a $15.00 resort fee which they charge everyone (unless, like me, you book the room before it when in effect). The fee covers a free USA Today, in-room wireless interent, cardio room access, two free bottled waters, local and 800 number calls and outgoing faxes and boarding passes. WARNING...do NOT even touch the candy, waters and other items sitting in a box like thing in the living area. The items are on a sensor and if you even move them you will be charged. Same goes for the mini-fridge. Luckily, they give you a key you have to use to open the mini-fridge which is easy to hide from kids/drunk friends but the items just sitting out in the box is within reach. You WILL be charged for just moving them (this is the same at The Venetian). The shower in the bath was showing its age (already???) but The Venetian bath rooms were wonderful. I liked the lay out and quietness of The Venetian but it is really personal preference. Don't worry, the walk from TheHotel to The Mandalay Bay casino/beach/restuarants is really not that long of a walk compared to other hotels. The beach and pools were impressive but I'm not much of a pool goer. The little kids looked like they were having fun. Cabanas were crammed together and were SO close to the regular beach goers....did not look worth the money. There is a tram that takes you from Mandalay Bay to Excalibar with a stop at Luxor if you want. Also..there is now a tram that takes you from Monte Carlo to Belligioand Aria. Check out was fast and easy!!! Great staff!

Reviews.Title: “A secluded alcove from the hustle and bustle of vegas”
Reviews.Author: marylizz26
Reviews.Content: When you enter The Hotel you really feel you are getting away from the usual intense las vegas experience. The decor and aromatic atmosphere of the main level are soothing and visually pleasing..making up for a slightly awkward design... the lobby is a walk down a long hall and then a walk back to find the elevators. The rooms are suites with nice amenities and offer extra space for teenagers who loved all the plasma tVs. Service was good but not exceptional; likewize the food; It is a distance to the pool area which is very crowded on hot days and if only guests can get it then they should have made it larger. We were hoping this area would live up to the disneyworld water parks but the wave pool and lazy river fall short. too bad as the area could use these features.

Reviews.Title: “The H-Suite is da bomb!”
Reviews.Author: Gilbertoo
Reviews.Content: As we were hosting a 10th Wedding Anniversary party, we decided to book the H-Suite for two nights and whilst it was quite expensive, it was definitely worth the money. Reception/Check-in The boutique feel hits you the second you walk in. No manic casino to walk through, just calm chic. They pump a nice smell throughout the lobby too. I couldn't quite make it out but it was nice all the same! We had to wait a while to get checked in and was unfortunate to be seen by a trainee. No bother though as she checked us in without any issues. We were offered assistance with our bags but we respecfully declined... The H-Suite (60th Floor) The suite is very big, with it's own wet bar, lounge/dining area, small business desk with fax machine, etc., a secondary lounge just before the large bedroom, a large bathroom with massive jacuzzi tub and shower/steam room. There is also a seperate toilet just off the main lounge area so no queues whilst entertaining! In total, there are three 42" TV's plus a smaller one in the bathroom. The rack housing the rest of the AV equipment was very impressive; two amps, two DVD players, a radio receiver and a VHS player. All of this could be controlled by wall mounted controllers in every room. We showed a slideshow on every screen during our party and used the in-ceiling speakers for our party music. The TV channels offered were actually quite poor and inferior to the main hotel at Mandalay Bay....mainly because THEhotel don't provide HD channels, whereas Mandalay Bay does. No bother though as we weren't interested in watching TV. As well as the AV controllers, other controllers for aircon and curtains were also available in every room. Room Service The day we arrived, we requested for an additional fridge to be delivered to our bar area (as we were hosting a party) and this was delivered within 30 minutes. We only ordered food once and, again, this was for our party. Because we were ordering food for 12 people, we gave them a bit of time and ordered it at 4:30pm and asked for it to be delivered at 6:00pm. It was delivered at 6:05pm. My only (small) criticism was that some of the food wasn't particularly hot.....but no doubt this was due to the amount of food we ordered and the time taken to prepare it all. When the food was delivered, they laid a table cloth on the dining table and presented the food in a professional manner. The food itself was nice, nothing too special.....steak sandwiches, wagyu burgers, club sandwiches, tuna baguettes, vegetable paninis, french fries, potato salads, etc. THEbeach area and other pools To get a free lounger, you need to get there quite early! By 10:00am, most of them are taken. You can pay a fee to get a slightly better one. You can also pay considerably more (upto $500 per day!) for a beach bungalow (with aircon, TV's, fridges!). The beach itself is nice and the simulated waves coming from "the sea" were very realistic. We paid $70 ($50 for men, $20 for women) to go to the Moorea Beach Club. This area had more pools, loungers, day beds, etc.....plus a DJ and a bar. It was full of artificially enhanced people (think silicon and 'roids!). It had more of an exclusive feel to it and if you want to party during the day, it's definitely worth a visit. Facilities We didn't use many of the facilities, but they all looked very nice. We did go to the Mix Lounge on the top floor though. From there, the view of the strip has to be one of THEbest in Las Vegas. Truly awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe and Unresponsible”
Reviews.Author: shelsizorhand
Reviews.Content: Stay away from their health spa. The ceramic tiles are very slippery when wet, which is obviously unavoidable. I (and many others according to hotel employees) slipped and fell there and as a result ended up with a concussion, whiplash and an injured rotator cuff. Even with confirmed statements from witnesses that it was obviously the fault of the hotel, they basically told me they were not holding themselves responsible because they had a girl on duity to dry the floors! It didn't mean anything to them that she clearly hadn't done her job or that I fell, either one. So unless you have a lawyer ready for hire and up to $2000. out of pocket on hand for repairs, I'd stay away from hotels like this one. Shelly Vincent

Reviews.Title: “Sedate respite from the Vegas merry-go-round”
Reviews.Author: sfiver
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a more sedate Las Vegas experience, I highly recommend THEhotel at Mandalay Bay. It is part of the Mandalay Bay resort although is in its own building. It has a modernist art-deco lobby and the staff is friendly and professional. The elevator service is very quick and no long walks to your suite. All the rooms are suites complete with a living room and bedroom. It is very comfortable and quiet. The bathrooms have a soaking tub and separate shower. A separate "half-bath" is located in the entrance hall. A fully stocked and high-priced mini-bar is part of a small bar with sink in the living area. Flat screen TV's are in all rooms including the bathroom. (They do not have - as of yet per the engineering staff - high def reception - so everything is wide.) The bed is very comfortable. The floor to ceiling windows are great especially if you are on a higher floor facing west toward the mountains. The only major drawback is the very long walk to the pool area. The other drawback to some might just be what is so attractive to me about this property. The ambiance is sedate - meaning that it is dark but not gloomy. The atmosphere of calm is enhanced by the darker tones. I find most Vegas hotels are overly bright and cheerful with color clashing everywhere. This is not THEhotel. The tones are cool and (again) sedate and quiet; peaceful. However, the casino excitement and numerous eateries are steps away. Make sure to join their "Players Club" as they offer special rates as low as $90 & tax per night. You can do this online, I think.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!! ROOM BROKEN INTO WHILE WE WERE SLEEPING!!”
Reviews.Author: Howard
Reviews.Content: My friends and I came back from a restaurant Friday evening. We had no one else in the room and no guests. When we woke up Saturday morning, my Rolex was gone from the nightstand where I always leave it, shoes were missing, cash and other jewelry. Security downstairs was a joke, fortunately my insurance company has reimbursed me for my Rolex which was to be handed down to my son. Our room was locked, we did not have the additional latch on. How scary to think that someone stood over me, looked down, and stole from me. The thought that I could have been beaten, killed, drugged or any other endless possibility makes me shiver. I will never stay there again. Also, check in was torture, very rude lady, if you can call her that. Rooms are getting old and beat up. This used to be a 5 star hotel, now my rating as Dean Wermer from Animal House put it so well is, ZERO point ZERO. Yes, I can laugh, it was only a material possession and I wasnt physically hurt. Scared forever but I have learned a vaulable lesson, use the latch and the safe, and never stay at THE HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip...Low Rates”
Reviews.Author: Cryption359
Reviews.Content: I live in vegas but once in a while its fun to be a tourist so this trip we decided to stay at THE HOTEL since a lot of people recommended it to us and we'd never had stayed there. From the moment we entered the hotel there were no lines and the check in process went by pretty smooth. Once we were in our room we were impressed with the room and the service was great. The food options where immense and the variety we liked. The only downfall was that the room service was a little slow one night that we almost went downstairs and ordered from a restaurant other then that we enjoyed our experience at THE HOTEL. I would definitely stay again at this hotel due to the service and options that it offers especially with the rates being as low as they were i cant really complain.

Reviews.Title: “The biggest surprise of our trip!”
Reviews.Author: Yencie
Reviews.Content: We booked months in advance the most basic room of the Mandalay Bay (we found a great offer on the internet). When we went finally got there (to the Mandalay) for the check in, there were no double rooms available, so they gave us an upgrade to THEhotel. I was sharing a room with 2 friends, but they also upgraded the room of my cousin who was in another room so we can all be together! We didn't know what to expect, because we have never seen THEhotel before. Oh my God... what an upgrade!! We ended up in a huge, beautiful room in the 21st floor, we had 2 bathrooms, living room and 3 tv's. It was always clean, and the bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The bathroom was HUGE. The view was great too (to the Strip)! The only thing we didn't liked was that it was very far from all the action on the Strip. We had to walk a lot to get the Deuce (the trolley), or take the monorail to the Excalibur so we had to walk less. THEhotel is connected with Mandalay Bay, so it was like we stayed there, but with an even better room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service we ever had”
Reviews.Author: nats-dk
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online as the rooms seemed very nice. We visit Vegas once a year, but this was our first New Year Eve there. It was also my partners bday, so made sure to make a point of that priot to booking and at our arrival. Noone seemed to give a damn, we were rushed and ignored when we tried to point that out. One thing you can normally ALWAYS count on in Vegas, is service. We stayed at Paris, Venetian and Bellagio and absolutely loved it. I know The Hotel is suppose to be on a quite end, we were well aware of that, but there was no atmosphere at all. Combined with such a poor service, I will never pay to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kidsandtravel
Reviews.Content: Loved this Vegas hotel. Vegas is a noisy crazy place, yet every time I crossed over the line from mandalay into The Hotel, it was calming, quiet and even smelled tranquil. Mandalay is big and bustling and within seconds from The Hotel. The rooms were modern and clean, loved the separate living area and powder room. We had 4 girls to a room, ordinarily this would have been to much. With this room I rarely felt like we were on top of each other, even getting ready for evening (not a room for prudes as the shower is all clear glass). Staff were helpful and friendly. Beds were comfortable and rooms quiet. Tip - Cut through the garage to get to the Mandalay pool much quicker. Casino was fun, but other hotel Casino's felt like they had a better atmosphere about it. Ate dinner at Mix. Great view from the bar up there, food A+, service B at best, very slow. Downsides, not anything major. Mandalay pool scene is loud, nothing relaxing about it, but it is a party 24/7 in Vegas so to be expected. The Hotel is at the very end of the strip, didn't bother us much, we used taxi's or limos. There is also a free mono rail that connects mandalay to some hotel close to NY NY. Rum Jungle is lame. 'The Hotel' spa staff were bit rude and it's very clinical looking in there. Would stay here again, had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet oasis in the middle of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: smushie
Reviews.Content: What more can I say that hasn't already been said. It's a gorgeous and swank hotel hidden away in plain sight in the middle of the Mandalay Bay resort. I booked a suite that included floor to ceiling windows, great furnishings, a comfortable bed, a huge bathroom with a shower and tub and the word "quiet" doesn't even begin to explain how thick the walls in this place must be. In the middle of the day I could draw the curtains and literally hear a pin drop while taking a nap.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but too far for the money”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaKruse
Reviews.Content: THEhotel at Mandalay Bay is truly a great hotel, but there are a couple things to be aware of before booking it: Rooms: The room itself was very clean and the beds were so comfortable. The room had a bedroom with attached full bathroom (including a TV and separate bath/shower) and a living area with an attached half bathroom. We weren't in it very often but it was big enough for four girls to get ready. Mandalay Beach: Being the only man-made beach on the Strip, it was very crowded, but that's to be expected. We weren't able to find seven chairs together, but we didn't expect to. Instead we just grabbed a patch of sand enough for all of us. It's a great pool area though and the wave pool is so much fun! Dining: The only place on-site we went to was Raffles Cafe which was way overpriced for their food. Their eggs were overcooked and one waffle was about $13. Location: Awful if you want to see the rest of the Strip and are only there for a couple days. Great if you want to stay around your hotel and want a quiet place. It literally takes all day to walk from one end of the strip to the other (if you want to go in a lot of the hotels, which you should do). Bottom line: I'd recommend with a disclaimer on the location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved theHotel ! An Oasis of Calm & Luxury in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mvtourist
Reviews.Content: After debating whether we should take the kids to Vegas during Spring Break we decided to go for it. We arrived at the Hotel and immediately we were so glad we did. Check in was quick and very smooth. We got a great suite on the 18th Floor. We were travelling with 3 small kids so were thrilled with the size and comfort of the room. The presence of an additional half bath was very handy and after the kids were asleep , we could relax in the living room without having to worry. Everything about the room was great - very clean, comfortable beds, HUGE bathroom. The lobby is very clean and modern and the nice thing is you don't have to walk through a gross casino to get to your room. A bit of a walk to the pool but again there is a nice route which avoids trekking thru' the casino. The pool area was great for kids and it was usually easy to get a sunbed (except Friday afternoon and Sat when it got quite busy - but even then if you get there by 11 you'll be fine) Kids loved the wave pool and the lazy river. Had a blast and will definitely stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, overall not bad, just one big faux-pas”
Reviews.Author: relax_n_eat
Reviews.Content: Let's start of with the positives. The hotel is in a quiet location on the strip and features some great restaurants. The room itself was a nice size, with a separate living room and TVs in the Living Room, Bathroom and Bedroom. It's like a mini apartment. The liquor cabinet is well stocked, although extremely overpriced (which is no exception for Vegas). I would say the decor was tasteful and modern. The only "problem" I encountered was with the complimentary bathrobes that are provided by the hotel. One of our robes was blood stained on the inside around the private area. Waking up in the morning I didn't notice and I wore the robe for a bit, until I noticed the dark spot on the robe. For a hotel that holds itself out as a luxury hotel this is totally unacceptable, and the only thing that went through my mind was "if they miss that, what else do they miss?" and obviously having been in contact with someone else's bodily fluids didn't help my impression of the hotel. At least, once I called the front desk I got a brand new robe 2 hours later. It is the details that make a luxury hotel what it is, TheHotel failed at least this time.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: nick22
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 9908 at THE Hotel from 4/19-4/23. The room was gorgeous: nice furniture, clean, spacious and practically designed. As many have said before, the additional room and half bath make a world of difference. Feels like an apt more than a hotel room. Besides the room itself, I really like the close proximity of THE Hotel to the rest of what Mandalay Bay has to offer. While the pool could be a decent walk, the restaurants and casino are a very short distance from THE Hotel. Although I was originally considering staying at The Signature at MGM, I was so glad I chose THE Hotel after walking over to The Signature suite. The MGM set up is MUCH more spread out than Manadalay. Put it this way, you have to go down at least three moving sidewalks just to get to building one of The Signature....not including the long walk from the casino through the shopping mall and restaurant area. Checking out Mix nightclub is a must. Incredible views and an overall cool atmosphere. Lastly, I really enjoyed the "bottom of the strip" location of Mandalay Bay in general. In my opinion, this resulted in the presence of enough people to make it feel busy and lively....but not so many that moving around was a hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch!”
Reviews.Author: womackjames
Reviews.Content: Spent five days at this luxurious hotel. Exquisite service, gorgeous rooms, fantastic views! The employees are some of the nicest people you would ever want to meet and will bend over backwards to make sure that your stay far exceeds your expectations. Have stayed at other establishments in Las Vegas but, this is the tops! Will recommend the hotel to everyone I know. Thanks for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Real Nice Hotel, but....”
Reviews.Author: jenlaur1
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip on a plane. That in itself was quite something. But, we're talking about THE hotel. We got into our room and were impressed by the size of it. It was real quite. Although, ten minutes after we arrived, a maintenance guy shows up to tell us that our bathroom sink is leaking into the downstairs room. Ok..no problem, he fixes it and then we decide to go out and explore Mandalay Bay. We had our dinner at the buffet there and I can tell you it's the first buffet where I had to wait to be seated. The food was okay though. Nothing terrific about it though. The servers there were attentive; deserving of their tip. We then played some slots and went to bed. It was a long day. It was real nice to look out our window and have a great view of the Luxor to our left and the mountains in front of us (the airport, too). I couldn't go to sleep right away. Stayed up and watched tv in the living area while my husband went to sleep in the bedroom. We were on the 26th floor and there is a restaurant/club up on the 64th floor. I could hear the people and the music as if they were outside my window; that's how loud they were. I was tired enough, though, that I was able to go to sleep in spite of that. The next morning we discovered our shower made this real loud whistling like sound. Someone came and fixed it while we were gone for the day and we were told that it's usually not that loud, but they had a bigger crowd than usual up in the club which could explain the noise level. I didn't hear that level of noise again during our stay. (Sat to Thurs). Monday morning we left early to go on a South Rim Grand Canyon tour. Loved it..although it was long, it was well worth it. The canyon is a beautiful example of nature at it's finest. We did get back later..around 9 p.m. to discover that our room key cards didn't work. Had to wait 20 mins in the hallway for the maintenance guy to come up to watch him break into our room with crow bars. Turns out that the batteries to the lock were dead. Not something we needed to deal with at the end of a very long day. We purchased Las Vegas Power Passes and the writing as to where we had to pick them up was not clear; ended up spending a couple of hours trying to find out where it was that we had to pick them up in. It's at the Forum Shops in Ceasar's Palace at the Planet Hollywood retail shop next to the restaurant. I don't think those are worth the money unless you are able to really travel to all the attractions. Just be aware, there is tons and tons of walking to be done unless you have your own car. You have to walk through every casino for one reason or another to get wherever you need to go. To get to the monorail from THEhotel, we had to walk through Mandalay Bay to the tram that goes to The Excalibur then we had to cross the street to the MGM Grand and had to walk at least a mile if not more to get to the monorail. And when you want to come back that way, it's the same, having to walk through some casino for a mile or more to get to the monorail. We saw The Blue Man Group, The Tournament of the Kings and Defending the Caveman. All really good shows. We also caught a small blues band at the House of Blues in Mandalay Bay on Tuesday night that was real good. All in all, the hotel room, while very, very nice and the hotel employees were very helpful, the casinos and the shows and the Grand Canyon stick out in my mind. If you want to know what you'll spend most of your money on (if you aren't a huge gambler like myself) it's the food. Unless you live in places like McDonalds, you'll find most food bills will be at least $30 for two people. Oh, I do advise not buying drinks at THE hotels lounge. For two drinks; a gin and tonic and a fuzzy navel...$23!! geesh. Nothing is cheap in that hotel except when you need to print out your security documents for your airline; that is free in their business office. Oh, that reminds me. we don't use a credit card. We used our banks debit card that has the MC logo on it; allowing us to use it anywhere. Anyway, we wanted to purchase the internet from them and they said b/c the card was a debit card and not a credit card they would charge us $100 a day for the 'incidental' expense and would, at the end of our stay, then reimburse us the difference once we checked out. We were lucky that my husband had his works wireless usb or we would have been without internet and unable to keep in communication with out kids. That's about it folks. I hope this is even a little bit helpful. :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Bon2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently on a girls' weekend away. The room was fantastic. Immaculately clean, very spacious and fresh in appearance. Upon entering the room, a powder room immediately was to the left, then a living area with mini bar area (sink, glasses, wine glasses, corkscrew), couch, desk & chair, and a good sized flat screen tv (approx 40 in). In the separate bedroom there were 2 queen beds with a bedside table in between. A wall unit had another (smaller) flat screen tv in the center and an armoires for clothing on both sides. The bathroom was lovely, with double sink, tub, separate shower, and a small tv. Nice toiletry items. The casino area was classy; not over the top, and not stuffy. The Mandalay Bay complex had many excellent restaurants to choose from & and a gorgeous pool area outside. I had absolutely no complaints, and highly recommend THEHotel. Will stay here on my next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: CEYLON_10
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here and I had forgotten what the first stay was like and would not recommend it and will not stay here again. The Hotel staff at the desk were helpful but the rest of the staff had a lot to be desired. The bathroom towels were torn and the noise from the music etc was not conducive to sleeping - even in Vegas !

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, too many extra costs, esp. internet”
Reviews.Author: brently55
Reviews.Content: Start with the good...rooms were nice - spacious and comfortable. Now for the bad...you get charged for EVERYTHING...felt like I was really nickle and dimed. Watch out for INTERNET CHARGES...$15/day/laptop. Thats right, if you have 2 laptops and an iphone your internet charges will be $45/day which is outrageous. No coffee in room, which is just standard now. Instead they expect you to go down to Starbucks, stand in line for 20 mins at 6:30am and pay $5/coffee for the privledge. It seems this hotel is entirely focused on getting every last cent out of its customers...rather than thinking about the customer's experience. Lastly the hotel is at the far end of the strip and we were kept awake most nights by thumping music from one of the nightclubs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, terrific rooms, great service. Would stay again and again!”
Reviews.Author: robbyk1005
Reviews.Content: Cant say enough good things about THE Hotel. Our room was fabulous. We had an amazing view of the strip and the room itself was excellent. Nothing but great service from check in to check out. Great food and the pool was incredible. It was quiet enough for rest and close to all the sites on the strip. A+++++++++++

Reviews.Title: “THEsuite was spacious and great for entertaining!”
Reviews.Author: lilazncanadian
Reviews.Content: We booked THEsuite at THEhotel at Mandalay Bay. Checked in after a day of shopping. Self-parking was no problem but it was a 5-8 minute walk to the hotel from there. Room was on a high floor and faced the Luxor. 2 Queen beds - both were luxurious. Plenty of storage space for shopping and suitcase items. I loved their bathrobes and slippers. The slippers were furry and exquisite! Bathroom had a separate shower and tub. 2 sinks in the master bathroom and then another half piece bathroom outside in entryway to the suite - wonderful idea! I liked the formalized desk area and the amount of space in the living room area. Plenty of space to entertain a couple of friends before going out for the night or after dinner one of our other nights. Someone managed to spot the In-n-Out burger from our window and we did go there for a quick bite to eat sometime after midnight. Good times. We had a car - so it was extremely convenient for us to be at the THEhotel. I can understand that if you don't have a car it can be a pain to get to/from to the hotel. Casino was okay for our needs. Had a large sports betting area and lots of table games/slot machines that we wanted to play. It's also connected to a mall so plenty of shopping could be done... One thing to note is that there was an upside down M&M Peanuts can in our room which was empty on arrival. We advised them of that and we weren't charged for it - but it reminded me to always check for those kinds of things in the room. There were also weird syrupy stains near the desk area and the remote felt dirty. I guess all the dark furniture/carpeting hides most of this but I figured at the price I'm paying it would've been a little more immaculate. I did, however, find THEhotel stickers on my neatly folded bathroom tissue and THEwhatever all over the room's items. I think there was THEnotepad. It may annoy some but I found it endearing. We ended up spending the resort credit offer on some food at the hotel and the hotel's convenience store. Check-in/check-out was a breeze. 5-10 minute wait but the reception staff were a pleasure to deal with. This isn't the hotel's fault but we got a taxi downstairs to go to the Bellagio one night (just to drink and have fun) and the driver decided to give us guff when we responded to his question of: "Which way do you want me to go?" and I responded: "The shortest and cheapest way." He then proceeded to complain about the 40 minute wait he had sitting alone in the taxi rank at the hotel. I figured it's because this property is further away that guests may usually be looking for longer rides to other locations and that the Bellagio was too short of a fare to make up for his wait. I mention this just to warn others but it may have been an one-off experience.

Reviews.Title: “Stay closer to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Pisces4444
Reviews.Content: The V-Suite in THEhotel was very spacious and the corner room on the 30th floor was awesome. The reason we picked this hotel was because of the wave pool. We spent no more than an hour there in our 4 days. The waves were weak and the pool area was overcrowded such that we spent 10 minutes waiting for chairs mid-afternoon. The chairs are inches away from each other. Way too crowded!!!! This hotel is at the far south end of the Strip so everything is pretty far away. We did walk and walk to see all of the other hotels and attractions, but next time we will stay in the center, specifically at the Bellagio. The pools at the other hotels seem just as crowded, so who cares about the pool next time. Location is now more important. Front desk staff at THEhotel is useless - couldn't understand the check-in clerk, and when we had issues with our room key not working we were given the run-around until we insisted on having someone from security/engineering actually go with us to fix the situation. Mini-bar and gift shop item prices are stupid, so try to purchase your liquid needs elsewhere outside of the Strip. Food was excellent at the Red Square, but the Mandalay buffet was mediocre. Atmosphere was just OK. You had to pay $15 per day for in-room internet service.

Reviews.Title: “very plush hotel...comes with a price”
Reviews.Author: 121star
Reviews.Content: i stay at THEhotel for a bachelorette weekend. all the rooms are suites with separate living areas and fantastic bathrooms. the location of the hotel is a little ways from the main portion of the strip. THEhotel gives you access to the pools at mandalay bay which are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique retreat”
Reviews.Author: Charps
Reviews.Content: The first thing we noticed about this hotel was the scent – it smelled lovely – there’s a scent pumped throughout the hotel. The next thing is just how quiet it is – it felt more like checking into a spa than a Las Vegas hotel. We were on the 38th floor and the room was amazing. The separate lounge area made a pleasing change and gave us somewhere to chill out and relax after a hard day walking ‘the strip’. The bathroom was huge and had the best tub I’ve ever seen – it was definitely made for sharing. The only downside to the room is the lack of coffee machine. The pool area was really good, although we didn’t really take full advantage of it. We were originally told by our travel agent that all but one of the pools would be closed, this wasn’t true – they were all, but one open. The lazy river was fun, but no free rafts for guests to use – big let down! We had one small problem with our main hotel room door not quite locking some times – we reported this to reception and it was sorted smoothly and swiftly without any hassle. Many people have commented on how the location (at the end of The Strip) lets this place down. This was one of the best points for us. It was great to have somewhere where you could really escape the chaos of Vegas. Everything was still in walking distance and the free tram from Mandalay Bay to Luxor and Excalibur was good. There are various drug stores for soda and snacks nearby. We did visit the buffet in Mandalay Bay which was about $27 per person for dinner and $17 per person for breakfast – a great option if you’re really hungry! Almost forgot – the miX Bar is a must – visit before 10pm and there’s no cover charge to pay. Get there for sunset and the view is stunning. Loved this hotel – the ambience and location were perfect me and my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: jeeper4fun
Reviews.Content: From the minute we stepped into this place we realized it was going to be a great time. The room had 3 plasma tv's in it, One in the 2 bathrooms that it had. The king size bed with Egyptian sheets made that bed so cozy that we didn't want to get out of it every morning. The wave pool was fun, but we only went in it once, cause we didn't fly all the way to Vegas to sit by a pool. We loved the Shark reef at the resort. Lots of fish to see up close. I can't think of one bad thing to say about this place. You get what you pay for. We paid for luxury and we got it.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Ras Al Khaimah, United Arab Emirates
Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: XKCX
Reviews.Content: Got upgraded to a suite, which ws spacious and very clean. Liked the double bath and flat screen tv in the bathroom. Nice that the hotel has a back entrance to avid going through the casino everytime. Stayed in the Ballagio the followig year. This hotel is far superiour to the Bellagio. On the negative side the pol was crowded, especially at the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Suite but not a Luxury Price”
Reviews.Author: JJBZ3
Reviews.Content: THEhotel at Mandalay Bay is a true luxury hotel. The moment you pull into the private check-in area, away from the craziness of the casino, you fell like your in another world. The rooms are spacious with a living room, bedroom, and two bathrooms (one great full bath & a half bath). The only negatives are my 17" laptop didn't fit in the safe and no coffee maker.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome rooms and very unlike regular Vegas”
Reviews.Author: desitraveljunkie
Reviews.Content: We simply loved this hotel.. located at one end of the strip this only-suite hotel had a very chic decor and modern ambiance, quite unlike the loud, encroaching surroundings at other Vegas hotels.. the room was huge with a living room and a large bathroom.. it was very nice to come and enjoy the comforts of a hotel which, although on the strip provided a calm and comfortable environment to simply lay back and relax after soaking in a long day of whatever Vegas has to offer. And the best part is that its all very affordable..

Reviews.Title: “"Hidden" fees amounting to more than the room rate”
Reviews.Author: tweetster13
Reviews.Content: BEWARE OF EXAGGERATED CHARGES FOR THINGS IN THE ROOM THAT YOU MAY NOT HAVE EVER EVEN TOUCHED I stayed here for 1 night with a promotional rate of $85 plus tax in December 2009, and ended up paying $200 [basically their normal rate]. It wasn't even a full night, we checked in at like 8:30pm close to 9pm, and checked out earlier than 10am to make it to the famous Paris Brunch, before head on over to our Time Share. That's like 13 hours, including sleep and walking the strip for 5 hours. Don't get me wrong with this, it's a very beautiful and impressive property, but what happened after I left, can't be forgiven. It's appalling, and I feel like I've been personally violated by the whole ordeal. When my Credit Card Bill came, I noticed 2 charges from "Mandalay Bay". I called to find out what the second charge was about and found out that I had apparently been charged over $100 for things from the private bar.
