I travel a lot, and know better than to touch anything in the overpriced bar, when there's the same exact stuff down stairs for much cheaper. When I asked for a receipt of the itemized charges to be emailed to me. I never received it. I called twice to have it emailed, and twice they said they'd do it, and they wouldn't, so I disputed the charge through my Credit Card company. 30 days later, my Credit card was able to receive a copy of the itemized list and below were the items they pretty much made up out of thin air. --- half of this stuff, i don't even know what it is. A "CD?" what the heck. What would i play it in? Who plays a CD in Vegas? I stayed in the room with brothers and sisters, what would I do with a "Love Kit". The only thing I could think of would be the personnel taking everything before tidying up the room, and blaming it on me....how would you dispute that? 4 bottles of Fiji water ($5) 1 Pringles Sour cream ($5) 2 Orange Juice ($4) 1 CD ($10) 1 Travel Kit ($15) 1 Love Kit ($30) 2 Cranberry Juice ($4) In the end I couldn't do anything because they had my credit card on file for "incidental" charges. -- something that's industry standard, but to Arbitrarily charge for everything that was in the room, even if it wasn't used is absolutely NOT standard at all. It's Shady! I come to Vegas a lot and have stayed in a good handful of hotels on the strip and have never had any other Hotel chain do this. From the budget friendly Imperial Palace, to even their very own newest 5 star, the Aria hotel, and not ONCE did any of them try this nonsense. For the many conferences and personal visits to Vegas I shall make, in the future, I will never, ever stay at the Mandalay or TheHotel again. It's managed by Shady people.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Vegas and loved it.”
Reviews.Author: dhcjhl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights and it was great. Started with great customer service from the start. Asked for a non-smoking, one king bed room above the 5th floor and received a room on the 26th floor with partial view of the strip but great view of the Luxor Pyramid. Mind you that THEhotel is behind the Mandalay bay and at the end of the Strip (Las Vegas Blvd). If you want to see the full strip recommend a hotel like the Bellagio or Paris. Room was extremely clean, spacious and great suite living experience. Bonuses were huge 2 person soak in tub, separate standing shower, 2 toilets, small kitchen sink, and tv in the bathroom. Great lounge at THEhotel called the mix. Walking to the Bellagio takes about 20 mins. Definitely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: FrisbeysTravel
Reviews.Content: When I stayed at THEhotel, I stayed in a suite with one bedroom which consisted of 2 queen sized beds, a living room/office, a large and very spacious bathroom, with a jet tub and large shower, and a second guest bathroom. It was very great. The other rooms are also worth your stay too!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MnKuke
Reviews.Content: Personally I hate the Strip, it's full of drunk and depraved people, everything is expensive and you get nailed left and right. But Mandalay Bay is at the quieter end, it's nicely maintained and very reasonably priced. We were just passing through and were supposed to stay in the regular hotel for a relaxing evening. We got the obligatory upsell, sorry 'upgrade offer', which my wife obviously accepted ;-) Oh well, the room was nice, clean, comfortable. The bathtub was HUGE! Just be prepared to say, "oh thanks, but I don't really need the upgrade thanks!"

Reviews.Title: “A good time, all in all”
Reviews.Author: oilersesksfalcons
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in THESuite. Yeah, there's a lot of grumbling about location, but there sure is a lot close by...it's mere steps to the Mandalay Bay casino, House of Blues, Mandalay Place, etc. A huge difference compared to the Signature (where I stayed during my only other trip to Las Vegas.) The cab rides will eat away at your travel budget, so be smart about it and use the tram to Excalibur. 4.2 miles walking from Mandalay Bay to the Stratosphere doesn't sound like an awful lot, but it's a bit of a time waster to be perfectly honest. Rooms are modern and tastefully appointed, although having seen the pictures of the bathroom in the V suite, I was quite disappointed to set eyes on the bathroom in THESuite. It's big, but rather plain looking. Room size is generous at over 700 sq. feet, and for the rate, it's decent value too. For some odd reason, I woke up with a sore back in the mornings. I've never experienced that anywhere else, so I don't quite know what to say... No free wi-fi here is a pretty big bummer, and I guess that's one of the thing the Signature covers with their "resort fee." Message to THEHotel management: Free wi-fi for guests please! Only then will I award full points for value. Room service was an excellent experience overall, with tasty food at reasonable prices. I had read on here that it arrives cold from time to time, but thankfully, I didn't have to experience that. Check-in is quick and painless, and check-out offers a couple of express options. Service here is good for people used to being treated like VIP's, or even downscale folks who want to see how the other side lives. I'm undecided right now as to whether or not I'll be coming back to this one. I think for my next trip to Las Vegas, I'm going to go for more of a "low-cost value" option, such as the LV Hilton, or a downtown/off-strip property.

Reviews.Title: “Still a little oasis of calm on the Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: UKexpatNewYork
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to THEHotel, this time for New Year. Again we had a V Suite, this time on the 5th floor. Despite being so close to the traffic, we never heard a sound and slept like the dead. The suite bedroom and sitting room are not huge but easily large enough for 2 people. The bathroom is enormous, and the tub is big enough and deep enough to drown in. I love the exclusive toiletries which I always think smell like a margerita, citrusy and a little alcoholic. The location is a little off the beaten track, being the southernmost hotel on the Strip, but I think that contributes to the calm and quiet. After experiencing the excesses of some of the other hotels and casinos, it can be a relief to return to THEHotel at the end of the night. Even if it did take us around an hour to walk back from the Bellagio at around 1 am on New Year's Day with all the roads closed to traffic. The only sour spot was the manicure I got at the spa before a dinner out. It was ridiculously expensive and totally perfunctory. She could barely be bothered to slap a bit of hand cream on before applying the polish. My tip would be to drive out to one of the numerous strip malls just off the Strip and find a local nail bar to do a better job for less money.

Reviews.Title: “A real treat”
Reviews.Author: davidmeyer
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Vegas for eleven years. I have stayed in most of the big name places. Venetian, Mandalay Bay, Flamingo, etc. etc., and this one might be my favorite yet. I am not much of a gambler or an all-night clubber, so when I come to Vegas, I appreciate the ability to have some peace and quite in my room. This is what you get here. To begin with, the rooms are beautiful. My room (36901) was a two-room suite. It had a nice living room with a huge flat screen TV, and an exceptionally comfortable couch. There was a nice desk to work from and and the entire room reminded me more of a well-appointed apartment or condo...not a hotel. The bedroom was beautiful and the bathroom (there are two) was huge. The master bath included a TV as well...just in case you didn't want to miss your show. Ckeckin-in was exceptionally fast (something you won't find at the larger casino properties) and the property is joined with the main Mandalay Bay property so all of the resort facilities are available to you within a few steps. The ONLY drawback I can see to this property is the location. Mandalay Bay is at the far end of the strip. I personally prefer to be closer to the center because of the traffic, the cab ride will kill you. But if you have your own car, this is a non-issue. All in all, I would give this a five star rating. It really is deserving.

Reviews.Title: “been coming to Vegas for over 40yrs... best place yet”
Reviews.Author: texnewmex
Reviews.Content: I've probably stayed at almost every place on the Strip since 1966. Best yet, better that Wynn, Bellagio which are the next ones I like.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the deal....very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Martini 425
Reviews.Content: Hi all - have been to Vegas many, many times and have stayed at about 80% of the properties....and a few that are no longer there sadly! I stayed years and years ago at Mandalay Bay and really enjoyed it. THE Hotel was always on my list to cross off but had never found an awesome price before. This time we hit the jackpot! Got two nights for 189$ with a hundred dollar resort credit. What a steal this was. THE Hotel is a very chic upscale property. Property looks just like the advertisements and all the pics everyone has posted. No need to say mcuh more on the rooms, very nice, exactly as the pictures, comfy bed, nice robes, nice slipper, huge bathroom, awesome soaking tub. Did use room service one night, very nice as well. Delivered promptly and served warm. Waiter set up a table very nice for us. Everyone in the hotel was really warm, friendly and helpful. No complaints. Would stay here again only if the price was fantastic - prefer to be mid strip. My other new Vegas comments: Boy City Center is ugly. In my opinion it just does not fit in. The one tower that is built to be crooked on purpose drives me insane. Pink's Hotdog Stand (new for us this time around..Planet Hollywood) was fabulous. I can't wait to go back and try it again. Play at Planet Hollywood. Vibe is always good and their slots pay for us...mostly :) Go and enjoy - we are back for a week in April - can't wait! Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “very nice, probably the best I have seen”
Reviews.Author: ripley304
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay for a family wedding in February. The hotel is one of the nicer hotels I have stayed in. The room was fantastic, very new, very clean and very roomy. We were given a corner suite which had extra room and extra views. Loved having the extra bathroom and loved all the TVs in all the rooms. Robes and slippers were great for after a soak in the GIANT bath tub. Shower was the BEST. As is typical in Vegas, things were overpriced but that's just Vegas in general, no reflection on the hotel itself. Front desk staff were curteous and helpful and so was the concierge. We have stayed in cheaper rooms and we have stayed in more expensive rooms but overall this was one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at THEhotel. Where? THEhotel. Where? THEhotel”
Reviews.Author: user2400
Reviews.Content: Liked: Huge comfortable suites, easy access to freeway, lots of parking, great views of strip, Disliked: Location (not too bad, but it is at the end of the strip), very dirty hallway Discount car rental - Fox (have to take a shuttle to McCarran Rent-A-Car Center, then another shuttle to Fox) Discount Shows - Tickets 4 Less, VegasTickets.com (get in line at 10 am to buy discount tickets to that nights shows)

Reviews.Title: “THEhotel”
Reviews.Author: NicholeJ
Reviews.Content: The view, the deep soaker tub, the large flat screen TV...you catch my drift.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas baby!”
Reviews.Author: tfishbone70
Reviews.Content: place was awesome, could've never left the hotel there was so much to do there

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but Vegas is so much better in the summer.”
Reviews.Author: FMagellan
Reviews.Content: Biggest rooms in Vegas! What a relaxing get-a-way from the strip. I would absolutely recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place...”
Reviews.Author: ThomasB4
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small for the price, but other than that, love it.

Reviews.Title: “Better than MGM Grand”
Reviews.Author: arthursiew
Reviews.Content: I came in during the Winter Break for school (President's Day Week) and it was pretty packed. THEhotel was located next to the actual Mandalay Bay hotel, but shares the same resort and facilities. THEhotel was basically the upscaled and modern version of Mandalay Bay. There are actually two places you can check in. When we first came in from the parking lot, one of the employees accidentally directed us to the Mandalay Bay check in counter. They still checked us in to our room. The check in time was 3PM and we came just around then. We then walked to the actual lobby of THEhotel. When being taken to the other side, THEhotel was actually totally different compared to Mandalay Bay. The hallway was divided in which the other side was dark, but stylish while the Mandalay Bay side was elegant and tropical. THEhotel was not a typical boutique, but it was a large and spacious one with many employees ready to help. The room was spacious. Our room was on the 4th floor. However when we got there, the room was not ready yet as it was still being serviced. She kindly let us go in and we trusted her to not take our stuff when we left our things there. We came back a while later and found the whole room clean and our stuff in the same condition we left them in. The room had a living room, two bathrooms (one without a shower or bathtub), and a bedroom. When it was time to checkout, the process was quick. You can checkout using the TV in your room or drop off some paperwork at the Express Checkout box. Both options were great, but we used the TV option. The facilities were pretty nice. When we were there, Mandalay Beach was not opened but they left a pool open with two hot tubs. The pool was pretty nice and the spas too. There were also a number of restaurants like Fleur de Lys, miX and much more. There was also a tram connecting to the Luxor and Excalibur which were next door. The Bathhouse was pretty nice too, but it wasn't free. It costs $30 a day and theres a fitness room and sauna. Pretty good deal. The internet was not free though. In the end, THEhotel at Mandalay Bay was a great hotel. Besides the bad things like no free internet and fitness room, it was a great stay. I would recommend this hotel to anybody!

Reviews.Title: “Great romantic rooms”
Reviews.Author: c0mpassi0nate
Reviews.Content: What a great palce to stay and be pampered for a few days....great access to shows, dining, and other Vegas attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, easy access”
Reviews.Author: Captpablo
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at TheHotel and overall I would come back at the right price point. Immediately I noticed how easy it was to get into the hotel. Most of the hotels in Vegas it takes forever to get to your room. Easy drop off and very close elevators. I arrived early in the day due to a early flight from the east coast. Upon checkin was told room was ready, but only two queens. I asked if I could wait or got the spa and check in later. This was not something they do. They mentioned they could make a note and move me later in the week. Whatever. The room was big. I was on the 12th floor with a decent view. My room had two rooms with 1.5 baths. Flat screen in the sitting area and tube tv in the bedroom. Again for $130 a night, I was happy. It was clean. The bathroom was gigantic. This would be a good option with kids due to the space. One AM I ordered room service. This was a low light of the stay. Food was off. It easy to make eggs, toast, ect. This was ill prepared. Note, I was not staying there for their gourmet breakfast so I let this one go. The spa and gym were also very nice. The equipment in the gym was very new and state of the art. Decent space, free water, fruit, ect. The spa was good and clean. A little small, but steam room, showers, ect all very nice. Service was top notch. They mentioned they were going to renovate soon. Again, I would have guessed it was pretty new or at least very well taken care of. Good price point, good access to airport and the rest of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful Hotel however staff not very nice....”
Reviews.Author: MeAndMr
Reviews.Content: We were in awe when first entering the hotel. Our room was very clean and upscale. The staff is snotty not sure why. The restaurants were so so. Nice to see but when you are paying good money you expect good quality. We found the food to be o.k. but not worth the price. We met a large group here and spent good money. The Ice Bar is very cool and we liked the hotel for the look but probably won't stay here again. We felt that it is a cool place to stay at least once.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas for Business - Stayed to Play”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunky25
Reviews.Content: THE Hotel is one of the nicest hotels in Vegas, attached to Mandalay Bay for a great central, social spot to drink and gamble. Also was just built - so the ammenities are top notch. Highly Recomended.

Reviews.Title: “70th Birthday Party at THEhotel”
Reviews.Author: AntMPortland_Oregon
Reviews.Content: Everything was very acceptable but for the fact that they promised "stay three nights get one free". They reneged on the deal at checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Netty13
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Bellagio, New York, New York, The Wynn, Mandalay Bay and various others. The Hotel is the best. You have access to Mandalay Bay casino, pools, restaurants and bars etc. but coming back to The Hotel is like entering another world. A long cool walkway leads down to the tranquility of The Hotel leaving all the noise and lights of the casino behind you. There is a very elegant, quiet bar in the lobby here perfect for a pre-dinner cocktail or a nightcap afterward. The rooms are all suites, with fabulously comfy beds, flat screen TVs, separate sitting room, very well appointed bathrooms with huge soaking tub & separate shower stall. If the pool complex wasn't so great I might have been tempted to stay in the room all day! The pools are awesome, and the restaurants in Mandalay Bay have something for everyone from high end to cheap and cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service no flexibility”
Reviews.Author: rarlkr
Reviews.Content: Beware, this hotel offers poor service and is not flexible. they only want to give you discount tickets to a show that you are not interested in. if you try to use a promotion they jack up the cost of the rooms and try to sell you this as a better deal. There is no personal service. The reservations people do not listen, they merely try to sell you a room. The hotel is old.

Reviews.Title: “good memories”
Reviews.Author: paprika_pm
Reviews.Content: Great room, views,fair rates, awsome pool and great coktails

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service @ THEhotel”
Reviews.Author: lucks1
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to give my 2 cents about this hotel. I have been to Vegas many times and have stayed at Luxor, Monte Carlo and MGM Grand and never have I experianced such poor service. A bunch of us cousin's decided to take our wives to Vegas as a couples trip, 4 couples in total, 2 couples left Toronto and another 2 left from Edmonton. The first issue was our connecting flight out of Chicago was delayed by about 2 hours, no big deal. So we arrived in vegas around 6pm. When we finally got to the hotel, my room was not ready (this is at 6.30pm and I was told I would have to wait 2 hours to have my room ready), and my cousins room apparently got changed from a KING to 2 queens (even though we all booked KINGS). And David the front desk rep was not helpful at all. He had to go ask his manager about every little thing, if we could be upgraded, comp'd anything, we even asked for free wifi and they said no to everything. We also wanted to have all of our rooms close by (at least on the same floor, and when we called they said they were all confirmed on the same floor). This too wasnt the case, we were all on different floors and when we asked to get the same floor they told us it wasnt possible. The only redeaming factor was the fact the rooms were very nice, as a standard suite it was beautiful. I am heading back to Vegas at the end of March and will not be staying at this hotel. Maybe if you are not in a group you'd have better luck with their service. Anyways, thought i'd share my experiance. PS. DELTA AIRLINES SUCK A$$..(on the way back to Toronto, our connection in NY - JFK, was cancelled and they wouldn't help us at all, we ended up driving back from NY to toronto). Unlucky in Vegas....

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional room”
Reviews.Author: wsteinhauer
Reviews.Content: Received free room offer for THEHotel through our casino play. We were upgraded to a two room corner suite, and it was wonderful. Flat screens in living, bedroom and master bath. Also had second bathroom. Probably the nicest room we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “THE Hotel is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Rumpster1
Reviews.Content: Amazing rooms. Fantastic service. The Bathhouse Spa was AMAZING! Aereole restaurant was over priced and overrated.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: SJENewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in more than 100 hotels in 38 countries. This is the most extraordinary hotel that I have stayed in. New luxurious suites with all desirable amenities with an extraordinary view on the mountains surrounding Las Vegas. This is, frankly, a one of a kind hotel. In addition, we got a special deal on the room. This was, by far, my best experience in any hotel, ever.

Reviews.Title: “Mandalay Bay (The Hotel) Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Shawkiss
Reviews.Content: Sept 09 Flew to Vegas from Vancouver and stayed in the Mandalay Bay. Arrived on a Saturday, we asked for an upgrade but the Hotel was full and the receptionist advised we come back Sunday after 11:00am. Our room in the Mandalay Bay was very comfortable and to a high standard. On the Sunday we went to reception just after 11:00am and asked for an upgrade there was a bit of coming and going before this was agreed, but at all times they were very polite and helpful. We said we were happy to move our clothes etc ourselves later. The upgrade was to The Hotel which was all suites, 1st class the suite wasexcellent. The downside to staying at this Hotel is that you are at the end of the Strip (nearest to the Airport). Transport - plenty taxi's but if you want a laugh take the Deuce bus if you aren't in any hurry and listen to the patter of the drivers, maybe our public transport drivers should go and learn how to chill, (if they didn't have timetables to keep to) sorry guys. We stayed for 7 days and I would say if you don't like the heat it is too long 4/5 days would be enough.

Reviews.Title: “THE Sweetest Suites”
Reviews.Author: JSFULHAM
Reviews.Content: Wow! Gorgeous accommodation tastefully decorated and well appointed with every amenity yoiu could wish for. The staff were all very professional and the hotel was spotlessly clean. The location is a slight drawback, but the tram to Excalibur helps and I appreciated the peace and quiet away from the madding crowds. This was a place where you could relax. The rooms were well lit and inviting. The huge bath tub was liuxurious and it was great to have a long soak while watching the TV. The Spa was wonderful and another peaceful oasis with every amenity taken care of. The gym was well eqipped and you could even watch TV on your own personal monitor. I would strongly recommend this hotel, it offered superb value and comfort.Probably one of the best in the City. Having a separate lounge was great. I stayed on the 10th Floor room 10902 and had a nice view of the pyramid. The slots in Vegas are all pretty tight, but the Players Club made up for this with some very generous comps.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Room”
Reviews.Author: Grazzxy
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed five days at THE Hotel in a huge suite on the 30th floor. Beds were comfy, bathroom was gorgeous and even a tv in the bathroom. We ordered room service for breakfast (pancakes) and lunch (pizza), and both were delicious. The location of THE Hotel is a little south on the strip and would have preferred to be a bit closer to other hotels. However, there is a free monorail that takes you from Mandalay to Luxor, Excalibur and MGM. The spa was great, besides a mix up in pricing. The Lion King show was long, but enjoyed it. The Red, White and Blue restaurant has great sandwiches (large portions) at great prices. Beware of the $20 gym fee and $15 internet access. Would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a family”
Reviews.Author: holagato
Reviews.Content: As we've learned with traveling with young children (ours was about 17 months old at the time of our trip), getting a suite is a nice luxury since it lets you close the door while the child naps or goes to sleep early in the evening. Our suite at THEhotel offered us plenty of space to set up a crib (the main bathroom was so big, we thought about putting her in there!) and we were able to hang out in the living room and watch tv and relax when she was sleeping (plus use the extra half bath without disturbing her). We also liked how we never had to walk through a casino to get to our room. It's also pretty close (if you have a car) to Town Square if you need to pick up supplies from Whole Foods. Our only complaints were that the room didn't come with a coffee maker and that the fridge was small and packed to the brim and wasn't very cold. (We wanted to store some milk and we were worried that it would spoil). The all-you-can-eat buffet was also just so-so. And while I guess the maids expect no one to be in their rooms in the afternoon, they were really, really loud as they were cleaning the rooms around us.

Reviews.Title: “Why so stinky?”
Reviews.Author: Tubbytoast
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to our stay at THEhotel. But as soon as we walked through the front door, we were assaulted with a sickening cloud of coconut fragrance! This sensory assault made it difficult to breathe, and would be impossible for anyone with asthma or allergies. The guest floors also are bombarded with fragrance. The room was nicely furnished and fairly clean (used toothpick from previous guest in the bathroom, ick), but the self-parking lot and stairway to the front entrance was filthy as if it hadn't been cleaned in weeks. We liked the convenience of being close to the Convention Center, but it's unlikely we'll stay here again when there are so many other, well-ventilated and well-maintained hotels on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HotelLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at THE Hotel just after New Year for 3 nights - from the minute you enter THE Hotel you are made to feel welcome - Reception was fully staffed - and our check in was professional and extremely friendly. The lobby and public areas are very impressive and did not have a bad smell as mentioned by previous comments - in fact it was the complete opposite!! I can not praise the staff enough - Excellent value for money - Will certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “stay at mandalay bay”
Reviews.Author: joek9
Reviews.Content: myself my husband and a few friends stayed at the hotel for a week in october! i dont think there is one bad complaint i could make about the hotel. from the minute the taxi dropped us of at the hotel i couldnt believe how lucky we were we definitely choose well when booking! the rooms bars and restaurants were first class. we could have stayed another week. if you are looking for a beautiful hotel with luxurious rooms on the more quiet side of the strip the hotel is for you!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “My Stay at the Mandalay Bay”
Reviews.Author: LydiaB4
Reviews.Content: The View is amazing!! The rooms are Massive and the room service was excellent. Staff very friendly and it is sooooo clean! Definaltly would go back here. Its within walking distance for most of the strip, what a place!!

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Loved It”
Reviews.Author: toptip1000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply awesome. I had a suite with a living room and a bath and a half. Both rooms had flat screen TV's. The rooms were immaculate and the service was great. I had a bit of extra time on my hands and had a chance to visit the spa. Verry nice....

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas (Baby)”
Reviews.Author: fedsy
Reviews.Content: The hotel Mandalay Bay is a very clean, modern and all staff are very cheerful and helpful aswell as polite. The room we had was on the 10th floor which wasn't facing the strip but still has quite a nice view of the mountains. The bed was so big and comfortable it's actually the first time that I slept so well in a hotel. The bathroom was a good size very roomy. The bath was massive dirty towels were changed everyday. There's a tv in the room which wasn't a flat screen but it worked. The only downside to this hotel is that I found the entrance and lift area quite dark but it was very clean. The grounds of the hotel (Mandalay Bay) are really nice to take photos there are waterfalls, lovely statues and plant areas. We found the casino a little quiet so we went to the Luxor which is next door. There is a free tram which goes from the Mandalay bay to Excalibur which saves you a 10-15mins walk depending how tired you are. From the hotel it takes around 25mins to walk to Planet Hollywood Casino. There are foot bridges which you use to cross roads instead of waiting for traffic lights to change. The Bay side buffet in Mandalay Bay was really nice for breakfast you'll be spoilt for choice. Las Vegas premium outlet is a must we found lots of bargains. We got a taxi there from Paris it cost $20 with the tip. Fashion Mall and Miracle Mile have good shops too. We went to the shops in Caesers forum and Bellagio which are all expensive designers but it was nice to see. We watched Matsuri which is a Japanese circus style show. We found buy one get one free tickets coupons on the strip (newspaper stand) we paid $70 for both of us. There are half price ticket booths on the strip for shows and dinner. We loved Vegas will definitley go back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kendal321
Reviews.Content: We cannot fault this hotel. Check in was a breeze with no queues, and the receptionist Rosie was very helpful with advice about what to do in Vegas as well as what they offered on site and around. They also offer tickets to the shows at Mandalay Bay at a discounted rate. We went to see the Lion King, which was excellent. The rooms are spacious and ours had two bathrooms! TVs in all rooms including the bathroom. The bath and shower were excellent and toiletries were also of good quality. Excellent value as we had got a discounted rate of three nights for the price of two, well worth looking out for! Also excellent views from THEmix on the 64th floor bar of the strip. The only one slight problem that I would say was about the tv volume, it was either loud or noisy, or you had to play around with the remote a lot to get a good volume, although saying that we didn't spend that much time in the room anyway, so didn't really bother us. And it's also quite nice that in a morning you don't have to go through a casino to get out of the hotel as you do with most of the others. Location at the end of the strip was fine, as there is a mini monorail to excalibur which gets rid of a bit of the walking. But if you are going to Vegas you should be prepared to walk a long distance anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice & Trendy”
Reviews.Author: JTM6
Reviews.Content: I came with a cousin for a convention in Dec. I have found that everything in this hotel is very nice, clean & beautifully decoratred. Staff always greeted me and very helpful. On top of that I won (big bucks) on 4 different slot machines. So I am very pleased with this place.

Reviews.Title: “THEhotel did not live up to it's 4-star reputation!”
Reviews.Author: KDTravel19
Reviews.Content: During our stay we had a number of deficiencies occur....we ended up speaking with the Front Desk Agent who checked us out and she provided us with a small rebate for our challenges however a letter was written to the Director of Operations and three days later we have yet to receive a response, even if it is only acknowledgment that they received the email and are looking into it. Both my boyfriend and I work for 4 diamond hotels, and know that if we had this many challenges with the hotel management would have been in touch by now to see if the issues could be resolved and to ensure that we are a happy guest who will return. **No available king size beds upon check-in at about 3:30 pm on December 29th, can definitely understand that our request is never guaranteed but it was disappointing to not have one available. The Front Desk Agent then advised us that we could take the double queen available at that moment or wait for a few hours and a King might come available but there was no guarantee about that either. An offer to have drinks in the lounge while we waited for the next one could have been provided, which is what we typically do when the room requested is not ready. **The double queen room that we were checked into was dirty – crumbs on the couch and clothing tags and stickers all over the bedroom floor, which of course then made us question the cleanliness of the rest of the room. Decided to return to the front desk to let them know and after a few minutes a room change was offered as well as the assistance of the bellman. With only one bag each however, the offer to have the bellmen assist was declined. The unfortunate thing was that we had unpacked all of our belongings already and had all of our clothes hung up and put away into drawers, so even though we were the ones that mentioned the dirty room to the front desk and were appreciative of the room move it was an inconvenience to us and it was unfortunate that the room wasn’t clean in the first place. **The new room also had a few room deficiencies, which included the tv in the living room not working. The volume was either very low or very loud. Also one of the handtowels in the bathroom had a lipstick stain on it and the remote for the bathroom tv was missing. (After reading other reviews...sounds like a lot of the TVs need an upgrade) **Booked two Spa Treatments under the Spa Specials for the afternoon of New Year’s Eve at 5 pm – a $100 Gentleman’s Facial and a $100 Deep Tissue Massage. When the bills were presented to us after the treatments, both of the bills were at the regular price. The massage therapist assisted with changing the bill to the correct $100 amount, however my boyfriend had to go to the Spa Receptionist to get the charge corrected. **While getting ready for New Year’s Eve, after having had a relaxing time at the Bathhouse, we discovered that my bf had left his tie in the original room on the hanger at about 8:30 pm. I contacted housekeeping to see if they could assist with locating the tie, they advised that they could not. I requested then that we be passed on to Security (in our hotel, Security is also Lost & Found), unfortunately the gentleman we spoke to said that he could not assist and the Lost & Found Department would not be returning until 9 am the next day. In a hotel that size....how could there not be one single person that could access Lost and Found??? Unfortunately he wanted to wear the tie for NYE and we were leaving the hotel by 8:30 am to get to the airport. I was then passed onto a third person and once again had to repeat my story. My bf could sense that I was getting frustrated having to continually repeat myself and no one having any solutions on getting the tie other than to wait till the following morning so he then took the phone but still the gentleman could not assist. We decided to go by the Front Desk to see what could be done. We met with Mark, who listened to us and then contacted someone to see if they could assist, but the gentleman said that they had already spoken to us and nothing could be done until the morning. We then suggested that perhaps, they could leave a voicemail for the guest in the original room as it was the same guest since Tuesday night and have them check to see if the tie was still in the closet. We were advised that this could not be done and that we would have to wait until housekeeping went in to clean the room after the guest left to check the closet. Mark indicated that they could not disturb the other guest, however I don’t think that leaving a voicemail or a written note for the guest would be called a disturbance or intrusive, especially since we were also paying guests and if we hadn’t been checked into a dirty room to begin with and didn’t have to move because of it this whole situation could have been avoided. To date, we have yet to receive a call to see if the tie has been found or located. Although we had a less than perfect experience at THEhotel, we did want to say that we had some spectacular service in two of the Mandalay Bay outlets and think it would be great if you could share our positive feedback with the managers of both Mizuya and STRIP STEAK. We saw an ad for Mizuya on one of the info cards in the hotel room, so we thought we would check it out. Who knew though that it would be a Scavenger Hunt to find the restaurant. None of the maps in the room or on the gaming floor had Mizuya in the directory. (It might be good to include the information of the location of Mizuya on the promo piece.) After 20 minutes of wandering we were finally able to locate it in the middle of the floor and we were ready for a drink and some food. We almost missed out on the Bento Box special since it took us so long to find the restaurant however our server, John, had an awesome can-do attitude and made it happen. We were looking for a small snack since we had dinner plans for later that evening before the Black Eyed Peas concert. John was gracious, knowledgeable with the different sakes offered and was a wonderful host. He is definitely an asset to the restaurant! On New Year’s Eve, we decided to stay at Mandalay Bay and dine at one of the outlets. We made a reservation at STRIP STEAK for 10:15 pm with the hostess as there was a last minute cancellation. We arrived early to the restaurant since we could not find any black jack tables available on the floor and decided to see if we could have a drink in the lounge instead. When we arrived, we thought that our reservation was nearly lost as they had the wrong first name on the Reservation – it said Romy instead of Kassandra. Thankfully the last name and the phone number matched since there weren’t too many openings at the other restaurants for that time. Don’t know where Romy came from? Tori our server also deserves some kudos, because after what had been a frustrating hour before hand trying to figure out how to get information about the lost tie and then not being able to find some black jack tables on the floor, she was able to give us some fabulous service which made us forgot all about our frustrations. We had such a wonderful time at the restaurant that we didn’t even make it outside to see the fireworks at midnight. Everytime we mentioned to friends and even the locals we came across that we were staying at THEhotel, we had heard nothing but good things, which is why we were disappointed with our stay. Had it been only one or two things, we probably wouldn’t have been as disappointed but since it was a culmination of things most particularly the way in which the lost tie was handled the stay did not meet our expectations. As we also both work for 4 diamond hotels, we know that when something goes array with our own guests stay we try to ensure we rectify everything we can to ensure that the guests leave happy and satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “THEhotel wasn't bad...”
Reviews.Author: JNothing
Reviews.Content: THEhotel wasn't all that bad. I really didn't want to fill out this review but what the heck. THEfood was pretty good, THEnightlife was pretty good... Overall we just kept going from THEpool to THEbar all day and then into THEnight. Does anyone notice THEtheme here? Yeah, I think they try too hard.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelAdviceCA
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are certainly everything that they appear to be from the website pictures. The suites are two rooms with 1.5 baths. Two televisions, both 42" are in the rooms and the rooms are well appointed. The downside.. I seem to have a kick me sign on my back when it comes to giving me a room with a view... we had none. The window look out at a blank wall and to the extreme left you can see a glimpse of the Luxor's pyramid. Sixth floor and we can see nothing. The hotel's decor is dark, black, brown and beige with touches of blue, some people may find it elegant, others cold and depressing. The hotel also uses a scent in the main lobby which may bother some people, especially those who are susceptible to perfumes. The hotel's Internet access is $14.99 a day (per 24 hours) and considering the speed, the price is far too expensive. The hotel's charges for other amenities are certainly quite pricey. Even using their telephone for a local call or toll-free call could be a major burden. And, we left a note on the broken CAT-5 cable for their high speed Internet (they offer wireless as well) and nothing was done to repair it. Even the note was left. The televisions, while 42" (other than the small set in the bathroom) certainly weren't connected on HD... or if it was HD, it was the worst HD we have ever seen. The upside... the package deal we had was excellent, certainly in any other city in the world we would have had to pay at least triple what we paid for the room we got. The bathroom was beautiful. The parking was plentiful. The bathtub and shower were wonderful. The mattress was good. The room was clean and the amenities were certainly good.

Reviews.Title: “The room was so BIG! I would definately stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: dooney78
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 2:30 our room was ready and we were on the 32nd floor! The staff is very friendly and having 2 bathrooms is really nice! Mandalay Bay is not a far walk at all! We loved having the seperate living room! I would definately rate this place as a 5! The only drawbacks is it being on the end of the strip but if you have a car it doesnt really matter..

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place”
Reviews.Author: jk555
Reviews.Content: We came to Las Vegas to get married and decided to stay at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay. We had a great experience from the second we got there. Everyone who works there was extremely nice and helpful. Check-in was a breeze. We were concerned since we got there a bit early that our room wouldn't be ready, but we barely had to wait in line before we were taken to our room. We had a lot of friends and family staying in Mandalay Bay so we spent a lot of time on both sides of the hotel. I liked that The Hotel seemed to be a little quieter than Mandalay Bay. I would say that unless having a small living room is a necessity for your trip you'd do just as well at Mandalay Bay. I prefer the color scheme over there and felt that there wasn't really enough light over in The Hotel. The suite we had was nice, but we didn't really use the living room much and the standard rooms over at Mandalay Bay seem a little more spacious, even though the square footage is smaller, because The Hotel suites are separated into 2 rooms. I spent some time in the spa and found it extremely relaxing. There was almost no one there when I went and the staff showed me around and explained everything that was available and was there to answer questions, but didn't follow me around or bother me when I was trying to relax. All in all we would definitely stay in this hotel again. One thing I would let people know is that if they really want something in the middle of everything in Las Vegas this may not be the hotel for them. It is all the way at the south end of the strip so it is a bit of a hike to get anywhere, but it's still on the strip and the tram to Luxor and Excalibur makes it easy to get over to the rest of the strip. We actually enjoyed being a little bit away from the chaos of the main part of the strip. We also liked that there is a liquor store right across the street so we didn't have to spend the crazy amounts for a drink (which is the case at pretty much every hotel) if we just felt like spending some time in the room. Everything is insanely expensive and pretty much everything is extra, but this seems to be the norm for Las Vegas. The restaurants we ate at were all amazing. We had a small event at China Grill and the food and service were amazing. Raffles Cafe was a great place to eat that wasn't crazy expensive and the wait was never long. The buffet was nothing special, although breakfast was a pretty good deal. One complaint would be the lounge/bar area they have down by the lobby. My husband went there one evening for their wine specials (they do some sort of happy hour-type pricing) and said that all of the wines on their special list were terrible. Most of the restaurants have great wine lists though.

Reviews.Title: “THEDisaster: You call this Luxury?”
Reviews.Author: cvgtravel
Reviews.Content: We travel to Las Vegas 2 or 3 times a year, usually with a small group or another couple. We have stayed at a variety of properties, with our last trip to the Four Seasons a big success. For New Years we decided to try THEHotel at Mandalay Bay. Check-in was the start of an unexpectedly unsatisfying stay. We arrived a little before noon and were told we could not check in until 4 pm. Lunch wasn't much better. We had to wait about 20 minutes for a seat at THECafe holding on to a tacky flashing beeper that ultimately didn't work and the hostess resorted to yelling out names to get people seated. Apparently housekeeping can only clean the room when you are in the room as they did clean the room on the first day until 5:30 as we were trying to get ready to meet friends. The most disconcerting aspect of the service is housekeeping's policy of entering the room unannounced and without knocking. Twice either my wife or I were met in the bathroom by housekeeping asking if we needed anything. Another time the minibar guy came into the room to check the minibar while I was watching TV. Not so bad but couldn't he knock and let me answer the door? We finally resorted to throwing the security latch whenever we were in the room for privacy. Several times while we were getting ready to go out we heard the bang of the door against the latch. We tried bringing this to the attention of management but a call to the front desk and a request at the front desk to speak with someone fell on deaf ears. THESpa services were also handled with nonchalance. Checking in my wife was told to "go around the corner and we'll get to you soon" rather than the personal treatment she got at the sister spa at Mandalay Bay. In summary, if you are looking for luxury treatment and service head to places like Four Seasons, The Venetian or Bellagio. THEHotel is more like THEWalmart

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite!”
Reviews.Author: lbcheese
Reviews.Content: We were here for a small family gathering shortly after Xmas. After a long (7 hr.) drive from CA we arrived tired and hungry. We were surprised and delighted to be checked in immediately, then upgraded from Mandalay Bay to a suite in The Hotel, which was beautiful. My parents were also upgraded to a room directly across the hall. We had a couple minor housekeeping issues which were taken care of immediately and very graciously by the staff. The beds were very comfortable, and the robes and slippers were comfortable too. We loved the fully stocked bath and a half and the floor to ceiling windows that looked out over the strip. I admittedly loved the suites that I have had at the Venetian and Treasure Island, but this is my favorite!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: DarleneNanaimo
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! Our one bedroom suite had a powder room and a big full bathroom. We had a great view. Very clean. Excellent service. No casino is very important to us. Easy access to all the restaurants you could want. Easy to park either self or valet. Very quiet and a good sleep. We had a special that if you stay 3 nights the fourth is free; very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “GO TO THIS HOTLE ONLY IF YOU ARE TALL”
Reviews.Author: Aroosakziba
Reviews.Content: WE SIGNED UP WITH AN EXPENSIVE PACKAGE. the floors to walk to our concert was color of poop and covered with shinny slippery stuff. If you are going to wear high heels then do not go to this hotel (you will fall and break everything). The bathroom sink is for tall people. ( you wash your face as a short person you will be soacking wet. The bed is for tall people and if you are short you have to climb up and jump down. We were suppose to pick up concert tickets they send us to 3 lines and each took one hour and we ended up spending most of the day getting our ticket (we had only 3 days trip) what a waste?????????????????

Reviews.Title: “unfriendly staff and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: cindith
Reviews.Content: at checkin we were warned not to touch anything in the bar or the snacks - weight sensitive and would be charged if we moved anything. couldn't keep anything in the fridge, but we could "rent" another fridge for $20 a day - Really???? No coffee in the room - of course not - go downstairs and spend $7 for a cup. Consierge acted like we were inconviencing her by asking questions - not once did she smile. at check out, I stood under a sign showing the desk was open, with a person behind there. she told me she wasn't open yet, oops, sooooo sorry, I'll go back and stand in line. two seconds later, she called the next person in line. I didn't want to check out, I just had a question. I would never stay in this stuffy place ever again, unless I was dripping with diamonds, maybe I would get a little respect.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room -- we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Portlandtravlr
Reviews.Content: I booked a V Suite for my boyfriend's birthday present (12/26). When we arrived for check-in, the front desk clerk smiled at us, excused himself for a moment and returned saying that he thought we'd like our room -- he had upgraded us to one of the H suites on the 61st floor. Almost 1700 square feet with a dining room, bar, living room, office, and separate bedroom/sitting room with an amazing bathroom. Boyfriend was suitably impressed! The view is beautiful and the room amenities are amazing -- great bed. Evening room service was quite slow,but breakfast was brought to us within 20 minutes. I just went onto the hotel's website to see what this room would cost and for a Sunday check-in, they are advertising only $415/night right now -- an amazing bargain for this type of room. He will be booking this place on his next business trip for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Calm”
Reviews.Author: Enarra
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet, calm and large spacious rooms. I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “My purse got stolen out of my room”
Reviews.Author: vacation044
Reviews.Content: As much as I liked the hotel, I was disappointed by the hotel security when my purse got stolen out of my room. I reported with in two hours but they were very casual about it. When I went to file police report, Vegas PD asked me that why didn't I call cops. They said hotel security should have done that or told us to do that.. I felt that they were trying covering it up.

Reviews.Title: “I expected better!”
Reviews.Author: Disney76
Reviews.Content: The entrance to The Hotel at Mandalay Bay is nice, but not over the top. I guess, I expected much more. I have stayed at many 4 & 5 diamond resorts/hotels world-wide, and this so-called 4 diamond resort didn't meet my expectations. Service was slow, the TV in our room was outdated, and kept turning off & on. We visited for 3 nights, and on the second day, our roomwas never cleaned. Towels were lacking, I guess I could have called maid-service and more towels could have been brought up. But again, this hotel touts itself as a 4-diamond and they should place more towels in the room. I"m assuming its the whole economy thing Food was good, if you walk down the hallway to Mandalay Bay, tons of food choices. The clients at the hotel were more of your younger crowd, 20-35'ish. The only good thing at THE Hotel, were the room rates, I think I paid $110 for all three nights, it was through a VIP promotion i received in the mail, and my stay was during the weekend. Would I stay here again, probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Plush modern 2-room suite - blew my socks off.”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay, the all-suite tower of the larger Mandalay Bay Resort & Casino, was an experience in plush Vegas luxury. And a welcome retreat after the bruising days and nights in the Las Vegas fastlane. My 2-room suite was furnished in dark tones (black), plush toucheable fabrics in the living room and bedroom and wonderful strong air conditioning that made the scorching heat of Summer fade quicker that the accompanying hangover from the night before. The living room included a relaxing sofa, coffee table, massive plasma TV and complete office desk/workstation. Plus the wet-bar and toilette. The bedroom included an amazingly comfortable and soft bed with heavy blankets, another big plasma TV, a shower room and another seperated toilette, complete with TV and telephone. The restaurant downstairs was amazing... forgetting the name... as so many are in Vegas. The gym was also excellent, with top quality machines, no crowds, trainers on hand, and a great experience. Outside, the amazing Mandalay wave pool and beach setting is waiting for all frolicking and playtime, in preparation for another big night. Highly recommend this hotel and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest hotel in LV”
Reviews.Author: avelautham
Reviews.Content: What can I say, as far as clean hotels go this is the tops. Unlike pretty much any other hotel this one smells smoke free, it is off the Mandalay Bay which is itself a breath of fresh air literally. The hotel is linked to the Mandalay Bay casino via a 100m stretch of polished marble slabs, the entrance to the walkway to theHotel is next to the tram so it is very convenient. First of all, this is an all-suites hotel, so for those of you who prefer a separate sitting area where you can have a civilised coffee or room service away from the bed, this is a place for you. The rooms themselves have a minimalist feel, not because they lack amenities but because they have the zen colours. My room was on a corner and had 2 toilets, it was a nicer room than most. The products in the room were high quality branded by the hotel, it does of course have a very famous spa attached to it. There are 2 spas you can access, that of theHotel and the bigger spa of the Mandalay Bay. The Mandalay Bay property is itself one that is consistently ranked by locals as being a place they would stay it on the strip, cited because it doesn't smell smokey and of the outside pool which is amazing in summer. Even those who smoke dont like smokey environments so it is a winner for all. I keep talking about smoke filled environments because that is the norm in LV, it is especially a problem in the centre of the strip where there is more foot traffic, such as the Bellagio. You cant help but stink of smoke by the time you leave most hotels, not in this place. There is the Mix bar which is part of theHotel, the bar itself has a beautiful view of the strip, you can step outside some glass doors to smell the evening LV air, it's really quite a treat and is consistently rated in the top 10 of LV bars. The age range in this hotel is younger than than that of the main Mandalay Bay, talking to people at reservations they said the average age in theHotel is 38 rather than 46 for the Mandalay Bay. It shows a little, it is much quieter than the other hotels in LV. There is a cafe for breakfast which is a little expensive, but the other restaurants in the Mandalay Bay are a short walk away through the casino. I would recommend looking for deals which include a breakfast credit so you can eat at the cafe which is very stylish. The deals that are available are seasonal, my deal included the breakfast credit and a $100 spa credit which were both used making the room cost about $40 which was a complete bargain! Just one final thing, this is I would categorise a hotel for people wanting a quieter break in LV, it has class and is probably a place suited best for people not on their first trip to LV. If you are on your first trip stay in the centre of the strip since taxis are so expensive here you can save alot through just being in walking distance. If you want to be in LV but away from the crowds come here and Enjoy! But to experience the most come when the pools are open.

Reviews.Title: “THEhotel is THEE hotel to stay at”
Reviews.Author: jr7ruiz
Reviews.Content: Excellent service all the way around!!!! Faultless rooms great view and great food!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Guest Rooms And A Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Jtorsney
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at THEhotel four times so far. Check-in is hit or miss between a long wait and being shown to your room imediately. Guest suites are superb and are decorated in darkish colors. The suites are about 750 sf if I recall correctly and have very cozy living room and bedroom furnishings. Guest bathrooms are very large and a small powder room is included with standard suites. These suites include private bar and tv's in living room, bedroom, and bathroom. It's all very much 21st century. The public areas are dramatically decorated and include a restaurant, bar, cafe, and coffee bar. I find service a cut below Bellagio and Wynn/Encore. The properry has access to Mandalay Bay's excellent facilities, but has no separate pool. Surprisingly, room rates are not much higher than the main Mandalay Bay tower, so THEhotel rates as a good value in my book. Pros: Great guest rooms, visually appealing common areas, very good value Cons: Service could be better, no separate swimming pool

Reviews.Title: “Don't Even Consider This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 64Canadian
Reviews.Content: Since this is billed as an all-suite and boutique hotel, I very much looked forward to my stay. What a disappointment! I didn't sleep all night due to loud noise, later said to be wind. (In a new hotel made of concrete? I live in the windy Canadian prairies and my wood-and-siding house does not make any of these sounds!) Called front desk the next AM; they said engineering would check it out. I had no feedback so assumed problem was fixed. Spent second sleepless night. Next AM, was moved to what I was promised was "an upgraded room" (not true! Being hussled like this was even worse than the noise...almost). Duvet cover had dark stains on outside AND inside; bedskirt had stains. Previous guest's credit card left on bedroom floor (guess it wasn't vacuumed). Location is awful: the last hotel on the south end of The Strip; difficult to walk anywhere. Will go back to Bellagio next time: better service, cleaner rooms, excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “vegas baby”
Reviews.Author: SamuelR1
Reviews.Content: plush living at its finest. service was fairly good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: AmandaM28
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was amazing, at the airport end of the strip so it was quieter at night but it was the best hotel i've ever stayed in and wouldnt hesitate to book again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Viper22FL
Reviews.Content: Not extraordinary (for Vegas) but defiantly 4 stars. The staff was very friendly and attentive and the rooms were spacious and comfortable. The only negative to me was being on the very south end of the strip (just a personal preference I guess) but I would stay again and recommend it to friends. A Tip: Valet your car. The garage is huge.

Reviews.Title: “Two Room Suites, Nice and Quiet away from the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: Nomaad
Reviews.Content: Just came back from our Thanksgiving weekend trip to the THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay. This is our second visit to this particular boutique hotel and just as before it was a very nice stay. One of the main reasons I love this place is that the living room and bedroom are separated by a door. Other Vegas hotel proclaim the have suites but are nothing more than larger rooms with a slight split level. So I can watch my football games in one room and my wife can enjoy her shows in another room and neither of us is bothered. The room itself along with the rest of the hotel exudes a dark motif, which I kind of liked. The front desk was quick and efficient in checking us in and the concierge desk helpful in answering our questions. THE Hotel itself sits right next to the parking structure so you will have a very short walk to the lobby and elevators unlike many other Vegas hotels. Now for the good: The room had three televisions, two bathrooms and all of it very clean along with a mini bar (which we did not use) and no bed bugs to report. The living room had a large plasma screen. The bed was remarkably comfortable and it was mostly very quiet around our room. Our room stayed at a constant 72 degrees our entire stay and the HVAC system was quiet enough not to be noticed. Turn of the hot water faucet and instant hot water comes out, NICE! Our dining option was the Bayside Buffet downstairs. This is an above average buffet in my opinion and should satisfy most tastes. There are ton of food options in walking distance. The Luxor next door has McDonalds and Nathan’s if you want to eat on the cheap. When you get off the elevator, there is a convenience store and small restaurant and bar within feet of each other so you don’t have to walk far at all if you need something quick And now the bad: I’m not a big fan of the Bathhouse Spa. I think it’s too small. And if you need to go to the pool, it a monstrously long walk to get there. Note to the staff, you should have someone checking key cards at the elevators at all times. Reading other people reviews on Trip Advisor I’m hearing of room being burglarized. That’s not acceptable. Finally the ugly: The in room DVD player did not work at all. Not a big deal really but the guests should not have to discover these things for you, not if you’re an upscale hotel. To our surprise, we tried to order some soup to go from one of the restaurants and were told they don’t do take out. OK, fair enough so we went to the Raffles coffee shop and tried to order soup there, they will let you take it out but you have to be seated, order it from a waitress, get the soup, then ask for a container and don’t forget to tip the waitress. What a mess! All that was for a simple bowl of soup. Most MGM Mirage properties are setup now as a maximum profit enterprise. Expect to pay top dollar on everything and declining service. Please don’t be shocked at cost of things here, it is expensive. Service and amenities were very good and I hope they stay that way even as City Center opens down the street and they start to cannibalize everything around it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel a step above most on the strip”
Reviews.Author: alfrado
Reviews.Content: Stayed in TheHotel on our honeymoon. We stayed in a 1 king bed suite which was a spacious 650sqft with a seperate bedroom to the lounge area. The decor was clean and plush and hard to believe there is much better on the strip for the rate. Our rate for 3 days averaged £70pn because we got a 3rd night free offer (via Expedia, though was also available on Mandalay Bay website). However while we were there we wanted to stay for a further 4th night and found the rate had jumped up to £180pn because of a business convention. I've stayed in quite a few hotels on the strip and this is easily the best so far. When we return we'll be looking to stay there again. Only down sides were no coffee in rooms, $15 wifi per day and distance from the rest of the action on strip, as TheHotel is situated at the far end of the strip. Would recommend: Pepermill for breakfast, Hoover dam tour, Denny's for free wifi, in and out burger, freemont experience, golden nugget buffet (value) and the deuce bus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, shame about the unfriendly/unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: catgirl018
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice and we couldnt fault the room service/bellboy staff. However the Reception and hotel spa staff were unfriendly and unhelpful. We planned to get married in Las Vegas, so on the day of the wedding, I asked the Spa to do my make-up only to be told they dont do bridal make-up in the hotel? I decided to go and book a hair salon appointment anyway (the Salon staff were very friendly and professional) and staff asked if I wanted my make-up done aswell. Why did the spa staff tell me they didnt do it? As we were getting married, at least five messages were left at the hotel for us, we never recieved any, reception told us they were not there to pass on messages! My best friend tried to buy a bottle of champayne for us to go to our room, again she was met with the same unhelpful attitude saying to her ' we dont' do that'! On check-out we asked for the use of a day room, the receptionist told us that no hotel offers that service and we could pay $30 each for a day pass to the spa. this we refused to do as we had paid quite enough in room rates.This is the first hotel I have come across that does not allow you the use of a day room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but ended on bad note”
Reviews.Author: Stryker1112
Reviews.Content: I traveled to TheHotel with a friend for a weekend getaway. I uses the Centurion American Express travel service which utilizes the Fine Hotels and resorts program. Upon checkin, I was told of the amenities of the FHR program, which included the 4PM checkout, which I was told I would have. The stay was nice, the free breakfasts were nice, but on the last day the service fell through the floor. I left the city at 12:00, and my friend stayed to watch the games and check out. At 2:00 he could not get in the room, called the front desk to get let in, was sent a security guard to be let in. This guard stayed to watch my friend pack, was told he could not stay until the guaranteed 4PM check out. For as much as this hotel charges, and to be part of the FHR program, I have to say I was extremely disappointed. It caters to a higher consumer, but it has to deliver exceptional service, which it did not.

Reviews.Title: “Got Married At THE Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maeganrules
Reviews.Content: Amazing! Everything we could have dreamed for was at this hotel. The bedding and room were amazing! We stayed in one of the VIP V suites, with the most wonderful view of the strip. Because we got married there, we were comped nearly everything, and still recieve offers for free stays there. The first chance we have, we're going again. Their soaps are so amazing, that I ordered some from the hotel for special occassions. If you're looking for a treat, try it at least once. AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “An awesome and elegant hotel. Attention to detail!”
Reviews.Author: jtram98
Reviews.Content: We were comped two nights in a suite and THE Hotel. It was awesome. The suite had two bathrooms, 3 televisions, a wet bar and a beatiful bathroom. The rooms are very quiet - we could not hear anyone in the other rooms. There is a door bell for the rooms at THE Hotel - nice touch. We been to Vegas many times and have stayed at Golden Nugget, Paris, Treasure Island, Monte Carlo and Planet Hollywood. THE Hotel is by far the best we've stayed at. Our next stay will likely be here. Some past reviewers have complained about the walk to get to the Mandalay casino. Its not that bad, maybe 5 minutes. You can also walk in-doors to Luxor and Excalibur - its a bit of a walk, but again not that bad (you can also take the tram). The hotel is at the end of the strip, and it does take some time to walk to Treasure Island, however its good exercise to burn off all the calories from drinks! There is no actual casino in THE Hotel - there is a casino in Mandalay Bay. Its nice after a long day of gambling and drinking to come back to a quiet hotel. The casino at Mandalay bay was good, we spent a lot of our time there. Won some money at the slots. THE Hotel does seem a bit expensive. We paid $50 for a cheese plate which is a lot. However, we did get a good variety of cheeses, crackers and fruits. Bottled water was also expensive - but its what you would expect at any hotel. We ate breakfast in Mandalay Bay - it was good. Nothing awesome but not bad either. In THE Hotel, on the main floor, is a wine bar/lounge that has a happy hour from 5-7 with decent prices for wine. One of the best aspects of THE Hotel is the beach area. We were there in October so it was not as busy. It also was not that warm but still an awesome pool and beach area. Overall, THE Hotel is an awesome hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: joeiii
Reviews.Content: A great Vegas stay any way you look at it. Try to get a room facing the strip as the mountain side looks at light commercial areas and the AC system of the hotel. I have no complaints about this hotel though except that the bed spreads were a little worn and dirty and for two days there was a very strong sulfur smell in the hallways from them cleaning the spa (and I was on the 22nd floor….)…I stay at hotels all over the world for work and I can truly say, this is very comfortable and very nice, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkamalx
Reviews.Content: We went and stayed their for 4 nights with our kids, amazing hotel, amazing suites, very very clean. The decor is amazing. My wife loved it. There are several pros to this luxury hotel and very few cons. First with the pros: Like I said the suites were very big and nice, the hotel valet entrance is in the back so you can avoid all the hassle of Mandalay Bay front entrance. Staff is very helpful and nice. Some people in their review complained about gas smell, we didnt experience it, it was very please and smelled very nice. Room service is very quick. The bedroom is huge with the a separate living room area with office desk and small kitchenette Plasma tv in the room and living room and also small one in the bath. Also the living room area has 1/2 bathroom. The main bathroom was huge with lots of lighting and amenities. Stand in shower and huge tub. The hotel has 24/7 cafe and bar thats open but also quite, not noisy like other casinos. Plus all the restaurants of Mandalay Bay and the Bayside Buffet. An amazing spa. Over all one of the best Vegas hotels I have ever stayed in. Now the Cons: Its expensive, the room service is also expansive, the menu is great but just a regular sandwich will cost you $22-$26. In order to get to the pool area you have to go through the Mandalay casino which is quite a bit of a walk. Other then that no big glaring bad items.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence!”
Reviews.Author: TexasLovingVegas
Reviews.Content: I must say that I am very picky when it comes to my hotel stay. Because my last two visits to Vegas offered disappointing hotel rooms, I was very concerned as to what THEhotel would offer. From the time I stepped into the lobby to walking into the beautiful suite, I was very impressed! The hotel service staff could not have been more courteous! And the suites...all I can say is wow! I stayed in THEsuite. The room offered 1.5 baths, both of which were very large! Two large screen TV's in both the living area and the bedroom! The decor was fresh, updated and very comfortable and the bed.....well, it was the best rest I have had in a long time. I discovered a small light over the seating area in the bedroom was out. I didn't think it was really worth mentioning. But the next morning the maid noticed it and within the hour a service guy was there to repair it! I really liked the soaps and lotions provided and I can not say enough about the size of the shower and the bathtub! If you have the time I would recommend the SPA! My budget was such that I requested a 25 minute message. The best I ever had! I really appreciated the connection between Mandalay Bay, the Luxor and the Excaliber. It was simply fun to walk all these hotels to see everything there was to offer. I am a very early riser, so to find all the wonderful coffee shops opened was a plus for me! Everyone was so nice and the room was the most comfortable I have experienced in a long, long time. I would recommend this hotel to everyone! I have a week long convention to attend in Vegas, in June, and I sure hope that THEhotel is listed as one of my choices!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing”
Reviews.Author: BeeLeigh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay in early January 2009. We booked a V Suite a few months before we arrived. A few days before our arrival we discovered that the rate for the room on the internet was cheaper than we had booked. We rang the hotel and they immediately matched the current internet rate - no questions asked. Fantastic! Our arrival was somewhat tainted by the airline loosing our baggage however the hotel assisted us by cancelling our dinner reservation (we had no clothes to wear!) and organising for the bag to be brought from the airport. The V Suite is amazing - huge bathroom, a small bar, fantastic lounge and large TV. The view of the Strip is wonderful as The Hotel sits at the very southern end of the Strip. You can catch the monorail equivalent to the Luxor and Exaclibur which then allows easy access to New York New York and MGM Grand. The Las Vegas monorail then runs from the MGM Grand to the Sahara. However we walked to the Venetian in no time at all - so much to see. Could not fault our entire stay - staff were lovely and helpful, room was immaculate, restaurants delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: IndianaSoxfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel from October 26 thru the 29th and have to say it was one of the best Las Vegas Hotels I have ever stayed in. The suite was so much bigger than a room at the Bellagio. I really enjoyed having the luxury of the extra bathroom. The staff couldn’t do enough for their guests. Every time I asked for anything the response was always “my pleasure”. The view from our room was spectacular even though City Center blocks a lot of the strip. Unfortunately the weather was cold and we were not able to take advantage of the beautiful pools. We just hit a bad week for weather. Room service was quick and the food was warm and delicious. Definitely will stay again, service like we had is seldom given anymore.

Reviews.Title: “THEhotel does not dissapoint! Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: vegasdragon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at THEhotel at Mandalay Bay last weekend in October. Service was excellent and real suites were great. Half bath in entry way to living room. Door to bedroom and main bathroom with both large tub and shower. Very clean and comfortable. Housekeeping was always great and helpful. Ate at RM seafood and had a great meal and time. Cliff is an excellent server. Casino never felt smokey too me and all the staff were very friendly and up beat. Other places I had gone in Vegas this was not the case. EyeCandy lounge is a great but if you can score getting passes to the Foundation room you get the best view of the strip and outstanding bar staff. Mix can be fun on top of THEhotel and has a great strip view also. I don’t consider the location to be a negative because I really don’t have to leave the property too much but if I do the traffic is much nicer near MB.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and very quiet compared to other othel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Ermejo
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the EHotel. We were given a suite with the view of the strip. The accomodation was excellent , comfortable, very clean , and above all very quiet. Different from the other hotels we visited in Las Vegas, the reception is far away from the casino floor and you are not boliged to walk through the casino to go to your room once you have checked in. This hotel has the swimming pool and restaurants in common with the Mandalay Bay Hotel. The swimming pool was disappointing as it was extremely crowded and no space at all between chairs. We had dinners at two different restaurants. The food was good but we found the prices to be expensive. The rooms have free internet but if you do not have a laptop with tou as it was our case, to use the internet in the business center it will cost you 1 dollar a minute and that was unacceptable. Overall our experience was positive and we would recommens thids hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Rooms....Customer Service could be better”
Reviews.Author: tcouncil
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice recently. The first time was back in May when I reserved two rooms. I was told they would be next to each other and I would get my bed preference, but neither ended up being the case. The accommodated me with a $100 food and beverage credit for the inconvenience. Another mishap was that the room they gave me (supposedly the only one left in the place) was a handicap accessible room, which meant I did not get the luxurious bathroom that everyone else got. After my trip I was sent a survey and wrote about all of this and they were nice enough to contact me offering me a free night stay on my next trip. I took them up on the free night stay this August for a birthday celebration. It was a great room with all that we asked for and the trip was great until we were ready to leave on Sunday. Apparently the valet when parking our car on Friday left the car on (push button ignition btw). I should mention that the car is a hybrid as well. This resulted in the car being left on for who knows how long until both the battery died and the car ran out of fuel. The hotel basically refused to take responsibility. It took them over an hour to jump our car and then they paid for our gasoline. Needless to say I figured theowed us a little bit more. I got to Vegas quite a bit and have had my fun with Mandalay now, but will move along to other places at this point. I will say that the pool at Mandalay is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Hovitez1979
Reviews.Content: Amazing Sleek Exclusive Loads of Facilities Excellent Pool Loads of Food

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - especially if you have a suite!”
Reviews.Author: Rovers2009
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to this hotel we drove up to the vallet and let them take care of the car. We only had to tip the guy a couple of bucks and they parked the car for us and brought our luggage to our room. Reception were very professional when checking in and helped any way they could. We had booked The V Suite and even though it was a little more in price on their website it was well worth it. The lounge had a great view and was large enough to have a party! The bedroom was very modern and comfy,another great view, huge TV in the room as well as the lounge - a smaller TV in the bathroom. The room has a safe which is free to use. The Bathroom we thought was the best part of this room, the bath was like a swimming pool and both me and my partner could fit in fully submerged. His and her sinks and a seperate shower.
