The only time I heard anyone in the hallway was if I was standing at the entry to the living room area down the short hall from the door. Other than that, we didn't hear a peep. The MB complex is extremely large, so unless you're going out for dinner, wear comfortable shoes. MB is also adjoined to the Four Seasons Hotel, which has the Charlie Palmer Steak House. We splurged one evening for an awesome dinner there along with a bottle of wine. The whole meal was terrific and the wait staff were wonderful. This is a very pricey restaurant (at least in my book), but since we're not gamblers, when we travel to Vegas we always choose to have one splurge meal. The House of Blues is also a very good restaurant. This year we ate breakfast there one day. We've also had dinner on previous trips. You can't go wrong with this restaurant. By Vegas standards for a hotel on the strip, the prices are average, and you will always have more than enough food. My husband and I split the 4 egg omlet and an order of their donuts with dipping sauce (mmmmmm). We ended up taking half of the donuts back to the room to eat the next morning. We also rented a cabana one day just to kick back and relax by the pools. The wait staff was good, and they're not constantly bothering you. Some may like that, some may not. If you want service more frequently, just ask your server to come back more often. There is enough to do at the MB complex, that you really wouldn't need to leave if you chose not to. However, if you're a little more adventureous, rent a car for the day right from MB and go out to Red Rock Canyon for a close up view. This is the mountainous area you see in the distance off to the West of MB & The Hotel. They are beautiful!! We did just that this year and went hiking on some of the trails. Just be careful stepping on the loose rocks. I twisted my ankle twice. Also, take plenty of water and snacks with you too, as there really isn't anyplace to get those items out at Red Rock Canyon. The only other thing I can say is to enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: gman01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights in October at The Hotel. I found satff at all levels very helpful and courtesy. My wife loved the decor and configuration of our suite. I agree that food costs are high but I feel they are in line with the other luxury hotels. Also, the proximity to Mandalay Bay and it's amenities is fantastic. It's great to enjoy the night life, restaurants, and pools and then have the ability to go back to a VERY tranquil setting. The MIX Lounge on the 64th floor has a fantastic view of the strip. The drinks are priced accordingly and if you get there early in the night you find a quiet place to chat. I can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Great bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: modernize
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 nights here. We chose it for the decor, the 1 1/2 bathrooms & the beach. The decor was sleek, but a little drab - it needed punches of color instead of it's mostly shades of grey. The lighting was very poor, so it was hard to put on makeup. The room was showing some wear - scraped up furniture, torn desk chair, etc. The bathtub is great - very deep tub and beautiful water spout. The beach area was so much fun - we went down every morning to play in the waves & the lazy river. The walk wasn't that bad to the beach - maybe 5-10 minutes. Housekeeping was terrible - they got worse and worse each day. They threw out our exisiting soaps and lotions and didn't replace them. When we tried to get more, they would only allow us one. They made up the beds crooked & just stacked out pillows in the center of the bed instead of placing them correctly. We got good service the first morning - that must be because we tipped really good the first time. The less we tipped, the worse service became. The Mandalay casino is very clean & just a couple minutes walk from THE Hotel. There is a bus stop across the street for north bound hotels and there is also a stop right outside Mandalay if you are coming from the north. Even though we had bad housekeeping & some scratched up furniture, I'd probably stay here again if it was a good price. The beach area was just too much fun to not do again. If you are looking for more luxury though, I'd recommend the Palazzo. They have many more ameneties and the rooms seem bigger than the ones here. Palazzo also has better sound proofing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it probably one of the best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: quirky76
Reviews.Content: This place is great and adult only so no kids yey ! Rooms are great and suite like - very clean and beautiful decor, we had a great view. Hotel complex is great, modern and a spa to die for loved it. On a negative no tea and coffee making facilities and you pay for everything so to use the gym, etc etc We paid extra to sit in the adults only beach and they had music booming out at 10.30am the average age profile was 40's and when a few of us asked for it to be turned down we were told the beach was actually a club and the music was controlled by satilllite ......?? Oh please ! The private beach was tacky and something akin to playboy mansion - just not what we expected or wanted and other residents felt the same. The hotel has a resturant to die for called Mix - which is Alan Du Casse and we had the tasting menu - beautiful and the service was just excellent. The mix also has a lounge/bar with in my opinion some of the best views in Vegas All in all well done just sort the private beach out !

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Stay and Getaway”
Reviews.Author: FreakyDeakyVA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (aged 41 & 40) stayed for 4 nights starting on Sept. 28, 2008. This is our second stay at TheHotel and I am very pleased. I love being at the end of the strip where it's not always super crowded. We had a rental car - so we just drove wherever we wanted to. The first night we drove up to the Bellagio, which is about mid-strip, and there were so many people walking the strip and in the hotel that after a couple hours we were ready for our escape back to TheHotel. The people were so thick, cars couldn't pass and that is no exaggeration. The Hotel is modern with a clean minimalist decor. The Suite rooms are extremly cozy and suit my taste - darker decor but lots of lamps to brighten it up if desired. The suites are the perfect size for a couple. The half bath was a delight. I love their bath products as well. My only complaint about the hotel was the price of the food. In some instances the cost soars beyond pricy into insulting levels. I do not mind dropping coin on meals and atmosphere - but as I said - insulting. We ate at the Border Grill the first night and the food was excellent. I also recommend Trattoria Del Lupo. The portions were large and I tried very hard to down the whole thing but couldn't. As with any large hotel, prepare yourself for lots of walking. I couldn't imagine how all the heeled ladies were getting around and still having a good time. We left $5 everyday and had a clean room and the extra 3 pillows we requested. I never heard a peep from other guests - not even slamming doors. The walls must be thick. (I couldn't seem to do anything about my husband snoring and I was tempted to put him out in the hall a couple times.) I travel for a living and my expectations in most things are very low because I've seen it all over the years. I always go into travel situations expecting that things may not always be perfect - so I'm rarely disappointed. With that said, I highly recommend this hotel - it's relaxing, fun, and upscale.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Adult-only Hotel at the very end of the strip”
Reviews.Author: blazerlady
Reviews.Content: For clarification- THE Hotel is a seperate, slightly higher-end, all-suite hotel that is within the Mandalay Bay Hotel-Casino complex. They share a casino, restaurants/bars and pool, but is its own seperate tower, connected to the rest of Mandalay by a long hallway. It has its own check-in/lobby and distinct decor. Decorated in modern style and without a theme, it seems that THE hotel strives to be the 'adult-only' hotel. It is certainly quieter, and I did not see any children in THE hotel the entire 5 days I was there. If you don't need a theme, and like the idea of escaping away from the revelry of Vegas when it's time to go to sleep, this is the place to stay. Also- GREAT bathrooms. My only complaint about The Hotel at Mandalay Bay is that it's on the VERY end of the strip (closest to the airport). It's an easy tram ride to Luxor, Excalibur, MGM & New York, New York... but you have to take a $10-15 cab to any of the others....

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Clara13Newcastle
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at THE Hotel for 5 nights in Sept and it was absolutely fab!! From the minute we arrived I loved the hotel and Vegas. This hotel is a lot more chilled than other hotels on the strip as they don't have a casino and I think it's catered more towards the couples rather than families. The check in staff on reception were so nice and very helpful (infact everyone in Vegas was lovely) The hotel room was fab like a luxury apartment. Huge comfy bed and plasma tv in the bedroom and plasma tv in the sitting room. The bathroom was really big with a fab shower. The only down side with the room was the lack of natural light in the rooms. (when your getting ready at night it can be a bit of a nitemare, but the light in the bathroom was fine) We only sat around the pool one morning and after reading the reviews I thought the pool area would be really busy so we went down for a sunbed at 8.30am. We didn't really need to go down that early though as it didn't start to get busy until about 11.30am. The only bad thing about the pool was the lack of parasols (infact I didn't see a single one). The sun was soooooo hot and having no shade was a bit of a nightmare!! If you stay in this hotel I advised you to go for drinks in the MIx lounge bar. The view from the 64th floor of the strip is amazing. Get there early to get an outside seat though (after 10pm I think it's reserved for bottle customers only) We went to see the 'O' Cirque show and it was amazing. Wear something warm though as the theatre is freezing off the air con and your in there for about 2 - 3 hours. We absolutely loved vegas and will defo be returning. I would definately stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best on The Strip!”
Reviews.Author: LittleSoot
Reviews.Content: This has got to be the best hotel on The Strip. Visited some of the others, which, in comparison, looked tired and dated. Yes, you don't get a kettle and you have to pay for everything, but that's par for the course in most top notch hotels isn't it? The room was luxurious, the hotel spotless, staff excellent and a fine casino to rid you of any excess cash - I came out $20 up! There is food fine food to be found at reasonable cost available at the hotel, but don't leave without trying the Indoor Skydiving at the top of The Strip (near the Stratosphere)!

Reviews.Title: “Has Pluses & Minuses!!”
Reviews.Author: wobby
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel for a long weekend with the cost of the suite picked up by the player's club. The suites are reasonably nice and spacious, ours was clean enough, the bathroom is good with adequate amenities and pretty standard for Las Vegas. However, both Friday and Saturday nights we were awakened around 2:00AM by loud noise from the MIX club 32 stories above our room; The Hotel seems to appeal to the younger crowd. We enjoyed meals in the buffet and Raffle's coffee shop. We were so disappointed with MIX RESTURANT because the food was pretty good but grossly too expensive, the wine steward had a condesending attitude, and we were seated at the middle of three tables situated very close together.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel @ Mandalay Bay”
Reviews.Author: Bev2008
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at the Hotel at Mandalay Bay it's still a very good hotel just the carpet needs to be replaced due too normal wear. They also need to replaced the matress it was softer than the last time we were there which was about two years ago. Still the room was kept clean and we had plenty of towels each day and the room was clean before we got back each day. We ate at a few of their restaurant like the China Grill the food and service was excellent. The Burger Bar the food and service was excellent the restaurant was crowded and noisy. We ate at the Cafe also a very good restaurant the food and service was good. I think pretty much think all the restaurants in Mandalay Bay are very good. We ate at Fat Burger on the strip the burgers was not good and the service was not up to par we had a five minute wait on our beverages which were milk shakes, and had to ask for them twice. The weather was great we thought it was going to be vey hot but during the week of labor day it was not so bad I think the temperature did not get above the mid 90's. All in All a great trip for 2008 getting ready for 2009, hopefully we can stay at one of the new hotels if the price range is in our budget.

Reviews.Title: “Loud Music at the Pool past 10:30pm. Wont be back ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: buatjnk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a conference. The hotel itself is nice but not the service. Charges for wireless, "personal refrigeration", no coffee maker. The worse thing ever is you cannot enjoy peace and quiet in your room until after 10:45. The music at the poolside played way past the 10:30pm I was told by the frontdesk. The music is very loud you cannot even enjoy watching tv in your room. Let alone have a rest in the room you have paid good money for. I stayed from Monday to Thursday and it happened every single night and its not a one time event. My recommendation is to avoid this hotel if you can. Never again will I stay in this hotel and I will make sure all my family and friends knows about this as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: SamNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was a good choice. The rooms were a good value. The color schem was dark, but after a while you get used to it. The hotel facilites were excellent. The only negative was the housekeeping. They did a poor job. The gym and pool were good. The variety of restaurants was also good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved "The Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: tkhong1989
Reviews.Content: I loved the design of The Hotel. They "upgraded" us to a V Suite, these are just the suites on the edges of the hotel. They are slightly bigger, but not really much of an upgrade (although I appreciated it). The service we received was great, although you really cannot expect much from a huge hotel in Las Vegas. We really loved the toiletries, they smelled great. I was there for a conference at Mandalay Bay, however it was still quite a walk to get to the convention center, although it was nice not to have to go out side. Even in September it is still hot in Vegas. We spent most of our recreational time outside the hotel, but did use the pool, which is the nicest in Vegas, lazy river, wave pool, private pools etc. I would definitely stay at The Hotel again, although my wife still likes the Venetian better. She felt like The Hotel was a little too business and not as much recreation...

Reviews.Title: “THEhotel - Somewhat Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ShaggyDusty
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell this is a nice hotel, but unless they spiff up the rooms a bit, it may not be the lap of luxury that the advertising suggests, and having to share the very popular Mandalay Bay pool area, which is a combination of a kid's waterpark, and a spring break frat party, is disappointing. THEhotel does have a cool factor in its design, and the suites are very roomy and comfortable, but beyond that, things deteriorate a bit. Aside from what I already mentioned, the room was a bit worn for the price being paid. The carpet was fraying in a couple spots, there was a broken handle on the night stand, and the TV reception was awful. In addition to poor TV quality, the two larger sets in the living room and bedroom only seemed to have 2 volume settings: too loud, or too quiet. Then there is the pool. I usually spend one day lounging at the pool on a Vegas trip, and this time I decided to rent a cabana. This was no small expense - it was close to $350 for the day - this is more than the cost of the room upstairs. One day prior to my cabana rental date, my wife and I took a walk around the extremely crowded pool area and checked out the cabanas to see what we were getting for the money. The cabanas were set up practically right on top of each other, and had only thin fabric walls to filter out surrounding noise (other guests, screaming children, televisions in other cabanas, and the constant, thumping club music that is played throughout the pool area). The "patio" in front of the cabana offered you just a few square feet of the regular pool deck, and due to the overcrowding, other guests were virtually in your lap. We canceled the cabana reservation and went to the spa instead, which was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Will not be returning!”
Reviews.Author: Twitchee
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at theHotel. I was really looking forward to treating myself and my partner to a wonderful time at a hotel that is supposed to be top notch. I have to say that I was really disappointed! When we arrived at 10 p.m., I was told that the Non-smoking, King Bed that we booked was unavailable. In fact, there were NO non-smoking suites at all and we would have to move the following day. The individual who booked us in was unapologetic and completely indifferent. I have asthma and sleeping in a room permeated with smoke was awful! The front desk staff advised that a non-smoking, king suite with a strip view would be given to us the following day. So, we checked at the front desk at 1:00 p.m. the next day to get our new room and were told very rudely that NO rooms are guaranteed, there was no strip view and that we could come back at 5:00 for a strip view. At this point, I just want a room and agree to any non-smoking room! For the inconvenience, I wanted them to do something for us so they comped us $100 for food (which gave us 2 breakfasts and a lunch in the hotel). That was not given without speaking with another staff member. I observed others being checked in - for example, business travellers who seemed to be getting the royal treatment with the staff gushing over them. It seemed to us that a "regular joe" was given the bare minimum in terms of customer service. I found most of the staff that I encountered quite snotty. When we checked out, we were told that we owed money from one restaurant and a ridiculous amount of money from the mini-bar! We didn't even open the door to the mini bar. With investigation by the front desk, one restaurant bill wasn't transferred and, apparently, the mini bar charge was from a previous guest (yeah, sure!) In the end, we didn't owe anything and it was taken care of. I was really expecting so much more from theHotel. Yes, the hotel is beautiful, the suites are huge (found toenail clippings and hair in the bathroom....yeeeeesh!) but I felt that the staff honestly didn't care about their guests. I think staff are becoming apathetic because they know that someone will always be filling their beds! After this experience, I won't be returning to Vegas for a while. Save your money - I'd rather scrimp and save to stay at the Palazzo the next go around!

Reviews.Title: “Won't bother again”
Reviews.Author: Crackerjacker
Reviews.Content: Had a 2-centre holiday - one week at Comfort Inn (yes, I know!!) and another week at Mandalay. Give me the Comfort Inn any day - free beverages, free breakfast and free internet and a fridge to keep a cold one (or two!) in! Plus a free shuttle up to the strip. Not even an in-room kettle at Mandalay - the fridge was there for mini-bar items and you couldn't move anything to make room as it was all "electronically" charged to your room as soon as it was moved. Internet was $15.99 a DAY?! We were on 33rd floor and the views were amazing but the lift ride up was nauseating. Wish I'd saved my money (more for the tables!) and had a fortnight at the Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “A Class Above”
Reviews.Author: musicben
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a lot of Vegas Hotels over the years: Golden Nugget, Binions, Mirage, Sahara, Rio and this place stands above them for quality and service I got a great deal on a suite with strip views and always felt like a VIP whilst there which I guess is part of the Vegas magic

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!!”
Reviews.Author: OCPrincess
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend at THEhotel at Mandalay Bay with my girlfriends and the best way to describe it is - WOW!! I will never stay anywhere else in Vegas! I arrived in Vegas early and was expecting to wait until the standard 3pm check-in time. To my surprise, my suite was available and I was in it by 9:45am. I requested a mini-frig for our room and it was delivered in 10 minutes. The room was VERY clean, well stocked, beautifully decorated and had tons of storage space for 3 women - even with all of our shoes, clothes, etc. LOL. We reserved a slightly larger suite that had both a full and half bath! Made for getting ready so much easier! The room had 2 large plasma TV's, sunken tub, wetbar, huge couch, etc. My girlfriends fell in love with the plush robes! To save $$, be sure to get the mini-frig for your room. The wetbar is stocked with a shaker, glasses, bottle openers, etc. The staff and service were great!!! Had to call for wake-up calls, extra towels, etc. and everytime they addressed me by name and made me feel like I was their priority! Don't waste your time at the club at the top of the hotel called MIX. Put our name on the list when I checked in and still had to wait when we got there at 1am. Club is small/narrow and has a very small dance floor. Outside balcony is reserved for VIP/bottle service so we couldn't go out for the view and fresh air. Not a lot of sitting space unless you get bottle service. Left after 10 minutes! The pools at Mandalay Bay aren't too far of a walk from THEhotel side and are nice. Word of advice - GET THERE EARLY if you want a chair in the main beach area. Or spend a lot of $$ and book a cabana! There are a few smaller pools off the beach area and those get busy too. Didn't go in the lazy river because it was packed. Discovered the South Lagoon Pool and it had plenty of seats - probably because the action (music, wave pool, lazy river and bar & grill) is at the main pool. Plus, It had a direct view of the Mandalay Convention Center's large parking lot so you don't feel as removed from the "real world" there. There's so much to do between THEhotel and Mandalay Bay Resort that you don't ever have to leave. Lots of restaurants, bars, cafe, pools, spas, shows, clubs, etc! My girlfriends and I enjoyed it so much that we're already planning our next trip there!

Reviews.Title: “We were treated extremely well by everyone!”
Reviews.Author: 2Schmoops
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Hotel in September for the Superzoo trade show. We were seeking a place where we can do as much or as little as we wanted. This was a fantastic experience. For starters, the property is located next to the airport, so it was a very short (for Vegas) cab ride of less than 15 minutes. Checkin was a breeze. We had requested early checkin in hopes of being in by 2 0r 3 PM, but we actually able to get in at 10AM! Granted, this was a Monday arrival and the weekends are no doubt far busier. Our room was spotless, just be sure to turn on the AC when you get in as it seems they are on a timer for every couple hours or so. I would do the same thing if I had to chill over 1000 rooms. We had one pleasant experience after another with staff. The Bayside buffet offers great value when compared to room service and similiar options. If you are a caviar fan, the Red Square offered a happy hour 4-6 including free caviar with minimum drink purchase. The beach and wave pool were great, although it got crowded as the week filled in. Even still, we were not lacking for attention with drink service. Same true for the casino. We were well cared for and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in this Metropolis”
Reviews.Author: ACAMW
Reviews.Content: Great Boutique type experience, even though connected with the Mandalay Bay. Fabulous Spa and all the other usual America pomp and ceremony.

Reviews.Title: “TheHotel has TheWorst service in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LB-likes2travel
Reviews.Content: Looked forward to TheHotel's stylish contemporary vibe, and x-large "V-Suites." Decor & size of room did not disappoint, but service was sub-par for expensive ($300-400/nite) room. Robes & slippers appeared only after calling housekeeping, toiletries were never replenished during our 4 day stay (until we ran out and again called housekeeping), TV remote was missing from room, and this very large suite had a single small wardrobe which was inadequate for 2 adults on a 4 day visit (and we don't bring a lot of "outfits"). Biggest problem was the pool. Lovely pool complex, but a long walk thru the parking garage, or even longer walk thru casino to reach pool. And, inexcusably rude treatment from a pool attendant on a quiet weekday afternoon. Towels were too small to fully cover the beach chairs, and we requested a 2nd towel. Attendant refused to provide a 2nd towel to each of us (3 guests), which prompted a 45 minute call first to the concierge, then a front desk staffer, and finally front desk manager @ TheHotel. Their "rules" don't permit more than 1 towel/guest, but they "would make an exception" for me. When I returned to the pool after the calls, the attendant gave me 1 towel, & when I said "but we are 3 people" I got some kind of answer along the lines of "so what, 3? It's just another number. 3 + 1 make 4, 3 + 3 make 6," and so on, and he still refused to provide me with the 3 towels requested He did everything but give me the finger! We brought friends along for their 1st visit to Las Vegas, and as their host, I was terribly embarrassed by the treatment we received. I have never had an issue like this (having to beg for a 2nd towel), nor have I ever encountered rudeness from any hotel staff member, ever. I rarely ask for anything, and almost never have complaints. TheHotel's "pool policy" (allowing for only a single towel) & staff problem would have been disappointing at a low-end motel, but was really outrageous at a hotel which promotes itself as a luxury property. Hotels are in the service business, and no matter how stylish the decor, mediocre housekeeping and rude service by staff are inexcusable. We paid 4 star prices, avoided low-cost deals, and received 1 star service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: SkinnyNottingham
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May for our wedding, the hotel is beautiful and you really feel you are living in luxury! I’d highly recommend a V Suite room as we had a fantastic corner suite with amazing views; some friends in the same hotel with standard rooms had far more restricted views. The spa is lovely and is a pleasant way to spend a few hours as is the pool where you can people watch and listen to the (fake) waves rolling in. The Mix is a fabulous bar at the top of the hotel with a balcony looking over Vegas, although sadly we weren’t allowed onto the balcony any of the evenings as they always had a private party which was a real shame. Also note that the residents lift to the Mix stops quite early so you have to use the public lift and pay to get in, although the public lift is great fun, made of glass and on the outside of the hotel (not for anyone with a fear of heights!) I’d still recommend using the residential route and going there first or at least early in your evening! We loved The Hotel and even though it is probably less friendly than some others on the strip it felt more elegant and relaxed than the others.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey choice on the Las Vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: NJdudette
Reviews.Content: Finally getting around to posting this after staying there two weeks ago – sorry about the delay. Getting to the hotel from the airport is a breeze and surprisingly the traffic on LVB on a Friday night wasn’t horrendous. My sister and I arrived at the hotel around 9:00 PM and didn’t have much of a wait. We were offered a king room even though I had reserved a room with two doubles. I was told it was late (9:00 PM is late?!?!?) and nothing else was available, but they could downgrade us for one night and then move us the next morning to a suite with two doubles. We were only staying for three nights so I wasn’t interested in unpacking, packing and unpacking again so I told them the king room was fine – it’s my sister after all, I’m used to her cooties <LOL>. I was then informed they only had a handicap accessible room available and would that be fine? I didn’t see us as having any other choices so I accepted the room. I completely understand stuff happens and you don’t always get the room you want, but why does this always seem to happen to me? We didn’t need a room with a fabulous room and I find it hard to believe they had nothing left but a king/handicap accessible room. My guess is they didn’t want to upgrade me to a nicer room at no charge. We arrived at the room which wasn’t too far from the elevator. I was little concerned at the potential noise level, but it never bothered me – my sister on the other hand was somewhat bothered by it. The living room was nice and spacious and having a ½ bath is great when someone else is using the other bathroom. For me, having a mini bar isn’t necessary due to the cost of the goods, I’d much rather have a mini fridge to store my beverages in and I was disappointed we didn’t have that option. The bedroom appeared to have queen bed rather than a king, but I wasn’t sure and I didn’t want to call down to the front desk and sound like a moron. It seemed like it was the same size as my bed at home (a queen) – dunno, maybe I was wrong. The bathroom on the other hand was a real letdown. We didn’t have the nice marble enclosures the other rooms had, but instead the shower and tub were the fiberglass units many of us have at home. What a bummer. In addition, they weren’t very appealing to look at. Both the shower and tub bottoms were stained with soap scum. A little elbow grease, a scrub brush, and bleach works for me – they should give it a try. Not to mention, by the time either of us were done taking a shower we were standing in ankle deep water. I tried on three separate occasions to contact housekeeping/maintenance about fixing it, but ended up on hold for five minutes before giving up. Sorry, but I was in Vegas to have a good time, not to sit around and wait for someone to pick up the phone. We chose to deal with it and make the most of our trip. My sister passed out on the couch a couple of nights and complained of the noise during the night. I never heard anything, but I’m a heavy sleeper. She said the noise coming the adjoining room door was unbearable and she could clearly hear people in the hallway. I’ve typically found this to be a problem with many hotels in Vegas and have simply chalked it up to “that’s the way it is.” The walls are thin in Vegas <shrug>. We hit the pool rather late on Saturday and that was a HUGE mistake. If you’re not down there by an early hour you can forget finding a chair. This doesn’t hold true for every day, just Saturday. We spent half an hour searching for a chair and then gave up. We staked out a parcel of sand and laid out our towels. BEWARE: during the summer, by noon the sand is too hot to walk on – flip flops are a must. I managed to grab us some chairs after an hour or so and we enjoyed the rest of our day by the pool. The wait staff was wonderful and always managed to keep our glasses filled. It was hot though, we spent most of our time sitting in the pool and drinking our beverages. God, you’ve gotta love Vegas. All in all it was a good stay and I wish we had more time to stay there. I’m not exactly sure if I’d stay there again as it’s rather pricey and if you’re only going to sleep there I really can’t justify paying that kind of money. In addition, having to deal with the crowds at the pool is a bit of a drag. If you’re really looking to splurge the Signature at MGM may be a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a great choice in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: heatherinPhilly
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just returned from a 3 night stay at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay. This was our fourth trip to Vegas - and have previously stayed at Mandalay Bay, Bellagio and the Venetian. The Hotel is a very nice and elegant hotel, where as soon as you walk in you no longer feel like you are in Vegas. There is no dinging from the slot machines, no large hords of conventioneers roaming around. However, a short walk away gets you into Mandalay Bay where you can find all that you want - casino, shops, many restaurants, etc. Our suite was very nicely designed, with separate living and sleeping areas, as well as two baths. However just like during our stay last year at Mandalay Bay, housekeeping leaves a lot to be desired. The floors in both of the bathrooms were definitely dirty (stains, hair, etc) which made it clear that they are not properly cleaned. Also, for being a fairly new hotel, the furniture in our suite was pretty dinged up. Again, just like last year we had a "pool" view, which means a view of the pool as well as the airport. However, we paid very little for the room so I am not complaining about that.. just know that that is what a pool view is. The front desk staff was very nice, however when we checked in, we had to wait a good half hour in a long line to do so. And when we called for our bags to be brought up to our room, it took almost an hour and 4 calls from the bellman (asking, are we really staying at The Hotel and not the regular Mandalay Bay? "Um.. aren't you calling us in our room at the Hotel???") they finally located our bags and brought them up. The bed was extremely comfortable, and I loved the TV in the bathroom. Due to the layout, you cannot hear anything happening in the hallway in the bedroom of the suites, so it was very quiet. All in all, I would definitely stay at this property again. All of the Vegas properties have their issues due to their shear size.. and the sereneness of The Hotel was very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but...”
Reviews.Author: That_vacationer
Reviews.Content: Checked out a room with THE hotel when I had to switch hotels after a bad experience at Luxor. Decent suites, so we booked a one night stay at a pretty good price since it was in the middle of the week ($149). Was impressed by the room's decor and size. However, took a closer look at the cleanliness of everything (mostly the bathroom) and did not feel it met my expectations of the hotel. The toilet area/water closet in the main bathroom had dust, hair and a small bit of toilet paper behind the door, it just looked like it wasn't cleaned. The shower door didn't close easily and I found it was because the rubber strip on the bottom of the door (that stops the water from coming out under the door) had become separated from the door and was hanging down the side of the shower. Also, there were little bits of mold in the corners of the shower, which were difficult to see due to the dark grout. Anyways, I had already switched hotels and switched rooms twice at the previous hotel, so I was just tired of complaining and moving all around. We stayed there the night and decided not to complain once we checked out. It was a decent stay, but I think from now on we'll be at the Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: kenty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic, chic, modern and spacious. A welcome relief from manic Vegas and little place of calm. We loved it, got married in the Mandalay bay chapel and had reception on 64th floor - at MIX. It was exceptional. Everything was perfect, a little pricy but was so well done. Rooms great, roomy, great views.

Reviews.Title: “Our Room Was Broken Into While Asleep”
Reviews.Author: 360TravellerOntario
Reviews.Content: Our first night at the Mandalay Bay we walked around the strip, came back into our room and went back to our rooms to sleep. Sometime around 4am and 6am someone crept into our hotel room and stole a wallet and jewellery case from the dresser. We knew these items were stolen during our sleep because the mans wallet who was taken had his room key in his wallet and was the last person to come in after using the pop machine down the hall. After searching our room for 2 hours we finally agreed our items were in fact stolen while we were all (2 men, 2 women) asleep. We called security who took a statement and followed missing items protocol. Myself and my roommate went to the last place our friend had his wallet- the pop machine. We looked on top, bent down looked underneath it and saw the wallet, jewellery case and another purse which did not belong to anyone in our room. We ran back into the room, told the security officer who recovered the purse and brought it down to the front desk. We complained, called, went down to talk to literally everyone who had any type of authority to do something about the situation. The hotel ran us around in circles for a day and half. They told us WE LEFT OUR DOOR OPEN (which is physically impossible as they are designed to close automatically). We did not even get a refund let alone an apology- NOTHING!!! Not only did we waste our vacation trying to be reimbursed we also spoke to 3 other women who had their wallets stolen from their rooms while they were asleep- they were not recovered- and the hotel did nothing for their situation either. The hotel manager, and risk assessment both informed us that our door was left open- we tried to explain this was not possible and even in the chance it were- how did this justify their staff entering our room and removing items from our rooms while we slept. We spoke to maids who informed us of how they get assigned rooms, a print out of whose room they can enter with the keys they have and how they have to check out their keys when they arrive on shift- the hotel informed us that to find out who entered the room would take 10 days. I spoke to the hotel manager who hung up on me after I threatened them with a phone call from my lawyer. We also requested that the police be called and brought into the hotel lobby as we would like to file our robbery complaint- the money from the wallet was never recovered- this was denied. They told us police were not allowed on the property even in the event of a robbery, we would have to go down to the station- they also refused us a cab ride there. We met a couple who knew people who had items stolen from The Venetian Hotel and their hotel offered them 2 nights free stay, a roundtrip flight to use whenever they like and all meals included. Mandalay Bay did nothing for us after being robbed while we were asleep. I would NOT advise anyone to stay their as we got NO apology, there are no cameras in the halls, the hotel blamed US and they basically tried to cover it up HORRIBLE experience, customer service and hotel etiquette

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with some flaws”
Reviews.Author: Just_g0t_h0me
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel for 5 nights and had a great time there but also some disappointment. First the negatives of the stay: We had booked The Hotel 4 months in advance and requested a suite with a view of the strip. When we arrived at 2pm we were told that there were no strip view suites available, but we could move the next day. We were disappointed but decided against the hassle of moving. When we got up to our suite we found a cleaner in there and knocked on the door to find out what was going on. He explained that he was trying to clean a stain off the floor and left us to it. The stain remained and while we didn't complain I was surprised that we'd be given a room that was still being cleaned. Surely there were other clean suites available for us to have on arrival? We had chosen The Hotel due to the great reviews of the Mandalay Bay pools. The week before we departed I had tried to book a Cabana (on the hotel internet site) for 2 days while we were there (a Saturday and a Tuesday). After settling into our suite we took a tour of the hotel and pool area and went to make sure our email had been received and the bookings confirmed, as we had received no reply. I was told that if we hadn't gotten an email back then there was nothing available - Cabanas can be booked up to 30 days in advance and it looks like in the middle of August you actually have to reserve it 30 DAYS prior. We were so disappointed with this, as this was the main reason we’d chosen this hotel. From a hotel who claims to be 5 star, I found it hard to accept that at the very least we were not sent a reply informing us that the Cabanas were fully booked. We actually considered moving hotels at this point and getting something that had a better position on the strip; we decided to stay and make the most of what we had. On the Tuesday we managed to get a beachside Cabana ($500) through a cancellation and had a great day in both the beach pool and the lazy river. It was expensive, but then I guess when it’s booked out 30 days prior they can charge what the like! The waitresses were great, and came but every half hour or so to make sure we had everything we needed. As for the positives, the suite was great, a separate lounge area with plasma TV and second toilet. A huge bathroom with a TV, large bath, separate shower, 2 sinks and another toilet. Great bed, with another TV (not plasma). As mentioned above, we didn’t have a view of the strip, just the road behind, but not a big issue after the first day. We had room service one night, ate in the Mandalay Bay restaurants on 2 other nights, and then had dinner elsewhere on the other nights. All the food was great and we didn’t feel it was either overpriced (or underpriced). Every morning we had coffee and juice as well as a muffin from the cafe in the hotel reception, which was quick, well priced and tasty. Loved the fact that we could walk through a connecting hall to the Luxor and on to the Excalibur for something different – a relief that we didn’t have to go outside in the August heat. There was also a free monorail between these 3 hotels that we used as well. The Mandalay Bay and the Hotel are at the end of the strip and so if you want to walk the strip it is nice that you can get back via a train or through air-conditioned casinos on your return. On the whole, we had a great time, came away without losing any money (about even for the 5 days, so very happy with that!), but probably wouldn’t stay at The Hotel again. We’ve been to Vegas before and stayed at the MGM – thought the Cabanas were better there (value for money, service, extras), and while the pools were definitely bigger at the Mandalay Bay, the MGM lazy river was fantastic! With the position of The Hotel being at the very end of the strip, everything would have had to be perfect for me to want to return there, as it wasn’t we will be trying something different next time, somewhere in the middle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer Luxury”
Reviews.Author: monkeytours
Reviews.Content: What can I say ... worth every penny. We had a one of their smallest suites but it was huge superbly decorated with an opulent luxurious feel but without being tacky but instead very classy. As you entered the suite there was a small tolie and sink cloakroom and then you were into the lounge with a comfortable sofa, chair desk and plasma and a huge window looking over the Luxor and onto the strip. There was also a minibar and wet bar in the lounge. The next room was a huge bedroom with shot silk luxury soft bedding and huge wardrobes with hidden plazma and safe and another huge window over the strip. The bathroom had a tub big enough for two and was the deepest weve ever seen, a huge shower, twin sinks, small TV and a seperate room within for the toilet. The room service is affordable and superb. The common areas of the hotel are fantastic very classy and expensive looking with a beautiful scent in the air. The pool/beach are is busy but there are plenty beds and it has a great atmosphere. Rubber rings for the lazy river are extra but you can bring your own if you would like or go in without one. We always said nothing would ever beat our room at the Grand Hyatt in Dubai but this certainly did and I would recommend to anyone. Only downside could not e-mail hotel before getting there, had to call but this was fine using a proxy caller to get cheap calls. Was able to transfer to a deal price after I booked when a special offer came out after booking, this was no problem to them and got us free spa passes etc. There are loads of reataurants to choose from and a club/Bar on the 64th floor overlooking the strip which is fantastic. House of Blues should be tried also the food is great. If you are going to Vegas don't hestitate to book here, its at the good end of gthe strip and not far from the main hotels, there is also a good cheap bus service and mini rail.(free)

Reviews.Title: “Not all so perfect”
Reviews.Author: LordHumble
Reviews.Content: The place is very elegant! Check in was good as we had arrived very early and missed any crowd. Staff was friendly. We were originally booked into the Bay but we upgraded to the Hotel suite for an extra $54 a night (well worth it). Weekday prices were good at $170. (Weekend prices were crazy) Suite was excellent. Very clean. Great view. Huge bathroom with double sink and a half bathroom in the hallway for guests. Beds were very comfy. TV in every room, even the bathroom! I asked for a discount on the upgrade but they said no because the Hotel was nearly full. A lie cause you can tell how full the floor is by how many morning newspapers are left outside the doors and my floor was barely half full. The first night we were all very tired and when I turned down the bedsheets I found what appeared to be blood on the sheets. We complained and they cleaned up very well. They gave us an apology and compt us a one night upgrade of $54 and told us the stain was actually only rust (sure!). Regardless of what it was the shock value was worth more than $54 in my mind. Call ahead to rent your Cabana or you may find they are all taken. Be prepared for high prices (starting at $250). I had to put my name on a list. If called in to take one after the noon hour they said they would discount the price but that did not happen to me when they offered a tent to me at 12:30. I asked but they said no. I found the Cabanas were low grade for the money compared with other hotels. Our hostess was great but the waitress was on her monthly friend I'm sure. When the waitress took a break nobody replaced her so I had to get my own drinks. There were no misters (water mist), Lounge chairs came with no cushions. Cabanas are not roped off so everyone piles up in front of your spot without regard for your access or view. At the TI my price included a bottle of sparkling wine and a small fruit plate along with the basics. At the MB it came with nothing except your basics like water and pop. In the casino I was playing max bets on a 25 cent slot and it took over an hour before a waitress got to me. Expect everything to very expensive! It will cost about $30 just to sneeze here! A muffin will cost $3.50. Three large pancakes will run $12. Lunch at $20 and dinner at leat $30. If you are a good eater then the buffet is your best bet. Not cheap but good value. The MB is at the far south end of the strip and getting around can be very exhausting. There are available forms of transit but they do get busy and can take time to travel up and down the strip due to heavy traffic. I recommend renting a car from the airport with a GPS. Total with taxes will run about $40 a day and is well worth the freedom to explore and get around in comfort. All Hotel parking is free. Every Hotel can easily take up a city block and the blocks in Vegas are almost a half mile long. Unfortunately Vegas is becoming an expensive place to go and the days of discounts are quickly leaving. Ticket discount places usually buy up lower quality seating areas and people offerring free tickest only want you to spend the whole day looking at their rental properties first! Try to avoid the hot season at it gets REAL hot!!! and exhaustion can set in real fast and walking around is just not comfortable at all. When we checked out they asked if all was went well. After telling the issues with the pool and suite they compt me $75. A nice jesture. I would probably not return to the MB as the cost exceeds what I can afford to budget. I'll leave it to the rich who can!

Reviews.Title: “Very tasteful for Las Vegas !”
Reviews.Author: Doughballs
Reviews.Content: Location : the Mandalay is at the very end of the strip (South). It is linked to the Luxor and Excalibor by a regular tram, but I would still have preferred to be slightly more central (maybe New York New York location). The strip is much longer to walk than seems at first sight, especially in the heat. I was travelling with my 16 year old son and so we had booked a suite, with a rollaway in the lounge. We checked in OK, but on reaching the room it was actually being used as the trash room and was not ready for use. The lady responsible for cleaning the floor called her manager, and they were very nice, but nothing could be done to make the room ready for at least an hour. She suggested I talk to front desk which I did, and they credited the room with $100 food allowance, so the hours wait was worth it, no complaints here. When we did get in...room very nice. Carpet a bit dodgy looking, but rest of room impressive, very tastefully decorated. Partial view of strip / Luxor. TV’s literally in every room- lounge, bedroom AND bathroom. Couldnt get DVD in lounge or IPOD dock in bedroom to work, but maybe that was me, and as we didn’t get to spend much time there I didn’t get it sorted. Good shower and toiletries. Iron and ironing board. In the hotel complex there was a Starbucks (good for early morning trips), and several decent restaurants, I liked the fact that within the complex you had different price ranges to choose from for meals. Also you could easily buy water / drinks / snacks from several shops – whilst more expensive than supermarkets you did not have to rely on mini bar prices. The shopping centre between Mandalay and Luxor, Mandalay Place, was pricey but not extortionate, and they had a very good selection, I would shop there again. BUT I did not like the pools very much. It had been much lauded as a real sandy beach with wave pool. But the sun beds (hundreds lined up in rows like sardines) had no shade whatsoever, and after about 15 minutes in the 40 degrees sun I had to stand under a tree and wait for my son to finish in the pool. It was a real disappointment for me. Design –wise, the Mandalay hit all the right spots and could not be faulted. But with a 16 year old, I could not help feeling that we would have been better in a slightly different type of hotel such as New York New York. I have rated it high – it was not the perfect hotel for our needs, but if I were in Las Vegas for a romantic weekend, I would definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: “First Timer!”
Reviews.Author: ofdevils
Reviews.Content: First Time to vegas...LUVED IT! So Much Fun!!! The Hotel is a sophisticated and secluded but, close to all the action! suite is everything they say.strip view as requested is special for a first timer.mandalay bay is bigger than i ever imangined.the pool complex is so much fun.shark reef is tasteful.restaurants are great. TIPS: -rented a cabana for 1 day for $250.they tried to charge me $300 but, I took down the cabana reservationist info to prove my $250 charge.record name,date and time of reserve.cabana is well worth it with temps of 106 and no chairs available, especially if u have a group to split costs.refrigerator is filled with $4 sodas and water, free w/ cabana.it's a nice retreat and splurge! -bring your own tubes. can get one for $2 at CVS. they are happy to blow up for free at towel stand. -14 and younger don't need rm key to enter pool if this applies to you. -use the free monorail MB-LX-EX to navigate south end.can use walkway to NY/MGM from there.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Beach_Baby2006
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel through a travel package on SouthWest Airlines. We were celebrating an anniversary and requested a room upgrade. The front desk personnel worked hard to accommodate our request, even though we were checking in several hours early (it was a Tuesday). We were given a corner suite overlooking the Strip, which was great, but looked better at night, since it overlooked the back of two hotels with trash areas, etc. But nighttime: OMG. It was great. See other reviews for the rundown of the TVs, marble shower, etc. I will tell you that every staff member we encountered in the complex was friendly and happy to help with directions and answers to questions. Some reviews mentioned snotty staff--but we saw none of that in the 4 nights, 5 days we were there. My biggest complaint is that August is HOT and being so far south on the Strip requires lots of walking. But that said, the overall ambiance of the Mandalay complex is calming and amazing and not terribly smokey. Of all the other hotels we walked around, this complex has the best selection and quality of restaurants, save for Wynn and the Venetian (did not check out Caesar's). Didn't do the pool, but lots of people did and seemed happy enough. No in-room coffee and THE Coffee Bar was expensive ($3.75 for regular, 16-oz coffee), but that's Vegas. We would absolutely stay at this wonderful hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “There are ways to save money in Vegas! Cheap Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: RebeccafromNJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 night stay at Las Vegas, Nevada. We stayed at the Mandalay bay booked through expedia. We were there July 31st-August 5th. Overall we really liked it. I have been to Vegas many times but my husband had not so I was set on getting him a strip view. I had heard that only floors 20 and above were good so wehn checking in I asked for that. The woman behind the counter was really friendly and nice. The lines were long but I expected that from reading other reviews on here so it didn't bother me. Anyway, I insited on a strip view on floor 20 or above but she said she had a strip view on floor 17. The room was really great, nice large bed, flat screens, nice bathroom and..TA DA an amazing view of the strip. I was so excited! Overall we really liked it but agree AUGUST is HOT in Vegas..I think it reached 106 daily! I wanted to write to tell you how to save money b/c all the other reviews are correct Vegas is EXPENSIVE. First of all, if you are staying at mandalay, it's not like you are stranded on a resort in jamaic or the d.r.. I mean go out the front door, walk across the street(look both ways foolios) and go to the liquor store, the conv. store, the mcdonalds, the panda express! Seriously, people complain about no coffee makers, well get your lazy tooshies out the door and walk the freakin' 100 feet to the McDonalds and get a coffee. I think they even have the fancy flavors now, whoo pee doo! I like panda express, yummy chinese,..whatever.. I don't need to drop $$50-100 on breakfast and lunch. That's just silly. And, weak drinks at the pool? Go to the liquor store..seriously it's directly acorss the street from mandalay! Get yourself some cranberry juice and voda or stolio o and sprite and make a drink or two in your room while you are gettting ready you can have a cocktail or grab a to go cup from the pool area, bring back to your room and VOILA..cocktail to go and you jsut saved yourself a god $100 by purchasing your own stuff. As far as spending money save it for dinner and a view or a show! We had dinner at le eiffel tower restaurant and it was awesome! You can see the bellagio fountains going off every 15 mintues (ask for a window seat) and have a yummy meal. they even gave my hubby a free birthday dinner dessert. (tell the hostess) Dinner at Le Eiffel Tower Restaurant at the Paris Hotel cost us $250 with drinks, appetizer (try the escargot, I'd never had it, and it really was good, altho I'm glad it came chopped up and not pretty woman style) that's $125.00 each. Don't expect huge portions, but def. decent. If you don't want to cough up the cash for dinner there, then def. go for drinks, they say dress code but it seemed to me like they didnt' care, we saw people in Jeans. Anyway, a cocktail will drop you back..umm..I think $18.00 if I remember correctly but the view is pretty cool. Other than that..check out the Wynn, its pretty spectacular and have a drink on the patio overlooking the fountains! Have fun and ride the deuce! We loved it! It picks you up outside the panda express, mcdonalds on the strip outside mandalay. It's FIVE DOLLARS for a 24 hour bus pass. It's a cool double decker, air condiitoned bus, that comes every 15 mintues and goes ALL up and down the strip ..even down to freemont. Plus if you are looking to pick up, it seemed like all the hot, drunk younger girls rode this bus late at night) Other than that, during the day the crowd was a mix of everybody but mostly tourists. We had a lot of fun conversations on that bus. If you gave me tips on the bus, or exchanged taking pictures. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms at THE Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlueRTA
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay for a family vacation. We booked two rooms (all rooms are suites) and were not disappointed. Each room/suite was very well-furnished, with 2 TVs and a second half-bathroom in addition to the large master bathroom. The amenities at Mandalay Bay are great; lots of excellent restaurant choices and of course the pool. One downside, the pool is not that close to THE Hotel and it also gets very crowded. Also, you are at the far south end of the Strip when you stay here, so it actually can be worthwhile to have a rental car when visiting the north end properties such as Wynn. Overall, a decent value for great rooms on a very nice property. The main difference between this hotel and a 5-star resort is that the service at a 5-star resort feels much more personal; all of the amenities here are top-notch.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel ~ not the accounting dept.”
Reviews.Author: votivelady
Reviews.Content: Had booked The Hotel through a conference held by Home Interiors & Gifts for an acceleration meeting for leadership in home decor. I had this room booked by June 2008, but The Hotel charged my card for one nights stay on July 1st even though I did not arrive to the hotel until July 27th! I have never heard a hotel taking a payment on a card a month in advance! Our stay was very comfortable, even though our room (on 23rd floor) did smell stale and the front room flat screen TV did not work, nor did the hair dryer. But overall comfortable, until... after splitting the room with three other roommates that checked out before I did... the front desk charged two of them the correct rate and the third person's rate was decreased by $54 that they charged to MY card (my card was the one that reserved the room). Only because I caught this error when I checked out did it come to their attention.. and THE Hotel front desk asked me to get the reimbursement from the third roommate! Telling them I lived two states away from her and hardly even know her.. did they finally agree to adjust my card and charge hers. When calling the Accounting Dept. to make sure they were crediting my charge card... a rude man, said that they fix 'Mistakes" from the front desk ALL the TIME... so make sure your bill is correct when you check out!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room and Pool area”
Reviews.Author: runner4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mandalay Bay with my 6 year old son for 1 night coming back from vacation. The entire staff was very helpful from the check in staff down to the valet and restaurants. The room itself was gorgeous. Flat screen tv and even a small tv in the bathroom. Access to the pool area was quick and easy without having to go near the casino. Pool area was great, but a bit crowded. "Lazy" river was actually fast and FUN! The other pool areas were nice. Note to travelers with small children - pools are all 4" at shallow end. For the wave pool you have to be 48" tall and they enforce that very strictly. My son was one inch short and they wouldnt let him go in even though the waves were TINY and we live at the beach and he boogie boards on much bigger waves all the time! It wasnt that great anyway and the Lazy River was a good alternative. All service in the restaurants was excellent although if you are traveling with younger children you may have a bit of difficulty finding food that would appeal to them. However, the aquarium is great for small and big kids alike. OVERALL we would definitely stay there again if we go back through Vegas and it's the ONLY hotel my son wants to stay in!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, but the service...”
Reviews.Author: hollyx113
Reviews.Content: First of all, the rooms at THEhotel were AWESOME. Very spacious, it is great to have two rooms with a half and a full, we paid nearly twice the price for a similar room at the Four Seasons in Vegas the last time we were here. That said, you certainly aren't getting Four Seasons service. Granted, we did not expect five star service, but for the quality they pride themselves on you think the service here would be a little faster. Everything was slow here- when we arrived at 10pm after a long flight our room was STILL being cleaned by the maid service. However the woman at the front desk kindly gave us a $100 gift card we could spend on food (not including drinks). Of course when we checked out they denied that they offered this to us, but did not bother arguing and took $100 off our bill anyway. It took about 15 minutes to get a bellman to store our luggage for us and after eating we called to see if our room was ready and since the hotel was so large we were practically on hold 20 minutes before someone talked to us. theCAFE was always very slow, we went there twice including for lunch this afternoon, and the food is very average. I would suggest taking a few steps over to the Raffles Cafe in the casino which is a lot more charming. The pool area was packed and practically impossible to get any chairs. However the pool felt AMAZING, they do a great job of keeping the water nice and cool and also very clean. I will probably stay here again because the rooms are GREAT for the value.... but the location so far away from everything, and the service (while nice) is very very slow. Overall, a good place to stay in Vegas if you are looking for luxurious appointed suites...but don't expect that luxurious service to come with it.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: karennn
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had booked a two night stay at mandalay bay and upon arrival were told we had been flagged for a free upgrade to THEsuite room at THEhotel. I had someone previously recommend this hotel for me to stay at and was very excited upon the deal we had just received ($238 for two nights)! I felt instantly transported walking into the lobby as the noise and bright lights of the casino disappeared behind me. Not knowing what to expect I was blown away at how wonderful the hotel and the room really were. Along with a large fabulous bedroom and bathroom THEsuite also came with a living room. All together there were 3 TVs and 2 bathrooms. For me, the decor made the room! Everything was very simple and elegant, dark wood, dark marble, and best of all...a completely mirrored armoire. Our air conditioner worked amazing and I enjoyed walking into my freezing cold room after being outside. The bed was seriously beyond comfortable, down pillows made it hard to be up by 11 at check out the last day. I honestly was impressed with everything in the room, even the bathroom with its extra large tub with waterfall fill and giant marble shower. THEhotel really exceeded my expectations with its level of class and simplicity, even down to the ultra soft robes hanging in the closet. I can not say enough about how wonderful my stay was and will not sleep anywhere else when i go to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Loved THE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: lynn0101
Reviews.Content: THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay is wonderful. The rooms are suites. I think it was 650 sq ft. The bedroom was large enough to have two queen beds and a roll away. The living area had a huge plasma tv (great when travelling with teenage boys). The swimming areas at Mandalay Bay are perfect. Easily the best pool in Vegas. Being in THE Hotel was a bit quieter than being in the Mandalay Bay (although it is all connected). Service in the hotel is good. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good!”
Reviews.Author: Liebchen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 3 other girls for my bachelorette party. The hotel in general and the room were beautiful and very clean. The only issue we had was that we requested 2 double beds since we had 4 girls and they did not have any rooms available that had more than just 1 king bed when we checked in. So, we had to take that room (although they did comp us a slightly bigger suite) and change rooms the next night. That was kind of a pain and unexpected since we booked several months in advance. The reason I wanted to stay here was because I had heard it had the "best pool" and that is what we planned to do during the day each day. We were all very disappointed. I was not impressed AT ALL with the pool. It looked like one that you would see at a community civic center/public pool. The chairs were old and plastic and the towels were downright dingy and disgusting. We could not even believe that they were clean. I never would have expected to have moved to the "adult" pool (Moorea), but when the guys came by and offered to let us go up there for free, we jumped at the chance. That pool was much nicer and more what I expected (if you do not count all the drunk topless women that seem to congregate there after 2 pm). It can get kind of crazy in the afternoon, but given the heat, we usually were heading in at at that time anyway. Based solely on location, I would probably not stay at this hotel again. I was not as familiar with Vegas before this trip, but I now know that this is kind of off the beaten path. You have to take a cab to go almost anywhere. So, next time I will probably stay at the Bellagio so I can walk to shopping and restaurants outside the hotel. Just my 2 cents ....

Reviews.Title: “One of the best resorts in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: A.Evans1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at TheHotel for 8 nights in July. This was our second visit to TheHotel. We stayed at the Wynn last year but found the Mandalay Bay resort far superior. Check in was very quick and staff courteous. Suites are huge and bathrooms fantastic. I have no idea how anyone can complain about these rooms. The whole Mandalay resort is great. Yes i agree with other people the beach is far too crowded and if you get a bed round the beach it feels as if you are almost laying on top of each other!! Pools are great though and much needed in 110 degree heat! Despite what others have said, the drinks and food round the pool are great. No it is not cheap, but hey, this is Vegas and the drinks/ food prices are in line with the rest of Vegas. The Mandalay Bay comes into its own at night. The choice of resturants and bars are amazing, Personal favourites were Rumjungle, China Grill, and Eyecandy bar in the centre of the Casino is great. Do not miss the Mix bar. It is by far one of the best bars in Vegas with amazing views. On the negative side, i do find it amazing that they charge you $20 to use the gym and charge you daily for Broadband use!!! If you are paying a lot of money to stay at this hotel i think the fact that you are charged to use these services is a discrace. Location is not a problem at all. In fact is nice to be away from the central craziness of the strip. Overall a great hotel, with lots going on. This was our third visit to Vegas and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: wjschmonsees
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on the Mandalay Bay -- about $150/night -- but still felt that we were not getting our money's worth. The room and bathroom are fine and the property itself is new and spectacular. However the staff were discourteous and uninterested in helping. We had a few problems such as a gurgling toilet noise in our bathroom that were unaddressed. The "Ticket Counter" was never open when we passed by and the Box Office sold only tickets for the Mandalay Bay's own shows. The Concierge is supposed to book tickets to shows around the Strip but seemed uninterested in helping us and treated us impolitely. The pool area (including wave pool, jacuzzi and raft ride) was extremely overcrowded, even on a weekday, and the water seemed dirty. The drinks at the pool bar were awful, but that didn't stop the hotel from charging top dollar. We're not expert gamblers, but we noticed that the casino seemed to cater exclusively to people placing bigger bets; it was harder for us to place a few small "fun" bets than it was in casinos in the other properties. Finally, the location was a big drawback; it was a real chore to get from the hotel to the central Strip. First you have to take the hotel's tram to the Excalibur property, walk over the elevated crossing to the New York, New York property, then walk over another elevated crossing to the MGM Grand. If you then want to get to the Las Vegas Monorail you have to walk through or around the MGM. All this takes maybe half an hour on average, and can be tiring in the hot weather. You're much better off in one of the properties that is in the central Strip and closer to a Monorail stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, Great stay for Adults & Singles”
Reviews.Author: m3speedy
Reviews.Content: Took nephew to his first trip to Florida and he is 18. Wanted to show him Vegas but only had 2 days to do it in and wanted to stay somewhere nice. THE Hotel is classy quiet place away from the crowds ,but close enough to action. Room was perfect with 2 bathrooms, seperate master bdrm from living room, spacious and all the amenities we could want. Pool area was nice since we rented a private cabana. They had a promo deal normally $250. cabana but got it for $150. Well worth it since it was hot and not too much shade by the beach areas. Cabana included sofa, plasma tv. fridge, safe, table, reserved lounge chairs and you have it all day with personal service. We went to the private 21+ adult only pool area called Moorea and he had a blast since they didn't check his ID. Topless pool area, private, great music and very relaxing. Cost $40. to get in but we had a VIP pass. We were back and forth from the adult pool to our cabana.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasanty surprised”
Reviews.Author: La_Rubita
Reviews.Content: I was really surprised at how intimate this hotel felt, and I was very happy with my room. I enjoyed being close to the craziness of Mandalay Bay but able to escape to relative tranquility. Had 2 really nice spa treatments and was happy to find the spa similarly peaceful. The same can not be said of the Mandalay Bay pool area. Even though we rented a cabana, we were sweltering (no misting system), and the pools were so noisy and crowded, it was pretty tough to relax. I plan to stay again soon, as the proximity to the Strip combined with peace and quiet can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Had THE greatest time! Upgraded for Free”
Reviews.Author: julezpower
Reviews.Content: I booked the MANDALAY BAY hotel 2-3 months before our stay. I booked directly with the hotel on the phone. I was on the email list and got a good deal, $129 M, $129 TU, $99 W, and $99 TH nights. Since we needed 2 rooms for upto 7 people, I needed to call reservations directly. I wanted 2 rooms connecting with 2 queen beds each. At 2pm Eastern time, I got an email confirming my reservation at THEHotel. I was thrilled! When they arrived, they said they did not have any connectiong rooms, but they could upgrade us to two suites on the same floor for no additional cost. The rooms were exactly like you see in the pictures and on the website. It was perfect. The amount of space was needed with 3-4 girls in each rooms. 1.5 bathrooms came in very handy when we were getting ready to go out or hungover the next day. We had a mini fridge in our room, worth the $$. On our last day we checked out of the hotel and we checked into our cabana which we booked for the birthday girl. $350 for a friday on the Lazy river island. [YES, more than a hotel room for 3 nights.] It came with unlimited sodas, water and ice and all the other details. We were mix our own drinks with the liquor we snuck in. [vodka in waterbottle trick] The pool attendant wasnt too strick about the 1 key per pool guest, but we were prepaired anyways. Bring your own tubes for the lazy river and ask the Tube guy to fill it up for $1 tip. Drinks are $10-$14 and food is $10+. There were a lot of kids at the lazy river tu-thursday. They get in the way of relazing and they are jumping alover the place. The east Lagoon and West Lagoon pools were better for adults. We were there during a freak lighting and rain storm. They will close the pools if this happens and not reopen for atleast 45 minutes after the last lightning strike. Since we had checked out of the hotel and were not catching the Red-eye flight till 11pm, we showered in the open showers near the bathrooms/beach and changed in the cabana. There are private shower stalls in the Womens room outside the south convention center entance, and plugs for your hair dryer. [the cabana had plugs too, but no mirrors] We looked pretty good for spending the whole day at the pool. THEHotel is amazing and I would go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Vegas Stay at THEhotel”
Reviews.Author: vpfreedude
Reviews.Content: First off my Wife and I and another couple stayed at THEhottel because we wanted something modern & luxurious wiht a boutique hotel feel. THE delivered in spades. The room was very nicely appointed a wetbar, 1/2 bath and a work area in the main room. King beds and a master bath complete with shower and a 2 person tub. Our room over looked the pool complex which was nice but we weren't there for the view. All services that we used were friendly, efficient and overall quite top notch. THEcafe was good and so was the lobby bar. Overall, we will definately be booking again on our next trip to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “THE Best : )”
Reviews.Author: SRD357
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Hotel twice. Loved it both times. As soon as you walk in you notice the sweet aromatic air . The service is excellent and very attentive. The suites are great, especially if you're a smoker. You can sit in the living room and smoke a cigar and your clothes won't stink. Tvs in every room. Another great point, two bathrooms. The mini-bar is definitely overpriced, but I suggest you hit up the liquor store thats right across from the Mandalay Bay. You can buy a bottle of whatever you want, because it will cost you three times more if you order it through room service. Less than a 10 minutes walk. The pool area is kind of a hike, and must be there early if you want a seat. Pool service was very attentive and friendly. Drinks are pricy, but so is everything else. As far as food, there there are great restaurants available downstairs. The Cafe, Wolfgang Puck's Lupo.... Countless others. Great bars, I suggest an apple martini from The Red Square or an espresso martini from Lupo, you'll thank me. Another plus, the cab ride from the airport is only ten minutes. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone who expects nothing but excellence.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jbw431
Reviews.Content: The time we spent at The Hotel was a very nice experience. The reception and public areas were of 5 star standard, leather furniture in the bar area, a coffee shop and a well presented reception area. Check in staff were polite and helpful and we got to our room without much delay. We stayed in a V suite on the 19th floor with a strip view, i was very happy with the room, the view was good but would probably be even better on a higher floor. The room was well furnished with a large bedroom, lounge and bathroom and a second toilet off the lounge. Both living room and bedroom had a very large plasma television, with a 15 inch telly in the bathroom. The bath was large and deep, i loved it and spent a lot of time in it. There is only 1 complaint that being the lack of wardrobe space, we stayed for a week and had to share a small wardrobe. The Mandalay bay hotel itself was great, plenty of good eating places. Great swimming pool that shuts to early, one evening at 1700hrs for a staff party, what about the paying guests? I will go back, great holiday, my third in vegas by far the best, i previously stayed at MGM and Luxor.

Reviews.Title: “The best place on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Dribbs
Reviews.Content: There is something very welcoming when you can see your hotel from the airport, a gold glittering shimmer in the haze. As soon as you walk in there is a lovely smell, someone told me that they pipe in purfume to relax the guests, if so it works. I had heard of long lines to book in and we had a few people in front of us, though a lady welcomed us and chatted to us as we waited. Book in was quick and very welcoming. We had a wonderful suite over looking to pool and the mountains, it makes you wonder how they ever built this city. Perfect air con and three wonderful rooms with tasteful fittings. Be warned though you may need water wings to get into the bath. One little problem was that we found the last occupants underwear stuffed down the side of the chest of draws and it was more of a worry that they had blood on them. We left a note for house-keeping the next morning and they were removed. We didn't want to get the house-keeping staff in trouble so never mentioned it again. When you have all the sights and sounds of Las Vegas to enjoy it's wonderful to come back to your own little space and enjoy the view. Just a tiny walk into the Mandalay bay complex and then a free monorail ride to the next two hotels, from which you can walk to the MGM and then onto the transport for the rest of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Sparkle59
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late, however in 2007 we found the service to be above great and the room to be stunning. The only thing that we found annoying was the long walk from our room to the pool! Imagine walking all the way through the casino with your bathing suite on! Not my idea of a pretty sight! Also having to get up before 8am to get a chair by the pool. I used to leave my husband in bed, go down get two chairs, leave a book on one and flip flops on the other then return to my room - remember the long walk I told you about!
