Best show - at the Wynns - outstanding!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, large rooms, fun pool”
Reviews.Author: MarinRyan
Reviews.Content: Since no casino in this sister hotel to Mandalay, you can get to room so quickly. I contacted the hotel directly, took advantage of their summer promotions, and then was upgraded when i checked into hotel. When we arrived, our carpets were wet in spots where they had done some spot cleaning and the bellman slipped and almost fell. He called housekeeping and engineering and within minutes they were drying our carpet, cleaning our room, checking on us, etc. Also, the light on our room lock never lit when we inserted our electronic key. Again, a call downstairs had someone here in minutes who fixed it and tested it and was so nice. Needed more towels, had them within 5 minutes. Pool is VERY crowded but fun for kids. It's more fun than relaxing. The suite layout was great for my husband and I with our kids. (three tvs were a huge hit - living room, bedroom and bathroom). Buffet at Mandalay was Great! way above what we expected. Parking is free, but everything else costs a whole lot. I used the internet for 5 minutes, printed 4 pages and then faxed 2 of the pages to my office. Those services combined cost about $50. The most comfortable hotel beds we've ever slept in . My husband had me check the pillows to see who makes them so we can order when we get home. So my wrap up - great service, fantastic beds, no congestion in lobby, busy but fun pool, free parking, very good buffet, extras very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, great property!”
Reviews.Author: coreypenrose
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time, this is a GREAT property! Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: kittenmagic
Reviews.Content: Oh my goodness me, if you want to get away from the madness that is Las Vegas and stay in a beautiful hotel then stay here... Big yes, room had everything you could wish for staff very friendly and helpful, quite expensive but really well worth it. It is the last hotel on the strip but I think that is why I liked it because it felt like on oasis of calm.

Reviews.Title: “Love the room, hate the pool”
Reviews.Author: CB172
Reviews.Content: Like many, expected more of THEhotel (their spelling, not mine) given the glowing reviews it receives. The best part of the experience is the room -- spacious, good beds, lovely br, fluffy robes. The room was as promised. I had no issues with the service. The pool area, however, was such a disappointment that it clouded the stay somewhat. There are insufficient chairs (and insufficient space for the chairs they already have). So, after your hot and irritating hunt for chairs, the music (at 9am!) and the crowds and the screaming kids do not add up to a relaxing experience. The other consideration is the location. As the hotel is at the south end, you will spend considerable time and money on cabs. So overall, if you want a great room, this is a possibility. If other amenities are a priority, you may consider other options.

Reviews.Title: “"Guests have to work too hard to get what they want"”
Reviews.Author: SgtDingo
Reviews.Content: I am a former fan and frequent guest at Mandalay Bay. I've stayed there in the past because they have the best pool on the strip, because I can get a two-bedroom suite for less than I'd pay for a regular room at the Four Seasons (another favorite hotel), and because I can walk to the Luxor and Excaliber hotels via indoor walkways, so I never have to face the Las Vegas heat if I don't want to. HOWEVER, the lack of service during my last stay at this hotel was unforgivable and indicates that this hotel is having serious management and/or financial issues. Read on for the ugly details (it's a long review): The problems started before we even arrived. I made a reservation for three nights after receiving a "floating holiday" solicitation from the hotel offering a third night's stay for free. I decided that I would make this a luxurious mini-vacation and tried to reserve a garden cabana (their most expensive cabana @ $700/day, which includes use of a private pool) for two days of our stay via the Mandalay Bay website. Although their website promises a response within 24 hours, I heard nothing back. I e-mailed again a few days later. This time, I received a short little message back that said "the cabana you have requested is not available." Nothing else. Since I was e-mailing two months before my trip, I was a little surprised by the unavailability. I e-mailed back asking what cabanas, if any, were available (information that any good customer service agent would have offered me without my asking). I then received an e-mail that said ALL cabanas were available, I just wasn't allowed to reserve them more than 30 days in advance. (Their website says you should make reservations AT LEAST 30 days in advance, which implies the more advance notice the better, but apparently not.) No offer of additional assistance was made. So I made a mental note to e-mail again in a couple of weeks. 25 days before my trip I e-mail again requesting a garden cabana. Again, I'm told that no cabanas are available, but if I'd like to come down to the cabana office by the pool, they will put my name on a waiting list. Obviously, they misread the dates in my e-mail and think I'm asking for a cabana that same weekend. Finally, I have my husband call the hotel directly. After speaking to someone in person, he is able to reserve a $250/day cabana for only one day of our stay. Shocked at the total failure of any customer service at a hotel I frequently stay at, I send an e-mail to Bill Hornbuckle, the CEO of Mandalay Bay. I get a generic letter back from Kim Cimini, Senior VP of Operations that apologizes for the lack of service and assures me that the hotel "consistently strives to exceed our guests’ expectations by providing superior customer service every day, to every guest prior to their arrival and during their stay" and thanks me for giving Mandalay Bay another opportunity to serve me. We arrive at Mandalay Bay about 4:30 p.m. on Sunday, June 30. The lines to check in look about an hour long. I have never seen it so bad in all the years I've been going to Vegas (15+ years). The people in line with me agree. They've never seen it so bad either. The front desk clerk says "Nope. Sundays are always like this. You should try coming on Wednesdays instead." (I have to wonder: if Sundays are always so bad, why don't they have a full staff working? I would say a third of the check in windows were closed.) We wait in line for about 30 to 45 minutes. Some lines are worse than others because the front desk clerks keep leaving their posts to confer with a person at a seperate area behind the counter. We make it to the front of our line. The front desk clerk checks our reservation, smiles then says she'll be right back and goes to confer with the mystery person behind the desk. When she comes back we find out the real reason check-in lines are a mile long: they have over-sold the hotel. They have already given away the room that I booked two months ago (for which I had already paid one night's stay at $389). Instead of the 1450-sq. ft, two-bedroom, two-bath suite with a dining and living area that I reserved (and paid for), they offer us a regular, 450-sq. ft queen room with two double beds for the first night at the "discounted" rate of $275/night and $100 food credit, and they promise to move us to our reserved room the following day. The front-desk clerk talks really fast during this offer, and I am confused. "You're putting us in one room with two-double beds?" I ask her. "It's two rooms. It's just like your reservation, but without the parlor," she replies. "Are the rooms connecting?" I ask. She looks at me like I'm dense. "It's one room," she says and then repeats "It's just like your reservation, but without the parlor." Huh? I'm thoroughly confused. So I choose a different approach. "How many beds are there?" "Two" "There are five people in my party. That's not enough." "We can send up a roll away." "Do we have any other options?" "Not really" Fine. She hands us our keys, doesn't tell us our room number or even direct us to the elevators. We figure all of this out on our own. We get to our room, and the keys don't work. We sit down in the hallway and wait for security. When we get in the room, I fail to see how it is "just like the room we reserved, but without the parlor." If we had tried to reserve this room for a party of five people, the hotel would have refused and told us to book two rooms. We definitely exceed the room's maximum capacity. We call and complain. They discount the room further (to $109/night, the more realistic rate for this room) and swear that our transition to our new room tomorrow will be flawless. The next day I have to rise by 8:00 a.m. to make sure that I check in with the cabana folks before 9:30 or, I'm told, they will give our cabana away. The pool opens at 8:00 a.m., but the cabana office does not open until 9:00. I get down to the pool by 8:45 a.m., and there is another long line for me to wait in. When the cabana office opens, a huge, tall gentlemen announces that everyone who has a reservation should stay put. Everyone who wants to be put on a waiting list should line up behind him. There is a mad dash by the non-reservation people to get in the new line, and I felt bad for the people who had come down at 8:00 a.m. so that they could be first in line only to be snaked by those people lucky enough to be standing closer to the new line location. I wait patiently for my turn to check in. My turn comes, and the tall man skips right over me and starts helping the couple behind me. The husband of the couple apologizes profusely to me after being helped and points out to the tall man that I am next. The tall man is not so apologetic for skipping over me. By now, I had no confidence that they would actually find our cabana reservation, but they had it, and it was nice to have a place to relax by the pool. If you didn't have a cabana, finding a place to sit at the pool past 9:00 a.m. is next to impossible. It would have been nice to have a cabana for the next day, but I didn't see the use of waking up early again only to wait in line and be declined. I ask my husband, Do you think it's possible, we're already on a waiting list? Ms. Cimini, the Senior VP of Operations, did say in her letter (and I quote directly) "You may be confident that every effort is also being put forth to fulfill your request for a cabana or private bungalow on Tuesday, July 1. " So we ask. Of course, we're not on any waiting list, and no one can put us on a waiting list until the 9:00 a.m. cabana frenzy each morning. I guess "every effort" means "no effort what so ever" in Mandalay Bay speak. Check-out is at 11:00 a.m. each day. By 1:00 p.m., no one has called us regarding our new room, so my husband calls the front desk. He's told the room is still occupied and they'll call us when it's ready. By 4:00 p.m., we've been at the pool all day and need to go back to our room and get ready for a show. No one has called us, and the prospect of all five of us fighting for the single bathroom in our single, tiny room is depressing. So much for a flawless transition. We call the front desk again. The person we speak to can find no record of our transfer, but miraculously finds a suite that's available. It is not the 1500 3X that I reserved (and paid for one night), but is a 1500 2X, which means it has only two king beds, but they agree to provide a rollaway bed at no charge (the 15002X is priced at $310/night vs. $369/night for the 15003X). We are told we can transfer immediately, and our old keys should work on the new room. They don't. We sit out in the hallway again waiting for security. We get into the room and try to call down to the front desk for new keys. Only one of the 3 phones in the room work. Other than that, the suite is nice. All in all, it is a great value for the money. Finally in our new room, we enjoy the rest of our stay. Until check out. The line to checkout on Wednesday, July 2 was about 20 people deep. We can't do Express Check-out, because we have to hand the front desk clerk our credit slip to get our $100 food credit. I notice that most of the people checking out have credit slips. When I get to the front, I'm told the $100 credit is only good for specific food locations (their buffet, room service or Raffles Cafe). It does not include food service by the pool, which is where we thought we were spending it. Finally, however, after three days of obtuse employees who were sometimes deliberatly misleading and almost always unhelpful, the front desk clerk actually says "let me see what I can do" and helps me out. Despite the restrictions on the credit, she credits our meal by the pool and also the two movies that we rented, earning the Mandalay Bay one star for this review. IN SUMMARY: As a guest, I felt like I was punished for being nice. (and after reading another reviewers comments, I suspect those of us who took advantage of the "floating holiday" promotion may have been targeted as "less important" guests.) The only way to get what you wanted (and sometimes paid for!) at this hotel was to do all the work -- calling and e-mailing again and again -- and finally to get angry and mean. It made what I was hoping would be a luxurious, relaxing vacation into something stressfull and exhausting.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as before”
Reviews.Author: JayjayOklahoma
Reviews.Content: We have been vacationing in Vegas for over 18 years and have stayed at most of the strip hotels. Our favorite has always been THE Hotel for the rooms and the parking garage located next to the elevator. This time we noticed a shift not only in the attitudes of the staff at THE Hotel but in Vegas generally. No longer is the customer always right, no longer do you feel welcome anywhere. Example, I requested a female masseuse at THE Spa and they gave me a male. When I objected, they essentially said its your fault we made a mistake. It took having to speak to the manager to get it worked out and she could best be described as surly. The Mandalay Pool is still a dreadful mess. It is beyond reason why they have not figured out that having people get in to shoving matches at 8:00am for lounge chairs is not a good thing. And don't even think about renting one of their overpriced cabanas, Basically those are reserved for the highest bidders. No one we met at the pool was happy about any aspect of it. Crowded, incredibly overpriced drinks, and debris [beer bottles, food wrappers, etc] everywhere. The room was fine although still dimly lit. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. Strangely, the housekeeping staff kept coming in our room while we were gone and turning the air conditioning up to 78. All in all, we are probably done with THE Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, OK”
Reviews.Author: charliekboston
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying I did alot of reading before booking this hotel. I didn't enjoy as much as I expected. Nothing was terribly bad, but in terms of service and polish, it under achieved. We had a LONG line at check in. As we got closer and closer to the front, you start overhearing peoples complaints about their rooms not being ready, and I was expecting the worst. Luckily, when I got to my nice reception desk associate, my suite was ready and she was nice enough to give us a Strip View. Small things, like a weakly flushing toilet, always being put on hold because of high call volume. Your property probably has over 3000 rooms. Hire enough people to answer the calls. I gave up calling the third day!!! It seems like basic stuff. Every time you get out of the elevators, there is no way to tell if you should go left or right. Then the walk from the elevators to the hallway out of theHotel and toward the rest of the property, has 2 huge columns that impede your view as to where your going, and progress getting there. The suite itself was very nice and roomy. Great contemporary decor. I hated that the temperature always returned to 72 degrees. I enjoyed the beach area. Make sure you get out early, or really late. Finding chairs can be challenging otherwise. Absolutely loved the burgers @ Burgerbar in Mandalay Place. If you feel frisky, try the buffalo burger, excellent.

Reviews.Title: “grass is always greener...”
Reviews.Author: yafman
Reviews.Content: we stayed both here and on the "mandalay bay" side of the casino last month since we were having our wedding in the chapel. the rooms are amazing and for the most part we had an excellent experience. i dropped one star because there were two maintenance issues (shower drain, scale) that should not have been present upon arrival, and there were issues at both check-in AND check-out because we had staggered, concurrent dates we were using to stay in both hotels (since we did not want to stay in the same room the night before the wedding). i will say that most issues were resolved rapidly and courteously, and Mandalay Bay is definitely one of the casino resorts in vegas you could stay in without needing to go anywhere else. the other side is probably more popular because the elevator goes straight down to the pool level, but i personally will be staying on this side from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Pools are AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: arizonateacher
Reviews.Content: The pools are outstanding! The wave pool is so much fun, the lazy river is a good time just floating around, and the other pools are clean and beautiful! The drinks at the bar are reasonable (for Vegas), a bucket of 7 beers is $35. The downside of the pool area is not enough lounges and chairs. We first got there on a Saturday at about 11am, and there were no chairs or even space by the pool to put down your towel and lay, so we went around the lazy river until a space by the pool opened up. The cocktail waitresses do not come around very often, so we went up to the bar instead. The room was beautiful! We stayed in a standard room. It had a comfy bed and linens and a killer bathroom with a soak tub and small tv. The buffet is terrible- don't waste your money. The casino is okay, the cocktail waitresses don't really come by all that often. We just sat and played video poker at the bar in the casino for comped drinks. The casino does have a fun upbeat vibe though. I would stay at Mandalay Bay again, the only biggest downfall is its service (that's why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5). The overall customer service in all areas of the hotel is the service, so be prepared to wait!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best xx”
Reviews.Author: Topcliff
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay here for 4 nights during our anniversary celebrations, this was the first time we had been to Vegas and from the minute we walked through the hotel entrance we knew we`d made the right choice booking here. The front desk service was second to none and when they realised we were celebrating our wedding anniversary they made sure we had a suite with an excellent view of the strip. Hotel restaurants were within Mandalay Bay and there was such a huge choice of where to eat and drink. Pool area was massive with a good selection of beds and fab lunch time eating spot. When returning to vegas I wouldn`t hesitate in staying here one again- we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great for large groups!”
Reviews.Author: palmtreesandcoconuts
Reviews.Content: 11 of us stayed here last weekend for a bachelorette party and a good time was had by all! Great lobby, though the elevators were a bit confusing. Take the left elevators for floors 2-25 and the right elevators for floors 26+. Be wary of the self-service internet in the lobby - the computer freezes and it's a hassle to get a refund (took me 45 minutes, as we had to call an outside service provider, but the front desk was very helpful). On the 13th floor, we had a suite with an adjoining king room - 2 bedrooms, a common living room area and 3 bathrooms in all, and we had the same configuration on the 19th floor as well - a perfect set-up for a large group of women, and fairly priced with everyone chipping in. The bathrooms are HUGE, almost a little bigger than necessary (unless you're a bride in a huge wedding dress). The bathtub is spacious with a waterfall tub filler on the side, and the shower is large with great water pressure/temperature, a rainfall shower head and very cool tile. They supply lots of signature amenities with creative names (THE-everything), from shoe-polish to shower caps and all the usuals in-between. The shampoo and conditioner worked well, although the scent wasn't all that appealing, in my opinion. Q-Tips, cotton balls, natural (oatmeal I think it was) body soap and glycerine soap for the face puts THE Hotel a step above as far as amenities go :) The bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept on. My first night there, I had to sleep on the couch - which was also extremely comfy. I called housekeeping for extra bedding and towels - took about 30 minutes for them to bring them up - not bad considering the size of the hotel. They forgot to bring up a sheet, but oh well. Big floor-to-ceiling picture windows give you an awesome view of the strip or the mountains, both of which are spectacular :) Regular coffee at the Coffee Cafe will run $3.00, other specialty coffee drinks run about $4.50-$6.00. THE Store is convenient, but a total rip-off - try to bring everything you need or buy it elsewhere on the strip. I didn't eat at the restaurant, so I can't vouch for that. All in all, it was a pleasant stay and I would definitely recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: macy78
Reviews.Content: Was great stay, would definitely stay again. Loved the t.v in the bathroom, the huge bath and the robes. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The shops and restaurants so close by were very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Property but Extrememly Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: MandFMom
Reviews.Content: I was booked into The Hotel at Mandalay Bay for a business trip that my husband and children decided to join me for. We had never been to Vegas and were looking forward to the trip. First the good, this is a stunning property. The hotel suite is nicely appointed and well-decorated. A one bedroom easily holds a family of 4 happily - and we have a 12 and 14 year old. The hotel does smell lovely. There is much less noise than other hotels on the strip and the air in the casino was clean. The pool area is a blast. You get the feeling you at the beach. Food in the restaurants is very good and service is good except for the buffet. Now for the bad. My flight arrived at 11:30 and I arrived at the hotel with my family a tad after midnight. I was the only person checking in. Apparently they gave away my room since I did not "arrive" that day (though I called and informed reservations that I would not be in before midnight.) We waited at the front desk for about a 1/2 hour for them to 'find' me a clean room. I was told that the hotel was fully committed but despite my late arrival they were going to honor my reservation. (That was a direct quote from the night manager.) When we get to our first room, housekeeping is still cleaning it. When they see us at the door they tell us to come back in 20 minutes. The room was a holy mess. I use the phone to call the front desk and I am placed on hold with the front desk night manager for about 20 minutes. He finds us another suite that is already clean and tell us that a bell hop will meet us there with the new keys. When we get to that room, there is no bell hop and now it is closer to 1:00 AM. When I go down to the front desk, the attendant meets me with a dumb stare and tells me he knows nothing of my situation. Once I explain , he defensively tells me that housekeeping told him the room was ready and he can't be held accountable for housekeeping's lies (another direct quote). He finally gives me the keys for the new room. As I am walking away, I ask to have manager call me in the AM, and he tells me that he will 'notate my account.' In the morning I speak with a manager who tells me she is stunned and this is unacceptable, so she comps me the first night's stay. I think that the service issues are over at this point. I inform her that the bedroom phone is no working and that the shower leaks water at an alarming rate and she tells me while I am at my meeting that day all problems will be resolved. We all go off for the day and come back at night to shower before going to a show. Neither issue was taken care of and after 4 showers, I am on my hands and knees using every towel in the suite to mop up the water in the room. I call housekeeping to explain and request the room be cleaned up and turn down service. I was told there was a 2 hour wait. We get back at 12:30 and housekeeping never showed up. A call to housekeeping is a waste of time (I am asked, "What would you like us to do at this hour?") A call to the house manager gets housekeeping and engineering to our room in under 3 minutes. The shower and phone issue were never addressed during our stay and we learned how to place towels in front of the shower door to absorb the water. Turn down service did happen every night after that. The pool complex is wonderful and service there is great. Drinks are very, very expensive. My one complaint here is the 'closing' time. The pool is suppose to close at 7:00 PM. At about 6:30, the teenagers with their aviator shades start telling you to get out. At 6:45 they start stacking chairs and moving personal items. The shut down of the pool complex borders on rude. They need to honor the 7:00 closing time and clean up after guests have excited the pool complex. I suspect management has no idea this is how guests are treated by this department. Room service is horrible here. Long waits for cold food. The beauty of the property almost makes you overlook the the customer service issues and I suspect one would love this property if they did not need to contact the front desk during their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not THE Hotel but THE Rooms”
Reviews.Author: grummelNetherlands
Reviews.Content: It all started out wrong with the unfriendly welcoming at the desk. We just checked out at Mirage and booked 3 more nights at The Hotel as it advertises itself as more non-casino and has a big pool. Moreover The Hotels has no real entrance its more a concrete parking lot entry:( The not-so-friendly desk guy was more concerned with the simple fact that he was afraid that we already went to our room which was not yet avalaible after we had to check out at Mirage(We were still MGM customers) and did not hand out a floor plan of the hotel. We only wanted to have a look at the amenities, a drink and than go to our room. There was no welcoming either thats suits a five star hotel! All over the world u get a drink or a cold towel or whatever. Here not even a: nice to have u here, which costs nothing. The big search for the pool began. The hotel has NO pool, you have to walk a mile in your bikini and swimming trousers either over the parking lot , being stared at by limo and taxi drivers or over the Mandalay casino floor, being stared at by gamblers!, to the Mandalay pool..... All the reviews are positive on this pool. Well we expect more in a five star hotel. The pool was so crowded during the weekend and even during the week that even as a The Hotel-suite guest, u have to search and hunt for a place to sit. The pool is more like a municipal pool. U have to grab the towels yourself and they come in seven colours off-white! (Too old) The beds are dirty and old too. After finally being able to find a spot, we waited for 43 minutes for a waitress to come by and another 15 minutes to be able to get two soft drinks! Thats BAD service. My friend had to get back all the way to the room because there are no lockers or guards that will look after your camera, creditcards or sunglasses, while there are a lot of stories that things get stolen. Talking about the this to the pool staff makes no sense either as they are not aware of the fact that u pay 1000 dollars for three nights for a suite and they remain indifferent... The pool with waves is probably not designed on safety as u get directed by four guards not to get too far at the back the left , the right AND the front, which makes the pool a lot smaller and unrelaxed. The lazy river offer swimtubes for rent at 20 dollars a day to hotelguests, there was one guy in a huge swimtube who bought it for 4 dollars outside the hotel. Sure the pool looks cool on pics but in reality it is not that big and every inch is covered by beds and the service is poor . Vegas probably doens't know anymore to cater to the upper middle class. Only if you pay extra for a cabana 300 -3000 dollars.... If not your certainly not at a five star hotel......and u get better service at a municipal pool in many places in the world. After a big discussion, we were really disappointed and almost left the place, the manager was so professional to give us a big discount. Well we rather had a cheaper and smaller room at Mandalay or another MGM hotel. Anyway we spent the money on drinking and dining at The Mix-Ducasse, Atelier-Robuchon, and Bradley Ogden plus a Elton John concert. The concierge was very helpful and gave us back our holiday feeling again. The suite was great and the cleaning staff of the rooms were great, but a hotel is SO much more than just the room. As a Vegas visitor I dont want to be able to have a look behind the stage/curtains. At night its a magical illusion especially at The Mix. During the day you look down on the terrible roof of the parking lot... So its not a room with a view either. My suggestion is to make a tropical lush garden on that roof or maybe a bigger swimming pool that has sufficient capacity for both Mandalay AND THE Hotel guests...

Reviews.Title: “Beware of false promises”
Reviews.Author: gary7272
Reviews.Content: While the property is nice and the pool area fantastic (we have stayed here a few times in the past), one must be aware that they do not necessarily honor reservations. Two days before our June 15 arrival, we received an e-mail saying they would not honor our reservation (made months before). We were "moved" to the MGM. They offered us a complimentary night at the MGM. The problem is that under their "floating holiday" promotion we had a comp night. They proposed changing our $119 comp for a $59 night. Of course, this says nothing regarding the serious discrepency in accomodations. We eventually negotiated a second night (they offered a "discount" rate at the MGM that was $9 higher than the going rate). We could use the Mandalay bay pool facilities, or so we were told. We were denied entrance at least twice during our stay (after a 20 minute walk/tram). They only let us in after repeated complaints to the concierge. We wrote a letter of complaint and have yet to received even a "form" letter response. The next apology will be the first one. As such, buyer beware if you book with Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool area”
Reviews.Author: Kaz_from_Manc
Reviews.Content: We had booked to stay at the Mandaly Bay, but were luckliy upgraded to a suite at THEhotel! The room was very nice, separate living area, bar, 2 toilets, tv in bathroom, all done up to a high standard. The best bit about this hotel is the pool, we really started to think we were on the beach! The wave pool and lazy river were really good fun. There isn't a problem with shadows covering the pool and sunbeds as with some other hotels. There is a beach cafe and mexican restaurant that do really nice food, and the cocktail waitresses will bring you a bucket of beers on ice for a discount. You can put all charges onto your room tab, so you don't have to worry about carrying money/cards around the pool. The hotel is slightly further from the main part of the Strip than other Vegas hotels, but this is not a problem with the free tram and regular deuce bus service (goes up and down the Strip for $2 one-way; $5 all day). The casino area isn't anything special, so we mostly went up the Strip to gamble and for evening meals.

Reviews.Title: “Room Stolen at Mandalay - It is not Hotels problem”
Reviews.Author: JOCA-BR
Reviews.Content: On June 12th my room 26-116 at Mandalay Bay was stolen. The thief took the SLR Camera and Lens. I spent my entire day talking with security, risk management, police and today I received a nice letter telling that Hotel has no responsability on that. I'd expect a little bit more from this type of hotel... Attached a photo from the hotel door. The investigation never said anything about it. So, if you gonna stay there make sure to lock everything into your luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: euro79
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - the room and the pool was fantastic. Would stay again should we go back to Vegas for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay at Mandalay Bay”
Reviews.Author: FountainRunner
Reviews.Content: OK, I have no clue what the other folks are complaining about on here. Maybe they stayed at another Mandalay Bay but my experience was totally different. Firstly, the rooms are huge, clean and smelled nice, which are musts when I visit a hotel. Secondly, the beds were comfortable and the feather pillows were a nice touch. Our view of the strip was lovely, however, since the hotel is located towards the end of the strip closest to the airport (maybe a mile or 2 away) you can see part of the runway. I didn't mind because it was fun looking at the strip and then watching the planes take off, lol. Thirdly, the bathrooms are beautiful. I'm not one to take a bath but once you look at the tub you just want to jump in and have a luxurious bubble bath. Fourth, the beach/pool was nice. It's not spectacular or anything but it's a heck of a lot better than half the places I've seen. They went through a lot of trouble to make it felt as much like a beach as possible and the staff worked very hard to make sure everyone was being taken care of. The one day I went it was packed and a staffer went around trying to secure lounge chai rs for everyone while a waitress went around making sure everyone had a drink. Now I couldn't imagine the bed linens being stained but if they were I'm sure housekeeping would replace them immediately. Speaking of housekeeping, I've never met a nicer professional cleaning staff. This is my first hotel experience where the cleaning staff are happy to clean. They were literally at our door like clockwork throughout our stay asking when they could come in to clean - no lie. Oh, and the towels. I'm usually at the first desk begging for a clean decent towel - not at Mandalay Bay. While the towels aren't heaven soft or super luxurious, as is the case with most hotels these days, we had enough towels to last us two whole days without requesting replacements. So you couldn't imagine my shock when I looked under the sink and discovered extra towels. I nearly fell over. I was at a lost as to how I could use so many towels. The large flat screen plasma TV in the room was nice, but I was furious that there were not a single movie channel. I'm just accustomed to having at least one movie channel at any hotel I stay at but I guess this being Las Vegas they don't expect guests to be in their room watching movies. I didn't get a chance to eat at their buffet but my friend wouldn't shut up the whole time about how excellent the food was. We did eat at Red White Blue and enjoyed the food. It must be a popular place too because most times we walked by there was a line out the door. My friend also went to the Rumjungle and kept saying how it was a very cool place. The hotel casino area is very tastefully done and more relaxed than the other casinos on the strip. Compared to the other hotels and casinos Mandalay Bay is definitely the best. I couldn't stand all the crowds, noise, smoke and hype of the other places. Due to it's location at the Southern end of the strip you don't have to deal with the crap that comes along with the other hotels. No gridlock surrounding the hotel, no loud drunken folk, no nonsense. At the end of each day when I was done visiting each of the other places I was happy to return to the peace and quiet at Mandalay Bay. At first I was disappointed I wasn't staying at TheHotel until I discovered how overrated it is - very overrated. And no, I'm not some old geezer either. My friend and I are both young crazy guys in our 20s who thought we made a very bad choice picking this hotel when we first walked in but now can't stop raving about how much we loved our stay. We both agreed that if we go back to Las Vegas we're staying here again. Sorry, I can't share my hotel pictures. I fell asleep at the casino one night and lost my camera.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean, modern property with awesome pools”
Reviews.Author: dbsanders
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite places to stay in Vegas. The air in the casino is somewhat cleaner than other places, and the property is clean, new-looking, and well-kept. I wouldn't recommend playing the slots here. Every time I've tried (on many trips), I consistently lose. Maybe the payout percentage is lower than other places, I don't know. Take the tram to the NYNY or MGM and my payouts always seem better. Maybe it's just me. The pools are the best in Vegas. Maybe 6 different traditional pools, with a giant "wave" pool and a lazy river pool that floats you around in circles enjoying the scenery. As with most big hotels here, some things are just a rip off. Want a drink by the pool from the bar? $12. Send a package from the business center? $15 "handling" fee. A beer at the bar in the casino? $10. Housekeeping sure liked opening the door of my room without much warning also, which was annoying. Twice. Even when we said "NO, we're in here", they still opened the door. Don't know what that's about.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky! :)”
Reviews.Author: LouLu1986
Reviews.Content: Apart from losing our luggage for the last nights stay here, and wearing our trackies all evening/next day.. we loved this hotel! 3 flat screen tvs, shower, HUGE bath, 2 toilets, king size bed, mirrors galour, 2 rooms, bar & best of all AMAZING view! The Mix is such a Swanky Restaurant & bar..loved it! Was the perfect place & well deserved for me and my boyfriend!! MIss you Vegas!! x

Reviews.Title: “TheHotel a Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: luvs2fishNV
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4-night stay at TheHotel at Mandalay Bay. We had previously stayed at Mandalay Bay but this was our first experience with TheHotel. For a hotel of this caliber there were some problems. The good: hotel staff, with the exception of one front desk person and manager, were all very friendly and seemed eager to please. Suites are roomy. Rooms were always cleaned before we returned each afternoon. The bad: Robes were missing from the room. Kleenex could not be found in either bathroom. Housekeeping was called and this was taken care of. Room service was ordered approximately six times during the visit and only 2 orders were completed without leaving anything out. Ex. muffin for breakfast was forgotten, whipped cream for fruit was left out, etc. The rooms are dark to provide a relaxing feel but I thought they were a little TOO dark to apply makeup, etc., even after turning on all the lights. The ugly: There was a definite smell in the bathroom and pool areas. It may be that Vegas is short on water and using treated water? I don't know, but there is definately an unpleasant smell that interferes with the sense of relaxation. It seemed that the hotel scents the air with coconut but even outside by the pool you still get whiffs of treated water that spoil the experience. My daughter and I both had stomach cramps and diarrhea and wonder if it had something to do with the water. Lastly, I left my purse in the bathroom by the pool and the person who found it called to say she returned the purse to the front desk (she used my cell phone that was with my purse and dialed the last number, my husband's phone). What a wonderful person! BUT when I went to the front desk to get my purse back the clerk blew me off and told me to go to "lost and found" at Security. I hiked back out to the casino area only to be told they did not have my purse either. I was very upset and emotional. When I went back to the front desk a manager was brought because I was crying. Suddenly my purse appeared and there was no apology given for sending me on a wild goose chase. As I turned away the manager said, "it was a pleasure". Huh? This hotel definately has potential if they can fix the water/smell problem and train their managers in customer service. The friendliness of the rest of the staff almost made up for the little things missed but I would not stay here again until the larger problems are fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Already off to a bad start...”
Reviews.Author: LVGamblers
Reviews.Content: Booked a king, strip view room in April, paid in advance, and got an e-mail a couple of days ago telling me I've been "transfered" to MGM. Apparently, there is a big convention and since I'm there for pleasure, not business, I'm easily moveable.I know I can fight this, but it's just the idea. What's the point of a reservation if you don't actually keep the room "RESERVED?"

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MsTalented1
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, the room actually looks like the pictures. The Hotel is connected to the Luxor and Excaliber as well as Mandalay Bay, so it gives you a lot to choose from. The front desk was very nice and accomodating. They provide wheelchairs (manual and motorized) at the bell hop. The decor is great, staff is friendly, and very quick to respond to calls for extra towels. The hotel was quiet, great selection of food as well as shops. Would definitely stay there again! The hotel is located at the end of the strip across the street from the airport. Pools are very nice, they provide towels while in the pool area, but not when you come out and no lockers. But loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at THEhotel”
Reviews.Author: Malevolent1
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful. The separate entry was awesome. The service from the check in to check out was flawless. We even got free beers from one of the housekeeping staff because she found them in another room. All the people who complain about the service...try being nice to people and see what happens. I think some of these reviewers have an overblown sense of entitlement. Just because your a guest does not mean you can treat people poorly. I lost my wallet in a cab one night, and within an hour I got it back with help from the security staff at Mandalay Bay/THEhotel. The money was gone, but everything else was intact. ALWAYS REMEMBER THE CAB # AND THE CAB COMPANY. The pool, while underutilized by our group, was really cool. The wave pool is a nice touch, but the lazy river is really fun. If you catch the right span you really move fast, with or without an innertube. The decor is really low key, but it is also very consistent and upkept very weil. It is actually a very relaxing walk to your room. The suite was exactly how we hoped. The 2 bathrooms is a necessity when you have 4 people in one suite. We spent many relaxing moments watching a game having a beer and discussing our options for the evening. I would stay there again with no question.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT HAVE A BACHELOR PARTY HERE.”
Reviews.Author: THEHotelVegas
Reviews.Content: DO NOT HAVE A BACHELOR PARTY HERE. We rented the H Suite - 1674 square feet that holds up to 20 people. It comes with 3 TVs and a surround sound system. Just don't plan on using any of them! We had 14 people in the room (less than their 20), and at 11pm were warned about making too much noise. 20 minutes later we were kicked out of the room. DO NOT GO TO THEHOTEL IF YOU WANT TO HAVE FUN. PERFECT FOR BRINGING YOUR TODDLERS OR LITTLE KIDS.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience......again!!”
Reviews.Author: atlantacmh
Reviews.Content: This was my boyfriend and I's second time staying at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay. We were so impressed with our first time that we had to come back. We were not let down. We arrived May 26th at 11:15AM. I was prepared to have to wait a few hours to get to our room, since check-in time is usually 3:00PM. Not the case though. The check in clerk was EXTREMELY friendly, honored all of my room requests, and had the room ready for us in abot a half hour. We simpy had a drink in the lounge while we waited. I will say that the line to check in seemed a bit long at first glance, but it moved quickly, and there was an employee greeting guests in the line and directing them to the next available check-in agent. All in all, a good check-in experience and we were settled in our room by noon. The Hotel still looks and SMELLS GREAT!! The moment you enter the lobby, there is this wonerful aroma everywhere. Some people may not like it I suppose, but my boyfriend and I cant resist it. The room hallways are immaculate; occasionally you'll find a room service tray on the floor, but that happens in any hotel with room service, and housekeeping is quick to remove it. The room looked just like it did the last time we stayed, which is wonderful. Personally, I think its a very classy, well done room. The only difference with this stay from our last is that we had a king size bed this time in a corner suite, which was pretty nice. I agree with some previous reviews that the wear and tear on some of the furniture is becoming noticeable. For instance, our living room tables had a few chips here and there. I guess its a matter of opinion, but for me it is nothing to complain about. Any hotel of this size is gonna see some wear and tear, including the Bellagio or Venetian or any other classy hotel. Regardless, the room looked great, very clean, AMAZING BATHROOM with lots of marble, I loved it. Beware of the mini bar, its stocked with lots of nice liquors that aren't free, lol. The casino at Mandalay Bay still looks nice, as does the pool. The pool was still as crowded as ever, but they, its a great pool complex with a wave pool and lazy river. It's the best pool area I've seen in Vegas. Drinks are still running about $12 a piece for any frozen concoctions. I also found the waitress service by the pool very good this time. One other thing I will note, we went to the BATH HOUSE SPA this time, it was WONDERFUL!! We both had Swedish massages and were very satisfied. We will definitely be going back. Overall, The Hotel at Mandalay is a great place in our opinion. Very classy with that cosmopolitan feel, and its a good value for the money. We go to Vegas at least once a year, and I'm debating whether or not to book The Hotel again simply because I really want to stay at the new City Center complex that nearing completion. It will be a tough choice, but either way I reamin a loyal fan of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very nice, would go back anytime.”
Reviews.Author: psmconnor
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in May. Check-In and Check-Out was a breeze. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful in answering our questions. The suite with 2 bathrooms and 3 TVs was well maintained, very clean and spacious, king size bed was very comfortable. The bathtubs are huge and deep and very easy to float around in, would not recommend the bathtubs for children or seniors it would be too dangerous. We did not hear any outside noise or our neighbors at any time during our 3 night stay. The hotel was very quiet, did not smell like smoke, however it does smell like an air freshener but it wasn't overpowering and did not bother my allergies. The restaurant, casino activity and shopping mall are far from the rooms so they did not interfere with our stay. We rented a car and self-parked in the hotel parking lot, it was well lit and it was always easy to find a close parking space. The elevators were fast and easy to locate. All of the staff were pleasant and attentive. We will stay there again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: NYC-triptaker
Reviews.Content: You should not stay here, unless you want to engage in battle from the moment you arrive. After waiting in line for half an hour, my husband and I finally get to the check-in desk where we are told that we either have a choice of a queen bed or a handicapped room. Of course we had booked a king size room. We said that was unacceptable, and asked for a manager. The clerk vanished for at least 15 minutes and magically a king size room appeared. She was rude and incompetent and only spoke to my husband, as if I was invisible. Same issue when we called to ask for a late checkout. We were told no, asked for a manager, and magically yet once again, it became available. It is quite obvious that they simply train their employees to reject every request, and only to capitulate if the people demand a manager. What a joke of a customer service policy. Literally every person we came in contact there was just plain rude- and I live in Manhattan, so that is really saying something. And I've saved the best for last. When making the reservation, my husband asked if they would comp a cabana. The person said sure, as long as there was availability. When we arrived, we asked again, and told the same thing. The word "comp" must have been used at least 5 times in various conversations with VIP services, the cabana people, etc. When we went to the pool area, we were lead to our cabana that "VIP services had reserved" for us. We were not given a price list, a choice of cabanas, NOTHING. Lo and behold a $400 dollar charge appears on the bill. When we called VIP services, the "manager" there, Brett Jones, consistent with their wonderful customer service we had experienced thus far accused my husband of making up the fact that we were assured the cabana would be comped. He said that we were lying, and regardless, they reserved the right to deny comps to anyone at any time, so even if we were promised that it would be free, because he wasn't satisfied with our level of play, he was taking it away. It totally ruined our day- to be taken advantage of like that-we made every reasonable point that rational people would, and he was just awful. Sure the cabana was lovely, but we certainly would not have paid $400 for the privilege of using a little hut by the pool for a few hours. My husband called again later that day, asked to speak to another manager, and this person "split the difference" with him. So we were charged $200 against our will for something we were assured numerous times, by numerous employees of The Hotel would be free. It is simply not right. While the room and pool facilities were nice, there are other places to stay in Vegas where you can relax and enjoy yourself instead of fighting with the staff and being ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Probably a nice hotel 5 years ago”
Reviews.Author: Roook
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 5/27/08 at 11:30 am. My wife and I expected to be told that we couldn't check in until later, but no, to my surprise they said that they had smoking/king rooms available right now. The check in ladies were extremely nice and amazing, however that was the highlight of our The Hotel experience. We arrived up in our smoking room and didn't even have to light up to get hit in the face with a powerful aroma of stale smoke, but who am I to complain, I smoke. Next I went to put our valuables in the safe so that we could hit the town, unfortunately the safe had been locked by the previous guest and I had to call security to open it. The room was very hot so I turned down both thermostats and we left. When we came back, we noticed that the room was very hot again. I figured out that the thermostats where configured to set back to 72 (which was really more like 76) after a couple hours. This was a constant pain during our 2 night stay. Every time we woke up or came back to the room it was roasting. I don't keep my home at that level of heat and I certainly wouldn't expect a nice hotel that cost a couple hundred a night to dictate my comfort level. The final let down of the room was the bed. I woke up numerous times throughout the night with a spring in my side. The matress was so firm and wore out that we slept horribly both nights. The views from The Hotel are also not the greatest. We had a view of the parking structure and the Mandalay pool, but it was pretty far away and not really that enjoyable. I found the couch to be kind of disgusting. It was fabric and looked like many stains had been cleaned off of it. Also the chair for the desk was something that my cheap office would throw out in the dumpster. The tv was poor quality analog. I have no idea why they put LCD tv's throughout the room and have horribly split analog channels. Another thing my wife noticed was that the living room was actually smaller than the bedroom. We would have preferred more living space in the suite, as opposed to wasted space in the bedroom. Well, hopefully The Hotel will remodel their rooms soon. They are in desperate need. My brother visited The Hotel about 4 or 5 years ago and he said that it was really nice. My wife and I didn't agree on this trip, but would be willing to give it a try again if they remodeled. Overall, I think I would just rather stay at the Mandalay if I wanted to be South-strip. There was no fridge in our room, no high definition tv, bad bed and a gross couch. It really wasn't a "suite" experience. We didn't take pictures because, honestly we weren't impressed or planning on returning.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, slick decor, but not enough "vegas" for us”
Reviews.Author: vancouverkitty
Reviews.Content: theHOTEL was the last place we stayed on a trip to vegas that included 2 other hotels. it was a beautiful hotel, with very nice furnishings, but we liked it least, just because we felt like it was missing the vegas glitz and pizazz. it's much quieter than most other strip hotels and felt like it catered to an older crowd or business travelers. don't get me wrong, our one bedroom suite was beautiful and the price was a bargain for how nice it was... but it just wasn't our style. the staff in the lobby and bell desk were excellent, prompt and friendly. the room itself was lovely, we especially liked the bathtub and the little bar area in the living room with a sink and fridge. we also had a good laugh at how everything in the room was "THE" something. "the pen", "the toilet paper", "the pad of paper". very funny stuff. the view was the worst part of the room - we overlooked a parking garage. oh well. not every room can have a great view. that's not a deal breaker for us. and we certainly didn't pay extra for a good view, so what could we really expect? overall, if i was to stay there again, i would certainly not complain, but it wouldn't be my top choice, only because it felt like a high end room that could have been in any city. and when i'm in vegas, i want to feel like my hotel is vegas-y.

Reviews.Title: “High Class but room too dark”
Reviews.Author: stevew918
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here over the memorial weekend. The hotel is on the southern end of the strip. Very convenient if you have events at Mandalay Bay area. Otherwise, it maybe a little far to walk to the rest of the strip, although there is a tram to connect to Escalibur hotel. It might be because of the long busy weekend, we had to wait a long time for check in, and wait almost 45 min for the bellboy to get luggage from our room when we check out. Our was a suite unit with a living room, bedroom and two bathrooms. It has the feels like an upscale hotel. A lot of room also! We had three flat-screen TV: living room, bedroom, and even one in the bathroom. Cool. They also have one TV channel from Hong Kong TVB in cantonese. That maybe a good draw for some chinese. However, our room was kind of very dark, the furnitures were all in black. If you prefer bright room, better check the room first. Wonderful spa and massage that we can use at the Madalay Bay complex. The gym was reasonable size with adequate equipments. As a guest, we could use the "Beach" at the complex, with Lazyrun, Wavepool and so on. Too many people over the Memorial Weekend holiday though. Otherwise, it is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “I Love it!!!!Im staying again in july...”
Reviews.Author: chulosx
Reviews.Content: I Stayed at The Hotel it was great a pleasure. Room was nice and spacious clean and inviting. The check in was a breeze and you should use the video check out due to long lines checking out. The beach was incredible and not to far. I will be visting in July again.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel at Mandalay Bay”
Reviews.Author: MattLasVegas
Reviews.Content: I just stayed the weekend at theHotel at Mandalay Bay. Keep in mind it was Memorial Day weekend so it was quite busy. The hotel was great. The room was a two bedroom suite which was big enough for our family of 4. The pool was very very busy. When they designed this hotel the pool was only for Mandalay Bay, then they built the hotel but did not upgrade the pool area so it get very very busy and it can become hard to find a place to setup camp. The staff was incredible except on our second night after coming back to our room after housekeeping had did its thing, we found that our mini bar tequilla bottle ($50) was missing. In which we called the front desk and were not charged for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, needs some TLC”
Reviews.Author: worldtripper
Reviews.Content: Carpet in hallways is getting worn, and things in the room looked worn out as well. Overall: I like the Mandalay complex, THEhotel is more of a walk to everything at the hotel, but we didn't mind. Everything is a walk in Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, definitely would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: GtownHoya
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend and loved it! Thehotel is stylish with boutique hotel style, but the size of a larger hotel. We ate in theCafe for breakfast one morning, portions were too big, but the food was delicious. It's about a 5-8 minute walk to the pool at Mandalay, not bad to me, but I know that's a pain for some. Others have said the same thing...the pool area does get crowded. Gates open at 9 AM and there was long line when I got there around 8:45. If you want your choice of seats, get there early. There are a number of pools along with a wave pool and lazy river. Also, we had dinner and drinks at Mix at theHotel and LOVED it. It's expensive, but it was worth the splurge. The decor is impressive and the food was delicious. The view from the 62nd floor is amazing! My one pet peeve is that we paid extra to check out late at 6 PM. I went to the gym (not impressive by the way and definitely not worth $20!!!), came back, and I was locked out. When I went to the front desk, they gave me a little attitude, saying obviously my key didn't work because it was past the normal check out time, but I paid extra to stay late AND they had that in their system. VERY inefficient if you ask me! Despite that, I definitely recommend theHotel and will stay there again when I go back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated Stay”
Reviews.Author: nonentitygirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Hotel on business and found my stay to be quiet relaxing. This hotel shows Vegas' sophisticated side and I loved it!! It was nice sharing ammenities with Mandalay Bay. I hear the pool is the best throughout all of Vegas, but I didn't get a chance to see it. The Hotel adjoins to lots of great shopping and has an excellent spa. I saw algae on some of their fountains, but other than that, it was one of the best massages I've ever received!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: essjay
Reviews.Content: We had three nights at The Hotel and really enjoyed our stay there. A couple of minor gripes though ...... we arrived at 4pm and our room wasn't ready which we felt was poor as check in time is 3pm. The front desk staff were apologetic and gave us a food credit which was much appreciated. We ate at The Cafe that night and had the worst meal ever! Would not eat there again. Apart from that, The Hotel was quiet, had fast lifts, nice pools (next door at Mandalay Bay) and helpful, friendly staff. The room was excellent and with 2 adults and 2 children, it was great having a second bathroom. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room at The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucian47
Reviews.Content: Overall I highly enjoyed my experience at The Hotel. The rooms were spacious, well maintained, and nice amenities. The pool area was awesome and the casino was nice. Pros - Room was spacious with a separate living room and bedroom. - Everything in the room was new and well maintained. - The bathroom was large, with a great large bath. - Pool area was large and fun. Cons - Pool area could get crowded and it was difficult to snag chairs for a group if you didn't get there early. - At far southern end of strip so either a longer walk or a cab ride to some of the other casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Sexy Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: buganne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Hotel at the Mandalay Bay for my birthday weekend in December, and it was a fantastic experience. We had a suite, which was exquisite, with a large (2 person tub) and separate shower. The sitting room was also very sleek, and had a great view of the Vegas strip. It's at the far end of the strip, but that's not a problem because the hotel employees are very helpful directing you to the tram or getting you a cab. Everything was pretty expensive, but it's Vegas, so it's going to be more expensive than the mainstream. We visited several casinos while we were in town, and I really liked the one in the Mandalay bay the best! Friendly, prompt service and great table games going on. Also, good poker room! The hotel's pool also looked amazing, so I'd definitely go there if it was during the summer months. The club at the top of the towers was also awesome. Great views of the strip, cool music and a chill scene. Overall, I'd recommend it very highly. Enjoy your Vegas vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “TRY THE H SUITE”
Reviews.Author: petershaun
Reviews.Content: I booked one of the H suites for my partner's 30th birthday. OMG it was amazing! It was on the top floor with a panoramic view of the strip. I will start with check in... It was very easy and quick. You don't have to walk through a casino to get to the lobby which is a huge bonus here. The lobby and all of the hallways smell like flowers (probably because of all of the massive flower displays). No horrible cigarette smoke smell that I found was overbearing in every other hotel we walked into. The check in staff were very friendly. The lobby is very classy and immaculately clean and there is no horrible casino noise. As I said before the room was amazing. If you can afford to upgrade to the H suite, even for just one night, it will be worth it. The suite is 1674 sq ft and includes a big entry, a powder room, a wet bar with bar stools, an 8 person dining room, a sitting room, a tv room, a den, a bedroom, a dressing room, and the biggest bathroom you have ever seen. There are 3 giant plasma screens. The bath was massive. Easily big enough for 2. The shower converted to an awesome steam room. The curtains are electric. There is a central sound system so you can have sound in any part of the suite or all of the suite. The view from up there is amazing! It is a very comfortable suite. I guarantee you won't be disappointed. The hotel itself is beautiful. The grounds are amazing. The casino is one of the best we went into although there is no crazy theme. The pool is easily the best on the strip. The spa is beautiful but a little busy so not very relaxing. Now the bad points. I was on hold for over 40 minutes to order breakfast. Really not very acceptable especially for one of their penthouse suites. I didn't even end up ordering. I gave up after 40 minutes on hold. The location kind of sucks. You are right up one end of the strip. Was not ideal for the first time in Vegas... But saying that there is nowhere i would have rather stayed. If it is your first time it would be better to stay in the middle of the action at the Bellagio or Caesars Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Sanctuary In the city of noise.”
Reviews.Author: maxcarrie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Vegas for a total of 6 nights so for the last 3 nights we wanted a non casino based hotel. This hotel seemed perfect for our needs. First impressions were very good very masculine decor through out with deep natural tones. We were allowed to check in early(11.00am) we were given a high floor (35) and a strip view room which we had to pay $20 supplement per night.Rooms were very spacious very clean,bathrooms are well appointed with a huge bath and glass shower with seperate toilet. We had two queen beds and to be honest I was a little disappointed with quality of sheets and very standard bath robes and slippers. Even though the hotel was a definate sanctuary from the noise and glitz of the casinos after the first day it became very apparent at how darkly lit the rooms were even with every light on it was still quite dark. A massive plus point for he Hotel is the Mix Lounge on the top floor fantastic view of the strip and has to match the Ghost bar for wow factor we found it less pretentious than the Ghost Bar and always got a table on the outdoor terrace between 7-10pm before they introduce bottle service only. Overall its worth a look its very different from most hotels in Vegas a couple of nights stay is enough personally the Palms & Red Rock Resort are better.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: rayjay80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel for a 4-night stay. The past couple of years we have been staying a Caesars' Augustus Tower, but due to the current construction we decided to try this place. Glad we did. Thought it was great. Check in was easy, only waited about 5 minutes. And that was at 3:00PM. I requested an upper floor with a Strip view and got it. I told them I was concerned about the noise from the Mix club that I read about here, and asked for a "quiet" room. They gave me a room on the 36th floor underneath the Club's open balcony. So I was a bit concerned. But with the A/C on, we never heard a thing. From either the club or the rooms next to us. The Suite room was wonderful, but I won't go into great detail since the previous reviews on this website have given such a great description. Just let me say that having a living room separated from the bedroom was nicer than I expected. While the lighting was a little poor, we didn't think it was a big problem. We thought Housekeeping did a great job. We left the room every day around 9:00 or 10:00AM and returned around 2:00 or 3:00PM. The room was made up before our return every day. We never actually saw the housekeeping staff. That's a good staff. Our one complaint would be that the pool area at Mandalay is way too overcrowded. We stayed there around 6 years ago, and it was not that bad. This time there were herds of people everywhere. Many without lounge chairs after 11:00AM. But more people just kept coming in. After the first morning there, we decided to try the adults-only Moorea Beach Club. Worth the $50 entry fee they charge guys ($10 for women). It was a whole different world there. Gorgeous waitresses, a DJ, comfortable padded lounge chairs, a bar steps from the pool, and a hip, younger crowd. We went there every other day too. Tried both spas (The Hotel and Mandalay). Liked the one at Mandalay much better. Larger with more lounge chairs. The BathHouse spa at The Hotel only had 5 lounge chairs in the entire place. We had massages at The Bathhouse though and thought they were great. All the restaurants we went to in Mandalay, The Hotel, and the Four Seasons were incredible. But I will review them individually. All in all, we loved our stay at The Hotel and highly recommend it. It ranks well against our previous stays at Caesars, Wynn, Bellagio. As long as you pay the extra for the private beach club. The regular pool area at Mandalay is just too much of a hassle. Besides, even being at the Beach Club still gives you access to the Mandalay's wave pool and lazy river, the best features there anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury suites - but no 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: Megaflyer
Reviews.Content: Sorry to be a bit negative about my experience here but this is not a comparative review, as I haven’t stayed at any other Las Vegas hotels. However I researched as best I could with the help of reviews on Trip Advisor and this appeared to best suit my requirements. I want others to know what to expect to avoid similar disappointment. THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay is in a separate tower to the main hotel. Also housed within this tower on the upper floors is The Four Seasons hotel, although you wouldn’t really know it, as it has a separate entrance and public areas. The suites are beautifully furnished in a contemporary style, although the chocolate coloured walls make them feel smaller and a little gloomy. The Philips plasma television in the living room looked very dated and it seemed penny pinching and pointless that it be mounted in a cabinet rather than straight onto the wall. The large sofa doubled up as an extra single bed and it was very comfortable. However, it was very difficult trying to get housekeeping to make this up as a bed each evening. There is a nice bar area but contents of the mini bar are too expensive and it could not be used to store ones own drinks. No ice available other than through room service. Expect to wait 30 minutes for ice and 90 minutes if you want food – that is a total joke in what purports to be a luxury hotel. There is a second toilet off the living room, very good if an extra person sleeping on sofa. The bedroom had two queen sized beds – very comfortable but not exceptional. The television was once again built into furniture and was old fashioned (not flat panel). The bathroom was probably the most impressive part of the suite: truly large with an enormous wide and deep bathtub, separate shower cubicle and twin sinks. A novel feature that I haven’t previously seen were the lights, which when turned on were very dim and automatically gradually brightened, quite useful during the night. So all told the quality of the suite was very good and, apart from the televisions, would rate 5 star. Now I will explain why this apparently high quality property caused such disappointment. Firstly the sheer size of the operation means that residents feel totally anonymous. It is probably virtually impossible to experience five star service in such a large establishment and I expect this is a common feature of many of the Las Vegas hotels. The thing that had swung me most in favour of this property was the supposed wonderful pool areas. Well at first glance the pool areas seem impressive. The problem is that once such areas are filled with literally thousands of people it takes on the feel of a busy water park or a crowded beach (think Benidorm) with no escape from the masses of people and worst of all, no escape from the mindless, bass-thumping, mediocre music being pumped out throughout the whole area. There are at least five pools but even though one was slightly removed from the others and with fewer sunbathers, the same music was piped there to ensure it was utterly impossible to achieve any sort of quiet relaxation. These hotel companies are supposed to know their target customer, so I’m afraid this hotel is not aimed at me, nor a huge number of other people who want to relax in peace and quiet. Perhaps the idea that anyone who wants the excitement of Vegas could also want relaxation has never occurred to them. Having decided to forget the pool area altogether, salt was rubbed into the wound on my way back to the room when I spotted a lovely pool that was quiet and relaxing and music free, only to discover a sign advising that it was exclusively reserved for residents at The Four Seasons, admission by room key card only. So perhaps there is the answer: pay the extra if you want a true five star experience, because you won’t get it here. PROS High quality suites Wonderful bathroom Luxurious public areas Beautiful smell wafting through the hotel Free shuttle to Excalibur (short walk to New York, New York) Affordable rates mid week CONS Huge hotel – long walks to everything Totally impersonal service Everything very expensive Housekeeping incompetent at best Room service a joke Unusable pool areas – if you want relaxation

Reviews.Title: “family reunion at The Hotel at the Mandalay”
Reviews.Author: staceyvegas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Hotel for 3 nights, May 9, 10, and 11th. We drove in from San Diego and were confused as to where to check in. We received directions from a valet at the Mandalay Hotel who told us how to get to The Hotel. We wanted to unload our car and park it ourselves. However, there is ONLY valet parking. The valet allowed us to leave it at the entrance for "5 minutes" while we checked in. The hostess who checked us in was very friendly, but my father who was very stressed about his car was not in the mood for small talk and just wanted his credit card so he could run out to move the car. Also, when we first walked in from the parking garage to check in, the signage is scarce. It was frustrating originally because we couldn't even FIND the check in area. After I checked in, I appreciated the layout and minimalizm of the hotel lobby. My room was 60-804. I loved it. I asked about a smoking room and was told that I could choose to smoke or not. I don't smoke, however there was an ashtray and matches in my room. I never felt as tho I was in a "smoking room". I had 2 closets and 6 drawers. 2 of my family members stayed in suites and complained that they had only 1 small closet. The bathroom is the biggest I've ever stayed in. There were 4 places for the soap. I felt lonely staying there with 2 seperate sinks, large shower, a bathtub that was at least 5 feet long with jacuzzi jets, separate toilet room, and a mirror that every woman loves. My family stayed in 5 other separate rooms. I heard no complaints other that the small closet space in the suites. My children and I loved the pool area. 5 different ones to choose and all good! I love the theme of THE hotel. As soon as you leave the elevator, you have THE STORE, THE COFFEE BAR, THE CAFE, THE LOBBY, THE LOUNGE. The Cafe was wonderful for breakfast. Subtle lighting and comfortable chairs, food was good. The Lounge was used for us to just meet in while waiting for other family to appear. We were able to move the large leather chairs around to fit our group. We were never approached to buy a drink,etc.. I went into THE STORE and asked for the cheapest bottle of wine. The African American lady went through all the prices with me and helped me choose. When I inquired about purchasing a cork screw she told me they were in all the rooms. I had to call the front desk and was told cork screws were in the mini bars. I had no mini bar but took it from my sister who did. I love how you can walk easily into the LUXOR and from there into the EXCALIBAR. My sister-in-law paid $30 for the day at THE SPA. She went in the morning and loved it so much went back in the evening. This was my first trip to Vegas. I visited the Stratospere, New York New York, Excaliber, Luxor. I was impressed my the classiness of THE HOTEL. I would stay there again in a second. I recommend THE HOTEL. It's classy, subtle and lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Mandalay Bay”
Reviews.Author: gakowalyk
Reviews.Content: 08.05.09- Duration 4 days Flight- United I choose an early morning flight out of Canada/Alberta, with the arrival into Vegas at approximately 0800hrs (time change). The flight was quick/painless. Airport- Immediately out of the front doors, there are aggressive "salesperson(s)" hawking limos/etc. Quite nice, convenient, but about $80 for a normal limo(goes up from there) to Mandalay. Past the limo area, are regular taxis services, for the price of about $15. Choice is yours, either way it tis a quick trip to Mandalay(one can see the hotel from the airport on the way in). Arrival/Check in - Again, large line, but moved quite quickly, as staff coordinated the line into about 15 different service/check in bays. Rooms were a tad unorganized, as I was in a group of 4 total guys, and wanted adjoining rooms. After changing my room once, was able to have connecting rooms through the room doors which was nice. No real issues here, staff quite accommodating. Rooms - Vegas rooms! Plasma 42" television, safe, with plenty of room. The upper levels(34 floors) have awesome views, both in the day time and at night. Mine had a view of the airport/MGM. The other side faces onto the pool area. Clean, well maintained. The fridge bar has beer, with each being (?) $6, which is cheap as the bars cost $8-10. There are close liquor stores is that’s your bag as well. Hotel - VAST casino, with both high end black jack/poker tables, as well as the "low end". The low end black jack is about $15 minimum, with the higher end ones about $100 min bet. Lots of slots etc, no lines ever. The resort is nice, well put together, but friggin huge. It took me at least 2 days to understand the layout. The hotels are all connected, either through pedestrian walkways, or LRT/Trains. Mandalay connects to the Luxor(black pyramid). Here are the IMAX theatres, and of course more gambling. My issues was the prices of course, tis not like the Vegas of old. Food is pricey, even in the food courts. I wanted to work out at the gym one morning, but even there they charge $30 just for the drop in fee to the gym. Pool - Very Very nice, but busy. All days we were there, the pool was packed, and finding chairs was onerous, but was able to usually find 4 chairs in a row with a bit of work. There is the "public pool", and then the "private" pools. Private just means you pay more, then have access to them. There is one topless area which is hidden by walls. I think the extra drop in cost for the private pools is about $80/day. There is a good Mexican style restaurant just outside the pool, and a grill inside the pool with good food/portions(about $12). There is a lazy rivers inside as well. Plenty of lifeguards, as well as a nice children swim style side of the pool. The actual pool has a wave maker which is fun. Bars - I went to several, the best being Hardrock Cafe(10 min cab ride, $15). The Palms hotel has a cool bar on the top floor one should see, as it opens up on a cat walk overlooking the city which was awesome to see. Mandalay itself has several bars, which were also good. Went to the Moon bar, the Playboy bar(ashamed to say-ha, was cheesy), and the Mix. All the above bars were huge and damn loud. The only bar I went to that one could see others around, and be able to hear others was at the Hardrock(several additional bars within Hardrock). Prices in all about 8-10 dollars per drink. Flight back- delayed 1 hr, but hey, that’s airlines for you. There are restaurants inside the Vegas departure area, so there is plenty to do when leaving Vegas and awaiting your departure. *all in all, a good trip. Not sure if I’ll do it again, as I prefer the all inclusive Caribbean style resorts, but was fun.
