I am not a gambler though, so that was a bit of a waste for me, but my buddies were and they enjoyed it. **oh, and go see the Shark Reef exhibit, was very cool!**

Reviews.Title: “Way better than the others”
Reviews.Author: Snoopy_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from The Hotel. This was far and away the best hotel we've stayed at in Vegas (we previously stayed at MGM Grand, Bellagio and Mandalay Bay). The room and service were each incredible. We had our breakfast comped for all three days we were there for a small problem we had checking in. Everyone of the staff was so professional. But what was really great was the fact that we were literally only steps away from everything we wanted - Mix, Sportsbook, House of Blues, and Mandalay Place. On our previous trips to Vegas we were just so tired of walking everywhere and I had feared that with this hotel too but boy was I wrong. And the spa here (Bathhouse) is incredible. When we go back to Vegas this will be our #1 choice.

Reviews.Title: “Let me give you the lowdown on the 2nd best hotel in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: suegator
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an extra long weekend at THE HOTEL, Mandalay Bay and was "WOW'd" from the start. I worked for the Ritz Carlton for years and am a pretty picky traveler. So, here's my assessment. THE HOTEL only has suites which makes it the best room for the money "hands down" on the strip for this caliber of hotel. Valet parking is easy to access and puts you really close to the room elevators, no long walks through or around casinos. I'd call down before I left my room each time and my car was there waiting for me. The valets also give you a nice chilled complimentary bottle of water (most others do not). The room is plush, a TV in each room, wet bar for your snacks, a mini-fridge for your drinks. You can ask them to remove the honor bar items so you can utilize the entire fridge and not be tempted by the pricey snacks. Amenities include terry cloth sandals (one pair each for men and women), chenille robes, primo bath products in apothecary style jars complete with bath salts, to fill the enormous bathtub. The tub is uber- deep, like a Japanese soaker tub, big enough for two people to lie down side by side in. The waterfall like faucet fills the tub in no time. You can watch TV from the tub as well. Floor to ceiling windows to offer a great view of the strip (had to pay $20 extra a night for that but worth it). Good soundproofing, never heard a thing. Plenty of drawer and closet space. Housekeeping was spotty. If you plan on going out for the afternoon or evening, call down and ask them to make up your room. The pool gets rated highly but that only makes it the place to go to, meaning....big crowds. Even with the massive pool area and amount of chairs, the place stays packed from the moment it opens its gates. They have a ton of cabanas which are reserved months in advance. If you plan to spend the day out there and are with at least 4 people, pony up and get one, it's worth it to have chairs and a spot to call your own. Plus you can bring your own food and drinks and not pay $8 for a beer. But the place is clean, decent pool food and the wave pool is pretty nice, I have to admit. Bring a water noodle or blowup tube for the lazy river. Theirs are $25 a day and too big to use on the narrow river. Go to Walgreens and get a cheap one you can toss at the end of the trip. The restaurants range from fair to fantastic, do your homework before you get there. But for the money, I'd opt for one of the restaurants at the Bellagio or Wynn that offer outdoor dining or views. The fountains or waterfall (at Wynn) offer great scenery with your meal. Room service was boring, nothing special, portions are small (by in-room dining standards). The shop downstairs is much smaller than most other hotels and has a limited selection of food and drinks. There are drug stores up and down the strip that are all open 24/7 for supplies. The coffee shop in th elobby is a must since the Starbucks always has a long line and runs out of items by noon. Check-in was painless, I never saw any lines. The concierge staff were young and not very experienced. Girls that are size 0 are not going to know where to eat but they will know where to go clubbing. Yeah, its at the end of the strip but also not in the high traffic areas and easy to get in and out of if you have a car. If you have any doubts, rent a car. Every hotel offers free valet parking, the buses are super slow and taxis are really expensive. One taxi ride up the strip will run you about $25 on a Saturday night. The car rental is about that much for a day and you can bounce back and forth at your leisure. Overall, the only other hotel that is better is the Wynn and their rooms are smaller. This hotel is contemporary, trendy but not too hip and a nice boutique hotel in a big complex. Email me if you have any doubts or specific questions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: SunnySD1
Reviews.Content: My best friend and stayed at THE Hotel for a girls weekend. We were so happy that it was one of the few "non gaming" hotels in a good location. Room was spacious, clean and the beds were very comfortable. Room service was quick and friendly. Drinks at the bar were very expensive, but we werent huge drinkers so it didnt break our budget! If I go back to Vegas I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Huckle
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with fabulous rooms. The bedding is high quality and there is a separate living room area in each suite with a desk and flat screen TV. The bathroom is wonderful with a large tub and separate shower, double sinks and a TV! There is a lot of storage for your clothes. Elevators are plentiful so you don't spend a lot of time waiting. Check-in and out was quick and efficient as was the bell staff. The location of the hotel is at the end of the strip and therefore it was not nearly as insanely crowded as most of the other hotels and we enjoyed that. There is a tram to connect to the Luxor and Excaliber and after that a short walk to NY NY and MGM. Otherwise a taxi is the best way to get around and all our drivers were friendly and informative and rides cost between $7 and $12 depending on where you are going. The pools were my favorite attracttion at this hotel. There are plenty of them and they are wonderfully kept. Only criticisms are that internet access is too expensive ($1 a minute) and almost no cable channels-lots of hotel channels (silly). Eat at the Burger Bar, our favorite by far and it is in Mandalay Place-it was excellent and affordable. Have a cocktail at Mix (64th floor) for the view alone before dinner and then head off to your next destination. Overal an excellent experience and I would definitely return to The Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mandalay Bay, not the hotel I remember from many years ago”
Reviews.Author: edyang
Reviews.Content: I had previously stayed at Mandalay a few times over the span of 5 years or so, but had not been there recently. Decided to take the wife there and enjoy some poker and Mama Mia. My memory had images of Mandalay rooms being a bit more cheesy with floral tropical patterns on the bed and a kind of Hawaiian theme going on. Recently all the rooms look much more "trendy" and "contemporary". Standard is the flat panel TV. Bathrooms have great little amenities (although still lacking an exhaust for the toilet room), with a tiny LCD TV as well. Beds are on the soft side, and not up to par with Heavenly Beds of Westins, but hey, this is a mass market LV hotel after all. Room service was tasty as usual. Service was fast and courteous. Restaurants and shows within Mandalay ran the spectrum. All in all, I was pleasantly surprised and would stay there again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great once again”
Reviews.Author: Chux
Reviews.Content: Just got back today. Our second stay at Thehotel. 5th time staying at Mandalay Bay. Once again the service was top notch. We got there at about 5pm and it was only a 5 minute wait to get registered. Everyday housekeeping was on time and very friendly. The only thing that was a bit of a hassle was the walk to the beach (10 minutes) but hey, it is what it is. You have to get to Mandalay Beach by about 10am or else you won't be getting a chair. Bring your own innertube cuz it's better than paing $20 to rent one. The food served at the beach bar & grill was excellent value. I highly recommend this place for single people as well as for people with families. Easy access to TheMix as well as LAX at Luxor. We were on the 25th floor and we can still hear the Mix late at night but it wasn't too overwhelming. If you want some peace and quiet ask for a lower floor. Definitely take your child to Shark's Reef! It's well worth the admission. The Noodles restaurant was the most authentic Chinese restaurant that I've had in Vegas. We've eaten at the Chinese restaurant in Bellagio (Jasmines), NYNY(ChinChin), Changs and SamWoo in Chinatown and they were all just brutal. We took a chance with Noodles and were pleasantly surprised. You get a complimentary USA Today every morning. The tv cable selection also includes TVB and Taiwan Channel. Internet is $13.99/day. The Bathhouse Spa is definitely way more quiet than Spa Mandalay but the gym at Spa Mandalay is a lot more nicer and more equipment. The Bathhouse gym has no windows, just neon 80s style lights while the Spa Mandalay gym has open windows and is really bright. I think that Spa Mandalay is definitely better. THEhotel is also located next to the entrance to the Mamma Mia theatre, sports book, House of Blues, and the access to Mandalay Place-Luxor. There is no elevator in the parkade to get to THEhotel directly. You have to use the main elevator down by the parkade entrance by Rumjungle on the Mandalay side to get down to the 1st floor entrance for the lobby. We will definitely stay here again. If you're there for a convention it's better to stay in the regular Mandalay towers and save yourself the walk. The casino was very very smokey this time around.

Reviews.Title: “A Breath of Fresh Air in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: KAZ2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed at THEHotel recently for a short family vacation. I have stayed at several of the "better" hotels on the strip and I am partial to Mandalay Bay for many reasons- we decided to give THE Hotel a try because we were able to get a great rate for a suite, which was a must as we were traveling with three kids. When we arrived to check in, we were told that our room would be ready in about 1 hour, 2 hours max. We were waiting for more family members to arrive and had not yet eaten lunch, so we killed some time in TheCafe. The food was delicious and the service was great. We visited with family for a bit and after an hour and a half had lapsed, we checked with the front desk to see if the room was ready yet. They told us it would be another 2-3 hours! We had a wedding to attend that evening and this would have been just absolutely impossible for us...putting us in our rooms with our bags just an hour before the wedding was set to start. After some cajoling, they offered us a different room on a different floor (allegedly an upgrade, but looked exactly the same as the 'regular' room our family had) and $100 in credit for food/bev at either hotel. Fine. To make a long story short, the room was even further delayed- according to the desk clerk, the people before us had "left a humongous mess" (greeeeeeeat. just what you want to hear). As a result, they also offered to upgrade us to a "V Corner Suite" the following night. We accepted. Overall, the hotel is clean, elegant and a refreshingly quiet change of pace from your typical smoky Vegas casino-style hotel. You are not assaulted by flashing lights and dinging slot machines the moment you walk in. The valets are very personable and will try to address you by name and remember the details of what you are doing in Vegas that weekend (How was the wedding Mrs. so-and-so?). The bell staff was fast and efficient and friendly, although on our departure, they forgot to come and get our bags- we wound up just bringing them down ourselves, no biggie. The mini-bar prices were surprisingly modest- about the same as the hotel gift shop "TheStore" lol...which was nice. The furnishings were in good shape and were of nice quality. In essence, everything was as it should be for such an establishment. My one word of caution would be to avoid the extra expense of the "V Suite". We were switched a total of 3 times between the standard "The Suite", the upgraded "The Suite" and the "Corner V Suite" and there wasn't any appreciable difference. In each case, the view was equally poor/good depending on the window you looked out of (several were of parking lots and rooftop vents, a few showed pool, corners of the Strip, etc.) and all were furnished exactly the same with almost the same amount of space. In actuality, the smallest of them all, esp. in the bathroom area was the V Suite. Tiny by comparison...although you do get a nicer robe in the V Suite. Very stingy on towels and blankets for such a fine hotel...but again, no biggie.

Reviews.Title: “Grossly Overrated”
Reviews.Author: effinbadass
Reviews.Content: Wow! Talk about overrated. Where to start...hmmm... 1. I will start with check-in. Took 30 minutes to check-in. We had two people in front of us. I should rephrase that statement. It took 30 minutes of standing in line before we reached the front desk. After that it took an additional 15 minutes. Why? I have no idea. We checked in at the Mandalay Bay rather than TheHotel. The front desk person gave us the wrong directions to Thehotel. 2. The room was dirty. The bedspread had a greasy handprint on it, neither of the two 42-inch plasma TVs worked very well, the glasses in the bathroom were filthy and the light fixture in the closet was a small bulb hanging by its wires. The toilets are a joke. They barely flush their own water. I guess Mandalay is trying to save money wherever they can. The entire hotel is done in cheap plastic. I would expect more from a so-called 5-star hotel. 3. Why do they charge you for the bottles of water and snacks in the room? When I stay in an upscale suite that is usually complimentary. I guess Mandalay needs more money to purchase more cheap fixtures. 4. Now to the buffet. Lmao...$26.99 for some basic food? No lobster, shrimp, oysters etc... All you get are some cheap steaks, mashed potatoes, pizza, ham, egg rolls and rolls. Big deal! Stay away from the Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay. 5. One of the machines ate my $100 bill. It took 25 minutes for a technician to arrive. I even had to ask another employee at one of the desks to call for assistance. In all, everything is overpriced. The environment is cheaply done and poorly maintained. I would never refer to this as a 5-star hotel. My stay at the California hotel was more enjoyable. My advice is to stay far away from Mandalay Bay. Get a room at the Bellagio, MGM and so forth.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, bad service”
Reviews.Author: mlddrss
Reviews.Content: I am giving the Hotel only 1 point because of my personal bad experiences with the service. Overall the hotel is OK, although there are some objective disadvantages like the location at the very end of the Strip. Which means, you either take a taxi all time when you want to go to a different place like for dinner, or you walk for more than 20 minutes. I personally disliked the smell of the hotel. They use some special kind of perfume all over the place that put me off. Also, although rather new, the rooms (I stayed in 2 different) show signs of wear and tear. Don't believe what their website says. I reserved a suite with "enticing views". In fact they gave me a room on the 6th floor with enticing views of a parking space and a highway. I complained and, on the next day, could switch to a different room where the view was better, but far from "enticing". Also the switching was done in a very unprofessional way and required us to wait for hours and remind them 3 times. The views were important to me, because I got married in Las Vegas , so I went through with it. On my wedding day I made special arrangements, like Champagne and flowers in the room after our return from the Chapel. They ignored every single one of them -- so no Champagne, no flowers :-( -- and did not even clean the room. I had been down at the front desk in the morning and specifically arranged for them to make up the room while we were away and was told, it would be no problem. So my recommendation is to stay away from the Hotel. If you are looking for a really great hotel in Las Vegas, choose the Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, horrible staff”
Reviews.Author: Word_Traveler_8
Reviews.Content: THE hotel is a beautiful new facility with great rooms, but with our stay, that was where the positive experience ended. ~Waited in line 40 minutes to check in at 3:30pm only to hear that the room was not ready. ~Waited another 25 minutes in line at 5:30pm to get our keys to the room that was finally ready. ~ Rented a cabana by the pool in advance, which required us to confirm upon arrival. That wasn't possible, as the cabana staff never answered the phone or returned calls. Funny thing, on one call we were put on hold, so we put the call on speaker and just watched tv for 45 minutes with nobody ever picking up. ~We had the screaming kids that banged on the walls at 3am in the room next to us. Called the desk and nothing were told that they couldn't do anything. Asked to move the next day and were basically told that it was our problem. Its nice to pay for a room for 2 nights and not get to sleep. In sum, great physical property, but the service and attention to the guest that you would expect is just not there at all. You'll be better off at pretty much any other strip hotel - we moved to Bellagio after 2 nights just so we could get some sleep. In my opinion, stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little yuppie-ish...but excellent”
Reviews.Author: lovedcostarica
Reviews.Content: We took our 2 little kids with us and got upgraded for free to the H suite. There was alot of 20-30 year olds with no kids. Granted, Las Vegas is not a great place to take kids. The beach club is crazy with loud music and tons of people. We went the next day at 9am with the kids and it was great. It smells so good in the hotel- they must put some sort of purfume in the air ducts. The rooms are new, comfy, and roomy. It is a bit of a trek through the casino to get to the beach club, but worthwhile. We go to Vegas 2 times per year and have been going for the last 10 years. This is the only hotel we will go to again. It is that good.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tawny07
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay. I had seen an advertised special for this hotel on a travel website and since we had always wanted to check out the pool area at Mandalay Bay, we decided to stay here for one night. We had excellent service from everyone we came in contact with. The valet and bellman were very prompt on both arrival and departure. The gentleman at the front desk was quick and efficient. Our king bed room wasn't ready when we checked in as it was before 3:00 but he set us up in a double queen room so we could check in right away and get to the pool. The suite was large and spacious with a 1/2 bath right inside the door, a wet bar in the living room, DVD player, large screen plasma TV, couch, desk, etc in the living room. The bedroom was beautiful. It had two queen beds done up in satin comforters with many beautiful pillows, lots of storage room and an in-room safe. There were a couple of stains on one of the comforters and there was a hole in the wall behind the door that entered the bedroom. These were the only issues with the room. The bathroom had a toilet in a separate area, a large shower, nice big deep soaking tub, lots of amenities, etc. We both thought the suite was very comfortable and beautifully done. The beds were very comfortable, and we didn't hear any noise from anywhere during our stay. We would definitely stay again for the right price!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room and service”
Reviews.Author: DukefanNY
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine and I visited Las Vegas for the first time this past December and opted to stay here. The young lady who checked us in was very friendly (always smiling) and was very informative. Our rooms were spacious, very clean and offered a nice view. Nice views as well. There were plenty of dining options and "eat we did". Overall we had a great time and enjoyed the hotel. Thanks for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shuluv
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous suite with plasma tv's. Magnificant views of the strip. Quite expensive but has a great pool area which is needed when staying for a few days. Trendy bar at the top with again brilliant views.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Main Drag, but Loads of Comfort”
Reviews.Author: DNewYork
Reviews.Content: Staying at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay is a very comfortable experience. This is Vegas, so this is not going to be quiet elegance, but The Hotel gives in ways that many Vegas properties do not. The Service--Not so much here. The only hotel in LV that seems keen on service is the Four Seasons. Here we find business as usual. Rushed staff, little attention to detail, and perfunctory treatment all around. Now, let's be clear, I was not abused by anyone, but nobody went out of their way. The Environment--The lobby has a very strange layout. It is as if the architects wanted to create a maze, rather than a clear sense of space. That being said, there is marble everywhere and unlike gaudier properties (pace, The Venetian), there is some understatement here, which I liked. Also, the lobby has some terrific art. Great prints by folks such as Richard Serra, Jasper Johns, and Robert Rauschenberg. I especially like the two huge Rauschenbergs printed by ULAE that are near the reception desk. The Location--We are not at the center of the Strip here; in fact, we are from it. Also, remember, taxis are a plenty, but an annoying expense in Vegas. The Room--We had a standard room, which is a two-room suite with a 1/2 bath in the living room. I liked this for its comfort and ample space. The beds were comfortable (in fact, even the roll-away bed was terrific!). The bathrooms were quite large and while three flat-screen tvs seems a bit much, it's Vegas, so why not? The Pool--Crazy water park fun, which would be great for kids. The Gym--Small, cramped, and expensive! Yes, plenty of equipment, but we need some of the tvs from the guest rooms in this space! The Bars and Restaurants--The food was tasty. I liked the breakfast in the main restaurant. Great corn beef hash. Concierge--They seemed to be there at their desks, but I was not sure what their job was beyond surfing the Internet. Overall--I would suggest this hotel for comfort and ease. While not centered around the chaos of the Strip, it is definitely a hotel that I will stay in again. The biggest plus here are the rooms, but don't drive yourself mad looking for other extras.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: darrenzo
Reviews.Content: What can I say other than this hotel is truly excellent! We arrived at The Hotel and the entrance was amazing, really contemporary and modern with a great fragrance. We were given a corner suite which was huge, it had a lovely lounge with bar area including fridge, a bedroom with floor to ceiling windows, a huge bathroom and another separate loo. The view overlooked the Mandalay Bay beach and the strip. There were plasma tv's in each room, giving details of the hotel along with the usual channels and music. The only down side to the room was the lack of tea and coffee facilities but this is usual for Vegas hotels. We went to the Mix nightclub a couple of nights, it was a stylish nightclub situated on the 64th floor, you got to it using a glass lift which offered an awesome view of the strip. With our booking we got free spa passes; the spa was a lavish place which you would pay a fortune for in England. All in all this hotel is special, for the amount you get for your money its well worth splashing out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ... Really Busy!”
Reviews.Author: hospidium
Reviews.Content: The Hotel at Mandalay is a superb hotel and the rooms are decorated and furnished to a very high standard. Plasma TV's in the bedroom, living room and the bathroom. The hotel is "very boutiquey" in style and ambience. I tihnk this hotel would be better as an independent hotel away from the Mandalay Bay as it's too busy and can't get a sunbed or place by the pool for love nor money! Also to warn anyone from the Europe or the UK .... drinks are not cheap and telephone calls are a rip off in the hotel. You cannot top up mobile phones for som reason and all the payphones don't seem to work. Funny that! 3 local calls and 2 calls to a US cellphone was $50! Overall though the hotel was really nice, but bit far away from the centre of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but there are better”
Reviews.Author: KathyDanRoyaloak_MI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at THE Hotel (yes, the toilet paper does say "The TP") from March 23rd to March 28th of 2008. We had mixed feelings about our experience. Part of the reason to stay at The Hotel rather than Mandalay Bay is to have an "exclusive" or special vacation. However, while the room was nice enough and the staff gracious it seemed as if you were just in another tower of Mandalay and not in a seperate enviorment. Same pool, same restaurants and nothing exclusive. Also, the atmosphere was very dark and sterile. It was nice having a suite and two bathrooms but if I were looking for somewhere special again I would return to the Signature at MGM. We stayed there last year and it has its' own gated entrance and pools seperate from the main hotel. Each room also has a coffee maker and microwave, which The Hotel does not, and a small fridge you can put something in, while The Hotel's very small fridge is jammed with overpriced mini-bar stuff. Overall, while we did have a good time we will not go back to The Hotel since we feel we can do better.PS-My wife says I have to add that one TV did not work, there were mising pictures in the bathroom and one elevator had the overweight alarm go off all week even though we reported it and no, we're not that fat,.

Reviews.Title: “THEhotel Power Outage”
Reviews.Author: dandbear
Reviews.Content: I stayed at THEhotel while attending a convention at the Mandalay Bay Convention Center. Arrived on a Sunday afternoon and while it took 35 minutes standing in line to get to the front desk to check-in I was offered a room immediately. The rooms are small suites with a separate sitting area with half-bath, writing desk, counch, chair, and plasma television. The adjoining bedroom has a wall length piece of furniture that house another plasma drawers and two closets for clothing. The bed was comfortable, but the pillows far too soft. The bathroom was large and included a third tv - not sure why one needs a tv in there especially as it was placed on a wall next to the vanity and if you were soaking in the tub you could not see it. THEhotel has a bar, bakery and cafe on the first floor - on the top floor it hosts a club called Mix. Mix has great views of Las Vegas and one of the more interesting bathroom designs I've witnessed. THEhotel is directly attached to the Mandalay Bay Casino and the offering of dining options. It is a nice oasis to not be in the casino when you are in your hotel. Staff were pleasant but did nothing out the way as you would expect in a higher end property. The Tuesday night of my stay the property lost power and I was stranded in my room for nearly two hours. I quickly learned that they were able to power the casino - but not the sleeping rooms or elevators. I was expecting a note under my door the next morning appologizing for any inconvience. That never happened - which is too bad they had a great opportunity to have a service recovery and blew it. When I made issue with the clerk as I checked out I was given a slip of paper with the electric company's phone number. On my last night after being on the trade show floor for 4 days I decided to stay in and order room service. I was quoted 45 minutes - 80 minutes it arrived and it was cold. They did replace it within 20 minutes and the charge did not appear on my bill so they get credit for that. Overall I would say that if you get the room for a cheap price - give it a try. Otherwise save your cash - the service levels and indifference is hardly worth the average room rate which is more than $200.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Beautiful, Expensive, Sometimes quiet/noisy, Spring Break KIDS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DebrawTexas
Reviews.Content: We booked THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay for Tues March 25-27, 2008. My husband had a conference in the Mandalay Bay convention center so we stayed in The Hotel because we had read such great reviews of The Hotel on Trip Advisor. The entrance to The Hotel is separate from the Mandalay Bay entrance but it is easy walking distance to the casino and other restaurants. It is also easily located near Mandalay Place so you can walk to Luxor within just 5 minutes or so. It is quieter in The Hotel but there were a lot of kids since it was Spring Break week. There was even a kid on a unicycle coming out of the elevator with the rest of the family. A freaking unicycle! What the heck is that about? The restaurants are expensive, but then again it feels like everything is on the rise in Vegas. I noticed a lot of activities and clubs did not get going until 10pm or later. We had dinner at the Mix one night, great atmosphere but the food was not that great. Very small portions and I had the Surf and Turf. The surf was halibut and the Turf was duck. The duck was marinated in a very strange sauce that left me feeling like it had soured. The halibut was very good but the brussel sprouts were tough. I gambled about $2000 the first day and went to the Player's Club the next morning to see how I was doing and maybe score some tickets to a show or something. They said I was gambling enough to have a LITTLE ( not all) of my food comped ( we charge all food and drinks to the room) but no show tickets. The tickets they had were to Mama Mia in the $110 seats. They said I was not even close to scoring those. That blew me away and I kept wondering the rest of the trip , how much do you have to gamble and for how long to get some $100 show tickets? Needless to say I did not gamble much after that in the casino. I just did not feel important and I was bored in the casino. There were tons of penny machines! I am a Dollar or Quarter slot player, and i was not happy with the selection. My husband played backjack and found the dealers to be friendly but were older than we had seen at other hotels. The cocktail waitresses looked bored, tired and had very little energy and walked by so quickly I just skipped trying to get a coke or a coffee. Oh yeah only Pepsi in this hotel, no coke products. I don't drink but I have a feeling if you drink you would probably enjoy this hotel. I saw a lot of people talking in small groups in the lounges and they all looked like they were having fun. The room was spacious, clean, contemporary, lots of great toiletries, a full size regular hairdryer, 2 sinks, 2 bathrooms, sitting room and beds. 725 square feet and we faced the strip. Excellent view. We checked in at 10 am and the room was not ready until 11:30am. Ask for a coupon booklet, great coupons! I would probably stay here again but would use the pool/beach and spa next time. Gambling was just ok, kind of boring. Lounges and restaurants look good if you are ready to blow some cash. It is upscale all the way. I think next time I will try a smaller hotel so I can be a big fish in a little pond.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT ROOM that makesup for location”
Reviews.Author: itcouldbesweet
Reviews.Content: Because it was my best friends birthday we wanted to stay somewhere very nice and different. I have stayed at many hotels on the strip and the Venetian so far is my favorite but i received a great deal on the hotel at $149.99/night (sun-tues) so I decided to book THEhotel over the wynn and the new palazzo tower. The entrance is adjacent to the parking structure and right next to it is the back entrance to mandalay bay restaurants and casino which is really convenient. Right upon entering there was this really pleasant smell in the hotel and the decor was very modern and chic. Woman at check in was older and she said the highest available with king was on the 7th floor (which i really doubt) and she seemed a bit surprised that two women wanted one king over two queens... no view but our room was right next to elevator. We really loved the room and not having to go through a casino to get to our room was absolutely great, plus the ambiance inside is very relaxing, it is quiet and the dim lighting around the elevators and hallways really set the mood. Rooms are a great size at 725sqft and i really appreciate the extra bath (toilet and sink) in the room right at the entrance in addition to the large bathroom with the tub that could comfortably fit two people... they even provide bath powder. This would be a great room to stay with a bunch of your girlfriends-with all the mirrors to get ready, 2 toilets, 3 sinks, tons of drawers for storage, nice separate lounge space with a huge t.v. and even a dvd player to pop in a movie (we brought our netflix). Really enjoyed the little extras like the drink stirrers, cork screwer, robes, slippers, huge desk doodle pad, copy of usa today, cd player, doorbell to room and do not disturb/maid service function that with a press of a button appears lit on the placard outside by the door. I really loved my stay the THEhotel and would def. go back although as i figured the location is a bit of a disadvantage being that we spend lots of time around center/north strip, but with a car its no problem since we just take the freeway when there is lots of traffic on las vegas blvd. Pool is one of the best in vegas. Crowded, but wave pool was amazing. Drove to Grand Luxe Cafe at Venetian over Raffles for 24hr dining.

Reviews.Title: “A worthy accomodation experience fitting of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: powpow88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at TheHOTEL at Mandalay Bay January 1'st through January 6'th. We originally visited Las Vegas in September 2007 and like it so much decided to come back for some more Vegas fun. What we liked: Room Layout: We've stayed in regular rooms at both Bellagio and Wynn, and neither comes close to the layout of TheHOTEL. Nice marble entry way with attached washroom, small living room with couch, chair, desk, wet-bar, and flat screen TV and DVD player. Super large bedroom with a very comfortable bed and tons of storage space (great for the aftermath from shopping expeditions), and easily the nicest bathroom of the three hotels in Vegas we've stayed at ~ and that's saying something, Bellagio and Wynn are certainly no slouches. The bathroom, much like the suite itself, is huge as our each of its amenities (bath and shower in particular). Overall, the suite layout makes your stay here very comfortable. Other nice touches included the ipod dock, lighted do not disturb and cleaning signs, and great smelling bathroom amenities. Room Location: Face it, with many hotels in Vegas you can spend most of your vacation walking from your room to the car parking lot. Ok, maybe not half your vacation but certainly 10-15 minutes each way (e.g. Bellagio). Not so with TheHOTEL. On average we walked from our car to our room in about 3 minutes. You wouldn't think this was a big deal ~ but overtime you really start to appreciate it. Amenities: There are plenty of good places to eat within walking distance. Its great to have a Starbucks on-site. The Burger Bar offers excellent value for money. Mama Mia is good value, entertaining, show. There is also a good convenience store in the lobby. Location: This is both a pro and con of TheHOTEL. The pro is that you can easily get to the hotel by car without dealing with Strip traffic. On the other hand, walking to the center or north strip from this hotel is a work-out, given its southern location. However, there is a free tram to luxor/excalibur which makes the rest of the south end strip hotels (such as Monte Carlo and MGM Grand) easily accessible by foot. What we didn't like: Cleanliness: Overall, the room was dusty ~ maybe its the dark lighting, or all the glass covered, dark wood, furniture, or the fact that cleaning staff have much bigger rooms to clean (and therefore one assume less time) but the room really needed a good dusting. There was also a stain on the comforter and a hair in the bathroom which took away from the stunning layout of the suite. The walk to the pool: The con of being so close to the parking lot is that your a good 5-10 minute walk to the pool via the Mandalay Bay's smokey Casino. The Lobby: To be honest there is not much here. It almost seems like an afterthought. On the other hand we didn't mind, it just meant we got to our car faster. Of Interest: We found the front desk staff were friendly. We arrived early (around 11 am) and they had a room that fitted our requests (king bed, non-smoking, strip-view, high floor) ready by 1pm. When we checked out they waived the internet usage charge which was appreciated. Overall: The good definitely outweighs the bad here, this is a worthy accommodation experience fitting of Las Vegas. We loved it. Given the right price, we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool”
Reviews.Author: Ozzietraveller08
Reviews.Content: Loved the arrival, someone welcoming you before you hit the desk, getting your details so the check in was nice and fast. The decor was perfect, and the branding fantastic, the whole placed oozed chic - very dapper I kept the CD supplied in the mini baras I wanted to be reminded of what a great Hotel this place is. It is located at the end if the strip, but I enjoyed the walk back, exploring the other Casinos as I worked my way back to the Fashion mall and Wynn Casino. At around $650, it was a little expensive, but a couple of hundred extra was worth it

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: mandrake144
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at "The Hotel" part of the Mandalay Bay and incurred a few problems. Although the room was very nice and the service was very good there were a few problems that the hotel should step up to. 1) They have a disco or night spot on the top floor (65) I was staying on the 38 floor and it could be heard, it was extremely loud. It stopped about 1-2 am in the morning. 2) The room had been smoked in and stenched of the smoke. I had to change my room the next day which I find to be a major incovience. They excuse was that they couldn't control the disco and they couldn;t control smoking or should I say they indivduals who disobey rules. Although I could not say anything further bad about the hotel because it;s very nice and the staff is very polite and effiicent. I think that the hotel should step upto the disco problem and open some other night spot without that kind of noise. If you can hear 30 floors below you can imagine how loud it is. As far as the smoking I do not blame the hotel I blame the rules, all hotels should have check out rule of one night charge of smoking in a non-smoking room. Just the threat will stop it. I am tired of checking to hotel were they use room deoderizer to tried to mask the smell. It's not the first time with me.

Reviews.Title: “Long check in and sick after RM Seafood Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Anyushka28
Reviews.Content: Net net: - had an awful experience with the quality and safety of food at one of the restaurants at this hotel (you can read more below) - check in was very long - rooms were nice - spa was average (over marketed on the website and brochures) More about the food and how Mandalay Bay handled the problem: We had a 2PM lunch at RM Seafood Restaurant at Mandalay Bay, and started to feel signs of food poisoning on our way to the O show. We could only see about 10 minutes of the show and had to leave to be really sick (throwing up and etc.) We hardly made it to the cab and back to the hotel. We ended up staying weak at the room all evening and next day until 12 PM. The hotel let us check out later by 3PM, but didn't do anything to compensate for the meal, tickets, and, very regrettably, our wasted time in Vegas (we only had one day and a half there). We didn't see a doctor when getting sick for 2 reasons: 1) we had to either try to get back to the hotel as quickly as possible or call the ambulance;-) 2) my mother is a physician and treated the signs of food poisoning "in house"

Reviews.Title: “The Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: bilandkel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel at Mandalay Bay will not disappoint you... My husband and I are frequent visitors to Las Vegas. We have a pact to stay at a different hotel each visit. We both agreed that once we had hit all the 4 and 5 star hotels, we will be back here! I believe normal check in time was 3PM, however, we arrived at 1:30 and had no problem getting a higher floor strip view room (which we requested while booking on their website). Our 39th floor room had a great corner view of the strip. The room was very clean, the couch in the living area very comfortable and the 42 inch flat screen tv was wonderful. There was also a 32 inch tv in the very comfortable bedroom (along with floor to ceiling windows). There was a 15 inch tv in the very oversized bathroom. Every bathroom has a very large bathtub, with a separate shower. The smell of the amenities (BATHE) was so refreshing that I bought a bottle of lotion at the gift shop. Since our stay was during the first week of March we were unable to take advantage of the pool, but we did take a walk around of the entire area. The pools were amazing. We ate at Raffles for a lunch. The service was exceptional. The price was a bit high for a lunch ($75 for two people), but that is to be expected at such a high-class beautiful establishement! During our checkout, we noticed that a $28 coffee shop charge was applied to our bill. We had not been at the Coffee Shop and disputed the charges, the front desk immediatly apologized and took the amount off of our bill. We would highly recommend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: greaser03
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I originally booked a room at Mandalay Bay however upon check in we were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a room at THE Hotel. THE Hotel had a completely different feel from Mandalay. It was a lot quieter and less congested. We both liked how THE Hotel is slightly removed from the main hotel yet still close enough to spend late nights gambling in the casino. The entrance to the parking lot is right at the entrace to the hotel and the elevators are a short walk (unlike the distance to the elevators of Mandalay). Since we rented a car, the location was no problem for us and we actually liked the fact that we dealt with less traffic closer to the hotel. The room was absolutely beautiful and spacious. One downside was that we had requested a king size bed in our reservation and got two queens with our new room. This was a minor setback as we were so impressed with the room to begin with. The bed was extremely comfortable and I liked being able to charge my iPod in the dock on the night stand. The bathroom was a nice size and we especially liked the flat screen TV. It was great to get ready while being able to watch the news or other morning program. The bathroom amenities were also a plus and I liked being given a regular hair dryer rather that a wall unit to use. The view from the room was great through the floor to ceiling windows however at night with all the lights on, the reflection makes it impossible to see outside. Other extras I liked were the daily newspaper delivery and the extra soft robes available for use. We both liked THE Hotel so much that we plan to go there again on our next trip in July.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Melanie3
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a few days in Vegas at THEhotel. We loved it. It's very chic and modern inside--a total departure from most of the other hotels in Vegas. We appreciated the details -- the iPOD alarm clock, the real blow-dryer as opposed to those terrible wall-mounted ones, the lights in the bathroom that brighten gradually. And who doesn't love having a TV in the bathroom? We also found the attached Mandalay Bay casino to be the least smoky and stale inside of all the casinos on the strip. The only con is probably it's location. It's basically one of the last hotels on the strip, and it's a bit of hike to get to the center of things. But that really didn't detract from our experience and if you can't handle the walking, there are a lot of options (bus, tram, etc.) for getting back and forth.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel is gorgeous!!”
Reviews.Author: Ani B
Reviews.Content: The Hotel on Mandalay Bay was so beautiful and the rooms were massive. The room I stayed in had a seperate Lounge area if you had any visitors and a seperate Bedroom. The bathroom was huge with a flat screen tv and the bath was big enough to swim in!! The Hotel had all faucilities needed, you could stay and not even leave the hotel! It had restaurants, shops, clubs and the pool or should i say beach/bay style area was fabulous. I had to wait at check-in as it had a little line up but it went quite fast and the staff were very friendly. This is a fantastic hotel to stay in and i highly recommend it to anyone of all age groups.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: everyshadeofblue
Reviews.Content: As much as I'd like to try out other hotels in Las Vegas, I will admit I'm addicted to THE Hotel. In less than 5 years I have gone from the Excalibur to the Luxor to the Mandalay Bay and now to THE Hotel. I've stayed at THE Hotel twice and am going for the third time in August. This is simply the best hotel I have ever stayed in. The crowd is hip and sophisticated, no screaming kids, no trashy tourists, no walking through a casino to get to your room, etc. I simply park in the garage and go right up to my room. It's a completely different type of Vegas experience. I prefer a low-key, relaxing atmosphere and THE Hotel provides that. I am happy going from my room to the car or the the fantastic pool at Mandalay Bay. I also enjoy eating at the Verandah restaurant at the Four Seasons (best kept secret - I feel guilty even mentioning it!). A lot of people will say "Who cares about the hotel room when you're in Vegas? It's not like you spend any time there!" I disagree completely as I can spend hours relaxing in the beautiful THE Hotel rooms. Everything from the bedroom, living area, bathroom, etc. is top notch. I don't feel guilty at all avoiding the chaos of the strip and relaxing in the hotel room. The beds are extremely comfortable with lighting that is soft and soothing. The dark woods are calming. The toiletry products smell great, especially the body lotion. Can't say enough about THE Hotel. You really do get what you pay for and this place is worth the premium over the Mandalay Bay. You can sometimes get great deals for this hotel and it's worth every penny. I don't think I can stay anywhere else in Vegas...which is a problem but also evidence that this is one of the nicest hotels for young people in their 30s in Las Vegas. Please don't bring screaming kids to THE Hotel...go stay at Excalibur or Circus Circus. Staying at THE Hotel leaves little desire to walk the strip and dodge the tourists with their M&M store bags and their strollers. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for your first Vegas trip as it's important to sample "real" Las Vegas. Save THE Hotel for when you are sick of the chaos.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: tbevis
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four day stay at THEHotel. The short story is, it's just wonderful, on nearly every level. My husband has already said he wants to stay at this hotel again next year-something he rarely voices an opinion (I'm the travel planner for the family.) That's just fine with me - I've traveled a great deal, love beautiful hotels like the Sofitel chain, etc...but few can compare to THE Hotel (I don't even mind saying the name anymore... :) As for the details: It is sparkling clean. The room begins with a lovely marble entryway, with an elegant half bath...then a generous living room, beautifully appointed, super tv and floor to ceiling windows. The hotel photos (and a couple of reviews) made me expect a darkish room with not-so-great lighting. In fact, with the drapes opened the rooms were simply flooded with light - wonderful to sit in the sunspot with coffee in the morning! Plenty of light through the windows in the evenings, too. I'll concede that the bathroom could have had slightly brighter lighting - but it was very managable. There's a fairly-good, lighted makeup mirror provided, which helps. But that is the only negative thing I can say about the bath - which was just perfect. Black marble, spacious, double sinks, sparkling clean, superdeep tub (the water spills out dramatically from a waterfall slot at the side of the tub - it's not a jacuzzi though - just a very deep tub with a neat waterspout). The toilet is in a separated room (which I like) and the soaps,etc they provide are especially nice, and refreshed throughout the visit. Attention to detail is great. Even the toilet paper had a tiny sticker at the point of the triangle, that said "THE tp" :) We didn't try room service - the restaurants downstairs were too convenient- the maids were nice and prompt with cleaning, as soon as we stepped out, it seemed. Front desk checkin and checkout was fast, friendly, helpful....we experienced none of the slow service described in some of the reviews. In fact, service was top notch throughout. We didn't wait for anything. As for proximity to things: I loved our location. The trek from our room on the 29th floor to the casino and restaurants of Mandalay Bay took about 5 minutes tops. If you want to head to another hotel, there is a taxi stand close to the THEHOtel registration area, and cabs were always right there. Very easy to get around. The Mandalay Bay casino is now my favorite in Vegas, because it's beautiful, easy to navigate, and I WON $2,000. with a $1.00 bet (video poker) - Wow - I'm an instructor in a small college - hardly a gambler - so this was sheer luck, and such unexpected fun. I highly recommend the video poker machines marked "Triple Devil" on the top-or something like that. Another thing I liked about this location - we could walk not only to the Mandalay Bay facilities, restaurants, casino...but down another fairly short hallway, lined with upscale shops, is Luxor (maybe 8-10 minutes walk from your room, if you don't stop along the way) so you have two hotels to mill around in without taking a cab anywhere. Yes, we will likely stay here if we come to Vegas next year - aside from all the above accolades, the price was less than any other one-bedroom suite of this quality in Las Vegas (we paid 169.-189. per night)....the only one to compare was Platinum...but after experiencing the convenience of being able to walk to two casinos and a total of around 18 places to eat (between MBay and the attached Luxor) we wouldn't consider a non-casino hotel now. THE Hotel was the very best of all worlds. My ONLY complaint was the lack of a coffee pot. But, in fairness, a wonderful coffee place was right downstairs, just across the hall from the elevator. So running downstairs for a cup of quality coffee was actually quite easy. I could sing its praises for days. I love THE Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Surprise....”
Reviews.Author: Cube44
Reviews.Content: We live in the Las Vegas Valley. The Mandalay Bay Resort has been one of my favorite hotels to visit on the strip for years. I find it to be a great spot for meeting up with friends, seeing live bands, and some of the other great attractions the hotel offers. For locals, it's an "easy access" hotel on the strip because of it's location, at the far south end of the strip, with great restaurants and live shows nightly. For visitors, it can truly be "one-stop shopping", in that they have a great mall (The Shops at Mandalay Bay), wonderful pools (including a great wave pool), about a dozen restaurants ( a few of them are truly world class), and amazing entertainment (the huge stadium venue, the House of Blues, and headlining bands playing by the Pool in the summer). One hint for visitors: I you want to have a night out and do the "Strip Thing" ...... Take a cab. The hotels look very close because they're so huge. It is a serious pain to try to "hoof it" all the way to the Flamingo Hilton, Caesar's, and the Wynn Resort. It's only about a $10 cab ride to get to the heart of the Strip. I think you should definitely try the strip thing for one night, just to see the sights and the spectacle of Vegas. Once you've gotten that out of the way, The Madalay Bay Resort has a ton of attractions that can keep you busy for a week. My wife surprised me with dinner and a suite at Mandalay Bay on Feb. 28th. We had an amazing dinner at China Grill, played a few poker machines, then just retired to our two-room suite and had a great time. The Hotel lobby was very impressive and grand, almost like some thing out a a science fiction movie. ( I promised my wife that I wouldn't mention Star Wars, oops) The room was very well appointed with reading material, soaps, lotions and other trinkettes that will have your carry-on bag filled to the rim. My advice is to order extra pillows BEFORE you get there or while you're checking in. Keep in mind that this property is immense. Anything you'd like to have brought up to your room can and will most likely take quite a while, so don't be too surprised. From a local who has "been there and done that" in Las Vegas, This resort is a sure bet.

Reviews.Title: “This is still my favorite hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: JLFERG
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying in THE hotel, and I have to say it is an oasis of quiet in the otherwise chaotic Las Vegas strip area. I love this hotel! The rooms are elegantly furnished and have the latest technology (iPod docks, 3 flat panel TVs per room). The hotel is quiet. The bath amenities are lovely--in scent, texture and the way they feel on your hair and skin. I have never been disappointed by this hotel. The staff is very friendly; the lounge is relaxing and makes great drinks; the bathhouse is one of the best spas in Vegas (especially for its size). I'd stay here again without any hesitation (and I wouldn't say that about most other places in Las Vegas that I've stayed--and I've stayed in a lot of the hotels on the Strip.)

Reviews.Title: “60th Birthday Celebration”
Reviews.Author: HawkeyeIn
Reviews.Content: Eight women stayed at The Hotel to celebrate a 60th Birthday. We had two women to a suite. Each suite had 1 1/2 baths, two queen beds and a separate living area. The hotel is beautiful with an attentive staff. The Cafe food was delicious and three of us had massages at the Spa at Mandalay Bay which I would highly recommend. Two groups were there with an American Express package. They recieved a discounted room price, free breakfast, and $100 credit to the Spa plus flowers and chocolates on their pillows at night. I wish I had signed up for the Platinum American Express card before I went; I would had almost made up the yearly fee. Rates had dropped after we made our reservations and hotel gave us the lower rates. It was easy to get taxi's to the other casinos because we were at one end of the Strip. The restaurants I would recommend is Japonaise at the Mirage and Mon Ami Gabi at Paris. I do not recommend Bouchon at the Venetian. Rude service, average food. Our dinners ran $60-$70 per person. Most restaurants would only let us use 4 or 5 credit cards which was a hassle with 8 women. Go to Mix at the top of The Hotel to watch the strip light up at sunset. The only complaint was the Hotel overlooks Hwy. 15 so we did get some road noise.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Stylish, Comfortable - all of THE essentials”
Reviews.Author: nosacrificeatall
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from two nights at THEhotel and definitely will plan on coming back. I've been coming to Vegas regularly (3-4 times a year) for the past few years and have stayed at the majority of the big hotels, so i think i've got a pretty good idea of the competition. Please feel free to contact me with any questions. CHECK IN/CHECK OUT: Very friendly and efficient, no problems at all. We (my boyfriend and i) were happy to hear we would be on a high floor and have a strip view. Our room (35805) was one of the standard suites and it was perfect for us! In fact, because the room was so enjoyable we spent a lot more time in it than we normally would. (On our first morning, we got a real kick out of watching from our room as the window washers made their way from the very top floor, allll the way down the building.) ROOM DETAILS: Huge flat screen in the living area, smaller flat screen in the master bath (it was wonderful to soak in the tub at night while watching mindless television!) and a "normal" t.v. in the bedroom. The closets are mirrored (in fact there's mirrors pretty much everywhere) which i though was cool. Lots of browns and subdued colors. Dark lighting (some of the lights are on dimmers). A very sophisticated and metropolitan feel to everything about this hotel and the room itself. Not a trace of smoke. THEhotel and M.Bay are great smelling hotels - someone else mentioned that the whole place smells like a spa, which is true! The common areas were immaculate - no leftover room service dishes, trash near the elevators were always empty, etc. It seemed well cared for. I also noticed that they played great music - it really fit the mood of the hotel. Bed/linens were very comfortable and i must say that THEhotel was the QUIETEST vegas hotel room i've ever stayed in. And i'm sensitive to noise, so that's saying a lot. The bedroom can be closed off from the rest of the room, so this eliminates virtually all noise from the hallways. We didn't hear a peep from our neighbors above us or next to us. (I started to refer to our room as "the bunker.") I got a great night's sleep here, and let's face it...how many times can you say that in vegas?? SPA/FITNESS CENTER: We did not use these facilities, though we did go up to check them out. The spa employees were very friendly and greeted us right away. The gym was huge and filled with state of the art equipment. One man was on the treadmill, and that was the only person we saw. Everything appeared clean and in order. The spa looked very elegant and i definitely plan on getting a treatment or two next time! DINING: We had breakfast one morning at THEcafe - service was friendly but a bit slow. Food was very consistent with other vegas cafes, both in price and quality. I believe my mushroom omelet was around $14 and included the standard potatoes and toast and was very good. We also ate at two other restaurants, which were in Mandalay Bay, just a quick walk from THEhotel. China Grill was very expensive for what it was - one chicken curry appetizer and two (weak) drinks were $55. Our server was a bit odd and his antics included talking and singing to himself...it was interesting! And our lunch at Red, White and Blue was pretty good - tuna melt and chicken mango salad came to about $35. Service was friendly. We also had drinks at MIX (on the 64th floor) which is always fun - it wasn't very lively in there but you cannot beat the view! Cocktails at Eye Candy were weak ($14 each) but the crowd was good and the people watching in vegas is of course, some of the best in the world. A couple of minor complaints about the hotel would be that some of our toiletries weren't replaced on the 2nd day - i assume they would have been if we had asked, so it seems like this is some way for them to save money maybe? A little cheap, if you ask me. We also noticed a few stains on the decorative pillows (not the ones we actually slept on). It looked like someone's hair or make up products, so nothing too gross. We just took them off the bed and didn't get too close. :) THEhotel was like entering a calm oasis after a hectic day/night spent in the rest of Vegas. We will most definitely be returning, especially once it warms up and we can enjoy the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Suites.”
Reviews.Author: RedGiraffe
Reviews.Content: My huge suite had 3 bathrooms ............... Can't really say enough good stuff about the modern well furnished suites with amazing views of Vegas through floor to ceiling windows. Beautiful reception area and reasonably quick check in. Great casino and lots of friendly cocktail waitresses with complimentary drinks. We ate at and would recommend : Stripsteak. Absolute quality steakhouse. Formal (sort of) Great menu but be prepared to spend a lot. we spent $600+ for two with only one bottle of champagne. Special from the truffle fries appetisers to the Kobe steak and gift wrapped chocolate popcorn. Shanghai Lilly : Top quality Cantonese food in elegant surroundings. Get a private booth if you get the chance. Mid range cost at around $150 per head with wine. Would recommend. Burger Bar - Pub type affair with amazing Kobe burgers and cold draught beer. Good for a large lunch. Low cost. Red, White and Blue - Corned beef hash and eggs for breakfast. Low cost. Verandah - good for a quick lunch or breakfast. Variety of food including a massive club sandwich that is enough for two to share. Medium cost. No real tips other than book the restaurants in advance and sign up for the casino loyalty programme as soon as you arrive. Try the outdoor pool and the lazy river. Shark Reef is a good place to recover from the night before. I have been to Vegas a few times and this Hotel is the best to date (much more up to date than the Luxor). Only gripe was the slightly cold hotel staff. Made no special effort to be welcoming or even helpful. On the whole a great place and I would stay again at some point.

Reviews.Title: “A nice looking hotel but never again”
Reviews.Author: LATravelbuff
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights in a corner suite and was throughly disappointed with the service. Where to begin? 1) As many have pointed out, the room service took forever, usually 1- 11/2 hours- no matter what time of the day it was. I usually had to be on hold for 4 minutes before anyone even took my call. The food was one of the worst I've had in my life and was lukewarm for the most part. 2) Housekeeping was very lacking in the cleaning department, and the way the room was cleaned was very erratic. One day, there would be a shortage of towels, and then the next day, enough towels but no replacement for used amenities (bath powder, conditioner, etc.). The mini-bar was never re-stocked. One day, the room was not cleaned at all although I left the room at 1:00 p.m. 3) The flat screen TVs were nice but the volume would have to be at max to get any sound at all. 4) Overall service at the front desk was very lacking and inefficient. When I was checking in around 6:00 p.m., there was only one person working at the front desk although there was a line. I'm not the type who is ultra-picky but I do expect service that is equivalent to its hotel class. I booked this hotel after seeing photos of the property and thought that it would be a nice 4-star boutiquish hotel experience. I left feeling as if I had stayed at a 2-star motel. Forget the boutique hotel experience, just book a room at the Four Seasons/Bellagio/Wynn. On a side note, I would eat again at the Mix. The view is nice, the food is very delicious, and the staff, thankfully, is nothing like the hotel it's in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjp1
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying at TheHotel and it was exactly what I expected after reading the reviews on this site. First the good stuff: Check in was very smooth and they had my reservation perfect. Off to the room...We had a partial strip view facing the airport. TheHotel suite was very large. It had a separate living room with couch, chair, desk, wet bar, cd player, and huge flat screen tv. It was perfect for watching the game with friends. There was a hallway bathroom as well for visitors. The bedroom was kind of small, but had plenty of closet space and had an ihome on the nightstand. Another tv was in the bedroom too. The master bathroom was huge. It had a seperate shower and tub thing, a two sink vanity, a flat screen tv, and the toilet was in a seperate closet for added privacy. I would give the actual suite at The Hotel an 8 out of 10. It was a good place to party and watch games. The reason I would not give it a 10 was that the room was starting to show it's age and felt dirty. Now the bad stuff: We had a suite on the 31st floor and could hear the MIx club rocking loudly late into the night. We usually fell asleep pretty late and the party was still going. It was very annoying when trying to get to sleep. The service was lacking. As others have noted, the room service takes forever. And when the food arrived it was cold. The service in the restaurant was also bad. In both instances it felt like TheHotel did not have enough staff. At checkout the bill was almost impossible to decipher with various $5 and $7 fees sprinkled in that could not be clearly explained by the front desk person. The location of TheHotel is at the south end of the strip in close proximity to the airport, but not much else. Everything at TheHotel is very expensive. Note that I expect to pay high prices at nice hotels, but stuff at TheHotel was over the top expensive. Next time I go to Vegas I will probably stay somewhere else. Somewhere that has a more central strip location and better service. TheHotel is a good hotel but did not live up to the hype.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect...”
Reviews.Author: Seanemac007
Reviews.Content: Nearly perfect. - The Look: Probably the best decor of any casino-hotel in Vegas, and I've stayed at the Wynn and at the Bellagio, as well as almost every other Casino on the strip. - The Service: We did not use much of it, but what we did, we loved. For example, we at about 3am, from our room on the 61st floor, we began hearing what someone called "King Kong"... some incredibly loud crashing/banging. It was only occasional, but I can honestly say that I thought about how similar that sound might have been to part of the building actually collapsing (not that I would know). After speaking with a very polite person on the phone, the noises stopped - at least until the morning. But there is a right time for everything. Also, check-in was maybe the easiest I have ever had in Vegas. - The Food: We ate at a few of the restaurants, this time and other times. All were very good. Even impressed with the coffee shop at the bottom of the elevators (although they were far from clean - they seemed like they were missing an employee). - The Room: Very comfortable bed, huge bathing tub... could have used a larger vanity/sink area, great view... windows were literally floor to ceiling, curtain buttons... nice to have, but what is the point of them being across the room and behind the TV/entertainment/dresser piece of furniture? Maybe by the bed!?!?! :) - Complaints: Only that I am totally frustrated that places this nice make you pay for internet still. WHY!?? In fact, it hurt them, and business for Vegas in general. We wanted to get online to look up the restaurants in the hotel and elsewhere, as well as clubs, bars, etc... and we ended up spending a lot more time in the room because we could not look such things up. In this day, this is just an embarrassing practice that seems to have taken over Vegas, but it is certainly not the norm in other hotels. It is such a frustration, I refuse to give 5 stars. That said, all and all, very nice place. Happy to have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Ronman100
Reviews.Content: I booked THE Hotel for my 22nd birthday in THEsuite as they call it and it was amazing! I actually came in early to see if it was available at 11:00 AM. I got lucky and got a high floor with a strip view. The check in area was small but they were very efficient in getting us all taken care of quickly. I told the girl at check in that it was my birthday, and she even gave me a few VIP cards for House of Blues. The room was very modern and everything kept up with the 'THE' theme. THE shampoo, THE sewing kit, even THE doodle pad, haha. All in all it was an amazing stay. I would definetly stay again. I recomend it to anyone looking for something ultra modern and doesnt really want to stay right in the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Room!”
Reviews.Author: Travelx2
Reviews.Content: THE Hotel is a great off-shoot at Mandalay Bay and the suites are amazing. We were in LV for the marathon, so the extra space, HUGE tub, two bathrooms, and separate sitting area were much appreciated. Contemporary decor, comfortable bed, very good desk (if you need to work/read the paper). Common areas of THE Hotel are spacious and contemporary. And the front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experiance at The Hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: racklatt
Reviews.Content: This is The Hotel, not a cheap hotel by any means. It's a great get away. I stayed on the 13th floor which had an awesome view. Very clean!!! Wish it had it's own pool the Mandelay pool was nice but pretty young. This hotel has a lot of class! Would highly recomend staying ...

Reviews.Title: “THE HOTEL at Mandalay Bay was great.”
Reviews.Author: 234rhc
Reviews.Content: We arrived at THE HOTEL Dec 23 for five nights. It was very busy at checkin (always) but they honored our request for a higher floor (26) and a kind bedded room, non smoking. When I had booked this hotel I did not realize that Mandalay Bay and THE HOTEL were two separate hotels, although jointly owned. The hotels share many features and the staff were very accommodating.We had two rooms. The bedroom area with adjoining bathroom with tub and shower and also a separate living room area. This was very convenient for my husband and I , as he is an early early riser and I am not. THE HOTEL had marble and granite throughout the room and three flat screen televisions. There was a separate powder room in the living room area. The sofa there was also a hide-a-bed and for $35 more plus tax per person the room could accomodate four persons. The first night there noise from below and outside was noticeabe all night from below (air conditioning?). Upon my request but the hotel moved us the next day to another room on the same floor but in a different wing.(No noise). The bellperson who moved us was most gracious and efficient. Distances are great which is typical in Las Vegas. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice suites”
Reviews.Author: Shoesgal
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 nights at the hotel this month. We liked the size of the suite which was generous - nice big bathroom and two separate loos! We found the room rather dark though. As others have said, room service was very slow - on average between 45 minutes and 2 hours. It was faster to go down to the cafe and order food which invariably took 30 minutes if that. We found the food very good at the hotel - namely the Cafe, R&M Seafood, and the sushi restaurant. Avoid the noodle place - it was terrible! One of my biggest peeves was that the gym was not free for guests! I have never stayed at a hotel where I have had to pay to use the onsite gym! If memory serves me correctly, I was quoted $30 per session! Neither my husband nor I were impressed. Though I liked the hotel, a more central location on the strip would have been better. I doubt if we'd stay at the hotel at Mandalay Bay again - we'll probably try the Wynn or the Venetian next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great food, not so great service”
Reviews.Author: drofnah
Reviews.Content: Starting with the positives... THE hotel looked super new... and super chic! When you enter, the whole hotel smells like an upscale spa... the music is great, the design is gorgeous... Check in was fast and easy, and the room is SPECTACULAR. We didn't have much of a view, but over 700 square feet of space for a reasonable price... I loved having the half bath in the living area. We had people in our room and didn't have to let them see our messy bathroom! The linens and the bed were great, and housekeeping did a fantastic job. For the downside: I knew from reviews before I got there that room service was S L O W, so I didn't bother to try. My brother and sister-in-law did, and it took two hours. I noticed on the menu that you can call room service and set up a time the day before, but I didn't attempt that. The BIGGEST problem was the service in basically all of the restaurants that we went to at THE hotel and somewhat in Mandalay Bay. The first day, we went to THE cafe in the lobby of THE hotel. We were seated and drink orders were taken. The woman who brought us our drinks kept bringing them, but they were generally wrong, and she often seemed confused. Our waiter was downright rude. One of my party asked for a diet Pepsi while he was taking our order, and the waiter's response was "You're going to have to wait a minute." Servers reached across the table to hand us items and we had to reach across each other instead of the server coming around to place drinks/ food items in front of us. When we asked to split our ticket three ways, the waiter had to come back and take our entire order. The whole time he was brusque and pushy. These may seem like small things, but when you're paying $25-$30 for lunch entrees you expect a certain amount of service. The food, however, was amazing. We experienced the same sort of service from the host and people who did the seating at the buffet. Earlier in the morning, the buffet was not crowded, yet the hosts were very pushy. "Hurry up! Come up here! Walk all the way to the back. Get on this side!" The food, once again was very good. I would suggest to arrive early. When my brother went on my reccommendation the next day at around 11, it was so crowded he couldn't even get to the food. The sushi at the sushi bar was excellent, but even that service was somehwat abrupt. Food AND service at the RED WHITE and BLUE was excellent both for dinner and for breakfast. Finally, the LOWLIGHT of our trip was our attempt to see the HEAVILY advertised "burlesque" show accompanied by a live three man band at Forty-Deuce. The show supposedly started at 10:30. At 11 we paid $25 cover charge per person... sight unseen. When we walked in, we were packed shoulder to shoulder in a walkway area. Around us were MULTIPLE sitting areas all roped off. When we asked about being seated ANYWHERE in the club, we were told the price would be $400 PER TABLE. We chose to stand. If there was a bar in the club, I couldn't find it. About a half hour passed by with no dancers, no shows unless you count the drunken bachlorette parties who continually got on stage as well as worked the pole. About 45 minutes in, one go go dancer came out... danced on the pole, took off her gloves, and left five minutes later. At midnight, we decided we were tired of waiting for the 10:30 show to start and walked out. We complained to several people in the front about the lack of show, all who seemed sympathetic. We then spoke to the manager who responded by saying, "I sent a go go dancer out..." Thanks a lot... so the six of us paid $150 to watch several drunk women dance. Overall, I would reccommend staying at THE hotel, but for service and entertainment, I would suggest going elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “THE Hotel for the Non-Vegas Type”
Reviews.Author: RedSabre
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Vegas to help celebrate a milestone event with my sister. I'm not the Vegas type (e.g. I don't like to gamble, don't like crowds, don't like smoke, etc.), but came to town for my sis and to satisfy my curiosity. Only after a few days in Vegas did I fully appreciate what an oasis THEhotel is compared to other large hotels on the Strip. Though part of the Mandalay Bay complex, THEhotel has a separate entrance and lobby that has nothing to do with the noise and smoke and congestion of the casinos which seem to front every other hotel. THEhotel has no casino, though Mandalay Bay’s is not far away by enclosed walkway. THEhotel is studiously hip and stylish, though unlike many other boutique hotels, the rooms are generous suites (the smallest at 725 square feet), not shoe boxes. It’s all creamy marble and chocolate/coffee brown accents in the public areas, and even more chocolate in the rooms. The rooms are dark almost to a fault, exacerbated by the fact that fluorescent bulbs in every single light fixture take some time to warm up to full illumination … don’t go into either of the 1.5 baths thinking you’re going to touch up your lipstick immediately, unless you don’t mind missing the mark in the slowly brightening darkness. Darkness aside, the only other complaint we might have had with our room was that it had no view whatsoever, unless you count the HVAC plant and the parking structure a “view.” I suppose that’s the price of checking in early, and I suppose we could have lobbied for a better room. But we just drew the curtains and moved on, choosing instead to enjoy the living room large enough to host 9 of us to watch the Giants/Packers playoff game, the beautiful marble bath, the comfortable bed, the wet bar, the 3 flat-screen TVs, etc. Overall, a hotel I would recommend to anyone who doesn't want the ka-ching of a casino hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Visit but getting a little tired”
Reviews.Author: Salthillhalli
Reviews.Content: Arrival staff - valet and front desk (Pia) were great. Public spaces are nicely appointed. Guestrooms are large with a nice contemporary style however felt the quality of the furnishing were inexpensive. The rooms it seems (for ours at least) have had a lot of traffic recently and are showing signs of wear. I would definetely return if the rooms were renovated, if not I would give another hotel a look first.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Every Minute of It”
Reviews.Author: Bronxite58
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Las Vegas and wanted to write a review of The Hotel while everything is still fresh in my mind. I booked there based on a co-worker's recommendation but I was a bit nervous after reading some of the negative comments on this site. As it turned out, my friend was right, we had a fantastic time. There was very little not to like. The suite was enormous and a good deal at the mid-week pricing. We found the staff helpful for those few little snags we did encounter, and we loved the hotel amenities. Perhaps because we were there at a relatively slow time of year, we did not encounter many of the problems that were mentioned by other reviewers. I'll tell you the downsides first: The biggest problem was housekeeping. They want to clean the room during the days, but we were generally asleep then.
