We would go out in the late afternoons and be gone for stretches of 8 hours or more, but unless we asked, they didn't come back to clean later. In other cities this might be understandable, but given the 24-hour nature of Vegas, they really should have 24-hour housekeeping. Other than that, only minor quibbles -- I booked a smoking single with a king-sized bed, they gave us a nonsmoking double, though the gal at registration said we could smoke and there wasn't any problem that we did. Also, if there's a way to pause an in-room movie, it wasn't obvious, and we didn't have a TV in the bathroom as had been advertised. We also wished there had been some cooking facilities in the suite; we used the minibar fridge and didn't get charged for anything (we took the drinks out and placed them in sight on top of the minibar itself). That's about it for the downside. I did twice encounter what seemed to be working girls in the lobby. But they also could have been extraordinarily friendly well-dressed hotel guests who really didn't have anything to do at 2:00 a.m. Depending on your circumstances, this could be a plus or a minus. Positive notes: We loved the decor, which some people might find austere. The main bathroom light seemed to start off dim, then get stronger, but there was a separately lighted makeup mirror that was an adequate alternative. The bed was super-comfortable, there was adequate closet space, and the shampoos and other stuff in the bathroom were fun. We found the staff to be friendly and accommodating. Room service was fast and efficient, they usually came more quickly than they said they would. The in-room meals that we had were fine. The restaurant on the main floor was good, and we loved the choices we had in the main Mandalay Bay and also the Luxor, which is connected. Special shout-outs go to Fleur de Lys and Fusia, two of the best places my sweetie and I have eaten, and restaurants are a hobby of ours. Maybe because we are from New York we didn't find the walking distances to be enormous. The Hotel is separated from the Mandalay Bay by a corridor of maybe 100 yards. I have to walk almost that far to get from my office to the bathroom at work. As others have noted, there's a wonderful sense of serenity that you experience when you leave the lively Mandalay casino floor and enter The Hotel, with its pleasant aroma. We had a car, which seems like a better option than relying on pricey Vegas taxis, although you could spend a pretty long vacation in the Mandalay Bay and never want to leave the property and its connected hotels. The Hotel had its own parking valets and a self-park garage that was conveniently close to the entrance. The valets were helpful and courteous. As others have noted, there are a lot of extra charges -- $12.99 a day for wireless access is pushing it -- but since the room price is a relatively good deal, you basically have unbundled services and you can pay for if you want them. Bottom line: If you want to stay in a classy, modern hotel that is one step removed from the frenetic pace of Las Vegas, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, spacious room but.....”
Reviews.Author: angelfish07
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at THE Hotel, M.Bay, Las Vegas. Thanks to United Airlines, we had a 48 hour nightmare of a return trip from Canada. We arrived in Vegas, the night before the Consumer Electronics Show, over 150,000 people attended it, so we were lucky to find a room. We called around, from the airport, most hotels were full b/c of the CES. Mandalay Bay had availability. By the time we arrived at the resort, we were beyond tired. We took a brief tour, but I cannot do justice to the resort as we were delirious with exhaustion. What I did see was very nice, check -in was polite, lots of nice boutiques. Our room was on one of the top 3 floors, I think 30 something, so our view was incredible.The room was spacious , 2 queen beds and a huge bath, 2 closets, flat screen tv, another in the bathroom. However, the room was dirty . I am not a neat-nik, I do not get upset with a little dust, but this was just gross. Most of the bath towels were yellow with stains, stains on the bed pillows,and the room smelled of B.O. ughh awful. We were too tired to change rooms , so we just slept ( in our clothes) , as we had to return to the airport early to make our flight. Even though the room was dirty, I might possibly give The Hotel at Mandalay Bay another shot- for the right price. I wish we could have spent more time there, but we were just trying to get home after a New Year's vacation. I would definitely have to research it more. I do love my space, so for 150/night and some assurances of a clean room, i might consider it.

Reviews.Title: “My "go-to" hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bluegatsby
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of The Hotel. I love the fact that I don't have to navigate from the front entrance to get to my room and the spa is very good (not the best, but certainly well maintained). The suites are spacious and the accomodations are well above average. The interior design is well done as well. I have heard a few complaints from freinds that they have had issues at the front desk (due to issues with bookings), but it seems like the issues have been resolved. The first time I stayed at the The Hotel they did have issues getting the room prepared, but this happens at almost every busy hotel occassionaly. Overall, my favorite hotel to stay in on the strip. Bellagio was my previous "go-to" hotel, and although I still love the Bellagio, I can live without the huge crowds.

Reviews.Title: “It Could Have Been Much Better!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ImHappilyMarried
Reviews.Content: The Hotel at Mandalay Bay is beautiful but the service is not what you would expect at such a nice establishment. When room service was called because they didn't supply enough materials they were rude and took their time about delivering items. They are very unwilling to switch your room even if they make the mistake. The casino atmosphere was nice and the staff that were there was very nice. The food is excellent and the buffet was the best. It was nice to be able to catch the monorail to some of the other hotels without having to walk. Overall, my stay was good but they could really use a much better staff.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: some_travelling
Reviews.Content: Sure, this is a LUXE hotel, but to me, some things are just plain inexcusable. And sorry if I am not an experienced traveller in Vegas, but I think it should be a punishable offense for hotels to not offer coffee - either coffee makers in the room, or at least complimentary coffee somewhere near the room. For the outrageous price, they could cough up the extra 2 bucks it would take to make me happy. But on to the other stuff. The decor was phony tres chic minimalist. Very little signage, very hard to find your way around. I suppose that is on purpose. The rooms, again, the phony tres chic minimalist decor, compounded by a wall of mirrors on the armoire facing the bed, which, trust me, were not necessary, or appreciated. Dull boring colors, poor lighting. The bed *was* comfortable, but the A/C in my room NEVER worked well and I felt stifled the entire time I was there. The best thing I could say about this hotel ??? The bathtub. That was a nice big soaking tub, and it was really the only saving grace. Checkout lines were huge, alternate checkout process allowed me to leave, but with the hotel incorrectly charging me for a $140 meal which I never had. It took several weeks to correct. Some of the staff were nice - the girl in the coffee shop, the maintenance crew. The rest I could do without. Oh, and the SPA ? Tremendously overpriced - especially since you have a good bathtub. The fitness center - also over priced, with the added bonus of reddish-orange walls (stimulating!) and nice, slippery floors (don't sweat too much, or spill your water - someone could really get hurt!). Sorry, I guess some other folks loved this hotel. This just was not not not 'THEHotel' for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mattmacnamara
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Hotel from 12-27 to 12-30 2007. Flew from Dallas to Vegas for UFC 79 that was held at Mandalay Bay. Our rooms were in excellent shape, clean, comfortable and spacious. We called housekeeping and front desk 3 different times for various things, towels, blankets, soap and they were quick to respond. The restaurants in The Hotel were excellent, some of the best Lobster Bisque I have ever had. Casino was busy at all times, but the waitresses were sure to remember your order and were fast. The guy who ran the Taxi Stand was very nice and informative, lead us to In & Out Burger which is always a good choice. Overall, an excellent stay and I WILL be going back to The Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: chadp1
Reviews.Content: My favorite of the five stars. Much better rooms at better price over Bellagio. Very nice casino, great buffet, and lots of restaurants to choose from. Room service was top notch, and room was in top flight condition. This is my new favorite place to stay on the strip. By far the nicest room I've had in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good stay - watch out for being allocated a smoking room though !”
Reviews.Author: TomCayman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property when exhibiting at Luxury Travel Expo in December 2007. Arrived around 8pm to be told that they didn't have any non-smoking rooms left, despite this being expressly requested on booking. When expressing my astonishment in this day and age of hotels going totally non-smoking, the front desk clerk came up with the astonishing line "we've only got 1200 rooms, and the non-smoking ones have already been allocated".... "only" 1200 rooms, and at 8pm in the evening they've no non-smoking rooms left ? Clearly either total b.s., poor management of the rooms division or both. Anyway, Front Desk clerk goes to the back office and says housekeeping have found him one... so when I get to that room, I find it in total disarray... ie the room was not cleaned, let alone inspected and marked clean. Called down to the front desk and they found another room for me over the phone, and asked if they should send someone up to that room to meet me, or would I come down.... at this point I was losing faith, so went downstairs. Anyway, after that saga, everything was fine.... rooms are very spacious, (two room suite at a minimum), with nice mini-bar and snacks (rare for Vegas hotels)....but everything in the room was "boutique lite", from the air conditioning controls to the amenities, fixtures, soft furnishings. Don't get me wrong, excellent value for money, but a luxury boutique style property it ain't. In summary, would I stay there again ? Yes, if at a conference at Mandalay Bay, as the rooms are very well priced for what you get, and it is nice to not have to go through the casino to use the hotel entrance to come and go.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Chic”
Reviews.Author: amidu
Reviews.Content: THEhotel is an all suite section of the sprawling Mandalay Bay. Vur and I loved this place. It has a separate entrance and is much quieter and less chaotic than most of the mega-hotels on the strip. Actually I never stepped into the main part of the building, so it was almost like staying a boutique hotel in New York. Great if you’re not a gambler or come to Vegas to shop, spa, dine, and accompany your significant other. The hotel décor is fab – uber-chic, sleek lines, dark colors, accented by whites and metallic. The room was appointed like a model NYC apartment, but was ultra spacious, much unlike most hotel rooms. It is one the bigger suites you’ll get for your money. The living room was well designed with sleek furniture and accessories – a well equipped desk, comfy couch, roomy armchair, large coffee table, side tables, Plasma, and a mini-bar with sink. It is one of the most usable and easy to hang out in living spaces I have experienced in a hotel -- great to hang out or throw a party. The Royalton NYC should take some tips from this hotel on how go mod and minimal without being obscure and impractical. The bedroom was equally spacious with a comfy bed and Plasma. The bathroom too, was spacious and equipped with a Plasma. Done in chocolate colored marbled granite, white marble, dark wood, and silver, it was posh enough to throw a party in. The downside: Long walks to the lobby from the entrance/valet, lots of walking the hotel itself too. The lobby bar had terrible service.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was okay”
Reviews.Author: pmmom
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference within the hotel for 5 days. The room and bathroom is huge. There's a plasma TV in the bedroom and there's another small one in the bathroom. The bathroom had a whirlpool tub. The hotel was so huge that I got blisters on my feet from walking back and forth from the conference to my room. They had an indoor pool and a wave pool. It looks like fun but I never got to do any of those. The room I got had 2 queen size beds. One was comfortable and the other was not. This hotel is really far from the other hotels/sights on the strip. You can ride the tram to help with the distance. There's also the bus, which the lady at the front recommended but I think the tram is easier. The food at the restaurants is not as good as the food in Venetian or Treasure Island. Even though the price is comparable. If I ever go to Las Vegas with the family, I probably would not stay here because I would prefer to be closer to the strip sights/ activities. But if the hotel rate is good, I would consider staying here and get the savings even though location is not ideal.

Reviews.Title: “TheHotel has a monopoly on Presumption, but i like it anyways.”
Reviews.Author: NeroTransmitter
Reviews.Content: TheHotel was a very nice place to stay once you get by the patronizing presumption that is forced in to your face at every step. From the time you step into TheLobby, you are re-enforced again and again that this is ThePlace to be, which is fine for some people, not so much for me. The toilet paper is even called TheTP. All that aside, along with the obvious form over function 'artistic vomit' that permeates this place, it is one heck of a nice place to stay. TheRooms: We stayed in a very nice suite at around 800 sqft. We had three tvs, an ipod docking station, wetbar, 1.5 baths, etc etc, very nice and very plush. Occasionally you have to do battle with form to get function. For example, the bathroom light is so low that it makes it hard to shave. But it looks nice in low light. I really like the desk area, the only problem here is that the wireless inet dint work. We had to go wired for inet, no biggie. Mandalay hotels have the shark reef on channel 26, so we kept all three tvs tuned to that and let the ipod docking station broadcast our audio, this was a nice option. If they put the music from the TheHotel along with it on channel 26, this would be even nicer. Bedding was decent, prolly soon in need of an overhaul if they want to be TheHotel. We bring our own 'throw', so no problems. Amenities were top notch, lotions and else are in jars not bottles, nice touch. Room came with a pocket shoe polisher which is also a nice touch. TheRoomService: I would avoid room service here if possible, we had one good experience, but one very bad one where we didn't get delivered for two plus hours (45 minute quote). TheSpa: The spa is another art nightmare, too chic for its own good. TheHelp here is equally worthless. Without any real great instructions on where to wait for TheTreatments. I got a great Deep tissue here however, that ,made TheLack of help, tolerable. TheMusic: I loved the music playing throughout TheHotel, it is chill out house that was a real nice departure from the usual muzack. You can also buy a CD with similar music so you can take TheMusic with you. TheRestaurants: We loved RumJungle. The tasting menu is the best option here, just do not load up on starches. Like every place in the LV, this place has a trap for you to fall in. They bring beans, salads and breads before they start bringing you the all-you-can-eat items, which invariably fills you up before you can eat too much of the high dollar items (like scallops, salmon, etc). Wolfgang Pucks entry at Mandalay (lupo) was about as mediocre as most of Puck's entries. I picked a risotto saphron cioppino like dish that was good, but i could have made it at home with a box of riceoroni risotto au grauten. StripSteak is one of the best steak houses I have ever been too. Very pricey, but if you can afford a $54 filet, you will taste the difference. They also have A5 Kobe steaks if you really want to throw some cash at this place. I recommend the Bleu Cheese scalloped potatoes if they are available. You will not need more than one order, as these are one of the most rich tasting side dishes you will ever consume. I also had a really nice Maine Lobster Cocktail here that was real nice. TheNightlife: Forty-Deuce is one of my fav clubs anywhere. They do real low key, kinda artsy burlesque. The wife an I head there every time we are in town and you can gain free entry by eating at any of the medium to high end restaurants at Mandalay. TheService in general was real good, sans room service. Bell Service was top notch. Maid service as well. One major thing that is worth mentioning is the cat and mouse game you have to play to keep from getting charged for TheMiniBar. When a place advertises a refrigerator, but it is filled with mini bar items it is usually worth calling to find out what the policy is. When we called we were told to put the items back before made service each day. There needs to exist a better way to deal with this, for I like to bring my own beverages, and in this case it would have been nice to have a cooler, rather than play cat and mouse with the mini-bar guy. Consider yourself warned. All in all we had a real nice stay and would stay here again without hesitation. I would give this an 'excellent' if not for the few hiccups we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Total quality at TheHotel”
Reviews.Author: GarfieldScotland
Reviews.Content: Spent a week over Christmas at TheHotel. My partner and I were most impressed by this hotel. The rooms are magnificent and after a long day on the strip it was great to come back to a hotel which had no casino. Check in and out was also very fast. The only downside is that you are right on the southern extremity of the strip. There is a very cheap bus service (only $5 for 24hrs)but at night it takes an hour to go the length of the strip. Would definitely stay at TheHotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Ever Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: cowgurl808
Reviews.Content: Went there for my boyfriend's 21st birthday. Hands down, the nicest, classiest hotel I've ever stayed at. The bathrooms had TVs (!!!), a tub, and a shower. The TV in the bedroom was large and flatscreen. Our room was always immaculate every time it was cleaned, towels replaced, shampoos, etc. Never had to complain about anything. The hotel itself is gorgeous. The pool area is enormous, though we didn't have enough time to actually utilize it, it looked amazing. Highly recommended. The only complaint is that it is located at the far end of the strip... but we looked at it in a positive light: we were forced to exercise. =)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but a bit far away from other strip hotels”
Reviews.Author: 1234Portland
Reviews.Content: The rooms at THE Hotel are above average - great modern decor, large size, one and 1/2 bathrooms, helpful staff, the only downside is that it is a bit far from the other popular strip casinos. We found ourselves spending a lot more money than we thought for cab fare and our shoes and feet got a workout from the long walks to the other part of the strip. Overall however, a good hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place”
Reviews.Author: RaleighT
Reviews.Content: This is by far my favorite hotel in Las Vegas. I have stayed at all of the big places, but TheHotel is the best. Our check-in was a breeze and our bags were promptly delivered to the suite. All of the employees that I encountered were happy and friendly and service was always very prompt. The suite was fantastic...seperate living and sleeping areas (with AMAZING beds) and a beautiful marble bathroom with a huge soaking tub and seperate toilet room. There was also a second half bath that made in very nice when getting ready to go out. The colors of the suite maybe a little muted to some, but I found it very hip and relaxing. The view was great, we were on a high floor. Room service was very prompt and friendly as I ordered breakfast in every morning. Mandalay Bays casino, shopping, and dining topped off my experience with The Hotel. We also used the tram that runs between MB and Excalibur and it really helped on the walk. A little tip...the seperate entrance for The Hotel is a lot faster when you want a taxi instead of waiting in the Mandalay Bay line.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing! Didn't feel like a Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: nietsnetto
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Thanksgiving weekend and couldn't be more pleased. The accommodations were fabulous!! The rooms were a great size with ultra luxurious bathrooms and amenities. We did not feel like we were in a Vegas hotel at all...no sounds of slot machines, etc. Not having a casino made this hotel even better..we didn't miss the casino for a second. If you want to go to a casino, you can go directly to the Mandalay Bay which is just a short walk. The service in the breakfast room could've been better but the food was pretty good. The Hotel is chic and modern, and done in very good taste. The spa was beautiful and has nice treatments. There is a nice aroma when you walk into the lobby..it almost feels like a new york hotel. This is definitely one of the nicest hotels in Vegas and we couldn't have been happier!! I would DEFINITELY recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: talwazir
Reviews.Content: Very elegant, exclusive and fresh. Rooms are very large, toiletries are top of the line, plasma TVs in bathroom, bedroom and living area. Towels have a fresh scent to them. Service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “THE Hotel is THE Best!”
Reviews.Author: Scottas66
Reviews.Content: This charming little property has all the amenities of Mandalay Bay without the crowds. I love being able to charge back to my room at the Casino-less Hotel from any Mandalay Bay outlet including Spa Mandalay. If you're a Spa goer, and like larger, grand spas, go to Spa Mandalay instead of THE Hotel's own THE Bathhouse, which I found to be lacking in an appropriate number of facilities, and too tiny to be relaxing, especially when it was overbooked. Anymore than five guests in the spa, and it feels cramped. The rooms at THE Hotel are all suites, and are phenomenal for the price paid. Very luxurious, in prime location in a prime part of the Strip. Could not ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MIACRUISER
Reviews.Content: We stayed at THE Hotel from 12/19 thru 12/24. We were upgraded to a "V" suite (I think the fact we arrived on a Wednesday helped). They gave us a room on the 11th floor, strip view. The view is not that great because of the Luxor pyramid in front of you, but still it was very nice. The suite itself was perfect. Very very clean, spacious, private, TWO BATHS!!! (can't emphasize that enough). Plenty of storage room. Lighting is on an automatic dimmer, the longer the light stays on, the brighter it gets (environmentally friendly). Decor very nice. Housekeeping was exceptional, always done in the morning. Everything impecable. Lots of toiletries. In general, the Hotel staff was excellent. Check in and chek out very helpful, polite and professional. They will assist you with anything, including directions to nearby attractions. Take advantage of the Dollar Rent a Car desk at the Mandalay Bay Hotel. Very convenient. Check out time from THE Hotel is early, so we rented a car the last day and went out to Red Rock Canyon and Hoover Dam, and then drove to the airport. Saved a lot of money (instead of purchasing guided tours and using a taxi to the airport). Suites with strip view are numbered as follows: The First two numbers are the floor number, then the third number is an 8 or a 9 (depending on which hallway your room is). If you get an eight, then odd numbers are strip view (i.e. 11815), if a 9, then even numbers are strip view (i.e. 11916). I hope this works for all floors, but at least that was the case on the 11th floor. The Mandalay Bay has the best Restaurants in town. Don't forget to visit the connecting shopping center to the Luxor, there are a lot of shops and restaurants there as well. If you take the Tram you will miss them. Hotel is not that far from the action. You'll need the excercise, Vegas is becoming a meca for fine dining, and you will eat a lot (you should limit your buffet visits, otherwise you are missing a great experience). We sincerely hope you all have a great time. We certainly did!

Reviews.Title: “we found a new home”
Reviews.Author: themoops
Reviews.Content: What a treasure! Cool, hip, quiet, a great oasis from the frenetic energy that is Las Vegas. We were in a V suite on the 23rd floor, great strip views, fabulous suite. We had a living room, seperate bedroom both with 42" plasmas, living room has a DVD player. Wonderful pillow top mattress, down comforter and pillows. Huge master bath with deep soak tub, seperate marble shower and a 12" plasma on the wall. Separate 1/2 bath off living room. Customer sevice was unbeatable. Asked for a humidifier when we checked in, was there when we got to the room. Nice touches like fuzzy robes and slippers, even complimentary botttled water while you are waiting to pick up your car from the valet. Public areas are slick and contemporary, cool, dark and welcoming. No this property is not kid friendly, and we couldn't be happier with that fact.

Reviews.Title: “Our son is made in The Hotel... need we say more?”
Reviews.Author: hubert
Reviews.Content: Almost everything is said. And true. The pool is great but very crowded. Etc. We stayed for several nights. Got married in Vegas, and made our son in The Hotel. so it was a great hotel for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: pilotgirl21
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at THEhotel in Nov/Dec 2007. I have never stayed in such luxury in my life. The rooms were huge. There were two bathrooms in the rooms, a living room area, and a sleeping area. We were on the 26th floor with a view of the mountains. The staff was great. They even printed out my boarding pass for me when I was leaving. The rooms were cleaned well. The whole hotel looked spectacular. I would recommend staying here to anyone who is traveling to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: sreb
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the Delay in posting this review. My Husband had a conference to attend at Mandalay Bay - OCT,07. So we stayed at the Hotel for 4 days,as suggested by a Friend. Please try & check in as early as 10.30 am (the reception staff told us) as they can let you get a better room, we chose to pay a bit more for a corner suite on a higher floor, we were given room keys but were told that it would be ready in 2 hrs or so, the staff were very nice & we left our luggage with the Bell/Luggage Staff. We were called on our cell & told the room was ready around Noon & when we saw the room which was on the 27th floor, corner, which had a view of the mountains in the living room & strip views from the bedroom, The Suite had 1 &1/2 bath which was very nice, it was done up beautifully & luxurious. The Mattress was amazingly relaxing especially after all the walking & the bathroom was huge & very well done, it had a huge shower stall with a glass door & a very large soaking tub, the robes,slippers and bathing products were very good. The staff were very nice when we asked for a humidifier to be sent up as it is VERRRY DRY in Vegas & it helps to use one, they promptly delivered it. All in all it was a good place to stay but a little on the expensive side, it helps if you can join the Players Club before you check in & show it to the reception while booking, play some & they may even comp some for you. The one thing we loved about The Hotel was it was a NO SMOKING HOTEL which was wonderful as most of Vegas though lovely choked us with all the SMOKE from too many uncaring smokers who didn't follow basic courtesy towards others. We spent a few more days at MGM and The Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Oh so worth it! A truly posh getaway from themed Vegas hotels.”
Reviews.Author: lovelofi
Reviews.Content: Well, the gal at NWA World Vacations did NOT point us in the wrong direction! We're not gamblers, and we wanted our hotel experience to be a beautiful, no-hassle retreat while in Vegas. THEhotel hit the spot! THEhotel is upscale, yet understated...very much up our "young 30s" alley. We were looking at the Wynn or Bellagio as our other options in Vegas. Just stepping one foot in the (beautiful, grand, over the top, VERY BUSY!) lobby of the Bellagio, we new that wouldn't have been the place for us...though a room with a view of the fountains is probably priceless! We never made it over to the Wynn, but it is a beautiful spectacle on the strip. We also stayed a night at the Venetian in the Venezia Towers during this trip - absolutely gorgeous and HUGE suite. But, that was also my (minor) complaint about the Venetian...it was just HUGE and "over the top" in every way. THEhotel and the Venetian were both awesome, and I'd highly recommend both....just depends on what experience you're looking for...Venetian is beautiful and over the top...THEhotel is simple and refined. The second you walk into the lobby of THEhotel...you will feel that it is just very different from the other hotels...classy, understated, and unassuming. People don't come here to be flashy...they come for a relief from the strip and a luxurious, but not over the top, hotel stay. For an chilled-out hotel stay in Vegas, I would opt for THEhotel again in a heartbeat! One perk sincerely worth mentioning...Mandalay, Luxor & Exacaliber are connected by a (free!) tram, making it super easy to check out three properties extensively during your stay! Walking from hotel casino to hotel casino is a drag, and we're in good shape! (We both had ouchie feet and blisters at the end of our four days in Vegas.) So, why not 5 stars? This is silly, but the bath products smelled horrible! And, in this day when the airline limits so much, I am at the mercy of the hotel's shampoo, lotion, etc. So, this is a big deal for me. I probably should have mentioned this to someone during our stay, but complaining seemed like too big of a hassle during our very casual and relaxing stay in Vegas. Oh, almost forgot...our favorite "normal" priced restaurant was Mandalay Place's Burger Bar. We told ourselves we wouldn't eat somewhere twice on this trip, but Burger Bar's good prices, HUGE beer selection, and location convenient to THEhotel won out this time. And, one more thing --- we discovered it too late, but, if you like clubs...one to NOT miss is a tiny place called eyecandy (I think) in the middle of the Mandalay casino. Super cool and super packed and no admission charge (at least on the night we went)!

Reviews.Title: “Class and Style at THEHotel at Mandalay Bay”
Reviews.Author: Klug
Reviews.Content: Interesting Place - liked it alot and would return. Check-in: Stayed using AMEX's Fine Hotel and Resort Program - room was ready upon arrival at about 10 AM. Long-ish line at check in but they moved it quickly. Room: Very nice, clean and well appointed. Bathroom was fantastic, large and tub and shower were spotless and very nice. 2 sinks was also a plus. TV in bathroom was another nice feature, products are good quality. Living room was cool, not really something I need in Vegas but still nice. We turned down an upgrade for a "better view" of the pool - actually it was a tiny view of the pool and mostly a view of the roof of the parking garage and casino. Spa was really nice although we didnt use it - we checked it out. The food in the Cafe was really good. Drinks at the bar were also great. You are connected to lots of good restaurant choices in The Mandalay Bay Hotel and The Mandalay Place shopping mall. Pool- Its nice, but way over crowded. The seats are tough to come by, everyone reserves them early but only 1 out of 4 are ever being used, so although there is a shortage of them you arent too crowded if you actually get one. We also kept finding lots of broken ones. "Beach service" was spotty at best, seemed like it depended alot on who was your waitress and they were assigned sections and reluctant to work outside of their assigned section. Prices of beach service and the beach restaurant are as high as you would expect at any beach resort. A cabanan would be the way to go but the prices to reserve one were extortionate - must be good for high rollers only. Best part of the whole scene was the beach casino, while rather small the dealers were friendly and the bar service was excellent. Good time to gamble while being able to watch the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Luxury”
Reviews.Author: LeslieOC
Reviews.Content: My cousin blocked a group of rooms at this hotel to celebrate a 50th birthday. I have stayed at all of the high end hotels in Vegas and this is by far my favorite. It is both elegant and stylish without being "themey" (like paris or Caesars). The bathtub is massive and the bathing/shower products are by bulgari. The views at the rooftop restaurant are unbelievable. The room was 199.00 on a friday and saturday night, and worth every penny. You can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: GypsyBride
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 4 days and 3 nights at THE hotel at Mandalay Bay. We booked a package deal though the hotel and were just SO pleased. The rooms are ROOMY. We had the 750 square foot suite and it was just perfect for the two of us. THE hotel has thought of everything. Lovely scent piped into the lobby, quick elevators, amazing bathrooms (bring bubble bath), lovely soft sheets, down comforters, feather (and synthetic) pillows. Lots of room to store clothes. COMFY robe and slippers. Toiletries that smell like heaven. Nice TV's everwhere. Just lovely. Someone even has a sense of humor as the stickers on the toilet paper say THE toilet paper. The valet was perfect and prompt, they always give you some very welcome bottles of water. Every details is thought through. The service is helpful and friendly. We DID have some (small and easily ignored) noise from the nightclubs on the top floors one night, but having read the reviews on here we were prepared for that, and asked for a room on a lower floor (32nd) as opposed to the suite upgrade on a higher floor we were offered (the room we had was plenty large). Everywhere we went if people asked us where we stayed the reaction was always... Oh you've got the best rooms on the strip! And we couldn't have agreed more.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Amazing”
Reviews.Author: troybadoo
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel on our honeymoon, and after a long and delayed flight, plus a long wait to pick up our vehicle, it was like walking into a new horizon as soon as the sliding doors parted! Ok I've heard complaints from others about the scented air conditioning, but to be frank after 3 seconds you forget about it and realise it is putting you into a very chilled, happy mood. We got to the desk very quick even though there was quite a big queue. The girl who checked us in was nothing but charming, and gave us a beautiful room, ok it was on a low floor ie no view, but it was a corner room and as such was enormous, and the attention to detail plus the amazing facilities was nothing less than worthy of 7 stars if it existed! We stayed 5 nights on the way thru, and 2 nights on the way back of a circuit of the south west. We had a regular sized suite on the way back, still enormous, but I guess we'd been a little spoilt with our suite at the start. The eating options, enterntainment and gambling options too are all first class. Staff are very freindly and happy. Plus the complimentary drinks whislt gambling are THE most generous and best at any casino in Vegas! Of course its more expensive than most, but you really do get what you pay for, and even though its truly a 5 star resort, they are in no way snobby, they in fact are more freindly and down to earth than many lower class establishments! The Mandalay beach is to die for, with real sand, wave machine etc its like you really are at a real beach resort. You couls literally spend a whole week or even longer with never leaving the property, as there is so much to do plus the very handy monorail link to Luxor and Excalibur is dead handy to catch their shows and also get a head start on to the mid strip area. We had a lot of wonderful hotels on our long trip, but it was wonderful to start and finish at THE Hotel, I would recommend it to anyone without a second thought, and we are already planning our next trip back here within the next year! As an after thought make sure to sign up to the players club in the centre of the casino, to get loyalty points etc, you can sign up online prior to departure to quiken the process and it covers you for a large number of hotels not just the Mandalay. I think really the largest compiment of all is this: We just got a new kitten, guess what we named her?? Mandalay is her name!!"! Nuff said I think.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay.”
Reviews.Author: randjworldtravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in a strip view suite which was on the 38th floor. Fab! This gave us views to Luxor, Excalibur and in fact the whole strip down to the Stratosphere. The suite itself is well appointed with plenty of room including 3 tellys, superb bathroom, wet bar and is extremely comfortable, however we would have to agree with other reviewers that the room can seem to be quite dark. The reception area is very impressive as are all the general areas. The valet parking was quick and efficient. We also greatly enjoyed the boutique style of this hotel which makes quite a change from the other big Vegas hotels. We would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: Castlerockmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel at Mandalay Bay for three days over the Thanksgiving holiday as a party of 5. Two adults with 3 children. Lets start with the POSITIVES: We got a great price on our rooms and the third night free through Mirage's website! (this definitely swayed our decision on where to stay). The lobby is understated but still impressive (once inside from the underground entrance). The modern feel is accomplished through very tall ceilings, sleek lines, rich and dark wood features accented by clear glass blown chandeliers and tall lighted pillars. The lobby has a persistent odor of wood polish as the staff is working overtime on oiling the wood and polishing the marble floors. The bellmen and front desk personnel were very personable and accommodating. The front desk originally gave us two adjoining suites on the 26th floor. The views of the mountain range were amazing however one of the nonsmoking rooms was clearly smoked in so we moved to a lower floor with two suites and an equally wonderful view of the Luxor all lit up. The spa is quite nice - arrive early for your treatment and enjoy the facilities including bottled water, juices, snacks, etc... Our dinner at The Hotel's Mix was better than Mandalay Bay's Strip Steak or the Bayside Buffet. ***Be sure to visit the Mix lounge - the view at sunset is beautiful. Also include a visit the restroom! (It is a private toilet which faces a floor to ceiling glass window for a view of the entire strip). Now the NEGATIVES and NEUTRALS: The rooms are as pictured BUT the photos do not fully display the extent of the perpetual darkness. The rooms are in fairly good condition, showing some signs of wear and tear--ie worn carpet, scratches in woodwork, one broken piece of marble in shower. However, due to the heavily tinted dark glass, the deep brown walls, the dark wood coupled with inadequate lighting - you cannot achieve light - even in the morning. (Some recessed lighting could solve this problem) The best way to describe the situation is to say it feels as though you have your sunglasses or shades on in the room and you cannot get any brighter than that. The darkness is fun and funky on the first day but gets old by day three. The pool(only 1 open at this time of year) and restaurants are a hike from The Hotel. The casino atmosphere is okay but not that special. The hostess staff at Red, White & Blue is horrendous and the restaurant mediocre. With a VACANT restaurant the hostesses frowned, hemmed and hawed, and sulked about whether they could seat us for the raw bar and cocktails at 5PM. The Mandalay Bay buffet is very average for dinner but actually pretty nice for lunch and breakfast. The wait for room service was 2 hours at one point on Thursday evening when returned from Momma Mia. Generally room service had at least an hour to an hour and a half wait anytime of the day or night. *****If paying full price STRONGLY consider Bellagio, Wynn, Four Seasons or even Venice over The Hotel at Mandalay Bay. Those properties deliver a much higher standard of service and atmosphere that runs throughout the property overall. While I was satisfied with The Hotel I don't think I would stay again -- even with a great rate. If you are looking for a 5 star or even 4 star experience I am not sure The Hotel is it.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at TheHotel”
Reviews.Author: Meheen
Reviews.Content: We vistied TheHotel in Oct 2007 and had a great stay! The fact that it is a boutqiue hotel - very different in style from the rest of the hotels in Vegas suited us perfectly. It provides a calm and chilled out vibe while also being directly connected to the Mandalay Bay which provides the usual Vegas casino centred atmosphere. Things we loved were the rooms (great size and well done up, with loads of storage space), the spa, the pool at Mandalay Bay and Mix - the restaurant and bar at the top of the hotel (amazing views, food and decor). On the other hand, the service was seriously lacking. The conceirge was the worst I have ever come across. If you call them from your room they keep you waiting for a minimum of 15 mins on hold and then are not that helpful. Once they actually gave me wrong information - I wanted to go to a certain shop and they sent me all the way to a mall which didnt end up having the shop! So wasted about one hour of my time. Also if you're planning to order room serivce - we found the quality of the food to be poor and be prepared for a long wait (tested on more than one occasion). All in all, we had a great stay but were just let down by a few small things. I think I would probably return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved "The Hotel" at Mandalay Bay”
Reviews.Author: TB15376
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a "The Hotel" for seven days in Nov 2007 and were very pleased with it. We did have issues with the maid not respecting the "do not distrub" sign, but when I complained about it when I checked out, the front desk removed $200+ room service charges from my bill, so that made up for it. We had a one-bedroom suite and having the two bathrooms was really nice, my only two complaints really was the food was really over priced and you have to pay for everything, even the gym was pay use only. WIth internet access, the room was nearly $250 a day, but the company picked up the bill since I was there on a conference, but I probably wouldn't stay here if it was on my dime.

Reviews.Title: “Super Schwanky, yet Very Dark”
Reviews.Author: sadiethompson
Reviews.Content: THEhotel is beautiful, contemporary, classy and chic. All the amenities of Mandalay Bay, but with an upscale, urban feel. The only thing we would have liked was the ability to make the room LIGHTER. After 3 days, we were frustrated with the darkness of the rooms. Super accommodating staff, but the concierge could have been more knowledgeable... we found better info flipping through the free Vegas magazines. Ask for a room on about the 10th floor or above, or you won't really have very good views (we were on the 6th floor, and we had a view of a lame stucco wall).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...crap location.”
Reviews.Author: 1AvidTraveler
Reviews.Content: THEhotel at Mandalay Bay is totally different from the other hotels on the strip. The decor is very simple, the hotel is quiet, but you have access to all of Mandalay Bay's facilities--including the wave pool/lazy river area. Unfortunately, the main pool with the beach and everything was closed for the season. We enjoyed great weather but did not get to experience the supposedly "amazing" pool that the critics tout. We stayed in a suite and truthfully, I was disappointed with the size. The beds were comfortale and the bathroom was huge but the living room area was TINY. Still, it was nice having the extra half bath and more room than a normal hotel room, but I'm not sure if it was worth the price. Also, we ran into a lot of problems with the DVD player, there was a huge scratch on the TV, and the lighting in the bedroom was practically non-existant. Overall, although this hotel was nice, I wouldn't stay there again. There were too many little things that bugged me, and to top it all off, this hotel was on The Strip but JUST BARELY. Plan on walking forever/taking $12 one-way taxi rides everywhere if you want to spend a lot of time on the main part of The Strip...

Reviews.Title: “THEhotel is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JennyBear13
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Very modern and clean, not cheesy at all. We had a great room with all the amenities. Had two spa treatments at the bathhouse which were great. Very different than most traditional spas. Staff were friendly and helpful. Went to see KA and was really impressed. Had a vodka tasting at Red Sqaure which was one of the highlights of our trip. I would strongly recommend THEhotel at Mandalay bay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room – shame about the thin walls”
Reviews.Author: RichardLister
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Mandalay Bay. We’ve stayed at many of the other major hotels in Vegas and this trip with opted for the clumsily named “The Hotel”. We booked one of their “The Suite” rooms which is very nicely designed and makes good use of space with its separate living room and bedroom. It took a while during check-in to persuade them to find us a room with a king sized bed. This is a pet hate of mine that hotels will not guarantee the type of bed at the time of booking – I mean I’m using a hotel primarily as a place to sleep, so the bed should be the most fundamental element of the booking! We were very impressed with the quality of the rooms for the price of the hotel – they are decorated to a high standard with two good televisions and a very nice bathroom with a big separate shower. However, ours was already starting to show signs of wear and tear - almost everywhere you look there are scratches, dents and marks. This was not a problem for us because it was all quite minor, but I wonder how long these rooms will continue to look good for. I would agree with some of the other reviews here that this hotel’s biggest problem is the thickness of the walls. You can hear everyone walking past in the corridor and the people either side. Luckily our neighbours during this stay were very quiet, but you may not be so lucky. The soundproofing of the windows is also not too good and the traffic 16 floors down was easily heard. My other pet hate with big hotels is how they’re still charging for internet access ($14 a night here) – when everyone else like Holiday Inn, Hampton Inn, Best Western (etc etc...) all include it for free. We had room service a couple of times and it was average quality – and quite slow (e.g. 50 minutes). Looking at the prices for this hotel now, it looks like we got the room pretty cheap ($240 a night) – so for that money I’d say this was good value. For the $300 they’re now asking I’d say you’re getting just about what you paid for – while the rooms last.

Reviews.Title: “Loved THEHotel!”
Reviews.Author: BCTravelbug63
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 days/nights in LV and thoroughly enjoyed THEHotel. They had a great special on whereby you received a 3rd night free and a complimentary upgrade. I had a "V Suite" room on the 19th floor with spectacular views of the strip. Both the living room AND bedroom has huge floor to ceiling windows overlooking the strip - i enjoyed lying in bed at night and looking out at all the lights! The bathrooms, as previously commented, were large and the amenities were very nice. Room service was pretty good, it never took as long as they said - the food was average - doesn't compare to the Wynn where I have stayed three times. Most everything else did compare though in my opinion - beds, linens, service were all as good as the Wynn. The location is somewhat removed from everything, but I really liked NOT having a casino in the lobby to have to walk through to get outside. It was refreshing not to have the stale smell of smoke attach to your clothes before going out! I found the service at the Front Desk VERY good - professional, efficient, and hardly ANY wait at both check-in and check-out. Visited the pool at Mandalay Bay, and although a bit of a walk from THEHotel through the casino, I really didn't mind it. The pool area is pretty neat with the sandy beach and there were LOTS of free lounge chairs. All is all, having stayed at the Bellagio, Wynn & Venetian, I thoroughly enjoyed this hotel and will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “live the highlife in vegas!”
Reviews.Author: dougnjo
Reviews.Content: flying into vegas was every bit as exciting as we had hoped. Checking into thehotel at mandolay bay and seeing our suite was also as mind blowing. we were in room 5-911 and this faced west towards the mountains. OK so you cant see the strip but we were still impressed. the choice of bars and hotels was superb. its a MUST to go the the MIX bar and restaurant at the top of thehotel as the views are out of this world and is surely the place to see and to be seen at the mo. Staff are a little snobby but do not let that put you off. the sample menu with wine was excellent. we had superb weather and it was a real shame not to get a chance to lie by thehotel pool which again was a bonus. however it is vegas and the mandolaybay casino was calling. Staff there were really friendly and helped us learn the tables. we managed to have some success on the roulette and black jack tables...coming from a non gambler i can highly recommend. The canyon is a trip you must book. We did the south side by plane which then transferred you by coach to 2 stops in the canyon and they were both excellent views and good photo opportunities!! Flew Virgin economy direct and was fine for the 10 hours as long as your headset worked!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: jibinall
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel, i would recommend anyone to experience a visit to the hotel at mandalay bay. The reception staff where very pleasant and helpful they also allowed us to change are room 2 days into are stay to a higher room with a strip view. All rooms are suite with plenty of room with TV,s in every room including the main bathroom. The mini bar in the room was cheaper than the main bar at the hotel, unless your having the free drinks while gambling. The walk to the pool took about 10 minutes but was worth it when you got there after a few day you will know the quickest route through the casino floor. The pool area was fantastic and very clean by far the best pool at vegas. The is plenty of restaurants in the hotel and the main hotel, for the best burger ever i suggest you try the burger bar in the shopping centre it justs melts in your mouth. Although this hotel is at the beginning of the strip you don't feel left out. There is a free tram from mandalay bay to luxor and Excalibur every 5 minutes and just outside the hotel on the main road you can pick up the deuce bus $5 24hr ticket the bus runs 24hrs up and down the strip, when coming home on the bus of a evening it gets pretty full but you will have a laugh. We are thinking of going back to vegas next year and i will definitely staying at the hotel at mandalay bay,

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with some bad experiences”
Reviews.Author: Delraypete
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I were in town for the Photoshop conference and were upgraded to THEhotel at check-in for reasons unbeknownst to us. We had been excited to stay in the refurbished Mandalay Bay rooms, but were immediately excited at the prospects of an upgrade. We were put in a standard room on the 60th floor's north wing facing east in the very inside corner of the hotel with a pretty good view of the strip. The room was very nice, if not small, had a standard TV in the huge built-in with closets on one side of the room and a very nice, high-end bathroom with Givenchy toiletries. I was amazed at the amount of marble in just one bathroom. However, we would discover the next morning, the entire morning, that this room was right next to housekeeping, which was obnoxious. Doors, carts banging into everything, talking, yelling - any noise you could think of was going on outside our door all morning. The sound insulation is definitely lacking. There was even a visible gap beneath the door that didn't help. So, beyond some nice finishes and a feeling of prestige, THEhotel was kind of a let down. It's about as far as you can get away from the entrance to the pool and you would think the housekeeping would be a little more respectful first thing in the morning. Do they stage all housekeeping out of the 60th floor? The second night a horrible smoky stench filled our room and hallway. It smelled like someone was burning a rack of lamb on a grill and it became hard to breath. I was too tired to do anything about it, so I stuck my head under the sheets and kept sleeping. I was told the next day by the front desk that they had received no complaints. Weird. It was really THAT bad. Our third night we were greeted by a rowdy bachelor/dance party in the suite next to us, so we were luckily able to move to the Mandalay Bay tower at about 12AM. All said, I would not try to stay at THEhotel again unless I could get a suite no where near the housekeeping area.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: amen1986
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at THEhotel at Mandalay Bay this past weekend. Overall, we had a very good experience at The Hotel and would be happy to recommend it. We arrived on Friday around 11AM and were pleased to see that they had a room available for us right away. Unfortunately, my only choices were an 8th floor with a king bed or a higher floor with queen beds, despite my request to have a high floor, king bed, with a strip view. No strip views were available, but it wasn’t a big deal. The hotel lobby was very quiet. I was second on line to check-in, and I checked in without any issues. What a difference compared to previous stays at the Bellagio, where check-in can take over an hour. Next to the front desk you will find a small room with two internet stations. While they do charge for their usage, they will let you use them free of charge if you simply want to print your boarding pass or check your flight status. The room is just as many have described. We found it to be clean and modern. The living room has a nice-sized Philips plasma HDTV, but unfortunately, they offer no HD programming. They’ve got a bunch of on-demand programming, and a decent amount of free programming (ESPN, ESPN2, CNN, and the networks). There is also a DVD player in the living room. The bedroom also has a TV, although it is not a plasma flat-screen, and it does not have a DVD player. There is also a small LCD TV in the bathroom, which we did not use. We found the beds to be very comfortable. They will rent a mini refrigerator to you at $20 per day, unless you just want to refill your bathroom or bar sink with ice to keep your beverages cold. Their mini-bar had a few small bottles of vodka, soda, and red bull, but I think it was broken, since all of the drinks were warm. I know some people have complained about the amount of walking you have to do as a guest, but I don’t think it’s a big deal. From the moment you leave the elevator at The Hotel, it’s about a 5-7 minute walk to the wave pool at Mandalay Bay. It’s about a one minute walk from the elevator to the gaming floor at MB. It takes 90 seconds to get to the entrance/escalator for Mandalay Place, which is a shopping mall. If you’re staying at The Hotel and want to have dinner at Mandalay Bay, follow the signs for “restaurants”. There are probably 6 or 7 all in the same spot. It’s a 3 minute walk from The Hotel. We had dinner on our last night at Shanghai Lilly, which was very good (Chinese food). Back to the pool (which they call the Mandalay Bay Beach); it was a lot bigger than I had pictured, and it was very nice. The main attraction is a huge wave pool – the pool goes from zero entry to about 7 feet deep. The waves run often, maybe once every 5-10 minutes. The majority of the seating at the Beach is on lounge chairs that cover the sandy beach. The chairs are not very comfortable, by the way. Towels are free and are available once you enter the Beach complex. To enter, every guest (over age 14 I think) needs to show a room card for either MB or The Hotel. They provide pool side drink service that you can charge to your room if you prefer. A pina colada is $12 before tip. Aside from the wave pool, they also have a lazy river, and two smaller pools. We had a quick lunch before laying out pool side. They have food available to-go, but it was easier and more relaxing to eat at a table. They have a bunch of salads, appetizers, and sandwiches, which were all good for the most part (there were 7 of us total in our party). The food wasn’t cheap, but this isn’t a cheap hotel. Lunch for two was probably $55 or so. We didn’t spend too much time entertaining ourselves at Mandalay Bay or at The Hotel. But we did manage to go to Mix and the House of Blues. There are two different Mix places – the lounge serves drinks and appetizers only. It opens at 5PM daily. There is also the Mix restaurant, which serves dinner at 6PM daily. If you want to go to the lounge, you have to go there through the special “Mix” elevator – you will find it a few hundred feet away from the spot where The Hotel’s hallway meets the MB gaming floor. If you try to access Mix by using the “regular” elevators before 6PM, the elevator will not take you there, since it thinks you are trying to go to the Mix restaurant, which doesn’t open until 6PM. I attempted to avoid confusion by calling before we went out, and the person on the other end left out all of these details. The lounge had an eclectic appetizer menu with pricey drinks. Two apps and two drinks for was around $65. You are able to sit out on the patio and take in the view if you’d like. The lounge starts charging a cover at 10PM. The cover is $10, but I’m not sure if that’s the regular cover charge, or the price you pay when you show a room key. We did not have time to eat at the Mix restaurant. We stopped by the House of Blues inside MB one evening, around 12:30 or so. There are two sides to the HOB, each of which has its own admission. The pricing was a bit sketchy, as we though it was $20 per couple, but when we tried to pay, the price went up to $20 per person. When we explained that was different than we had just heard, and that we had an issue with the pricing, they lowered it to $20 per couple. The salsa and merengue theme was not doing it for us, and as we complained to the bartenders, they actually agreed with us. They managed to get us up to the other side of HOB without having to pay (again), and we appreciated that a whole lot. The other side featured “oldies” night which was primarily 70s, 80s, and 90s dance music. A 70s cover band came on stage and was actually pretty good, considering we’re all around 30 years old and not big fans of the 70s dance scene. The only other thing to mention is check-out. The latest “late-checkout” was 11:30AM, as regular check-out is at 11:00AM. Knowing that we had a 10PM flight, I booked the room for the whole day/night, instead of having to depend on them storing my luggage for most of the day. There’s no discounted rate for doing this, but I found it to be convenient and worth the price. Checkout itself was simple, since you can drop off your keys in a drop box in the elevator lobby. The TV allows you to review your bill in advance if you’d like to do so, and then they will email your final bill to you, by request. Overall, we both enjoyed our stay at THEhotel. We found the staff to be courteous and friendly, the hotel to be clean and modern, and the amenities to be plentiful (considering that you’re only a few steps away from all that is Mandalay Bay). As long as you keep in mind that you’re staying at the bottom of the Las Vegas strip and you’ll need a taxi to almost everywhere, I think it’s a great hotel and would recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: sunshine0430
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Mandalay was for a technical conference being held at Mandalay Bay. I arrived Oct 14th at 5:30pm and was able to request a room with a great view of the strip. The check-in was seamless. From reading the previous reviews, my expectations were pretty open. I was ecstatic when I settled into my room and the view was wonderful!! My room was very clean and spacious and the beds were extremely comfortable. When the housekeeping cleaned the room daily you could actually smell that the room was clean!! Having a television in the bathroom to view while brushing teeth and taking a shower was a plus. The hotel staff were very helpful and responded promptly to my requests. I noticed that the casino was not smoke filled. Each morning when I went down for breakfast (at 6:30am) The casino air was clear and breathable. I was able to take home a profit of $350 (playing blackjack and yes, they had $5 tables!!) which was icing, since I'm satisfied leaving with an extra 20 bucks. I stayed 5 nights and was a little homesick, but other than that I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Stylish!”
Reviews.Author: KgBlue18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of our honeymoon and were really pleased with it. It is a very different experience to staying in a standard Las Vegas Casino hotel. You enter the hotel from the underground parking (in a car) and through a seperate entrance to The Mandalay Bay. It is very sleek and stylish looking - lots of marble, minimalist pieces of art and floral arrangements. All the rooms are suites and were a very nice size - with a full bathroom/toilet with freestanding shower and bath plus a seperate toilet. The suite also had 3 plasma screen TV's! There is a great bar called The Mix which has fantastic views overlooking The Strip. One downside of the hotel is that to get to the pool you have to walk through the casino and it is a good 15 min walk but the pool/beach is lovely so it makes up for it! I think this is the case in most Vegas hotels. Overall we were really pleased with the hotel - you have all the amenities of the Mandalay Bay but THE Hotel feels very calm and quiet in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room, service not quite as good as it could be, overall a great stay”
Reviews.Author: trilinearmipmap
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at The Hotel at Mandalay bay October 4th to 7th. Arriving at the hotel the first impression we got was poor. The entrance is a big parking garage. Then there is a long walk down a wide corridor / entrance foyer to the reception desk about a hundred yards away. There was no bell staff on hand to take our luggage so this was a bit of a hike. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. We booked through the Amex FHR program and the clerk offered us our room upgrade and complimentary amenity etc. without any prompting. We were upgraded to a corner suite. I am told this is no better than their regular suite but I have never seen the regular suite so I can't say. The room was the nicest room I have ever stayed in and this is compared mostly to four and some five star places. The bedroom was large. There was a fair sized living room. Bedroom and living room had large flatscreen TV's. The main bathroom was spacious and had its own TV, soaker tub, shower and two sinks. A second bathroom had a toilet and sink only. The service overall was not up to the standard I expected. Calls to the front desk took a long time to get answered and same with calls to book a spa appointment. I gave up calling a few times after 10 to 15 rings. Room service took 45 minutes (they said it would take 45 minutes and it did) and I am used to much faster room service. Service at the cafe downstairs was sometimes prompt and sometimes slow. The food and drink prices seemed very inexpensive to me considering the quality of the hotel. We had breakfast and lunch a few times at the cafe downstairs and there were a good range of choices on the menu. We both thought the cafe food was quite good as was the room service meal we had. We did not eat at any of the other restaurants in the Mandalay Bay hotel adjoining this hotel. The decor of the hotel lobby and entrance area was some kind of modern dark style which was supposed to look hip but just gave me a headache. We never waited more than two minutes to get a cab. Overall the very nice room made up for the service shortcomings of this hotel. We will stay here again and in fact are eagerly planning our next trip here.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again...”
Reviews.Author: kauaimom
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a birthday weekend on a friends request. So very over rated and so very disappointed. Room service at 9:00 am (over 1 hour and 2 calls) , Room Service at 12:00 am over 1 hour (3 calls), the Gym had 25% of it's cardio-equipment down and they still charged $20 to workout. There was no service at all as far as I can see. I don't mind paying over $600/night, but with zero amenities it seemed just plain dumb! I will NEVER stay there again and I will NEVER recommend this property to anyone. If you are willing to spent over $600/night, there are several better options available.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poulman
Reviews.Content: The idea here is that you stay in a hotel, rather than a 5,000-room casino-hotel. The advantages are: Much faster check-in, does not take twenty minute to get to your room and you can still use all the facilities of the Mandalay Bay (via short, air-conditioned undeground walk) including the fantastic sandy beach and wave pool. The rooms are very comfortable for a family of four (if the kids don't mind sharing a queen size bed) flat screen tv in bedroom, lounge and bathroom(!). It is situated at the south end of the strip and you get great views to the north. Can't really fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalistic neat-o”
Reviews.Author: LTKING
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights in September at The Hotel at the recommendation of a relative. I loved it! The fresh flowers changed each day at the entrance were gorgeous! The hotel is surprisingly quiet, which I enjoyed. We had after dinner drinks 2 nights at their bar (the one closest to the lobby) and they have great, friendly bartenders. Our room was great - overlooked the pyramid and a big red rock. I love the fact that the rooms have 2 bathrooms. The colors are soothing and all the mirrors are a neat touch. The "beach" area was amazing and I would love to go back when it's hotter. We took tons of cabs and never waited more than 7 minutes to get a cab from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware housekeeping rips your belongings off and get away with it!”
Reviews.Author: hhg2005
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mandalay Bay in Sep. 2007 for five nights. Room was dirty , burnt out light bulbs, no robes , worthless tv's ect. Food prices and drink prices completely outrageous. Rude staff awful room service , just completely overrated. On the day of check out I mistakenly left a drawer full of expensive brand new clothes. Now most any high end three to four hundred a night hotel would gladly return your items to you if they were left behind, not the Mandalay Bay , the housekeeping staff hired there figures whats yours is theirs! They kept my stuff and then pretended to do a full investigation , which they did NOTHING! They made me wait two weeks just to tell me there was nothing they could do about it and that anytime anybody stays at their hotel they are not responsible for lost or Stolen goods. I am fit to be tied! I spent alot of money at their rip off hotel and casino, and figured the cost to replace my items would be the least they could do. Mandalay Bay Stinks! Don't stay there if you value your belongings.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: NoOceanInKansas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were booked for a two night stay at Mandalay Bay in Las Vegas. When we checked in, there were no rooms available at Mandalay Place, so we were given a room at The Hotel. WOW is the best way to describe our experience. The first think you notice when walking through the lobby is the smell. There was a very light floral scent in the lobby, and even into the casino. I am completely in love with that scent, and hope to some day find out what it is that they pipe into the cooling system. The Hotel is tastefully decorated in a minimalist way: black marble and the names of various shops/cafes are The Coffee Shop, The Store, etc. Love it!!! After the noise of the casino, when you step into The Hotel you feel completely relaxed. Our room was on the 13th floor and was a two room suite. The "living room" area had a mini-bar, desk, couch, chair, and large plasma TV. The bedroom area and bathroom were AWESOME. Crisp linens, plump comforter, lush towels, all the free toiletries you can imagine including bath powders, lotions, shampoos, hair "masques", shoe polishers, and hand-made soap. There was another plasma TV in the bedroom and one in the bathroom, and of course the phone in the toilet area. It was amazing. The housekeeper for our floor came by and introduced herself (Joyce), and promised to take care of us. She delivered on her promise all three days we were there. The casino at Mandalay Bay was not crowded, very well laid out, and was the only casino we played at that had slot machines that were actually paying out. I didn't win a jackpot, but did come home with $300 more than I left with, which says a lot in Vegas! The downsides to staying at The Hotel are: 1. $$$ It's pricey, $280 per night for our room. 2. $12.99 per night for internet access. Seriously, can't they throw that in? 3. Location on the Strip: it's at the tail end of the Strip and they make it extremely difficult to find your way out, which I suppose is the whole point, to get you to gamble there. 4. Raffles Restaurant: $$$, long wait, and the food was definitely not worth the money. Only good thing was they put families with small kids all into a separate dining room away from the couples who wanted a more intimate dinner. Steak was like shoe leather. 5. $20 a day to use the work-out facilities. Again, for the price of the room, can't you include use of the work-out facilities? 6. $$$ to visit Shark Reef. I know it's a "for profit" operation, but this is yet another attraction that should be free for paying guests. Over all, I thought this was the nicest room I've ever stayed at while visiting Vegas (comparing it to Tropicana, Stratosphere, Venetian, and MGM). I'm not sure I would stay there again, as I can visit the casino for the smell and loose slots without staying there. No perks for hotel guests, too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Always A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SLHerman
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at THEhotel several times before and the hotel never disappoints. We arrived very early in the morning and surprisingly they had our room ready for us. We overlooked the strip and had a great view of everything. My husband used the gym and loved it. Sharing the property with Mandalay Bay, we had use of all the faciliites. It was great to see they completed the renovations at the pool area and now there are many more lounge chairs, a redone and expanded outdoor restaurant as well as take out if you dont' want to escape the sun. There is als now a casino overlooking the 'wave pool/beach' . They also added many more cabanas that range in price from $150 to $3000 a day depending on location and features. I've stayed at THEhotel before and I will definitely be back. The only negative experience we had was the very long wait we had for the elevators because there was a convention on the lower floors. They really need to encourage those people to use the stairs. Guests should not have to wait 15 minutes to get up to their room.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Is The Best Hotel In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ckayjr
Reviews.Content: This was an awesome hotel. I booked 2 rooms using the Bus. Plat. American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts Program. We arrived early, 11am and we were upgraded and able to check-in immediately. The suite had an amazing view and was extremely spacious. The bed was super comfortable as were the pillows. The amenities in the bathroom were quite nice as well. The Bathhouse Spa is expensive, but worth it. My wife had a facial and I had an 80min deep tissue massage. The spa facility is very unique and we both wished we would have had more time planned in the facility. Breakfast at The Cafe was great. The brioche french toast should be tried at least once. We did do room service one morning and it arrived on time and tasted as if it was just made. Dinner one night at Mix was fabulous. The Celebrity Chef definitely wants to impress! Great menu and very knowledgeable staff. Try to get seated on the balcony, but dress warm in the Fall. The starters to the main course to dessert were all perfect and it felt as though it wan an Iron Chef presentation! I don't think we totally are Vegas people but we would go back to just stay in The Hotel anytime!

Reviews.Title: “not "The" best”
Reviews.Author: khb9237
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights, Sept 16 and 17 2007 as part of a trip to Vegas for my birthday. We booked here because of the reviews on tripadv. and wanting a little quiet and rest in addition to visiting the strip madness. Let me also say that I am not a high maint. person and have been quite happy at holiday inns, disney and various hotels in NYC, I wont stay here again nor can I reccommed it to anyone else. The we had to switch rooms twice, I got sick because of wet carpeting and moldy smelling room and when we asked at 10 am, if we could please swtich rooms as I didnt think this one was ready for guests, we got snippy treatment at the front desk and were only allowed to get a new room after I said that we would like to check out and would try to Four Seasons instead. I also must say that I worked in hotels for over 5 years and try REALLY hard to be polite, tip generously and thank ALL the people that help us in any way. I was EXTREMELY displeased with the level of service, and general attitude of the front desk staff. In addition, we booked a package that inlcuded use of the spa facilities and when we went in to take a quick peek at the bathouse area the 'rottweiler' desk attendant could not have been more unpleasant and rude. We had hit or miss service in the restaurants in Mandalay Bay - The Red White and Blue cafe there is a waste of $ and the girl at the ice cream counter there was horrible. Again, I almost feel badly being so negative, because in general the more stressed out and rude someone is to me the nicer I try to be in return. Ive spent 25 years in customer service, sales you name it and was really taken aback at the treatment we recieved. The hotel is attractive, modern and sleek, the valet attendants were wonderful and the views - IF YOU ASK FOR A STRIP VIEW were lovely. Be prepared to hike 20 miles thru the Mandalay Bay lobby and casino to get to the pools, and be prepared for an ordeal if you want to charge ANYTHING to your room. Overall, I would stay at the regular Mandalay Bay, the Bellagio or the 4 Seasons if I ever return to Vegas. The Mirage pool area looked really nice if you want a cool pool, but I understand the rooms are very small there. The pool at the Mandalay Bay was fun and we spent a nice afternoon on the 'beach" but Ill bet in busier times its impossible to get a chair unless you are out there at 11am.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Vegas ever!”
Reviews.Author: Tober138
Reviews.Content: In years past, we've always chosen to stay at a different hotel on every trip to Vegas. After our recent stay at THEhotel, that will no longer be the case - hands down the best hotel we have ever stayed at in town and we plan to stay there again when we return next year. Connected to Mandalay Bay, this "boutique" hotel provided everything we needed on our recent trip both in terms of quality and service. The standard two-room suite was quite spacious, clean and well-appointed - the perfect environment for recovering from the excesses of the previous evening. Check-in was a breeze; although we arrived later in the evening, we never saw that long of a line at the desk during our stay - nothing which comes close to what we have seen at some of the main strip hotels in years past. As others have noted, the lobby is rather dark, but that was a plus for us. The decor, coupled with the lack of a casino of any kind in the lobby, was actually soothing after being around the bright lights, clanging slot machines and throngs to be found in the casinos and along the strip (the Mandalay casino is a brief walk down the hallway). It was enjoyable to be able to walk back to our room, or enjoy a drink at the lobby bar, without having to deal with all the noise and traffic that typically surrounds the lobby in the other hotels. In fact, if it wasn't for the view from our room, we might have forgotten that we were even in Vegas while in our room. Speaking of bars, the Mix Lounge on the top floor of the hotel offers one of the best views of the strip, second only to that from the Foundation Room at the top of Mandalay Bay. The beds and the sofa in the room were comfortable and we never heard our neighbors (and rarely heard any noise from the hallway) during our four nights there. A few reviews here have complained about long waits for room service; the two times we ordered found our food delivered within less than 30 minutes. Our interactions with the staff were always pleasant and we found them able to answer any questions that we had during our stay. In short - great rooms, excellent staff, and no problems whatsoever. A few reviews have mentioned that THEhotel is a bit pricey - this is true. But you do get what you pay for - and we found the place to be well worth the cost.
