However, if you are looking for a deal on a hotel room, or have an issue with the little charges for all the little things such as room service, etc. this is probably not the place for you. This is not the hotel for those looking for a $5.99 prime rib dinner or who go to Vegas planning on a hot night at the nickel slots. This is an upscale hotel, and prices and charges will reflect that. It has also been mentioned on here that THEhotel is not all that kid-friendly. I would agree with this and will gladly promote that fact - if only because the ambiance of the hotel would have been ruined by a bunch of kids running around (why do people even bring their kids to Vegas anyways?). All in all - a very hip, upscale hotel at the end of the strip that provides a perfect, relaxing atmosphere while in Vegas for those who enjoy finer establishments.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: LoraJae
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married at the Chapel at Mandalay Bay. We stayed at THE Hotel and are so happy we did. We just fell in love with THE Hotel. Loved the two rooms. And having two bathrooms was definitely a plus. Loved the ambiance of the room. So relaxing. The large TV in the living room was great. We used room service a few times and the food was wonderful. The wait was around 35 minutes. Not too bad. I was worried that the hotel would be too much of a walk to the casino and everything else. It was a bit of a hike to the pool and the chapel, but convenient to everything else. During our stay, we ate at House of Blues, RM Seafood, China Grill, Burger Bar, and The Café. We enjoyed every meal. The only downside was the $13 a day internet. But, hey that’s Vegas for you. We’ll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: tberry1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel on a Friday and Saturday night and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The rooms were gorgeous, comfortable and clean. I think I am pretty spoiled now by the size of the room and the decor. The staff was polite and professional. We also ate upstairs at Mix, the hotel restaurant, which, although quite pricey, was an excellent meal with an even better view. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: chitowntravelguy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at THE Hotel for 3 nights as part of a bachelor party. Overall we really liked the hotel and would recommend it to friends, albeit with a few caveats/tips. See pros and cons below for more detail: Pros: --The hotel had a stylish, modern feel similar to that of a W Hotel. --The rooms were great, really no complaints. Very comfortable beds, 2 bathrooms (not sure if that is the case in all rooms), excellent air conditioning, and 3 tv's. The main bathroom is better than almost any I've ever stayed in. Some people might complain about the view from the room, so if that's important to you, insist on a view of the Strip. Also, note that the sofa is not a pullout, so it is a challenge to sleep 3 people (though you can request a cot). --The hotel has a store in the lobby that sells snacks, toiletries, and beverages that is open late -- very nice for when you come home late and don't want to pay the high mini-bar fees or order expensive room service. --The pool area, though about 5-10 minutes away from the rooms, is a lot of fun. Wave pool, lazy river, good music, food easily available, etc. In particular, check out the club upstairs "Moorea" which has a $50 entry fee. It's smaller and has its own bar and pools that are slightly less crowded. Note that many of the women are topless (which can be good or bad depending on you and the crowd you're with--for a bachelor party, we enjoyed it). Frankly, we felt like were on the set of the HBO show "Entourage" --The casino is nice with lots of tables and a great sports room --There is a mall attached with some cool boutiques and restaurants Cons: --Everything is really expensive. If you're concerned about money, but still want to stay here, keep in mind that room service, restaurants, internet, the spa, and even some parts of the pool all have pretty stiff fees. Nothing free here. Even the public computer in the business center next to the front desks costs $15 for 30 minutes of use. --The cab lines can be REALLY long. You might want to try to arrange a limo or car service if you have a large group and/or don't want to wait in the long lines. The hotel is at the end of the strip and not walking distance to most of the other hotels in Vegas that you're likely to visit. At the very least, allow a lot of time to wait in line to get a cab. Also, here's a tip: the Four Seasons is in the same complex as Mandalay, and it's easier to get cabs there, and also easier to get dropped off there. --The front desk line can also be REALLY long. There must have been 20 people waiting on Friday afternoon, though admittedly most of the rest of the time it didn't seem too bad. You might want to make sure you can do express checkout on Sunday morning, which could also get busy (I left very early, so I'm not sure). --You need reservations for everything. If you want a cabana ($250, 4-5 people) or a bungalow ($500, 8-10 people) at the pool, make reservations well in advance (i.e., long before you arrive, they sell out days/weeks in advance). If you want to go any of the restaurants or clubs, MAKE A RESERVATION! This is true for everything...if there's one thing I would tell a friend about Vegas, it's this: make reservations for as many things as you can ahead of time!! It really makes visiting there a much more enjoyable experience. Try to plan out where you're having dinner and what clubs you're going to on what nights, and make reservations! If you think you're just going to walk into places, or make reservations after you arrive, you're going to be very frustrated (unless you're a group of women). I have now stayed at Harrah's, The Palms, and THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay. Though The Palms has some cool clubs, I really liked the room and atmosphere at THE Hotel so it would probably be my favorite of the three hotels. If they cut out some of the nickel and diming, reduced the front desk line, and did a better job of helping hotel guests get into some of the restaurants and clubs in the complex, I'd give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: MLBKRB
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel!! The rooms were huge and very well kept. We had new towels and our bed was made and we had new toiletries everyday. The staff was great from the moment we checked in until the moment we checked out. Anything we needed we got, from VIP tickets to the clubs to a key to the mini bar!! Everything was very well maintained, with fresh flowers being replaced in the lobby everyday. The casino was great, even though smoking is allowed in there you could not smell it at all. The food was great at all the restaurants, yet a little expensive, and surprisingly room service was also really good and also really expensive. It cost $50 for 3 of us to have a small breakfast. I traveled with a group of people and we had about 10 rooms. The only things that we had to complain about was the fact that one tv didn't work and a couple of rooms didn't get access to there mini bar. The pool was amazing. We never had trouble getting a towel, a tube or a place to sit. One thing that I was shocked about was if you don't have the DO NOT DISTURB light on housekeeping will just let themselves into your room even if you do no have that light on. The clubs in there were also fun but super expensive. We had my bachelorette party at the Rum Jungle at it was $13 for a mixed drink. We also went to MIX and found it to be extremely high priced, not to mention a very strict dress code. All in all I would stay here again, and would recommend it to anyone!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Still Great As Far As We're Concerned”
Reviews.Author: buffgirl73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 nights in Aug / Sep and were just as pleased with the service and accommodations as last time. The rooms were clean and tidy as usual and the service we received from check in, to check out was quick and courteous. I requested a high floor when we checked in and promptly got it and despite arriving around the busy time, only had to wait for about 5 minutes. Personally we haven't had any bad experiences with the staff. This was the first time we've stayed at THEhotel in the Summer and we were looking forward to using the pool etc. Yes, it was busy but because it was so hot, it never seemed to be totally rammed and we thought the wave pool was great. There are loads of kids around, and not having them ourselves, we thought this may prove to be a downer, but the place was big enough for all of us!!! The drinks service is a lifesaver as well, and I don't think it was too expensive. Saves getting up as far as I'm concerned! We were at the hotel during Labour Day weekend, and even then, room service was pretty good and they always set expectations as to the timescale for delivery, and it always came quicker, can't argue with that. The only disappointment we found was the reduction in the size of the menu at Raffles Cafe, saying that though, if you like a good steak and a great atmosphere, you must visit the Steakhouse in the Mandalay, it's amazing. The rates we got were direct with the hotel and we found them to be very reasonable although we did have a host which does help I think :) We would (and are) definitely go back and I would recommend this hotel to anyone who likes to have a bit of peace and quiet whilst only being a few minutes walk from the centre of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Hated It”
Reviews.Author: syreetab22
Reviews.Content: To sum it all up, the house keeping threw my night guard and colored contacts and contact cases always. I felt no compassion from the staff when i called in my Complaint. It was a chase to get their risk management Dept on the phone and when I did they were very rude. I was then in formed about the Nevada’s innkeeper statute, which prevents the Mandalaybay from being liable for my missing things. So much of my vacation time was wasted on this trip dealing whit their rude staff. This whole experience has traumatized me, and made my trip offal. -Syreeta

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - but depends what you want from your Vegas experience!”
Reviews.Author: missie22
Reviews.Content: I have visited Vegas 7 times - and have stayed in every level and standard of hotel - so I do think we know a thing or two about Vegas! The hotel is one of the newer and higher priced hotels. It is a fantastic hotel - but lots of the hotels are in Vegas, so you just have to consider what it is that you want from your trip. For me, the accomodation was fantastic, the rooms are stylish and you get a plasma in the spacious lounge, the bedroom and the bathroom. The rooms are furnished in boutique hotel style and are really stylish. The bed was one of the comfiest ever, and the bathroom amazing (for those who read my reviews will know that the bathroom is very important!), it had the deepest bath ever, not very eco friendly to use it, but fab, a walk in shower and twin sinks - just fantastic. The hotel itself, because it is attached to the Mandalay Bay doesnt have all the major facilities of its own, the gym is fantastic, but you do have to trek a long way to the pool. Also, because the Manadalay bay pool has a lazy river and a wave machine it does tend to be one of the hotels that attracts a lot of kids. The pool, was the thing I was looking forward to most, and was the thing I was most disapointed with. It was really busy (not the hotels fault), but it was teeming with kids (it was summer holidays) but was also so noisy, pumping loud music out from every area - there was no escape - its not a relaxing pool area. The pool at the Bellagio (from previous visits) was for me much better as you can get away from the loud music if you want and can actually relax and the space versus the number of people is much greater. The hotel, does have a great gym - although even as a guest you have to pay twenty dollars a day for the privelige of using it (fairly normal for Vegas though). The Bathouse Spa, although very stylish and with great facilities disapointed me a little as there is no unisex area and I like to go to the spa with my partner. The bar areas in The hotel - particularly the fantastic Mix bar at the top of the hotel are worth a visit. The view is great and it is uber cool...check out the toilets....floor to celiling windows - you can see out, but you hope no one can see in!! The hotel and the Mandalay itself are positioned at the top end of the strip so you really do need to get a taxi everywhere - I prefer staying at The Bellagio or something nearer the middle of the strio so that you can wander our and about easily and enjoy the atmosphere. To sum up,. you cant knock the place - but for me, you can't beat the Bellagio for position, service and the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Its good but ,read on”
Reviews.Author: Smaaaarty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August the 4 of us and liked it very much ,when you enter the hotel you can feal you have reached a high class hotel the nice marbled hallway with the shiny floor tiles and funky music sets the scene.The check-in was smooth and asked politely for a nice strip view and she said no problem you got it ,great i said ,good start? but when we opened our room our view was a parking lot and a highway i was shocked ,i phoned check-in and complained and got a great view the day after looking towards the Luxor and strip .The room is real nice with 2 amazing comfortable beds and the living area had a huge tv ,the bathroom was nice but never supplied enough shampoo etc etc for 4 people and the towels were very hard not fluffy soft the way i like them.In all except for the few minor faults this hotel is good but cant say it was great ,the money you pay is a lot and the fine details should be perfect ,would i stay here again i might say yes but im not sure 50/50.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED TheHotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: J M
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with friends, under the impression we were staying at Mandalay Bay, which was great - we love it. But upon check-in, we were told we were in TheHotel. Wow - what a great hotel! Rooms were huge, 2 room suites, to be exact. Big bathroom, with HUGE soaking tub. Big flat screen tvs in living room & bedroom and smaller one in bathroom. Comfortable bed, great view of the pool. Awesome stay. Will definitely go there again! (as a side note, the Four Seasons Spa was incredible!)

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL ROOMS- Great for groups!!!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel2929
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a three night stay at THEhotel with 12 people (four in each room). The rooms were great! What a treat to have an extra half bath, and for the den area to be separated from the bedroom area. The beds were so comfortable and the main bathroom was huge. I loved the shower. TV's in every room. Check in was quick and easy-- they let part of our group check in around 9:30 AM! Wow! I requested all three rooms on the same floor- that wasn't a problem at all. We also paid $30 for a day pass to Bathhouse (the spa) and had so much fun lounging around and using the hot tubs, steam room, etc. It has such a relaxing atmosphere. The front desk didn't always immediately answer the phone, and the service at the Border Grill was pretty slow, but other than that it was great. The Burger Bar was very good and had very good prices. The pool was fun, we all loved the lazy river. I wouldn't suggest going to the Moorea area of the pool unless you are guaranteed a chair- we went in for five minutes and left because it was so crowded (they did give us our money back). Not sure I would waste money on a basic cabana either, they weren't all that impressive. The upgraded cabanas were very nice. They don't have a grand entrance- your cab actually drops you off in the parking garage, but the lobby is nice once you get in the door. We we worried about being so far down the strip it would be hard for us to get anywhere, but it was actually easier b/c they either took the interstate or back roads, so we never had to sit in traffic on the strip. I would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “THEhotel is gorgeous!!!”
Reviews.Author: ninabean
Reviews.Content: After being told just before arrival that they no longer had a two bedded room available, we arrived with some trepidation. All our fears were unfounded. Check in was quick and easy and the staff super efficient and friendly. We were allocated an upper floor room with side strip view. The room was amazing..... spacious, clean, modern. Even the bedroom (with two queen beds in ) had loads of room and storage. Room service was pricey, but quick. Housekeeping perfect. The distance to the pool was not a problem, it never took us longer than 5mins to walk there, and WOW what a pool!. The stunning lobby and lounge area was relaxing. The Mandalay shopping mall and restaurants were all amazing. We have never stayed anywhere so beauiful before and after visiting all the hotels on the strip we remain delighted with our choice. We moved to The Orleans for the last few nights of our stay which was fantastic value but obviously not a patch on THhotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Suite”
Reviews.Author: valebaruch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay in Vegas: they upgrade our room to a Honeymoon Suite. It was just so perfect. Great king size bed and great crispy fresh linens. Jacuzzi and large shower made it even more enjoyable. Look for the Promotions on the hotel website, we paid just 119 dollars for the night. Must see.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent holiday at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay”
Reviews.Author: CathyWhittall
Reviews.Content: I agree with everything said in the last review. We stayed in a 2 roomed suite, huge bathroom, 2 wc's perfect for a family of 5. Everything you need under one roof, a long list of restaurants, bars, cafes, shopping. Huge pool complex. We hired a cabana for a few days, excellent service, complimentary soft drinks, fridge, plasma screen, free rings for the lazy river. Well worth the money, felt very spoilt. We ate at the House of Blues a few times, fab southern style comfort food. Italian good food, great wine list, great buffet breakfasts in the Bayside Buffet. Lots to do for kids of ALL ages. If you think Vegas is tacky, this hotel will change your mind. Helicopter flight through Grand Canyon, excellent! After six days here we then went onto New York and Boston.

Reviews.Title: “THE Best Hotel In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: VegasBabyC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at THE hotel from August 19th through the 24th. It was an absolute amazing experience. We were booked at the regular Mandalay Bay Hotel, but when using the front desk tip trick, we were upgraded to THE hotel. The rooms were very spacious and comfortable. I read some of the other reviews, and the talk about small closet space is ridiculous. My wife and I had more than enough room in the closets and there was even room for the additional clothes she bought when she went shopping! The smell that hits you when you walk into THE hotel is great. I think they pump some kind of jasmine or something else, but it really refreshes you and is much more pleasant than the normal smell of a smoky Vegas casino. Speaking of the casino, it is just a short walk from the entrance to THE hotel and all of its noise is kept away from you. The Mandalay Palace is right by the entrance to the casino which gives you quick access to many shops, restaurants and ultimately leads you to the Luxor. If you have to pick one spot, eat at the Burger Bar. Sit at the counter too, to get served quicker. The Kobe Beef Burger was the best burger I have ever eaten. The pool is somewhat of a walk from THE hotel, but if you learn a short cut through the casino, it isn’t all that bad. Be sure to stop at your local Target before going to this pool so that you can purchase a tube for the lazy river, otherwise it will cost you $20 for a Mandalay Bay tube. The wave pool is absolutely awesome, just be sure to get there early because it can get jammed up with children later in the day. It was an out of this world experience to be in the middle of the desert in Las Vegas and sit by a wave pool with a beach. The casino is very open and spacious, however the tables have fairly high minimums (no lower than $15 during the night and $10 during the day). I spent most of my time at the poker table, which was a very pleasant experience. The Sports book is possibly one of the biggest in Vegas. For food, all of Mandalay Bay’s restaurants are available to you. The buffet was decent. If you go to it, be sure to have some of the chocolate candle cake, it was the best cake I have ever eaten. The Shanghai Lilly was excellent. My wife and I ate there on one of our last nights. It was a little pricey, but the meal is out of this world and the deserts will leave you speechless. My wife checked out THE bathhouse and said that it was an excellent spa, so I guess I would have to recommend that as well. In conclusion, my wife and I both agree that we will never stay at another place when going to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “the Best Hotel in Las Vegas hands Down!”
Reviews.Author: kayciereyes
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. I had a rate of $150 for my stay during a promotion. BEST HOTEL in Las Vegas, just blowing it out of the water with such a modern design. LOVED it and service was impeccable. Front Desk was AMAZING. For such a large property, I was extremely supprised that they can keep their personalities up with so many people staying there. All my friends from San Diego stay at this hotel if they're looking for the modern chic boutique hotel feel. LOVE LOVE LOVE IT! The Bathhouse was ALSO amazing. The option to go nude is awesome. Even if I was paying 700+ for my room,, I would've definetly gotten my money's worth. Loved the amenities as well! Everything so cleverly designed. Jacuzzi tubs in every room. FAB!

Reviews.Title: “Was very impressed”
Reviews.Author: YngBizTrvl
Reviews.Content: To start I think that you have to know who is writing a review before you can know if it applies to you or not. A family is going to react differently compared to an older couple compared to a single bachelor. Im 29, male and single and went with a large group of friends who got several rooms. I travel on business several times a month.I have stayed at the Bellagio, TI and others and found THE hotel to be the best. To start, if you have American Express you should definately book your room with them. I had received a considerable discount on my room compared to what my friends were paying via Expedia. On top of that I got a total of $120 to be spent in the cafe or restaurant and $100 dollars to spend at the spa. The best part of it was the room situation. They gave me the highet floor, 4 pm check out (which is crucial in vegas) and guaranteed me 2 queen beds. You would only get this through the Fine Hotels and Resorts Program with a platinum or black amex. The late check out is crucial because in vegas most flights leave later and you are stuck in the casinos on your last day. This is intentional and all my friends ended up cramming into my room on the last day. At the end of any vegas trip youll be exhausted and you definately want the room as late as possible. I travel constantly and the FHR program with amex is great. Ok, so the lines that people are writing about are actually not as bad as in other hotels. I checked in at primetime and there was NO ONE in line. When i checked out I had a 20 minute wait, which is nothing in Vegas. The only reason I checked out at all is I needed to split my charges, otherwise you just walk out and they check you out (there is also a drop box by the elevators to drop off your keys). The smells people are talking about are one othe best reasons to stay at this hotel. The aromatherapy is not unlike the smae one used by Sony in their mall stores. It is similar to the scents used in their bath products which are amazing also. I will say that on the last day my room reeked of cigarettes because somewhere on my floor someone smoked even though it was a nonsmoking floor. This is not the hotels fault, in Vegas stuff like that will always happen. I called, they offered to switch me and I decided agasint it since I was so tired. The people that work here were nothing but EXTREMELY professional and clean. I stay in many nice hotels, they were the best I had ever seen. The Ritz, the Bellagio, none compare to these people. The hotel itself is gorgeous, absolutely gorgeous. It is small, secluded and very elite feeling. Exiting an elevator to the sounds of a thousand slot machines is awful. I gamble, but I like the seclusion I feel in THE hotel. The distance to the Mandalay casino is about 100 feet and somehow they are able to completely hide the noise. The rooms are the best value in Vegas. I am used to being upgraded to suites in any hotel I stay in and I was concerned that since I was getting two queen beds (they only have regular, not V suites with 2 queens) that I would not like the room. I was VERY surprised and delighted to get such a room. It was clean and updated. This is in contrast to most rooms in Vegas (like the Bellagio) which are small, overpriced and too dark. We got a table at the club there called "Mix" and I have yet to see a prettier bar in my life. Its on the 60-something floor and has an outdoor area. It was gorgeous and I highly recommend it, and highly recommend you get a table outside, you are going to spend money anyway. I stay in hotels all over the country and Vegas. This is the best deal out there folks.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky Hideaway on the Other Side of Mandalay Bay, could be improved”
Reviews.Author: RissesPieces
Reviews.Content: I actually booked for Mandalay Bay, and after arriving late, was checked in for THEHotel instead It was my first stay at THEHotel, and "swanky" was all I kept hearing in my head when I was walking through THEHotel's lobby, lounge, and other common areas. We stayed in the basic 1-bedroom suite, which has a lot of upgrades: TVs in the living room, bedroom, and bathroom A guest half bath and a wet bar was also in the living area. I was amused by seeing variations of THEHotel brand on all of the things within the room: "THEtp" sticker on the toilet paper, "THEpad" on the notepad, "THEdoodles" on the large desk blotter. The only negatives were that the room needed a little maintenance. A lamp was out, one of the sinks had a stopper that wouldn't release, the shower temperature was difficult to set. Also, it's a very LONG walk from THEHotel to the Mandalay Beach pool area. The room decor was also a little dark and heavy for my taste. It was more masculine, i suppose. I wasn't sure if the duvet had a duvet cover that was washed after ever guest left, which made me a little leery of it. After having stayed in some of the best rooms at Caesar's and at the Wynn and Venetian, I suppose I expected more from THEHotel. I wonder if the fact that the living area and bedroom was separated by a wall and door, in addition to the dark decor made the living area especially feel a little small and a bit claustrophobic. But on the upside, the bathtub filled up fast, and the beds were very comfortable. The a/c was responsive. And there was a lot of closet space. And I liked the one-touch indicator at the door for housekeeping or do not disturb notification. Overall, a nice stay, but it wasn't quite a 5 because of the few flaws.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Sportsguy6524
Reviews.Content: Stayed at THEHotel Aug 8-15/07. Had booked back in March based on much Internet surfing and with research and recommendation from several travel books (e.g. Frommer's). Had never been to Vegas before, and wanted the first trip to be special as my wife and I had never been away on holiday before without kids in 14 years of marriage (never had a honeymoon). Read all reviews prior to leaving on trip and frankly was getting a bit nervous before departure based on several bad reviews that seemed to have a couple of common themes (room thefts, poor service, smell, cost, etc.). Perhaps because of these negative reviews, we arrived at the THEHotel expecting to be disappointed. I can honestly say that we were NOT disappointed! Our room was fabulous! All of the suites at the THEHotel are essentially the same, so no need to discuss the excellent amenities such as the 2 bathrooms, double sinks in the ensuite bath, granite counter tops, large flat-screen TV's, 14" flat screen in ensuite bath, etc. The furniture and carpet were in very good condition (unlike several reviews I recently read stating otherwise). I had booked a king bed suite, but tried the "20 dollar trick" at check in to guarantee not only a king bed but also a strip view on a high floor. We had a late check-in (near midnight), so I only half-expected the $20 dollar trick to work, thinking the hotel was probably close to full already. When the desk clerk asked for my ID at check-in, I pulled out my ID and credit card, clearly showing her the $20 bill. As I handed over the ID, I asked if there was any way she could GUARANTEE a king bed and a room that was high-up with a strip view. After checking, she said they were pretty much full for the night and could not, but she COULD certainly set it up in the computer for a room change the next day. She informed me all I had to do was call by 2pm the next day and they would provide our new room number. Given her cooperativeness, I offered her my credit card and the $20 tip "for her extra trouble". She accepted very appreciatively. Our room was high up (31st floor) and had a king bed, but it was only a partial strip view (it faced east towards the airport - the strip could partially be seen looking "sideways" to the north). Called at noon the next day to get our upgrade. Imagine my surprise when they claimed there was no room change documented in the system! They claimed that they do not guarantee views, only upgrades such as 2 queens to a king or smoking to non-smoking, hence the reason it was not in the system! I told them I was very disappointed because I was led to believe the change was all set up the previous night. I was put on hold for a minute and was then told they had a strip view for me on the 15th floor (really too low to see the strip around the Luxor). I again expressed how disappointed I was and felt I was led astray based on what I was previously told. Again I was asked to hold, after which they somehow "managed" to find me a strip view on the 33rd floor! We happily checked in to our fabulous strip view! I have to say that the 20 dollar trick itself was not successful, but my persistence and repeated expression of disappointment seemed to work in the end! With regards to the some of the negative reviews on THE Hotel I offer the following: 1)Service overall was pleasant and they seemed eager to help, although still not sure what happened with my original check-in. At check out, clerk was not overly friendly, but who cares? I was leaving anyway. Housekeeping was excellent! Never had an interruption and every day we returned to a perfectly made up room with all amenities replenished (left a nice tip in appreciation). 2) The "smell" that some have complained about is an incense-like aroma that they circulate through the air system. You may not like that particular scent, but all the strip hotels do the same with a variety of smells. Having said that, on our second last day in the room, we did catch a very faint "sewer smell", but it seemed to disappear in about an hour. 3) We used the in-room safe for all our "valuables" when we were not there, so obviously theft was no issue. Just common sense in my opinion... 4) The shower in our second room did have some problems maintaining constant water temperature (read other reviews complaining about the same thing). More of a nuisance rather than a complaint. 5) Location: If you are not renting a car, you may want to stay closer to center of strip to avoid walking or taking trams/other transportation. Walking down strip normally would be fine (outside of summer), but a bit tough in 110F heat dressed up for a show! We had a rental car and did not find the drive down the strip too bad except one night where there were 2 separate fender benders - took 1 hour from Mandalay Bay to Mirage. Also did several day trips (Grand Canyon, Hoover Dam, Primm, NEV Outlet Mall) and it was MORE convenient at THEHotel to get out of town. 6) Price/expensive: Found THEHotel a bargain for the room you get. Paid about 50% more (room averaged about $220US per night inc. tax) than I pay for a Super 8 or equivalent standard room in Canada in summer season, and THEHotel suites are far from "standard"! Food/restaurants on par with any other major hotel on the strip. If you want a bargain, go to Freemont Street downtown...you won't find many ANYWHERE on the strip itself! 7) Casino overall seemed to be less crowded than most big hotels on the center of the strip (especially week nights). If you want high-energy and action in a casino, Mandalay Bay is probably not the place for you. If you like a quiter, less crowded atmosphere, gamble here. 8) Nightlife: Did not really partake in the club scene, but the "rumjungle" club seemed to be the place to be. It was as popular or perhaps more so than any other club I saw on the strip - weekday or weekend. 9) THEHotel Entrance: Not "grand" like the other hotels on the strip, including Mandalay Bay itself. In fact, it's a downright shabby entrance via the parking garage. However, I would rather pay for the room I am staying in instead of the marble and architecture at the revolving door! Overall, loved THEHotel. If not for a couple of minor issues, would have ranked it a 5/5. Would definitley stay here again, but probably won't next time in order to try out something else on the strip for comparison purposes.

Reviews.Title: “THE Best Hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MVSRMom
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Las Vegas and we didn't know what to expect since we had our young children with us. This hotel was fabulous. It was clean, sleek and contemporary and the staff was beyond nice and courteous. We checked out a lot of the other hotels on the strip and decided that we liked THEhotel at Mandalay Bay the best. It is much more family oriented. When you walk into the lobby, it's peaceful, serene and smells wonderful! There's no smoke and loud clanking noise of the casino nearby (although there is one). The wave pool and lazy river were a huge hit with the kids and the adults. There were also other standard type pools if you want quiet and distance from the crowds. It was hard getting the kids out of the lazy river -- it was a lot of fun! You should definitely buy a donut float locally and take it with you. I bought one at a toy store on sale for $2.50. I needed another one when we got there and couldn't find one anywhere at the stores near the hotel. The hotel sells a basic one for $16.00 or you can rent a nice one for $20/day. The downside was that the pools were a good walk from the hotel and they don't allow you to bring in a cooler. It got really hot and was hard to keep the kids hydrated on lukewarm bottled water. But, this was a small inconvenience compared to the wonderful time everyone had. All the rooms are suites and very clean and spacious. The extra 1/2 bath was really nice to have and very convenient. The main bathroom was large and comfortable. The couch does not fold out to a bed so you need to take that into consideration when getting a king bed room or a double queen bed room (which are not always available). They do have roll-away beds and mini refridgerator that you can rent (although they comp'd both for us since they didn't have a double queen room available, which we appreciated very much). We plan on going back to Las Vegas with the kids and the only place that we would consider staying at is THEhotel at Mandalay Bay!

Reviews.Title: “Great romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Shanester81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay 12-14 August. We had a great time there it was great for a romantic getaway. The room was superb we had no problems with the bed or the layout of the room and sitting room. The bathroom was great with a tub and shower with great amenities. The dual sink and toilets came in handy as well so we never had to wait on each other to get done or get ready. We had no real problems with our room, internet was slow and it did not get super cold in the bedroom but it was small stuff nothing dramatic. We had no problems with hotel employee's being rude, housekeeping stealing stuff, or funky smells we actually liked the flower smell in the hotel. This is not a hotel for families as I did not hardly see any children at this hotel unlike other ones on the strip where parents were letting their kids run rampant at all hours of the day and night. We would definately stay here again and would recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Miss Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BermudaKay
Reviews.Content: Even though I haven't stayed here in a couple years I was surprised at some of the negative comments. Mandalay Bay is now outrageously priced compared to the other Casinos but they do have the best rooms. Even though it's on the end of the strip the L takes you right to Excaliber where you can easily walk to other places. If you like a late breakfast/early lunch go to the buffet. Although it's not cheap, if you go about 10:30 to 11:00 you can start with breakfast and then also have lunch. Staff is friendly and they let you relax and stay as long as you wish. No matter where we stay in Vegas we always make the trek over for brunch. Gambling is so, so. Alot of the machines appear old and I've never seen it busy there. Shark habitat is not worth the hour wait.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting service”
Reviews.Author: foodie192
Reviews.Content: The service was far from 4 or 5 star. Being both new visitors to Las vegas and the USA, this hotel and its rude staff have put us off visiting the USA forever. Never again under any circumstances. Expect room service to deliver your food at least 5 hours after you place your order, bu of course only after you follow up with several phone calls. The staff really pay no attention and act as though they are doing you a huge favor by letting you stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Very luxurious hotel...”
Reviews.Author: 04302010a
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Vegas for 4 nights at THE Hotel before flying to Hawaii for a week. After researching most hotels in Vegas, we were very keen to stay in this hotel as all the others were typical Vegas glitzy decor, whereas we fancied something a bit more modern. The decor was gorgeous and all rooms are suites. We had 2 bathrooms and the main one had a shower and a seperate bath with additional shower! No complaints about the hotel. We got a good rate on Expedia for the deluxe suite. All in all, beautiful hotel in a great city!!

Reviews.Title: “Not for the Adult Getaway”
Reviews.Author: MaryPat850
Reviews.Content: My husband and I picked THEhotel at Mandalay for our anniversary getaway because it appeared to have an upscale, exclusive feel. Based on our own experiences and the experiences of close friends and family, it was a considerable leap of faith to stay anywhere but the Bellagio. However, the Mandalay Bay website was geared toward good service, adult relaxation, and entertainment. When we arrived, it was clear we could not have been more wrong. The service was slow, unapologetic, inconvenient, and borderline rude. Everything that was negative (no, your room isn't ready, no we don't have that available even though you booked it, no we can't help you store your bags) was said with a condescending and dismissive smile. The restaurants were average and incredibly expensive, even for Vegas. The highly acclaimed pools were swarmed with children and unattentive parents. The one adult pool cost us $50 for the day. No employee seemed to be supervised or held to any sort of code of exceptional service; in fact, many were uniformed, ignorant, and rude. No employee went out of their way to help us or answer questions. Our room was just okay for the money we paid, had a terrible view, and was only cleaned after calling housekeeping ourselves. Worst is the location. It is far from anything else you'd want to see on the strip, and navigating your way to the sites is difficult and cumbersome.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: CtheGlobe77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Hotel in April 2007 because of a business conference. I didn't know what to expect as I hadn't heard much about the hotel itself. It's actually very beautiful. The decor is modern with an Asian flare. The staff is efficient and the rooms are very nice. My only complaint was that I was dropped off at the Mandalay Bay entrance and had to wait forever and a day to check in. Once I checked in I had to trek what seemed like miles across the casino to the THEhotel section of the property. Next time, I'll tell the cab driver to specficially drop me off at THEhotel entrance. :) I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: cncinlcf
Reviews.Content: Entry way was lovely and smelled like coconuts, but we like coconut so there you are. Beautiful floral arrangements greet the eye upon entry. The place is beautiful. The desk clerk was very friendly and gave us a free upgrade on the 34th floor with a great view of the Luxor. (We stayed in the Luxor the next night and enjoyed the view of Luxor from The Hotel better than we enjoyed actually being in the Luxor, where we were repeatedly hit on for time shares.) 3 flat screen TVs, 2 person tub (hubba hubba!), beautifully furnished, very comfortable bed. Quiet but close to the action. The pools were great! Lots of great restaurants to choose from close by. Don't believe the other crummy reviews--this place is terrific and we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “THEhotel at Mandalay Bay... THEbest hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: R_Kernohan
Reviews.Content: The Hotel (spelt THEhotel) is one of the very best hotels in Las Vegas. I travel the world on vacation and this is up there with the very best. I was planning on staying in Las Vegas for 10 nights on vacation so I wanted a hotel that offered good rooms, good pool area and great restaurants. The Mandalay happens to offer the BIGGEST pool in the city with it's very own beach and wave machine. The adjoining 'suite only' boutique hotel, offered a great level of service throughout my stay with only a very short 200m walk into it's big brother hotel, The Mandalay. The complex offers the best of both worlds with all the great restaurants and casino in the main hotel and a more relaxing atmosphere from the reception, bars and restaurant of THEhotel. Of an evening I can highly recommend the top floor bar in THEhotel. Two glass elevators take you to the top floor bar... 'MIX'. It has an open area balcony allowing you to take in the sunsets of Southern Nevada. After a day or evening in the casinos, it was great to enter a quiet zone, free from the ching, ching of the slots... just the sounds of people enjoying each others company in the bar area. The Mandalay Bay Resort is not on the strip... but a regular free monorail takes you though The Luxor and onto the main Las Vegas Boulevard in less than 5 minutes. I have no complaints and if I was visiting Vegas again, I would not consider any other hotel. This hotel is not called 'THEhotel' for nothing... R.Kernohan. NORTHERN IRELAND. U.K.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointed”
Reviews.Author: pks17
Reviews.Content: The pool was very expensive to drink at.$12.00 for a 12oz drink. Unreal! At least make a good Margarita if you are going to charge that much. $8.00 for a bottle of beer. $40.00 for 5 beers in a bucket with ice which is a must when the temp is in the 90's. Too much money though. However, drink prices in Vegas in general are very high. So very unfair when you consider how much you are paying for rooms and shows and gambling. The mix restraunt was very good. The best thing they have going. After we had diner we stayed around for the club to pick up. I ordered the same martini that I had in their restraunt and it was not the same. I tried it again from a differant bartender and it was even worse. when I asked if the restraunt had their own bar he replied yes and told me that the drink was differant because they use a premix. well It was much better I told him. He didn't seem to care at all. Poor service at the bar in Mix club. Be prepared to wait even when not busy we found. The music was terrible. The DJ keep messing with the volume in the beggining and the music was not good. On our way down in the elevator the manager confirmed that the last two nights were off nights and did not know what was wrong. We suggested get rid of the DJ.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: saminwp
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at Bellagio or Venetian but we wanted to use the great beach pool at the Mandaley Bay Hotel so we've decided to give this hotel a try. I guess my expectation was too high but this hotel is good but nowhere near great among the hotels in Vegas. First, the smell... upon arrival at the hotel lobby, I was overwhelmed by this very strange smell. It reminded me of very cheap car fragrance piece. Very unnatural and too strong. Some may love the smell but many would hate it and you can't get rid of it. Fortunately the smell didn't fill the room but it did pretty much everywhere else. It should be more neutral and natural smell. Then the service.. not to mention the very unfriendly front clark but what surprised me most was the house keeping. In the morning, I left the room for breakfast and put up the sign 'don't disturb' and few hours later I came back to the room, the room was cleaned. While I was taking a nap late afternoon, again with the 'don't disturb' sign on, I was interupted my sleep with a door bell and someone wanted to check my room for some unknown reason. Well trained staff in a high end hotel would never do those things. Those 'little things' sometimes make big difference when we stay at supposedly 'great hotels'.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StuH29
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was Fantastic, it has just about everything you can wish for in a Hotel. The Suites are very modern looking, some will say a little dark. Not a problem at all. Has everything you need, 3 TVs, 2 bathrooms, Internet/Fax Connection. The Hotel is part of Mandalay bay and is linked directly. Although THE HOTEL has its own cafe bar and retaurant. There are many more in MB. The complex also houses a large shopping centre. The Blues Bar is a Must, as is the Burger Bar for Lunch. If i went back to Vegas, i would probably try a different Hotel, although just for comparison as this one was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Our 25th Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: travelsatlast
Reviews.Content: We had this hotel booked for 5 months and had been assured verbally by the hotel that we would have a room high enough for a good view of the strip and we would get a complimentary bottle of champayne for our 25th anniversary. Unfortunately, when we arrived we had a choice of being on the 3rd floor with no view or a higher floor and being in a handicapped room meaning the layout of the bathroom would be different. There would be no complimentary champayne but we were given a room service credit instead to be used for food only with no alcohol credit. The room was just like the pictures on the website with the exception of the bathroom. It was clean, however we were constantly interrupted in the mornings by the service attendants even with our lighted do not disturb light and double locked door. The 2nd day we were not given washcloths nor soap, shampoo, or conditioner. The 3rd day we finally had to call for soap since once again we were not given soap, shampoo or conditioner. The room was very nice but the service was bad. Room service took at least a hour every time you called. One night it was 90 minutes and this was at 2 a.m. I am very surprised for an all suite hotel that it lacks good customer service and having to ask for soap and shampoo and washcloths is pitiful for a 5 star hotel. It is doubtful we would stay here again as the service was below average and having the handicapped room and "mountain" view we had for our 25th anniversary is not what we had wanted as part of our memories. I just hope that a handicapped person was not turned away who needed this room.

Reviews.Title: “Be Prepared to Spend $$$$”
Reviews.Author: Dana4U
Reviews.Content: This was our 13th annual pilgrimage to Vegas. We have stayed many places and have visited during each of the 4 midwest seasons. This was our 2nd stay at The Hotel and 5th to the Mandalay Bay complex (2 other times at Mandalay Bay itself and once at the Four Seasons). It seems to me that the cost of everything at The Hotel has increased ... including the topless pool (Moorea Beach Club). Breakfast inside The Hotel will set you back $35/couple; lunch at Moorea Bay is about the same; drinks during the day poolside is $100; access into the pool is $50/male and $10/female; and everyone associated with The Hotel has their hand out waiting to be tipped. You would think that if you stayed at their property you would have free access to the nightclub (The Mix) - but you do have to pay $10/person on Friday and Saturday nights. You also get to wait in the common folk line while every other VIP person goes into the club before you. Health club access is $20/person if you only use the exercise equipment - if you want to use the spa facilities, throw in another $15/person - so now you are out $35/pp/day. Want a massage - buck up another $150. The cost of the rooms are higher than that of the Four Seasons, and while the rooms are very nice, how often do you really need an extra room with a couch and second bathroom? For two people, this seems like a waste ... but I already knew this going in. Met great people at the Moorea Beach Club - but two other girls and me were the only ones that were topless. The bulk majority of girls keep the tops on. Not a show stopper - but you seem somewhat out-of-place in a place that was designated for European sunbathing. The other girls I chatted with said that the Wynn and Caesars have many other European sunbathers and do not charge a separate access fee. Check-in this time was smooth, however, we asked for a view when we checked-in and was given a room on the 8th floor. It was a great view of the parking deck. So we went back to the front desk and they re-assigned us to the 38th floor. Much better view the second time around. All-in-all, we had a great time, but were somewhat taken back by the high cost of everything. Probably won't go back for the next four or five trips. Four Seasons is less expensive and you don't have to pay for every single activity.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Hoppy07
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 9 night stay at this hotel for our honeymoon. What a fantastic hotel with excellent staff! We were recommened this hotel by a friend who works in the travel industry and described this hotel as the best in Vegas! and I believe it is. It suited us as we wanted to relax (as well as see all there is to see in Vegas) and because this hotel doesn't have a casino actually in it (there is one next door at the Mandalay bay though) then it has a more relaxed feel about it. The decor is also amazing! I believe all the rooms are suites here and if our room was anything to go by then they are amazing. The house-keeping staff were also excellent. Can't fault this place! would love to go back here!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: tam65
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Las Vegas. We stayed 4 nights at The Hotel. From the time we entered the lobby, we were amazed. It was very clean. We were a little nervous because we never seem to get a room with a good view. After reading the reviews here, we asked about upgrades as soon as we registered. We gave the guy checking us in a $20 tip and had a room with a great strip view. It was well worth it! I usually can't wait to hit the strip, but I was happy just sitting in the hotel. We took our children (ages 8 & 15) and they loved the room. It was nice having the extra 1/2 bath too. We splurged and rented a cabana for one day at the beach. Even though the price seemed a little high, we were happy we had it. It was great not to have to try and find shade when we got tired. The cabana host was always around asking if we needed anything. We did think the drinks were too expensive. It cost $7 for a beer and $12.50 for a mixed drink. Water and soda were included with our cabana. Usually I can't wait to come home after a few days in Vegas, but I wish we could have stayed longer this time. I would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay (Don't Upgrade)”
Reviews.Author: dgantt
Reviews.Content: My third stay at THEhotel (for 3 nights) was just as good as ever. Important note: Although the standard rooms are the best in town (utilizing two separate living areas, instead of a mere "step-down" concept such as The Venetian's); strangely enough, this first occasion for an upgraded room (to the "V Suite") was actually a disappointment. The miniscule increase in space was barely noticeable, and the muted decor (read that: "stark") was somewhat off-putting (the room actually looked unfinished.) Additionally, the puzzling reduction from two armoirs for hanging clothes (in the standard room) down to one (in the "V") was downright unexplainable (and actually quite inconvenient.) Stay with the standard, and you'll be happy. As for the rest of the stay, we made the unusual decision (for us) to stay on-property for the entire visit, and couldn't have been more pleased. All restaurants were fabulous (though our choices fostered eye-popping tabs), MiX Lounge was very cool, and everyone's TripAd suggestions to go to the South Lagoon pool were right-on. THEhotel is a real winner, and my new home in Vegas (for reference, previous faves had been Bellagio and Venetian.) I did not notice any degradation since my last visit (as was noted by some other recent reviews) but your mileage may vary.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at THEhotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler786
Reviews.Content: I stayed in THEhotel at Mandalay Bay in April for two nights for a friend's birthday and had a great time. For the price, I expected the rooms to be a little nicer, but overall, it's a fabulous hotel, and I would definitely stay here again. THEpros: 1) Check-in is fairly hassle free. We took taxis from the airport, and they took us directly to the separate THEhotel entrance away from all casinos/big crowds. The lobby is sleek and modern, with high ceilings and minimalist decor. We walked straight to the registration desk and did NOT even have to wait in line! The only minor issue is that our rooms would not be ready until the afternoon. However, the bell-hop took all of our bags with no hassle and brought them to our room when it was ready. The staff was quite friendly, so no complaints! 2) THEhotel is smoke free. Yay for our health! 3) Two separate bathrooms is a major plus, especially with many people in the room! Overall, the amenities in the room are fabulous, BUT we did have issues with the wireless at times. 4) Many of the restaurants in Mandalay Bay are VERY close to THEhotel entrance. I highly recommend making reservations for dinner. However, for one night, my party decided to switch at the last minute from Italian to Chinese, so we ate at Shanghai Lilly in Mandalay Bay. We didn't even have to wait 1 minute, and the restaurant was very accomodating with our last minute requests and food substitutions. 5) Room keys will each get VIP/front of the line access for up to four friends per key at Rumjungle nightclub in Mandalay Bay. Rumjungle has amazing decor (waterfall walls, cool lighting) and the DJ usually plays hip-hop so it's a pretty happening dance floor. The bellhop at THEhotel even hooked us up with free passes, so we didn't have to pay the $20 cover! THEcons: 1) The room lighting is poor. When you have several girls wanting to get ready at once and the bathrooms are full, even with all the mirrors on the closets, it's hard to find good lighting to get ready, apply makeup, etc...Better lighting would help with the practicality of the rooms. 2) The sofa in the living room is NOT a sofa bed. For a proper suite, I would expect another bed in the living area. 3) THEhotel does not have a separate pool, so you have to use the pool at Mandalay Bay. However, the pool is VERY far, so be prepared to walk a fair distance. Again, THEhotel is pricey, but barring some minor complaints, I had a great time and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “THE Hotel was Good....kinda great.”
Reviews.Author: Ndalsteve
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a two night stay at The Hotel. I read all the reviews about this place before I got there and kinda did not expect a whole lot of wow. We got there on July 4th evening and there were four of us, all guys. Well they had ran out of double bed rooms and was looking to accomodate us, Dana was our hotel front desk agent. Well he first began is saying (before he told us of no dbl rooms avaliable) that he was going to go check with his boss about a possible upgrade. And I was thinking that there was no real upgrades since the V Suite only had king beds and the Suite is the one that carried both dbl & king. Well I was mistaken, he came back and told us that there were no double rooms and that he could accomodate us in one of the Penthouse Suites but it also only had a king bed. He offered to put in a rollaway and there was a couch in the room that could be made into a bed. He could not put in two rollaways because of fire code. Well then he sweetened the deal by giving us a 100.00 food and beverage credit to apply to any Mandalay or Hotel resturants. We took him up on his offer and agreeed that we would take the Penthouse and then move the following day into to dbl room if we wanted to. Well after seeing this room...OMG 1500 square feet...three 56 inch plasma TV's, three couches....full bar, dineing table..the biggest Jacuzzi tub I have ever seen...total electric blinds...built in stero sound systems that had controll through out the Suite. After seeing this we were like...we ain't moving! two of us slept in the bed and one on the wide couch inside the bedroom and the rollaway. The second night one slept on one of the sofa's in the living room and the other on the sofa int he bed room. Service was ok, had the rollaway promptly and the concierge helped us get show tickets. Dana at the front desk was excellent, other hotels in Vegas should hire him to train their staff! Some points about this place I read here that are true: Water temp in shower goes up and down....not consistant. Hotel is dark...but in 116 degree heat that's fine with me. Walking in they scent the air...was nice after coming out of a smokey casino. Room had dust...floor was scuffed and the carpet was stained and worn. (thin walls and adjoining doors, could hear other rooms adults) Over all a pretty good experiance.

Reviews.Title: “TheHotel doesn't disappoint”
Reviews.Author: katie1778
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at theHotel. Arrived at 11am, and was told to come back at 12noon to check-in. Long check-in lines, but asked for an upgrade, and received one (to a corner "V" suite"). The room was very clean, modern, comfortable, and quiet! Being that we stayed around July 4th, the hotel was very crowded (especially the pool/beach areas). Thanks to a tip from a TA member, we made our way to the south lagoon pool, which was far less crowded with its own bar. The Moorea Beach club was also a good option to beat the crowds, with a good mix of people, and great music for the younger crowd. Can't comment on many of the restaurants, we ate most dinners while out viewing the strip and seeing shows. Contrary to previous posts, front desk staff were very helpful and accomodating at all times. Express check-out was a breeze Second stay here, and already making plans to return to theHotel soon for a third time

Reviews.Title: “Great service and accomodation”
Reviews.Author: awslufc
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights at the Hotel at Mandalay Bay in mid June and was very impressed. I had previously stayed at New York New York but found it a little pricey and came across a great deal for The Hotel. I have also stayed at the Monte Carlo and The Hotel is far superior in terms of room size and standard of accomodation. I booked a room with two queen beds and expected just that. The room however was far better than I expected and was more of a junior suite. A seperate living area with sofa, chair, flat screen TV, a bedroom with two queen beds and another tv, an amazingly fitted out bathroom with a smaller flat screen TV, large shower and large bath. The staff were excellent and very friendly. I would definately stay here again and recommend it very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: LW23
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! I really loved it and it is so different in comparison to Vegas classics such as Bellagio or Venetian. I loved modern interiors, very nice, spacious rooms and room service. Obviously it is pricey but this is not a regular king or double room, it's a suite with living room, 1.5 baths and bedroom. Bathroom is especially nice, with LCD TV and separate shower and tub. I will definitely go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't let bed bugs bite!!”
Reviews.Author: NYCLonghorn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at THE hotel in early June. It was my 3 stay here and each time the service was terrible. I only stayed there this time as my company booked a huge block of rooms for people for a conference. This last time at THE hotel we had bed bugs. And unfortunately bed bugs that start in Vegas don't stay in Vegas. When we got home the bed bugs got to our bed and we were forced to pay thousands of dollars and an obscene amount of work to remedy the problem. I am a scientist and know the bed bugs came from there but the Hotel denied ut saying they had an independant company inspect our room and it was clean. When we asked for the report they said sorry we can't share that with you. Do not stay there. There are better hotels for the money. SOme people like the beach at the hotel but you need a shoe horn to get a spot it s so overcrowded. Stay at the Wynn or Hard Rock if you want a good Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “Love the cosmopolitan style and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: mf3551
Reviews.Content: I originally reserved two rooms for th emandalay bay but instead the gave me 2 rooms at THEhotel which is a property adjacent. The rooms were marvelous and everything was incredible. The bas thing my wireles network card didn't work and couldn't hook up the internet. The restaurants had a long waiting line but it was incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge rocks at TheHotel!”
Reviews.Author: JonaVSeattle
Reviews.Content: We (3 ladies in our late 20s and 30s) stayed in a double room suite at the TheHotel at Mandalay Bay. We had one of the most relaxing girls trips ever! Our suite was a big size and was very comfortable. Imagine 3 girls getting ready to go out and not fighting over mirrors or the bathroom. We had 1.5 bathrooms! The staff at TheHotel and Mandalay Bay were so nice. I was shocked actually. A friend had recommended me to use the concierge to book restaurants and clubs. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS APPROACH. The concierges (Jason and Ricca) were amazing and friendly. They got us into Tao and Trist nightclubs with no fees and we didn't have to wait in line! The lines were so long too and we just walked right in. They emailed all the club promoters and were way better than paying for those VIP line services. We saved like $60 in cover charges for bars! We also used the Spa at Mandalay Bay and it was a great way to end the trip. Very relaxing. I fell asleep in the steam room. If you're going to use the "Beach", WATCH your intertubes. We had to pay $20 for our intertubes to float down the river. Someone stole our tubes when we went into the wave pool! And they wouldnt replace them. Oh well.. lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “Cinco de Mayo”
Reviews.Author: sanchezie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the mandalay from April 28th - May 7th.... Stay was great, room was clean, bed was comfortable! What a great swimming pool (the wave)!!! Topless beach $25 a person. Get there early!! There's a connecting walkway to the Luxor (luxor had a great buffet & small food court with great cheap food) You can catch the bus a block away (it stops at every hotel but it beats walking or taking an expensive taxi), eat at Micky D's (value menu) and buy beer cheap!!

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: girlgnome
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was fabulous and everything that I expected but the customer service seriously sucked!

Reviews.Title: “Completey fabulous,dicreet & very tasteful”
Reviews.Author: ChippySapphire
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel as it looked classy and tasteful and it certainly did not disappoint,although when we checked in the queues were awful and it took forever,only to find when we got to the check in that they were trying to palm us off with a room at Mandalay Bay, which is not what we had paid for, anyway all was quickly resolved and we got a $100 voucher for food & drink! I would definitely recommend the valet parking,the car park is too big and it's very easy to lose car. The room in this all suite hotel was fabulous and very sumptuous with gorgeous luxury toiletries and a large bath & separate shower with a small plasma screen in the bathroom and a huge plasma screen in the sitting area! Thoroughly recommended and it was nice the hotel did not have it's own casino, although there is one at Mandalay Bay,next door.Set at the end of the strip,but not too far to walk to lots of other hotels.The rooftop cocktail bar (Mix) is a must and the glass lift on the side of the building gives you an excellent view of Vegas at night. Once you stayed here you wouldn't consider staying anywhere else in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: RCD19027
Reviews.Content: I have read some not so nice reviews regarding this property, and I wanted to say that my husband and I really enjoyed our stay at THE Hotel. The rooms are decorated in a dark manner, it is true, but that is the overall theme throughout the hotel. The hotel is decorated primarily in black, grey and gold colors. The customer service from the time we arrived, to the time we left was wonderful. The pool area is also wonderful and offers four pool areas to suit your needs. The only negative thing I have to say is that it is difficult to access the strip from this property. Otherwise, I would recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Watch out here”
Reviews.Author: 7OR11
Reviews.Content: Mandalay bay has a problem. THEFT from rooms. Stayed 16-20-june 07. Heard about several situations. Message is--- Dont leave valuables in the room. Appears Management is not too concerned, according to one guest I spoke with. Forget SECURITY, Rent a cop is not concerned.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place to Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mangopa
Reviews.Content: Let me first start by saying that we have stayed at this hotel 6 times. We really enjoy it, to be honest we can stay at any of the other hotels on the strip Bellagio, Venetian or Wynn. Why do I choose Thehotel. There are 3 main reasons. Boutique Hotel, well the hotel is connected by a hall to Mandalay Bay, so the hotel is not overwhelming big like an MGM. (where btw, at MGM it could take you 15 mintues to walk to your room) The Room, is great a 2 room suite, with 45 inch flat screen tv's 1 1/2 bathroom. Fantastic. Price those other 5 star properties and you will not be able to come close to the rooms at TheHotel. Pool, this is the best pool in Vegas. Yes, it can get crowded, Yes, service can be slow however, go early get a good shady spot and relax. Also, for those people that are looking for service I have to say, I bet it is difficult for a hotel with 1000+ rooms to accomadate and please everyone's taste. Firstly, for a room range of $ 169 + per night you are not going to get Four Season/Ritz Carlton service. I would say give the hotel a try, I am sure if you go with an open mind you will enjoy. We are booked again for later this year!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: colinlove
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying we have been to Las Vegas 8 or 9 times and usually stay at The Mirage. We were in THE hotel at Mandalay Bay. We arrived the day before Memorial day so it was very busy as you can imagine. It was 97 degrees and the bar tenders did not want to give the patrons wanting water any ice. The line for drinks was huge. They need more staff on weekends/holidays and a better way to get us water. Their cafe by the pool had huge self serve containers, like a cooler or something. Thats a great idea. The pool was beautiful of course. It has a wave pool and a lazy river. There is a shallow area by the wave pool that you can sit in to cool off, that was nice. To rent a tube or raft was 20.00. The cabanas are 250.00 per day and all you get for free is water and soda. There is a very good restaurant, The Border Grille, outside by the pool. It was delicious but very pricey, $42.00 for lunch, and that did not include any booze! This hotel is huge. It took us the 4 days we were there to figure out our way around. My other complaint is that after 2pm all blackjack tables were 15.00 per hand. They were only 10.00 at night at the Bellagio for cryin out loud. We did not gamble much there for that reason. We went to Luxor, Monte Carlo, MGM. One of the dealers and the pit boss yelled at me for sitting in a chair at a empty blackjack table at 1am while my husband was playing roulette nearby. Breakfast buffet was 15.99 per person. To use the gym/spa was 27.00 per day. Our room was awesome. We got a deal on it. Overall, everything was more expensive vs The Mirage. If you are someone who does not care if you spend extra, then great. We love it at The Mirage and the location is better so in the future we will go back there. If we could get the same suite for the cheap price I would stay at Mandalay Bay again.

Reviews.Title: “THE hotel needs THE service training...”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMuch
Reviews.Content: My stay the THE hotel for my bachelorette weekend started on a sour note - we booked a suite with two queens and were given one with a king bed only, since the hotel had sold out and over-booked their room types. I work at a hotel and know this kind of thing happens, especially since we were coming in so late (1am), but the problems didn't stop there... When we got up to the room, the maids were still cleaning it - they opened the door, told us it would be one second, and then shut the door in our face.... I was in shock. A couple minutes later, they came out, and we went into the room... We asked for 2 roll-away beds since there were 4 of us, and were told at check-in this would be no problem. When room service came up with only one roll-away, we told them we had asked for two, and they said OK. About 20 minutes later, they called and said they couldn't bring up another roll-away, it was a new hotel policy they could only take up one. Also, the room smelled of smoke and we had asked for a non-smoking room, again it's Vegas so I wasn't surprised, but it was still unpleasant. So, two of us went down to the front desk - we asked if there were usually maids in the room when guests were sent up, why our room smelled like smoke, and why a second bed had not been sent up. They assured us our room was non-smoking, that tomorrow we would be switched to a non-smoking two queen room, and were told that they had talked to housekeeping, and another bed was being sent up.... 30 minutes later after no bed was sent, we called the front desk... at that point they told us no bed was being sent up, that whoever told us it was had been mistaken, and that we could only have one roll-away... this was almost TWO HOURS AFTER CHECK-IN and around 3am. Disappointing, to say the least. We did get switched to a smaller, two-queen suite the next day - one which had no smoke smell whatsoever. Both suites we had were really great, loved the bath products, decor, etc., and we were pleasantly surprised by room service as well - they were prompt, accurate and friendly. However, we had problems again at check-out w/the front desk. Upon check-in we had asked for a late check-out since our flights on Monday weren't until 5, and check-out is 11am - again, they told us no problem. On Monday we woke up around 11am and called the front desk to re-confirm our late check-out. We were told that the hotel was sold out Monday night and therefore we needed to be out ASAP.... needless to say, as much I enjoyed the rooms and pools, I will never be staying at THE hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “go just for the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: scubadoll
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my second stay at The Hotel. If there is but one reason to go to this hotel, it is for the size and luxury of the rooms. They are gorgeous suites that are over 700 square feet. There are 3 flat screen tv's, 2 bathrooms, a giant bathtub, and a spectacular view of the strip. It is nice to have two rooms separated by a door so that you can watch tv and not disturb someone else who may wish to sleep! I have stayed at numerous hotels in Las Vegas, and these are by far the newest, sleekest, and nicest I have seen. I definitely recommend requesting a "high floor with a strip view". Otherwise you get the opposite side of the strip which is a bland desert view. Anything above the 30th floor will give you a nice view with your floor to ceiling windows to boot! It's a delight when you come back to a darkened room at night! I have read a number of reviews regarding the smell of the hotel. This is a matter of opinion, of course, but I loved it. It created a very "zen-like" atmosphere with all of the beautiful white floral arrangements and the dreamy music they play throughout the hotel. The Hotel provides a nice retreat from the casino vibe. It's the whole package. To my surprise the smell comes from a "spray bottle" that they spray the carpets with. And, everyone of course loves the pool at Mandalay Bay. You have access to all of Mandalay's amenities as a Hotel guest. To my dismay the "beachside casino" was not open yet. I was told it would be open June 8th, and it was no where near completion when I left on the 9th. So, I ended up at the Moorea Beach Club which, to my surprise, was a topless beach club. It was $10 for women and $50 for the men to enter. (My husband opted to hit the craps table instead) But, there are some new cabanas and bungalows that are also open now that look like a great deal of fun. The bungalows at the beach club have a small grassy area, negative edge pool, big cushy beds, etc. I believe they go for $3000 a day. I actually saw John Mayer lounging about in one of them so you never know who you might see! Also, the main bar at Mandalay Bay is under construction. This was also a small disappointment as it sets the tone for the whole Mandalay atmosphere. Now it is a giant walled-up square in the middle of the casino. So, no big place to lounge, no live music in the center, etc. A bummer. : ( I have to say the room service was amazing at The Hotel. The french fries were to die for, and the breakfast mango sorbet was delightful. We figured with what we had comp'd with our players card, that at least one of our room service meals was free. Be sure to get the "Players Club Card" so you can get the comps. Lastly, you must head up to the Mix for a drink after sunset. There are big brown square couches where you can nuzzle up on the balcony and watch the strip. Try to get there at a reasonable hour because seating fills up quickly. Oh, and be sure to check out the bathroom... quite an experience. I do not recommend dining at the restaurant however. The food is mediocre, and if you are in heels, it is dangerous to walk around on the wooden planks that they have for a floor out on the patio! I found it to be a restaurant that is trying too hard. It's all very aesthetically pleasing and all, but really not a top Las Vegas restaurant. If you want 5 star dining then go to Le Cirque! It's the best! Overall, I give it an A-

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the Sun”
Reviews.Author: viajera79
Reviews.Content: Stayed at THE Hotel for a weekend with girlfriends. I have stayed at this property before, and always have a great time. It is pretty overpriced, but a lot of the hotels in Vegas seem to be regardless. We love it for the pool, Bathhouse spa, and great rooms. Being that we are more poolside rather than gambling or walking along the strip, the location was just fine and the MB complex has a lot of great restaurants and always seem to have music events or concerts of some sort going on. The rooms are nice and always have a great view. The lines at check-in/check-out are ridiculously long, but staff was very friendly. My gripe would be that one morning a male staff member just barged into our hotel room to check and re-stock the mini-bar. We found this to be intrusive and unnecessary. I would return to THE Hotel with friends, but if I were looking for something romantic I would probably go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “just, ok”
Reviews.Author: Earlee
Reviews.Content: i stayed at "THE Hotel" for 2 nights. it was just ok... upon arrival... the lobby was beautiful, very clean, but had an awful smell! the desk clerk wasn't very helpful. the day before i requested a high floor with a strip view, the person on the phone said it would be no problem and they would have a high level suite with a great view ready for me when i arrived. not so true... the clerk told me that the room originally booked for me was already occupied. he then gave me two choices on rooms,,one was high level with a view of mountains, with two queen beds. (me and my girlfriend arent gonna sleep in seperate beds), the other was on the 14th floor with a partial view. i was very dissapointed! He never attempted to offer me anything to make-up for there mistakes. the room was nice, smaller then i thought. decor was nice, and bed was awesome. lighting was a little dim for my likeing. The Shower and tub were both nice and big, but the water tempature was out of control. the water was either HOTTT or Really COLD. there was no in-between. it took about ten minutes to get it nice and warm. but that temp would only last for about 5 min. so it went from warm to icy cold. there was really no way around this. That alone ruined it for me, and you would think that such an establishment as Mandalay Bay would offer certain comps or upgrades to keep there guests happy. never happend. Overall the hotel looks nice, horrible smell, and horrible customer service. if you want a nice, hip hotel, where you cant shower, then stay here, but other then that i dont reccomend it at all. try the signature at MGM,,,soooooo much better.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
