Reviews.Author: Aggie00
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Las Vegas after staying June 1-3 for a Bachelorette Party. This was my second time ever but it has been 6 years. The previous time I stayed at the Mandalay Bay and loved it! We left Dallas early on Friday morning and arrived by 9am Friday morning. Of course we knew that check-in was not till 3pm but we were hoping 1 of the 2 rooms were ready so we could leave our bags and change to our swimsuits to head to the pool. The rooms weren't ready but they said the bell hop could take our bags, however we were not allowed to the pool without a room key. We said we understood but we were guests there and going to be staying all weekend so couldn't they give us a pass to get in so we could spend some time in the sun? Well no they insisted that they couldn't. We were furious. We ended up checking our luggage with the bell hop and then he was able to give us a key to get in the pool area. So we got our swimsuits out and went in the hotel bathroom to change into them. We then went outside before 10am and the pool was already packed. There were hardly any chairs left. We finally found some but were not happy. There were kids everywhere, sand was getting into everything. We were like what in the world? Well 3 of the girls walked around and found out about the Moorea Private Pool. They looked inside and it was 21 years and up because it was a topless pool but you didn't have to go topless. It cost 10 bucks to get in for women. So we decided to do that because there were no kids and it was much nicer. As we were packing up our stuff to move one of the guys came up to us and gave us wristbands to get in. WOO HOO!! So we headed that way. WOW......much better. We hung out several hours ordering food and drinks and relaxed. We were finally able to check into one of our rooms by 12:30 so we just all piled our things into the one room so we could clean up to go shopping until the other room was ready. It wasn't until much later in the afternoon that there room was ready. We had requested multiple times to be close to each other, but of course that wasn't granted. Friday night we did eat at Mix on the top floor and went to the Mix lounge for cocktails afterwards. A wonderful experience and great meal! Housekeeping was always available and brought up things that we requested. Our shower leaked bad as well and the lighting was horrible with several lights out. Other than that most of everything else was okay. Oh, we did eat a snack one day at the Border Grill and it was good as well as appetizers from the pool. We had breakfast in the CAFE the last day and it was yummy! We just thought for the money we were spending, they could have been more accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Forget The Hotel, stay at The Wynn”
Reviews.Author: NolanAwb
Reviews.Content: Understand first that I don't mind paying top dollar for top quality and service. I always stay at The Wynn in Vegas, preferably the Tower Suites if available. Usually a suite there is in the $500 range. It is well worth it. The Wynn has no match in Vegas, not even the Bellagio or Venetian (both of which are over-rated) Recently we planned a last minute trip, and were planning on a quick one night at The Wynn. We extended the stay by one more night, but the Wynn, was sold out. We tried The Hotel. Nice enough suites, but simply not in the same hemisphere as The Wynn. The HUGE negative is the pool area at The Hotel. LONG, walk to even get there, and then, the adult pool is VERY disappointing. Terrible service, and the setup is poor. Construction going on, and workers gauking to see who is taking their bikini tops off. If you bring kids, for whatever reason people do, to Vegas, you'll probably like the Mandalay Bay because of the wave pool, lazy river, etc. If however, you are coming with a girlfriend or wife, and you appreciate luxury and class, The Wynn is the only place to look. Shopping and food are exceptional. Pool is the best. Clean, classy casino. Not a snobby place, just very nice. The Hotel building itself and the rooms are not bad, they are just not great. The casino, and pool areas are substandard. I will say the spa there is quite nice. The bottom line problem with The Hotel is that they don't have their own pool and casino. They built it after the Mandalay Bay, and while the vibe is very cool, it doesn't flow with the cheesy Mandalay Bay. They have two different sets of clientele, but then they throw them all in the same pool area, with pool attendants who have no clue what they're doing. There is always a problem when a hotel/resort adds a new section or building, and tries to make it flow with the existing structure.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were WOW, but lobby and surrounding area had a sewage smell”
Reviews.Author: Luvtoski1966
Reviews.Content: We stay stayed Memorial Weekend and a few days there after from 5/27 to 5/30. Generally, a wonderful place to stay. However, if I would have had to pay full price for a room there would have been a few problems that would have caused me to be less than happy. When we arrived it was through a parking garage. The smell even in the cab was evident. It smelled like sewage. The smell carried into the lobby and the immediate shop and bar areas. It was really bad! However, by day 2 or 3, they fixed the sewer smell? There are wonderful water features and such, and once they turned them off, it quit smelling. Humm, not sure, but that was a welcome relief. The rooms were the best I have ever had. Ever! You have 2 bathrooms, 3 TVs, a living room area, and the best bed. Slept like a baby on it. Huge soaking tub. It was fun to soak in the tub and watch TV! The pools. Oh, la la la! There is a wave pool, a lazy river pool, and 3 regular pools, with a tops off private pool. Hey, if you want a quiet pool with no kids...keep walking past the main entrance. There is a far south pool that has its own entrance, near the Four Seasons, and no one seems to know about it, and its much quieter. We liked to people watch, so we stayed in the main pools. If you want to go to the topless pool, it is now open, and it is $10 for women, and $40 for men. :-) Where to eat? We ate breakfast everday at the Red, White and Blue Cafe. Fair prices, and supper lunch and breakfast, and its right on the way to the pool. We went off the strip to eat at our old favs, such as the great Italian "Hole in the Wall", and Paris Buffet. We ate at a fancy Italian restaurant at Mandalay Bay, and it was good. Shows...check out what bands are playing at House of Blues, and we saw "Crazy Horse" topless show at MGM. Crazy Horse was fair. Check out Elton John or Prince if they are playing when you are there, everyone says those shows are incredible. Well, I have nothing but good things to say about THE Hotel, except that they are understaffed at the pools for drink orders, and please correct the sewage smell! It is way too fine of a hotel to be bothered by the such a smell. That would not be acceptable to a patron paying $300 a night. Otherwise, its beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “nice suite, horrible service”
Reviews.Author: GreatBlueFish
Reviews.Content: Decided in March 07 to visit Las Vegas for a one night stay in May 07 for business and pleasure. I booked two rooms at TheHotel at Mandalay Bay for $179 each. This rate was lower than other travel websites and lower than the hotel's direct website for the specific date I needed. In addition, this rate included: 4pm late checkout, two $20 breakfast certs per room, potential for an upgraded suite if available and a $100 spa credit for services for each room. WOW. When my associate and I arrived at TheHotel at 10 am, the bell desk took my two suitcases to a storage room. The front desk rep advised one room was available and he confirmed that I would have a 4pm late checkout. I was provided with the keys to my room, my associate was advised to call the front desk later in the day to see if his room was ready. I provided the front desk rep with my luggage tag and asked him to send the suitcases up to the room. We both went to my room for about fifteen minutes, we then decided to leave, even though the luggage had not arrived. I wrote out a large note to the bell desk employee and left the note along with a $5 tip on the table. In addition, I left my itinerary for the flight the next day, my dinner reservation confirmation sheet, breakfast certs, minibar key and some other paperwork on the side table next to the couch. My associate left his duffel bag containing his clothing in the room. I also placed several of my credit cards into his duffel bag. We left the room and returned at 3pm. When we arrived back in the room, my associates duffel bag was missing-including my credit cards, along with the $5, and all other paperwork. Furthermore, my two pieces of luggage were not in the room. I called the front desk immediately and was transferred to security. After a brief investigation (10 minutes) I was advised that the room was cleaned and that his duffel bag was in Lost and Found. I was obviously concerned that my credit cards were missing and asked for an explanation as to why the attendant had cleaned the room when it was clearly occupied and we had checked in. The response was, it "appeared to be an error." I asked that my luggage be delivered to the room along with my associate's duffel bag. I'd contacted a concierge service months prior to the trip to set up a special dinner reservation for 5pm that night. It was now 3:15 pm. At 4pm, I called the front desk again to find out why we had still not received my luggage, his duffel bag, replacement breakfast certs and his room key. At 4:15 pm, my luggage was delivered along with his duffel bag and his room key, but no breakfast certs. We were wearing resort attire and needed to change into business casual after showering, etc. It was obvious we weren't going to make dinner at 5pm since it was at least a 15 minute cab ride, not including the wait and we were still in shorts/tshirts. I called the concierge service and fortunately they were able to move the time back to 6pm. A bit of a hassle on my part stemming from TheHotel's error and very slow service. We went out to dinner, when we returned, I had to call the front desk again for the breakfast certs. The Breakfast the next morning was wonderful, two of the four certs were used and greatly appreciated. The next day, we both utilized the spa credits toward several services. My associate left TheHotel about noon to catch his flight. I called the front desk as a courtesy, since a large event was in town, to advise that his room was now vacant and to verify that I had a 4pm ck out. It was confirmed. I went out for a while and returned to my room at about 3pm to gather my luggage for my 440pm flight. My two keys did not work in my door. I was very concerned that I was going to have another bad experience at TheHotel and I was under time pressure since airlines advise arriving at the Las Vegas airport at least two hours prior to departure. I called the front desk from a hallway courtesy phone (I was on the 29th floor, a walk to the front desk would have consumed several minutes and when I walked through the lobby earlier, there were at least 25 people in line to check in). I was advised that even though I had a 4pm ckout, the computer system had automatically checked me out. I needed to wait for security to deliver me a new key. Based on my hour and fifteen minute wait yesterday, I was very upset and concerned that I was going to miss my flight (I'd booked a first class seat and didn't want to be assigned to coach-or lose my seat on this Memorial Day holiday weekend if I ck'd in late). Plus, I had other travel arrangements for the next day. I waited 15 minutes for security to arrive with a new key, a front desk staff member also arrived at my room. I expressed my concerns about my flight and the previous day's several incidents. They made no attempt to offer expedited transport to the airport and provided me with a basic apology for being locked out. I hustled to TheHotel taxi line-without stopping for a copy of my bill even though I need it for my tax records because the front desk line was again very long and I was in a rush; fortunately I made it to the airport on time. The room rate and package of benefits was really great; unfortunately, TheHotel's many service related issues created several stressful situations. Even though the I enjoy the décor of TheHotel, I won't return for quite some time since my overall impression is that they have many service glitches. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Reviews.Title: “Bad Price/Value relation/Great spa”
Reviews.Author: DCTraveler95
Reviews.Content: The property grounds are really beautiful but I had two bad rooms --- the first had dirty carpets and noise from a compressor that sounded like a toilet flushing every 5 minutes. The second, a beautiful upgraded newer room, had a broken shower that leaked all night. Front desk response was lack-luster -- and at this resort's prices, that's wrong. The restaurants on site are upsell-mad; order bottled water at Fleur de Lys and you'll wind up spending on bottle after bottle. The buffet was also subpar, esp. given the price. The pool is great, but again, expect to pay way more for everything.

Reviews.Title: “A 2 star hotel with 1 star service !”
Reviews.Author: CAJacklyn
Reviews.Content: I am a 10 year regular of Vegas. I have stayed in the top hotels there and almost all in between. My most recent stay at The Hotel was the absolute worst in my 10 years. I did arrive with an open mind and blank canvas. However, my first opinion was that this place has a very, very dark atmosphere. I mean everything is dark, from the winding parking garage entrance(yes, your entrance to this hotel/first impression is a parking garage), the lobby, and the dim rooms themselves. Even the bathroom lighting was extremely dark(so ladies, if you like having light while applying make up, look elsewhere). A very dark and somber place. The staff here seem very apathetic- riding on the large numbers of tourists that come to Vegas. They made mistakes on my reservation, then placed me in a room with a non functioning safe. Fixing that problem alone took an hour out of my vacation! How many of you enjoy a nice warm shower? I know I do, but I could NOT get one at this hotel. I had to constantly play with the temperature if I could get hot water at all ! For all you light sleepers, the hotel constantly has wind noises that sound like a blizard in your very own room. To top that, the wind is often accompanied by the sound of plumbing from all your neighbors! I love a nice pool, but there pool is a good 3/4 to a mile away to get to. Once there, it is a zoo of people and kids. I tried to find some positives at this hotel, but could not. Even the staff from bellmen to the cleaning staff do not seem happy here. Needless to say, I will not stay at this hotel in the future. It is sad because I used to be one of the Mandalay Bay's biggest fans. Notice where MB is ranked on this website if you need a second opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but would not go back”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Phil
Reviews.Content: Stayed in TheHotel for 4 nights last week. The room was on the 30th floor looking west. Great View looking West. Room was very nicely appointed. Good temp. control, very nice bed, great TV etc. Here is where I part company with other travelers. The room was expensive, but I expected that. What I didnt expect were the prices in the restaurants within the Mandalay...OUTRAGEOUS! $12 for a lettuce salad, Dinner for 3 $400. Plan on spending at least $100 to 150 per person for dinner, and that is not hitting it hard at all. Hint: House of Blues has the best price for meals..even breakfast. You can walk out the door of the Mandlay hotel and hit McDonalds for breakfast and the liquor store next store to get what you need to put in your room. Swimming Pools..very nice wave pool..crowded though...one margarita and two large waters...$30 (ouch). I think its much better to stay off the strip...too many good restaurants now in Vegas to confine yourself to one hotel..easier to get a cab at peak times as well if you are off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Right Hotel, Wrong Guest??”
Reviews.Author: jhw516
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me start by saying that I am a Four Seasons, Bellagio kind of person. I like overt luxury and am not the least put off by things that are slightly over the top in terms of plushness (is that a word?) or opulence. When I travel, I want total comfort. So it might not be fair for me to comment on the very minimalist, trendy THEHotel. THEHotel (the reference to everything as "THE"whatever became a joke among my companions and me) was billed as an all-suite hotel. Did I miss something? When did a room with an adjoining bathroom become a "suite"? The room was drab, boring, and dark. The public areas were busy, cluttered and noisy. A lovely flower arrangement adorned the glass table in the entry way that was littered with drinks, empty cups, and other trash. The price was as over-the-top as the place was boring and annoyingly full of itself. I understand it is supposed to be an alternative to typical casino-oriented hotels, and designed to be attractive the "boutique hotel" set, but this place just didn't cut it for me. I think I am the wrong audience.

Reviews.Title: “What is not to like?”
Reviews.Author: LoJoMinnesota
Reviews.Content: After relying on this site to review TheHotel at Mandalay Bay I felt compelled to share our feed back. Wow what is not to love about this place. Great suite, great service and great pool. So what if you have to walk alittle to the pool. A tip is go out front and cut thru the walk way the the convention center, down the esculators and you are at the front enterance of the pool. I guess one draw back it is at the end of the strip but jump a cab to four corners and walk where you want from there. Spa is great, many food choices and we thought the people and staff we very pleasent

Reviews.Title: “THEhotel for the discriminating Vegas vacationer.”
Reviews.Author: Thalia82
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 7 day trip from Vegas with my boyfriend and stayed @ THEhotel the whole time. It was phenomenal. I checked out Tripadvisor along with Frommers to get a really good cross section of the hotel options. THE hotel fit the bill. It wasn't in the middle of all of the craziness of the strip but not far either. THEhotel is contemporary and definitely for people that enjoy minimal design rather than ostentatious fabrications of roman sculptures that are double their real size. It really felt like the whole hotel was non smoking but in fact I was told the ventilation system is the best at Mandalay, and it showed, as a non-smoker I really appreciated not smelling the dusty air in the casino or anywhere in the hotel for that matter. The crowd was definitely more refined and less "trashy" and "tourist-y". It was definitely a mix of 25 to 45 years of age. The suite was exactly how it had looked on the website, and i had called weeks earlier to confirm we had a good view of the strip. The maids were very nice, I asked one on our way out for extra face cloths and she left a dozen upon our return! THEhotel restaurants were gorgeous, The Mix especially. The view is breathtaking along with the hand made murano glass chandelier they have. Other dinner options I would recommend is Bartolotta di Mare at the Wynn (plan reservations well in advance), Lawry's Prime Rib and Alize on the top of the Palms. These are all exceptional restaurants, and the quality of service is outstanding. The best buffet above all is at Paris. Nothing else compares. NOTHING. I went to the Mandalay Buffet and that was decent, and MGM was just "ok". The BEST lunch / dinner you'll have that doesn't break the bank is The Cheesecake factory in the Forum Shops at Caesar's Palace. The portion sizes are ridiculous and the cheesecake is unreal. Make an effort to see the outlet malls, it's worth the $15 shuttle because you find amazing deals. The Fashion Show mall is out of this world also, 7 different department stores...imagine? Don't think you h ave to eat in the hotel restaurants either, we went to the Bali Hai golf course very close to Mandalay for lunch and had the best lunch and their lagoon patio is gorgeous. Definitely "O" at the Bellagio is the best show to see. Don't bother with Carrot Top, unless you like ridiculous prop humour. I didn't see Lance Burton (magician) but I heard very good reviews. Do your research like I did before you head out to Vegas and you will have the best time ever! We're going back in September!

Reviews.Title: “THEhotel at Mandalay Bay has seen better days. . . . .”
Reviews.Author: harrietfly
Reviews.Content: I am actually 2 nights into my 5 night stay at The Hotel. I am out here with a conference and have stayed here the last 2 years. I personally think this place is overrated and I am reminded of it again this year. The pool is absolutely packed, loud and rowdy and like mentioned in previous reviews, is a construction zone. "The Hotel" doesn't have its own pool so we share with the Mandalay guests and there are more people than chairs. The rooms have seen their better day and customer service has lacked in every instance. 3 years ago I stayed at the Venetian and was catered to at every turn. Not the case here. The hotel is what it is, if you are looking for peace and quite, good customer service and a great room, then go somewhere else. If you are looking for a rowdy crowd, an OK room and cool lobby, this is the place for you. On the positive, the restaurants and clubs here are great. Mix is a favorite and so is Aureole, Fleur de Lys. Red Square for the vodka and China Grill is always fun. Just my 2 cents.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been great if not for the noise and the malfunctions”
Reviews.Author: Canadianknowitall
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in mid-May. Very impressed upon arrival when I walked into my suite on the 30th floor with its physical look, but NOT impressed when the cabinet next to fridge flew off its hinge and banged me painfully in the knee as I opened the fridge to inspect its contents. Also the AC in the bedroom didn't work properly. One either had to crank it up to full blast freeze to make it work or it wouldn't respond. Also the shower in the elaborate bathroom could never decide whether to scald you or ice you. No matter how I tried to adjust it it would play "guess my temperature!". Also the oddest thing about it is that at night you hear the noise from a nightclub wafting outside. It is just perceptible enough to be annoying and as I luckily brought ear-plugs I was able to block it out when I went to sleep. The casino is a short walk away and though pleasant is nothing special. As nice as the property is, the Hotel rooms decor and amenities iare nowhere near being in the same league as the Wynn, The Bellagio, Caesars or even the Red Rock Resort but I can see how it would impress the heck out of anyone used to a Holiday Inn room standard.

Reviews.Title: “Simply spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: Balckyball
Reviews.Content: Overall I highly enjoyed my time at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay. Service was top notch, very elegant. Room was spectacular: - 2 room suite - Nice living room area with a bar - 50 inch flat screen - Nice desk for business travelers - Bedroom was equipped perfectly, king size bed, 50 inch flat screen - Bathroom had a 25 inch flat screen, nice tub, great shower. Room was a corner suite, so I had a 180 degree view as well. Overall great stay!! And Great Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Paper Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: apter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is for young people who want to act less than their age. The rooms are nice BUT the walls are paper thin and make sure you do not accept a room that has a connecting door. You can hear every word said in your neighbor's room. I guarantee you, I will never stay in the Mandalay Bay Hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Mandalay Bay is the Place To Be”
Reviews.Author: Katherine95
Reviews.Content: Myself and a group of friends have just returned from a weeks stay at Mandalay Bay Las Vegas. After reading some of the reviews befor my holiday i was begining to dread going but we all had a fantastic time. Mandalay Bay was excellent with a whole lot to offer. I stayed in The Hotel at Mandalay Bay and the rooms were fantastic and very modern. Some of my other friends stayed at Mandalay Bay which was also very nice. The guest rooms were very big and bright. I could'nt belive my eyes when i walked into the Casino. The atmosphere was brilliant and it was always kept busy. The minimum bet on a table is $15 alittle steep compared to other casinos but its well worth it. I remember reading a review befor i went which said the hotel was very expensive to eat in but i thought it was really reasonable. The House of Blues is excellent i went for a couple of meals there and paid around $20 for a starter and main. Mandalay Bay has around twenty eating places so there is somthing for everyone. The pool was brilliant we never struggled looking for a sun bed and the pool staff are very friendly. I could'nt keep out of the wave pool and the lazy river!!! A beer from the pool bar is about $6 and they also do some great cocktails for about $10. I was worried about the location of the hotel but there is a free tram service in the hotel taking you to as far as the Luxor then you simply swap trams over at the MGM Hotel which takes you into the heart of Las Vegas. The tram service shuts at around 2am. Overall i has a fantastic time in Las Vegas and could not of asked for a better Hotel to stop in than The Mandalay Bay...

Reviews.Title: “Best rooms in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: planetclaire
Reviews.Content: I stayed at THE Hotel for 3 nights in late April on a business trip. I had no idea that this was an all-suite hotel and was very pleasantly surprised to discover everything that THE Hotel had to offer. The suites are very tastefully decorated. They have an Asian fusion theme. Minimalist and modern, but pleasing. No chintzy fabrics whatsoever! If you like bright, flowery fabrics and antique-type furnishings, this might not be to your liking. The living room, bedroom, bathroom and half-bath are all huge. The suite is much larger than most apartments I've visited in NYC! The bathtub is enormous -- I enjoyed soaking in it while watching the TV in the bathroom in the evenings! Separate shower with great pressure. I didn't have any issues with temperature changing. Nice amenities too -- loved the soap and the body lotion. Plenty of towels. I had to call housekeeping for a robe, though. I liked the electronic "do not disturb" pad. The high-speed Internet access was fast and problem-free. Ate at Wolfgang Puck's Tratorria del Lupo (good, but expensive), Border Grill (excellent and good value for your money) and had breakfast at The Cafe (good, not spectacular). I found the staff to be very helpful and polite. Make sure you get a print out of charges when you leave. They added $17 of mini-bar charges that I didn't touch. They took the charges off with no problem. Overall, a great experience. I would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Love THE huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: pastmaps
Reviews.Content: After a business visit to Green Valley Ranch, my wife and I decided to spend some time on the strip. Getting a suite for the price of a room struck me as a no-brainer. Getting to THEhotel was a bit of a pain, as the entrance is tucked away in a dark corner of the parking garage, but the room was huge and comfortable. Overall, our stay was quite enjoyable. A few bugs... the "do not disturb" switch was broken and it took hours to get a hang tag, the shower temperature was all over the place, switching from hot to cold every few seconds, and there were light bulbs out. I got the impression that maintenance was not on the top of this hotel's list. All in all, it was a very pleasant experience, although I expected just a bit more given THEhotel's reputation.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Crawfy&Lexy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in THE Hotel Apr2-7th as the 1st stop on our stateside honeymoon and we were not disappointed. Ask for a Strip view room above 25th floor for the greatest views in Vegas. With a postcard backdrop the huge rooms are somewhere you can chill and relax. Watching one of your 3 flat screens while lounging in teh bath is teh best way to recover from a long flight. Hit the town for some action and return to THE Hotel. You can actually feel yourself relax as you walk from teh bustle of Mandalay Bay's casino floor into THE Hotel's lobby. The staff were professional and friendly. The concierge met our every request there and then. Pamper yourself in the Bathouse Spa and catch some rays at the beach. Speak to the doorstaff at Mix and Forty Deuce, explain you are guests...we were able to get on the guestlists for a Saturday night and was the best way to celebrate our last night...Vegas style!! Treat yourself - book THE Hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a bit of tweaking”
Reviews.Author: MrWonderfulToronto
Reviews.Content: Very nice and quiet suite except they are very dark with a view of nothing. We stayed for a week March 24 - 31 and had a very smooth checkin. Our problems arose with getting the room cleaned. 1 day they plain and simple didn't come despite 3 calls. Room service was excellent in both speed and quality. MIX restaurant is one of the best restaurants in the US followed by Fleur de Lys. Wolfgang Puck is as good as can be expected. Max at THE LOUNGE is a fabulous bartender. Skip Aureole Restaurant; Chef Palmer is declining with all his expansion. Used to be good. And avoid at all costs the House of Blues Gospel Brunch. Food is disgusting and the show features wannabees without talent. We walked out after 15 minutes. So, owners, allow your guests the opportunity to brighten up their suites and tell management to get housekeeping to get their act together and then you'll get 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kar7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there recently April4-8, with three other couples, for a surprise birthday party for my husband. When we first arrived, the hotel desk explained that they were pretty full-would we be interested in a penthouse suite at the Mandalay Bay? He checked on it, and it was not available, so he upgraded us to a suite at The Hotel. It was nice-except one lamp lightbulb was out and they forgot to put in the bathrobes. All it took was a phone call and it was taken care of immediately. Our room was comfortable, cozy and fun. The views are amazing, and it was nice to walk into lobby without hearing gaming machines (there are no machines in The Hotel lobby). However, The Hotel is attached to Mandalay Bay, which has every game you can think of. The Mix (restaurant) was great-they did a spectacular job of food and wine for my hubby's birthday. They are a little pricey but the food is good and the view is great. The restuaurant reminds me of the Jetsons, or the the 60-70s era. A lot of pretty people in the bar-however, some of us in our group thought they were working girls. The bar is fun, it is partially outside. Stripsteak in Mandalay Bay is fabulous for dinner too. I would highly recommend this hotel and hopefully we will return again.

Reviews.Title: “If it weren't for THE inconvenience...”
Reviews.Author: novessa
Reviews.Content: The sleek black and white decor and quiet ambiance of THE Hotel's lobby sets it apart from other casino hotels, with their relentless slot machine noises and multi-colored carpeting. The rooms are large and the extra half bath is a nice feature. I got a very good pedicure at the spa. However, it is REALLY far away from most places I wanted to go on the Strip (like the Forum Shops, Fashion Show Mall, restaurants at Bellagio, shows at the Mirage). Be prepared to take a lot of cabs and/or walk for miles each day. Also, the service was not particularly attentive (there always seemed to be a line at the front desk, there was no turn-down service, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but.....”
Reviews.Author: azlarry
Reviews.Content: We had stayed a the Mandalay Bay Hotel before and were expecting at least as nice a room. When we first saw the room we were disappointed. The decor was very nice but there were some aspects that were overlooked. The bathroom in particular. There was no storage area for our toiletry articles. Underneath the bathroom sink was a large open space. Some shelving would have helped. We ended up placing our articles on the floor. We can appreciate the attempt to save the environment by using energy saving lightbulbs. However it was quite dark in the bathroom and could have used a better lighting system. Perhaps several lightbulbs rather than one. Finally, the shower. The shower head was an upgrade but the stuff coming out of it wasn't. The water was alternately scalding hot or icy cold. Needless to say it made for a brief shower. Maybe this is an energy saving technique also?

Reviews.Title: “Why Stay Anywhere Else?”
Reviews.Author: travellinghopefully
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in most of the hotels on the strip but after staying at the Hotel, I will never stay anywhere else. What's the point? for the same price as a room, you get a SUITE with 3 tvs and 2 bathrooms. The spa is beyond magnificent. The negatives-the pool at the Mandalay is ridiculously crowded and the sheets could be better. But the bed is comfortable, the amenities perfect..Why stay anywhere else?

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel is The Best!”
Reviews.Author: travelgrrlnyc
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room at the Mandalay Bay for one night. The trip was for business. I arrived at check-in and was informed that there was a "situation" at Mandalay Bay. They said that I had been upgraded to The Hotel. I've been wanting to try The Hotel so it was a pleasant surprise. The Hotel is perfect. I was in room 60-806. The view is from the 60th floor over looking the pool. The pool is nice to look at, as is the reflection of the tower in the Mandalay Bay and you still see a lot of lights across the desert. There is also quite a bit of rooftop, but it wasn't distracting. I do think it might have been more fun to have a view of the strip, but the view was certainly very pretty. The decor is very typical of a nice boutique-style hotel. There is a great Jacuzzi tub, Bulgari bath products and even a scale. Try the bathtub soak that is provide...it is worth your time. The linens and bed are very comfortable. The hallways are serene and very quiet. The wireless worked perfectly and was $11.99/day. The robes and slippers are a must-try! :) The cable system is pretty limited. Obviously most people traveling to Vegas aren't spending a lot of time in the room watching TV, however I thought HBO would have been standard. The coffee bar and bar off the lobby are a nice, quiet place to meet friends or co-workers away from the casino. You should note that their restaurant closed at 3PM during the week. It is good to note that on The Hotel side valet you can call down and they will have your car waiting for you. (They won't do this on the Mandalay Bay side.) They also offer you bottled water which is a nice touch. Parts of the pool are still under renovation. I've always been a fan of the adult part of the pool where you paid a small fee and it wasn't crowded like the other areas. That section was still not open as of April 10th. You should also be aware that if you arrive around noon-2PM...you are going to have trouble finding a place near the pool. Just keep walking...there is a smaller pool at the very end of the pool complex that seemed less crowded. I had a great experience and can't think of a thing I would change about this hotel. I highly recommend The Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite Vegas Stay”
Reviews.Author: Wuah
Reviews.Content: Modern, trendy look with all the amenities you would expect of a top notch hotel. Great room sizes and the best pool in Vegas, what more could you ask for? Despite the fact that I spend little time in the room when in Vegas, it is very nice to have a nice place to go to for those few peaceful hours you may spend. And this definitely fills that bill. It great to have a true suite with separate living room and bedroom areas, particularly if you have to share the room with someone with different sleeping habits. Now, I wouldn't necessarily put it up with the quality of the Ritz Carlton-type hotels, but definitely upscale. And while the price tag is a little higher than the average Vegas hotel room, you are paying much less then the Wynn or Bellagio and the like, for their comparable room (a suite) - so I think it actually a pretty good value. I also like the quietness of the "casino-less" hotel lobby - you have to walk through the connecting corridor back to the Mandalay Bay main area to the casino. I don't know why some people complained about bad service, but I had great service in every aspect of the hotel. Note that the pool is still finishing their construction and is as crowded as ever. Got to get there early if you have any hope of getting a chair, but it's always been that way. There's a reason it's popular - it's a great pool area. I would recommend this hotel to anyone... and will.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: shunn
Reviews.Content: The suites are terrific as I found them to be clean and spacious. 3 TV's in each suite. The pool area which includes a wave pool and a lazy river is the best in the city. The only downside is the long walk from the hotel to the pool area. My 7 year old (at that time) twins were completely thrilled with this trip. I recommend seeing a Cirque show with the entire family. Flyaway (indoor skydiving) is a must. It was the most exciting part of our trip. Flyaway is located a few yards off the Vegas Strip near the Hilton. I lived in Las Vegas between 1981-1984 and have been back several times since then. I must say I am very impressed with the improvements of these new hotels, especially The Hotel at Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time we stayed at THE Hotel - its still great”
Reviews.Author: brunogerrussi
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed there april 2-6 2007. i won't repeat the other positive reviews about the rooms, spa, etc. One of the biggest positives - state law prohibits smoking in most areas EXCEPT casinos. THE hotel has no casino (it has a corridor that connects to mandalay bay), so it is smoke free. A huge plus because so many other las vegas hotels have the registration area and/or room elevators adjacent to the casino. A tip - your quickest access to mandalay bay pool and the Rum Jungle nightclub is by exiting the main entrance to the hotel and walking left to the valet parking entrance for mandalay bay. this not only saves you distance and time, it enables you to completely bypass the mandalay bay casino. our only negative experience: the front desk staff. we checked in around midnight and were told that they had no rooms (we'd reserved). they offered us an upgrade to a penthouse suite in mandalay bay. when we told them we'd prefer to stay in the room we'd booked, one of the other front desk clerks proceeded to lecture us about how great the penthouse suites at mandalay bay were and how she'd love to stay there. we gave in because we were too tired to argue. after staying the night in the mandalay bay suite (the interior design inspiration for which was apparently was Tony's house in The Sopranos), we insisted on being moved to The hotel. We were intially told that it was sold out and that, besides, we'd been "upgraded"...we stood our ground and were moved. lesson learned: stand your ground. just remembered 2nd negative experience: a "working girl" sitting in one of the recessed areas in the wall outside the room elevators trolling for customers. very surprised to see that in this place (saw her again in the connecting corridor next morning at 6 am). but, i suppose that can happen anywhere. having said all of that, we're definitely returning because the positives FAR outweigh the minor negatives

Reviews.Title: “absolutely wonderful hotel for mother-daughter trip and some other comments”
Reviews.Author: simmie17
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Hotel for 4 nights in early April with teenage daughter. Beautiful facility. Check in was easy, The room was lovely- very clean. Asked for extra towels each day and housekeeping only forgot the request the last day. However, housekeeping does not change linens during your stay unless you ask- they should let you know this when you check in. Amenities were plentiful We used the Internet connection each day- worked fine. I used the Bathouse Spa 3 times. It was so peaceful and restful. The services were excellent. Mandalay Bay itself was impressive. We ate in the Burger Bar once and it was very good. Cannot say the same for RM Cafe- very expensive and seafood was not up to par. Had much better meal at Joe's. Crab Louie salad was exceptional. Border Grill though was great. We ate outside our last night. Best Mexican food we both ever had. Tried to get a chair at the pool one afternoon but it was packed. Pool facilities looked ok but too much of a scene for me. Enjoyed the bar at Mix - the staff there was the most personable I encountered. The view is incredible. Also learned there may be a strike in June because of union issues with MGMGrand. Hope it is resolved. As a first time visitor, had also considered staying at Bellagio or Wynn. As to the former, I did not care for the ambiance there when we went there to see O. As to the latter, it was very beautiful - and very crowded. Shopkeepers were pleasant, except for woman in the Chanel store. (Interestingly, the woman in the Chanel store at Bellagio was also rude, as were personnel at the Louis Vuitton stores- that may be part of their employment contract....) I had rented a car based on advice on this site. Upon reflection, I am glad we did only because we went to the outlet at Primm one day. (OK mall- daughter loved the Miss Sixty store) I think a car is a good idea if you are leaving the Strip- otherwise, forget it. Driving in LV is an absolute nightmare- worse than NYC. On the other hand, found the whole cab situation ridiculous. The Taxi Authority should allow you to get a cab at more sites. Overall we both loved LV and The Hotel. LV was packed with kids of all ages. This is probably a good facility for families, but saw kids everywhere. We were only on the Strip (other than Primm) and I saw nothing that I found either offensive or problematic if you came with your family. We both wished we had more time! Hope to be back.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: sparkggl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at TheHotel from April 1-April 4, 2007 for our one year anniversary. We had initially booked our stay at Mandalay Bay for an amazing $100/night, and when we checked in we were offered a complimentary upgrade to a suite at TheHotel. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to anyone. To be fair, here are a few negatives: 1. We requested housekeeping to not come before 3pm (my husband had some work to do in the mornings) and on our second day they didn't come at all. We called to get some fresh towels and toiletries and it took them around an hour to bring them up. However, they must have sensed the annoyance in my husband's voice because they brought up a bag filled with toiletries. 2. When we got to our room, the carpet was totally damp and had that icky wet-carpet smell, probably from cleaning. Actually, the entire floor that we stayed on smelled that way. The positives: 1. Great room- three tvs, trendy decor, awesome bathrooom, and they provide a great bath powder. 2. The spa (The Bathhouse) is conveniently located on the 2nd floor. I went there the second day and the Mandalay Bay Spa the third day. I prefer the latter but The Bathhouse is pretty visually stunning. However, their "eucalyptus" steam room consisted of a worker popping her head in and squirting her spray bottle full of eucalyptus scent into the room. 3. The hotel has a quieter, chill vibe than the frenetic Mandalay Bay. My husband and I had a great stay and would definitely stay here again. We got a bigger bang for our buck that we anticipated, and that's always a plus. My advice would to be on Mandalay Bay's email list and they'll notify you of any promotions.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic if you are used to this type of hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigjollie
Reviews.Content: Just back from THE HOTEL, spent two weeks there from the 12th March to the 26th so had ample time to check out the good points and any bad ???? I will say that out of the whole two weeks the only bad point I could find was one of the male conserges who was just lazy and rude and to be quite honest couldnt be arsed. I had read a few bad reviews about the staff but I can honestly say they were excellent, I would like to say a particular thankyou to Sandy Front of house Manager, Micheal Front of house Supervisor, Michelle Concerge and Max Head barman from the lounge bar, theses people were exceptionaly professional and worked hard to make our stay fantastic. The rooms were great and I have stayed all over the world in Four Seasons, Bagglioni, Ritz Carlton etc these rooms were much better. Take a trip to the 64th floor to the mix bar the view of the strip is the best in town. We also ate at the mix restaurant on the 64th floor (get a table outside on the terrace) its not cheap but if your looking for all you can eat for 10 bucks go to Orlando) If you have time do the helicopter to the Grand canyon ( I reccomend Maverick helicopters who were fantastic. This was my 8th Trip to Vegas but my first to THE HOTEL I would thouroughly reccomend it (Treat Yourself)

Reviews.Title: “Most luxurious hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: clydeandrhonda
Reviews.Content: While my overall trip to Las Vegas was disappointing to say the least (my husband and I received a $190.00 ticket for JAYWALKING), The Hotel at Mandalay Bay was an oasis. To start out, I failed to submit my reservation properly with Orbitz, so the hotel had no record of us. The front desk manager accommodated us, and even honored the prices that I had printed from the Orbitz website. I think I have gotten spoiled by the experience. I have no idea how I ever managed to stay at a hotel without: exceptional customer service wonderful smelling huge bunches of flowers in the hotel entrance decor that I would LOVE in my home a bathtub large enough to swim in a bathroom larger than some New York City apartments a flat-screen television in the main bathroom a REAL living room Too bad we won't be travelling back to Las Vegas EVER - The Hotel at Mandaly Bay would have been our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pryncess14
Reviews.Content: We came to stay here for my girl trip in Vegas and I have to tell you that the room is pretty much like the type of room/studio you wished you had when you first left college. At certain times we enjoyed the room more then we thought we would. Huge bathroom and a 1/2 bathroom in the hallway when you walk in.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Easywin
Reviews.Content: This hotel has rooms like you have never ssen: 3 flat screen TVs (one in the bathroom), marble, a living room and a separate bedroom, even another 1/2 bath in the entry. This is truly a very nice spread! The hotel itself is attached to Mandalay Bay, and is your typical casino hotel. They do offer some great places to eat (expect a long wait). My only "complaint" is that the entry and lobby of the hotel is somewhat dreary. Very cool and chique, but dark and kind of depressing (no windows). The rooms are also very dark but pretty. Also, there is no coffee pot in the room which I thought was weird for such a nice hotel. If you are looking for a nice room, this is a good place.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place to Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gmc1940
Reviews.Content: THEhotel at Mandalay Bay is the only place for us. The service is extraordinary, the rooms are spacious and fabulous, the restaurant is wonderful. You're near any gambling that you may care to do, but YOU HAVE A CHOICE. You can be as 'into the action' as you like. Everything about this place is first-rate.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend of Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Yaleguy310
Reviews.Content: I just spent the weekend at The hotel at Mandalay Bay. It was a wonderful experience. The service was excellent. Just a note be sure to check your bill as I noticed some additional charges on my bill that were not mine ,but when I called attention to them the charges were promptly removed. equest a room above the 30th floor for a view. If you tip housekeeping well during your stay you will find extra very nice surprises in your room. They allowed me to check in early around 11am. The spa services were excellent. I only wish the rooms had an IPOD docking station ,but they do not so bring cd's for the dvd/cd player.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel, great spa and cafe”
Reviews.Author: leungv
Reviews.Content: GOOD: Trendy hotel, hip decor, non-smoking public areas (except restaurant/club), fantastic food (at the Cafe) BAD: Unreliable cleaning service, unresponsive guest services Just got back from a weekend stay there. Overall, the it was a pretty good value since it was about the average weekend price for a room on the strip, but you get a suite at theHotel for that price. Our room was not yet cleaned when we arrived, even though it was already 11pm, and we had to negotiate with the front desk to get a small discount. (Half the night was over, so I figured we should get something for this incovenience.) The next day, our room didn't get cleaned until very late as well. The food at the Cafe in the lobby level is fantastic, as is the Bathhouse Spa. For the ladies, I definitely recommend taking a moore mud bath in one of their private tub rooms if you're not claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “Slow start but great after that”
Reviews.Author: Mocha31603
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a convention Feb. 19-23, 2007. The valet service was excellent throughout our stay (used it several times daily). The first room we checked into had many problems. I usually overlook small things but this room had not been cleaned properly, ammenities had not been refreshed, 2 sinks did not drain properly, tv in bedroom didn't provide all channels, phone in living room was faulty, and no tv remote in bathroom. The second room was fine but the view was not as good as the first room. Stayed one night then they moved us to a better room. The desk was very willing to please and moved us with no problem - but there was never an apology for the initial room. I think the housekeeping staff is not functioning properly and this should be looked into. Otherwise, the trip was great - great room service, gambling, shows, food in general, service in general. I will stay there again no doubt - they even comped my last 2 nights for my gambling at the casino. All in all it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Still Great but slipping a bit”
Reviews.Author: Monopot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after having a brilliant time here the previous year. This time we were getting married in the Grand Canyon so wanted a nice place to stay again, and didn't dissapoint. We were given a room with a mountain view but asked if we could move to a strip view. Were told there were none (my folks got one the same time??) but said we could move in a couple of days which was fine. Room was nice and clean, large and everything every other review says here. They really are ace! Only moan was the half-bath stunk when we came in but as we were moving in a few days we didn't mind. After a couple of days and before our wedding we got moved to a corner suite facing the strip. This was fantastic for the view but the bedroom is a lot smaller with only 1 small wardrobe. Also the safe stunk of weed! The bathroom was smaller but was still about the size of our house back in the UK anyway :) Overall, its a fantastic hotel, it really is. If you want to feel special and with the times, this is the place to go. Only other gripe was the maids hardly ever replaced our toiletries which as anyone who has been there will say, are out of this world!! A quick call to housekeeping though and they brought up a bag, and I mean a bag full of soap, scrub bars and shampoo! We bought it all home and 6 months on we are still using it! WELL HAPPY!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value, best rooms in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: evolvehomes
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in Vegas. Great rooms, beats all the rest!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Glitz Free Zone!”
Reviews.Author: CasaMilano2
Reviews.Content: As you'll read elsewhere, the entrance to the hotel through the car park is truly awful, which is a great shame as we were very impressed with the hotel overall, especially after visiting some of the other big names on the strip. The suites were superb with a useful separate living room - the only downsides being haphazard servicing of the room, poor lighting, strange volume control on the TV (either too quiet to hear or loud enough to wake your neighbours) and a lack of tea/coffee facilities in the room. We tried room service for breakfast on 5 out of 7 days and dinner on 2 nights and it was fantastic. The hotel really benefits from the connection to the main Mandalay resort and its fantastic choice of restaurants, which made it almost perfect for us and our requirements. We'll be back! Oh, we really enjoyed dinner at stratosphere, the food was decent enough but the views were truly amazing and constantly changing as the restaurant revolved.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was great”
Reviews.Author: RiotPelaaja
Reviews.Content: The Hotel and the Mandalay Bay complex is big that you wouldn't have to leave for a good five days and you could still eat at a different place each night and see something new. While the hotel's at the end of the strip next to the Luxor, there's a shuttle that takes you from the hotel via Luxor to the Excalibur, which is right at the intersection where MGM is...for those who dont know Vegas, this is the place the where the "action" starts, with more stores, restaurant etc. So it's a bit of a walk from the hotel to get around definitely, but doable. The hotel's connected to the Luxor, which is cool. There's some shops in-between the hotels. The Hotel at Mandalay Bay is really nice, with very spacious rooms. My regular room was comprised of a living room and a big bedroom that connects to the huge bathroom. There's two toilets btw. Everything from the tv's (one in each room) to the toiletries and the bed was excellent. The room was comfy, you could definitely stay there for a longer time. The work desk was ok, the work chair not so great, but the internet was super fast. It should be at the price of 11$ a day. I was working while I was there and I was uploading files at over 200 kilobytes per second to our servers, which is very fast and not very common in hotels. Only the breakfast at The Hotel's own restaurant was very slow and pretty standard fare. You only have to walk a bit further to find the Red White and Blue restaurant which served up the best american breakfast I've had in like 10 years, great place. The service outside the restaurant was impeccable. My toilet didn't flush and it took about 10 minutes for someone to show up and fix it after my call. Checking out and in was a breeze. There's a few nightclubs at the hotel, with the Mix being on the 65th floor. Suffice to say the view is incredible. It was 10$ to get in after 11pm for hotel guests, 25$ for others. Great place, very expensive, but very comfy and cool.

Reviews.Title: “Eh, it was so-so”
Reviews.Author: jasmin193
Reviews.Content: To be fair, my expecations were teased a little bit about this hotel, I had booked through my Amex Platinum so was all excited to pay for the standard suite and get upgraded to the next suite courtesy of the card. Upon arrival, my 'upgrade' was simply that my room was at the corner, therfore a slightly better view. I called downstairs and they basically said there were no other types of rooms except penthouse, which I was not 'eligible' to be upgraded to! I had wanted to try the $20 trick but with that attitude I am glad I didn't bother. The clerks at the desk were not friendly and barely said a word to us, just clacked away at the computer. They did let us check in at 11:30 am though, which was nice I guess, but that was still 30 mins after we got there, and we couldn't find anywhere to sit and wait in the lobby. So we bought a coffee and wandered around with our luggage. The room was clean and pretty, though like other reviews, it was indeed dark and somewhat gloomy, so I wasn't all elated as I had expected to be until we came back to the room at night and saw the impressive lighted strip view. The tvs had problems with volume and distortion and the channels were limited. It seemed like almost every channel was a promo guide about the hotel. The bathroom did have a lovely deep tub which could easily fit two it seemed. I used the bath powder the 1st night but it was not replaced the second day. The shower was nice looking but upon inspection was filmy on the showerhead and in the corners, like calcium deposits. Also, the seal on the shower door was peeling so I stepped onto a nice soaked bathmat upon exiting shower. We joked also about how much the 'body balm' smelled like Pledge! Speaking of smells, the whole hotel had intermittent patches of a fowl, sewage smell, especially on our floor, though luckily our room did not. I also felt my nostrils burn immediately in the elevator, which is a sure sign of air conditioning overload. My amex card offered guaranteed 4pm checkout, and even though I called downstairs to remind them of this, I still got a knock on my door at 11 from the maid, then another maid asked me again when I walked out of my room at 12 and I explained again. Then when we went back to get our stuff to leave at 3:45, our room key had de-activated and wouldn't open. I went down to the front desk and he just stared at me blankly and eventually handed me a re-activated card key and a checkout bill. For a 'luxury' hotel, they could have at least said something, like sorry for your inconvenience, or, your bags are still there dont worry....I had to ask all the questions and make sure I wasn't being charged for the day. I am being pretty negative but I still enjoyed the room to some extent, the mini bar was relatively affordable and it was nice to have a mini fridge. The maids were friendly and smiling, even though no one told them about our late checkout. The bathrobes and slippers were a nice touch too, and of course it always feels nice to be in a 'suite'. We ate at the Cafe and the food was good even though the waitstaff was not very attentive and they forgot our drinks until after the food came...At 'The Coffee Bar', the food and coffee were good too, but they really need some management help...the girls messed up my drip coffee order twice and were fighting with each other about the orders in front of the customers..I didn't care but still was not a great first impression, and all the customers were rolling their eyes waiting. On a side note, I had enjoyed the main Mandalay Bay's brunch a few years ago, but it has gone downhill...with lots of fried foods and unappetizing appearance. Maybe I was spoiled by the previous night's excellent buffet dinner at Bellagio. That was awesome and around the same price! Back to TheHotel...For me, a fan of minimalist and modern design, even I felt this hotel was lacking in a bit of warmth, and it all seemed a bit narrow and crowded and dark. It was less cheesy than some hotels, design wise, but I was much more impressed with the Wynn when we walked through. Wynn was bright and colorful, but still strangely modern and chic. I will hold out for a Wynn promotion next time. Oh, but we did see Dr. Drew getting out of the elevator at TheHotel, so at least there's some credibility for you...

Reviews.Title: “For those who want style instead of glitz”
Reviews.Author: mod3rntraveler
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough how much I enjoyed my honeymoon in Las Vagas because of this hotel. It was connected to the Mandalay Bay, so you were within walking distance to a major casino, but the hotel itself is seperate from that. I chose the hotel because of the pictures on the internet, and I was blown away by how nice the room actually was. I would have a very hard time ever staying anywhere else. I would not recommend it to families with children or elderly adults because of the location on the strip. Although there is a tram that takes you all the way to NY, this trip really involved alot of walking. One of our favorites was the House of Blues which was inside Mandaly Bay. We actually ate there twice. But, of course, it being our honeymoon, we spent alot of time in the room, and in the nicest robes I have ever used in a hotel. There were THREE flatscreen Tv's in this room (including one in the bathroom). A huge tub and separate highend shower sealed the deal for The Hotel to be our favorite of all time. P.S. The main bathroom is bigger than some NYC apartments.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed. All you pay for is the atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: nwwriter
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a couple of positives. It's not your typical Vegas hotel. No slots or casinos, which is nice if you want something different. Rooms/suites are large and well decorated in nice colors and furnishings. Room service was abysmal, and never arrived on both nights we stayed there. I won't even get into that fiasco but someone at that hotel needs to look at this problem. Staff were maginally friendly. Mixx restaraunt was a disappointment. Again, the atmosphere was awesome, but very expensive and the food was below par. Their signature lobster curry dish nearly made me gag at the sight of it. We were crammed into tiny tables right next to other couples. No privacy whatsoever. Went to the awesome terrace bar and finally felt redeemed, only to be told we had to leave at 10:00 because it was closing only to people that spent $$$ on bottles of liquor. Not a nice way to treat a customer that just spent $200 on a lousy dinner. Bottom line: there are much better choices in Vegas for the price. Bellagio is tops, Venetian is a class act, Four Seasons is no disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Plush comfort at the end of the strip”
Reviews.Author: blueid_bbw
Reviews.Content: Dec 2006 we made our first trip to Las Vegas, and having been we wonder why it took us so long to go. We had planned a Vegas wedding/honeymoon so we wanted accomodations that were a cut above the rest. We booked out travel package through Expedia and got what we felt was a very reasonable price. THE hotel was everything we had hoped for and more. We arrived at 3pm which seems to be the check in rush. The line was long but moved very quickly. When we made our way to the reception desk to check in we were greeted with a smile and checked in quickly and couteously. THEhotel staff was freindly and knowlegable and answered all of our questions, and when we asked questions they couldn't answer...like what time does the observation platform on the Eiffel Tower at the Paris close, they found someone who could answer it for us. THEhotel was immaculately clean, our room fantastic, the bed extremely comfortable, and the bathroom was to die for. After a long day of sightseeing I resigned myself to the HUGE tub. I soaked for hours watching TV on the wall mounted LCD flat screen, while sipping champagne....what a life! If I had to say anything negetive (and I hate to call it that) it is the location. We were not aware that THEhotel was at the end of the strip, and we did not rent a car so everywhere we went was at least a 10.00 cab ride. This, however will not stop us from staying there again....next time we will rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rlh
Reviews.Content: There is no other place to stay in Vegas. This is the best hotel. You walk into the room and it really does make you go "WOW!". All rooms are suites and they are absolutely huge. Living area, bedroom, bathroom with separate toilet and another toilet in the entry way. There is a TV in every room. Beds are extremely comfortable and the whole experience was very luxurious. Rooms are very dark but there is plenty of light in the bathroom which is the most important thing. The rooms have a fantastic view down the strip. Bathrooms are perfect with large bath tub, separate shower, double vanity and beautiful amenities - including mouthwash. This is the first hotel I have stayed in where the moisturiser is actually that and has not been watered down so it feels like it is doing nothing to your skin. Porters were fast and friendly as was check in. We asked lots of questions and all were answered pleasantly. Does not take long to walk through to the Mandalay Bay Hotel and casino and all other facilities. Plenty of restaurant choices within the complex. Only downside is the booths where they offer free shows if you go to some 2 hour seminar. We weren't interested and got sick of being asked every time you walked past them. All hotels have these now and there are even some along the street. I felt like I was back in Asia with the amount we got hounded by these people. Highly recommend the Hotel at Mandalay Bay. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “A classy place on the strip”
Reviews.Author: ndfan01
Reviews.Content: My brother, not much of a Vegas fan, invited his girlfriend and I to spend a weekend in LV at the last minute. I belong to the MGMMirage slot club and called to see what I kind of a weekend deal I could get on a couple of rooms at Mandalay Bay. I was pleased when the casino desk advised that I had a 2 night comp at THEHotel I could use for one room. The second room there would have been a fortune even at casino rate, so since this was a true 1 bedroom suite, I figured the 3 of us would be fine in one room. I had been erroneously told that the sofa was a fold out bed. It isn't. So I did spend a few less than comfortable nights on the sofa. (We asked for a rollaway on check in when we discovered that the sofa wasn't a fold out. It didn't arrive on our first night. When they brought one the second night, a few hours on that lumpy torture device persuaded me I was more comfortable on the sofa.) This hotel does have a masculine decor. I didn't mind it, but it is sleek and cool rather than charming. We did not have much of a view. And I have to say that if that was a plasma tv in the living room, it was the worst plasma tv on the market. The screen was big but the picture was grainy and blurry. They don't get too many channels either. For these prices, they need to upgrade to HD. Aside from those issues though, this is a top quality room at a top quality hotel. It is very comfortable and spacious to relax in, the toiletries and amenities are top notch. We found the service to be quite good in all facets, and dinner at the Mix was pricey but absolutely divine. It is a young hip upscale crowd for the most part. Other people I knew who stayed there warned that it was a journey to the casino, but I really didn't think so, and I liked coming down the elevator to a peaceful lobby instead of din and smoke, especially in the morning. It would be a very long walk to the pool, but the weather wasn't conducive to pool lounging so that didn't affect us. Some of the restaurants are a mile away (i.e. Border Grill in particular) but so what? Half the fun is the people watching. The Mandalay has by far the best restaurant and bar selection of any property in Vegas. It is always a treat to try something new, and it would take quite a few visits to exhaust all of the options. We liked "Red", Rumjungle, Border Grill, and especially the aforementioned "Mix" I really like this resort, and would recommend it to the younger crowd who like to party more than they like to gamble, or to honemooners who plan on spending significant time in the room. The club was obviously popular, and the crowd was great looking, and largely drunk. For video poker players like me, the pickings are slim and the paytables lousy. I got lucky on some stupid slot machine though, so I broke even in the casino. This is not a place I'd recommend for someone who plans to gamble for long periods. It is not particularly comfortable, and the table limits and slot selections are crummy. Nice sports book though. It was a great trip, and good time had by all of us. I'll go back for a sporting event type weekend for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The best by far”
Reviews.Author: ESH07
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a quick business trip to Vegas. THE Hotel is easily one of the best hotels in town. I stayed in a "basic" room, all rooms in the hotel are suites. Even at the lowest level the rooms are enourmous, bathrooms top notch, marble, walk in showers, oversized bathtubs, etc. There are 3 TV's in every room: living room, bedroom and bathroom. 2 bathrooms in each room, one in the living room. Everything is beautifully appointed. For Vegas, this is the best you can get. Room rates change so often, I paid $339 but it's worth every penny at The Hotel. I will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness, Service, Not here!”
Reviews.Author: matslaw
Reviews.Content: Should have check here 1st. ** *75 of the 482 reviews were 'Okay but with Problems' or LESS** That’s 15.56% negative. ** 1 out of every 7 guests has a problems with TheHotel. ** 27 of those are 'Terrible' (5.6%) ** 1 out of 20 have a terrible experience! ** I'll try to make it brief, but hard to do: ** The front desk staff are not rude per-say, but are extremely apathetic. 'I need your CC and ID, here is your room key. Elevators are over there, NEXT.' She didn't even TELL us what our room number was, had to get it from the card. ** TV in living room had no volume until it hit 100% even then it was fuzzy sound. Bathroom TV inop. So no News, that is okay I guess. ** Made reservations for dinner through TheHotel reservation system, guess the restaurant was not informed by TheHotel. In the light of day, the armchair in bedroom was COVERED in gross stains, as were several couch cushions. (If I had noticed the night before, I would have asked for a new room or checked out and found other accommodations all together. Wonder how clean the bed was that I slept in, makes me sick thinking of it.) ** Tissue box in bathroom was soaked with water, and not by us. ** Down to the Bathhouse. Usually a spa will give you a lay-of -the-land tour right? Not here. Walked around to orient myself in the spa, little hint for The Bathhouse: lable the doors so you can tell the showers from the saunas. Found that the lounge chairs at the Bathhouse are disgusting. Every one is covered in stains. (Go ahead, check it out yourself.) So I shudder to think how clean this place REALLY is, so skipped the sauna that I wanted to use. ** Wife’s pedicure was between 2 robed men (they could have mentioned that service was co-ed.) During her treatment, the techs discussed their hours, and lack of benefits. "Sorry Honey, I know that was supposed to be a relaxing experience, maybe next time." ** The final kick in the teeth? Upon leaving, an elevator arrived with 2 maintenance workers. One went off to some task, the other held the elevator for us and said 'This one is going down,' no reason to doubt her, so boarded only to find (as the doors closed) that the next 2 floors up had been pushed. Nit-picky, sure, but is typical of the lack of attention to detail here. ** There are SO many nice places in Vegas, do yourself a favor, go elsewhere. By the way, that makes 76 of 483 negative, and 28 of 483 Terrible. It is supposed to be an upscale 4star hotel after all, why bother.

Reviews.Title: “My choice....hands down!”
Reviews.Author: hotelafficianado
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler who stays in Las Vegas frequently, I have stayed at all the top properties. The Bellagio and Wynn are very nice but, I don't like having to schlep through the casino with my luggage and deal with all of the smoke in the casino. The Signature @ MGM is very nice and has it's own direct entrance, so you don't have to go through the casino to get to the hotel elevators. It has a more residential feel, with a kitchenette in the rooms. Though I prefer a direct hotel entrance and a more quiet and secluded atmosphere than hotels inside casinos, The Signature was a bit too quiet and secluded for me. THE Hotel strikes the perfect balance: direct hotel entrance, relatively quiet and secluded, fantastic rooms (design-wise and size-wise), great food, fabulous spa. I would agee that the rooms can seem a bit dark but, that was not the case on my most recent stay. They must have upped the wattage on the bulbs. On my first visit, it was a bit confusing to find the entrance. I don't see that as a negative, though. Any of the hotels that are more secluded in Vegas, have off-the-beaten-path entrances. The Signature's entrance is hard to find, too. That's what makes them more secluded. All in all, THE Hotel is my top choice in Vegas....hands down!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Baby”
Reviews.Author: Hoteljunkee
Reviews.Content: Love the look .. I had stayed at the Mandalay Bay hotel before but a friend suggest i upgrade to THE HOTEL.. i loved the room and the showers.. Very masculine feel to the rooms Everyone was so delightful.. I cant wait to go back again .. If you can go to Mix for dinner great view and great pppl watching

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, comps no longer impressive”
Reviews.Author: JETSJetsJetsJets
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas with two friends in late December 2006. This was my 5th trip to Vegas and I have stayed at the Bay every time except for one where I stayed at the Bellagio. The staff at the Hotel was great, the room was in perfect shape and the room service was good. I have eaten at some of the restaurants there and always had good food. The Bay is a nice place to stay if you want to be away from the action a bit when you are ready to relax. It never gets as crowded as the casinos in the center of the strip. They were doing remodeling at the sushi bar portion of the casino, which was sad because I love sushi. Other than that I didn't notice anything out of the ordinary. My only complaint with the Bay, and this will stop me from every returning, is the comps have gone downhill. They are now completely part of the MGM/Mirage universe which means they have a much more corporate culture/numbers crunching approach to comps. It used to be much better. I played at an average of over $300 per bet according to their stats and that didn't warrant complete coverage of my room and food/beverage. Their stats were also a bit off as they showed I lost 1800 but I lost a lot more than that. Not sure how I could have only lost that with an average of 300/hand, my luck is not that good. I still was charged for one night of the room, some food as well as the mini-bar. I tried to get the last $350 I was charged taken care of but they said I was already overcomped. The fact that I had to call to try and nickle and dime over what was only one bet based on my play is ridiculous. Same thing happened to me at the Bellagio earlier in the year, and they are both MGM/Mirage properties. The Bay has never given me grief with comps in the past. I was offered free rooms at Paris any time while playing at a blackjack table there based on my play so I will be staying at Paris when I return to Vegas in 2007.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it - why the gripes?”
Reviews.Author: hopenm
Reviews.Content: Okay, I can't say that what other reviewers have said was untrue - the room was a bit dark, a lightbulb did happen to be out, and we couldn't imagine why we would want to fax anyone from Vegas (or for that matter, weigh ourselves - ouch!). Having said that - so what?!?!?!? Everything about THE hotel was great - least cheesy decor in Vegas, great giant tub with cool water-fall faucet, large suite, and a nifty "do not disturb/housekeeping" lightswtich. When I wanted more bath salts and a towel, they were in our room in about 5 seconds flat. We especially loved the roomservice. I am usually not one to order room service and when I do I don't expect much, but after twisting my ankle (one should not simultaneously walk and stare at the Bellagio fountains), it was the only option. Not only did it arrive in 1/2 the time they said, it was DELICIOUS! Ahi tuna tartare, lobeter cobb salad and prime rib - every bit yummy. Apparently the chef at THE cafe was a runner up on a reality cooking show - Top Chef, I think. Yes, you can find something to complain about anywhere, but with so much right, why?

Reviews.Title: “"Secluded" Stay on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: DaytripperVA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at THEHotel at Mandalay Bay for four nights immediately before Christmas. We have previously stayed at the Bellagio and the Venetian in Las Vegas and liked "THEHotel" the best so far. (They like to brand everything "THE," pronounced as "thee," to include the spa (THE Bathhouse), THE pad for notes, and up to the little sticker on the toilet tissue saying "THE TP." Some folks might find it pretentious or overly ironic, but we just found it amusing.) We booked via an Orbitz package with air and hotel and were upgraded by the hotel to a corner suite (number 17916--rooms ending in 917, 816, and 817 are also corner suites). Standard suites are on floors up to 23--the first two digits in the room number--and luxury suites are on 24 and higher. The hotel website has good photos of both. The room was quite large, although the corner rooms lose a little space due to the curve of the bedroom wall for the extra windows. There is a separate sitting area with sofa, easy chair, and coffee table as well as a wet bar area and a separate half bath. There are flat panel TVs in both the sitting area and bedroom as well as a smaller one in the bathroom, which has a double vanity (with good storage space), separate tub (luxury suite tubs are jetted) and large shower, and separate toilet. Good amenities (their brand, also for sale in THEBathhouse), nice towels, and sheets. Did have to ask for a bathrobe and then they only brought one although the hotel was not busy--at least the initial couple nights of our stay. A very comfortable and functional suite. Maybe because of the extra windows in the corner suite, did not find it dark as other reviewers have said. Used the spa for several treatments as well as the gym. Both were very nice and had great service. Prices were reasonable. You can also book to use the spa at the adjoining Mandalay Bay (much larger, lighter in colors but also nicely maintained and serviced) and at the also adjoining Four Seasons (did not book there as prices about 30 percent higher for treatments than at Bathhouse or Spa Mandalay). Marcia and Michael give very nice deep tissue massages at Spa Mandalay and Penny gives a nice facial at THEBathhouse. Did not eat at THE Coffeebar (used the Starbucks at entrance to Mandalay Bay casino) or THE Cafe, but did eat at the House of Blues in Mandalay Bay, Cafe Georgio in the Mandalay Place shopping area, and THE Mix restaurant on the top floor of the hotel.
