HOB was fine, Cafe Georgio quite good, and Mix excellent. Had no line at check-in but should have asked for written print-out of what was included in our package from Orbitz as it differed slightly from the hotel's own promotional package (two-for-one spa passes instead of two complimentary spa passes--which cost $30 per day if not booking a service over $50, for example). Line for check-in on Christmas Eve was massive, however. We had several issues to resolve on check-out (due in part to differences in understanding of what was included) but they were resolved very professionally and amiciably by the staff. As noted in other reviews, the hotel's front entrance is via the parking garage--it's a little confusing on entry, but if you check out the map on the hotel's web site you will know exactly where to go. It's great not to enter via a casino and the lobby is quiet and modernly elegant. The location on the south end of the Strip and away from the main Mandalay Bay hotel, make it a little secluded oasis in the midst of all the Las Vegas glitz--giving you the best of both worlds.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally nice”
Reviews.Author: markgregory
Reviews.Content: Did some checking online, since I was looking for an upscale hotel, and this fit the bill. The rooms are really gorgeous, tasteful decor, very elegant. Staff was very polite and prompt, and I honestly cannot thing of one thing about the place that was anything but perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel-The Place 2 B”
Reviews.Author: caribart
Reviews.Content: I planned to visit Las Vegas for the first time to celebrate my 9th Anniversary as a "Surprise present" so I wanted the tip to be well planned and special. I did online research, sought personal advice from friends who have been to Vegas before and came down to a short list of two for my hotel choice. It was either The Signature at MGM or The Hotel at Mandalay Bay. In the end I chose correctly and booked at THE HOTEL at Mandalay Bay. After a 12 hour flight, arrived just after midnight on a Friday at THE HOTEL, looking forward to the start of a Restful and Romantic stay. The Hotel is a short cab ride from the International Airport (approx USD15.00) It is true that the approach to the lobby is like driving thru a service entrace/multi-level parking garage. Although no bell-hop or doorman greeted us we walked confidently into the Hotel's entrance and wheeled our way to the check in desk at the back, passing the coffee bar and cocktail bar. Seemed very chic, elegant and nice energy. CHECK IN: Without a moment to spare, could not wait for a shower and to hit the bed for some rest after our long flight, ony to be told at check in that "WE ARE OVER BOOKED-we can only offer you a room with a rollaway" Well, my smile dropped to the floor, like a fine crystal glass to marble tiles. My specially planned trip is being undermined by bad Reservations Management. I had paid a deposit in advance of coming and also commented on my late flight arrival at the time of booking. The Checkin clerk offered no other alernative. As embarrased as I was when I saw the look on my partner's face at his disappointment, I asked from the Front Desk Manager. I was told that she would tell me the same thing. I asked again, insisting the she tell me. After a [----] and some flarring of nostrils and stamping of feet, my suite miraculously became available on the 36th floor. SUITES: As advertised, all the trimming I was expecting. Very nice, elegant, contemporary and comfortable with adequate lighting. The draw of the curtains revealed an amazing Southward view over the suberbs of the city to the mountains and also a view of the runway (I like airport observations) Room was extremely spacious, well appointed, good amenties however, no coffee maker which I found odd. BEDS: Although I had requested a KING BED for my Anniversary trip I had to settle with two Queens (no comment) nut the bedding was indeed very comfortable. Great rest was earned. LOCATION: THE HOTEL is at the Southern end of The Strip and off the busy Casino of Mandalay Bay. This was a good thing for me, away from the gawkers which the others hotels attract and noise of the strip . The Monotrail from the Mandalay Bay thru Luxor and Excalibur is a good headstart to entering the strip. Access to/from LAs Vegas BLVD and I-15 is easy and away from the traffic associated with the Strip. A CAr Rental for out of town exploring will work for this location quite easily. Dollar Rent a Car is at the Mandalay Bay-Beach Level. RESTAURANTS: One of the highlights of our trip is fine dining. It is for this reason that we like London and New York City so much, especially NYC. I have discovered that Las Vegas is quickly becoming a Fine Dining mecca with many celeb chefs and high end designers creating new rendy restaurants, like NYC. Overall, the design element was great but the food quality fell short and the prices much higher than a midtown meal. We ate at: MIX (For the actual Anniversary Dinner) reserved via Opentable website. Staff were very attentive, all acknowleging the special day. The dining room is spectacular and white. The window seat we got had awesome views from the top of THE HOTEL. Food was 7 out of 10 and our dessert came with HAPPY ANNIVERSARY scrolled out in choclate on the plate. We also ate at FAT BURGER on the Strip for a quick burger but HAVE THE MILKSHAKE (This is a diner). Dinner at FIX at The Bellagio after O was good, nice trendy mood, another 7 out of 10. Then lunch at BURGER BAR for healthy gourmet burgers in the Shops at Mandalay Bay i a must....8 out of 10. We tried only one buffet (not our style of dining-but when in Rome...) The Buffet at THE BELLAGIO was our choice..... 7 out of 10. On the last night we ate at STRIPSTEAK at Mandalay Bay which was probably the best meal 8.5 out of 10 (we were walk-ins) so could have been seated in the lounge. We ate breakfast everyday at THE CAFE off the lobby at THE HOTEL which was very nice always. MANDALAY BAY has a great selection of restaurants including Red Square, Lupo, Rum Jumgle, Areole and Flyr de LI (spelling) you could not want for anything else. Overall: Bellagio was best casino and hotel lobby for people watching. Checkin desks always had long queues as did taxi lines. Venetian seemed the most difficult to navigate and the Gondola ride captures my RIP-OFF prize. The Italian accent was wrong and the lyrics to the song was wrong to add insult to injury-Tourist Trap!!! Danicing Waters at Bellagiio is mesmerizing. Shopping was ok at FASHION SHOW MALL just next to Treasure Island and opposite the WYNN. We also drove to Las Vegas Fashion Oulet at Primm....that was a wate of time. Best find for shopping is at FRIES on South Las Vegas Blvd., about 1 mile South of Mandalay Bay. A techie heaven, it is like BETTER THAN BEST BUY. SHOWS: Booked in advance to avoid disappointment> Saw KA at MGM which was good but preferred O at Bellagio which was awesome 9 out of 10. Also recommend BLUE MAN GROUP at The Venetian, and Bally's Jubilee for the real Vegas showgirl experience...aslo include the backstage tour here. And last but not least, the highlight of my trip was THE HELICOPTER TOUR OF THE GRAND CANYON, LAKE MEADE and HOOVER DAM. I called ahead of my trip to the concierge at Mandalay Bay and they recommended either Amverick or Sundance. I eventually booked via Air Vegas, using one of the Sundance Tours. A courtesy white limo arrive to pick us up for the short drive to the heliport. A small check in terminal and gift shop was comfortable and the pilots were personable and conducted the tour well. Five of us were on our 945am flight and we were able to alternate with who got to ride infront with the pilot. The Canyon was beyond words spectacular. Once landing there, you are just one in touch with nature. AWESOME. Wished we had more time there to absorb. Great picnic basket and light champagne was offered. Return flight brought us in over the Strip. Hotel-Hotel was 4 hours. Well worth the money. Can also recommend adding the rafting opion, but in warmer weather. (BOOK IN ADVANCE) Sundance was very professional and excellent Customer Service. And all this was just on a action packed 5 day trip. We don't gamble! Although we did the token 10.00 in slots to say we did it.

Reviews.Title: “best Hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dennythepenny
Reviews.Content: For those who want to stay in an upscale property on the Strp but are tired of walkng through a smoke filled casino to get to the elevators for your room, this is the place to stay. You have all of the conveniences of one of the large Luxury Hotels with the Mandalay Bay attached. If you want to gamble it s one of nicest Casinos in Vegas but you are not relegated to traveling through it to come and go to the Hotel. The rooms are all suites with great amenities and wonderful modern decor. Prices are comparable to the other Large high end Hotels, Belagio, Venitian, ect... but the lobby and atmosphere is quite and low key. No security to hassle you as in the Bellagio and Venitian. The staff is remarkably personal for such a large hotel which makes it feel much more like a Botique Hotel, which it certianly is not. Also, the Mandalay Bay has the best selecton of good restaurants of any of the large Hotels. Try the Chna Grill for some truly unusual food.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: EllieC
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at The Hotel whilst on honeymoon - what a good decision! The Hotel is one of the most stylish and elegant hotels I have stayed in. The lobby is beautiful and the rooms are lovely. We stayed in one of the 1 bedroom suites and it was absolutely perfect. The staff on the front desk were very helpful. When we first checked in they did not have a strip view room but they arranged for us to be moved the following day. As the hotel is at the end of the strip you get a perfect view of all of the other hotels. Definitely ask for a high floor / strip view room. If you don't have a view y(or even if you do) you should head to the bar on the top floor. Very slick indeed. This hotel is very good for escaping from the hustle and bustle of Vegas. You do feel slightly away from the centre of activity but we really enjoyed being able to go out, enjoy the fast pace of Vegas and then escape back to our sanctuary. The only disappointment was the cafe in the lobby. We were served by a very grumpy and unhelpful waiter (the only one we came across on a 3 week trip) and the food was average. There is however a very nice coffee shop and so many other places to eat nearby that this wouldn't put me off staying there again - in fact I doubt I would stay anywhere else in Vegas unless I was on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE....BUT CAVE-LIKE DARK!”
Reviews.Author: bellamanhattan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights at THEhotel at Mandalay Bay, Las Vegas. BIGGEST COMPLAINTS: NO COFFEEMAKER IN ROOM! UGH! VERY DARK ROOM! HARD TO FIND OUR WAY AROUND CASINO & RESTAURANTS~! ONE, GIANT MAZE! Our first impression was not good. As we entered a VERY large parking structure, the mixture of DIESEL fumes and SEWAGE was nauseating! It was not easy to find where to park - we drove around a bit before entering the sewage/diesel fume-filled structure. As we carried our bags into THEhotel, we weren't sure if we were even in the correct place. Mandalay Bay is right next door and we didn't know if we were at Mandalay, or at THEhotel at Mandalay. There were no visible signs pointing to either hotel. As we walked past the casino, we were utterly clueless as to where to check in. After finally stopping to ask, we were pointed in the right direction, though it was like a three-hour tour trying to reach the check-in desk! Add a few corn fields and it would have been a great maze! Check-in was simple for me, however, the other party we were with didn't have it so good. Her reservations were not in the computer at first, and when they were finally found, she was given the runaround about receiving the same "goodies" that we got (she booked the identical package (thePleasures) at the same time we booked our package ($250 shopping coupons, 2 free passes to Shark Reef and 2 free passes to the Spa). After pleading with the clerk, she finally got her goodies, but, the clerk had to add "you're not supposed to be getting these" as if to say she was doing her a favor (and to get the last word in). After all of that, we were sent to separate elevators (we were on floor 32 and she was on floor 15). We tried to get rooms next to each other and were told they were not available. THE ROOM: VERY POORLY LIT! Bring your flashlights and Coleman lanterns because you will need them in order to see anything! The beds were very comfortable! Nice bedding, warm and cozy! The TV in the bathroom was awesome, and the two PLASMA TVs in the living room and bedroom were great! Pay per view movies were standard in price (10.99 and 11.99 for the two we watched), but what was great is that they have "not yet released to DVD movies", which was a treat! The mini bar had lots of goodies, which is great if you want to pay $30 for a 1/2 bottle of wine! The Pringles came in handy for my kids though. Very noisy party going on the night of November 22nd. I woke up at about 1:30 and all I could hear were people laughing, and music, which seemed to be coming from downstairs somewhere! Bring ear plugs. Thanksgiving night was better. BATHROOM: In the bathroom was a scale that didn't work. Thank goodness for that! The bathrooms were the only well-lit areas (great for visualizing all of the imperfections). Great, DEEP tub, and a wonderful, magnifying make-up mirror (to see ALL of the wrinkles!) Actually, I really liked the mirror! The plasma TV on the wall was a PLUS! Just don't drop the remote in the tub! Shower was just okay. HOUSEKEEPING: There were no robes (but there were slippers) in our room - had to call to have them brought up. Housekeeping was very prompt w/ the robes, as well as extra shampoo and bath stuff! Once we got the robes, we discovered they were worth the wait! VERY HEAVY AND PLUSH! NICE! Housekeeping was very generous w/ extra bath stuff, too! They were nice, in general. ROOM SERVICE: We arrived at about 3:30, and had driven from California, so, we had a "snack". The kids ordered mango smoothies which, from what I could tell by the empty glasses, were GREAT! My husband and I split the Vietnamese beef summer rolls which were served w/ a spicy peanut sauce and were VERY GOOD. We also split the mozzarella/tomato/balsamic plate which was OUTSTANDING. He had a beer and I had a Ketel One Citroen Martini, which was wonderful! Room service was reasonably prompt, and, not too unreasonably priced for the amount of food that was served (we weren't hungry after spllitting the two hors d'oeuvres). CASINO: The casino was smoky, but, I've been in worse. I hate sitting in it! It would be nice if there were a non-smoking section. I also hate to drag my kids through all of the second hand smoke, but, you have to, in order go get around. The casino doesn't use money. They use paper vouchers, which worked just fine, until went to cash out and my voucher got stuck. I had to wait by my machine for a good 10 minutes before tackling an attendant for help. I practically had to run and jump on him to get him to come over to my machine! There are not nearly enough attendants on the floor. However, on a positive note, the casino was not overly crowded (except for the tables, which is the case everywhere you go). SHOPS: WAY overpriced and not enough diversity in selection. I am from Manhattan Beach, CA. We know shopping here and we know that many places are pricey. Almost every store in this place was HUGE $$$$! RESTAURANTS: Buffet for breakfast on day 2. Not great! Good price, however. 13.99 for adults. 10.99 for kids. If you are the all-you-can-eat type, this is for you. We aren't. We go more for quality than quantity. The bacon was repulsive (though that might be redundant). I took a bite and looked for a napkin to spit it in. It was all fat - disgusting! The oatmeal was runny and slimy. The eggs weren't from real hens. They had to be from silicone hens. They were unreal in appearance. I didn't bother to try them. The omelette bar was way too crowded to attempt. The fresh fruit actually looked good. There were crab legs which were split down the middle. I didn't have any. I love crab, but,, for breakfast? My husband had them and said they were good. The service was good. The coffee was great! RAFFLES: We had our 2nd breakfast here and though the service was very slow, the food was OUTSTANDING. Bacon, eggs, fresh fruit, coffee, ALL WONDERFUL! RED, WHITE AND BLUE: We ate dinner here. I had the chicken noodle soup & a lemon martini. It was fantastic. I had them add a Matzo ball to the soup because I've never had Matzo ball soup. The Matzo balls were gross, but, I'm not a conneisseur. The kids split spaghetti, which was fantastic! The man had a burger. He said it was great. Later, we got ice cream to go, from there. My kids said it was the best Cookies and Cream ever! STAFF: Overall, nice, accommodating. Not overly friendly, but not rude. FOOD: Stay away from breakfast buffet! ROOM: Dark! Noisy on first night. Very comfortable, though. WOULD I RECOMMEND: No. Though the suites were lovely (smallish, though, for a suite), clean, comfortable, and definitely worth $150 per night, I would not recommend it simply because it was irritating trying to figure out how to get around the casino and restaurants, and, the rooms were cave-like dark! Very difficult to read, or see anything other than the TV! One other downer was that the beach and lazy river were closed, and I was not informed of this when I made the reservation. WOULD I GO BACK? Possibly. We will try the Bellagio next time (we ate dinner at Sensi on Thanksgiving. Very, very expensive, but, great food). For $150 a night, THEhotel is certainly upscale; lounge, nice coffee bar and beautiful restaurant right off the elevators, which was very convenient. Walk a little further and you'll hit a Starbucks! Despite all of the negative comments (it is a review, after all), I feet this was a great deal, even without the beach or lazy river.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, CLASSY Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aleigh0119
Reviews.Content: Well, I know it has been awhile since we stayed at Thehotel, but felt I should "give back" to the TripAdvisor commuity since I use this site so religiously! Thehotel was wonderful. From start to finish, I couldn't have asked for a better experience. Well, I guess one can wish for perfection (as evident by some of these reviews), but honestly, Thehotel is a remarkable little gem in a city of high-rise hotels hosting 1000's of guests a night. I agree with some of the other reviews, very NY "boutique-style" hotel yet there are over 1,100 suites in this place. And the suites are what makes this place remarkable. The beds are delicious, the bathrooms - heavenly. The location is at the end of the Strip. I don't know about anyone else, but we took a taxi everyhere we went OR you can take the tram from the Mandalay to the Luxor, MGM and get down further down the Strip before hoofing it. I liked being away from the action a bit & also being able to look down the entire Strip from the bar and restaurant at the top of Thehotel - WOW!!! If you are accustomed to nice linens, ultra-comfortable beds, huge bathrooms and wonderful service, you won't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “What a Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: orisam
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 who travelled from the UK to celebrate our sons 21 birthday. When booking our airline tickets the agent said that if possible to stay in TheHotel. We shopped around a got a great deal through Orbitz for 5 nights. As a regular tripadviser visitor I thought I had a good idea of what TheHotel was going to be like but it exceeded our expectations. The suites are a very good size, especially if 4 are staying and ideal for families with the tv's in every room. With regards to the quality of the picture on them - no problem and to be honest who comes to Vegas to be a couch potato? The beds were sooo comfortable after long days to the extent of when got home went out and bought a new bed. Rooms were very clean, the only concern was when we first went into our room the previous occupants had eaten/drunk from the mini bar and tried to cover their tracks but from previous experience we always check so we dont get charged, this was rectified with 1/2 hour. Although TheHotel does not have a casino in the reception it is a pleasant change in Vegas. The walk to the pool is further than you expect but it is worth the walk. We found no problems at all getting sunbeds and the pools are fantastic especially for children. All in all we had a fantastic time here and would definately stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “You have arrived in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Andy99
Reviews.Content: Arrived somewhat frazzled and grumpy after almost 24 hours travelling. Check in was efficient and very friendly and I was in the suite without delay. Excellent living / sleeping space, spacious and clean. No complaints at all for $179. I only wished I could have stayed longer to fully enjoy the facilities. A great place to stay if you don't mind being at the end of the strip. I stayed on business, but would definitely stay again if I was coming for a break.

Reviews.Title: “UGH”
Reviews.Author: OverTraveling
Reviews.Content: Like others, I read all the reviews, evaulated the pro's / con's and decided to roll the dice. I travel 75% of the time so I've seen my fair share of hotels. At first I was critical in my travels...but after 5+ years of living on the road, it takes alot to disappoint me as well as impress me. We arrived on a Thursday and stayed until Monday. VALET / DOORMEN: We had a driver from the airport so I can't really comment on valet parking. I can say the taxi cab line was minimal throughout our stay, which is awesome for Vegas. I don't recall any doorman, but will all the madness out "front"...who could tell. I don't expect to have a glam arrival to this hotel. The "front" doors ae located in a parking garage. It's hot, sticky and full of exhaust fumes. However, once inside....you quickly go from drap to fab in the blink of an eye. Lobby is exactly like photos and yes, the front desk is at the end of this super long catwalk, I mean hallway. We arrived fairly late (11pm) so there was no wait...another rarity in Vegas. CHECK-IN The reviews are 100% accurate ! A-T-T-I-T-U-D-E and for no reason.....Puuuuleaze people !! Check-In wasn't a breeze but I anticipated that. After 20 minutes (remember...there was no wait)...we were off to our room. Down one hall over to the other, past the ultra sleek bar (which was playing football or some other sports thing on the TV's...totally not appropriate). GUESTROOM Again, just like the photos...stunning, everything you need, everything you expected...bathrooms are sexy, towels are fluffy (another rarity in hotels everywhere). Only Con....ever tried to get dressed in a nightclub? The lighting makes anyone gorgeous....but when your getting dressed, you want to see all the flaws that need to be corrected. The lighting in the rooms, including bathroom, are the WORST. I don't want a halogen light...but I bulb over 40w would have been nice. HOUSEKEEPING Very clean and like magical fairies....you never see them. Room was spotless when we got there and each day we returned. Hats off to them ! POOL The pool is literally less than a 5 minute walk. If you can't do that without huffing and puffing, this high-end fashion hotel is probably not the right fit for you (or your body). Mandalay Bay pool rocks...THE END! There isn't a pool like it in Vegas. We experienced the "private pool" this trip too. Oooh la la...recommend it too....but not to the huffy puffy folks who complain about the walk. SPA Even though it only takes a few elevator stops to reach....it's a WORLD away from reality. Friendly staff who had good reason to throw attitude, but didn't. Bathhouse totally raised the spa bar in Vegas....can't wait to go back !!! LOCATION Now, this is the only "complaint" I have about the lovely THE hotel @ Mandalay Bay. On the baseball diamond of Vegas....this hotel is over the fence, past the parking lot and barely in town. Okay, it's not that bad...especially if you rely on drivers or taxi cabs (which we did in the evening time). The few times we did venture to the strip I wish I had worn my sytlish sneakers vs. some trendy thing. Down the elevator.....over to the pool....thru the pool compound (which is HUGE and great when your laying there...not enjoyable when trying to walk thru it)....thru Mandalay Bay....down the drive....viola, your finally at the strip. At the end of the strip....but your on the strip. ONE LAST NOTE.... I totally shouldn't bash the location. For those have been to Vegas a hundred times....but yet, have never been to the world famous "Welcome to Vegas" sign. The sign is literally 2-3 minutes from the front drive of Mandalay. I highly suggest you going left vs. right the next time you head out of Mandalay....and bring your camera.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Osprey1
Reviews.Content: Just a classy, well executed boutique style hotel. Nice suites, beds are excellent, I liked the DVD player in suite. Nice robe and Bathroom products. The location is good for not having to fight as much traffic as at the south end of the strip. No casino in the lobby of this hotel, you have to walk a little to Mandalay Bay proper, which is ok by me. I like modern, more spartan design, and this place is right up my alley. The Mandalay Bay Pool is great, with the wave pool and everything- I haven't seen a better pool in Vegas so far. Have stayed here before this trip and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Slick, Sassy & Sorted”
Reviews.Author: Wolfsbait
Reviews.Content: After enjoying Beverly Hills, Big Sur, San Francisco and Death Valley, but enduring Monterey Bay and the soulless charms of a new Mustang convertible, Vegas was a welcome retreat into the surreal and The Hotel @ Mandalay Bay was pure sanctuary. Myself and my young family are a laid back set, so I can't really comment on whether the mattress was of regulation depth or the plasma's in each room were of the pre-requisite definition for HD viewing...However, what I can say is the view from our V-Suite was utterly awesome - rendering the use of a TV, no matter how well defined, a rather secondary passtime - and the bed was as comfortable as you'd expect in a top hotel. And that's exactly what The Hotel is....a top hotel. Great room service, very friendly concierge, wonderful lobby and the awesome Mix bar all made for a great base to explore the nonsense of Las Vegas... So, if you're blessed with taste and aren't overly keen on gold leaf and chintz, then the subdued elegance of this place won't disappoint...book a V Suite on a 20+ floor and non-disappointment is virtually guaranteed.

Reviews.Title: “A Solid Las Vegas Choice, Somewhat Distant Location”
Reviews.Author: ocGlobetraveler
Reviews.Content: As many of the other reviews on TripAdvisor have pointed out, theHotel is one of Las Vegas' more hip hotel options. Until the W Las Vegas arrives, this is it. theHotel at Mandalay Bay offers a nice alternative to some of Las Vegas's other casino hotels. Although the property is attached to Mandalay Bay, guests don't have to contend with a casino being at the lobby level. This can make a huge difference when traveling back and fourth to your room. Depending on the nature of your visit, the general location of this hotel can be average to somewhat poor. I prefer being more central to local happenings, bars, restaurants etc. Mandalay Bay tends to be somewhat removed from most of these outlets, so closely look at the map before booking. One plus is that the hotel is just a stones throw from the airport. This property features an all suite concept, which will ensure that you have plenty of room to stretch out and get comfortable. With few exceptions, rooms are almost all identical to each other. The standard layout is approximately 750 sq. feet, with a division between the bedroom and living room. Rooms are equipped with two queen beds or one king. Standard suite rooms have one main bathroom with a separate shower stall and tub, which serves as a nice feature. In the living room area, you will find an additional half bath which is nice when sharing the room with multiple people. Rooms are equipped with a plasma tv in the living room area, desk with fax machine, wet bar with minibar and sink, couch, and chairs. Rooms at theHotel are well appointed with a nice contemporary residential feel. Having stayed here several times, I have always been impressed by the accommodations. In fact, I am generally partial to the Four Seasons brand, but I must say that theHotel has more impressive rooms than the Four Seasons Las Vegas. Beds linens might not quite be as nice, but the room in general is. If nice rooms and a semi-private feel (compared to some of the other mega resorts) is what you're looking for, than I would most definitely opt for theHotel at Mandalay Bay. Service is typical of most other Las Vegas hotels- non-existent, but rooms and facilities are great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: dantoon
Reviews.Content: I was a bit leary after reading some of the reviews, but wanted to check out the hotel anyway after staying at many other Vegas locations. The room was amazing. Though not the best I have ever stayed in, my husband disagreed. The 3 tvs were nice. We wished we had more time to actually enjoy the room. The look was very clean and modern. It was great to be close to the casino, but not directly above it. The check-in was really fast because we were the only onces checking in. We requested a king, non-smoking, strip view, but did not get the view. It was fine anyway. We got in around 10 and decided to see if we could eat dinner at MIX. I wanted to go there for my birthday the next day, but after reading reviews decided against it. BIG MISTAKE!! The food and service was amazing. We really enjoyed our meal here. We paid more than usual for dinner, but were on vacation and decided to splurge. The club was crowed, but a nice view. We went to Forty-Deuce to check out the show. Not really worth the $40 cover for 2. The show was basically 3 songs and 2 dances. I would have liked at least one more dancer. The dancers they had were awesome though. I am pregnant and wanted to sit, but could only sit if we bought a $275 bottle though they said they would charge $150 since I couldn't drink. No thanks, we stood and left as soon as the show was over. Overall, THEHOTEL was great. My only complaint was that we asked for a later check-out and were told they do not offer that. After paying $900 for a room you would think they could let a pregnant woman have another hour or so. It was a nice hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome alternative to waiting 11 hours for our flight”
Reviews.Author: Msk6261
Reviews.Content: Our flight out of LAS had the potential of being delayed 8 hours (turned out to be 11) so we took the opportunity to spend another night in Vegas and fly the next day. We called the Mandalay Bay at 4:30 for an inexpensive, last minute overnight instead of the Double Tree which the airline had offered. We were thrilled with the fun atmosphere at this beautiful hotel for this unexpected addition to our weekend. They offered us a GREAT rate and upgraded us to a suite at The Hotel when we arrived. This beautiful, contemporary suite was well appointed and quiet. All was great except the pillows which were quite hard and uncomfortable. Great bathroom products were a plus. We wished we could have stayed longer since the atmsophere was fun. Not too smokey in the casino and the pool looked like a blast (as viewed at 8 am without any guests). Even though the ADA convention brought thousands of people to the convention center, the hotel did not seem overwhelmed. There are lots of really fun options for dinner and clubbing. Rum Jungle was great. The clubs were hopping even on a Monday night. I would have loved to check out the spa......it looked great. We chose to have breakfast at the airport however since the convention crowd created long lines at the coffee locations. We will definitely make The Hotel and Mandalay Bay a destination in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Don't care for staying at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cujocujo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for 3 nights in September. This is our 7th time or so to stay at this hotel. This time, the stay was not any better than expected. I see no improvement at all for over 3 years of our occasional stays. Here are a few things that I wasn’t satisfied with. ·As we drove into Valet, a bellboy didn’t show up right away, so we unloaded our luggage out of the car. As we were ready to walk into the hotel, a bellboy showed up and loaded luggage into a cart. As we walked away from him, he said, “appreciate it.” We sensed right away that he said that because we did not tip him. However, I’m glad that I didn’t tip him for less than expected service and to someone like him whose ironic attitude toward customer was not acceptable. ·Although we requested a room with 1 king size bed, as usual, the front man said that the only available room was a room with double beds. I know that room type is not guaranteed. but frequency of not having rooms with 1 king size bed is far often than other hotels we’ve stayed at. Although the front man said that he would check availability of king size bedroom next day, we never received a call from the front. I’ve seen many times here that the front promises to call you next day but they never do. ·Their computer system was down, so it took longer to check-in. ·Inside our room, 4 light bulbs were out (again, a usual pattern). So the already-not-enough-lighted room is dimmer than ever. I didn’t even bother letting the maintenance/service know since the old bulbs never got replaced despite of my requests before. ·Our room didn’t get made until 6:30 pm one day. My husband had to call to have it made when he returned to our room evening time. The room somehow doesn’t get made even though no one was in the room most of the day. No “Do Not Disturb” light was on either. This is a usual thing at this hotel. When I deal with workers at THEhotel, I truly don’t think workers there are trying to make guests’ stay easier or more pleasant. If you seek better service, it’s better off to stay at the next-door Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “something for everyone.”
Reviews.Author: 5stargirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights at THE Hotel - we had four rooms,for our teenagers (and their guests) ages 15 through 20, and then my husband and I. THE Hotel is very cool and has a minimalistic feel to it - which is a relief after your senses are bombarded by all the noise and lights of Vegas. Our check in was swift and easy, our rooms where all together (as requested) and the bed types as requested. We all had junior suites that pleased everyone - lots of room, plasma tvs in every room , big bathrooms. The views were lousy, but we were not in Vegas for a view. The rooms are also very dark, including the bathroom (guess it adds that "mood"), and there are no bathrobes. Each kid loved the hotel from the wave pool to the hip restuarant on the top floor - and we loved it because everyone was happy! This is a great place to escape to.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, very dark, very average.”
Reviews.Author: TS7
Reviews.Content: On a recent business trip I stayed at THE Hotel at Mandalay for 4 nights, Mon-Thu. For comparison purposes I've also stayed at MGM and The Wynn. Overall I can't find much to complain about, but I also can't think of a lot of good things to say. The entire stay was average. First, I'll describe the look and feel. This is a modern, dark hotel. We were frequently looking for 'one more light to turn on' inside the room. And speaking of rooms, I had a huge problem with the bathroom. It was impossible to keep the shower at a constant temperature. I experienced this each morning, as did a couple co-workers on different floors. The same angle of the faucet handle would either be scalding or freezing, dependant upon some unknown force. It made 5 minute showers last nearly 15, as you'd have to step out of the way and fiddle with the temperature, back and forth, back and forth. The bed was comfortable. The room views are average. You're either looking south or west at the Vegas suburbs, or you're looking at the back of the regular Mandalay Bay or the Luxor. You're not going to find a really nice view of the strip from any room here. The rooms do have multiple widescreen TV's, but it certainly isn't anything close to HD. This is simply a rather cheap large television with a coax signal. The picture is very average. Plus, who watches TV in the shower? I'm not sure how that got started, but it's useless to have a TV next to the bathroom mirror. The Mandalay is the furthest south of the big casinos, and thus it seems to be a little quieter and more secluded. You're not going to want to walk a lot of places from it, you'll be taking cabs or the tram. If you want to wander around, stay up near The Bellagio or Caesar's. Housekeeping was fine, room service was fine. Had a drink at the quiet bar in the lobby, and ate at "THE Cafe", which was expensive, but great service. Last note, apparently in Vegas, you don't drink the water. So when you order food and ask for the glass of water...make sure you order a bottle.

Reviews.Title: “Flatly disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: ThWilmesi
Reviews.Content: Well after reading all the reviews we arrived at The Hotel with high expecations. First the valet parking at arrival was so-so, they let us wait quite a long time despite the fact that there was no crowd checking in or out, we arrived at about 3 PM. Check-in was ok, was offered an upgrade to a bigger suite for 20 US$ a day more, but declined. Room didn't disappoint, since it was as advertised a nice big suite, with a wonderful bathroom with separate shower stall, lightning as mentioned in previous posts was poor. I requested a room with a strip view and was able to get one. So far so good, now to the less good: Service at this hotel is horrendous, it feels very pretentious and the staff let's constantly feel you in what nice hotel you are, and that is the best hotel in Las Vegas, and that it is an honour for the guest to be served by them. Couple of things in the suite didn't work properly and were never repaired. Worst of all is their housekeeping service, which doesn't show any coordination at all, the culmination of problems was that on the second day wasn't made despite the fact we left the room by 12 PM and they had a lot of time left, their housekeeping service only runs from 9 - 5, whihc in my opinion for a self proclaimed 5 star hotel or best hotel in Las Vegas is rather poor, no turndown or second housekeeping service is being offered, just plain miserable, we even had a hard time getting some fresh towels. Restaurants at the Hotel are so-so, not so good, and the MIX in my opinon, while good, is heavily overpriced. Combine this with the rather poor location at the south end of the strip, we decided to check out 3 days earlier that planned. We opted for the Mirage, where we received a very good deal, while the rooms clearly can and are not in the league of the Hotel, the property is much better run and their service and attitude is so much nicer. We will definitely not return to the Hotel nor can I recommend it except for the very stylish rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed THEhotel, calmer, modern place on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: tedward2000
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights over a weekend at the Hotel at Mandalay Bay and enjoyed the subdued (for Vegas) atmosphere of the place. The Deluxe Suites are great with plenty of room and a modern if little dark look. The room is somewhat upscale without being pretentious or stuffy. This is still Las Vegas so the hotel is big but the room differentiated itself to me from the usual room that you get in a large hotel, maybe more of a boutique feel but on a large scale. Staff was friendly and efficient, although I tend to like seeing as little of the staff as possible. The check in however was quick, friendly and the room cleaning crew did a good job. The pool area is great although crowded on the weekend day we went by. One downside for some is that the Hotel is located at the end of the Strip. It's a major walk to the core say around Caesars. We however found plenty to do at the end of the Strip, lots of restaurants and clubs and used the free tram to get as far as the Excalibur when we ventured further. I found it relaxing to enter the darker, quieter area of the Hotel from the ubiquitous casino noise when returning to the room. The Mix lounge at the top floor of the Hotel is worth a look even if just for a quick overpriced drink. The view at night is spectacular looking down at all the Casinos, lights and signs.

Reviews.Title: “SWEET”
Reviews.Author: Sexykitty714
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel @ mandalay bay!! The suite is big clean and sweet! The room is great!! You get any office with desk, fax and anything else you need to get work done which is great if your going to work while you stay in vegas! The bed are big and not like any other hotel bed!

Reviews.Title: “Classy!”
Reviews.Author: Greylady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at THEhotel (that's not a typo!) at Mandalay Bay in September, following a mountain-biking/hiking vacation in the Grand Canyon, Bryce and Zion National Parks. We were hoping to have a few days of luxury before returning home. We'd never been to Vegas, and were told we had to see it once before we die. Once turned out to be more than enough! The city was just too over-the-top for us, especially since we aren't big gamblers or shoppers. But THEhotel was a perfect choice - very impressive looking with marble everywhere and huge crystal vases filled with white flowers. The staff was efficient and friendly. When we booked the room they were careful to mention that it was "only a room", not a suite. When we checked in we were again told it was a room (with no mini bar). We were picturing something like a broom closet, but upon opening the door, we discovered it was far from just a room. The bed was king-size. A huge armoire hid a large flat-screen TV as well as cozy robes and fuzzy slippers. The gorgeous and spacious marble bathroom had his and hers sinks, a jacuzzi tub and a shower along with plenty of high-end toiletries. A separate little room held a toilet (with a phone). The best thing was the view - we were on the 61st floor and could see most of the strip and watch planes taking off from the airport. There is a comfortable clubby bar, a coffee shop/cafe and a restaurant downstairs as well as a very hip eatery and bar called Mix on the 64th floor. It's also quiet - there's no casino at THEhotel, but the property is attached to Mandalay Bay which does have one, as well as a pool area that could be accessed with our hotel room key. The wave pool and "lazy river" looked like a major attraction - we avoided it as it was busy and crowded. We walked the strip several times during our stay - it's quite a sight at night! Make sure to check out the fountains at Bellagio after dark and sit at a cafe to people-watch during the day (try the Eiffel Tower bar or Mon Ami Gabi).

Reviews.Title: “Needs Ritz Carlton training”
Reviews.Author: JohnMD
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews and decided to try this hotel anyway.... most of what has been said is true. You enter the hotel from the garage and it takes a bit to find out where the registration desk is... we arrived around 1pm on a Sunday, and agreed to wait until 3pm for a strip view room. We had lunch at Border Grill and called at 3 to be told it would be 2 more hours for our room... so I complained, and they gave us a corner suite and $100 free room service credit (which we used for a great breakfast both mornings.) The suite was comfortable... a bit too brown for my taste, even more so than the all brown Wynn hotel; the toiletries were first rate. The overall feel of the Mandalay was upscale... the restauarants terrific although we paid $300 each night eating at Aureole and Mix. The beach was fun... enjoyed the wave pool; although we were given passes to the Beach Club, it closed the second day of our stay. It's true that the flat screen tvs in the rooms have poor picture quality. The trams are convenient to getting to the corner of Tropicana and LVB. So, overall, we enjoyed a relaxing couple of days in Vegas here... nice place... could be better if the staff were a bit more consistent .... on another note.... we saw Zumanity... we knew that it would be more adult themed than the usual Cirque du Soleil... but it bordered on raunchy at times... so if you haven't seen it, you may want to learn more about it before buying tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WolvesTilIDie
Reviews.Content: What can I say!!! Arrived at theHotel and were greeted by probably the most overfriendly check-in assistant I have ever met. If anything she was too much...but all went smoothely and were on our way to the room within 5 minutes of arrival. Probably the only bad thing I can say about the whole place is that when you arrive there are no signs, or any indication as to where the reception is, so we did walk round for a couple of minutes trying to find where to go. However, once we got to the room...Man O Man. Very nice indeed is all I can say. Seperate lounge area to the bedroom with bar area, and very large bathroom. There was also a small second bathroom which came in very useful when one is in the shower etc (you get the drift). The rooms are a little dark, but very very nice, and very quiet. We were right next to the lifts and could'nt hear a thing. We had read on this site about the long walk to the Pool area, and were dreading it, but the walk is'nt that bad. Again the only problem being it is'nt very well signposted, but once you do get there it is by far the best pool area in Vegas, well worth the 10 minute walk. I would definitely recommend the express checkout however, as the queue for reception from about 10.30 is enormous. the express checkout was very easy and we had no problems. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, but do shop around for the deals, there own site has special offers from time to time.

Reviews.Title: “My experience”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia R
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a business convention at THE Hotel. The hotel seemed very nice and the beds were wonderful. The problems I found with our room was the previous occupants must have been snorting some kind of drugs because we found two straw pieces in the room. One on the floor in the sitting area and the other in a dresser drawer in the bedroom. I threw the one away that was on the floor but left the one in the drawer. Also found a tube of vaginal cream on a shelf in the bathroom. The fax machine went out the first night which caused the phone in the sitting area not to work during our entire stay. The only good thing about our stay was the room service food. It was the best food I had ever eaten via room service menu.

Reviews.Title: “Not Blown Away”
Reviews.Author: KEWLBEANS
Reviews.Content: My expectations were high and I was a little disapponted. THE BAD- bed was very uncomfortable, hated the linens and the pillows. Asked for hypo-allergenic pillows, received feather (!), bathroom very dark, water pressure & amount of water really bad. Like the previous reviews-poor quality TV. VERY LONG TREK to pools. Pool area filthy, chairs were incredibly dirty. VERY noisy neighbors who partied LOUDLY. (reported to the hotel but I don't think they did anything) I was VERY surprised that they did not offer an express check out service, apparently my bill will come in the mail). NO closet in the (standard?) room. NO refridgerator in the room (kind of strange for an upscale hotel). THE GOOD- I actually had a very good room service experience, Renee who took the order was very nice, food was good (the lobster bisque was awesome). Service was good but after 30 minutes I left the cart outside, no one showed up to pick it up. Because the shower sucked, I decided to use the spa facilities on the last day. INCREDIBLE & BEAUTIFUL. I would definitely go back. The hair dryers were old/bad, so I went back to the room to dry my hair (the IN room hair dryer was great). Michael G at the front desk was very pleasant. If I were to return, I would try to upgrade to a nicer, quieter room with a view of the strip. I would definitely use the spa again!

Reviews.Title: “The Classy Way to do Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: poochy76
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at THEhotel for 6 nights to celebrate my 30th birthday. I decided on this hotel after many hours reading Vegas hotel reviews and ignoring many friends and colleagues advice to go to the Bellagio! Here's my opinion for what it's worth! - THE ARRIVAL - dropped off at the rather unimpressive entrance inside the parking garage - no doormen/bellboys/staff of any description to be found even though it was 3pm in the afternoon. But sometimes it can be nice not to have all the fuss and rummaging for tip money. Found the well hidden front desk - I agree with the other reviews - a sign would be helpful! Did have to wait - but I had expected this. When we eventually made it to the desk the very nice but confused lady was unable to find our reservation and was unable to contact anyone else to verify our booking. She wanted us to pay in advance for our whole stay until our booking could be found! She eventually realised that she was looking for the wrong name despite being given our prepaid hotel voucher with the correct name on. Anyway - not a big deal really but I am a fussy tourist and do like everything to be perfect! THE ROOM - 35th floor - side on view of the airport with an angled view of the strip. Not bad. Had a King Size Suite and found it very homely, clean, stylish and welcoming. As a designer and a Virgo I can be VERY particular (much to my boyfriends annoyance!) but really couldn't find any major fault. And yes the bed was perfect! Thank god there was no furry brown undersheet or suspiciously stained overblanket! THE CASINO - While I found the strong air freshener a little overwhelming after a couple of hours this was nothing compared to the strangely pungent aromas of the other casinos! The atmosphere though was nice and less tacky and cramped than many other casinos. Not a big gambler and a newcomer to Vegas I did still manage to lose money on the cheaper slots machines - but I never expected to win - just enjoyed some of the more modern machines which were fun to play (such as Star Wars). THE POOL - Yes it was a little walk to the pool but nothing to break a sweat over. If you get there early (before 11) you will get a sun lounger. You can even hire a private cabana with air con, tv and fridge if you have money to burn! Liked the little pools but found the beach area to impersonal and noisy. My personal favourite was the lazy river - where you can find a nice quite spot - with shade or not and just either enjoy the sun or have fun swirling around the lazy river. It might be nicer if they could turn down the music which competes with a couple of bars and restaurants and can be a little annoying if you are near a speaker! THE FOOD + DRINK - Didn't go to the mix or eat in the cafe or any of THEhotel place as I found them a little overpriced and pretentious. Loved the Buffet at Mandalay Bay which is perfect for breakfast! Tried Raffles but was a little overpriced and the atmosphere was strange. I would avoid the left hand part of the Red, White and Blue restaurant (can't remember which colour that was) as it was quite dirty and tacky compared to the other places. TRANSPORT - Found the free tram (at the front right hand corner of Mandaly Bay Casino) really useful as it gives you great access to the MGM Grand which is only a couple of bridges over the roads after the last stop at the Excalibur. Don't bother with the Excalbur or the Luxor - v.tacky, smelly, run down in comparison. OVERVIEW - Apologies for the length of this review - You should stay at THEhotel if you are in Vegas for more than two nights as it is a great place to come back to at the end of the day and being part of the Mandalay Bay means you have 24 hour access to the nice casino and other amenities. The constant noise and hustle of Vegas make THEhotel suites a pleasure to escape to every evening and a lovely environment to wake up in!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms nice, Front Desk AWFUL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cbearnw
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice, but the front desk was terrible. From the grumpy front desk clerk who checked me in, to the rude, blunt, "no, we can't do that and no we won't make an exception" when I asked for a 12 noon checkout, rather than the normal 11am checkout, to completely messing up my bill when I checked out, overcharging me $50, which they very reluctantly changed after I refused to pay for something I didn't buy. The front desk, and front desk management need to take customer service training, because they had none. They did not seem interested in helping, nor did they seem to enjoy their jobs. I had a blast in Vegas, but the people at the front desk took a little bit of the glimmer away.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: PC2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were booked into The Hotel for two nights, suffice to say we checked out after one night. The Hotel uses the same pool as the Manadalay Bay hotel and although the wave machine, beach and lazy river seem a good idea it doesn't really work to well as there are far to many people for the size of the facility. It was difficut to find a sunbed and then when you found a vacant one it was a challenge to get to it as they are packed in like sardines. On check in the room had not been prepared properly as the minibar had remants of the previous occupants food and had not been restocked, the room was dark, even after they fixed the lights. We were told that we had a mountain view, 12th floor, what we had infact was a carpark view complete with air conditioning fans which due to the noise made it difficult to sleep. If you're in Vegas for 2 nights and don't intend to spend much time in the room then the location is good but I would probably choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hey TheHotel Management, Get out of your office and make a few changes!!”
Reviews.Author: crazyredcr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at TheHotel on 9/8 thru 9/11 for my brothers wedding. We made reservations 2 months in advance for $499 (Fri), $499 (Sat), and $299 (Sun). A little pricey since Las Vegas in my opinion is getting too big and service suffers. For that kind of money, I expect excellent service in every area of the hotel. We got a tip from a family member 2 days before we left that the published prices for TheHotel had dropped. We checked their website and they in fact did. Prices were now $299/$299/$169. Very large difference. So I made a call to the reservation desk at TheHotel, told the less than happy to be at work female who answered the phone what I had learned, and she promptly made the change. Saved over $500 which I later lost at the Casino anyways but had more fun losing it. TheHotel takes a very different approach to check-in. You are actually dropped off inside the parking garage where the front door is hidden from public view. Greeted very nicely by the staff. Walked inside and was happy to see we didn't have to walk thru the casino to find the front desk. Very Nice!!! Tried to find the front desk but could not since there are no signs. Not Good!!! Found the front desk only when we saw a line of about 20-25 people. Several who were voicing their discontent on the wait. We waited and were greeted by a very nice young lady who took care of our check-in with courtesy and professionalism. I glanced back at the line which was now longer than when we arrived. I also noticed only about half of the check-in stations were being used. Much like at your local bank or grocery store!!! This area of TheHotel needs a major fix in customer service fast. Sets a bad tone. Total check-in time was 26 minutes. As for the rooms, very nicely decorated and clean. The previous reviews about the televisiions do not lie. Reception is fair at best. And with all the hype about plasma TV's in your room, not one of the channels is in HD. Simply a waste. The beds are the BEST. Overall, happy with the rooms. Did not go to Vegas to watch TV!! Now let's talk about Room Service. I have two words. TRAIN WRECK!!!! Called 3 times, first two times no one answered. On the third, waited on hold for 7-8 minutes. Eventually placed my breakfast order for two and was told 30 minutes. Did not believe it for a second. They showed up just short of an hour. Food was cold. Silverware dirty. Butter frozen solid. Linen soiled. Overall, TheHotel is a nice place to stay. But with all the choices in Vegas to stay, I would hesitate to pay my original reservation price for the level of service we recieved.

Reviews.Title: “worst ever”
Reviews.Author: supfoo
Reviews.Content: They are despictable animals who sent security to my room at 3:30am by mistake! Instead of an apology, the planet of the apes looking security guards tried to pick a fight with me, They don't know how to treat people with respect, they are rude, they are criminals, they overcharge, they treat the customers awful, the staff is better suited for the Jerry Springer show than the hotel business.

Reviews.Title: “Super cool, but be aware of a few things...”
Reviews.Author: Treemarc
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at THE Hotel when it was pretty much brand new. While it's hard to fault- definately the nicest Vegas hotel we've ever been in- it's not perfect. The main issue is with the living room. Sure, it's nice to have a plasma TV, but be aware that this is a ultra low-end model. I have an LCD at home that cost under $1000 that has a far better picture than this. Of course, part of the problem is the usual substandard hotel cable system. On top of that, the set wasn't set-up properly...set to stretch the picture to fit the widescreen and no way to "un-stretch" it. There's really no sense in having a widescreen TV in a hotel that's not equipped for HiDef (pretty much EVERY hotel.) It's just there because the designer thought it would look cool. On the other hand, they do have a DVD player...we happened to have a couple widescreen DVDs with us and they looked pretty good. Also, the sofa was chosen for style rather than comfort. And the whole living room seemed a little cramped. But if you're here on business, it IS a great office space, with a huge desk, comfy chair, Fax/printer. Only drawback is the charge for internet access- at this price level, it should be free! On the other hand, you don't go to Vegas to sit and watch TV. And the bedroom is nearly perfect. It's actually bigger than the living room. The bed is the most comfy I've ever been in- period. There's also a very nice 35" (or close to it) tube TV- it's actually better than the Plasma. (Sorry, I'm a video producer, so I pay attention to the TV.) I've read some reviews that say there's two Plasma screens- either they don't know what a Plasma is, or some rooms have Plasmas in both rooms. The master bath is equally perfect- almost as big as the living room with giant bathtub and a glass shower bigger than an NYC studio apartment...perfect for-ahem-couples. There's a small LCD TV that doesn't really work well (typical), but even I don't care if there's a TV in the bathroom. If you're there on business and need to check the stocks while you shave, it'll work fine. We had stayed at the Mandalay Bay before, and it was February, so we didn't go to the fantastic pool, but I understand it's quite a walk. On the other hand, you are just a few steps from the parking garage, and a few more from the theater and casino. The hallways are sleek and silent, and the whole thing just oozes cool. Other "fancy" Vegas hotels are too gaudy...less is more at "THE Hotel" Note- everything is VERY dark, from the furniture, to the lighting, to the tint on the windows. Speaking as a middle class, average guy...If you can get a room for under $200, it's well worth a stay, if only just for novelty. I think the good features wouldn't seem as nice if I was paying $300 or $400. Go for an aniversary or special occasion...have a nice dinner at one of the many good restaurants onsite, see Mamma Mia or a concert at the House Of Blues, have a nightcap at Mix, and retire to your perfect bed. But it's not the place to go if you just want a nice place to sleep. You're better off just getting any 4 star off Priceline or Hotwire. Or if you do have $400 a night to blow on a hotel room, the Four Seasons is probably a safer bet. (Or Wynn- the new "cool kid" in town)

Reviews.Title: “You'll be OK at the Mandalay”
Reviews.Author: MVelez
Reviews.Content: I stood at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay from August 24th through the 28th for a bachelorette party. What follows is my experience from start to finish. It may be lengthy but I want to make sure I cover everything. Location: The Hotel is the last hotel on the strip. So plan on taking cabs everywhere. The Hotel's main entrance is in an indoor parking garage. It is not the typical grand entrance that you normally see in a major Vegas hotel. You do not have to walk through the casino to get to your room. This is the sort of laid back, private atmosphere that the hotel is going for. Rooms: Absolutely gorgeous!! As mentioned in other reviews the rooms in the hotel are all suites and quite large. They are extremely modern, spacious and quite glamorous. Other travelers have mentioned that the rooms are a little dark, but this is the modern and swanky look and feel that the hotel attempts to achieve. The beds are super comfortable and the one and a half bathrooms really come in handy when there are multiple people getting ready. Pool/Beach: The pools and "beach" are sort of far away from The Hotel. If I could have taken a cab there I would of. We ended up spending all our days at the Moorea beach club, which costs $10 for ladies and between $40-$50 for the guys and you have to be over 21. We were lucky enough to make nice with the staff at the beach club and were never charged to get in. We did tip the staff nicely so maybe that had something to do with it. I do warn that the line for the beach club does get long on the weekends, and they continue to let people in when they aren't seats for them. Our last day there we spent the morning at the wave pool and at the pool on the right hand side when you first enter the pool area. Both areas were really nice and relaxing. Vegas Nightlife: During our stay we visited Rum Jungle, Red Square, China Grill, Tao restaurant and nightclub, Tryst at the Wynn Hotel, and Mix. We ended up at Tryst everynight of our stay because we just had so much fun there. We danced the night away by the waterfall and had so many laughs and the pics to prove it. Tao restaurant at the Venetian was delicious and the night club was ok except that it was extremely packed. Some of these places are a bit hard to get into and the lines on the weekend can get really long. So either be prepared to wait or offer the bouncers money. We ate at Mix which was the priciest of all the restaurants we ate at but the view is amazing. The Mix lounge area is a great place to start or end the night, since it is in The Hotel. One of my favorite places was Red Square, where we got to take a couple of shots in the vodka freezer. The freezer is a chilly 4 degrees so ladies are offered fur coats to put on to stay warm. It really is a fun thing to do and provided the perfect backdrop for memorable pictures. Rum Jungle also offered great portions of food at a decent price. Overall, I had a great time at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay. I would definitely recommend this hotel. I wouldn't mind staying there again, but not sure if I would only because I prefer the hotels more towards the center of the strip, like the Bellagio or Caesars. I also didnt care for the long walk to the pool area, and I enjoy hotels where I have to walk through the casino in order to get to my room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: s25843
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I am a Hilton Honors Gold VIP member, and a Starwood Preferred Guest Gold Member. I usually spend about 15-20 nights a year in hotels. I also do not provide room numbers in reviews for privacy reasons, if you would like the room number, please email me. I stayed at TheHotel for 2 nights on part of a multi-hotel Vegas trip. Rate: $159/$149 a night. Service: At check-in there were probally about 25 people in line, however, the line looks longer than it actually is, since you are forced into standing in a long hallway. The check-in agent was very efficent and found us a room on the 32nd floor with a view of the strip. The Bell dept was also very friendly and efficent and offered to help with everything. Rooms: The rooms are large 750 square foot suites with a large master bath with Tub, Seperate shower, 2 sinks, and an enclosed room for the toilet. There is also a smaller 1/2 bath with a vanity and toilet. The living room has a sofa, table and sitting chair, desk with a printer/fax machine, office chair, and a 42 inch plasma TV on the wall with a DVD player. The bedrooms have 1 or 2 beds, large 36" Flat Screen (not panel) TV, and a very large vanity. It is my understanding that there is also a small number of regular (non-suite) rooms, and a handful of large multi-room suites reserved for high rollers. Location: Mandalay Bay is the last major hotel on the south side of the strip, and is a bit of a hike from everything. It is directly connected to the Luxor and Excalibur by both walkways and a tram. TheHotel is about a 4 minute walk to the Mandalay Bay casino, and about 7 minutes from the Mandalay Bay Beach (aka Pool). I would definately stay here again, and am already planning on it.

Reviews.Title: “Sort of nice...”
Reviews.Author: MorganJ
Reviews.Content: Well, I booked this place for a 3 day holiday. I have stayed in Vegas before at the Mandalay Bay, and liked the pool area (which is shared with The Hotel and 4S). Let me just define what you can expect. A lot of other reviews say the place is "Swank", "Luxurious" etc etc. Well, having travelled all over the world I would rate it as a decent 4 star hotel. Nothing more, nothing less. The entrance is nice. The lobby is nice. Access to the pool area was annoying. (long and cumbersome walk). The valet was annoying. (leave me standing there for 10-15 minutes and look all angry at me for not tipping, well, duuh). The check-in counter was a mess even though we checked in on a Sunday late. It seemed like most the staff was being trained on the job, which I guess explains a lot. When we got our room it was sort of dirty. There was someones luggage stickers in the garbage can (same date as we checked in - someone else was there and left the same day??). Used qtip in the drawer, very few toiletries. Hmmm.... Room service was soggy - seemed like evrything had been boiled. I'd guess they keep 'em warm some how. Not nice. (fairly priced @ approx 100$ for 3 burgers and softdrinks incl. fee's). Room quality was way nicer than Mandalay Bay, but we are not talking 4S or LHW standard here. Bellagio and 4S are much nicer for Vegas. Ofcourse room rates very cheap. 250-280 pr night incl. taxes for a large suite (900 sqft). During our 3 day visit housekeeping never made it to our room. We hunted them down for towels and toiletries. TV's (both of them) had bad reception, and the inhouse movies had a weird sound control so either things were LOUD or sound was off. I asked at the front desk to have the A/C fixed (very noisy, on and off), but no one ever made it to our Room. All in all - at the price - very good sized room / interior. If I had paid 4-600 pr. night I would be fuming mad.

Reviews.Title: “THE Hotel is THE Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MalibuMom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at THE Hotel with my two teenagers, 13 and 16 years old for two nights. We checked in on a Wednesday afternoon, only to find that they had made an error with the room. We were quickly upgraded to a suite at no extra charge (unfortunately, with a view of the mountains and on a low floor). The room was terrifically appointed, and was quiet (amazing for Las Vegas!). Decor is sleek and sophisticated. Service was excellent, and the hotel restaurant was actually quite good. The kids and I enjoyed the pools tremendously, although they are definitely a hike. Stay away from Shark Reef, it is over-rated (especially if you have been to the Aquarium of the Pacific in Long Beach). Great place to stay if you want to be in Vegas without kitsch. Definitely will return with my signigicant other for a more grown up holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Nice digs but long waits”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: Look, TheHotel is a swank place with great access to Mandalay Bay without all the riff raff of having a casino in the lobby. Having said that, it is ridiculous when you come in and you have to wait an hour to check in. We visited during the first weekend of March Madness and it was like the staff hadn't anticipated that the place would be sold out--they were moving people to different hotels and severely understaffed! When we finally got to our suite, it was awesome and relaxing and everything. It's just too bad that it took us too long to get there. We're trying it again on a better weekend...we'll see.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCNYC
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Hotel was great. It is not your typical Casino/Hotel, and as such, you don't have to take a long walk through the casino to get to the elevators, nor do you have to deal with the typical hordes of people in the common areas. If the "Casino/Hotel" experience is what you crave, the Mandalay Bay is a very short walk from The Hotel. Furthermore, a resonable taxi line sits just outside of the lobby. We found the rooms were extremely spacious, comfortable and well-kept. Remember, context is everything....you're in Vegas staying at a casino property, not on honeymoon at a 5 star hotel on Bora Bora. And, unless you're paying $600+/night for a hotel room (and it really doesn't matter that you're spending more than you've ever spent on a night's stay anywhere) it is unreasonable to expect perfection. The only negative that I could find was the property's abuse of the article "The" when labeling/naming everything from The Gym, to The Notepad to The TP (found on the sticker holding down the leading edge of the toilet paper). It was a bit much.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bachelorette Weekend/Girls trip base in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Rach727
Reviews.Content: I was recently hetre for a bachelorette party weekend and can honestly say that this is the Best place in Vegas to hold a bachelorette party for the following reasons: 1) The rooms- The "standard" rooms at The Hotel are by far the most spacious (yes I have stayed at Venetian and Wynn) with a proper living room, wet bar, and seperate bedroom. The best part is that every room comes with two bathrooms (a necessity when a few girls are getting ready at the same time). Unlike the Venetian, rooms are the same price whether you request a king or two doubles. 2) The spas- When staying at The Hotel you have the option of either The Bathhouse, Spa Mandalay, or the Spa at the Four Seasons. They are all great, but i recommend the Bathhouse because it is so modern and a great place ot just relax even if not everyone is getting treatments. There are always room +spa deals going on. 3) The Mix- The Mix is a lounge located at the top of the Hotel that has spectacular views of the strip and a great vibe(though not super crowded like Ghostbar at The Palms). All 11 girls in our party were comped entrance and seated in the VIP area though we hadn't ordered bottle service. Yes, we had a hassle checking in and the front desk put our rooms on completely different floors, but no one complained because everything else more than made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: McDelt
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas 5 or 6 times in THE past few years. Stayed at Ceasars, Flamingo, Paris, and MGM. People we traveled with had stayed at a couple of the hotels mentioned before as well as the Bellagio and Monte Carlo. THE Hotel was the hands down nicest hotel any of us had stayed in. Imagine walking into a vegas hotel without dragging your bags through a Casino. Super modern design with an easy to find lobby (not a Casino bottom floor). Mandalay Bay's Casino is just steps away but you cannot even hear the bells from the slots in THE lobby. THE rooms are the biggest I have ever stayed in. 1 and 1/2 bath suites with wonderful styling huge bathroom (with flat screen), comfy beds and lots of mirrors in the room. Only gripe was the rooms were a little dark. Request a high floor and strip view for better views you could get the mountian view which isn't what you came to Vegas for! THE Hotel is connected to Mandalay Bay and you can use the pools thats right pools plural. Theses are the best on the strip. Get out there about 9:00 or 10 AM throw your towels and a spare t-shirt down and head to the Bay Side Buffett breakfast in Mandalay Bay. Tons of food for $12.50. Come back out and you have a chair... everyone does it...dont feel bad. Like any other resort eating by the pool is pricey like $8 - $15 but it is good food!. TIP...there is free water inside the restaurant pool side (just ask where it is) if you dont want to pay $3 for the FIJI. Mix the club on the 64th floor is free to THE Hotel guests (a $25 cover otherwise) There is a quicker back way to the pool so you dont have to go through the Casino. I guess the previous reviewer never asked anyone about it. Everything is Vegas is big and it takes time to walk from place to place...thats what makes Vegas so great. On that note you are WAY down at the end of the strip so here are two tips. 1) Take the monorail that runs between Excaliber, Luxor, and Mandalay Bay. Make sure you get on the one that doesn't stop at Luxor. That will get you to the first big block of MGM, NY-NY etc in 5 minutes. Then you can walk 20 minutes to the next big block of hotels...or you can opt for.... 2) A cab to the Caesars/Paris/Bellagio block is $8.00 +tip and takes 5 minutes. We did this when coming back with her bags of purchases. This is a great hotel if you are looking for a place to "get away" a little bit but still be on The Strip. I Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about here. Not really anyway”
Reviews.Author: VacationJunky57
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for four nights during the week. We originally arrived about 11:00am but were not able to check in until the next time we tried which was about 2:00. Officially, check in is 3:00. No problem we headed off to the Casino, got a drink and toured the property. It's true that from THE hotel, it's about a 10 minute walk to the pool complex. This was not an issue or a problem with us - just reiterating a point others have made here. We had requested at check in a Strip view and got one on the 35th floor. We couldn't have been happier with the accomodations. Buffets: We tried three; those at Mandalay Bay, Luxor and Excalibur and liked all but Excalibur's. Morea Beach Club: It's $40 for guys and $10 for ladies during the week. Although I wondered whether the price was worth it, we decided to take the plunge and do it one day. We arrived about 8:30am and were let in when they open at 9:00am, were able to put the charge on our room and stayed until about 5:00. There is a level of service that we felt justified the price in part and wished we had made the decision to do this sooner. We ordered lunch and drinks and were waited on wonderfully. Pools in general: The wave pool and South Lagoon pool are a blast. The wave pool generates a nice body surfing wave every 90 seconds or so. The South Lagoon pool is there pool they only have open as an "overflow" pool when it gets too busy at the wave pool. As I never more than jumped in and out of the Lazy River pool cannot comment much on that. Mix Restaurant: For you and your significant other, plan on it costing you around $250 which will get you a drink a piece, appetizer's, entree's and dessert's + tax and tip. It's French themed and you have no fewer than 5 wait staff. Try and get a window table for one awsome view. Would I go back? Yes without any doubts.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any better.”
Reviews.Author: JCashMoney
Reviews.Content: Anyone complaining about The Hotel is likely to have trouble anywhere they stay. The simple fact of the matter is that The Hotel is difficult, if not impossible, to beat. I've stayed at The Hotel at least 5 times. Never once have we had a problem. Those that have complaints about The Hotel are probably the type of people that would gripe about staying at the White House. The Hotel is much less congested and much quieter than the Mandalay tower. The rooms are the largest standard rooms in Vegas; nearly 800 square feet. Check in is a breeze, especially if you are using the V.I.P. check in room just off the main lobby. Anyone complaining about the walk to the pool is likely just lazy. The pool at Mandalay Bay and The Hotel (they share the same) is second to none. Finding a chair can sometimes be difficult. However, that can be the case at any decent Vegas pool.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your walking shoes....”
Reviews.Author: kittycop
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for a bachelorette party Fri-Sun. The check in was a mess. The wait was a half an hour. They did not have a seperate line for check outers, everyone was in one big line. The staff here treated you like they were doing you a favor by talking to you-ugh. The hotel though was nice and the rooms were big and comfy. Problem-it is a trek to the pool. Im not kidding when I say it must have been a 15 minute walk. Dont forget anything. We hung out at the Moorea Beach Club which was not bad. We were charged 10 bucks to get in, guess the guys had to pay 50 bucks! The scene was cool but the pool was way small, by the end of the day it looked like a people fondue pot! Room service was HORRIBLE! Initially it was great unti lthey forgot our juice and the coffee tasted like there was soap in it. We requested mew coffee and our juice. almost three hours later, up it came. Maybe they were delayed cause it was a Sat. morning, but come on, is the word comp in your language?? Oh, and good luck finding a bell boy. We were standing around with our luggage and I had to chase one down by the taxi line - really unorganized. And, if you are checking in early and hope to get to the pool, you need your room key. And they are not big fans of handing them out early, be prepared to argue this one. And did I mention the room was still not ready at 4:15 that afternoon. We told them to clean around us. Not sure if I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love,love,love The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sox04
