Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews here I was worried that everything was going to go wrong. It didn't. From our transfer from the airport to check-in, all went flawlessly. We arrived around 11 and couldn't check in until 3 so we checked our luggage and hopped in a cab and headed to PF Changs at the Aladdin for lunch(excellent)and then back to the hotel to get our room. The room was AMAZING. The plasma TVs (2), the view of the strip, the bathrooms (2), the unbelievably soft beds!!!! Needless to say, everything was perfect,almost......... the only flaw this hotel has is sharing the pool with Mandalay Bay. Although it was beautiful, we could never get a lounge chair (not that it really mattered because it was so hot, we just stayed in the pool).Although this might be a big problem for some people we just "went with it". We were on vacation! I also strongly suggest going to the bar "MIX" at the top of the hotel, beautiful views,and best of all, the cover charge(25$) is waived if you are staying at THE Hotel. What a DEAL!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “all that shines is not gold”
Reviews.Author: groovyk
Reviews.Content: mandalay bay hotel is another example of success going to ones head. if it is service you are looking for look elsewhere. poor check in, worse room service, aweful food [room service] and interminable valet delays. stained carpet and broken furniture in a "deluxe room".

Reviews.Title: “THE Hotel was great”
Reviews.Author: Angela42
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed the THE Hotel from July 17th to 21st and all I can say is everything was superb.........I read many reviews on this site prior to going and was wondering what to expect.........nothing but excellent service, polite staff.....makes me wonder what the complainers on here are expecting. We arrived Monday @ 1:00 pm and checked in with no wait. Our king bed room wasn't ready , so we were offered 2 queens (and ready)......really how much time do you spend in your room when you are in Vegas? The room was beautiful,. clean, lots of yummy toiletries, fluffy housecoats, and THE BED......was heaven. Air conditioning was great....we even had to turn it down. Housekeeping came promptly everyday and our room always clean when we returned from our day (even if it was 3:00). When playing the slots there were lots of cocktail waitresses running around to help you, and if not, you could go to the bar, play slots at the bar and have your drinks comped. One thing to be careful of in the casino....it appears they "wash" some of the stools during the night and if you get up early to play the slots, beware of "wet" stools......makes for a wet bum. We ate at Raffles....not a long wait.....good service....food is good. Also ate at House of Blues.....great atmosphere and food quite good...just be careful of the garlic in the ceasar salad.It is mighty powerful. Also ate at The Verandah @ Four Seasons which is attached to Mandalay Bay......it was very nice....very expensive.....I had a great meal....my husbands rack of lamb (he says) was mediocre. We called for a wakeup call on our last day, no waiting, just prompt, courteous service. I would definetly stay at THE Hotel again.....it is not in the middle of the strip ....take a cab and see the action....and be happy to come back to a bit of tranquility in a city that never sleeps......

Reviews.Title: “Simply Sensational!!”
Reviews.Author: ThePonts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at THEhotel from July 18th-25th 2006 for our honeymoon. We got married at THE wedding chapel, also at Mandalay Bay and we highly recommend both. We could not fault anything, it was just perfect!! A very glamourous, luxurious and modern hotel. The rooms are exactly the same as on the website. We had a suite on the 38th floor with a view of the strip which was stunning. The bathrooms are beautiful and very spacious. The housekeeping service was great and they were always finished in our room by lunchtime. The in-room safe was useful with a combination instead of a key, one less thing to lose. We had about a 3 minute wait to check-in and a 5 min wait to check-out which was excellent. The Valet staff / Bellmen were all really friendly, knowledgable and helpful. Our luggage was all taken care of for us. The room service is yummy and not too badly priced, the catering staff very friendly and prompt. Only warning is don't make any long distance phone calls - crazily expensive! Fantastic hotel can't wait to go back...hmmm maybe a first anniversary holiday next year...

Reviews.Title: “I give it a B.”
Reviews.Author: dango
Reviews.Content: After doing some research online (including at Trip Advisor), I decided to book two (week) nights at THEhotel. I was traveling with my wife and seven-year-old son and made the decision primarily based on two reasons: 1.Suites in a newer hotel for less than $200. 2.Access to the Mandalay Bay pools and restaurants. THEhotel entrance is in the garage off Hacienda Ave. Don’t go in the Mandalay Bay Las Vegas Blvd. entrance unless you want to get stuck in a pretty terrifying valet vortex. In addition, be advised that the name of THEhotel can lead to unintended misunderstandings, as in this Abbott-and-Costello-level exchange with the valet: Valet: Are you checking in to the hotel? Me (thinking he meant THEhotel): Yes. Valet (who actually was referring to Mandalay Bay): Pull up right behind that car. I followed his instructions and soon realized I was in the Mandalay Bay line. After some quick work by the valets, I managed to escape and get to the right place. My room (32906) faced McCarran Airport and the Luxor. I could see some of the Strip if I leaned against the window. The suite consisted of a fairly narrow living room and bedroom decorated in shades of brown. To call the lighting in these rooms subdued is an understatement. The living room included a rather uncomfortable couch and chair, a plasma screen TV and a desk. There is a fax and Internet access is available by plugging the supplied Ethernet cable into the appropriate port on your laptop. It’s about $12 for 24 hours of use. I only used it within one 24-hour period but ended up being charged three separate times. The front desk clerk removed the extra charges, but it definitely pays to check your bill before you leave (additionally, we were charged $16 for minibar stuff that the previous guests apparently had used). The bathroom was large, with a deep tub and a granite and glass enclosed shower, and there was a half bathroom in the front hall with a toilet and sink Alas, there was no coffeemaker in the room. Starting at nightfall, sounds of music and conversation drifted into the room and continued till about 2:00 a.m. I never did pinpoint the source, although I suspect it was either the beach or the club atop the hotel. This bothered my wife more than it did me. When she complained about it the next day, the front desk clerk comped our dinner and room service from the previous night and offered to move us. Ultimately, we decided to stay. The music/noise returned on schedule that night, so consider bringing earplugs and a fan for white noise. Getting to the pool involved a long walk past the casino and restaurants. It is an odd sight, seeing families carrying inner tubes and towels past the slots. If you’re heading to the pool through the casino, be sure to go to the left after you pass Red White and Blue restaurant, because going to the right will take you to the convention center (not that I ever made that mistake…) For a shortcut, go out THEhotel entrance and enter the nearby Mandalay Bay valet entrance. This will shorten the walk and help you avoid the casino entirely. We went to the pools late in the afternoon both days and found this to be a wise decision. The crowds have thinned out by then and the towers block the sun so you don’t have to worry about cooking yourself. Stay away from the wave pool unless you like being involved in a game of human pinball. It’s crowded with kids. Definitely try the Lazy River, a meandering loop that provides a mild current to propel you along. Inner tubes are a steep $20 to rent, $16 to buy. I skipped ‘em and advise you to do the same. There are a couple of serpentine pools that we found to be a pleasant respite from the crowds, although the water in them was almost too warm. We ate at Red White and Blue, the Noodle House, House of Blues, Verandah (in the Four Seasons). On the first night, we walked into Shanghai Lilly’s, which was a lovely spot, only to find it would be a wait without reservations. The next day I called Fleur de Lys to make reservations, but they were closed for dinner because, in the words of the staffer, it wasn’t busy enough to stay open. This was surprising, considering the masses of people everywhere. Housekeeping and service was fine, except for a few indifferent staff members at the pool area. I never once had to wait long for an elevator. Although the hotel’s ads clearly are pitched to the young and hip, the guests I saw represented a wide cross-section of humanity. Saw lots of families, couples, a few seniors. Overall, I’d give THEhotel a solid B. It was fine, but not good enough to keep me from trying someplace else on my next visit to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “V ery displeased with TheHotel”
Reviews.Author: Louisianian
Reviews.Content: We were "upgraded" to TheHotel by the front desk manager at Mandalay Bay because Man. Bay was overbooked. and could not honor our (pre-paid) reservation. We accepted the "upgrade" because we were assured that our accommodations at TheHotel would be a non-smoking suite. (Actually, we were told TheHotel was an all-suite hotel.) We were very displeased with the room we were given at TheHotel. It was not a suite, but a very small room with a very small bathroom. Someone had been in the room before us and had left literature on the rumpled bedspread. The room reeked of cigarette smoke and we found cigarettes floating in the toilet. The first time we called the front desk to request another room, we were told that both Mandalay Bay and TheHotel were overbooked, so we would just have to deal with the room. The front desk worker also told us that TheHOtel actually has NO non-smoking rooms and that guests allowed to smoke anywhere they wish. Further complaining eventually won us a non-smoking room at Mandalay Bay, which was what we had reserved to begin with! Although the Mandalay Bay room was simply a standard double room, it was FAR superior to the small non-suite smoky "non-smoking" room at TheHotel. I would NEVER book at TheHotel. Mandalay Bay is better for the price and, if you want to spend a little more, Venetian is far superior.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Idea”
Reviews.Author: reneecorine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Mandalay Bay 7-16 through 7-21. I was on my honeymoon and wanted everything to be perfect. Upon arriving, there was no one to greet us, no hi, welcome to Mandalay Bay, no can we help you with your bags, nothing. I waited over 45 minutes to check in only to find out that they could let me check in but my room was dirty. We were told to place our bags in the room and they would let housekeeping know to rush the cleaning. After waiting 12 minutes, yes, 12 minutes for an elevator, we got to the room only to find out there were still people in it. Went back down to the desk and waited again for 30 minutes to be able to get checked in to a dirty room, but hey, at least there were no occupants! No concierge in this hotel! If you want to book something outside of the hotel, you had to go there yourself. The room was ok, bed was extremely uncomfortable, and the air conditioning was not cool. Our T.V. also blew up during our stay. The pool area was nice, very crowded, and way to many kids for me. We rented a cabana which was a great idea. I found the staff unknowlegeable, and not very friendly. The spa was fabulous. I have stayed at the Mirage and the Bellagio and would choose one of them next time. Mandalay bay is just a bad idea for the amount of money you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Rooms”
Reviews.Author: JackandSally
Reviews.Content: I stayed at THEhotel for 3 nights, July 19th through 22nd. The staff was warm and friendly, our room was gorgeous. We upgraded to a Corner Suite and it was worth every penny. The view was amazing. I like how you don't find yourself tripping over gawkers in the lobby (I love Bellagio but every time I left and returned to my room I found myself frustrated at the large consentration of people blocking the walkways.) THEhotel is a quiet oasis thats just a few yards away from the excitement of Mandalay Bay (which itself is fairly quiet compared to many of the other hotels.) I love the decor of THEhotel, from the dark woods to the elegant paintings. The carpeting is gorgeous and housekeeping kept the room very clean. I have read several reviews in which the staff is described as rude. I can't believe we are talking about the same place. I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: fan-tastic-media
Reviews.Content: I was very worried as my wife and I pulled up to the hotel. i've read many dreadful stories about checking in and getting transfered over to a Mandalay Bay room. I was comforted when I was greeted by a friendly smile at the check in counter. There wasn't a wait to check in, and the young lady who was taking care of us upgraded us to a slightly larger than normal corner suite. The room was Beautiful. Very spacious, huge soaking tub, 1 and half bathrooms, and 3 tv's! What more could you ask for? I didn't have any problems with maid service at all. Many people complain about the "long walk to the pool" "The Hotel" elevators are literally 50 feet away from the normal mandalay bay elevators. It's about a 4 minute walk. The wave pool and lazy river are awsome. One last thing....Be sure to visit The Mix Lounge located on the 64th floor. The drinks are expensive as you might guess, but the view is unbelievable, and if you get there before 10:00 p.m. you don't have to pay a cover charge. ps. My wife said the view from the ladies room is like none other!!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel tower is excelent”
Reviews.Author: frednlori
Reviews.Content: I just returned from The Mandalay Bay. We stayed in The Hotel at Mandalay Bay-their new tower. The room was beautiful. Everything was brand new. We had a 1br. 1 1/2 ba. suite. There was a wet bar, huge plasma tv in the living room and plasma tv's in the bedroom and bathroom. The beds were comfortable and the room had everything a vacationer or business traveler could need. The pools were incredible. The main beach entry/ wave pool was crowded, but still had plenty of lounge chairs available. We went to a less crowded pool where the atmosphere was more laid back.(there are many pools to chhose from) All have bars to quench your thirst as well as compilmentary ice water and restrooms. Plenty of poolside places to get lunch or snacks as well as stands to buy sunscreen. Each guest must have a room key to enter the pool area and Mandalay Bay staff are guarding all entrances and are very diligent about checking for room keys to enter, which is very nice. Cabana's are expensive, but nice if you want to spend the $$$. The service was great.and all staff were helpful and nice. No complaints. There was a wide variety of places to eat-many very economical with great food. The Hotel tower was quite a walk to get to the pool though. A path from that tower is apparantly under construction now to relieve that problem. House of Blues is there and was very fun.

Reviews.Title: “Fun time at theHotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelingal31
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed theHotel! We were there on a Wed. and Thursday night, and left on Friday afternoon. We were in a non-smoking room, and were on the 13th floor- a view of nothing great, but it didn't bother us. Our room was super. I loved the soaps. The tub was huge. It was great having two large rooms. We loved the pool at Mandalay Bay. We got there early in the morning, and it got pretty busy, but it didn't bother us. I was able to find a place in the shade, so I was happy! Service was fine. We didn't have any complaints. The halls are kind of dark. It is very modern and chic!!! We never had to wait for an elevator. Check-in and check-out both went very smooth. I wanted an extra pillow, and had one within 5 minutes. Mix was very cool. I had no idea the elevator was on the outside of the building! I wish the location was closer to the center of the strip. Taxis were about $10 each way. We tried the Duece, but it was slow. We walked lots. We had a good rate, and I would stay here again, if the rate was similar.

Reviews.Title: “Other Vegas Hotels Pale in Comparison”
Reviews.Author: Momof3GorgeousGirls
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at THEhotel for three nights for our ten year anniversary. We are both stressed-out doctors in our late 30's and really needed to be pampered, as this getaway was sans our three daughters. Well, every moment was BLISS. We have been to Las Vegas 4 times previously and none of the other Vegas Strip Hotels can deliver even close to our flawless experience. Check-in was smooth, the front desk upgraded us to a Honeymoon Suite for free, which was on the corner 23rd floor and amazing. It was gigantic, 750. sq. ft, with floor-to-ceiling windows in both the living room and bedroom (two walls of windows in the bedroom). However, I had my heart set on a suite with a view of the Vegas Strip, a request that was immediately honored by ANOTHER FREE UPGRADE to the 36th floor with the most amazing views of the Strip, especially at night. What service with a smile! The suite is huge and chicly dark-hued. The 1 1/2, all marble baths had double vanities, separate seamless shower, a deep soaking tub, and I had the luxury of "banishing" my husband to the half bath when we were getting ready. The suite is beyond words and reminds me of a modern version of the St .Regis hotel suite on 5th Ave. and 55th St. in Manhattan. Need I say more? My requests for extra pillows , extra face soap, and a another CD player in the bedroom was granted almost as fast as I hung up the phone. The staff we encountered were friendly and professional, from the Housekeeping people to the Valets and to the Concierge. The beds were comfortable like crazy. We felt we were in a time warp, because between the buffets and the shopping, playing at the craps tables, and the shows (we saw Bellagio's "O," and MGM Grand's "Ka," and Danny Gans at the Mirage --- all excellent), and the restaurants (Le Cirque, Commanders Palace, Shibuya, Craftsteak), the hours and days just flew by, and we always had a hard time getting out of bed becuase of the the feather-tops and high-quality linens. THE hotel shares its pool with the regular Mandalay Bay, and it was quite crowded,as the temperatures were in keeping with the coutry's heatwave (about 114 degrees F). It was a man-made beach and wave pool and it was refreshing. We couldn't get chairs poolside, but that was okay because we only wanted to ool off for an hour. The nay-sayers on Tripadvisor are probably folks who are overly grumpy and hard to please. I'd stay at THE hotel again. Be warned that it is at the most Southern part of the Strip and cabs cost about $10.00 one way to get anywhere you want to go on the Strip, but that's okay because the Monorail is $5.00/pp and it's much more walking. What you get in return is a gorgeos, boutique hotel with excellent service and very minimal cheese-factor. The one thing that I would improve is the entrance, however. The cabbie from the airport dropped us off at the garage-level, which seems so un-grandiose, considering the high caliber of this wonderful hotel. This needs to be improved because the dingy garage drop-off is not fitting of the superior beauty and luxury of the hotel, which smacks you hppily in the face as soon as step foot past the depressing garage-level sliding doors. Overall, for THEhotel I give to you my HIGHEST RECOMMENDATION!!!

Reviews.Title: “Glorious hotel, hellacious pool”
Reviews.Author: mattkorey
Reviews.Content: I would rate this hotel (which I also stayed at last year) as five stars. I'd rate what the pool has to offer as five stars. I'd rate the practical application of going to the pool as zero stars. I've never seen such a ridiculously undersized (though it is huge) facility for the number of people it is expected to accomodate. I mean really. For what you pay at THEhotel, you get no sort of preferential treatment as far as the pool is concerned. I looked for a chair for over 30 minutes and just when I was going to give up, I found a broken one with three legs and just sort of balanced it and said, better than nothing. However, as I said, the hotel rooms themselves at THEhotel are glorious. LOVE them. Fantastically decorated. I also went to the Bathhouse Spa and to the gym. The Bathhouse is just fantastic. So well done, I was completely shocked. Great, great, great. The gym was very nice as well. Much better than a regular hotel gym, though the lighting was a little strange, very dim was a lot of red and yellow lights, but it was very nice and clean and completely uncrowded. I would stay here again for all the good things and I guess just grin and bear the other since on the whole it is still the best thing going in Vegas for the price, provided you go when they are offering sharply reduced rates which they do on occasion.

Reviews.Title: “attrocious service”
Reviews.Author: divenuts
Reviews.Content: i spent three nights at the hotel and it was a very disappointing experience . the lobby is pretty and the rooms ( all suites ) are comfortable and attractive . the service at the hotel is attrocious . getting a wake up call means being on hold for ten minutes , call the front desk and its another ten minutes , call for a reservation at alain ducasse' restaurant "mix" , you guessed it , ten minutes on hold . i wish checking out had only taken ten minutes , that was a fifteen minute line . room service was the only call i made that was answered in an exceptable time. the view from "the mix" bar is spectacular at night, and well worth the ridiculous drink prices. the restaurant is good but frankly its not what i would expect from such a famous michelin star chef . its certainly not in the same league as his paris establishment and i could think of at least a couple of dozen better restaurants in my home town of chicago . i was at the hotel for business meetings and my complaints were echoed by everyone at the event . if your looking for a cool vegas hotel that has substance and not just style , this is not it !

Reviews.Title: “Well Done Property”
Reviews.Author: newspro
Reviews.Content: We spent five days at THEhotel with family and friends. We had a total of three suites. Months in advance we requested an upper floor with a strip view for each room. Upon check-in when we asked if they were able to meet our request, the reception agent said: "Sir, your rooms have already been assigned." She made no effort to explain and we were too tired (this was late at night) to get into a lengthy conversation. Turns out we were on a lower floor (13). Two of our three rooms had a parking deck view with the mountains in the background. The third room was very nice with three windows including one facing the strip. We found all of the rooms to be delightful. They were well maintained with no "wear and tear" that previous posters have mentioned. The rooms were quite simply lovely in every way. The one downfall of our experience was housekeeping. On two consecutive days they failed to provide clean drinking glasses. On one day the toilets had not been cleaned. And on one day they didn't get up to clean the room until after 4pm. One other slight negative was the hotel's phone service. When they answered the phone they mumbled to the point that it was hard to understand them. And twice while calling restaurants for information on dress code and hours, the phone rang and rang and went unanswered. Overall we found THEhotel to be a very nice experience. Everybody in our family liked the place very much and we plan to make it a part of our next say in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: trvljunky
Reviews.Content: The beautiful boutique hotel at The Hotel, Mandalay Bay is sublime if you want to get away from the cheesey themed hotels on the Strip. You really feel special - staff are welcoming and not stuck up, and had amazing service and food at the Fleur de Lys restaurant. The beach & wavepool are great for kids. It's not cheap on the weekends but you can score a bargain during the week - would definately come back.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: DocStone
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that this review is of theHotel at Mandalay bay. There seem to be a LOT of reviews of Mandalay Bay Proper being attributed to theHotel and there is an important difference between the two. It is a silly name though and even our cab driver ended up taking us to Mandalay instead of theHotel. C'est la vie This was our second trip staying at TheHotel and it met our expectations again. We got a great room on the 21st floor on the corner, in a v suite with a super view. Always ask for a room ending in 815 if you want the best views. A higher floor would have been nicer, but were told nothing was available on that corner higher up. Check in by the way was a breeze at 3:00 on a Sunday. Line was non existent, David was pleasent and helpful. I think those people dealing with long check in lines are checking in during some peak times. Not sure what else you would expect. We arrived on Suday in order to avoid the crowds. If I had flown in Friday afternoon or evening, I would have expected a line. Anyway, David said he could give us the room I wanted, above the 20th floor ending in 815, but that housekeeping was currently in it. No worries. We dropped our bags, tipped the maid and grabbed some drinks. Room was immaculate on our return a few hours later. Housekeeping went above and beyond each day we were there (find my trip report in LV forum for more detals). A few bucks goes a long way. It was excellent service. The BathHouse Spa was a pleasure for my wife. She loved every minute of it. She spent HOURS there every day and would probably be happy to have spent her whole vacation there. The lighting IS low. It's a nice ambience, and matches the subtle and dark decor. Bright lighting would ruin that view. The only real complaint I have about the room is that if you are going to have three high end plasma tv's in it, you should A: have a decent selection of stations and B: have a clear picture. I'm not a TV guy so I don't care that much, but I did note that it's a pitiful selection and nothing is High Def. (I watched the All Star game in the room while my wife was napping, would have been nice to see that in HD). I just think that if you spend a gazillion dollars to buid that place you could hook it up decent picture quality. Had room service once, it was excellent, both service and food. Cab stand was friendly and effcient. All staff we encountered was great. Every single one we encountered, even if it was randomly in the hall asked us if we were enjoying our stay. We did not visit the mandalay pools complex, but I'm sure it was busy and full of drunk adults. It's vegas! In Room check out did not work when we were ready to leave, the system was down (it was a breeze last time we were here) but a quick call to the desk and it was done, never had to wait in line, which was really great and they are mailing a copy of the final bill. We had a great special rate for our trip this time, but I would have paid double. theHotel was every bit as good as it should have been.

Reviews.Title: “Be Aware”
Reviews.Author: vic49
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an annual trip to Vegas with friends. We like to stay at different properties and thought we would check out The Hotel. We like to stay at upscale proerties and since we stayed at Bellagio last year, we felt we should giveThe Hotel a try. We reserved our rooms 4 months in advance and called to confirm a couple of days prior to check in. When we all arrived we got two different front desk agents.My husband and I got our non smoking king suite on 22nd floor but our friends could only get a smoking room with 2 queens on the 5th floor. They said they were in a sold out situation and could not guarantee the requests for our friends. They did move them the next day, but was a bad way to begin. When we arrived in our room it was lovely. Very large, nice bathroom and TV in bath was a nice touch. We had two lamps not working and when I called down to front desk they had it fixed quickly. Which brings me to my next comments. When staying in this level resort you expect housekeeping to be more attentive to detail. They don't notice 2 lamps not working? We tipped them daily and not once did they replenish our toiletries, she also never left us any hand towels at counter. Only bath towels. I know they have them because we got 1 on our check in day. I know this seems trivial, but we have stayed in many hotels where those little niceties were done daily. Now for the pool. Great pool area with wave pool and lazy river and LOTS of kids. (infants to 20 somethings) so be aware that if you are travelling with kids it will be great, if not you will have to head to South Lagoon pool or private topless pool, or be willing to sit among wall to wall bodies with chairs lined up so closely you have to crawl down to end to get on and off. Oh yeah, pool opens at 8:00 AM and people start lining up at gate at 7:00 AM. Not fun. You can rent a cabana like we did for $300.00 - $400.00 a day (rent a week in advance) and that will afford you some space and get you out of the line but the service at our cabana was to say the least, sketchy. First day at cabana the attendent asked if I knew how to get to my cabana, (I did because we had requested one we saw the night we got in) so I found my way and he told me he would be around at 1:00 PM with bill. He was not kidding, we did not see him again for quite a while. We finally managed to flag down our cocktail server an hour and 1/2 later for ice, towels, cups etc. For those of you not familiar with the cabana scene, those things come std. as do sodas, water, fridge etc. You should have them in your cabana at time of rental or shortly there after. Not an 1 and 1/2 hours later. We stayed all day, got our floats and tubes for lazy river ourselves. ( they bring your floats to you at Bellagio when renting a cabana.) I had one too many Pina Coladas, WAY too much heat and sun and became ill. To the point where they called a medic to check on me. While in cabana with heat stroke and nasuea we used up the water that came in our fridge. When my husband tried to get a couple of more bottles the elusive cabana attendent informed us we would have to be charged for them! Now you have to know that all day we had invited our servers in out of the heat and even offered them a bottle of water. I am not blaming them because it was not there call. It's just unbelievable that when someone is as ill as I was that they would have the audacity to charge us for a couple of bottles water. Next day my friends went down to rent same cabana and got much better service upon arrival. They were shown to their cabana , stocked up with towels and water I might add. Dave was off that day and Dave needs a lesson in customer service. Food was great at all restaurants and service was also good. All in all it was a nice stay, but if I go again, I will go back to Bellagio. The poo lis lovely, but I don't have to line up at 7:00 AM for a chair and I am not touching the chair next to me while sunbathing. The housekeeping is more attentive also and over all service is a step above The Hotel. Oh before I forget, they also don't have security at elevators checking for your key like they do at Bellagio. I find it odd that MGM owns both of these properties and they can be so different.They tout The Hotel as such an upscale property and all. If you are travelling with kids, don't mind waiting in line for an hour at pool then go for it. But if you are looking for a grown up time away in an upscale property stick with the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed at The Hotel for a week in July, it didnt live up to the hyde. The biggest problem was the pool , its a 15min walk from your room and when you get there, they play crap RnB music the whole day, we paid extra to go into the exclusive beach area where they played hard house music all day , we couldnt relax at all during the day 2 days out of the 7 days there were no towels and when the tempurature is over 100degrees its not comfortbale to sit on beds in the heat apart from this , the hotel is very nice , but i wouldnt stay again..plus we lost at the casino!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Knock Our Socks Off”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldSeas
Reviews.Content: Check in at this hotel is atrocious. Waited in line for about a half hour only to be greeted by a stuffy desk clerk with major attitude. My wife made reservations in her name; he wouldn't let me check in without her being present (we share the same last name). This meant I'd need to again wait in line for another half hour after locating her. Finally convinced the clerk to take care of the matter with a phone call. Fortunately, my wife answered the phone and confirmed I had permission to check in. The lobby and elevator foyer were breathtaking. Very sublime and modern. Really liked the floors, woodwork, high ceilings, furniture, and light sconces. Were expecting great things when we arrived at our room. Apparently the desk clerk's intellect isn't as big as his attitude because he had assigned us disabled accommodations next to a utility room reserved for housekeeping (very noisy during the morning and into the afternoon). We aren't disabled. This meant that instead of a marble encased tub and shower, we received fiberglass enclosures with cheap shower wands. Since everything is lower in this type of room (including light switches), the shower curtain on both the shower side and the tub side were ill-fitting, dragging about two feet on the floor! Very ugly, to say the least. Outside of that, the suite was nice, the bed was comfy, and the air conditioning worked well. A full one bedroom with separate living/desk area. Furnishings are hip and appeared to be of some quality. Flat screens were a nice touch. View outside was nothing . . . parking garage and street running through the property. Another "thanks" to the desk clerk with major attitude. Didn't use any amenities like the pool. The casino is nice, room service was fast, professional, and efficient. The restaurant located between The Hotel and the casino floor was good and the people were very nice. Think we'll check out other upscale suites the next time we're in Vegas. This place was nice, but not overly impressive. Can probably do better for the same price somewhere else. Nothing here that makes us long to go back, that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend and will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Kansas38
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend. We had a wonderful, relaxing stay at THE Hotel. We arrived at 10pm on Thursday and had no wait to check in, with a very pleasant middle aged, knowledgeable member of staff waiting to assist us. Our requests at check-in were accommodated, with no hassle and no unpleasantries. Check out on Sunday at 11am presented a long line, but sufficient staff at the reception desk, consuming a total of 20 minutes of our time. They were quick and efficient. Room 12909 was very clean. Maid service was excellent and tipped accordingly. In fact, all service personnel were excellent and responsive to requests. For those kings and queens out there who deserve royal treatment, who complain about bad service, a piece of advice - tipping service staff DOES make a difference to the quality of service you receive. They are not YOUR servants, they are people doing a job. These people bust their butts daily, with few who recognize their efforts and many who leave their rooms trashed. A minimal tip and a simple thank you goes a long way. Room service was quick - food well proportioned, hot, and delicious. (We were comped on our bill when charged to our room, which made it even better). Although there are many complaints about the dim lighting in the suites, we found it very relaxing. With 2 bedside lamps, one pedastal lamp, and overhead canned lighting along the floor to ceiling, wall to wall window of natural light, it's as bright or as dark as you opt for it to be. The black-out curtains allowed for much-needed sleep well into the daylight hours, to compensate for the late nights, which we very much appreciated. We frequent Vegas at least yearly and always stay somewhere new. Up until our stay at THE Hotel, Bellagio was our #1 pick. However, after staying at THE Hotel, we feel cheated for having spent the money at other "high end" properties, as no room we have ever stayed in compares to that of the suite we occupied at THE Hotel. It was very comfortable, contemporary, and the rich earth tone colors provided a relaxed ambiance beyond compare. Other rooms we have stayed in were simply a place to sleep. Our suite at THE Hotel was a place we looked forward to getting back to, to relax and reconnect. When leaving our room to relax at the pool, we turned our housekeeping light on and upon each return, our suite was immaculately cleaned and toiletries replenished in abundance. Again, minimal tipping makes a huge difference with service staff. My husband and I are in our mid-30's and felt to be the mainstream at THE Hotel, as far as age is concerned. There was the usual fair share of 40 something's trying to keep up with the 20 something's - lots of plastic and collagen - so very LA. People watching is one of the free entertainment aspects we much enjoy and find great humor in, especially in Vegas. Although a short walk to the casino in Mandalay Bay, the pools were quite the hike. With the size of this resort being considered, the walking distance should be expected. We opted for the South Lagoon Pool, which we had no problem staking claim on lounge chairs directly poolside. This pool is the farthest walking distance with steps leading up to it, which we found to be kid-free and more of an adult crowd, which was our preference. Cocktail waitresses were very attentive and drinks contained a generous portion of alcohol, so the 12 dollars per drink became a non-issue quick. If you walk through the convention center all the way to the end exit, you don't have to do the stairs and it is a more direct path to take. After cocktails at the pool all afternoon, the quickest path to A/C was our preferred path. The Bayside Buffet breakfast was okay, usual buffet options. House of Blues breakfast was better and lunch was excellent too (burgers and boneless wings were out of this world awesome - although after many cocktails may have been the alcohol ;) Zumanity was comedic, moreso than I expected. Erotic, sexual, and funny. Definitely a different edge and would not recommend for virgin Cirque viewers. This is NOT typical Cirque. If you are not an open minded, passionate lover, do not see this production, as it will likely leave you feeling violated. For those of you, like my husband and myself, you won't be able to get back to your room quick enough. I was a little disappointed in the Zumanity gift shop, however. After leaving the show, I was hoping for some fun toys in the shop to take back to our room. Mamma Mia was AWESOME! Tickets were inexpensive and this was THE best musical production I have ever seen. Being an 80's child, big fan of ABBA, could see this one again and again. Highly recommend. All in all, can't wait to return. For the first time ever, will not visit somewhere new, but definitely plan to return to THE Hotel. For comparable rates, no other hotel comes close to comparing.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1) If you love to swim or be in the water, this is the hotel for you. There are multiple pools, fun wave action and a lazy river, and for the most part, I didn't consider them overly crowded, even on Saturday. 2) rooms were very average but the bathrooms were huge (although no locking door and a see-through shower - kind of odd) 3) cleaning staff very nice - I had several hold doors, smile and greet me each day Cons: 1) Very annoying to me that in the OBVIOUSLY shallow kiddie pool area, drunk, scantily-clad adults chose to sit in the middle being very obnoxious plus I didn't appreciate their cigarette butts and beer bottles in the water - please, show some courtesy. 2) Elevator situation is bad - when busy you can wait up to 15 minutes to get on. When I inquired about stairs, I was told they are only used for emergencies and fire hazards - ummmm.....whatever. Like 20 people crammed in an elevator is any safer than a family of four willingly walking up stairs? 3) Room rates are too high - not enough bang for your buck. My brother stayed in a suite and I didn't think it was even all that roomy. 4) Since it is located at the end of the strip, there aren't many affordable options for eating close by. Average rate - with a family, I wouldn't stay here again - I'd pay a lot less for a room somewhere in the middle of the strip and spend a day at a water park to suffice our swimming and water needs.

Reviews.Title: “Not much of THE Place after all!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before I visited THE Hotel I was overwelmed with comment about how great the hotel was, how gorgeous the suites are etc.etc. Lets be honest. The suites are not that bad, they are in fact large, well equipped and the design is kind of cool BUT too dark, not very clean and NOT as new as you think they are. My bathroom is suite 9916 had a broken toilet seat and the doors were somehow "not functioning properly". However what is really embarassinf with THE Hotel is the service. You cannot get more ignorant staff, bell service is sooooooooo slow, operators take for ages to reply and I can go on and on and on. Given that this is Vegs, this place is just OK but for the price, I would heat somewhere else on the strip.......

Reviews.Title: “A real Oasis in the desert!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a 4 night stay at TheHotel at Mandalay Bay Resort. This was our first trip to Las Vegas and we were very happy with our choice. The suite was fabulous! Beautifully appointed, very clean. We appreciated the seperate temperature controls in the sleeping and sitting areas. Everything looked brand new! The queen sized beds had wonderful pillow-topped mattresses, luxurious sheets and down pillows. There was a large full bath, with a soaking tub and seperate shower, plus a 1/2 bath which our teenaged daughter took for her own. Very nice when getting ready to go out! We had an amazing view of the entire strip from our room on the 23rd floor. Plenty of elevators, very fast service. We ate Sunday Champaign brunch at the Bayside Buffet, which was excellent! Lots of choices, seafood, chinese dishes, lamb, veal cutlet, prime rib, sushi.... all were very good. The pools and beach were wonderful! Yes, it was crowded at the wave pool and the lazy river. (It was 110 degrees, where else would you want to be?) But, we were able to find chairs easily at both 11:00 am and later at 3:00. There were also several pool areas to choose from and two were not crowded at all on the days we were there. Thanks to the nice lady who gave us her innertube as she was leaving..... If you plan to visit here save some money and bring a tube from home. The only complaints I have are 1: the tour busses don't pick up at TheHotel, so you have to walk to the Tour lobby at the Mandalay. 2. The pool is also at the Mandalay, so it is quite a walk through the casino. to get to the "beach". But, after all the noise and hectic atmosphere of the strip TheHotel is a peaceful respite to which to come home.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two week stay at The Hotel and it was amazing. After reading reviews before going we were a bit unsure but everyones experiences are different aren't they, we had no problems at all, with check in we were in our suite within 10 minutes of arriving, it was spotless with nothing out of place, it was always cleaned in a morning before we came back from the pool. The beds were so comfy I could have stayed there all day. The pool did get very busy but we are early birds and were always there for 8 o'clock, so we had no problems in getting a place. We even got to see all of Englands qualifying World Cup Games in the Sports Book which we weren't expecting to see. I loved everthing about it and I am now having withdrawal syptoms from Vegas life, counting the weeks to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the $$$”
Reviews.Author: katiekatie
Reviews.Content: Our rooms were not ready at the promised 3 o'clock check in time and were told rudely that they actually had until 6 to have our rooms ready. The pool area was very nice but you were lucky to get a chair, it was very overcrowded. We were reprimanded for having our 4 year-old son in the wave pool (even though 2 of us were holding his hands, he had a life vest on, and we never went above his knees in the water). We were rudely told to get him in the kiddie pool, which was FULL of drunk adults. The pool area closed at 7o'clock 2 nights, and 6 o'clock the last 2 nights so they could have concerts in the entire pool area. The rooms were nice and very large and could have easily housed four adults but no quad rooms are available in this hotel. The front desk staff was rude on check out.

Reviews.Title: “would never ever stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: ambi
Reviews.Content: Ive been to vegas quite a few times before and never encountered such a bad experience.While I was asleep in my room someone entered-according to hotel security they used a key-and stole alllll my stuff out of the living room.I know that I should have used the room safe and deadbolted the door-which ive kicked myself many a time for not doing.Well over ten thousand dollars of stuff was stolen.Unfortunately Ive come to realise that these things can happen no matter what grade of hotel you are at-my problem with the hotel at mandlay bay was the way which they handled the theft.I was sent to security who pretty much just shrugged,got me to write a report of what was taken and said they would get back to me within a few weeks.Im still waitng.They then sent me off in the blistering heat to walk to the police station without even so much as an apology.Granted I was crying and incredibly upset about the situation but they were incredibly unhelpful.While making the police report the officer told me that this kind of theft-despite actually being in the room at the time-was common and that they had dealt with similar cases at mandalay bay.I obviously told the hotel I didnt want to pay for the stay-which they didnt not like one bit.They said we would "discuss" that the following day when I checked out much to my annoyance.The next day i made it very clear I wasnt negotiating paying for the stay and they refunded my money-but not happily.The really scary thing is that I asked to be told exactly what the "investigation" into the theft would entail and was told that there was no security footage of the hallways of the hotel.Thats actually really scary that there is no way of knowing who is going into peoples rooms and stealing their stuff-if not worse.The good news is that I havent been put off visiting vegas for life-just the hotel at mandalay bay.I cant advise people planning on visting the hotel to use the safe/locks on the door strongly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time at THEhotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at THEhotel. The first was in November of 2005 prior to my deployment to the Mideast- this time was during my mid-tour leave, which happened to coincide with my anniversary. I called a few weeks beforehand to order champagne and strawberries to be ready upon check-in. We'll get to that in a minute. We showed up around 3 PM and were told, as expected, that our room wasn't ready. I mentioned that we'd probably hit up the gym as both my wife and I were eager to work out some tension after a long flight. The woman at the front desk was happy to comp us use of the gym and spa facilities for the entire week! We grabbed what we needed out of our suitcases, sent them away with the bellhop, and enjoyed the gym and bathhouse for a few hours. Our room was ready around 5:30 so we went upstairs, only to find out that our key didn't work. I went back downstairs and the problem was remedied. Luckily, I have an extreme amount of patience, so I wasn't really bothered by the minor inconvenience. Upon entering the room, the champagne and strawberries were absent, so I flagged down a room service attendant in the hallway and he promptly took care of it. The rest of the week went pretty well. We ordered plenty of room service (the portions are extremely generous and the quality was surprisingly good). We spent a day at the pool but, being from Florida, it wasn't a huge draw for us. The restaurants inside the Mandalay complex were great. We ate at The Burger Bar (which I was happy to see served Pyramid Hefeweizen on tap- the only such place I found it), Wolfgang Puck's Lupo (delicious), and China Grill (huge portions!). Our only complaint was the location. THEhotel's ambience, decor, service, etc. were top-notch, but it did become rather tedious to keep catching taxi's to get to the Venetian/Bellagio/Caesar's part of the strip. I'm definitely a repeat customer of THEhotel and will continue to stay there whenever I'm in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Would go again!”
Reviews.Author: JuicyLuicy3691
Reviews.Content: We booked THE hotel a few weeks before we arrived, for a family holiday, we stayed two nights, this was our third time in Las Vegas and first time at THE hotel. We arrived at THE hotel at around 3pm, Monday 29th May 2006. The lobby is very modern and minimalistic. We waited to check in for about 20 minutes, I would advise you to avoid checking in until 5pm, because 3-4 is peak times and you can be waiting for your room for a while. We had a room with two king-size beds. The rooms are fantastic, ours had a lounge area with a huge plasma screen TV. The view from the room was the back end of the strip, a wonderful view of the airport, which is great if you are interested in planes. The beds are very comfortable and we had plenty of space. The bathroom was one of the nicest we've ever had in the world. There was a power shower, a massive bath, two sinks and a separate toilet, there was even a plasma TV in the bathroom. The only complaints I would make are: 1. As THE hotel doesn't have it's own pool, it is the Mandalay Bay pool. It has been described as the best pool in Las Vegas, which is one of the reasons why we booked. There are at least four pools, but if you go at a peak time, say 12-5, it is extremley hard to find a lounger and there was no towels left when we went, and the hotel is very picky about taking room towels down to the pool. 2. There is a long walk from THE hotel to the pool, and it is not very well signed, we spent about half an hour looking for the pool, which is right on the other side of the resort, near the convention centre and shark reef. Overall, it was an extremley pleasurable stay and we hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous vacation at THEhotel!”
Reviews.Author: beenievt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at THE hotel from 5-10 June, 2006. Let me start off by saying that before we went, I read all of the reviews on this site and some of the negative reviews concerned me. We even considered changing our reservations. We went and had a wonderful time and we had NO PROBLEMS whatsoever. Everyone we encountered - the maids, the bellhops, the front desk staff – were courteous and helpful. We arrived at about 11:30 PM for check in. Check-in was fast and the registration desk attendant was very friendly and courteous. We were upgraded to a corner “V” suite free of charge. The room was clean and we loved the decor. The bed was incredibly comfortable and I slept like a baby! The bath products are wonderful and I took advantage of the large soaking tub every day. The only complaint we had was that when we entered the room, it took us a few minutes to figure out how to work the lights. Like many others, we requested a late checkout, but we were unable to get one due to the AFL Superbowl which was held over the weekend – we were told that they were 102% booked. We use the bellhop service and had no problems with our luggage. Maid service came around 10 AM on the first day (Tuesday) and then between 3-4 PM the rest of the week. Not a problem for us, we just planned around it. I don’t think they are intentionally being slow – I noticed that the maid’s cart was out in the hallway all day – they started cleaning early in the morning and did not finish until around 5 PM. The rooms are large and they take a while to clean. We know this because one afternoon we were in our room when they came by to clean. The maid was in our room for no less than 30 minutes. After reading some of the problems folks had finding chairs at the pool, we decided to go down to the pool every morning and get chairs, stay there until lunchtime and then go about our day (thus avoiding the crowd and the hottest part of the day). The pool was practically empty Tues & Wed. We had trouble finding chairs on Thurs. because we slept in and didn’t get out to the pool until 10AM. Friday morning we got out there around 9AM and got a seat in the front row by the wave pool. It did get very crowded on Friday and there was a lot of partying going on in the shallow section of the wave pool. We saw a lot of people “saving chairs” with towels, but it didn’t seem to slow most people down. I saw a lot of people removing the towels and having a seat. It does seem like they need to expand the pool area. One other concern was that on the busy days, the wave pool did get littered with a lot of trash – its disappointing that there was no staff around to clean things up. I decided to get a 50 min. massage at the Spa at Mandalay Bay because I thought that I would like the atmosphere better than the Bathhouse. While this was not the best spa I’ve been to, it was very good. I would give it 4 out of 5 stars, and I’m only knocking it down one star because the trashcan was overflowing in the restroom and the shower attendants did not remove some of the used washcloths and towels from the floor of the shower. Mandalay Bay is at the very south end of the strip, but I liked the fact that we were somewhat secluded from the crowds of tourists that we encountered roaming through NYNY, the MGM, and the Wynn. The tram and the monorail make it pretty easy to get around, and when all else fails, grab a taxi! You also notice a difference walking through the hallway that takes you back to THE hotel (feels like you are walking away from the madness). The entrance to THE hotel may be unimpressive (as it is inside a parking garage) but I think the isolation back there is a plus. People have complained on this site about the décor and atmosphere of THE hotel and have said that it is geared towards a certain age group and the “party crowd.” My husband and I are both professionals in our early 30’s. While there were a lot of younger partiers on Friday and Saturday, we weren’t bothered by any of them. All I can say is do your research and if you know you won’t be comfortable in a hotel with a certain décor that gears to a certain crowd – don’t stay there!! The options for places to stay in Vegas are endless. People have also complained that drinks, food, services, etc. are expensive. I’m sorry, but the days of the $4.00 buffet are long gone in Vegas. Everything is expensive on the strip – some hotels more than others – just plan for it and get over it! We would absolutely stay at THE Hotel again in the future – maybe not next trip because I really want to stay at the Bellagio or maybe the Wynn – but we will be back! Bars & Restaurants: Mix – We went up to Mix (the bar/restaurant on the top floor of THE hotel) on Wed. night. General admission is $20 but is free to guests of THE hotel (just show your room key). The drinks were $12+ each, but the view is WELL worth it. The bar is approx. 400 feet above the strip so you have a bird’s eye view of all of the hotels on the strip. It was just amazing up there. There was a lightning storm while we were there which was even more wild. If you go, make sure to use the restroom while you’re in there – the wall of the bathroom is glass from floor to ceiling – just WILD! THE Café – We ate breakfast in the café one morning. The food was very good. Service was a little slow (but the restaurant was almost full). R&M Seafood (Mandalay Place) – We ate dinner here Tues. night. The service was OK. I had a good plate of Mahi Mahi, but my husband’s Ahi tuna was not very fresh. I would skip this one and try one of the other amazing seafood restaurants in Vegas. Elements in the Aladdin is still my favorite for fusion seafood. Aureole – This is the famous restaurant with the 5 story wine tower and the wine angels. There are two menu choices – the first is a “tasting” which is $95/person. They bring you 9 small plates of various dishes and it takes about 2 hours to complete. The second is a choice from a list of first courses, main entrees and desserts for $75/person. We chose the later option. My husband had very good Ahi tuna (1st) and a Filet (main). My meal was just OK. I had a hard time selecting because I’m semi-vegetarian so I had the Gnocchi (1st) and the John Dory (main). The John Dory was good, but was served on an odd combination of sautéed avocados and mushrooms which I didn’t care for. Dessert was the best course in my opinion. The wine list is very cool – they bring it to you on a handheld computer. Service was very good. Our final bill was around $250 (incl. a bottle of wine and tip.) I don’t think we will eat there again – too many good restaurants to chose from in Vegas and this one was just OK compared to other restaurants we’ve sampled in Vegas. Red White & Blue – We went there for breakfast one morning. The food was pretty overpriced for what you get (i.e., $4.95 for a bagel) and the service was pretty slow. They had a lot of waitresses/waiters and bus boys just standing around goofing off. The Bayside Buffet – This was my husband’s 3rd time in Vegas (my 6th) and he had never been to a buffet, so we decided to give this one a shot. I have been to the Luxor and Bellagio buffets and both were nicer than this one (with the Bellagio being the best). This buffet is definitely for people looking for quantity over quality. It had some of the nicer items – crab legs, shrimp, sushi – but I sampled all and none were very fresh. I had three different plates of food – and each item I maybe took one bite and left the rest. The desserts were better – they had both a chocolate and white chocolate fountain with very fresh strawberries which was nice. Shows: KA: We have seen Drallion, Mystere and O, but this one was my husband’s favorite. The story line in KA is much easier to follow and as always, the costumes and set were absolutely amazing. Compared to the other resident Cirque shows in Vegas, KA is more dark and serious with a lot less comic relief. I enjoyed KA – there were many moments where I was sitting there thinking “how are they doing that?!”, but O is still my favorite Cirque show. Zumanity: After seeing KA and loving it on the second night of our trip, we decided at the last minute to see if there were tickets available for Zumanity on our last night in Vegas. We went to the box office Fri. afternoon and were able to get two tickets in the balcony in the front row. The show was very entertaining – the clowns were hysterical – the acts were very exciting. It is an “adult” show and they hit on some very erotic themes, but it was all very artistically and tastefully done. We loved it with one exception. The most obnoxious couple I have ever encountered sat right behind us and offered their commentary on absolutely everything the entire show. Despite several nasty looks from us, they never ceased to shut up. I didn’t want to ruin everyone else’s experience by getting up to get the usher to come have a word with them as well, so we suffered their talking the whole time. Why would you pay $170 for tickets and then come to the show and talk the whole time? I ask the same question of a woman at KA who sat in the row in front of us, about four seats down to our left, who talked on her cell phone for about 5 min. in the middle of the show. She made/answered several calls until the usher came into her row and sternly told her to put her phone away. Jerks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dez317
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay for a convention at The Hotel. We travel quite a bit and have stayed in a number of hotels throughout world. This hotel was quite nice. The rooms are a good size and having them seperated into a living area and sleeping area is nice if you are traveling with children. The half bath in the living area was a nice bonus as well. The lobby is very modern and elegant and the elevators are fast. Room service had good food, fast service and a decent price. I only have 2 main issues with the hotel. The first one is with housekeeping. Housekeeping never seemed to make it to our room until around 4pm. The problem with this was that it was usually the time in which we were coming back from the pool to take showers and get ready for the evening. One night we just let them clean up around us. The last night we were there we just asked for fresh towels and sent them on their way. We had a room right next to the housekeeping (room) station and did not understand why they would show up right when they saw us coming in from the pool every day. Also, they were quite loud in the housekeeping room, starting fairly early in the morning. One day they mopped (or polished) the floors and had loud fans running ALL day into the early evening. There was also quite a bit of dust in our room everyday. My second issue was having to walk through the casino to get to the pool area. I do not understand way they did not set up a more direct route to the pool area from The Hotel. It made it uncomfortable to walk through the casino in a wet swimsuit and coverup. Not to mention the kids hated walking through the casino because of the smoke smell. Other then those two complaints I thought the hotel was very nice. The pool are was great but the water was freezing cold. My children did not seem to mind but I couldn't even get in it was so cold. The lazy river was fun as was the wave pool and we never had a problem finding lounge chairs. I would recommend this hotel. Shopping and food choices are not as good as the Venetian but it does have nice rooms. It is on the end of the strip so if you want to be in the middle of the action you may want to stay elsewhere, but for those of us who do not mind walking or taking a taxi it was not a problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Less than optimal stay for us here”
Reviews.Author: golf4all
Reviews.Content: Positive: Excellent room size, and extremely comfortable bedding. Negative: a) First night of three hotel could not give us the bedding we requested (KING) so we had to settle for a double. Quite underwhelming since we had booked, and they had charged 1st night's charge all the way back to early Oct, 2005. If date of booking meant anything at all, our 9-month old booking should have preceeded most of the occupants for this particular evening. Since our check-in was around 7PM, relatively early, I felt clearly the hotel simply did not want to honor our reservation bed-type preference, made 9 months earlier. For the 2nd night they allowed a room change to requested KING bed. Too little, too late. Got no better room (ie upgrade) than what we had pre-paid for and reserved anyway, so there was no attempt to make it right after initial foul-up b) though we tend to handle our own luggage, there was not a bellboy in sight, from the time we got out of the cab, to the time we headed to the elevator after check-in. Surreal for a property of this size and reputation. c) we felt overall attitude of the front desk CSR(s)l was "take it or leave it, we don't want to be bothered". More than any other complaint, this arrogant attitude is why we would not repeat here. d) one other poster mentions this, and I have to agree that the room interior lighting is extremely poor. If you want to read late evening, good luck. A lady on the elevator was complaining about this very issue as well and commented she could not put on her makeup correctly due to the poor lighting. e) though it didn't affect us, our friends had a spa appointment at 10AM on the date of their checkout. Normal check-out is 11AM for this property. Once again, front desk could care less our friends were spending $250+ at their spa to allow for a late checkout and denied their request outright, so our friends had to finish their spa treatment and essentially hustle up to their room to check out. f) Could not get apple powerbook on their wireless service no matter what I tried, nor could friends of ours. Both of us are competent w/ the apple os to know workarounds to most problems, but we both gave up on the wireless access and were able to get online via the in-room cablemodel provided drop. The pool complex was the single reason we chose this location over much better rates, incl next door at MB. Next time we'll choose Mandalay Bay or skip the entire brand and go back to the strip groupings (Bellagio, Venetian). "The Hotel" was "The Pits" for us. At the price paid for this property, honoring bed type should be a "no brainer", and attitude of front desk personnel should be seriously looked at.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - just one disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: CMS4
Reviews.Content: We stayed in THE HOTEL at Mandalay Bay the first week in August. Our suite was wonderful. Staff and service was good. The restaurant, THE MIX, on the top floor of the hotel was incredible. Our only disappointment was the pool. THE HOTEL does not have a pool of its own. You have to walk a fair distance to get to the pool of the Mandalay Bay which is touted as having the "nicest pool in Vegas". It is nice, BUT it is VERY crowded. This being the first week in June - there were many families. The pool cannot begin to accommodate the amount of people staying at THE HOTEL and the resort of Mandalay Bay. My husband and I could not find a chair. I was told that to get a lounge chair, you have to be at the pool gate by 7:45 in the morning only to stand in line until the gate opens at 8. Frustrated, we opted to rent a cabana for the day which can run anywhere from $150 to $500 - on the weekends, some of the cabanas cost $1000. We did enjoy our private cabana - very luxuious and private. But, BEWARE if you are not wanting to pay extra to enjoy the "nicest pool in Vegas".

Reviews.Title: “Hip, but not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: KCMEO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel in April b/c we had great tickets to the UFC Championship fight between Couture and Liddell, which was held at the Mandalay Bay Resort. I read the reviews of the Hotel and thought it might be a slightly more interesting stay than the rather cheesy, tropical decor at the Resort next door. We arrived a little earlier (1:45) than the 3:00 pm check-in time, but knew we'd most likely have to wait for our room and assumed that this "luxury" Hotel would store our bags until our room was ready. After waiting in line at the front desk for approx. 30 minutes, we were told that the hotel was overbooked and that they would offer us a suite at the Resort next door for $50 less than our nightly rate. I explained to them that we had both spa and dinner reservations at the Hotel and that we'd spent quite a bit of money for fight tickets and that we weren't apt to move, especially since we were there early with a guaranteed reservation. Having worked at a hotel, I know that due to the overbook situation, they were trying to get any takers to move to the Resort and assumed that since we are on the younger side (30ish) we wouldn't know any better and take the suite. I should also mention I'm not one of those difficult, crabby travelers who yell at innocent front-desk receptionists. After I politely told the man that I understood they were overbooked but that we would not accept the suite and they would have to move someone else, he rolled his eyes and said "fine". He went on to say he couldn't check us into the system until 3:00 or after and that he could not arrange to hold our bags for us since we technically weren't guests yet. Told us to check with the bellhop at the front regarding bag storage. Not exactly what I call luxury hotel service. We finally did get a room around 4:30. It was close to the noisy elevator, with no view and poorly cleaned. Lightbulb was out by the only lamp in the sitting area. The Hotel is "cool" and everyone walking around the lobby seems to think they are equally as cool. Service the rest of the weekend was okay. Spa was decent, but again, service was only average. By check-out Sunday morning, the lobby and lobby coffeeshop were filthy. Overall, not worth the price especially given location at end of Strip near airport. NOTE: Do have a drink at MIX, the Hotel bar/restaurant on the top floor. Amazing views of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Don't order room service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Mandalay Bay Hotel was crowded and if you're not a smoker prepare yourself for that nasty smoke smell that is so prevalant in Vegas. Raffles was a good onsite restaurant but room service food was awful. If you travel with more than 2 (i.e. with kids) definitely get a suite! It was well worth the room-change for much more space and overall the suite was FAR nicer than the standard room.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: GlobalGina
Reviews.Content: New-looking and soo comfortable. Not only did we have a huge master bathroom (there was a tv in there and a tub big enough for 2-3 people) there was a side bathroom near the front door. I stayed in one suite with 3 other persons and we had plenty of room. The bed was a little soft for me but still very nice. However, considering the cost anything less would have been a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Las Vegas Get away”
Reviews.Author: NikShim
Reviews.Content: This is a great spot for being close to the action while being somewhat removed from the casino life at the same time. The rooms have 1.5 baths, separate living area and decent size bedroom. Oversized bathrooms and a wonderful bathtub! I can't even remember when I last took a tub. Room service food was very good and was fairly priced. Although I wasn't a big fan of the work out area, I did find the spa very relaxing and less crowded than the spa at Mandalay Bay. The pool areas are very crowded and we found ourselves getting up early just to get a spot. The bar and restaurant are also very good. I had an afternoon snack of Tuna Tar Tar that might get me to start eating sushi more often. The casino was a short walk which I liked. Some other hotels I have stayed out in Vegas seem to require a long walk from the room and then casinos everywhere which has driven me nuts at time. If you don't always want to be right on top of the gambling I thought this was great. Really enjoyed this spot!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous rooms and food”
Reviews.Author: Magpiesnest
Reviews.Content: At the end of our three week stay in California we realised we were heading for Las Vegas on memorial day weekend and we expected it to be busy...it was but THEhotel coped well as far as our experience was concerned. Check in was fairly quick and our suite was superb. The bathroom was full marble with a massive bath, the linens / bedclothes were top quality and there was a sizable lounge with Plasma TV and Internet and an extra washroom - what more was required? The hotel was very busy with guests but not the hundreds of 'day trippers' that we saw at the Bellagio and Venetian later on that day. THEhotel is at the end of the strip which means you have to travel to most other attractions so you have to decide what your priorities are. We were happy to walk / monorail to the other hotels, join the seething masses but then to come back to the relative calm of THE hotel. Other people may prefer to stay a bit closer to the middle where its busier but most things are in easy reach. Another guest was critical of not being able to use the pool / beach on this weekend and that is disapointing but it was Memorial Day weekend. The Monday and Tuesday were a lot quieter with plenty of space and chairs at the pools. The food at the MIX Restaurant was fabulous if slightly pricey. The view from the MIX at nightime is spectacular - its on the 64th floor and its position at the end of the strip gives it a unique perspective. For breakfast and lunch the Verandah Bar at the Four Seasons Hotel (also part of the Mandalay Bay) is perfect. If you want to avoid the crowds all together the Four Seasons has a separate entrance and a slightly older, more wealthy clientele and should be considered. Overall the Mandalay Bay exceeded my expectations. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Room was OK, location less than desirable, luggage handling seemed disrespectful”
Reviews.Author: VegasPlayer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from spending 4 nights at THEHotel. Unless we find an excellent rate for it, I doubt that we will return to stay there again. This is mainly due to it’s out of the way location on the far south-end of the Strip and the way the hotel's staff handled our luggage after we checked out (and paid) – more on that in a bit. The suite itself was pretty nice. The bathroom was spacious and the best thing about the suite. It had its own TV and a separate bath tub and shower. The suite had a small sitting area with a sofa, chair, and desk. Unlike the Venetian which has open floor plans, the bedroom and living room were separated by walls. It made each room seem somewhat cramped (although I guess you could call it cozy :)). While the suite came with three nice televisions, unfortunately, the reception in our suite was poor especially compared to the quality of the TV’s in the Sports Book at Mandalay Bay. Also on a negative note, we didn’t care for the type of sheets that the hotel used and the lighting in the bedroom and living room area was extremely poor in our opinion. The housekeeping was good, but somewhat inconsistent. One day our rug for the shower was not replaced and on another day we only received one hand towel – minor annoyances but we expected better. If I was just judging on the room, I would give the hotel 3 stars. What really compelled me to write this review was the way THEHotel handled our luggage after we checked out. Our flight did not leave until 7 PM on the day we checked out. I called down to the front desk and inquired about a late check out. The clerk indicated that they were not offering late checkouts but we were more than welcomed to check our luggage with the bellhops. That sounded reasonable. So we checked our luggage with the hotel at around 11:15 AM. Assuming that our luggage was in good hands, we enjoyed our final day in Vegas dining, playing some blackjack at the MGM Grand, shopping, and betting on the horses at Mandalay Bay. We finally arrived back to THEHotel around 4:45 PM to get our luggage and head to the airport. To our surprise, we found that our luggage and a number of other guests’ luggage were setting out behind the taxi stand and not in the baggage room. It was extremely hot on that date (June 2, 2006) reaching 104 F, and we had medicine and makeup in our bags that shouldn’t be in that temperature. So our baggage was in the heat and it didn’t seem particularly secured. After asking the bellhop why our luggage was out in the heat, I eventually spoke to the manager. He indicated that THEHotel had insufficient space for bag storage and that this was the best they could do. At one point he opened the door to show us his lack of space to discover in fact that there were plenty of empty shelves on which to store luggage. If I wasn’t upset, I would have laughed because it was pretty funny when he opened the door. We were finally given cash to cover damages to our medicine and my wife’s make-up. But it was a horrible way to have to leave Vegas after having to hassle with all of this. We both encouraged the manager to have his employees warn customers in the future that their luggage might be stored out in the open exposed to the temperature. I also wondered why the luggage was not moved into the luggage room as space became available. It seems like poor planning and/or training to me but maybe my expectations are too high. For a hotel that seems to pride it's self for being a swanky boutique hotel within all of the hustle of Vegas, I would have expected better guidelines for the handling of customer's luggage during a day that reached 104 degrees (F). The way they handled our luggage made us feel disrespected, especially considering how much we spent for the room. If you are looking for a suite, book the Venetian. The rooms are nicer and the location is superior. It is often available on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern suites”
Reviews.Author: NYCLady813
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay with friends memorial day weekend 2006. Suites have very modern rooms with flat screen TV. Large bathroom with huge tub and huge shower. The elevators had tv's in them that played advertisements about the resort. Rooms are very expensive. The rooms in this hotel were very far from the pool and activities. I would say at least 15 minute walk. Bring walking shoes. Service was good and rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as usual, great for couples”
Reviews.Author: dave9956
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is my favorite hotel in Vegas. Nice sized upscale rooms that are away from the casino. Excellent pool (a bit of a walk) and good food (room service and resturants). The buffet at Mandalay is excellent and overall pricing is a notch down from Bellagio and The Wynn. That said, this isn't a great place for kids. Kids are better at Mandalay (and would find a better value for families). The Hotel is a better fit for couples and singles. We enjoyed our stay. Check-in lines we fairly short, but I have seen them longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great for NY's”
Reviews.Author: wileySanDiego
Reviews.Content: What a treat to stay in Vegas without being hassled by slot machines and cocktail waitresses. Be sure to look at your room before you settle in. We had a nice view of the airport and parking lot and a broken vanity before we moved. Once settled, we were thrilled! Getting a cab was easy on not too pricey. The restaurant is amazing- great food and service! The spa is fabulous- be sure to allow time to soak and sauna.
