I think it's probably better for winter rather than summer visits b/c the spa is all indoors and dark and we didn't have to worry about wanting to use the pool. For summer, maybe try staying the 4 Seasons which has it's own pool (on the other wing of the Mandalay.) This is the only place on the strip I've been to where I'd actually return to stay. If you're considering a show, definitely see La Reve over O! as it's easier to get tickets and the staging is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Great Until we Tried to Go to the Pool”
Reviews.Author: LTC360
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on this site for a couple of weeks, I was very apprehensive about our stay at TheHotel. However, I have to say that everything went very smoothly. We arrived on Friday 5/26 (Memorial Day Weekend), right around 2:00 p.m.. There was quite a long line of people waiting to check in, but that was to be expected, and the 5 or so agents were moving quickly. Our check in was very smooth - they had the reservation, gave us our room (at 2..) and all was well. Frankly, we were prepared for them to tell us our room wouldn't be ready until 3 or 4, so we were pleasantly surprised. The rooms are absolutely wonderful! Definitely the highlight of the trip. They are well appointed, comfortable colors and beds, and definitely high end. We loved having the extra bathroom near the entry door, and thoroughly enjoyed the main bathtub and all of the wonderful toiletries. Maid service was prompt and thorough. We tipped the maid and she would leave extra toiletries in the room. TheHotel is very close to the casino, but very far from all of the restaurants and the pool at the Mandalay Bay. We ate at Rum Jungle one night. The food was good (not great)service was excellent and the drinks were outstanding. We also ate at the Border Grill - food, service and drinks were all excellent. We ended up getting muffins and fruit from the Starbucks in the casino area for breakfast, so I can't comment on the breakfast buffets. Our only complaint with this hotel was the pool, and this is the only reason that I rated TheHotel a 4 instead of a 5. Now, being Memorial Day weekend, we did expect it to be crowded. We went out at 10:00 a.m. on Sunday, and every chair around every pool was taken. It wasn't like people had thrown their towels on chairs and walked away - the people were in their chairs. A lady that we talked to said people were lined up at 8:00 and literally ran to their chairs as soon as the pool opened. My husband and I walked around for over 30 minutes trying to find a chair, but to no avail. We decided to grab a margarita from the outside restaurant, until we saw the prices. $12 for a margarita that comes out of one of those mixing machines. What a joke! We finally gave up and walked away, had lunch at the Border Grill and went shopping. When you are paying $300+ a night for a room, you should at least be able to enjoy the amenities of the hotel. The sad part was when we left the pool area around 11, there was a very long line of people waiting to get in. We just shook our heads in disgust. Like everyone else stated, the hotel is pretty far away from everything else. Yes, you can take trams and monorails and taxis, but if the ladies are wearing any type of shoe other than gym shoes, walking really isn't a good thing. My feet were destroyed by the end of the weekend. I think if we ever do get back to Las Vegas, we will stay towards the center of the strip - either Caesars, Paris or the Venetian. However, if you just want to stay in a nice hotel with a nice casino and not use the pool, I would definitely recommend TheHotel.

Reviews.Title: “Style before substance.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I arrived at 11am and tried to check in. We were told that our rooms weren't ready and that we should call every 20 minutes or so to check to see if things have changed -- 5 hours later and nothing had changed. Thankfully we had some other buddies that arrived the night before otherwise it would have been 5 hours roaming around after a 5 hour flight. We hung out in their room until our rooms became available. THE Hotel compensated by giving us a $100 room service comp -- pretty good. The Hotel looks gorgeuos. Everything from the lobby to the bedrooms and even the hallways look something out of a Crate & Barrel/Pottery Barn/Restoration Hardware catalog. Simply beautiful. The pool looked great but dont bother trying to get a chair, its almost impossible. Hundreds of people are in this area at all times. Its chaos. If your bringing small children I'd suggest a more " family friendly " place for swimming. THE Hotel seems to cater to the young adults. The party goers, the bachelor/bachlorette crowds stay here. This is why we had such a great time. The whole building seemed to be buzzing 24 hours......the vibe never died. Another great thing was RumJungle, the in-house nightclub and bar. After trying to get into popular clubs such as Rain, Pure, Tryst and Tao.......the RumJungle had them beat. Yes, we were hotel guests and got in easier but the music was better, the place looked great and there were so many beautiful women. It got crowded but nowhere near as crowded as some of the other places.......think sardines. Overall, I enjoyed my stay. The housekeeping could have used some improvement but the staff was polite and courteous and provided all of our requests. I'd defintely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Suites on the Strip - Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: TK_StackMoney
Reviews.Content: The Hotel at Mandalay is an all suite resort. The rooms are incredible, clean, and they have the best bath products. Also, don't listen to others you say, this is not a family friendly place. Kid's now stay free and with the Beach at Mandalay, the Shark Reef, and close proximation to kid activities at the Luxor, Excalibor, New York New York, and MGM Grand, this is the perfect place for families to stay. The extra half a bath in the suites are also vital for a family stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Room, But Not the Rest”
Reviews.Author: gibby214
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Hotel on a Sunday through Thursday in March. Positives: We liked our room a lot and had no problems with housekeeping like others on this site. Bathroom was terrific. HOB and Burger Bar get high marks. Negative: Sometimes no cabs were readily available (had to go to Mandalay Bay instead), check-in took far too long and restaurant options for breakfast are limited and dominated by convention attendees. Other: Unfortunately, the main pool area was closed while we were there. Mama Mia was just OK We'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but far from the pool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Here's my take on The Hotel at Mandalay Bay Rooms: Rooms were nice and big, decorated very modern and not much personality. The 3 Plasma T.V.s were great, and the D.V.D. player came in handy for children. The beds I have to say were very comfortable, and the bathrooms were nice and big. My biggest complaint is how dark the rooms are. The walls are painted dark chocolate brown, and the lighting is very minamal. Makeup was a challenge to put on. Service: Room service was expensive (like anywhere else in Vegas), but very efficient. The breakfast was brought in less then 40 minutes, and was quite good. Housekeeping was descent, although one day our room wasn't cleaned until 4pm. Location: The Hotel is located in a separate Tower from Mandalay Bay. It's located way too far from the pool area of Mandalay Bay. With children, this is their downfall. The Hotel needs a private pool located within walking distance, not so far where you need a taxi just to get there. This is the only reason why I would not stay here again. It was very difficult to first find the pool complex from our hotel, then to have to walk all the way back through the casino in our beach attire, with children, tired and wet. Also, the Wave Beach is not for children under 48 inches. The Tubes for the lazy river were $20.00. Honestly I truly enjoyed the pools better at the Mirage. There's more shade there, and they have slides for the kids. Overall I can honestly say that The Hotel is a nice hotel for conventioners, not for families. I will not stay here again, but can suggest it for singles.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FLMENCWA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thought "The Hotel" was very modern & unique. We enjoyed our stay. The room was large and clean. The bathroom was very clean. The bed was comfortable. We ordered room service.. the food was really good! We were happy. We waited about 10 min. in line to check in...and about the same for check out. The front desk was very nice and pleasant. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Love The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYGirl37
Reviews.Content: With over 40 nights a year at hotels around the country, The Hotel is by far, one of my favorites. It has a quite, classic elegance that is hard to find in Las Vegas. I've been partaking in an annual girls trip for four years. The Hotel at the Mandalay Bay is perfect for our trip. The rooms are large enough for 3 or 4 girls to share. The idea of two bathrooms per room is unheard of in most "rack" rooms. Three flat panel televisions, a refridgerator, the most comfortable beds ever, a huge tub, two sinks in the master bath, a separate water closet, lighted make-up mirror what more can you want? My only complaint is in regards to the lighting, it’s not bright enough in the bathroom, but you get used to it. The Mandalay Bay complex has something for everyone. The adjoining Luxor complex adds considerably to that mix. Yes, the pool is extremely crowded, yes the hordes of men and women can sometimes create an unsuitable environment for children. If you are traveling with children, perhaps the very little known Lagoon Pool, which is completely separate from the rest of the pool complex would be a better choice. The maid service arrives daily, usually when you are ready to take a nap, but they always offer to provide clean towels, etc. I would recommend the Spa at the Manadalay Bay over the Bathhouse Spa at the Hotel. The MB spa is larger and somewhat more feminine. The Bathhouse spa is sparse. The massage is expensive and both my friend and I were short changed by 5 minutes, which given the cost of the massage was annoying. I love this hotel. I love that there is no casino in this hotel, it is connected to the Mandalay Casino. I love the layout of the room. Every room is a two room suite. The hotel staff has always provided what was confirmed, check in/check out has never taken more than 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Love the rooms, but service is lousy!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kaykayram
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at TheHotel and I think the rooms are great, but not worth the hassle at check in. We arrived Friday 5/12 around 3:00 p.m. only to be told that our reservation is at Mandalay Bay and not TheHotel. I had called the week before to reconfirm everything and it was fine, so I did not bring any printed confirmation. After arguing for about 20 minutes with the very rude front desk clerk, I got out of line to go print the confirmation from my e-mail. When I produced the confirmation for TheHotel, they said my reservation was never put into their system. NOT MY PROBLEM! I was told I could stay at Mandalay for one night as they were sold out and then I could move over to TheHotel. I spoke to a manager and same story. The people next to us in line had one extra room and the clerk was not going to let them cancel the room without paying. They said they wanted to transfer their extra hotel room to us so we would have a room and they said it didn't work that way. I asked to speak to another manager and refused to move until they gave me a room. By this time we had been at the check in desk over an hour as had the group next to us and the line was probably 50 deep. I heard them telling other people that their reservations were not at TheHotel. Nobody was happy at the check in desk. I had conversations with numerous people who all had problems checking in. We finally got a room on a high floor with a nice view, but I had to fight for it for over an hour and it really put me in a bad mood. I think this hotel routinely overbooks and it is just not worth it to have to argue about your room reservation. Even though the rooms are very nice, I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay, but great if you like a dirty room!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After planning, reading numerous reviews and careful consideration we decided to stay at The Hotel. We were in town from May 14th - May17th for a convention and thought it would be a nice vacation. The photographs on the website are very accurate so what you see is what you get. The positives: 1. Room was very beautiful and spacious. Not our usual taste in decor but very nice all the same. 2. Having three televisions is very nice when traveling with children. The selection of channels are great. Have stayed in most of the hotels in vegas for over 15 years but have noticed that most tv channel selections are diminishing. There is also a dvd player for the plasma which we did not utilize. 3. The beds are comfortable. 4. Check in: we personally did not have any problems with check in or the staff. Our room was available even though we checked in about one hour earlier. I called the front desk to extend our check out time and did not encounter any problems, was accommodated with my request. 5. Swimming: we went to the pool around 3:00pm, had no problen finding a chair. The negatives: 1. The furniture in the room is not child-friendly. If you are traveling with very young children be cautious of the sharp corners on most of the furniture. There is plenty of glass and mirrors in the room. If your children are very active, you'll be worrying about their safety. 2. Housekeeping is very poor. You would expect by the high price you pay per night, housekeeping would be excellent, WRONG!! When housekeeping cleaned our room, they did the bare minimum. The did not clean the bathtub or vacuum the room. After seeing the room you'll notice that there is a lot of furniture to clean and dust but there is no excuse in not doing your job. This is a major no no in my book!! Not that it's a major offensive, but there was old gum in the carpet which no one had tried to get out. This attests to the getover mentality of some of the housekeeping!! 3. There were no robes in our room...not that I would use them but I certainly don't want to get a bill for something which was never there! 4. Swimming: there are many families who utilize the pool but a very raunchy, profane crowd tends to migrate to the lazy river pool. The life guards need to be more agressive when they see some drunk idiots spoiling the lazy river. Overall, the stay was ok. I will probably try the Wynn Hotel next time!!

Reviews.Title: “THE Hotel is A+”
Reviews.Author: LCarpenter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay for 3 nights in April. The rooms were amazing. Beautiful and large with a huge bathroom with a 2 person jacuzzi with seperate walk in shower. Also a half bath in the main entrance. Got a corner suite with views in two directions. The bed was heavenly and the flat TV's (2), decor, furniture and everything else was great. Be sure to eat at the Border Grill. Very good. Ask about the queso which is not on the menu. It is $14 and well worth it. Had we known it was so large we would have just ordered it alone. Tried the Burger Bar because of all of the reviews. Been there, done that ... would probably not go back. Stay away from the Bayside Buffet. If you want an excellent buffet take the tram that connects Mandalay Bay, Luxor and Excalibur and go to the Excalibur's Buffet. It was excellent. I only had two things that bothered me. There is no security keeping people off the elevators at THE Hotel. Anyone can go up there. I guess it is because you need to use them for the Mix. But after the restaurant closes they should have someone that keeps trespassers out. Also the House of Blues. Because of it's location right in the casino it would get very crowded in the evenings. Huge crowds milling around outside even when they could not get in. Not doing anything but drinking and waiting for the show to be over. Hanging all over the slot machines but not playing them. One night there was a young woman that couldn't even stand and she kept falling to the floor and people would just step over her. They need to have some type of crowd control. These two things would not keep me from staying there again. Just move to the other side of the casino to play.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Hype - Wynn or Hard Rock better and worth it”
Reviews.Author: keinwes97
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day stay here and weren't impressed. After reading several reviews, we went with an "open mind", hoped for the best and booked here. Here goes: The short - poor customer service skills of front desk staff leave a nasty taste/bad first impression.....no one seems to be able to check into the rooms they booked/paid for upon check-in and are given the same "scripted" please check back later speech. Managers aren't much better. Maid service is hit or miss, but bellmen and housekeeping are very responsive when you call to make a request for something. Most of the staff cuts you off and "yes's you to death w/ an insincere apology" so you can "go away" as quickly as possible. Will get far better service and check-in satisfaction at "old faithfuls" and newcomers like: Caesar's, Bellagio, Bally's/Paris, Wynn, Hard Rock etc... The Detailed version: 1) Arrived @ 12:30am on Wed Night/Thurs morning after flying for a total of 9 and 1/2 hours only to be told our room (King Suite) wasn't available. Only one other couple was being assisted by ONE OF TWO desk agents. The second agent made us wait (we timed it) for almost 5 minutes while he typed who knows what into the computer. When he decided to deal with us, we were told that our room wasn't available and that we'd have to stay in a Double bed suite. For the inconvience, he said he was going to upgrade us to a VIP suite on a higher floor with strip view. He instructed us not to get unpacked, assured us that the VIP suite was blocked so it wouldn't be unavailable later and to come back at 12 noon to be moved. As we were leaving we heard the other agent tell other guests the same thing and made the same "upgrade" promise. We returned at 1pm (decided to wait a little since check out is supposed to be at 11am) to inquire about our new room. This time - several agents and a long line of guests waiting to be checked in. We "lucked up" and got one of the most smug and condescending agents on staff. He acted as if we should be honored and priviledged to have a room at all. Instead of taking the time to read what was on the screen and listen to my explanation, he cut me off and inquired why we kept switching rooms. I explained that it wasn't by choice, but a result of the room we paid for not being available upon our check-in. Without apologizing, he stated "well, I do see the room that you are supposed to be moved to but it shows that housekeeping is there. I can't tell you how long they'll be so you're going to have to keep your room and try again later." Wrong answer! We explained that we were tired and wanted to get settled and be able to move on w/ the second leg of our vacation. When I asked for a manager, he instead offered to call the room and tell the housekeeper to expedite clean up and would call our room to let us know when the new room would be ready. 20 min later, we receive a call from him telling us to come down, skip the line and wait to speak w/ him and bring our luggage since he was switching us as we spoke. When we got to the "upgraded" room, it was filthy. The maid had begun to pull the sheets but nothing was changed or cleaned. Back to the desk again. This time different agent.....thankfully, this one was helpful and somewhat apologetic. She yes'd me to death in a tone that said "ok got it, now shut the f#$k up", informed me that we hadn't been upgraded as promised but sent to a regular King Bed suite that had a view of the strip...and offered to upgrade us to a VIP suite w/ a pool& garage view on a lower floor. When I asked about having a VIP Suite with a strip view, the response was (surprise) sorry but nothing's available. 2) Housekeeping - didn't come until very late afternoon early evening. Bed wasn't completely made, one of the complimentary bathrobes had a hole in the side and the belt loops were completely broken off.....did the bare basic cleaning (i.e., made bed, replaced towels and washcloths) but didn't organize things likes shoes and items on nightstand or coffee table at all. No biggie, there are worse offenses. 3) Pool - forget going. I've stayed at several other strip hotels with large/multiple pools and all provide more than enough (in some cases too many) chairs for guests. We were shocked that NO CHAIRS were available by 9:45am! It was insane. When we asked about the possibility of staff brining more the answer was "nope, what you see is what you get, sorry". 4) Shark Reef channel - a joke...the picture tended to be barely viewable...one minute it was extremely dark...majority of the time, too fuzzy and distorted to really appreciate. The Positives: A) The Bed - it was very hard for us to get up and get moving...the bed and linens were addictive....anytime we laid down we had to struggle to get back up. B) VIP Suite - the bedroom especially was wonderful! Very cozy, yet elegant and relaxing.....really loved the layout. C) Bell Staff - very attentive and helpful. Also Housekeeping arrived promptly after calling down for new bathrobe and laundry bags w/ price list. Summary - much better places for the same ball park price (or less) that are far more worth the money and stay. The front desk staff (mangers included) definitely need an attitude adjustment. In my several trips to the front desk, I overheard practically everyone being told the same "sorry but your room's not available, but check back later" schpeel and in tones that says "yeah get over it".

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous getaway”
Reviews.Author: kristirae
Reviews.Content: Just returned today (5/14/06) from a two night stay at THE HOTEL at Mandalay Bay. I had read the other reviews and must say I was a bit worried regarding the staff and the cleanliness of the hotel. It was PERFECT. Travelled with two other moms for mothers day weekend for a relaxing get away and it was everything we hoped for. We arrived at 9am on Friday to check in and were told (as we of course expected) that our room was not ready. We had spa appointments at The Bathhouse spa so said we'd check back. The front desk staff was very helpful and said to just call back in about two hours and our room should be ready. She gave us our keys so we could use the pool, told us what our room would be and helped us to check our bags. Went to the spa where, quite frankly, we spent nearly 8 hours of every day, just enjoying the tranquility. Called 2 hours later and our room was ready; we were in before noon. The suites are beautifully appointed and VERY clean. Also, very quiet. All of the staff at the spa, hotel and the restaurants were top notch. The only down side (and I expected this one) was how crowded the pools were. However, we still got chaises, even though we didn't go down to the pool until about 2 pm. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a very friendly vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the hotel at mandalay bay. Upon arrival at 2:30 p.m. we were told our room was not ready and to come back at 6 p.m. Check in time I believe is at 3 but we were told matter of factly to return later. After I complained that I need to change and had just gotten off a long flight, they offered our use of the bathhouse to shower. We had to retrieve our luggage from the bellhop and upon going to the bathhouse had to undergo an inquisition like we were using a bad credit card to go forward and use the shower area. We went to dinner at the hotel and after 6 pm I was again told that our room was not ready. I was apprehensive that the room would ever be ready but went out for the evening and finally checked in at 11 p.m. On the other days, I found my room not to be cleaned until 5 pm or so. I agree that the staff could use some customer service lessons and that the pool is too far away and hotel's attempt to get more money from you by making you walk into the casino in pool attire to access the pool is ridiculous. The pool chairs were all taken and on my last day, I did notice a huge line of guests waiting to enter the pool area at 10 a.m. It is definitely not a people friendly atmosphere. I also found there to be sufficient waitstaff for the vip's in the cabanas but not great service for the regular folks at poolside waiting for drinks. Overpriced warm beer did not go over too well either. I found the staff at other casinos to be much friendlier i.e. Paris and Venetian. Perhaps the hotel should take a good look at itself and make some management changes to make it more people friendly and hire sufficient staff to clean the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel first class”
Reviews.Author: DREAM99
Reviews.Content: Just returned from The Hotel at Mandalay Bay. Highly recommend this place. we stayed three nights, the casino was awesome you could not smell the smoke one bit. As for some others your eyes burnt pretty bad AHHH...Rio. The Hotel was clean as soon as you sat down the servers were there to take your drink order. We walked around alot to other hotels Bellagio, Caesars, MGM, New york New york, Monte Carlo and a few others and I would stay at The Hotel without a doubt. The other places were really crowed and overrated. whoever says that The Hotel is not a good place is just not happy. They have like 20 resturants to choose from for whatever you feel like eatin. Also, room service was prompt and the meals arrived with the table set with linen tablecloths and the food was kept hot until it was delivered in a heated box under the table. The pools are great you just have to wait in line from about 8:30-9:00am til it opens, then its a mad dash from hell to get a chair. but if ya got one it was nice. Valet service was very prompt and courteous every time. The Hotel had a more educated and cultured clientele than the heathens that seemed to be drunk and loud at all of the other hotels that I visited. And the people didn't wear flip flops and shorts to dinner or the shows. Our room was cleaned early in the day, not late in the evening like others have said. almost forgot the TVs 42 inch plasma in the LV 27 plasma in the BR and A 17 inch in the bathroom pretty cool. If your thinkin about it just do it...

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience at Mandalay Bay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This past weekend I stayed at Mandalay Bay to celebrate a friend's wedding. While we were at the wedding ceremony, cash and clothing were stolen from my suitcase. The hotel operations supervisor was unwilling to deal with situation. He stated that it would take 7-10 days for the issue to be resolved. Nobody apologized and nothing was offered to me to make my stay more pleasant. Instead, I spent hours dealing with the situation and was unable to fully celebrate my friend's marriage. Mandalay Bay demonstrated POOR customer service and their actions guarenteed that I will NEVER stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't plan on going to the pool”
Reviews.Author: islands traveler
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas on May 4th for 4 days. I picked the Mandalay Bay for several reasons, one was the pool. The pool had rave reviews. The reviews must have come from someone who never tried to use the pool. I thought we could sit by the pool during the day and read. I have never been to hotel where the pool is locked until 9:00 am and closed at 6:00pm. From my room I could see the pool. The line started at 8:00am waiting to get in the pool. My first day I thought this was strange. After eating breakfast we went to the pool and every chair was taken. There must be 900 chairs however each one had a towel or clothing draped on it. We sat on the cement. It soon became clear what was going on. Each chair was taken, but the guest had left the pool. I asked about this and was told if the chair was empty for an hour I could take the chair. This is the most absurd thing I ever heard. There were enough employees at the pool that they should have done thier job and moved the towels not leave it to guests. To me the easiest way to control this would be when you leave the pool area you tke you towel. If you don't you are charged. Mandalay Bay had no problem charging for everything else.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: travelsavy1
Reviews.Content: While travelling the world I have stayed at lodging ranging from five star hotels to tent rooms, along with a few Howard Johnson's. I love a nice room, but have found that good or bad customer service is a huge factor in wether or not your stay is pleasant. After all, your hotel becomes your home away from home when on vacation. The Good: Beautiful Rooms that are large, tastefully done with many amenities, lovely modern lobby, fantastic pools at the nearby Mandalay Bay Hotel and a casino that is nicer than most. The Bad: Pools are located away from the hotel, so guests have to walk through the Mandalay Bay casino in their pool clothing to get to the pool area. Not very far, but can seen that way after walking all day. The lazy river is really short and not that lazy, seemed to be full of kids and ran at a pretty fast pace the day we were there. Floats are too big for the river and cost $20 to rent. Take a look at the river before you decide to rent. TIP: you can buy a float at the small place that you rent floats from for only $15 (it's smaller, but just the right size). We bought one, but just threw it to the size, because it was easier to just body surf around. Also floats are not allowed in any of the other pools (including the wave pool), they will make you get out. The Ugly: Terrible Customer Service. They got everything wrong from the start. ignored all of our requests for specific types of rooms, i.e. king bed/no smoking (did'nt even acknowledge these requests). Gave us keys for rooms that when opened were still occupied, Twice this happened. Fed up, I called down on the hall phone and asked for a manager. They gave me just a supervisor, who said no other rooms were available (GIVE ME A BREAK, all casino's hold extra rooms for VIP's). After talking to another supervisor or front desk person for all I know, I was again told that no rooms were available. At this point I was really angry. I toted all my luggage down to the lobby and demanded to speak with a real manager, not just a supervisor. 15 minutes later I was in a VIP Suite with a great view of the strip. But, should guests really have to spend two hours checking in and practically beg for the room they reservered two months in advance? It took hours for me to calm down and get in a better mood. Not a great start to your vacation, especially when you're already tired from travelling! Housekeeping was also a problem: sometimes they didn't come until after 5PM and one day not at all (I'm not that messy, so it did'nt bother me that much, but still in this calliber of hotels, this should not even be an issue. Bottom Line: Because this hotel is so beautiful and great deals can be found, I might stay here again (that's a big might). I have a feeling that it is a hit or miss type of situation. I guess that if I do stay here again, I will have learned what to expect and take it in stride, or take lots of rum.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Bay!!”
Reviews.Author: TylerinTexas
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a quick 3 day trip where we stayed at Mandalay Bay. Must admit, was a little nervous, since most post here have not been to kind to the hotel. Glad to write that my wife and I had an excellent time (though short)! We arrived around noon, and check in was a breeze, only a couple of minutes waiting in the lobby. Checked into our room, 27th floor (fiji wing) with a tremedous view of the strip. Went down to grab a bite to eat, and although a huge convention just let out for lunch, the Resturant provided a pager for us to notify us when the table was ready, this gave us time to walk the grounds and have a cocktail. Service was good. My wife took a quick nap and I hit the poker room. Have to state that the poker room at Mandalay Bay is one the best run rooms on the strip. No wait time, friendly dealers and cocktail waitress were always present. That evening, we took in Mamma Mia (second time) and after the show, we went up to the 64th floor of TheHotel to the Mix Lounge. AWESOME view and service. Highly recommend it if you are looking for a nice drink and no young kids in the clubbing crowd. Next day, had breakfest at Raffel's cafe, again, very good service. Later, I asked the front desk for a Limo to pick up my wife and I for dinner at another hotel, and when we arrived downstairs, they had two color choices of limo's waiting for us. Check out was a breeze the next day. Must say, that we have stayed at the Venetian and Bellagio this past year, and the service and staff at Mandalay was excellent. Don't pay attention to the bad reviewers, they are probabley people that can never be satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but over-priced”
Reviews.Author: rachel2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay for 4 nights the end of April. Average cost per night around $350. We had a 1 bedroom suite. We liked the quietness of The Hotel--away from the casinos in the Mandalay Bay Resort next door. The bedroom had 2 queen beds, 3 large mirrors in the br; the sitting room has a sofa, an executive desk with fax/copier/scanner. Nice modern furniture in both rooms. The decor is also modern in dark/black colors. The bathroom in the bedroom is very large with separate shower and tub. There's an extra powder room in near room entrance. All stone countertops. There's a flat-screen TV in the masterbath so you can watch your fav. movies while soaking in the tub--which I found very nice. We had no pillowcase for 2 nights out of the 4. Housekeep didn't do a good job, there's hair on bathroom floors, not enough towels, not enough new shampoo/conditioner/soup, etc. We tried several of their restaurants/bars. Most of them are overpriced. Red-White-Blue offers stardarded American foods, your typical burgers, salards. The food is average however their portions are large. Speghetti with meatballs is very good around @$16, comes with large meatballs and heavenly garlic bread. Seafood is only so so. They also offer a kids menu. Service is good. The Raffles Buffet at TheHotel is nicer and better value compared to other restaurants here. We had champagne brunch on a weekend day. Very large varieties and quality hot/cold foods, including smoked salmon, cook-per-order omlettes, HUGE sized strawberries, etc. Fast service. The 2 cafes at the pool are ok, average food very overpriced. Three drinks plus a water cost us $28. Among the bars, we liked Rumjungle for its decor, good drinks there. House of Blues was not good at all, lousy music. The beach/pool area is large but always crowded. If you dont' get there before 9:30 am chances are you won't be able to get a beach chair. We had to tip the guy working there to get a chair. Since TheHotel is on the very south tip of the Strip, so it's kind of quiet at night. The free tram only takes you to the next door Luxor and Excaliber. After that it's long walks to MGM Grand or everywhere else if no taxi. Overall, we liked TheHotel. But since it's so overpriced we wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On the good side - the bed was unbelievably comfortable. Rooms were nice and bathrooms were good. The Hotel and Mandalay Bay don't have any offensive odor when you walk in like either smoke or The Venetian smelled like cheap bathroom spray. When you walk from The Hotel to Mandalay Bay everything is close and Luxor is nice too. The people are attractive, because its at the very end of the strip, you don't get the sightseers that are just walking through. Because the aisle are so wide, you don't really get the feeling of walking through a casino at Mandalay - I went the whole weekend without gambling. The pool areas and beach are great and the wave pool was too much fun even for a grown-up. Get there at 9 a.m. right when it opens, every seat will be taken by 10:30. Wolfgang Puck restaurant was awesome. Mamma Mia show was great. On the negative side, it was very noisy in the hallway during the day, mostly staff maids, room service carts, etc., hard to take a nap. The Hotel is very dark. The A/C was kind of hoisy, I turned off the one in the bedroom and just used the other one. The pool should have a non-smoking section. There is hardly any room between the lounge chairs and there were a lot of people smoking. All in all, this is the only place I would stay if I ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: GerMcManus
Reviews.Content: I happened to live in TheHotel for about 2 months due to work from Monday-Friday during Sep-Nov in 2004. I have to say I loved staying there, the staff were always very helpful and the rooms were always amazing, easily up there with the best I have ever stayed. Once or twice I did get a nonsmoking room that was apparent had been smoked in, due to the smell or the odd burn, but for the most part this hotel always lived up to what I expected. In my time staying there I must of had 10 different rooms and each time I entered each one I always felt totally comfortable. What I love about this hotel is that you do not hear the constant noise of slot machines, however, with a one minute walk you are smack in the middle of the Mandalay Bay casino floor. It is a little trek to the pool from The Hotel and after reading some more up-to-date reviews, it seems that the pool area is largely under construction, but in my time there it was great. Of all the hotels I have stayed in, in Las Vegas(there have been alot!), this is still my favorite and I always look to return there when I go to Vegas on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty Is Only Skin Deep”
Reviews.Author: tonikeb
Reviews.Content: The rooms are beautiful. They are quiet and loaded with amenities from 3 flat screen TV's in 2 separate rooms with 2 separate water closets to a doorbell for housekeeping to a beautifully oversized bathroom to a wonderfully comfortable bed. The bathtub was enormous and filled via a waterfall effect nozzle on the side. The rooms truly are suites and they're lovely. And that is all the good I have to say about THEhotel at Mandalay Bay. It started badly when I pulled up to the valet service, had to unload my bags myself (I'm not a big girl and I arrived solo), schlep them into the hotel myself (is there a bell desk anywhere at this hotel??), and had to ask a custodial worker (!?) where the heck the lobby was/is. No one had pointed me in any direction from the valet "service" and the signage is practically non-existent in the lobby area, which is keeping with the austere aura of THEhotel but not helpful to guests trying to get somewhere. After being directed to go past the "Coffee Bar" sign (go figure), I found the front desk or more accurately, I found the line for the front desk. I was treated to standing in the most ridiculous cattle call of a check-in line anywhere, anytime. The person behind me in our 25 minute check-in line (no joke and this was @ 9:45 p.m. last Thursday night) became enraged and collared every hotel worker she could find until she got her grips on the hotel manager. The hotel manager, in the lobby, in front of a line-up of us weary new arrivals actually said, "Yes, we're understaffed." And it even gets better... The hotel manager then disappeared (!) behind a wall at the rear of the barren front desk, not even attempting to help alleviate the check-in line personally. Other highlights include: 1. Whenever we called anywhere within the hotel, the average rings to pick up were 11. We truly counted because it was so mind boggling and, sadly, became a source of twisted amusement for us. 2. One of our room card keys became de-magnetized and needed to be replaced. The person assisting us casually asked how we were enjoying our stay. Our response was a genuine, "Not much so far" to which the worker responded with a shrug. A SHRUG? Either the employee had received z e r o training in customer service or had heard that response so many times before her shrug was a nervous reflex response. 3. There is no evening turndown service. There were never enough towels left with the once-daily regular housekeeping service. 4. Three (3) people working at the in-house Starbucks on Sunday morning. Six times (6x) that many people in line. 5. On the last night of our stay, we got back to our room only to find that there were no pillowcases at all on our pillows when we turned down our bed. After calling housekeeping, someone showed up with a couple of pillowcases but did not offer to put the pillowcases on the pillows (which, of course, we would've declined but not to offer?), much less did they not even offer an apology. They handed the pillowcases over to us and fled without a word. Finally, we left using the Express Check-out (little box by the elevators) because catching a look at the very, very scary line stuck waiting at the front desk on Sunday morning (while we were stuck in line at Starbucks) would make anyone never want to attempt a run at that front desk again and hope to catch their flight on time. However, since no initial bill was slipped under our room door for us to preview (??) we checked a box on the Express Check-out envelope requesting a copy of our bill to be mailed. I wonder how long it will take until that copy arrives... Take a cue from the person who brought us those missing pillowcases, flee from the abject lack of service at THEhotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel at Mandalay Bay worked very well for us”
Reviews.Author: youngerbrother
Reviews.Content: The Hotel at Mandalay Bay worked very well for us for a 4 night stay in late April. We had a rental car and the valet pick up area is convenient and very close to the lobby and elevators. Never a long wait to get the car. There was never a cab line and it is equally convenient. This was true even though the hotel was sold out. Some reviews described the hotel as being quite a walk from the main casino. Actually seemed very close and have walked longer distances from casino to hotel rooms at other resorts. It is just far enough though to be a quiet place to escape to. We thought the lobby area was beautiful, very modern, unusual. Didn’t find anything cold about it as some reviews have stated. Great lobby bar, quieter type place to relax and people watch. Our suite was very clean and the maid service was excellent, although sometimes was well into the afternoon before we received service. I’m sure they take care of rooms of guests that are checking out first. All staff were pleasant and eager to please. Had a couple of small problems - light bulb out and couldn’t get the printer to work. Everything corrected very quickly. Luggage delivery and pick up was very fast. Anytime we called the operator or front desk with a question, we received quick informative answers. But, with 1100 rooms, don’t expect boutique type service. Had a great view, corner room on 30th floor. Décor is a little strange and dark, but very comfortable, upscale. Excellent bed. Would say this is one of the better priced suites in Vegas that is actually 2 rooms. The 2 rooms and extra powder room gave us great privacy and convenience. I could have my coffee without disturbing my mate who slept longer. The café-coffee shop in the lobby had great food and service. Prices not bad compared to other places in the resort. We had a couple meals there. Also enjoyed take out from Red White and Blue. Burger Bar ok, nothing special, over priced. Drink prices at MB seemed higher than everywhere else. $8.50 mixed drink and $6 bottle beer. Ouch. Pool area is a long walk to get to. Very crowded and had to get there early to get a chair. But very enjoyable and great service there also. Although at the end of the strip, the tram makes it convenient to all south strip casinos.

Reviews.Title: “You can do much better for the money in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: RollingOut
Reviews.Content: Because almost ALL Vegas resort hotels on the strip are a notch or 10 above what we're all used to, I feel I need to start out by putting an important fact into perspective. Let's face it, compared to hotels in most places the resort hotels in Vegas are in another class. If you have never been to Vegas and you stay at the Mandalay Bay, you will find it to be fabulous. In fact you will probably find ALL of the resort hotels to be fabulous if you've never stayed in Vegas before and are comparing them to "normal" hotels. But they're NOT normal hotels and we expect more when we shell out big bucks and pick our hotel. And in Las Vegas we can easily find great hotels. Vegas is home to many world class hotels. Unfortunately Manadalay has forgotten what made it successful. I'm not going to go into all of the reasons why I say that because I think many of the other reviewers have already pointed them out. Suffice it to say that I agree with the reviewers who were disappointed. When you go to Vegas, you're going to spend some serious cash. You have every right lto expect world class service and accomodations. You WILL pay for it. Mandalay is a nice resort. But I think it has seen its better days and that its management seems content to let it ride on its past glory. The point is you can do much better. I have stayed at many resorts in Vegas. While I have not stayed at Red Rock or Wynn yet. I have stayed at many including the Venetian and Bellagio and they are clearly a couple notches above Mandalay in many ways. Bottom line, I decided at the last minute to go to Vegas last week. I tried Bellagio, Venetian, Red Rock, Wynn and a couple others. All of them were booked. I called Mandalay and surprise! they had rooms available. I guess that little fact says it best. Maybe they will start paying attention. By the end of your stay you likely will have spent a small fortune and I think you deserve to go home with a feeling that your money was well spent, at least most of it. Your hotel bill will be considerable. I don't believe Mandalay is worth it anymore and I think you can do much better for your money at one of the hotels I mentioned earlier. Anyway, Vegas is a non-stop good time. You probably will have tons of fun no matter where you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gone Downhill - Fast”
Reviews.Author: LondonRover
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Hotel only last August, and loved every minute of it. This time I could not believe the change. The valet parking guy on checkin was abrupt, unfriendly and not helpfull. Check in was fine, although we were given a suite overlooking the pool and airport - not a problem for me as 50% of us have to accept this view - although I did book and pay for the suite over 3 months ago and told them at the time of booking that we were here to celebrate my 40th birthday and would like a strip view. I also thought that as I had paid for 5 days they would at least acknowledge my birthday - not a mention (unlike the Venetian where we stayed for the last 2 days of our week, who wished me a happy birthday and upgraded the suite). Then the problems. It turned out that I had picked up the wrong case from the airport - my fault 100% not the Hotel. However when I asked the front desk for the concierge to help me contact the airport/airline I was told there was no concierge. I asked if they could help me track down my luggage. Reluctantly they offered to find me the number for the airport. After 20 minutes waiting they came back with a number - turned out to be a fax number. Then came back with another number - which was wrong. They were so unfriendly and unhelpful I ended up logging onto the internet to find the correct numbers. People - this hotel only cares about filling up the rooms and $ - not personal service. The pool area is a joke - by 11.00am there was not a seat to be had anywhere - at $399 a night I would have liked a seat - however with the number of rooms and the hotel being fully booked - this will occur. The casino floor is as good as any in Vegas and the bands at the bar areas in the evenings are superb. The restuarants are excellent, the House of Blues is good also, especially on a Friday night, but this was my only plus point. If you are young at heart, trendy and know what you want this is the place, but if you actually need anything that you would expect from a 5 star hotel, even taking into account this is Vegas, give this hotel a miss - it is too far up it's own arse these days. I cannot beleive how unfriendly the majority of staff have become and how much the persuit of $ over service shines through.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MarcDoesVegas
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Mandalay Bay and must say that is a fun place to do Vegas. I had never stayed at THEHotel so recently I booked it for a business trip. What a let down! I had read awesome review after review and can only think these people are comparing it to 2 and 3 star hotels. The lobby / registration area is about as cold and sterile feeling as a hospital. I stood in line for 20 minutes while the 2 guys behind the counter yuk'd it up about the artwork painted on the wall behind them. Despite my reservation and my pleads with the guy they gave me a smoking room. The room was dusty - dingy and very cramped feeling. The beds were very worn to be a semi-new hotel. There was no doubt I was in a smoking room! I gambled a little and went to bed. The next morning I unrolled and spread out my bath matt ready for my shower and kicked up a cloud of black hair one might expect to find in a hair salon! Obviously my bathroom had been cleaned with the same care that the rest of my room was. I immediately called the front desk and expressed my concerns. While the girl on the phone was nice enough it was pretty clear she was not overly concerned with my complaint. I checked out and went to the Wynn for the rest of my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 days, from 12-17 April, with my hubby. Positive points: Check-in: Check-in was swift. As requested, we got a King size bed, non-smoking room with partial strip view on the 29th Floor. Staff was polite and courteous. Those who are worried about the lack of casino, it is literally 2 mins walk away. It is also connected to Luxor via walkway (less tham 5 mins walk) which is very handy as Luxor has some nice shops and a food court. Food: We had buffet at Mandalay Bay and Luxor. Although it is pricier at Mandalay Bay, food and choice is better and definitely worth an extra $4. Also ate at the Burger Bar. Suite: Rooms are very well decorated with neutral colours. Bed is quite comfortable. Bathroom and bathtub are huge. There is even an extra toilet. All the toiletries are replenished everyday. Three TVs is a nice touch. The Mix: Went to the Mix on the 64th floor for drinks to celebrate my birthday. You have to dress smart even for a few drinks. Drinks are very very pricey............but worth it when you see the view. Our flight back was late at night, therefore we requested a late check-out. We were allowed to check-out at 1 pm (usual time 11 am) without any extra cost. Negative Points: The hotel and room are very cold. They keep the air-con at full at all times. It was 88F outside and freezing inside. I had to carry a jacket inside the hotel. We were charged $102 for bar when we hadn't even opened it. One call to the front desk rectified their mistake............so keep an eye on your bill via the tv services. Mandalay Bay is the last hotel on the strip. But the hotel has a free tram (monorail) service that runs every 10 mins and takes you to Luxor and Excalibur. I would highly recommend that otherwise it is a very long walk to get to the main part of the strip. Overall: I would stay here again if I get a good deal otherwise I would like to be more central next time.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed opinions about The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights (two adults, two children) in a two queen bed suite on the 37th floor facing the airport. First impressions: helpful bellhops, quick check-in, beautiful lobby and room decor, great view, wonderful amenities (i.e., Plasma or Flatscreen TV in each room, DVD player, toiletries, safe, wetbar). We really liked the layout of the rooms, especially the bathroom (big tub and shower; dual sinks; 13" flat screen TV). Never had to wait long for the elevator, especially during peak times. Things that we noticed during our stay: 1. DVD player in the room didn't initially work. It was fixed within a couple of hours. 2. Tub had a nice faucet, but a very, very, very slow drain. 3. Couch in the living room fit the decor beautifully, but was uncomfortable to sit on after a while. 4. Shower was nice and roomy, but hot water kept going in and out. At times, the water would be warm and then the next minute, ice cold. 5. Rooms were a bit dark at night even when all the lights were on. Maybe just a function of the decor. 6. We came back to the room around 2PM to freshen up and found the room not yet made up. We called Housekeeping before we took off for the afternoon asking them to clean our room (they said someone would up within the hour) and when we returned at 6:30PM to put the kids to bed, the room was still not made up. Immediately called Housekeeping, asking them to send someone up (they said they would send someone right away) and no one ever came. We ended up changing the sheets on the beds ourselves and dumping the trash into a big garbage bag we had with us. Housekeeping was quick about sending someone to give us towels and extra sheets, though. 7. We checked out using the system on the TV, and there was an option to have our bill printed via the fax that was in the room. The fax didn't work. Bottom line: The Hotel is beautiful and from appearances seems to be first rate, but looks can be deceiving. An okay stay, but not enough for us to be repeat customers.

Reviews.Title: “Coldest Hotel in the Country - Cold Service, Atmosphere and Service”
Reviews.Author: vaznayak
Reviews.Content: I'm staying at the hotel as I write this review - the experience thus far has been so substandard, that I feel compelled to write this even before I check out. Let me start off with saying that I've stayed at most of the top resorts in Vegas including the regular Mandalay Bay. I am also used to staying in higher quality hotels globally. THE hotel at Mandalay Bay is a hotel trying a bit to hard to be NY or LA chic. The decor is in stark contrast to the Mandalay Bay. What is amusing is how hard most of the clientile is trying to fit into the ambience of the hotel. Overall, this is the draughtist hotel I've every stayed at. The corridors, lobbies, walkways, etc. are all draughty - not the situation at the other hotels/resorts I've been to during this stay. The staff is impersonal and bordering on rude. In a touristy city like Vegas, where staff is usually friendly and supportive, the quality of serevice at this hotel seem to stick out like a sore thumb. When I checked in at 1 pm, I asked if I had a choice or rooms or views. I was told in no uncertain terms that I was lucky to even get a room that early in the day. The guy behind the counter actually informed me that there was only 1 room available and made it sound like he had won an Olympic gold medal by grabbing that room for me before anyone else got it. I will, however, add that housekeeping has been prompt to deliver anything I've requested. Room service food has actually been pretty good...... but the whole 'impersonal'/cold nature of this hotel is one I don't really care for. I'm sure there are folks who seek out hotels like this one, but I for one, ain't coming back to this hotel any time soon. I'd rather stay at a smaller room in the regular Mandalay Bay than stay in a suite at THE hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: FEBTRIP46
Reviews.Content: THE Hotel was fantastic. All of the pools are open, there are no bulldozers. The rooms are overthetop. No casino is lobby, so no late night gambling urges. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Pool is now open.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Contrary to other opinions, the full beach is now open at Mandalay Bay/THEhotel at Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay here! There is No Pool Available!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel at Mandalay Bay is definitely very nice looking, but i was greatly disapointed in my stay. First of all, Mandalay goes to great lengths to advertise " the best pools in vegas". Mandalay Beach, the Wave Pool & the Lazy River are all heavily featured on the Mandalay website. However, what they fail to tell you, is that NONE OF THEM are open, nor are they expected to be for at least 2 more months! These pools have been closed since novemeber and were supposed to reopen in mid-april but mandalay employees admitted to me that they are not expected to reopen until at least june. There are bulldozers and construction everywhere, so i'm sure they won't be open for some time. What they have available are 2 pools, each approximately the size of the pool in my backyard. At each pool they had about 50-75 chairs available. That makes a grand total of about 100-150 chairs for a hotel holding thousands of people. There were more people laying on the cement around the pool than there were on chairs. Everybody was furious. How dare you not tell your guests that you have none of the pools available including those advertised on THE FRONT PAGE of your website?! Common courteousy demands that you tell a guest paying more than $300 a night for a room that there will be no pool available, especially when you are a hotel in the middle of the desert! The Mandalay did no such thing. This hotel is so pretenious and full of itself that i guess it's attitude toward it's customers should not surprise you. The pool is just one example of this hotels total disregard for it's customers. If you're looking for a nicer place with cool nightlife do yourself a favor and stay at the Bellagio or Venetian and save your self about $100 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, Extremely Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a seasoned traveler, for both business and pleasure, it takes a lot of guest abuse to get me steamed. But I have to admit that my recent experience at THEHotel was one of the worst hotel stays I've had in a while. Granted, the all-suite "W" wannabe breaks the mold for Vegas, and overall the atmosphere and rooms are tres chic. But the customer service, especially housekeeping, is among the worst I've ever experience at ANY hotel at ANY price (let alone a “high luxury” property). Check in time is 2pm. So when I arrived at 130pm after a long flight, I was not expecting to get a room. But the desk informed me that housekeeping has "until 6pm" to clean rooms and most likely, that's when my room would be ready. I balked, and asked if there was a room a could have sooner. Yes, I was told, but it was a "VIP" non smoking suite for $40 more a night. Fine, I said, and they told me it would be ready by 3pm. So I checked my bags and got a bite to eat. At 3pm, the room still wasn't ready, but the desk told me I could drop my bags in it so I could change and freshen up. When I got to the room, it was not only not cleaned, but totally trashed with cigarette butts everywhere. Back to the desk I went, and told them I didn't want the “non smoking” room and to please give me a regular suite. OK, but gruff, was the desk, and the new room would be clean until 4pm. Now, I'm really getting steamed. 430pm comes and the new room still isn't clean. At this point, I drop my bags anyway and go to the bar. Needless to say, the room wasn't cleaned until 530pm. And then, NO ROBES were in the room for my shower. The next day, I was up early for business and left the room at 830am. Housekeeping was directly across the hall and I gave her a few dollars and asked her to clean my room next. When I got back at 11am, it wasn't clean, and even after complaining, it still didn't get cleaned until 4pm. And this time only one robe, not two, were replaced. On the following day, I specifically called housekeeping to have an "early" cleaning, and they still didn't clean the room until 2pm. And turn down service is by request only - something that's standard in most luxury hotels. On the last day, I ordered simple room service breakfast - coffee, juice and a bagel. On the menu, the cream cheese on the side was a whopping $2.00, so I told them just send it up dry. Sure enough, I got the $2.00 small dollop of cream cheese I didn’t order when they delivered my breakfast. For $349 dollars a night, even in Vegas, all of this was a pattern of not only pathetic, but unapologetic customer service. So I complained, for the umpteenth time, to the front desk, to get my room cleaned early for my final day. I told them my total dissatisfaction with my stay to that point, listing every blow-by-blow mess-up so they could understand my frustration. In the end, they took a paltry few dollars off my folio for "inconvenience". My advice - THEHotel is in the cellar of not just Vegas, but the entire luxury category when it comes to customer service (or lack there of). Stay somewhere else if you want to be pampered and treated well. Hospitality begins and ends with housekeeping –it’s table stakes in the hotel industry. I don’t care if it is Vegas – poor housekeeping is a reflection of poor hotel management and poor guest relations.

Reviews.Title: “New style Vegas High-End Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: audioguy
Reviews.Content: What a great way to spend a weekend! First of all, let me start by saying I stayed here with some close friends for a Batchlor party weekend. We wanted a high-end "hip" hotel for the activities and got more than we expected. Location was great, very close to the airport. A 15 minute limo ride is all it takes once you land. Nice after a 5 hour flight from Philadelphia. "The Hotel" is at the end of the strip incorporated with the Mandalay Bay. "The Hotel" is great for the traveller seeking top quality rooms and service. From the moment we were greeted at "The Hotel" till the time we left the service was excellent. "No" was not in the vocabulary of anyone we encountered. The decor in the hotel is definately upscale metropolitan. Tons of granite and marble. Dark rich browns and excellent lighting gives a warm feeling. Fresh, gigantic cali lillies all over the place. Our suite was large with 2 bathrooms and 3 plasma televisions! Now dont get me wrong.. it is pricy aprox 700.00 per night. Definately on the High-end... but hey, it's Vegas! What you do get is top quality bedding, super comfortable. Great huge showers with actually quite nice soaps and lotions. There was a huge soaking tub fit for at least 3 to 4 people... trust us on that! We had a great wet bar for entertaining. "The Hotel" being attached to Mandalay Bay is very convenient to the strip. There is a monorail that goes right to New York New York casino hotel and other hot spots. The casino floors are large and offer plenty of tables for all levels of play. We checked out the spa and salon.. again top notch... but pricey. Massage was 140.00 plus tip for 50 minutes. Worth every penny. We didnt eat at the restraunts but the hotel has many to choose from. All in all, a great getaway for couples and small groups wanting to feel like a million bucks!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: brny
Reviews.Content: My first time in Vegas (3/05), I stayed at Mandalay Bay. I loved it! Location is ok but it's alittle futher than the other's. Bring your walking shoes! Rooms were very nice. Price was reasonable for value. Staff was very friendly. Hotel bars/rest. were very good. Pool area was great, esp the sand. Fish/shark attraction on lower level was a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay, Jan 2006”
Reviews.Author: Anon_Texas
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in our mid-30s travelling without children. Our room had a nice view of the Luxor hotel and was cleaned very well daily. Staff at the hotel were very good and friendly. The hotel itself is far from everything else on the Strip - a fact we were aware of prior to the trip - but did not realize the actual distance until we got there. For example, it was quite a trek to get to the indoor monorail to go two hotels, followed by a brisk jaunt to get to anywhere. The best part of "The Hotel" was the 2 bathrooms. The worst part of the trip was the Burger Bar restaurant. We were seated and had not even said anything. The waiter comes by and slams two menu's down before walking off! We left and went to the House of Blues which was far more pleasant. BTW, Emeril's and Bobby Flay's place at Ceasars Palace were excellent. Overall, we would stay someplace else on a return trip solely due to the distance from the middle of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_SnobinSeattle
Reviews.Content: The not so good: Very expensive, for all the extra's you have to pay for - the gym is $20; the spa (which includes the gym) is $30 (but both included with a spa service -- 50 minute massage - $150); No coffee in the room (Starbucks in the lobby - for $2+ for just coffee); $12 for daily internet. We were first given a room facing West (away from the strip and hills). First call, we were told THEhotel didn't really have decent views. I called again - we were given a room facing the strip. Truth is - THEhotel Strip-facing rooms face LUXOR and MandalayBay hotel, BUT you can still see much and parts of the strip over them. It's better, so request it, but you need to be over 25 stories. The gym is annoyingly dark. A nice hotel gym, but really, poorly lit. First day- we made 3 calls to get our in-room bathrobes (not in our hotel room) - they finally came late that night. No pool - you have access to and can use Mandalay Bay's pool(s), with all of the Mandalay Bay guests. The Good: Excellent decor in the rooms; spacious; nicely done lobby; Starbucks in the lobby; lobby away from the gaming (with easy access down a corridor if you want it); Excellent bar and view on top Floor (TheMix) - go for a drink at least; The Excellent: Awesome bathroom and bathtub (fits two comfortably) w/ TV in the room; plasma TVs; The Spa ("Bathhouse") even at $30 is one of the best I've been to - well organized, spacious - hotspa, cold plunge, steam room; dry spa; sitting and reading area with healthy foods; The cafe breakfasts are great, and you can make requests that are honored. Overall - this is a hotel trying to be a "W" with a Vegas twist. It's dark (not well lit) and all furnishings and lobby are mod. This gets a Neutral because of the extra expenses for an already expensive hotel, and no private pool. Would I stay again? Yes, without complaint My next time? --- I'll probably select the Four Seasons -- it has it's own pool area, and I can still use THEhotel spa services for a day!

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AGSicilyBound
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were on our 15th wedding anniversary, which also coincided with both our birthday's. So we were looking to mark the occassion by doing something a little special for five days. We stayed in Vegas a few years ago on a family touring vacation through California, Nevada,Pheonix etc and we were so impressed that we decided then that just the two of us would return next time. We chose THE hotel at the mandalay bay resort based on it's unrivalled simplicity and minimalist decor. Having visited the Bellagio on our last trip we felt it a little too copious or superfluous for our liking. The staff at THE hotel were extremely freindly, courteous and efficient. For example despite our room not being ready on arrival we were immediately given the option of moving to another room overlooking 'The Strip'and were also given $100 credit on the room for our inconvenience. The rooms are reputed to be the most spacious in Las Vegas and we believe this may quite possibly be true. Very well designed with an eye for detail. As another reviewer has pointed out however there is a fair amount of renovation being carried out around the pool areas. Had we been visiting during the warmer weather it would have been a major disappointment.Though to be fair there is so much else to do this did not adversely effect our stay too much. In short this is a first class hotel and is definitively worth your hard earned cash.

Reviews.Title: “The Real Deal”
Reviews.Author: mhellman
Reviews.Content: Excellent experience at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay. Just great. I am sort of a travel snob and found nothing to fault. There are some significant pros to staying at this Hotel. The cons are less important. I'll start with them. CONS The only real con is that there is not a spectacular lobby. The main entrance is through an indoor parking garage. The first impression was pretty weak, but it only got better from there. PROS (I will stick to the stuff that matters) The main lobby. As I stated above, I was not impressed at first. However, the fairly intimate lobby has a great lounge and coffee bar. Very comfortable when meeting friends. Also, the lobby is only about 100 yards from the Casino. I was concerned about how far a walk it would be to the casino. You need not be. It's reaaly convenient. The Spa is first class. Really great. Go for the 1 1/2 hour massage. The extra 1/2 hour makes a difference. Restaurants - You can stay here for a week and never repeat a restaurant. The Burger Bar in Mandalay Place has some of the best burgers I've ever had. Try the angus burger with a fried egg and bacon. You won't be sorry. The Rooms - Probably the best part of the stay ws the actual suites. Every amenity you could need. Three flat screen TV's, internet, fax machine, designer tioletries, robes, slippers, etc. and extremely comfortable beds. Go to THE Hotel. Guaranteed to be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “The best hip metropolitan design hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been to many hip design hotels from Asia, Europe, & the states. But so far, i can say theHotel at Mandalay Bay in Las Vegas is the best. The best price u pay for the services & designs u get. I stayed at the regular King Suite & also the VIP Suite. They both have the same design, the VIP suite just has more space with a panoramic view. I would recommend a simple King Suite would be enough unless u want to pay extra $200 for the same design a night. The regular King Suite is about $200 a night depends on which day of the week. But the room is fully loaded, from bathroom amenities, flat screen TV in the living & the bathroom, a wide working desk with internet access and fax machine in your room, u pretty much can move your office to there & still feels like home at the same time. The decor of the room is very comfortable & nicely blended every furniture together. & the staffs are wonderfully well-mannered. From the moment that u walked to the front desk, till the time u leave the hotel, u will definitely feel your money well spent. Please make sure u stop by the SPA on the second floor. For $30 a day, u can have all the access to different facilities in the SPA including the gym. After a long night of partying, SPA on the second floor is definitely the best place to relax. The food from the room service is excellent too. All i can say is, u have to experience it yourself in order to differentiate a good design total package hotel other than those so-called hip hotel but lack of good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Conference”
Reviews.Author: NorthernAlbertaChuck
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference. I would have to say that I have no complaints about the hotel. Food was excellent and a bargain at the Bayside Buffet. The Mexican place was good too. One night some drunk was noisy in the hallway but overall it was quiet. The pool was awesome. But I would think it could get very crowded in the peak season. The sandy beach area needs to be cleaned more - cigarette butts everywhere. At $200/night this was considered a "deal" but my company paid for it. I have stayed at the MGM before and thought that place was fine at 3/4 the price. But Mandalay Bay was an obvious step up from the MGM. While I have no complaints I wasn't completely blown away. But I don't think I was ripped off at all. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: CindyYZ
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at most of the major hotels in Vegas including Venetian, Bellagio, Mirage, MGM Grand, and the regular Mandalay Bay. None of them comes close to THEHotel. The rooms were comfortable, spacious, and trendy. I loved the contemporary decor with 3 flat screen/plasma TV's in the room. This rivals the cool vibe of some of the finest boutique hotels in Miami. The spa called Bathhouse is also superb. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: My_Review
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel when it first opened. It was an all suite hotel so you can't go wrong with this place. This hotel was very contemporary in design. It had flat screen TVs in all the rooms, including the bathroom. It had all the amenities and then some. The bar area was great except it was a little quiet for a Las Vegas bar. Cons: The first time you walk into the hotel lobby it was confusing. The reservation desk was kind of obscure. My husband had to wave me over so that we can check in. The staff wasn't really memorable. They were average at best. The food at the mini restaurant near the lobby was okay. The desserts were kind of dry for the price. The last thing I want to gripe about is when I bought some bandages, for my blisters (from walking all day); they were the worst bandages ever. They would not stay put on my feet. So I had to buy more and the same thing happened. They were not a name brand bandages they were in some clear plastic no name container. (Go figure) The other bad thing about this hotel is the location. It is all the way at the other end of the strip. You have to take a $12 taxi ride to the other end of the strip. However, all in all I would stay here again because of the rooms. They are so comfortable and very luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Is there any better?”
Reviews.Author: jfromct
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vegas, stayed at TheHotel from 3/2-3/6. Arrived 6pm asked for a corner room with a view, was honored without a problem. No $20 trick needed here. Room was on the 7th floor (7-916) with a view of the Luxor and the Rio off in the distance. Excellent room, from the bed to the tele's, to the bank of windows in the bedroom simply unbelievable. How anyone could complain about this hotel is beyond me. The Mix was great. We had dinner there on Thursday night. We sat on the patio with a view of the MGM and most of the strip. Thought it would be cold but they moved a heat lamp close by and that did the trick. The view from the lounge is incredible. I suggest whether you stay here or not to check out the lounge to see the view. The casino is a short walk down the hall from TheHotel, pretty good size with all the games available. We were there on the weekend and the stakes are pretty high at night, but during the day you could find $10 tables everywhere. Mandalay Bay has all that you need, we found no reason to leave the property while we were there. Shopping, Food, Nightlife all there and quite enjoyable. All in All this is a fabulous place and I will personally guarantee that you will enjoy your stay... :+)

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best in LV at THEhotel”
Reviews.Author: Redheada
Reviews.Content: I arrived on a Saturday at 9am. Right when my plane landed, I received a call from the Spa canceling my previously scheduled appt. due to therapists calling in sick (it was later rescheduled). I used this to my advantage when I checked in. There were not going to let me check in for 2 more hours, but were very nice and accommodating after they heard about my schedule change. They gave us a mid-level V (corner) suite which was perfect. Check in was quick and painless. The overall decor of the hotel is deep and dark with wonderful lighting. I loved it, but I can see how it may not fit into everyone's taste. We loved our room. The corner suites are slightly bigger than the other rooms with a larger bedroom. I think they have one added view window in the bedroom. We loved it and had a dual view of both the back side of the strip (view of the RIO and Palms) and then the front view between Luxor and Mandalay. The room was amazing. We loved the décor, the lighting, the 2 bathrooms, the bathtub which was huge, the plasma tv’s (especially the shark reef channel), THEbath products, all were wonderful. I like this room better than any other hotel room I have stayed in to date in Vegas (and many other locations). Tipped housekeeping and they left a generous amount of bath products for us to take home. Overall A+ Bathhouse Spa: I have a mixed review of this spa. Following the original cancellation of my 80 mins massage, they were able to get me rescheduled for the same time for a 50 min massage. They also gave me an additional discount. My service was wonderful and I loved my therapist. The spa itself left much to be desired. Although I loved the deep, dark colors and designs of THEhotel, I cannot say my reaction was the same for the spa. I prefer warmth and comfort and it was very dark and cold in décor to me. The couches and lounges were not very comfortable, although many people were passed out sleeping on them so they couldn’t be that bad. It was also a very confusing layout, and without someone giving you a map of the spa, it was very difficult figuring out where all the pools, spas, steam and sauna rooms were located. I eventually found them, but it took some work on my part. The eucalyptus steam room was way tooo steamy and way too much eucalyptus. So I couldn’t really enjoy that. They did have plenty of water, fruit, nuts and teas for clients. My preference next time would be to go to Mandalay spa, which both my husband and myself felt we liked better. Overall B+ Check out the MIX at the top of THEhotel. Even going up for a drink at Sunset is amazing! Don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time at The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: novicetraveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Vegas. We stayed at The Hotel for a week. I was a little nervous about staying there after reading some of the comments posted on this site. However, our time at this hotel was wonderful. The staff was friendly, the room was fabulous and the hotel itself was gorgeous.
