The night we arrived we checked in quite late (about 11:30pm) and I was concerned that our room requests would not be able to be accomodated as it was President's Day weekend and the hotel was full. There were absolutely no problems. When we arrived at our suite it was even better than I had expected. Plenty of space, three flatscreen televisions (one in the bathroom), a huge bathroom and even a second half bathroom (toilet and sink with vanity). I had some reservations about staying in a hotel without a casino as I do enjoy gambling. However, the Mandalay Bay casino was just a short walk down a hallway from the elevators. There is also a tram that connects the Mandalay Bay to the Luxor and Excalibur and then walkways to other casinos like New York, New York and the MGM Grand. Most of the time we used taxis to get around to the farther hotels but when we had time to spare we took the Deuce bus. So don't let this hotel's location prevent you from staying here. Our last night we dined at Mix on the 64th floor of The Hotel. This restaurant is stunning! They have an extensive wine list and the food was great. They also had no problems altering dishes to accomodate my vegetarian diet. I go to Vegas about once or twice a year and like to stay at a different hotel each time. Our experience at The Hotel was so wonderful I'm sure it will be difficult to find a place that can compare. I don't think we'll have to consider any other hotels for our next visit to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel is THE HOTEL to stay at in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BellatrixBabe
Reviews.Content: I just have to wonder where people who give this hotel anything but 5 stars are staying that is better than THE HOTEL AT MANDALAY!?!?!Especially for the price. The rooms are SOOO beautiful, its really hard to describe... have you been to a Marriott or Best Western lately?? I HAVE! A lot! And every time I see the ugly floral bedspread and tired drapes or green carpet, I dream about being back here at The Hotel....even if it is a little more than other hotels! The lobby is GORGEOUS, its super easy to get a cab, even over memorial day weekend, the spa is amazing, the cafe is pretty easy in and out too.... YES you have to walk to get to the pool, alright, you have to walk anywhere in Vegas. The pool is amazing and worth the walk! (Even if the pool staff is, well, rude and disorganized) You get all the prevailages of staying at the Mandalay, without the casino in your face (unless you want it) and without the crowds and hoardes of clubbers. You have 2 pools to pick from, 2 spas, tons of restaurants (TRY Mix at the top for nice cocktails and view!) & a spectacular buffet!Plus world class gambling, the house of blues & Forty Deuce AND SHARK REEF!!! That place is great! I LOVE THE HOTEL! Its minimalist elegance, casual and chic at the same time. I've stayed at the Venetian (YUCK!), the Four Seasons (NICE!), Frontier (not bad), Excalibur (No comment), MGM (decent), Sands, etc. and I love The Hotel the most- we're going back again in April with our kids and parents, and we'll be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GMoneyminussix
Reviews.Content: December 19, 2005 to December 22, 2005: After spending several months away from the United States in Iraq, it felt really good to go to Las Vegas and let someone pamper you. The room was very nice and roomy. Very clean bedroom and bath. The bath tub was not for two people but the shower was... The bed was very comfortable with room service only a phone call away. Strawberries and whip cream with our dinner one night. Good thing we didn't bring the kids.... Second night went to see Tom Jones. Boy he is such a great singer. 65 and still going strong. My wife got us great seats. Right in the middle. The roulette tables were nice and the employees there were very helpful. The sights and sounds of the hotel were very nice with the Noddle Bar a great place to eat and hang out. It really hit the spot... Overall, I really enjoyed my stay and would come back to Mandalay Bay with the kids. Ride that monorail all around the block. Next time I want to see the Blue Man Group and Tom Jones again... Well back to Iraq for a few more months, but I'll be home before next Christmas and do this all over again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...Did I say I loved it?”
Reviews.Author: calico696
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved it. The rooms are the greatest! Had a high floor room with an excellent view. The staff was friendly and helpful, the amenities outstanding. It was a real bonus having an extra half bathroom and such a roomy main bath. The double vanity sink and separate tub and shower worked out well for us. My husband and I have a very similar bathroom at home and usually are really out of sorts when we go away, but we were able to get ready each evening with no problem. Loved the plasma tv on the bathroom wall so much....we bought one for our own bathroom when we got home. First hotel I ever stayed in that had more than ample closet and drawer space. Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Feb 2 - Feb 5 2006 I loved It”
Reviews.Author: MissRpk
Reviews.Content: Now first of all, let me say that this Hotel was the best ever. Like all of you I read all the reviews about The Hotel at Mandalay Bay and I made my decision based on the rooms features not service, mainly because I read that I could expect poor service. When we arrived at the hotel, the hotel looked gorgeous. The Front desk was excellent, no attitudes (like I read & expected). I had a $22 cheeseburger meal in the middle of the night. (I was hungry, tired, and didn’t feel like leaving the hotel room), I might say I t was pricy but it was thee best cheeseburger I ever had! To make this short I had an excellent stay, the rooms at THE Hotel is more than what you could ask for. It is the first hotel that I can say was worth every penny. The spa is wonderful, every staff member I ran into, (and I ran into allot) was perfect and courteous. Even the Housekeepers were great! But be prepared to spend, this is not a place for a low budget. The food is outrageously pricy. DO NOT eat anything from the Bar unless you are dying :) It’s like $10.00 for a $.99 bag of nuts. Really! Theirs a liquor store, McDonalds, Subway, etc, right across the street from Mandalay bay (about 7 min walk, through the taxi cab stand, under the bridge) We visited the other Hotels and let me say. I was excited because when we went up the strip we saw allot of young people (yes i am very young) so that’s when we figured out this is where all the action is. But when we went through the other hotels, we realized that it took 10x longer to find things. I t was a walk to everywhere, and it was crowded, about 20 times the people. So at the end of the day, we were happy that all the action (for young people) were further up the strip and that we could come back to a nicer, quieter and more sophisticated place that we didn’t have to walk mile to just to go to the bathroom. Spots to check out are the Caesers Palace, The MGM. The Caesers Palace has the best Hip hop Club, or should i say clubs (yes they have more than one) for all young people. Also if your looking online for other hotels the hotels is literally chain next to each other, their not as far apart as it may seem on the pics online. Theirs a shuttle that can take you from inside of one hotel to the next and if not, the walking distance is so short you would be wasting your money taking a cab. Have Fun!!!!! Email me if you have any questions Ill me more than happy to further my experience with you! I have pics that i will put online later.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern...Very Expensive...Bad Food”
Reviews.Author: dcdude
Reviews.Content: Rating "The Hotel" is difficult for many reasons. First of all, it is **very** modern...and I love modern hotels. Some things have been done very well at The Hotel...and I appreciate them. For example, our room was pure luxury. The furnishings were first rate. I felt like I was in a fancy movie about Las Vegas. Just very nice! But there were odd things that really seemed bizarre to me. For example, the remote control for the plasma tv is glued to the table...because guests (paying $400-500 per night) steal them?? When it came time to iron my shirt for dinner, I was SHOCKED to see that the iron is also "locked" to the ironing board so that it cannot be stolen. Both of these things were a real 'turn off' for me. I'm not trying to be picky, but it gave me the impression that -- although I was staying in this fabulous room -- the hotel is patronized by thieves. Now THAT is a weird vibe. And, if theft is a big problem for The Hotel, why not charge guests' credit cards for missing remote controls and/or irons? I mean, isn't that what the Ritz-Carlton does if you take home the robe that is hanging in your bathroom? Finally, the food in The Hotel's restaurant was expensive...and terrible. You know the old joke about "How can you mess up eggs?" Well, my egg breakfast at The Hotel was one of the worst breakfasts of my entire life. It was AWFUL. So there you have it: gorgeous hotel; gorgeous rooms; bad food; and a management team that fully expects you will be stealing from them. Only in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: JetSetter16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel at Mandalay Bay and thought it was great! The Hotel is beautiful, chic, hip and very welcoming. The rooms are gorgeous and huge. Every room has one and a half baths, a living room (with desk and copy/fax), a wonderful bedroom (with an incredibly comfortable bed) and large bathroom (with TV). I highly recommend staying at The Hotel for business or pleasure. The hotel is located within Mandalay Bay but seems like a world away. Guests get the close proximity to the casino and fabulous restaurants but feel far removed from the noise of Las Vegas. The views from the rooms are spectacular and show most of the strip. I highly recommend getting a drink (or many) at the Mix. The bar is located within the Hotel and has beautiful views as well as superbly cool design. On a side note, the shampoo and conditioner in the bathroom are fabulous!!! The only issue I had with the hotel is getting an Internet connection. I didn't bring my computer with me because I was told that there was a business center in the hotel. At the hotel I was told that guests could access the Internet in their rooms through the television. However, when I went upstairs there was no keyboard so I called the front desk when I was told there were no longer keyboards available in the room. When I got downstairs to go to the Business Center I was told it was closed (it closes at 6PM nightly). If you stay at The Hotel I recommend bringing your own laptop in case you need to access the Internet. Overall, the experience was great and I highly recommend The Hotel when booking your next stay in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved The Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FortCollinslady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at TheHotel for three nights. I had stayed at Mandalay Bay before and liked it, but had also stayed at the Bellagio and the Venetian before deciding to try TheHotel. We were not disappointed. We arrived at about 4:00 p.m. and were immediately checked in. Our requests for a smoking room on a high floor with a strip view were all honored despite the fact that we were on a "package" air and hotel deal through Allegiant Airlines and probably did not pay full price for our room. This was a "suite" in the true sense of the word, not a large room with a divider that some hotels try to pass off as a suite. We had a half bath as well as an enormous full bath with a two person tub and a shower all done in marble. There was a flat screen TV in the bathroom, one of THREE in the suite (a 42 inch TV in the living area and a 32 inch TV in the bedroom). The "sample" shampoo, lotion, etc., were high end, and were the first samples I have taken home from any hotel in the past decade. When we called down about two bulbs being out on the lamps in the living and bedroom areas (our only complaint), they were replaced within 15 minutes. We LOVED the floor to ceiling windows in the living and bedroom areas. We also loved the push button (as opposed to a card one hangs on the door) for either housekeeping or do not disturb. On one day that we did not put on the housekeeping light until late afternoon (not expecting that service so late in the day), we got it. The one thing I would have liked would be a coffee maker in the room for that essential first cup of coffee of the day. We were on somewhat of a budget and didn't want to get coffee via room service, so next time I would probably bring my own portable coffee maker for that purpose. We had meals at the Border Grill and House of Blues, both of which were excellent. I had two treatments at the Bathhouse Spa. The treatments were expensive but excellent, and the spa itself was wonderful. I was not charged the daily spa fee for the day I had the treatments. I would have probably used the spa on the other two days if there had not been a $30 fee, and it would be nice if that would have been included for hotel guests. Two other things we really enjoyed: (1) the Shark Reef at the Mandalay Bay; and (2) the Fab Four show at the Alladin. The show was truly amazing - the four performers not only sounded, but actually LOOKED exactly like the Beatles. We are still talking about what a great show it was. Finally, a tip: starting at noon, a booth near the MGM Grand (which looks like a giant Coke bottle) sold half price tickets for all of the shows that night. This was a GREAT deal for anyone on a budget, since the major shows can run upwards of $80 - $100. We did happen to be in Vegas during a slow week (right after the Super Bowl) so all of the tickets might not be available all of the time, but when we showed up to get tickets for the Fab Four, tickets for all shows were available. I'll never pay full price for a Vegas show again. The free entertainment in the lounges at Mandalay Bay was excellent. All in all, a great trip. We will definitely be return guests at TheHotel. I did notice some comments about the staff being "snooty" - this was not our experience. Not everyone is comfortable staying at this type of property, and they may have been intimindated by the type of service, but I found it excellent. Anyone who is intimindated should stay a different type of property (TheHotel is New York-style cosmopolitan), as should those who found that staying on the far south end of the Strip a problem. We didn't - we took the (free) monorail as far as the Exclalibur and walked to NY-NY, Paris and the Alladin. It was good exercise. Frankly, we could have stayed in TheHotel/MB complex the entire time had we not seen a show at another hotel. Please feel free to contact me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Superb holiday experience.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Walking in we were transported into one of the best hotel experiences we have had in our many years and miles of travel, so much so we extened our stay from 2 to 4 nights, the staff in all departments were first class, friendly and professional. Room service could not be faulted, housekeeping first rate. We will deffinately stay at TheHotel on our next visit to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny spent”
Reviews.Author: verigins
Reviews.Content: The Mandalay Bay was the nicest hotel on the strip. The ventilation system was above excellent. Never knew anyone was smoking. It smelled pleasent without strong perfume smells. Checked out all the other hotels while there and this one is worth every penny you spend. Nice to look at, eat at and lots to do. Staff is very helpful and always at your service.

Reviews.Title: “Swankiest of the Swank”
Reviews.Author: drivr8
Reviews.Content: Got a GREAT deal through Mandalay Bay for a suite the last two days of January. I've stayed about half of the hotels on The Strip (including Mandalay Bay proper) and this is probably tied with The Venetian for 2nd (Mandalay Bay will always be first) best hotel at a GREAT value. Beautifully designed, hip to no end, the hotel and it's rooms definitely give you the impression you are "somebody", even when you're paying a cut rate, LOL. Our suite was beautiful and spacious. While it's a little bit of a walk from THEhotel to the tram or walkway to Luxor/Excalibur, I've seen far worse (like MGM Grand, for example). The only real complain was THEcafe (THEhotel's version of a 24-cafe). Skip it. Overpriced and not particularly good. The Bathouse spa -- DON'T MISS IT. It is expensive, yes. And it is (along with Spa Mandalay) one of the best spas on The Strip, if not the best. IMO, far better than Canyon Ranch at The Venetian. The gym is a bit different (diffused and dimmed red light), but it got the job done. There were individual tv monitors on all the cardio machines. Even the toiletries are simple, clean, and classy. Keep in mind that understatedness is a key to THEHotel's design, and that goes for the lighting as well as the decor. I personally am not much for bright harsh lighting, so it didn't bother me, but a family member in the party wasn't keen on it. If only Mandalay Bay was moved to the center of The Strip it would be the only place I stay at. All in all, a great hotel and if I can get the same deal I got this time, I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day stay at the Hotel at Mandalay Bay. The hotel is very beautiful and the customer service was exceptional. The rooms are spacious, well maintained and the bathroom is large and beautiful. They also have an very large gym that is a great place to work out. We ordered room service one night and the food was great. We realized later that the room service food comes from the cafe downstair. We also ate breakfast at the cafe and somehow they made an ordinary breakfast of bacon and eggs a meal to remember! It is a short walk to the casino through a beautiful hallway with flower arrangements of calla lillies everywhere! A couple of things that did not impress us. The main entrance to the hotel is through the parking garage which, when you think of other hotels in this class, such as Bellagio and Wynn, is a serious short coming. We also found the waiting area in front of the elevator and the public restrooms to be VERY dark. Check out took in excess of 20 minutes even though we were only third in line. There were two clerks staffing the desk which seems a bit obsurd for 9:30 in the morning. When we mentioned this to the clerk she told us that it is always that way and asked us if we would like to speak to management. Of course, we had to decline because we had a plane to catch! All in all, we found our stay at the Hotel to be a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: irishgal92707
Reviews.Content: Okay Mandalay Bay rocks, simple as that! I was a bit nervous first going in because I wanted to stay at the Mirage again, but my parents reserved us a week stay here. And boy was I glad! Lobby-Freaking beautiful! It's breathtaking <3 Rooms-We had a comibned room. One king sized bed for my parents & the other room with 2 queen sized beds. The rooms were fantastic. They were very spacious & gorgeous, even for regular standard rooms! The bathrooms were just gorgeous & beautiful. Comfy beds & our view of the pool was so pretty! Pool-One of the best parts of the hotel! The wave pool is amazingly fun & the lazy river is so relaxing! Nice that you don't have to have a tube to float in it. Sure you have to lay out towels on chairs early, but it's fine! def. 5 star "beach"! Food-The food shops in the pool area were great! Nice, casual food & great to your tummy! lol. The Mexican restaurant (sorry forgot the name) at the hotel was excellent too. We only ate those times during my family's stay. Service-Great. No problems whatsover. Check-in wasn't too long so I was happy since I didn't have to wait for my parents to take forever. :) So most def. go to the Mandalay Bay. best hotel on the strip. (& yes I have seen all the other hotels). 5 stars all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Mandalay Kiddie Palace!”
Reviews.Author: chefeMark
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel......too large! My complaint with this hotel is the pool was too crowded. The teenagers would get up early every morning and put newspapers, towels, etc. on all good chairs by the pool then start appearing about noon. I was young once too....but paying too much money for this kind of problem.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My significant other and I had a wonderful time for my 40th bday. Jan. 21-23. We arrived at the Hotel around 1130am and were allowed to check in. The room still needed to be cleaned, but they said we could put our stuff in the bedroom closet and come back a little later. We were fine with that. Luckily the people before us were really clean, so it did not bother us. The room was excellent, big bathroom, it was kewl having a tv in there. Robes and slippers and all kinds of amenities. We watched a dvd that we brought on the 42 inch tv. Room service was great for breakfast. Steak and eggs (shared) and a full pot of starbucks cost about $34, not including tip. Had dinner at Rumjungle, excellent service and food. Had sushi another night in the lounge in Mandalay Place and watched sports on one of the many plasmas while we ate. Went to the MIX for a couple drinks and a great view. Service was great. Get there at 5pm to get a good seat. Had fun with the slots, especially the Wheel of Fortune. Most all the slots take cash or tickets, no coin. Which is a lot nicer and cleaner. Two billiards tables in the Lounge by the front lobby are complimentary, just let them hold onto your drivers license. Enjoyed the Lakers game at the Sports Book. Sat at a big table with big cushy chairs and had a great view of the game on a huge screen. Service was great, good drinks. All in all an excellent trip! Some fun things to do..... take the Deuce bus to travel on the strip. Only $2 a person. A lot cheaper than a cab. Or Tram it over to Luxor and Excalibur and then it gets you close to New York, New York, then cross over to MGM and walk down to the Flamingo and have some cheeseburgers and margaritas at Margaritaville. There is a kewl souvenir shop with Jimmy Buffet/Margaritaville stuff. Check out the habitat with the flamingos and penguins. The pools are kewl too. Some things to watch out for....... signs leading to the Hotel are not very informative. Look for the West Valet area, that is where you want to be. It is on the backside of Mandalay. Also, when leaving valet to get on the freeway, do not turn left, go right, towards the strip, then right onto the strip and follow the signs to the freeway. If you are a light sleeper, try to get a room away from the MIX club. You can hear the music. We turned the fan on to drown out the music on Sat. night. Sun night it was quiet. The One Club card isn't all that great unless you are a major gambler, plus it expires within 18 months if you don't use it. Drinks and food are expensive. Beers are $5-7, mixed drinks $8.50-13. Sushi was 19.50 for a Rainbow roll. Rumjungle was $91 for 2 drinks and the food. Cheeseburger at Margaritaville $8.95, margaritas $10. All in all a great experience, even if it was expensive, it was a special occasion. We pretty much stayed and partied in the Mandalay/Hotel area, lots to do and see. Fun, fun!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: isakalo
Reviews.Content: We went to The hotel and were surprised with the modern, beutiful rooms. all the rooms have plasma TV. A friend decide to stay in their best suite in the top floor, and the views and the decor were amazing. truly nice. The spa was nice, good service, but $30 per day just to go in. different style than other hotels in Vegas. More class and better design. however, it a little far from the most popular areas. It was great for us, but some people might want to be closer to the center. In that case, Bellagio is something else to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Unfathomably Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: pollyjean23
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? Awesome design, great service, beautiful room, generous ammenities, uspeakable luxury at the Bathouse Spa, aromatherapy in the motor lobby. We went for our honeymoon and had the best hotel experience ever. If you want to be in the thick of Vegas, stay at the New York-New York or Bellagio. If you want to take advantage of Vegas on your OWN terms, stay at The Hotel. No casino in The Hotel, but the Mandalay Bay one is just down the hall. Mix, the restaurant and bar at the top, has absolutely breathtaking views and wonderful tomato coulee! House of Blues (saw Lucinda Williams perform) is located in the Mandalay Bay casino--nice perk. Great service, nice bar, could've stayed there instead of moving on to So-Cal for the second leg of our honeymoon. Bathroom was a dream (1 and a half baths!), remember that these are all suites. If you like modern, sleek-yet-comfortable design, The Hotel is The place.

Reviews.Title: “Giant Boutique Hotel, not Vegas-Style!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel that doesn't open its arms to you with the sound of slot machines, is the opposite of over-stated and tacky and offers all the amenities of a large hotel, then make sure to stay at THE hotel at Mandalay. You will love the experience. The suites are huge. You walk into a beautifully modern furnished living room with a plasma screen, couch, large desk with personal fax machine and powder room. Then you get to the bedroom with a huge bathroom - both rooms have plasma screens as well (3 total in the suite). The pillows and Frette robes are to die for. I heard the spa/fitness is great but didn't get a chance to use it. However there is a fee - the prices are $30 for the spa and $20 for the gym to use. The lobby is very modern - similar to W Hotel decor, but everything in grand size. All browns and caramels. I ordered room service and was very impressed with the service. Everyone called me by my full name. This place is very relaxing and offers a non-hustle and bustle experience.

Reviews.Title: “Funn Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok, this place was fun cause we had the Rocky 6 production and some fight going on, plus the 26 mile run AND the rodeo convention. So we had bling bling from the fight, movie industry for the rocky 6 filming, health nuts from the marathon and cowboys from the rodeo – WHAT A MIX of people that week. I have been to Vegas many times and always stayed at the Ambassador in for 60 a night. This was the first time my wife went to Vegas so I did it up. We stayed 5 nights – bout a grand total. Was a fun hotel. Been there when it was new just to see it and have a drink – very expensive drinks compared to the Barbary Coast. The island bar is fun, it is in the middle. The Foundation room – GO THERE IF YOU CAN – it is cool!! On the top of the hotel, so cool. There is lots to do in this hotel!! Went to the deuce club, some club in the back of the hotel were they have girls dancers!! This was fun!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Just rockin! Pics show the view from our room – try to get the view of the strip not the back view of the pools (unless you have binoculars) hee hee When we went in nov/dec it was chilly The bad part is that the hotel did not have a mini bar or small fridge – marketing ploy. Room service is EXPENSIVE!!!! We went to the grocery store and the gas station across the street and stalked up on goodies and water. They had water bottles on the room and if you broke the seal it was 4.95 or 3.95 for the bottle. Across the street are the SAME bottles for 1.80. HA! I bet the gas station knew what they were doing there – Hotel is a bit from the main stuff. Tend to wake up and walk a bit to other places and then head back. The island bar kept us busy all night, the hotel actually kept us busy ALL night so we did nto have to wander off much. Very FUN place. Older and more sophisticated type crowd. Great Fun though – here is some stuff we did: CIRQUE Water show - Excellent!!!!! GHOSTBAR – at the PALMS - FUN!!!! Grand Canyon helicopter flight, we booked via Papillion – do the landing in the canyon!!!! Rio Casino - cool! Breakfast at denny's Stratosphere restaurant - Book in advance - great views Top of stratosphere for view - EXCELLENT! Zoo at mirage (white tigers) and Volcano The steak house in the Belagio is excellent! Watch fountains at Belagio Shopping at Caesar's 3d imax cinema at the Luxor (maybe for one evening if it rains) Rollercoaster and NY NY Big Apple piano bar at NY NY Liberache museum Gondala's at the venetian Electric gondolas on the 2nd floor of the Venetian The Mix lounge atop the Hotel Mandalay Mix Restaurant 60+ floors up alfresco dining 632 9500 5-3am Rum Jungle in Mandalay Bay House of Blues - in Mandalay Bay Sunday Brunch @ House of Blues - Mandalay Seafood buffet at Mandalay Aureals Restarant - Mandalay

Reviews.Title: “THE best in Las Veags? Well, maybe...”
Reviews.Author: MikeyBikey
Reviews.Content: This is one great hotel. It is located at the south end of the Strip, close to the airport. It is affiliated with and shares some of the nice amenities of the Mandalay Bay, including the typical collection of great restaurants and some great pools (most of which, unfortunately, were undergoing renovation in Jan 2006). All of THE Hotel rooms are suites. They are beautiful and well-designed. The living room is nice and functional. It sports an attractive sofa (it's actually a pull-out) and a plasma TV with a DVD player (which, unfortunately, didn't play my DVD-RWs), there is also a desk with fax machine, computer connections. The bedroom is large and sports nice furnishings, most with king-size beds. The room is indeed nice, but the bed was just amazing. It is the most comfortable that the wife and I have ever slept in, considerably nicer than Westin’s “Heavenly Bed.” The adjoining bathroom is very nice with a double sink. There is also a half bath in the entryway which would make the room very functional for entertaining. OK, here are my quibbles. The south end of the strip is a bit remote. (Though it is connected by shuttle and close enough to walk to three affiliated properties -- The Luxor and the Excalibur). The entrance to the Hotel is through a parking garage. The service, judging from the reviews here, is clearly improving, but not quite at the level of a top hotel. Next, even though this is very upscale, if the elevator is any clue, there still seems to be a good number of typical Vegas white trash in the hotel. Finally, despite the presence of HD plasma TVs, they hadn't spring for HD satellite, so the picture wasn't any better than any other TV in town. (We just returned from Japan, where most hotels had plasma TVs, but they came with HD content). Is there anyplace better in Vegas? The Bellagio has a nice central location. I didn't see the rooms, but the place was much more crowded than "THE Hotels," crowded enough to mean that I would probably rule it out (more than 30 minutes plus to eat in any restaurant or to wait in the cab line!) The Paris is across the street, sports the same central location, and is just slightly less crowded. I suppose the Four Seasons might be nicer, but it's really in a higher class than even THE Hotel. Practically, I'd have to say that THE Hotel has to be in the running for the best place to stay. Decide how important walking the strip is to you and your tolerance for crowds. If you'd rather be a bit off the beaten path, I'd recommend THE Hotel; if, however, you have to be in the center of the action, then consider the Bellagio or Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel in mid December for 4 nights during the very low season. The suite was top notch in every way. The bathroom was huge and the closets were outstanding. In most Las Vegas hotels, you need to walk half a mile from the parking lot to get to the front desk and/or rooms. The Hotel makes it easy with parking close by. One of the nicest aspects of staying there is that there is no casino within The Hotel, but it is an easy walk to get to. The big advantage is that the noise level is virtually nonexistant. The room and lobby decor is very sedate and classic. There are excellent restaurants within the Mandalay Bay complex, especially Restaurant RM. Additionally, a wonderful breakfast can be had at the nearby Four Seasons. The Hotel did not have any negatives that we could see.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful rooms,average staff”
Reviews.Author: diceburner
Reviews.Content: For sure the best hotel I've ever stayed in Las Vegas.Huge bathrooms,nice living rooms.The room tend to be a little too darky,but still beautiful. Now I cannot say good things about the staff.From the front desk staff to the maid,to all the others,they all acted like a bunch of snotty wannabes.What's wrong with this people?Maybe they are still pissed about the mega merger between Mandalay and MGM,knowing that MGMMIRAGE is not a great boss. Upon check out(TV check out) I was chargerd and extra $ 104 for the minibar.Never used the minibar and I'm still waiting for my refund after 2 weeks. Lines at the front desk are long and slow. I will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “worst service”
Reviews.Author: maier1
Reviews.Content: for what i paid the service and style are not worth it at all i like wynn and bellagio hands down to this dump

Reviews.Title: “Hit or Miss...”
Reviews.Author: lao824
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Jan 1/2, our first visit to Vegas & this hotel. The room/restaurant/lobby/spa decor is great, one of the nicest hotels I have stayed at. But, as pointed out in previous reviews, it is the customer service, especially at the front desk, that this hotel needs to work on. We checked in late on the first, were guaranteed a king bed with a Strip view, by a disgruntled front desk clerk, & were disappointed to find ourselves with 2 queen beds & a view of the top of the parking structure. (Note: The clerk assisting the couple next to us was in a great cheerful/helpful mood). After a call to the manager, we were guaranteed a king, corner suite for the following evening. We, too, had zero if any hot water/water pressure in the sinks/shower/tub. The water in one of the sinks was a disgusting rust color. Our room the next day was great, no complaints with the view, water or service. Unfortunately, your trip will either be great or disappointing depending on who checks you in & which room you end up in. If we had been in the corner suite from the beginning, I would have rated my experience as Extremely Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Most Confortable Hotel Room Ever”
Reviews.Author: gr8sportpa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Hotel from 12-20 thru 12-25 and it was wonderful. (5 nites) First, the value was fantastic, as it was the week before Christmas. Very slow week in Vegas, but an excellent week if you want a great room (suite) at a great price. I paid $119 for the first few nites, and then up to $169 for the last two. It also included a $35 meal credit with the promo they were running... along with some other coupons for shopping at Mandalay Place and for the Spa. The Suites are great, you can get descriptions in every other review on here. What impressed me most, was that this was the first hotel where I really felt like I was staying in an apartment. The furnishings are sleek and modern, yet have a warmth to them which makes them very home like. Not too minimalist or cold. Whenever I returned to the room, I felt as if I was returning to my own apartment home, away from home. I have stayed in many other hotels as I travel frequently for work and play to LA, Chicago, and Miami. The only other place I have stayed in Vegas was The Venetian, and I think these suites blow away the ones at The Venetian. Housekeeping was perfect and the other staff I had to deal with were helpful and courtious. I undestand that it was a slow week there, which may be the reason why the service was good. But if you like Vegas a little less crowded than usual, then the two weeks before Christmas are a great time to go. I really like the entire feel of the hotel. The decor is great and hotel floors are quite and the rooms quite also. You would not know there was any other guests in the hotel, except for seeing someone in the halls, as there seems to be no noise coming from the rooms. I am most impressed with the bathrooms and the high quality of their very own line of "Gilcrist and Soames" soaps, shampoo and lotions. So good in fact, I bought some in the gift shop for gifts for family and co-workers back home. I was also impressed with the hotel designers for having an electronic button by the door for "do not disturb" or "make up room". No need for stupid tags which always fall off the door handle or out of the card slot. This is the closest thing that Vegas has to the "W" Hotels. If you like the "W" Hotels, you will love The Hotel. If there is one complaint I have, it is with the resturants at Mandalay Bay. There really are no resturants in The Hotel other than The Cafe, which was closed for much of my stay. Seems that The Cafe is only open on weekends. I dont mind walking to the resturants in Mandalay, but they totally underwhelm me. I feel like I am always paying too much for what I ate. I don't mind paying good money for meals, but I want to say.. "that was a good meal". That was not the case at Mandalay. The meals were average and cost too much. The most satisfying meal I had was at the Burger Bar located in Mandalay Place. But, I still have a problem paying $30 for a Bacon Cheesburger, fries and two beers. This is by far the best "standard" room in Las Vegas!! If it is within your budget, I totally recomend staying there. I just re-booked for the end of February, even though the prices are close to $300 a nite. I will defintily be staying there each and every time I return to Vegas, no matter what the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Nice designed Lobby”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The lobby is very nice, modern in design. The suite is nice too, and it nice size bathroom. The bedroom has comfortable bedding. However, the suite is a little dark in lighting.

Reviews.Title: “Service on Level of 1 - 2 Star Property”
Reviews.Author: miwatch
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay and I felt compelled to write a review. I have traveled extensively and quite frankly have never felt so compelled to post a review. Having seen many prior reviews describing poor service we opted to still stay at The Hotel as we had made dinner and lounge plans for Mix on New Year’s Eve. Needless to say, 5 minutes into our stay I felt as though we had made a big mistake. Having confirmed a “V” suite two days before with a high floor location, we were checked into the last remaining “V” Suite in the property. It was located on a very low floor but given our 11:00 PM arrival time we opted to take it. The front desk staff were not personable and thus it did not seem like debating the room would get anywhere. Upon entry into the room it became apparent the room was not cleaned. Mind you this was 11:00 PM. Sheets on the bed were tossed and previously eaten room service was still sitting around. Needless to say, we had to trek back down and were given the only other King size bed room in the place. It was not a V suite and was located on a lower floor with what could best be described as a freeway view. The next few days were a continuation of poor service. For New Year’s Eve, despite having spoken on the phone with staff the day before to confirm, we were given a table about as far away from the window as possible at Mix. This, despite the fact that money was paid a month earlier for the specific window view. To make matters worse, a number of closer tables remained empty during our 9:00 PM sitting. It was obvious that they tables were being held for “more important” guests. Finally, 4 courses into the dinner the manager showed up to offer us one of the other tables. Quite frankly, it was more insulting as it clearly substantiated the fact that tables were being held for potential last minute reservations. With Mix serving what was a very poor dinner, this was most disappointing considering the nearly $2,600 spent for the two us at the restaurant and lounge (bottle service) for the night. Additional experiences proved disappointing at the Hotel over the next few days. Having room service removed from the room (or hall after many calls), was an absolute impossibility, and daily maid service was very poor. The two most disturbing occurrences at the Hotel occurred the last day. Looking to stay in Vegas another night, I stopped at the front desk to extend our stay one more day (same person whom checked us in). After some transitioning through their system, he quoted a room rate, and said it was taken care of. With this, we made our way back upstairs and changed all of our flight reservations. The next morning we receive a phone call from housekeeping asking us why we have not, and when are we going to vacate our room. With this, a call was made to the front desk only to be told the hotel was sold out for the night and that there was no way to extend the room. Keep in mind, all travel reservations had been changed. After some extremely tense “conversations” with the front desk, they agreed to “honor” the extended stay. Last but not least, that afternoon we finally transitioned to the bathrooms to get ready to find that the Hotel has experienced a water problem and no water exists. Four hours later semi-warm water began to disburse from some facets, however, through our departure at 5:45 AM the next morning the shower had NO hot water. Once again, front desk help maintained the attitude of take it or leave it. No “luxury” hotel staff at any other Vegas property would ever take this approach. I have stayed at many and while they have their problems, Bellagio, Wynn, the Four Seasons, or other 4- 5 star properties would ever be so unaccommodating. Thus, I have to agree with reviews posted earlier pertaining to the Hotel that put service far down the spectrum. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are up there with the leaders in Vegas, however, the staff and support services associated with the Hotel have much to be said for.

Reviews.Title: “Hangover Heaven”
Reviews.Author: HikaruDragon
Reviews.Content: If you are sick of the glitz, glitter and gaudiness that is Las Vegas, this is the place you need to stay, especially if you've had way too much to drink. The decor is slick, sleek and modern with cool and muted tones. The lighting in the rooms is subdued, and the rooms themselves are very quiet. The hotel was sold out, but you wouldn't know another soul was in the place, except for meeting them in the halls and public areas. If you've had too much of Vegas, just crawl into your big bed and recuperate. There are just a few things that I wish were different: an in-room coffee maker, please. We were on the 33rd floor--quite a distance to the Coffee Bar in the lobby for our morning infusion. (Pity the people on the 60th floor.) The beds felt like lumpy jello. Lighting is so dim that the workdesk (complete with its own fax) was barely usable at night. I guess you're supposed to be playing, not working. The hotel is so sleek that it's almost souless, and that's the clincher. It's a beautiful hotel, but I don't think I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply sexy!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This has to be the sexiest hotel in Vegas! I loved every moment of every area of the hotel from the lobby to the Mix Lounge (bottom to top floor). You would be remist if you stayed there and did not take advantage of the Mix restaurant and lounge. I am not easily moved by things, but this place is absolutely amazing-- the view, the food, and the decor are all phenomenal. Start with the Lobster Ceasar Salad and end on the outside patio drinking your favorite elixer while overlooking the entire strip. One concern which needs to be addressed is room service. If you plan to order room service , order before you are hungary because it take a long time to get your food--1 hour 15 minutes to 1 hour 35 minutes. Dont believe the quoted time given when ordering. I ordered three times and the quoteed time was 30-45 minutes. Great food and wonderful attendants made up for the awful room service. A must stay hotel in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Annettencalif
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful about THEhotel. The only negatives I would report is that housekeeping did not completely vacuum the room, as I found hair,etc. on the floor behind the bathroom door...they obviously don't move the door when they vacuum..also, bathroom vanity lighting is a bit dim unless you are used to using the magnifying mirrors, they do have those. This hotel as they say, is secluded, quiet and very cosmopolitan. The Bathhouse Spa should not be missed. For $30/day you can come and go, using the steam rooms, sauna, pools, hot and cold dip jacuzzis as well as juice/snack bar included. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 day there over christmas and it was wonderful. The room were everything I and my wife expected. Enjoyed drink wine and looking out over the city, for our room. The full lenght windows are wonderful touch to the room. Here are our views on the hotel: Service: From the time we checked in until we departed the hotel staff was wonderful! We asked for a higher room and we ended up on the 24th floor. Maid service was excellent. Mix lounge: Go up to lounge and have a drink, the views are wonderful. If you go before 10 pm there is no cover charge. It is a perfect way to end an evening. Room: Way above the average, 42 inch TV, a bath tub you could drown in, and a bed that made you not want to get up in the mornings. Overall: TheHotel is one of the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in. If you get the chance to stay there dont pass it up!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at The hotel”
Reviews.Author: hospbuild
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for the Christmas weekend and absolutely loved it! Ditto for everything said in the other positive reviews. We go to Vegas a couple of times per year and usually try a new hotel each trip, not anymore as we have found our favorite. If your budget allows you must have dinner at the Mix on the 64th floor. The nightime view of the strip is out of this world and so is the food. It's quite expensive but worth very dollar.

Reviews.Title: “TheHigh Life at TheHotel!”
Reviews.Author: neutral_leopard
Reviews.Content: We (myself, husband, and friend) stayed at TheHotel 12/18 thru 12/22. This was the most stunning and luxurious hotel I have ever been to (and I've traveled quite a bit). We were able to afford it due to the low pre-Xmas rates! High points: the bathroom! The tub could have fit three adults (not that we tried) and it was so spacious, all of us were able to get ready for a night out at the same time. The minibar was of course very expensive; we got around this by bringing a bag of gourmet snacks & mini champagne from World Market! The cover was steep for Mix Lounge, but we were able to get a table since the place was slow. Great view and personable staff. Staff was courteous; we tipped housekeeping $5 a day and they left us everything we requested and more. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a romantic and luxurious Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “BEST hotel stay of my life”
Reviews.Author: OUOUOU
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lot of hotels in my lifetime, but never have I stayed in a more beautiful, luxurious, and overall fantastic place. I cannot say enough about this hotel. The service was absolutely perfect. When we arrived on Thursday night, late, I asked for a room with a good view. The extremely pleasant receptionist left for a few minutes and then came back to say "I got you a penthouse suite." At no extra charge!!! I almost lost it right there. But then we went to our 42nd floor suite, walked in, and then I REALLY lost it. This place was incredible!! Three 42" plasma TV's, 1 smaller one in bathroom (in front of whirlpool tub), about 6 sets of speakers throughout the suite (with 6 different volume controls), 3 couches, a dining table for 8, about 40 feet of floor-to-ceiling windows, automatic drapes, bar area, office area, 2nd bathroom, I can go on & on. We just walked around the suite for about an hour, with our mouths wide open. We felt like we were doing something wrong everytime we left the room to go somewhere (I might add, we ended up staying in the room much of the time). We felt like we were in an episode of Lifestyles of the Rich & Famous. The amenities were marvelous, housekeeping was spot-on, etc. etc. I will never stay anywhere else in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “THEbest Rooms in Vegas for THEmoney!”
Reviews.Author: TheGoul
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Thanksgiving weekend, and can honestly say that these are the biggest "standard" rooms in Vegas. Could you pay more (a lot more!) for a 3000 square foot Presidential Suite at the Bellagio? Yes. But in terms of paying the basic rate for a hotel room, you cannot beat THEhotel! Rooms are just under 800 square feet, with two bathrooms (one by the front door and one in the bedroom) and three flat screen TVs: A huge one in the living room, a good size one in the bedroom, and even a small one in the bathroom facing the shower. I had three games going at once on Sunday! Carpet is nice and thick, huge fax machine (with paper!) on the desk for your use, and they have a Do Not Disturb red light button you can turn on (instead of those annoying hanging cards that always fall off the door). Decor is very classy and sleek. Seems a bit dark at first, but plenty of overhead lights and lamps to lighten things up. Great ergo desk chair, and a few lounge chairs in both rooms make it very comfortable. Wet bar is a nice touch (with wine and drink glasses, corkscrew, etc.); CD player is also great...in fact the room is so modern, there is no VCR (though I would have liked one.) Great toiletries in the bathroom, nice big glass shower and huge two-person tub, but for that size, you would think they could have made it a jet tub, but they didn't. No casino in the hotel, but since it is connected to Mandalay Bay, you don't have to go outside to gamble...just walk thru the lobby, down the hallway and you're there. But I think this is the best feature of the hotel: It's nice and sophisticated and quiet if you don't stray far...but if you want the noise and lights of a casino, you don't have very far to go. Didn't get a chance to see the spa, as they were fully booked for the day we wanted, so I went to the Four Seasons' Spa (the third hotel at Mandalay Bay), and it was amazing. Quiet, great lockerooms, great staff, couples massage room, top notch! Since it was winter, all the Mandalay pools were closed except for one, but it was even too cold to swim in that one, and yes, the pools did seem far from the rooms at THEhotel, but not that much farther from some of the rooms at Mandalay Bay itself. We asked for a second fridge and a microwave to be brought up to the room, and they were given at no charge. The front desk and the concierge service overall seemed a bit cold at first. Only two or three people at the front desk, and two concierge guys, and they were not extremely helpful or the "going out of their way" type to ask you what you need. But the group on the second day seemed much friendlier. For a hotel with over 1000 rooms on a sold out weekend, it did not seem crowded at all. No lines at the bars, coffee places, shops, etc. The prices aren't that bad either. You can easily get rooms for under $200 on weekdays, and we ended up paying only $169 for a Saturday night on a holiday weekend. And here's a tip: Book thru the hotel directly...they will always give you the lowest rate, but you MUST keep checking back on their website to see if the price drops at anytime before your stay. I booked my room 6 months in advance, and after a month, the price dropped from $209 to $189, so I "rebooked" at that time, and then a few months later, it dropped down to $169, so I "rebooked" again! Bottom line: Why would you want to stay anywhere else for the same price if the standard rooms at THEhotel will always be bigger and nicer than any other hotel's standard rooms? Plus, you get to take advantage of all the Mandalay Bay facilities at no extra charge, and can even have access to the Four Seasons Hotel without ever going outdoors...how can you beat that? And the only two recent negative reviews of the hotel on this website are very misleading. One person admitted that they took forever to check into the “Mandalay Bay” desk, because they didn’t know that THEhotel had their own check-in desk! And one of the latest negative reviewers, in my opinion, actually stayed at “Mandalay Bay” and NOT at THEhotel; because, they kept describing things that are not in THEhotel! For instance, they state that the maid kept rolling her cart over the “tile hallway floors,” but all the floors outside THEhotel guest rooms are carpeted!!! I cannot imagine ever needing to stay anywhere else but THEhotel ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, One Problem”
Reviews.Author: vtgambler
Reviews.Content: We'd stayed at TheHotel for 4 nights in December 2005 (9th-13th). We arrived at 10:30pm after extensive travel delays and were informed that they had no suites available but would give us a standard room and move us in the morning. This was a little annoying since they adverstise as being an all suite hotel, but since it was late we didn't really care. They knocked $50 off the rate and promised we'd be able to move "first thing" in the morning. Our main concern was that we had to be at a wedding by 1:30 the next day and wanted to be settled in our new room by them. Nothing available on the first try at 9:30am. At 11:30am we were told that check in wasn't normally until 3:00pm and that they were doing us a "courtesy" by moving our room at all. Things got a little heated at this point and we returned to our room. About 2 minutes later the front desk called to apologize and say they had a suite for us and we could move right away. Go figure. Other than the above problem TheHotel was great. The suites are top notch with a huge master bathroom, living room area, etc.. I've stayed at Bellagio and Venetian and I would say these rooms are better. Everyone else we dealt with was very friendly. We had breakfast at TheCafe a couple of mornings and it was very good. Unlike the main hotel there was never any wait for a cab or traffic congestion getting dropped off. Anyone who says its a long walk to get to the Casino probably hasn't spent much time in Vegas. It's no more then 3 minutes from the elevator. Feel free to e-mail me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Loved THEhotel”
Reviews.Author: waspkiller
Reviews.Content: THEhotel was excellent as always. The rooms look like they are well decorated New York appartments. The plasma TVs in every room are a great feature as well as the extra bathroom!!! The views are good from the right room but the ammenities help to compensate. Final thing, the bartenters in the Foundation room make fantasic martinis and are a lot of fun. Get up there if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Great style - great service - one NASTY little problem!!”
Reviews.Author: victoriacar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel in April 2005 for 4 nights. I'm giving this hotel an above average rating because it was excellent in terms of style, rooms, service. The one problem we encountered was a bed bug infestation. Yuck! I didn't let this affect the above average review, as I know it can happen at any hotel - it was certainly not due to a cleanliness issue. We had a suite booked, but when we arrived the front desk offered to give us a last minute deal to take a regular room instead. They must have been overbooked. We took them up on the offer. The style is excellent - modern with dark/light contrasting furniture and decor. Nice granite in the bathroom. Our room was a little small, but we knew what we were getting into when we took the regular room offer instead of the suite. The room was very clean. The staff was friendly and helpful as well. Its location within the Mandalay Bay is convenient. Unfortunately The Hotel doesn't have its own pool, so you share use of the Mandalay Bay "Beach". They do need a bigger pool area - it was WAY overcrowded. It looks like they tried to alleviate this by building a second, separate pool area, but it's kind of out of the way and not very interesting (it's just a pool with a bar and some lounge chairs). As I said earlier, the only issue we had was with bed bugs! I found a couple small flat reddish bugs tumbled up in the duvet toward the end of our stay. I didn't think too much about them - I just flushed them away. The next day (getting home), my husband and I had bites all over our arms. Trailing from our fingers to elbows in neat little lines. I started looking on the web and found that, sure enough, those were bed bugs! Ewww! But we survived, the bites healed, we moved on. I'm sure the hotel was responsive in taking care of the issue (we have not been back to find out!), but we honestly probably won't be staying there again when there are so many other hotels in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: agovan
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! So far the best hotel I stayed in Vegas so far. My friends and I drove down Sat morning while it was still dark on Thanksgiving weekend. We were suprised that there was no crowd. We got a super early checkin 8am! The front staff were really friendly and courteous. We also got a complimentary very late check out. Awesome hotel and awesome service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time at the Hotel at Mandalay Bay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel at Mandalay bay on November 4th. Originally, I had made reservations for a regular room on Vegas.com, but came to find out that for the same price, we could have gotten a honeymoon suite room for the same price if booked on the hotel's own website. I called and asked for an updgrade upon check-in. Upon arrival, the front desk clerk informed me that they were out of non-smoking honeymoon suites. After inquiring with her manager, they decided to put us in the penthouse suite. Not only was the room amazing, but the desk clerk was wonderful to us. Her customer service skills and attitiude were professional, attentive, and courteous. My fiancee and I were in Vegas for only one night for a shotgun wedding, and the accomodations and staff at the Mandalay Bay made it one special night for us. Our room was appointed with the best furnishings, toiletries, and a spectacular view. We will be staying at the Hotel at Mandaly Bay whenever possible!

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite Las Vegas Property!”
Reviews.Author: HiTravelerKapolei
Reviews.Content: Just returned last night from a week in Las Vegas. We fly to Las Vegas about 3 times a year from Hawaii. This hotel has superseded my favorite, The Venetian, for its prompt valet, quick room service & carefully thought out interior, including the floor nightlight in the bathroom & the powder room off the living room. We were called upon arrival to ensure all was to our satisfaction. I love the modern, Metropolitan decor that so reminds us of our last New York trip. My fiance especially likes the separate bedroom allowing him to watch football on the living room flat screen while I watch something more to my interest on the bedroom flat screen. The outstanding Gilchrist & Soames toiletries should've been replaced daily by the maid. The Casino at Mandalay Bay is only a brief indoor stroll. I especially liked the quiet of this property vs. the chaotic pandemonium in others. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite”
Reviews.Author: ghperezpacific
Reviews.Content: We stayed at THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay for the thanksgiving week. The hotel is top notch. The rooms were very modern and clean. I was very impressed with THE Hotel and I recommend it to anyone who wants quality.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect room”
Reviews.Author: bee-bum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel over the American Thanksgiving week-end and had a great time. I was travelling with my sisters and niece and the hotel room was perfect for the 4 of us to share. We were allowed to check into our rooom at 8:45a.m on wed morning and had nothing but good experiences with all the staff. The Hotel is a bit of a distance from some of the other hotels so be prepared to spend some time or money travelling to the fashion show mall or some of the other hotels which are mid strip.

Reviews.Title: “Swank Digs on Southern End of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: SusanOb75
Reviews.Content: Cool, understated (earth tones/dark woods) decor in spacious luxury suites and urban/modernist chic provided here. Plasma (LCD?) screen TV. Lots of black, somewhat cave-bunkerlike. Comfy lounge/cafe area, away from the din of the nearby Mandalay Bay casino. Friendly, efficient staff. Room service food quality is average; good food and atmosphere at House of Blues, great food and ambience at 3950, great vodka (over 100 varieties) and atmosphere at Red Square - all a 3 minute walk from TheHotel. The Bathhouse Spa is wonderful - don't miss it! A little inconvenient if you want to stroll around the center Strip area - taking the tram to Excalibur, crossing over to the MGM Grand to catch the monorail to head 2 to 3 stations north might take about 20 minutes. Would stay here again for the $149-169 special!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas in October 05 and was excited enough about going. But lets face it who wouldnt be. This Hotel is simply in the top three. The rooms are out of this world and you will be looked after from the moment you step foot in the hotel. I just can not fault the hotel it has everything and if it doesn't then they will get it for you. The casino is a short walk from these luxury rooms so there is no noise and the staff are always on hand to help. If you get a chance to stay here then dont think twice. Although The bellagio and the Venetian are great hotels they can be fairly steep in price. You get the same quality in this hotel for value for money and you get to spend your time like a high flyer!!

Reviews.Title: “Service could use some help”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, we had a very nice time. But, when we were registering the lady was very rude and said all their regular suite rooms were full so she had to put us in a regular room (which we thought the whole hotel was suites.) We asked why since we had made our reservation about 3 months in advance and called to confirm a day before our trip. She said "well, things happen, but I'll give you the difference back" Well the room was just like any other hotel room, nothing special, we could have stayed somewhere else for a lot cheaper and probably with more friendly people. The casinos were nice and we liked how we were part of MandalayBay. So everything else was fine but we were very dissapointed about the room because that was the main reason why we were staying there.

Reviews.Title: “In love with TheHotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: TheHotel was amazing... we checked in early and were given a corner suite... which was so beautiful with lots of windows... me and my husband took a bath in the giant bath tub (easily fits two people)... and then headed into the vegas strip for some fun... later that night around midnight, when we got back to our room, we ordered room service for dinner... it was some of the best food we ever ate... then in the morning we called down to get an extended check out time which they gave us without any hesitation... we didn't have to check out untill 1pm... all in all... our stay there was fantastic... the staff were all the most polite and nice people... i have heard some bad things about TheHotel... but we went for one night in the off-peak season on a sunday... so it wasn't crowded at all and there was never a line for a cab anywhere in vegas... so i recommend TheHotel for anyone who wants to get away from the vegas lights, without being away from vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Oh, baby! Worth it.”
Reviews.Author: vnogrl
Reviews.Content: Much quieter than most resorts due to lovely lack of gaming. Staff are incredibly polite; immaculate suite; nifty amenities; cool toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel at Mandalay Bay”
Reviews.Author: jetwhhs
Reviews.Content: The suite we had was absolutely spotless. The decor was a little to contemporary for my taste. We had a nice view of the strip. Room service was excellent. The coffee shop and bar in the lobby were convenient and satisfactory. The staff very helpful and courteous at all times. The restaurants were expensive but worth the price. I was disappointed with The House of Blues food. Just adequate. Overall a fun experience. I would definitely stay at The Hotel again. Be ready to walk a great deal or take a cab.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest in LV”
Reviews.Author: machen
Reviews.Content: I'm a believer. Without going into a lot of detail, everything about this place was top notch and wonderful: decor in the guest suites and public spaces, furniture comfort (a completely different thing than decor) the food, and service (mostly). The hotel's association with Mandalay Bay gives guests full access to one of better, more upscale hotels with great amenities. The pool facility at Mandalay Bay is the best on the Strip. The spa on the second floor is beautiful, well-laid out, and staffed attentively. My wife liked her massage and other treatments but thought they were a bit pricey for what they were. Oh well. The gym was small but complete. The nominal daily spa/gym fee was annoying but was successful in minimizing traffic, so the facility was actually very calming and serene. Shopping amenities at THEhotel (as it calls itself) are limited to things that you'd need immediately: bottled water, Starbuck's coffee, a bar. However, excellent shopping is one corridor away at the Mandalay Bay. The food at the little restaurant onsite was very good and reasonably priced, which brings me to my only beef with this place. The morning we arrived, I got up early and headed down for breakfast and was told by the rather insolent hostess that "We're not open." She did NOT voluteer that they were going to open in just five minutes. Instead, she waved me off to a place called "Raffles," Mandalay Bay's 24-hour coffee shop on the FAR end of adjacent hotel. Returning from my expensive, Denny's-like breakfast, when I saw the yummy breakfast my parents were eating in the dining room of our own hotel, I got really mad at that hostess. I know it's a small thing, but unfortunately it stayed with me.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ssnacksUSA
Reviews.Content: I am a pretty fickle customer and I was extremely impressed with The Hotel at Mandalay Bay (not to be confused with Mandalay Bay, the main hotel). The room was the nicest in which I have stayed anywhere, Las Vegas or otherwise. I had a standard room, which is a suite, with a separate living room, bedroom and two bathrooms. You definitely get the idea that they are trying to copy Starwood's W Hotel chain, but since there is not a W Hotel in Las Vegas, it seems fair. The restaurant in the lobby was nice and reasonably priced for Las Vegas. Breakfast plates were about $10 although I did not check the lunch and dinner menus. The food was good, but not great. About the only complaint that I had was that the pool, which is actually part of Mandalay Bay, was quite far from The Hotel at Mandalay Bay. You needed to go through the casino and over to the Mandalay Bay elevators near their reception desk. Also, the hot water in the shower would not maintain a constant temperature even when bathing at non-peak times. Shockingly, the parking lot was easy to access and it was complementary. You walk out the main exit and into the parking garage. If you are looking for a great place to stay, I highly recommend The Hotel at Mandalay Bay. Be careful that you are not booking Mandalay Bay, the main hotel. The main hotel is not bad, but The Hotel at Mandalay Bay is so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo for The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Hotel with a colleague to attend a conference. Front desk staff was helpful, courteous and very accommodating. The rooms were clean and housekeeping readily provides extra towels, hangers and toiletries. Limited concierge services but I had heard this before hand so I didn't expect much. The woman who attempted to help arrange dinner and show reservations had limited knowledge, but made a good effort to help. Room service was timely and the food was hot and appetizing. The view from MIX on the top floor was spectacular...Worth taking the elevator ride. Prepare yourself for outrageous prices for drinks. Staff here as previously mentioned is haughty and cold. We ate at the buffet restaurant for lunch. It was good not great, there are better on the strip. I loved the almond croissants at the coffee place in the lobby. Be prepared, you will need to walk ALOT. The casino, tram entrance, pools and restaurants are a distance from the rooms. Do try the spa at The Hotel. It is beautiful restful and relaxing. I would strongly recommend The Hotel if you want a respite from the noise and craziness of The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: TheHotel is a great place to stay. I put up a little extra money to get an above average room and I was not dissapointed. The decor is gorgeous and the bath products are awesome. I came home and ordered some right away. The beds are the most comfortable that I have ever slept in. I always take my pillow with me but no need here, the pillows were fabulous. I will be getting some of those as well. Check in was quick and staff was extremely friendly. Housekeeping was ok, the last day no towels were left in our room but you do get 2 great robes to wear around(and complimentary houseshoes!!!). The walk to the casino is not bad. You get used to walking, you do it alot in Vegas. The casino is laid out great and utilize the tram from Mandalay Bay to Excalibur. It cuts out alot of walking. The House of Blues restaurant is excellent. Service is a little slow but well worth the wait. We ate there every day! The casino is great and blackjack dealers are very friendly and helpful. Look for Maria Overall stay was wonderful and will definately visit again. If you have any questions or would like any suggestions please feel free to e-mail me.

Reviews.Title: “In the elevator there is a camera, so they know you're there. They always know.”
Reviews.Author: INFJ
Reviews.Content: I am not Mr. Peanut. I was stressed at work. I went to this hotel. I liked it. Don't hurt me Mr. Fruitbowl! I needed some time off. SRESS KILLS! Where's my shower curtain?! I was happy at this The Hotel. I wore a shower curtain to work. They let me have a vacation. The Hotel made me happy. A woman gave me a ticket to see the ABBA play. It was serendipitous. The woman was my wife. She's pretty. She calls me eccentric. I like that. The hotel room was big. I'm writing this to give you some important information if you go to The Hotel: Bring a DVD. There is a huge plasma TV and a DVD player but no DVD. I looked everywhere for a DVD but there was none. While I was searching I found in the room they were selling a candy bar for $5.00. I took a picture to prove it. I'm writing this to warn you that candy bars cost $5.00! I went to a restaurant. There was a bar with a statue of a Russian with no head! I wish I'd have brought the DVD "Sleepy Hollow" because that would have been appropriate. I want to go back. I am at work now. People would be starring at me, but I am invisible today.

Reviews.Title: “We liked the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjb225
Reviews.Content: The wife and I stayed here for our 8th Anniversary. We liked the room, only real problem was the plasma TV in the livingroom didn't work and it took a couple of days to fix it. Everything else was good. We had a good view of the strip, looking north. The hike to the pool from the hotel is considerable, but we called it our exercise for the day. We got massages and worked out at the SPA. The massages were good, not the best we've ever had. I didn't like the SPA overall, just didn't care for the feel of it. I like SPA Mandalay much better. We had breakfast at the coffee shop that is between the Hotel and Mandalay Bay, which is good, but I thought very expensive, even by Vegas Standards. I know we weren't at a $5 buffet, but $40 for breakgfast for 2 every morning, with tip, seemed high to me. That did include omlettes, juices, coffee, etc and was excellent but as I said expensive. We have stayed at the Four Seasons twice at the top of Mandalay Bay, it is much nicer, but a lot more. It is certainly a nice place, I would make everyone aware though, it you're coming to Vegas to see the entire Strip, this is not the place to stay, because it's at the far South end of the Strip and quite a distance from all the other top places.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!!! The Best Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: themitchells
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at 'thehotel' as part of our Honeymoon, a road trip around the states. During the trip we stayed four 5* hotels including the 'Spanish Inn on the Green' and the 'Beverley Hills Luxe' none of which lived up to 'thehotel'. Our suite was a good size with top notch decor and gadgets including a 5ft Plasma Screen, two bathrooms, plasma TV in the bathroom which had the biggest bath ever.... my new wife was able to 'tred water' it was that big!!! thehotel was smart, trendy, amazing value mid-week and a different league to the Ballagio etc etc where we have been before. One of the finest bits of the hotel has to be the 'Mix Restaurant'. 60+ floors up alfresco dining, amazing view with even better food and service!!! make a trip, it's quite pricey but worth every penny!!

Reviews.Title: “I'd do it again”
Reviews.Author: harrison38
Reviews.Content: Just checking out this morning. In town for VEGOOSE. THE hotel @ Mandalay worked great for us. Great housekeeping, good size rooms, great food choices. I wouldn't waste a lot of time or money at Mix, a lot of wannabees and the door staff does the "we'll treat you like dirt so you feel lucky to be here". Alway's cracks me up when a clerk takes that attitude, but other than the poser's at Mix, every person we came in contact with from wait staff to front desk was very friendly and helpful. We liked being a little further down the strip, you don't get the herds of people waddling through the casino. The casino is laid out such that you never feel too crowded. You do have to do a fair amount of walking to get from THE hotel to Mandalay restaurants, but we expected that... you have to walk a lot in Vegas. When we first got to our room, my wife commented on how clean it was, the lay out is perfect, however, there were a few burnt out bulbs and the latch on the front door was off. Called the front desk, who relayed the info to engineering and by the time we got back later that night (early morning), everything was perfect. If you didn't want to leave the resort (to check out the others, or see a show somewhere else), you'd never have to leave this place !

Reviews.Title: “perfect wedding weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel the weekend we got married and have nothing but great things to say. The rooms were beautiful and huge (although i will admit a little bit dark for my preference), the bathroom products wonderful, housekeeping did an excellent job keeping the room nice. The concierge was very helpful everytime we called, which was a contrast to my friends staying at Mandalay Bay. I have also recently stayed at the suites in the Venetian, and think The Hotel is nicer, plus you get the wonderful pool associated with Mandalay Bay. The only negative about this hotel is that it is located at the very end of the strip, so if you plan on hitting lots of hotels, casinos, or clubs throughout your stay, you may want to stay someplace more centrally located. Overall a great choice in Las Vegas!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nickled and Dimed”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelers1
Reviews.Content: I really liked staying at the Mandalay Bay. We had a suite which was beautiful and the beds are the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The whole property is very pretty with nice bars and restaurants. My issue with the Mandalay Bay is how they nickle and dime you in other areas. Our room was $300/night but the gym is not free. You have to pay $20 to use the gym! The pool is nice with a lazy river and wave pool but again you have to pay $20 to rent a flotation device. I feel like some of these amenities should be included for free (particularly the gym) because the room rates are high enough.

Reviews.Title: “Typical MGM owenership disapointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night due to airline problems from the East coast.The suite was very large but with minimal space for storing clothing if staying a week.The light over the safe was out...called down and noone replaced the bulb.Day two no washcloths from room service.the TV clickers were different for the two large tvs.Next the note pads ...one had no notepaper just a pencil,not even a pen...Gambling in the Baccarat Pit...for drinks...bar whiskey when top shelf is asked for...real bush league..The worse cut of all..returned after being away all day and the door to the room was not locked...housekeeping again...the air cylinder atop the door needed adjustment...luckily nothing was missing...The positives...an assortment of good restaurants and Excellent valet people...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, but......”
Reviews.Author: vegaswedding05
Reviews.Content: THE hotel at Mandalay Bay is massive! My husband and I stayed there last week for our wedding/honeymoon and it was wonderful. We would definitely stay there again, although next time we are going to try somewhere else just for the experience. This hotel is quite possibly the nicest hotel we have ever stayed in. The rooms are 700 sq. ft. with two bathrooms, a bedroom, and a separate living area. We arrived at 11 a.m. and asked right away if our room was ready. It took a little while but eventually they let us check-in. It was so nice, after a 5 hour flight, to go right up to the room. The guests before us had taken anything that was not bolted down and none of it was replaced. We had to request everything from a robe, slippers, pen, stationery, etc. All of these things are standard and we should not have had to request them. One other thing that kept our experience from being perfect is a problem we had with a room credit. We prepaid our room bill due to the nature of our stay.
