It turns out that we overpaid and were not told until the time we checked-in. We were told we could just use to credit for room service, etc. Well, when we tried to use the credit for room service they would not allow us too. It took some argument but we were able to get the overpayment credited back to our credit card. The views from our room were spectacular. We had floor to ceiling windows in the living room and bedroom. From the living room you could see the strip and from the bedroom you could see the mountains, the Luxor, and Mandalay Bay. There is a huge plasma tv in the living room and bedroom. There is also an LCD tv in the bathroom so that you can take a bath in the huge, deep tub, and watch tv at the same time. Very relaxing. The room had 1 and 1/2 baths. The full bath had a large shower, a huge tub, two sinks, plenty of counter space and the toilet had it's own "room." THE Lounge at THE hotel is a great place to hang out. The waitresses are very friendly and the furnishings are very comfortable. Hope this was helpful. Please contact me if you have questions. I would be more than happy to answer.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel equals pretentious and bad service!”
Reviews.Author: baseballmom
Reviews.Content: After reviewing many properties in Las Vegas, we decided to stay at The Hotel in Mandalay Bay for my 40th birthday celebration. We had a large group of other couples going. Most elected to stay at the Mandalay Bay Hotel. My husband and I decided to stay at this hotel because it was a special occasion and we wanted something extra special. FORGET IT!!!! I wish so badely we had just saved the money and stayed at Mandalay Bay instead. First of all, we checked in and were given our room , which right away I thought was very mediocre. The bathroom had a small tub and shower and was just very stark. The rooms are very dim...decor sleek and minimal. But so dark...you may as well be in a tunnel rather than a hotel room. Furthermore, the lights in the bathroom were out. After about an hour in our room someone from maintanence just opened the door to the living room and announced they were from engineering and that they had come to fix the bathroom lighting. I had not even called them...so thanks for the prompt attention to detail...but try knocking before you just enter a room which is occupied. Needless to say...we were very startled...and not dressed at the time! Good thing there is an entry into the living room first. The gentleman just lingered there for a minute after we told him to get out...and then finally left! I have stayed in many many hotels in my life...some of them very fine...and this has never happened...not even in the crummy ones. This is an invasion of privacy big big time! After our first very average nights stay here we found out that my other friends who were also staying in this hotel had a very different room than us. Their room had a HUGE bathroom with a beautiful tub and shower. We finally realized (too late) that we had been given a handicapped accessible room with a very small bathroom and living room. I was furious! Why were we not informed at the time we checked in that this was the room we were paying the "extra" money for??? And by the way, our friends checked in hours after us...so they couldn't tell us that there was an availability issue. When we did finally go downstairs to complain...they acted like they could care less. The front desk and staff there are very arrogant and seem to think they are above it all. I think the reason the hotel is so dimly lit has nothing to do with the hip and chic atmosphere they are trying to create. It has more to do with the fact that they are trying to cover up the mediocrity that is really their hotel! It also boasts about having a seperate entrance from the other parts of Mandalay Bay. The seperate entrance is if you leave the property and go elsewhere in Vegas. If you are going to the Casino, or the pool or spa....you will have to walk 10 miles thru the other hotel anyway...so there really isn't a seperate entrance. Eventually we were given a very small compensation for our troubles. No where near where it should have been for so many complaints. Do yourself a favor...stay in the Mandalay Bay instead...it's beautiful and it's a lot less money...and you'll be more hip than at The Hotel, a pretentious bore! Thanks but we will NEVER be that mediocre again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mandalay Bay from October 8-13. Before we went I check trip advisor to see what people were saying about the Mandalay. After reading some of the review I have to say that I was a bit concerned, there seemed to be a lot of complaints. After staying there for a week I can not figure out why? First I read about the nightmare check in. We had NO PROBLEMS with check in. We arrived at 10 am we were told that our room would be ready in a half hour but instead it was ready in less than 10 mins! I read that the front desk and housekeeping staff were rude... well, they were wonderful with us! Since my husband was attending a convention I choose to sleep in, leaving the "Do Not Disturb" sign on most of the day. Housekeeping went as far as to call me later in the day to see if I wanted them to come clean the room and asked what time would be best FOR ME! At one point I was walking towards my room and passed a housekeeping crew (which by the way greeted me EVERYTIME I passed them!) I asked them if I could get two feather pillows when they had a minute and I was told that it was no problem they would bring them right away, I walked down the hall, entered my room and before I could turn the TV on they were at my door! Our experience at the Mandalay Bay was AWESOME! We were pampered and treated wonderfully. I don't have anything negative to say about them. After staying there and seeing some of the other guest the conclusion I came to was that there are a lot of "snobby" people staying there. The type that would complain no matter what. The type of people that nothing would make them happy. It is just one of those things that you have to deal with when you stay at a 4 or 5 star hotel. We had the same type of thing went we stayed at the Grand Lido in Negril Jamaica, there was a couple that actually complained to the hotel that they didn't feel they should have to carry their own plates from the buffet to their table! The hotel actually had two people follow them around the buffet and after the fixed their plates they would set their plates down and walk to their table without a word! No thank you NOTHING! And after treating the staff like their personal slaves they STILL complained that they were not quick enough! Some people are just spoiled children in adult bodies, nothing will ever be good enough for them. So when you read any negative reviews keep in mind that most people will treat you the same way you treat them and in most cases the people complaining probably treated the staff poorly. One more thing, if you do stay at the Mandalay Bay or even if you don't, be sure to go to the House of Blues in the hotel! We were lucky enough to attend a private party there and treated to a night of GREAT music with the house band.... which btw is Jim Belushi's band! They were FANTASTIC! I have pictures posted on my Flickr site if you want to see them just go here --------------------

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: TheHotel At Mandalay is paradise....It was like living on cloud nine. Everything from the room including the size, the bathrooms(the bathroom products), the room service (on the expensive side....but you're on vacation) to the hotel service. We got a really good package wich entitled us to splurge on the extras. We ordered breakfast every morning (if you call 11:00 morning) which wasn't cheap..aprox $35.00 for two and we also used the mini bar. Also we charged a lot to the room (don't loose your vip card or you'll be screwed). TheHotel has this nifty little thing on the tv that allows you to see everything that you charge to your room as you charge it. As for the room itself, it was cleaned spotlessly everyday...couldn't ask for anything better. The beds were like sleeping on a cloud. The living room couch even can be used as a make shift bed which is almost the size of a double bed and very comfy.. The main bathroom has this huge tub (for2) a glass shower, double sinks and a private toilet...phone and tv are also in the main bathroom...the products are so heavenly, shampoo, bubble bath, soap...ect. There is also a little powder room when you first come into the suite. There is a lovely mini bar, and you are in vegas so you are going to pay a little on the high side but as i said if you get a good package deal then you can spend a little on the extras. The other dreamy place about this hotel is the beach....it actually belongs to the parent hotel (The Mandalay Bay Resort and Hotel). This is like being in true paradise. The only problem I had was the slight noise coming from TheMix, a night club on the top floor...if you go ask for a room on the lower floors. The next time i go to vegas there isn't anywhere else i will stay. TheHotel is the only hotel anyone wanting to experience true paradise should

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Interior But.........”
Reviews.Author: LLynn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at TheHotel this past weekend. We are regular Vegas visitors and were glad to have a new experience. The rooms are large and spacious. The amenities inside the hotel are perfect and housekeeping is timely. We were disappointed in our view - we were promised a view of the strip but ended up facing the highway. At least there were mountains we could see. We would never stay here again, however. For $300 (or more) per night we were not able to ever get a seat at the pool. This is over a three day stay. My husband was very disappointed as we come from a northern climate and October is cold in Michigan. His 40th B'day weekend was very much compromised because of our inability to get a seat anywhere in the entire campus. We walked around the perimeter at least 3-4 times/day looking for two lounge chairs together and then ended up sitting on the cement near the lazy river. Cocktail waitresses are stressed out and hard to find. Also, the other problem with the location of TheHOtel is the tremendous amount of money spent on taxis to get from one place to another. It is so far down the strip that in evening clothes it would be impossible to get to The Mirage/TI etc by walking. So for pool and location - I would not give TheHotel high marks.

Reviews.Title: “Best Modern Hotel I've Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: simonf
Reviews.Content: We had a suite on 29th floor with a great view of the Luxor next door. Room really was great (best modern room so far) - sitting room with plasma TV, bedroom, 1.5 baths. Huge master bath with LCD TV and separate shower & batch. Bar area towards reception pretty good, look for pool tables there. Pool area pleasant but shared with the main Mandalay bay hotel so busy unless you opt for the adults only area at $50 guys / $10 girls (which was cool after I recovered from the sticker shock!). The bar in the center of the casino area was good with live music. Rest of the Mandalay bay facilities we tried (top floor bar/restaurant, night club etc, casino itself) seemed so-so and pricey - had better luck taking the free railway to other places.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel, better than expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited THEhotel Oct 12 - 16. This was our 6th trip to Vegas. We have stayed at Bellagio (twice), Paris, Aladdin and Mandalay Bay. We greatly enjoyed our visit this trip. I will try to hit on all the points I can, because that helped me make my trip to THEhotel better was reading the reviews from others. Cab ride to THEhotel - make sure you tell your driver several times to take you to THEhotel entrance. If you are not clear about it, they will take you to the Mandalay Bay entrance, then you have 1/2 mile walk with your luggage to the registration. We had read about that, and the driver from the airport tried to take us to the Mandalay entrance. We saw a lot of other guest roaming through the casino with their luggage who didn't know to ask specific. The drivers do it on purpose, bacasue there are not that many people to pick up at the other drop off. Check in - I called to confirm my reservations 3 times during the day of check in bacause we were checking in at midnight and had read the horror stories. Our check in went with out problem. I tried hard to get a strip view and we did, however you need to be on at least the 25 floor to see over the Luxor. So make sure if you ask for a strip view, ask for a floor higher than 25. (The $20 trick got the strip view, not over the Luxor view). Room - Great room. The separation of the living and bedroom was great. I watch TV while my wife got dressed in separate rooms. Yes there is a HUGE plasma TV in the living room, but it is not feed with digital cable so you cannot get plasma technology without the digital cable, so it looks like a regular TV, only bigger. The large bathroom was great. Big tub and shower. Having a 1/2 bath in the living room was great. I set up my stuff in there, that way she could have the whole bathroom to herself. Closet space was just fine. There is plenty of room unless you bring 6 suitcases. The bed was the best thing. It compairs to a Heavenly Bed if you are familiar with the Westin. Casino - You use the casino at the Mandalay Bay. My wife and I have never been a fan of the MB casino and this trip proved no different. High limits on thier table games ($15 min). Even at the empty tables, we begged them to drop the min to $10 and no luck. The good thing is that there is a walk thru to the Luxor where we found smaller minimums, plus our ONE card can be used at the Luxor for comps, etc. Dining - we ate at the 24 hour Cafe our first night. It was 2:30 am. The place was 50% full. We sat for 30 minute and noone had helped us. The table next to us had been there an hour and just gotten their food. We actually bought their quesadilla from them for $20 and left. Very poor service at this cafe. We also ate at the Sushi Bar in the casino. Bill was $100 for normal sushi order and one of the worst I have had. I don't recommend this place. 3950 restaurant we ate at on the 3rd night. I really enjoyed this place. Great service and food. First class place. Pool - MB has the best pool area out there on the strip. It has something for all ages. We chose the Moorea Beach Club on Friday of our visit. The reason was because it is an over 21 only pool. Great place, we stayed for over 6 hours and had a very relaxing time. Drinks are too expensive, but so what. Yes the pool did have some topless sunbathers, but it is not a sexual thing. It's not like a Cinemax movie or anything, so don't expect that. The walk to the pool is fine. Just go through the convention center, it will save you 10 minutes. SPA - my wife had a message and she said it was great, one of the best. I hung out in the men spa for an hour while she was busy. Sap had everything you could want and the prices were reasonable. Overall - Very modern, mature place to stay. For the price, we got more than expected. Bottom line...we did see some "unhappy" people similar to what I had read about, but I would not treat these people kindly either. Most of the people who felt that they were treated bad had a bad additude. "treat me like royalty becasue I am in Las Vegas" personality is what we saw. My wife and i put a smile on our face and were polite when we had a request and each time we were given what we thought was fair from the staff at THEhotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unreliable”
Reviews.Author: Denveresque
Reviews.Content: We reserved a suite (and paid a one night deposit) at THEHotel in May '05, for an October Vegas trip to attend the Grand Sumo Tournament at the Mandalay Bay. My boyfriend and I do not gamble and wanted to avoid maneuvering through large and crowded casinos every day just to get to our suite or leave the property, so the THEHotel was perfect for us. We also prefer a modern, minimalist decor, and again THEHotel was ideal for our requirements. The morning before we headed out to Las Vegas, I read the negative review on this site regarding THEHotel not honoring its reservations. I became concerned and called the hotel that morning to confirm our reservation and assure them that we were checking in that night. The phone attendant confirmed our reservation and uttered the obligatory "looking forward to welcoming you". We arrived at THEHotel a little before 6pm, and waited in line to check in. Many parties checked in ahead of us without incident, and another 3 parties were checking in at the desk at the same time we were. When the attendant found our reservation, she excused herself and retreated to the back office. Meanwhile, the other guests around us were continuing to check in. When the attendant returned, she cheerfully announced that a suite was prepared for us at the Mandalay Bay hotel, as though she was announcing that we had just hit the jackpot. I was offended by how the bad news of the cancellation of our confirmed reservation was dressed up and served up to as as good news, something we should be grateful for. My boyfriend and I objected, and indicated that we did not want to stay at the Mandalay Bay, but at THEHotel which we had selected after careful research, had reserved and paid a deposit on six months earlier, and had confirmed that same morning. The matter was escalated to a supervisor, who apologized about the inconvenience and told us that they had exceeded capacity. I complained that they were meanwhile checking more people in, including those who came up to the front desk after us, and that they obviously had rooms to give away to other guests. After much unpleasantries and an interminable run-around, they did not give us our room, and gave us a suite at the Mandalay Bay hotel. This is one atrociously run hotel with an arrogant and incompetent management. There is nothing worse for a traveler to arrive and have his or her reservation unilaterally and summarily revoked. That put a damper on our entire trip. We did not appreciate the shoddy treatment we received at THEHotel. Would they have refunded our one-night deposit had we no-showed, even while they had secretly and uncereminously cancelled our reservation? Not a chance. We will never return, and don't recommend this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “THE HOTEL is THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: J.L.B.2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from October 2 to 5th. We arrived at 10 a.m. and stood in line less than 5 minutes. We were given our keys to our amazing suite! The room was quiet (didn't hear a sound), clean and better than expected. They don't mention the huge soaking tub, bath and a half, double sinks and incredible BATHE products! We went up to MIX (before 10 p.m. cover charge) for a drink and fantastic view. The ride up alone in a glass elevator to the 64th floor is worth it. There is an outdoor patio with lounge chairs (romantic and relaxing). A tram brings you to the Luxor and Excalibur where you can easily walk across the street to New York New York or others.The Red Square vodka bar is not to be missed. The bar is made of ice and keeps your vodka or martini at the perfect temp.(Go really early, by 6 the bar was full on a Tues.) This hotel is for couples. I love kids (have 3), but leave them at home and relax and enjoy your companion!!!!

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: NYCMom
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is an expensive hotel. But everything about it--from the understated elegance and spaciousness to the bath amenities to the three plasma televisions in the suite to the comfortable beds, extra half bath, and quality towels and linens--was a notch above most other hotels in Vegas and well worth the extra expense. It was wonderful having a separate living room with plenty of seating and an extra bath. The main bathroom was huge and luxurious with tons of storage space. Someone else complained about the clothing storage space in the room but there were two huge lighted closets with lots of shelves and hooks and tons of hangers, plus an armoire with six drawers. We had more than enough space for four people's wardrobes for the week. We checked in early afternoon on a Saturday and got a nice strip view and quiet room on the thirteenth floor. The elevators are the best and fastest I've ever encountered anywhere (and I live in NYC). You never had to wait more than a few seconds for one to arrive. Ever. I loved that there were separate climate controls in the bedroom and living room as my husband likes arctic temps and likes to stay up late watching television and I love to be cozy and read in bed. We tipped the maid well each day and got extra towels as requested, plentiful toiletries, and all the soap was replaced each day with fresh, wrapped bars. Everything was spotless. I loved the convenience of the coffee bar a few feet from the elevators--you could dash down and grab a cup first thing in the morning. The lobby was on the small side for Vegas--a big plus IMO. It was very quiet and manageable, not jammed with tourists. If you want a crowded "extravaganza" hotel, you need to go elsewhere. This was convenient--everything you needed--valet, taxis, registration, bar, coffee, restaurant, sundries shop--was a few steps from the elevator. If you've been to Vegas, you know this isn't the norm. This reminded me of a NYC boutique hotel. We had our two well-behaved children with us and everyone was pleasant and friendly to them; I was needlessly worried in advance about the level of sophistication and the staff's reaction to kids. The pool was a pleasant walk away--I could see where it would be a problem for the elderly, toddlers, or anyone not in decent shape or used to physical activity. But we enjoyed the walk and were glad our room wasn't in proximity to the hordes of people, nois and action by the pool. Because there have been so many complaints about service at THEhotel, I want to mention that the desk staff was really friendly, and the room service waiter on Saturday night was wonderful, as was the waiter in the restaurant Sunday morning--just extra personable and very accomodating. The casino and Mandalay Place mall were handy--nearby but not in the way. And the monorail and food court in the Luxor came in handy. Everyone in THEhotel itself was efficient and pleasant. My one complaint: Valet parking cracked a taillight on our rental car (we hadn't used it the entire time we were there, since checking in) and we didn't realize it until we were 1/2 hour away. Bottom line: if you want a bargain or a flashy, typical Vegas experience, this isn't the place for you. But if you enjoy the finer things in life and don't mind paying for them, I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: KeithTalent
Reviews.Content: Had 3 nights here - our first trip to Vegas. Extremely impressed - quiet, immaculate room, which was much bigger than we needed. Helpful staff, hip ambience, and great facilities - we especially enjoyed the views and cocktails in the Mix bar, where you can sit outside on the roof and look north up the Strip. No bad points to note, although it's at one extreme of the Strip so can be a hike to get anywhere else. I don't normally give 5 star reviews, but this is was great, and well deserved.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis”
Reviews.Author: shopvp
Reviews.Content: Quiet, relatively smoke-free, cool. Nice suites with 1 and a half baths. Extra half bath in the the living room area is great when traveling with friends or family. Flat panel TV's in the living room, bed room and bath. Security guards posted at the elevator banks in the evening through early morning so that only key pass holders can get thru. For those who dont have their laptops with them, computers and printer are available near the front desk for checking-in to your airline and printing your boarding passes. If you want to be able to get away from the chaos of Vegas some time during your stay, go to The Hotel. For those who like the feel of Grand Central Station at rush hour throughout their stay, go to the Bellagio or the Wynn. We'll definitely be back to The Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are correct”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well - the reviews are pretty accurate. The rooms are cool, modern, and bigger than my studio aptartment. The service - however is awful. Upon our arrival we requested a room with a strip view. The front desk said that was fine but that it wouldn't be ready until between 3:00 and 5:00. It was 2:00ish so we decided to just walk around and check things out for a while and come back closer to 5:00. We had left our bags with the bell desk at Manafaly Bay (the shuttle dropped us off at the wrong entrance). We went up to our room at 4:45 excited to get unpacked and get ready for dinner. I was very suprised to find that my room was deadbolted from the other side and that I could hear someone talking on their cell phone inside. My boyfriend and I went downstairs to the front desk and they siad that the occupant had requested a late check out and hadn't checked out yet. Are you kidding me? They gave us a new room and we went back upstairs. Well the new room was empty which was a start. However, the former occupants room keys were on the nightstand and there was used soap in the shower and bathroom. Yuck. I hope that they at least changed the sheets. The rest of our stay was fine - our room was cleaned really late in the day but we didn't really care. Our bathroom smelled awful and smelled worse as the trip went on. Monday morning we woke up to a very loud noise and vibrating feeling that I thought was an earthquake! Our room was right next to the pump room which was doing its bi-weekly pumping. It was actually a good thing that it woke us up because we had forgotten to set an alarm the night before but not a very pleasent way for anyone to start their day. When we checked out we viewed our bill on the tv first whoch had over 300 hundred dollars worth of charges that weren't ours which the front desk removed no problem. Overall I would probaby not stay there again, unless they get their act together. Oh, and the walk to the pool is NOT that far. Quit complaining, lazies.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rhiannon254
Reviews.Content: This hotel is spectacular in many ways. It is visually amazing. The elevators are a little hard to find though. The suites (I had a "normal" one on the 4th floor) are top notch. Excellent linens, huge bathtubs (separate from the showers) 3 TVs - a flat screen in the bathroom may seem decadent until you are running late and are trying to catch the news. Service was also very good. I ate room service a couple of times. Highly recommend the waffle, definitely not the eggs benedict though. I have already recommended this hotel to my friends. There is no casino in this hotel - you need to take a 2 minute walk to Mandalay Bay for that. Sign up for their email blasts and you can get great rates!

Reviews.Title: “The best!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have been in Vegas several times, stayed at Bellagio, Caesar's, Mirage, Paris. This time we wanted to stay at Wynn, however, the opinions for the hotel were rated very low. We finally decided to go for THE HOTEL AT THE MANDALAY BAY. What a great decision. Best hotel, great rooms. Makes you feel at home. The room distribution is superb! his - her bathrooms, complete privacy. Very clean, 300+ thread count cotton sateen bed sheets, 3 tv, clean, huge bath tub. If you're in business trip there is an oversized desk with a fully functional business area, My husband loved it, his comment was that he could live in there. At night we went to floor 62 a great outdoors bar and a fancy, rather expensive restaurant. We didn't eat there but food is been prepared in an open kitchen by aprox 20 chefs. We can wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: LHill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Hotel on September 21 & 22. Despite having reserved a suite as early as July, upon arrival the desk clerk left us standing at check-in for a full 10 minutes while she disappeared into a back office. While waiting we observed that arrivals on either side of us were either in irrate, animated conversations with their clerks, or had been left waiting as we had. Upon our clerk's return we learned why. We (too) were told the suite we had booked was not available, due "to a convention", and that we were instead to be be put in an executive suite in the Mandalay Bay. Just as those other arrivals all up and down the desk (we counted 5 harried clerks; the arrival next to us had booked her room SIX MONTHS earlier), we declined, explaining that we had booked The Hotel because we wanted a quiet, upscale, non-casino atmosphere hotel, all of which we knew the Mandalay Bay was not. The clerk, like all of the other clerks, was clearly embarrassed and uncomfortable with what she had been instructed to do by management, was unable to explain how or why a "convention" had (obviously, and IF true) been booked after a great many single reservations had been made and in full knowledge those reservations would then not be honored, and could only continue to repeat that we would be getting an executive suite in the Mandalay Bay instead. Finally, I requested our $283 deposit be refunded, we would go elsewhere. Only then did she suggest The Hotel could offer a regular room...in The Hotel. This too, and equally obviously, had been management's instruction to its put-upon employees should a guest balk at what management was attempting to have them do. Weary from our flight, and equally weary of trying to get a straight answer as to how this could have happened, we said fine, we would take it. The clerk then said The Hotel would "comp" us the difference between the rate of the suite we had booked 3 months earlier and the regular room we were being provided(!). No offers of a complimentary dinner, or breakfast, nada. The room was upscale, nicely outfitted, certainly smaller than a suite but nevertheless satisfactory given the alternatives...until my wife discovered a hand towel with blood on it...and a washcloth with mascara smears. Now, they were neatly folded, so it is possible the previous guest folded them and they were thus not noted by housekeeping - but of course upon checkout EVERY piece of linen in EVERY room should be changed. In this room (4915) it had not been. My wife notified the front desk, in person. The front desk apologized, said housekeeping would be advised. That was it. Not really the reaction one would expect. Clearly, management of The Hotel had either booked a convention in full knowledge it would mean not honoring bookings already in place and for which deposits had been taken, or were engaging in classic bait-and-switch. A Motel 6 would not do either. Why a capably and responsibly managed hotel would do so is beyond my capacity to rationalize, however I can say that in our 2 days at The Hotel we saw no evidence of a convention whatsoever. We did see 2 small group meetings listed on a board, that was all. The Hotel did not seem overly busy to us. Based on our experience, and of what we observed other guests experiencing, we would strongly advise avoiding The Hotel until the management has been replaced. We intend to determine the ownership of the Mandalay Bay and relate our experience to them in writing, as well as the Las Vegas tourist authority, so that hopefully others will not be subject to the appalling treatment guests were on this occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Mandalay Bay are very comfortable and the restaurant selection is great. I was in the hotel for over a week (trade show trip) so I had a chance to really get to know the property and the only down side was the distance from the hotel to the LVCC. Otherwise, my stay was great. I especially enjoyed the fitness facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dfresh39
Reviews.Content: My wife & I just returned from 1 night at Mandalay Bay & 3 nights at THE Hotel. We changed our original plans and arrived Thursday, a day early due to Hurricane Rita. THE Hotel was sold out so we booked a room at Mandalay Bay to make switching rooms easier. Friday morning about 9:30am we went over to THE Hotel to find out how to switch rooms. They were very helpful and were able to check us out of Mandalay Bay as well as check in into our room right then. Housekeeping was in the room cleaning when we got up to it so we left our bags & went to breakfast at Mandalay Bay's buffet. Saturday we had breakfast at THE Cafe it was great. Housekeeping came everyday before 4:00 at least, because the room was always clean when we returned from the day's activities. We spent all day Sunday at Moorea Beach Club, that was the most fun of the trip. We really liked the powder room and Bar in the Living room area. I found the storage to be the same if not more than the standard rooms at the Bellagio. I had become really nervous about the cleanliness and service based on reviews here since I booked the room in June, but our experience was everything I expected and more. I liked this room much more than Bellagio, although I think I liked the Bellagio's casino just a little better. For our next trip I plan to return to THE Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, cool, sleek, beautiful”
Reviews.Author: KellerRacing
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas, so I have nothing to which I can compare, but I have stayed at a number of nice places in the US and abroad. THEhotel is definitely a very nice place, assuming that you're looking for something modern as opposed to more traditional (like what I would imagine you'd find at Four Seasons). (THEhotel reminds me a little of Delano in Miami, only with darker finishings and maybe not quite as minimal.) I'm not sure of the complaints about distance to the casino. From the hotel elevator to the casino entrance is about 100 yards. It is a slight walk to the pool area, but not enough to merit a complaint, in my opinion. I found the front desk helpful and pleasant, and the concierge was very helpful in securing VIP reservations at night spots. I never had a complaint about any staff, and the staff at the lobby bar was exceptional. I do not think this hotel is a good option for anyone with kids (not sure why you'd stay here with a small one), but if you're looking for a "hip" hotel, THEhotel appears to be a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Complete disregard”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel, nice and pretty but: after booking in advance for a king room, we got 2 queen beds with a view of a brick wall, no natural light. we had to change rooms twice more after really persevering with phonecalls and personal visits to the front desk. We were there for a wedding which we had to make sure we abandoned for two hours to finally get the room we had booked in the first place plus our minds were pretty taken up with it when we should have been relaxing. In all this change, we left our swimming gear on the back of the bathroom door of a vacated room- we reported this within three hours. We called the chambermaid, she said call security who said call the chambermaid who said call security etc etc, swim suits disappeared never to be seen again- and we were told it was our fault, case closed but they still sent a security guard up to fill in paperwork. I think they just threw our stuff away The upshot of this is, the staff do not care, the hotel is way too big for any degree of quality customer care, the departments do not liase with each other, the employees know that eventually you'll leave, and the management know for every disgruntled customer, there's enough of a turnover not to court customer loyalty- for now.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our 3 night stay. We were given the corner room but closet space was quite limited. Nice views though. It is a long walk to the pool and we found that it wasn't very well marked on their directional signs at Mandalay Bay. We also found very few layout maps - not even one in the room. The last issue was housekeeping. Not once in the three nights did they arrive. We called for extra pillows and towels which arrived promptly. We didn't want to stay awake waiting for the room to be cleaned and figured it would happen the next day. We were out of our room all day and came back tired again. By the second day, we gave up. I told the front desk and she said she would take note of it - not even an apology. I like the room size but am not sure about returning due to these issues. I did like the fact that we didn't have to walk through a casino to get to the elevators and our room. When we stayed at the Bellagio last year, it was always a hassle to get to our room from an outing.

Reviews.Title: “Spotty service, so-so suites”
Reviews.Author: ocfotoman
Reviews.Content: I booked two suites this summer for myself and some German guests. We were really looking forward to a posh experience and came away disappointed. The suites felt small and cramped. I enjoyed my upgraded room at Paris overlooking Bellagio and the suite at Venetian much more, and their prices were better than TheHotel's. The room had a very strong cigarette smell, which was nauesating. The first night we had no robes or slippers, and no turndown service which is to be expected in a hotel of this quality. When I asked for turndown service the next morning, and for robes, the lady at the front desk just said "Oh, you want that??", like it was out of the ordinary. The pool area was a zoo. I felt like I was at the city plunge with all the kids running around, the lack of chaise lounges and all the screaming of the kids. I opted not to use the pool. The casino and general layout of The Mandarin is beautiful, nice selection of restaurants, etc., but NOT worth the extra money to stay at TheHotel. I'll go back to Paris, Venetian, Bellagio or even Luxor.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Decor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days. Suites were nice but for some reason the carpet was soaking wet (near the bar). We just avoided the spot. The check in personnel were very nice. The bed was very comfortable. The tub was awesome. Big enough for two. We would soak in the tub after a long day of walking and gambling and watch the news on the flat screen tv in the bathroon. The restaurant/cafe was pretty good. We had breakfast there twice. We also had Sunday Brunch at the Mandalay Bay Buffet. That was good also. The casinos were fine. One thing I didn't like was it's ultra modern decor. It was very cold. Went to see the Shark Reef. Wasn't worth it. Epcot has a better giant aquarium. Didn't use the pools but had a view of them from the 32nd floor. Overall a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “THE hotel is much better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay at THE hotel after reviewing all of the options in Vegas. My husband and I were traveling with our 2 year old and were looking for a nice room that offered a two room suite option. THE hotel was the only place I found with a two room suite option as a basic room, we could put our son to bed and relax without having to worry about waking him up! After reviewing all of the feedback on this hotel I was worried that we were in for a big disappointment and feared that I had made a bad decision. Upon arriving I couldn't have been more pleased with the room and the atmosphere was great as well. We arrived and one of our non-smoking rooms reeked of smoke and so the hotel send an air purifier to remidy the problem quickly. Minor dilemma, fixed promptly. Room service food was pretty basic, nothing fancy, but there are plenty of restaurants in the Mandalay Bay to pick from if you are looking for excellent food. We didn't eat in any of THE hotel restuarants so I can't comment on the quality. Throughout our stay we were fortunate to have great service from the travel concierge and housekeeping. We called for a pack and play and it was delivered within 20 minutes and the travel guide was able to help us find some great activities for our son! We also left our son's blanket, pillow, and special security blanket in the room. THE hotel was nice enough to locate the items send them to our home in Florida. Very nice hotel, great atmosphere, helpful staff, and a super comfy bed! I can't speak to the friendliness of the desk staff because my husband checked us in and out of the room, but everyone I encountered was friendly and helpful. The only downside I noticed was that the walk to the pool is a long one, so if you go take all you need to stay a while and it is very crowded, and it often hard to find an open seat. You will need your key to enter, I guess they are trying to keep the guests from inviting all of their friends at other hotels to party with them. We are planning on returning to THE hotel because it had everything that we found important for our personal needs, it may not be for everyone but it was perfect for our family!

Reviews.Title: “No big wow that's for sure”
Reviews.Author: Bobogriz
Reviews.Content: THE Hotel is drastically overrated and overpriced. When you spend over $300 for a suite you think you would say wow when you walk in, but wow this place is not. They tried to make anice place with a modern look, but the TV in the bathroom did not work, and it is just a big ho-hum especially for Las Vegas- Look somewhere else, this is not THE spot.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at the hotel for 6night sept 2 thru the 8th”
Reviews.Author: dddlgtm
Reviews.Content: Complaints. Very long walk to the pool/ The room service food was horrible (so bad that we called and complained and received a credit on our bill)/ Make sure when you go to the pool take a room key for anybody going to the pool. One day they only wanted one room key and the next day they wanted both, (this is a big problem when you are walking over a 1/4 mile to the pool. Probably closer to a half mile)/ Hotel view sucked had to [--] for a half an hour to get a room change and that is with staying there 6 nights. Suites have walls that separate the living room from the bedroom. (I like the venetian rooms with them open)/ Housekeeping did not do that good of job when cleaning Likes Beautiful rooms. Love the pools. It is my opinion that vegas is for adults. There are however kids there however they pretty much stay in the lazy river and the wave pool. there are 3 other pools that are pretty much all adults Overall it is above average. However next trip will probably be back to the Venetian

Reviews.Title: “No customer service”
Reviews.Author: julias
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 days at THEhotel - to sum it up, they simply do not care. The fact that there is no concierge at THEhotel is indicative of the treatment you will receive if you stay there. The room that I had reserved 3 months in advance with a credit card was "not available." My husband and I were down-graded to the only non-smoking room left and told that we could switch to our suite the next day. The staff offered nothing to us for our inconvenience, but finally agreed to a room service credit. However, when we got to our room, there was no room service menu to be found. By this time it was about 10 p.m. We called for a menu, and it never came. Finally, after waiting 25 minutes, we went downstairs to "the cafe" instead. For the first 15 minutes, the only service we received was from the bus-person. After we later placed our order, we were totally ignored, and after waiting another 30 minutes for our dinner, gave up and bought a couple of power bars at the convenience store. And, when we did flag-down the waiter to tell him we were leaving because we still hadn't been served our dinner, he just said "fine!" The next day our new room was not cleaned and ready for us until about 5:30 p.m. Again, no word of apology from management regarding the delay, and 5:30 p.m. was after I had requested that the room cleaning be expedited. At check-out there was, of course, no credit for any room service purchases. Although it is a very nice looking hotel, that alone does not compensate for THEhotel's complete lack of customer care and service. I do not recommend this hotel, especially if you are traveling for business.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...But I would stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: vintagegirl
Reviews.Content: Dark Dark Dark......I am into the modern look...but this is over the top...I like the idea of the hotel..but not when I arrived..the only thing I liked was the TV in the bathroom...I Would not reccommend staying there...Go somewhere else...Not Kid Friendly

Reviews.Title: “Like a W. Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: nosescott
Reviews.Content: I'm a complainer by nature and I read and write reviews for this iste for pretty much every hotel I travel to. I read with some trepidation about the terrible service at THEhotel and went in expecting to have a nice room with bad service (but, it's Vegas and when are you really in your room anyway?) I can only say that the people with negative reviews don't understand how Vegas works. Toss some cash around and you'll get what you need ahead of the schmucks who don't. Upon check-in, I laid a simple $20 on our guy and he told us if we needed anything or a change of rooms, let him know. We didn't care about a strip view room or anything. "We" were six guys out there for my 39th birthday. All we needed were two ajoining rooms. He took care of us and we had a HUGE HUGE room with the doors opened to both suites. Now, for those of you who travel enough, you'll appreciate THEhotel and it's lack of tacky Vegas touches. It's quiet, serene and very much like a W or even kind of like the Park Hyatt in Chicago or Tokyo. The suites aren't as big as I expected but it's better than a small, crapped room. We asked that our desk, fax and any business related items be removed and it seems that the $20 was still working. They were gone ASAP. All the lights worked and not one spec of dust anywhere as reported in other reviews. Room service came fast and accurate even at 3 or 5 am with six hungry and relatively loud and unruly guys waiting. We even laid a $20 on our chamber maid who was more than happy to leave us TRIPLE our towels (we all take two or three showers a day) everyday for us. The bar guys at the South Lagoon Pool loved us (I'm not a drinker but our pool bar tab everyday was $450). The only time we had any service issues were with the Morrea Beach line and door guys (yes, the pool even has a VIP list and a wait). The bottom line is simple: TIP the people who can make things happen. The check-in person, the valet, the chambermaids, room service...remember people, they ALL talk and say who are tippers and who are jerky people who shall get nothing and like it. Don't forget your host(es) at Mix. They ALL talk. Overall, the rooms are very nice, beds are great (Think Westin Heavenly), THEhotel tower is way off the casino noise and you even have your own cab stand. My only complaint (and it's really not a complaint) is that the walk to the pool is a bit of hike but unless you have a walking issue or are handicapped in any way, you'll hate the walk. Other than the trek, THEhotel was great. Any questions? nosescott@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved the room, and the service was very good; the people friendly. The check-in was fast and the clerk helpful, the room service was prompt and friendly, the concierge was helpful and friendly, and the room was cleaned well each day before we returned around 4:00PM. The room was fairly quiet, large, and quite pretty. The walk to the Mandalay casino is short. And we liked the pools, though, if you want to find shade, show up before 10:30AM...maybe as early as 9:30 (on a weekday). Although this is at the end of the strip, in terms of large casinos, you can easily get to the Luxor, Excalibur, MGM Grand, Tropicana, and New York casinos by taking a combo of a free tram and a short walk. Our only complaints? My wife, who is hypersensitive to smoke, could detect a slight cigarette odor in our non-smoking room. And, the view of the strip from our 20th floor room was 75% blocked by the Luxor. But let me stress ... the room was VERY nice, and the service was friendly. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice....but I'll stay elsewhere next time”
Reviews.Author: Sweetness072
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3-night stay at TheHotel. Jasmina at the front desk was friendly and diligently searched for our request of a king-room with a view of the strip. Unfortunately, we were unable to get a strip view. We checked in at 1:00 p.m., to a dirty room, and had to wait in the "dirty room" for our luggage to be delivered. Not acceptable. We would have rather not seen the room in disarray. Not a good first impression. The next day we left the room at 10:30 a.m. and returned at 3:30 or later. Room had not been cleaned and we had to call. The room was cleaned, but not very well. The next day, the room was cleaned when we returned from our outing. The decor is excellent, but the housekeeping is horrific. The lighting is very dark, which is okay for the bedroom, but why such a dark bathroom? My #1 complaint was the housekeeping. On check-out Vincent took off our room service, movie, snacks and internet charges, but I'll stay elsewhere on my next trip to Vegas. The House of Blues was five-stars on everything!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing decor but poor service”
Reviews.Author: Norie
Reviews.Content: The decor is impressive. Very hip and chic contemporary, it is definitely my taste. The receiving room has a large flat panel TV, even the restroom has a flat screen TV. Then there's another TV in the bedroom. The blackout curtains are not long enough that sunshine peers through. I found clothes (not mine) in the drawers, made me wonder if the room was cleaned before I occupied it. I requested for a microwave so I could heat up my son's chocolate milk but nobody from housekeeping called me back. The DVD player in the receiving area was not working. I requested for assistance but I was told on the phone that it should work and that was that. Nobody bothered to check it in person. Too expensive for such poor service. If you're not a big service person, the decor might be worth the money. Nice spa.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Service”
Reviews.Author: ffxstation
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the staying at THE Hotel for the labor day weekend in a corner suite. These rooms are some of the best on the strip. The service was also very good from the front desk, room service and others. My only complaint would be that the guests at THE Hotel don't have any seperate reserved space at any of the pools or the beach at Mandalay Bay. It is nice that the four seasons guests get their own private pool.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at THE Hotel was very pleasant, with none of the problems experienced by others. No problems at check-in, other than I didn't get the Strip view I had hoped. But otherwise, no complaints. My room was clean, nothing was broken, and everything worked well. As for the few contacts I had with the hotel staff, they were as courteous as I could expect. I was satisfied with size of the room, and the feeling of seclusion. I never heard any noises outside the room. My wife especially enjoyed the tub and bath products. We didn't dine at The Hotel, but had a few meals at the main hotel of Mandalay Bay. Very satisfactory buffet. Somewhat costly, but then again, this wasn't your neighborhood Holiday Inn. The casino is located at the main hotel, but it isn't much of a walk. They are connected. We never had a problem getting drinks. However, the casino is spacious and it takes some time to gather your bearing. The one down-side is the middle of the strip is quite a ways away. The tram will get you along, but it still requires a lot of walking. We enjoyed our visit immensely and plan to return again next year to The Hotel. As we did this year, we'll find a good rate and book early. Our week-day rate was $149.00. We feel we more than got our money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a nice room, then give "The Hotel" a 5 Star, but if you're looking for service you can go into a negative 5 Star (let's just say it's terrible). I'm not sure what kind of customer training these people go through, but they would have flunked in my class. From the front desk to the valet, to the housekeeping, service is just poor all around. If you choose to call yourself a 5 Star, then service is numero uno (period, end of story). My stay started off with a front desk person that had no personality whatsoever (I also got to listen to another customer complain while waiting in line for check-in about poor housekeeping). It didn't take more than a day to realize this person had a valid complaint. They did an awful job of cleaning the room each day and it was never done on a timely basis. Add to that the rudeness I received when I complained about it and it made for a poor stay. The average wait for the valet was about 15 minutes (sorry, but I just think that's too long). The rooms are nice but who's cares when you're in a bad mood because of shoddy service. I will not be returning to this hotel (would rather be in a hotel with a lesser room but excellent service). This hotel should not be rated as high as it is.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the trendy/hip crowd”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: THE Hotel is certainly a very nice hotel with modern/contemporary/trendy decor. Translation: Lots of black marble and not well lit. The rooms were very large (almost 800 sq.ft.)...we stayed in an upgraded end-suite with large windows, 42" plasma TVs and DVD players in both the bedroom and living room, and a flat-screen LCD TV in the bathroom. Bathroom had a nice big tub (large enough for two) and separate shower as one would expect. Bed was very comfortable. I would recommend for the younger/trendy crowd. Mix nightclub up top was very nice...what you would expect from a Hollywood-type trendy bar but very noisy and essentially a meet-market...again, great for the younger, unattached crowd. Entry into the hotel was not spectacular as I expected...kind of like entering through a garage and the atmosphere is not nearly as warm and inviting like the Four Seasons. Also, you cannot call down to the valet from your room to have your car brought up...you have to hand the ticket to the valet to get your car. If you like trendy, THE Hotel is the place for you (Beyonce and JayZ walked in as we were walking out to get our car)...If you like elegant, Four Seasons provides better service and would be more to your liking.

Reviews.Title: “TheHotel, TheBest”
Reviews.Author: Los Angeles traveler
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at TheHotel in the last four months and we were still impressed. Just like our first stay, we arrived two hours before checkin time and we were given a room with a strip view as requested and allowed to put our luggage in the room even though it was still being cleaned. Every staff person we encountered was polite and helpful including the maids and front desk clerk. Two issues regarding the room, no bathrobes and a burnt out bulb in one of the bedroom lamps, were promptly resolved. Our room was very clean and we really enjoyed having the living room to sit in and read the newspaper and drink coffee in the morning. Having a separate powder room and bathroom is also a much appreciated luxury. Many people have commented about how far the Mandalay Bay pool area is from TheHotel and the staff seems to be aware of this common complaint because when we asked about the shortest way to the pool area the staff person said "yeah, we really need our own pool here". Regarding the pool area, be aware that there are lots of frolicking children, and it is extremely difficult to get a lounge chair close to the beach and river unless you arrive before 10:00 am. Try going in the afternoon around 2:00pm when the crowds diminish a little.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at TheHotel for three nights, Aug. 13-16th. It was a great experience from start to finish! First off, it was for our wedding and when they saw the garment bags, they asked us at check in if it was a special occasion. We said yes and they upgraded us to the Penthouse! Wow, what an amazing suite! Plasma TVs everywhere, large living room, dining room, wet bar, desk with Internet access, very large bedroom, large bathroom with a jacuzzi tub (with a TV), a glass shower that was also a sauna, toilet with bidet in the master bathroom, PLUS a guest bathroom! It was on the 62nd floor with a gorgeous view of the strip seen from the wall of windows. Just lovely! We held the post-reception after party in our room and it wasn't cramped at all, even with about 20 people in it! Other than the lovely suite, the hotel itself is great. It's very quiet and you don't have to walk through a casino to get anywhere. There are plenty of nice lounges and places to sit and talk with friends downstairs, the cafe is reasonably priced and VERY yummy, and we enjoyed the giant pastries and coffee at the coffee bar. The hotel has very little "Vegas" to it, and feels like a quality luxury hotel rather than a Vegas hotel. We also enjoyed the amazing bathrobes and slippers, and high-quality bath products. As it turned out, it ended up being my favorite hotel on the strip (and I saw quite a few, as we had about 25 wedding guests). While I think the Bellagio and the Venetian are the most impressive in the common areas, the Bellagio's rooms were smaller than even a standard suite at TheHotel and the Venetian's rooms, while large, were a decorating monstrosity. None of the other hotels held a candle to the common areas at TheHotel or the shared facilities of Mandalay Bay... the beach was awesome and we enjoyed being slightly outside of the center of the action. It was a great retreat after a day and night of craziness! All in all, we will definitely stay at TheHotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay , but do not gamble”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HOTEL Aug 7- 10....My wife son and I ...My son is 16..It was great, yes the pool is a walk..but well worth it...get there early and enjoy the morning at the pool which is the best time...the lazy river is great and u can spend an hr just floating around....Drinks are always available but expensive, as is everything at this resort...Food is expensive and I would aviod the restaurants and go the buffet or eat elsewhere on the strip...the nightlife is great with two - 3 bands playing all night....the blues cafe is great for Karoake....but , u pay for the drinks, usuallly $7-10/per.......the card room and sports book is fine, not crowded and friendly dealers.... If u gamble like I do , $25 blackjack and $10 craps for about 4 hrs per day + 2-3 hours pf poker, don't expect anything comped.... u wont qualify... I earned a $7 comp over three days of gambling.... this was the down part......so go there enjoy, but unless ur a regular or high roller, dont expect anything back....Its worth it though, especially if you have a family, stay in the Hotel, its worth just to see the faces on the kids when they see the room......

Reviews.Title: “TheHotel...Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: THEWANDERER
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night (sigh), Thurs, August 11th. 1. Through my own fault, had no reservation. The front desk clerk spend considerable time trying to find one in the system- to no avail. Got a room at a decent rate, anyway. 2. Room was tremendous, as described by others. Very comfortable bed. Bathroom was amazing, and in line with a "sexy" theme I wanted for my girlfriend. 3. Lobby, TheCafe, and lobby bar very nice, uncrowded and relaxing. Loved the lack of "megaresort" look and feel. 4. Don't miss Mixx. The entrance is around the corner from the sportsbook in Mandalay Bay, or adjacent to Mandalay Place entrance. No cover prior to 10pm- don't miss the view, spectactular. 4. Only complaint- Moorea Beach Lounge was "sold out." Disappointing when looking forward to quiet, relaxing pooltime with girlfriend.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best, but less than perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at theHotel for the second time after having been faithful to the Mandalay Bay for years. The second stay was less amazing than the first, but still worth it. The CONS: 1) when we checked-in the room was not yet made up - odd that a hotel would give out a room key to a room that was was not ready; 2) our bathroom was significantly smaller than standard because of an awkward room location near the elevators (beware of the **800 rooms); 3) the wait for the elevators on the weekend is often a long one; 4) theHotel needs a separate entrance to the beach level as it takes forever to walk through the Mandalay casino just to get to the pool areas; 5) lack of turn-down service; and 6) the lobby and cafe areas need to be enlivened as they almost feel depressing with the minimalist/dark decor that is no longer as "cool" as it used to be. Also, a minor con is the lack of a stereo sound system in the room - the DVD player and TV sound must function as the audio system - Hard Rock suites have dedicated sound systems. The PROS: 1) having 2 lavatories in the room is quite a luxury; 2) the furninshings are superb; 3) beds are comfortable akin to Westin's Heavenly beds; 4) completely separate bedroom and living room make it feel more like an apartment than a simple hotel room; 5) easy to get to taxis at the separate theHotel entrance; and 6) very large televisions. Overall, still one of the best hotel experiences in Las Vegas. However, if management fails to addresses the service concerns voiced by many and if MGM Mirage does not pump money into theHotel to keep it fresh, next year I may look at some of the newer suites at Wynn or Caesar's new Augustus Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Silver1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel is heaven, its cool compared to the rest of Vegas, its peaceful, and the rooms are huge an amazing standard. The pool isn't as far away as people make out however, I didn't find the Mandalay Bay that well marked out. We got upgraded to a corner suite as we were on honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “What is with the Hair??”
Reviews.Author: RoseArt
Reviews.Content: We checked into The Hotel because somes friends stayed and told us about the rooms. They are big, but dark and felt dirty. we heard about the bathrooms being dirty so I brought Lysol with me. I sprayed everything encluding phones and tv changers (there are 3). That did not help the hair from the last patrons all over everything, also the pillow cases were the wrong size, they had full on king pillows and glass rings on most tables. The bed sheets came loose by the time you rose, and they need new sheets, they were full of little balls all over them. Service seemed to be good down in the beautiful lobby and the bathroom was cleaner down there than ever in our room. We had a ball of hair everyday for 3 days and called to have the room re-cleaned, but they never got the hair ball I looked at every time I used the toliet. I think house keeping needs some training. Room service tooked 1 hour 12 mins for a pot of coffee on a Monday morning. I recomend to go down to the coffee bar and get your own, it is right at the elevator. The Mix bar is most beautiful and a great place at night for a drink ($12-$15 each). I would stay at the Four Seasons over the Hotel...better service-pool-food-beds and rooms. Good Luck

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at theHotel”
Reviews.Author: chitownMS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at theHotel from Friday August 12 - Monday August 15. We took a shuttle from the airport - make sure you specify that you are staying at theHotel we were dropped off at the Beach level of Mandalay Bay. Check-in was efficient not cold as many have said. The only annoyance with check in was all the people insisting on a strip view or a corner room. The room great - all three TV's worked and had working remotes. Love the bar area. Our room was cleaned before noon everyday of our stay. Leave a good tip the first day of cleaning and you'll be set. They changed the sheets everyday which I wasn't expecting but we had the luck of always walking into the room when the maid was there and she always changed the sheets. The room was very quiet and the beds very comfy. We only ate at Raffles Cafe for a 2 am meal and it was actually very good. You can walk over to the Luxor for cheaper eats if you don't want to spend alot of money. The wave pool was busy. We spent more time at the South Lagoon Pool which does not open until 9 am. This is important to know coming from the east I was always ready to go to the pool by 8am. We also went to Moorea Beach Club. This was a mistake only because a storm rolled in after we were there just a hour. If you go - go early and when it is a guarenteed nice day. Women seemed perfectly comfortable without their tops. The men that were there didn't seem to be there just to see topless women. Women outnumber men 2-1 probably because $10 for women $50 for men! If you don't want to drop your top it is OK. Best things about Moorea - the music, the comfy chairs, a great hot tub, and no kids. The drinks at the pools are very expensive, though. The Tram in Mandalay Bay that runs to the Luxor and Excalibar is very useful. You can walk through the casinos but it gets confusing. We spent alot of time at the Nine Fine Irishmen a pub in NY NY. Hope this helps someone!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay was a wonderful respite from the nuttiness of Vegas. Very chic, sleek, gorgeous styling. Our room was stunning and very quiet. So much nicer than the Belagio (but of course it's a question of your taste). I think if you want to have fun in Vegas but have a place to relax and get away from the crowds, this is it. It's a much more serene, relaxing environment. Unfortunately, the pool was extremely crowded and there is smoking everywhere-- but if you can't deal with that, you just can't be in Vegas. The spa was wonderful-- and incredible facial and massage, but the body scrub was a total waste of money. Great gym.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Hard_to_please
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before I went...good, bad and in the middle. The hotel was excellent. The lobby was lovely. The rooms were nice and the baths were great. It is a 4 star hotel. The food was excellent and many choices. The service was very good. Yes, they said they gave us a strip view and when we got upstairs, it was a view of the pool. but it was quickly remedied. The lines for the elevated were only crowded when it was check out time and that was only on the way down. But that is only hearsay...we got one right away. The wave pool is the best I have been in. Chairs are taken early, but what makes this different from any other resort with a great pool and beach!! They do remove towels if it looks like no one has been there for a while. We had a chair everytime we went down......maybe not in the front row or under one of the misting palms, but we were in the water anyway. I am a tough customer and would recommend this to anyone. If you have kids, this is a great place to stay...it does not have high traffic volume of the other hotels and access to the other hotels is very easy!! I doubt I will go back to Vegas, but if you are going...stay here if you like a 4 star hotel without the 4 star price.!

Reviews.Title: “My 2 Cents”
Reviews.Author: JTgetsaround
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend stay at THEhotel. Our needs were met for the most part. We enjoyed the pool. We hung at Mandaly Beach during the day. Swimming was cool and a little crowded, and it was very hot. It felt like someone was running a hair dryer in front of your mouth the whole time. BATHHouse: I reserved a deep tissue massage and it was great. She listened to what I said was hurting and executed the massage well. As far as the locker room / spa facility: it has a weirdness to it. It kind of felt like walking into a "Clockwork Orange." If you do get a massage, you will have full use of the weight room, whirlpools, showers and steam-rooms for that day which is nice if you feel like working out in a pseudo-spaceship with an atmospheric trance breathing all around you. Anyway, the massage was good. Gambling: Minimum bets on the table games were $10 during the day and they went up to $15 after 6pm. Overall, the hotel was nice and clean, showing a litlle wear and tear in the rooms, but nonetheless nice. Bathrooms are big and spacious with an enormously deep bathtub. Plasma Tv's in 3 separate rooms. The bed is comfortable and the sheets sedative. Room service dropped the ball once though. I ordered a prime rib with a baked potato and it showed up lacking silverware and au-jus. -No extras with the potato either. The potato was all that I got. No butter, no cheese, chives , or sour cream, bacon, etc. This is the best part. When I called to ask about the sides for the potato and also for the au-jus/silverware, the supervisor told me it did not come with those sides(cheese, butter, etc.) and that I would have to pay extra for it. I don't know when 5 star adopted that policy, but for whatever reason my common sense told me to have them come back and pick it up because I wasn't about to pay for that lousy cold slab of moistless boring meat. My 2 cents. I guess if you don't mind paying $289 plus tax, have fun and stay here. It can be a lot of fun. Rock Star Kareoke at the House of Blues is way cool. You become a rock star and play with a live band. They know all kinds of cool music and you can ROCK with them!!! ... for a moment at least.

Reviews.Title: “It's not the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: rkr727
Reviews.Content: It's a nice enough room, but despite the "suite" layout, it seemed claustrophobic - maybe it was the dark colors. It was nicely appointed - loved the bath products and the bed was comfortable. The room service was the best feature of the hotel with good food and friendly, attentive service. That said, the rest of the hotel services were lacking. We ate lunch in the cafe and the service was so bad there, several folks made a scene. Maid service was once in the morning and unless we left the room by 8am, our room was cleaned at 3:30 or 4pm, and then it wasn't cleaned very well. There is no turn-down. Front desk did not pick up the phone. Restaurants did not pick up phone calls. Cigarette smoke bothers me so that was a constant irritant (almost like it's piped into the room and downstairs, ok, exaggeration). It's a decent enough place and we loved people watching here, but the rate was comparable to the Four Seasons, and if there's a choice between the two, go next door.

Reviews.Title: “Not good at all”
Reviews.Author: dutchcouple
Reviews.Content: The hotel @ Mandalay bay. The beds are good, so is the bath and the valet-parking. But thats about it..... We stayed here for 4 nights, and for the first time in my life is was really happy to check out of a hotel. Frontdesk, most of them should be fired on the spot. Unhelpfull, cold and not polite. Shower in the room, no water pressure, so it's hard to get wet. Restaurants, we tried a couple. All were below standard for the huge prices they charge. Lobster had more resemblance to a car tire than to seafood. THE hotel has a corkscrew in THE room, but no bottle-opener. You can BUY one in a store, but it's on the other end of the casino so thats a 1 mile trip. Our room on the 25th floor had a view of the Luxor. And there are so many more examples, look at the prices for roomservice or the minibar. They are outrageous even by the standards of a real 5 start hotel. And now for something really funny. We could hear the people in the suite next to us and follow their exact conversations. THE hotel has the thinnest walls i have ever seen in a "5" star hotel. THE hotel also has a pool. Only thing is, you will have to get up by 7 otherwise all the spots are taken. All in all, people, save you money and go elsewhere. THE hotel is not worth it !!!!

Reviews.Title: “great room, service was terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at The Hotel before and were given a smaller room even thought we had booked months in advance (it was either that or a handicapped room) but thought we'd give them another change. We have also stayed at Mandalay bay several times without any problems. But this last stay at The Hotel was perhaps the last. The room was NEVER made up on time! When we checked in, we were told our room was ready, but, if you've been reading the other reviews, you can guess what happened - the room wasn't ready! I called down and the service desk argued with me!!!! that I had heard the front desk person incorrectly!!! I just asked that they get someone up here to clean it. Several hours later, they were just getting to it. Anyway, I don't want to repeat what every one else has said, but the service is terrible. We even wrote them a letter, but have yet to hear anything back - surprise surprise. We spent more time out of our room, than in it, not by choice and had to make last minute changes to our plans due to the room NEVER being cleaned in a timely manner. One day we left at 9am, called to make sure it could be cleaned by 11am (the maids were already in the hallway cleaning rooms). They said No problem, but of course, when we came back, it was not done, we had to make another call, etc. It was very disruptive to what was supposed to be a vacation! I hope the management staff is looking at this site because they really need to get a clue about service!

Reviews.Title: “NY family goes to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ChrisM
Reviews.Content: We were staying at The Hotel Aug 1 to 3, 2005. I also found the front desk cold and unhelpful. There is very little info in the rooms about Vegas stuff and even the conceirge desk gave out limited information. They made a dinner reservation that ended not being at the restaurant when we showed up. The housekeeping never came on Tuesday, until I called for the 3rd time and got a supervisor who sent someone up at 6:30 pm. I started calling at 2:30 pm and again at 4:30 pm then again at 6. Also when I asked for extra pillows when we first got there I got told there already is one in the closet, of course there wasn't. I had to call back. Usually in a hotel of this class, it's "how many do you want, foam or feather?" not "there is one extra in the closet". Also when we got to our room there was a very obvious broken lamp and glass fragments on the tile floor. I had to have them revacuum and they did replace the lamp. I'm not usually this fussy but I've stayed at lesser hotels and gotten treated much better. For the room, it was classy in amenities and decor but I agree, the staff could be better. The Hotel is very far from the Mandalay Bay pools and the signs to the pools are ridiclulously confusing. Of course they make every attempt to get you to the casino! CM

Reviews.Title: “THEHotel another success!”
Reviews.Author: toulon96
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at THEHotel from 7/24-7/28. When we got to the front desk area to check in, there was quite a line (I think a convention was going on), but it moved relatively fast. Once we checked in, we went to our room and were thoroughly disappointed. The two queen bed room we received has one sink in the main bathroon and a shower curtain. I definitely had not paid $200/night for that. This was totally different than the room we stayed in last year with the mini LCD TV, glass shower door, and two sinks. I quickly called down to the front desk to request a different room with these amenities and they told us that a room would be available within the next hour. All I needed to do was to bring down the keys and they would gladly switch them. We went back upstairs and were so happy to see the room we wanted. WORD OF ADVICE: make sure you request this type of room or else you may get the shaft with a small bathroom over the ritzier-looking one. Housekeeping was very nice. After the first call on the first day for some extra towels, they remembered to do that everyday. They were also very cordial saying "Good morning" each day. My family and I headed to the pool at 8:30 every morning. The walk from the hotel to the Beach was not bad. I don't know why people have complained about it in the past. It's not that bad of a walk unless you are incredibly lazy. The Beach wasn't as busy as last year and we didn't have to stand in line, but as the day went on, it started to get packed. The week we were there, it was exceptionally hot. We ended up staying in the pool most of the time. BRING LOTS OF SUNSCREEN!!!! I know that we will be back next year and stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Slightly Tacky Good Solid 4 star choice”
Reviews.Author: gben88
Reviews.Content: It's Vegas right, so expect rhinestones (not diamonds). THE Hotel is probably a fair representation about what is good and what is bad about Vegas. So let's start from the beginning-when you drive up, expect a byzantine maze of parking garage with taxi's and traffic everywhere before you get to the entrance of the hotel, which is in the garage. The valet was great, and took our car and arranged for a bellman who came over immediately. He directed us to the direction of the front desk, which is at the end of a stunning lobby with a lounge to the left and coffee shop to the right. Bear in mind, our flight arrived at 9am so we asked for early check in. The lady who checked us in was very kind and went through extra trouble to get us a corner suite on the 31st floor, with a knockout view of the strip. Bags were brought up quickly by a super guy who showed us suite features and grabbed ice for us along with a pleasant conversation on "whats hot" in Las Vegas. The suite itself was well designed, with nicely finished walls, carpet and bathroooms and with a cheap quality couch, bed, armoire and cabinets that made you wonder if the interior decorator ever had converations with the furniture buyer. Kind of like a $3000 Chanel dress with a rhinestone necklace. The Plasma TV's were smaller than we have at home but they worked fairly well. The carpet -was stained and the mini-bar was dusty. Our encounters with Hotel staff were very positive-all were professional, cheerful, helpful and proud to be a part of the THE Hotel. But using the phone and dealing with personnel over the phone was another story, until someone told us that Mandalay Bay handles the calls.
