This explains a lot-you get treated like an annoyance, rather than a guest. And we had VIP designation so you really have to wonder. But face to face, all of the staff were wonderful. Room service was very fast and very good. Try a Lobster, Brie and Asparagus Omlette-an excellent choice. But you know, this is not the Bellagio or the Wynn or the Four Seasons. Having been guests at each of those hotels, we can truly say that this one is more on par with the Venetian, another good 4-star choice. They need to upgrade their furniture, art choices and level of service. Is it to much to have an operator greet you by name? Computer technology can take care of this. Is it too much to have a clean well-maintained suite? Is it too much to have security posted at elevators at night to ensure that only guests or their invited guests go upstairs? These are areas that are the difference between a 4 star and a 5 star. The rooms themselves are not enough for us to return, but if the hotel aspires to 5 star service and actually works to get there, we'd consider coming back. Otherwise, we'll just stay at the Bellagio again, which has never been a disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Except for the Cold Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Sumptuous hotel worth visiting. My husband and I stayed here for 2 days. As you step into the lobby, you feel a complete sense of calm in a city of chaos. Like everyone said, the rooms are amazing! The pictures I have seen really do not convey the feel of this place. The only real negative I would mention seems to be in many of the reviews. The customer service could probably be spruced up a bit. When we checked in at the front desk, they seemed a bit cold. They were polite but it did not seem like they enjoyed their job very much. The coffee bar area had baked goods that were probably a day or two old... Yet, like others, I would still recommend this hotel highly. We are planning to go back again at the end of this year. Hopefully the reception will be a bit warmer this time... I hope THE people at THE Hotel reads this and work on their service.

Reviews.Title: “TheHotel is TheBest!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Vegas every year for my birthday celebration. We try a new upscale hotel each visit while we prefer gambling at the smaller, lower limit casinos. I had read several reviews of TheHotel and was somewhat apprehensive regarding service. I must say we were very pleasantly surprised. We arrived for check-in at 11:00 a.m. on 7/29/05. We expected to have to check luggage and come back later. (After all, we were arriving on Friday for the weekend). We waited in a very short check-in/check-out line. Perhaps 10 minutes maximum. Our agent was very friendly and smiled the entire time. They had a room available, but it was on the 13th floor. She said we did not have to take it, but we said "what the heck". The room was unbelievable. Warning: If you are not into this type of decor, you will not be happy. It is dark shades of brown & beige. It is very oriental with pictures, furniture and all details of that style. The accommodations are very elegant. Every detail is attended to. I used the Internet access for business and was pleased to find a fax/printer in the room. There are 3 televisions (with DVD/flat screen), 1.5 baths, a safe, high-speed internet, and sample size bottles of every toiletry you can imagine. The casino is a short walk through a long hallway. We didn't use the pool, so I can't comment on that walk. However, we did see many people walking through the hotel in their swimsuits. Taxi service is instant (a big plus in Vegas). We had our baggage, a taxi and arrived at the airport within 15 minutes. We have stayed at Bellagio and Venetian. TheHotel is in the same class. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Major Problems At The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: barrytravel
Reviews.Content: If you’re looking for an excellent hotel, I am afraid to tell you I have experienced better and less expensive. My mother and aunt and I stayed at this hotel and found that the service was very disorganized and lazy. It started with the check in at the front desk, where we were informed that instead of a non smoking handicapped room with two double beds for my mother and aunt, they gave them a king smoking room instead. Then after pleading and bargaining for correct accommodations we had asked for and confirmed weeks in advance, we were told that the room was not ready yet but would be cleaned and prepared for us in less then twenty minutes. After more then one hour of waiting we were informed that it would be another two hours before it would become available. As far as bellmen or the concierge, service is something to do without. They gave away my mothers wheelchair on the first day by mistake and then wanted to charge us for receiving the new one on the second day there. When you call the dining concierge for recommendations for restaurants, they will only inform you on choices in their hotel and know nothing about restaurants in any other places in Las Vegas. This hotel is very pleasant to look at but staying there is a choice that you need to think about very carefully.

Reviews.Title: “In Love with The hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for our five year wedding anniversary. It was absolutely incredible! As far as hotels go and rooms , I am ruined for life. Nothing else will ever compare! I have read through all the other comments made and I can say that the dust on the night stands is from the air conditioning that is constantly on. The shower did get really hot when turned on and then really cold when adjusted. The newspaper from the previous guest was still there. For me these are just little things that overall are nothing to be a problem. The suite is absolutely the most beautiful I have ever stayed in my entire life! The entire hotel is incredible. I will only say that when I go to Vegas I will only stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Room is fabulous! (But service is so so)”
Reviews.Author: singleparenttraveler
Reviews.Content: There is no mistaking THE HOTEL is quite fabulous. The suite is more than I could have asked for. The lobby, bar, coffee bar and restaurants were all nice and at expected price points for a hotel (for example, no higher than when I was at MGM). I must admit I read the reviews a hundred times and looked at all the pictures. The suite actually was bigger than what the pictures show and the whole building quite beautiful. The only misstep at this place is housekeeping/room services are just not the best. For example, I was very disappointed to leave the room in the a.m. and to return at 6 pm and find our breakfast trays still there and beds unmade and towels not changed. There were also an assortment of bad service-related complaints (mistaken wakeup calls at 5 am, bedroom phone line dead, towels/toilet paper not left in powder room, wet carpet near the a/c). It was very disappointing to see such a so-so service level. If I was paying the 300/nt weekend rate I would expect better housekeeping and service and would have been completely upset by some of these things. I've read enough reviews to know that this is THE HOTEL's one pitfall. I told them at checkout. They said please try us again because they are working on it. Otherwise this property is excellent. The 3 TVs in the room were fun (although not many channels). Even the elevators have TVs. Here's some tips: Sign up at their web site for the paradise club and book directly on their hotel reservation site. Rates for the paradise club members went as low as $149/nt for THE HOTEL (and dirt cheap for mandalay). Expedia was quoting 199 each time I checked and didn't include 2-for-1 coupons, the extras you get by doing this. I signed up but forget to check that email box regularly and the special rates expired. (You will get only 1 or 2 emails from them unlike other properties, so pay attention.) Still, I stayed M-F 7/18-7/22 for 169/nt on the 30th floor with a pool-side view which I felt was a good price and good location. In reality, this is not an expensive price for a 2 bath, 2 room suite that really includes all the amenities you could ask for. At check-in I was given a VIP room card because of being on that email list. I got some deals that I forgot about that had been in the emails I received from the hotel. (At least I think that's why.) Also, my bar and refrigerator were fully stocked with all kinds of goodies, beverages, liquors, etc.. We ate containers of junk food, drank beverages and coronas and were only charged $15. If you have children 14 and under, they no longer charge the extra person fee for the room. That's a savings of $35 a night. Go to the Shark Reef after 5 pm. The admission prices are lower and the lines much shorter. We went about 9 pm. It was nice, but if I had stood in line for that or paid more than I did I would have been disappointed. Sea World it ain't. Also you are able to monitor what is being charged to your room on the television. It updates instantly. Just choose Guest Services. For example, we charged cocktails and meals to the room daily. Checking our bill helped to monitor our spending without having to worry about or remember what we drank at midnight or ate by the pool. The tube rentals for the pool are $20 each! Just pick up some rafts at CVS or walgreens while you are out. The mandalay beach staff will still blow them up for you free of charge. Always get your taxi from THE HOTEL side. The lines are short and their staff there very helpful. If you've got a car, take the garage stairs not the elevator and it will put you out right in the front of THE HOTEL. If you take the elevator, you empty out at rumjungle. Which ain't so bad though at night. It's a sight. Speaking of sights, the whole suite is dimly lit. Which is nice and calming. But if you need good lighting for reading etc., get it done during the day! Enjoy all the Mandalay property has to offer. THE HOTEL is actually very close to the entrance to Mandalay Place and connections to Luxor. It's also right at the theater entrance for Mamma Mia and the House of Blues. (But don't eat there! It's awful!) The walk to the beach is not as long as in some properties I've been in. In fact, except for the Shark Reef, the mandalay bay property was quite easy to get around. Enjoy THE HOTEL. You'll love it, even if your bed isn't made quite on time. The room is just too great for me not to give it an excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved THE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: youjustgogirl
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved THE HOTEL. Other members of our family stayed at The Four Seasons, so we visited them in their suite, and it just seemed shabby and plain compared to THE HOTEL. Of course the service at The Four Seasons is beyond compare, but I just truly thought THE HOTEL suites are better. The bed was amazing, so comfortable, great linens, great pillows. We really enjoyed the soaking tub. We'd start each day with a soak, while drinking coffee and watching the t.v. in the bathroom. I thought the service at THE HOTEL was good. Our CD player was broken and they brought a new one up right away. Room service was prompt and delicious. We organized with the maid service when we'd be out of the suite so they could clean it, and they always did. The bath products were very nice. The Bathhouse Spa is not to be missed. It's like another world. I had two facials in 6 days and they were top notch. Basically I don't have anything but praise for our stay there. Lastly, it's a sad commentary of how lazy americans are that the walk to the pool is considered long. It was a welcome chance to get a little exercise, and by no means did it take too long, 15 minutes at best. Unless your elderly and have mobility limitations, this is not a long walk. Peace.

Reviews.Title: “Best standard rooms in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cringle22
Reviews.Content: THEHotels standard rooms are 750 sq ft suites - true suites with separate sleeping and living room and 1.5 baths. Bedroom, master bath and living room all have flat screen TVs. Rooms come with stocked mini-fridge and snack basket, great very custom toiletries too. North facing rooms provide a fabulous view up the entire strip. THEHotel definitely serves as a nice quiet oasis from all the adjoining MandalayBay casino hubub. High ceilings, ultramodern decor, dark woods, refined atmosphere. My only complaint is that there's so much dark wood and other dark accents, to go along with the (stylishly) dimly-lit rooms and hallways - all the darkness might actually GET to you a little bit.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: reagan
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 6/26 for five nites and it was perfect. The pool area was a bit crowded but I managed to get my coffee and paper as I headed to the pool as early as possible. I wanted to secure two spots in a shaded area which is very hard to find. The staff was great and I had no complaints with the exception of the person who worked the coffee shop. I asked if I could have a venti drip and he said "not yet, we open in 2 minutes" and he just stood there staring at the clock on the register. I would like to find something to complain about but other than the guy who worked the coffee shop at "THE HOTEL" I can't.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful contemporary Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rbow2400
Reviews.Content: the Hotel @ Mandalay Bay was by far one of the nicest and less crowded hotels that I went to during my stay in Vegas. All of the other ones we went into (Treasure Island, Ceasars, Bellagio, Venitian, Luxor, Mirage) we sooo crowded in both the lobby and the Casino. The only day that the Hotel was busy was a Friday late afternoon early evening - when people were coming in for the weekend. Plus, it was a boxing weekend and a lot of concerts were coming to the Hotel. My only GRIPE about the place is the pool. It is a roundtrip distance of 1.6 miles from the lobby of the Hotel. And you have to walk through the casino to get there. There is no short cut to the pool. Also, we happened to go at one of the hotest times on record and there are NO umbrellas at the pool. They get you to spend $200/day (and only after you reserve 1 week in advance, or wait until 11:00 the day of to see if there were any no shows) to rent a Cabana. The cabanas are nice because they have misters, ceiling fan, shade, lounge chairs, table & chairs and a small refrigerator filled with water and Pepsi products. Also at one of the pools - in the late afternoon, there is a reflection from the gold building into the pool - and if you're in the pool, the reflection will accelerate your burning - so be careful. I just don't understand that in a place where it averages 115 degrees, how they don't have umbrellas at the pools. Even if they charge you to rent them, they'd still make their money. But as far as the Hotel goes, it's very nice - very clean, elevators are fast and you don't spend a lot of time waiting - carpets are plush, towels are amazing, their bath produts are lovely, etc. I cannot rave enough about the Hotel. It was very nice - only gripe, like I said was the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Mandalay Bay has a great pool!”
Reviews.Author: Nikkos
Reviews.Content: July 2005 - Mandalay Bay has a great pool area. We were there over the 4th of July weekend and even on a holiday there was plenty of room to swim in the pools, play in the wave pool or ride around the lazy river. I would say the pool areas are the main attraction and thing that sets Mandalay Bay apart from the other resorts. Although it is at the end of the strip, we did not find that to be a problem since there is a free monorail that takes you Excalibur, then you can walk across to the NY NY and take another free monorail on down to Bellagio which puts you right in the middle of the strip. Problems: The Mandalay Bay will "nickle and dime" you to death! There was no refrigerator in the room and it was $20/night to get one. Using their exercize facility was also extra at $27/day! If you want to ride an intertube around the lazy river (and you will) they rent for $10/day!! Absolutely everything is extra and of course the food and drinks are very expensive, but that is to be expected in a five star hotel. What I did not expect was the number of children and poorly behaved guests. I thought a five star resort would have a quieter clientele - expect to run into the same rowdy twenty-something crowd you would at a lesser hotel. Money savings suggestions: drop by the store and buy one of those styrofoam coolers for your room. You can also buy the same little plastic intertubes for the lazy river for $1.37 at Walmart or equivelant store - MB did not have a rule against bringing your own.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I Were Still There!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas because I will be starting a grad program there and we needed to find a house as well as finish paperwork on campus. We didn't plan to stay at TheHotel but we got a great vacation plan through our Costco membership and decided to go for it! We planned for 6 nights because we figured it would take a few days to find housing. Luckily we found a house on day one, so we got to enjoy the area more than we'd expected to. We didn't have too bad a time finding TheParkinglot. We did not valet during our first night, though, and boy did we regret it. It was two thousand degrees in the garage and we were a long distance from the entrance. Once in TheBuilding we took TheElevator up to TheLobby and absolutely loved what we saw- very clean and spacious, with shiny floors and a minimalist design we loved. Check in was easy and swift- we just showed our I.D.s. We were asked if we wanted to put any money on our credit card so that we could order room service, internet access, etc. and just charge it to the card. We said no, because we didn't realize at the time that you can't charge anything to your room without putting money on the card FIRST. Maybe it was the way she explained it to us, and the fact that we aren't used to traveling. I did put $50 on the card because I specifically asked about internet access, knowing I'd need internet during the entire stay (I'm still finishing my MA paper). Ethernet is about 11.99 per 24-hour period. Lastly, We were upgraded to a corner suite for free when we requested it. Our room was on the 29th floor. Once we figured out which set of elevators to use, finding the room was easy. There are only two wings. The ice machine is in one wing, our corner suite was at the end of the other wing. The halls were nice and clean. We chose non-smoking, so no smoky odors to deal with. The room was great- exactly like the pictures you see online. In fact, I regretted seeing the pictures because I didn't get to feel that excitement I wanted to feel upon entering our room at such an expensive hotel. The problems we encountered on day one: 1) Only one of the two large plasma TVs worked. Turned out one of the remote controls had dead batteries. We called for assistance and someone brought us two batteries. It would have been nice if they had brought us a whole remote, or offered to change the batteries themselves- I mean, for all the money we paid! But it was a small quibble for me. However, when I opened the remote and found the battery acid had caked over the batteryies and some of the plastic, I felt a tad resentful. The TV in the bedroom was crappy- the picture wasn't clear on most of the channels. We never watched that TV during our entire stay. The TV in the sitting room was fine. I watched it one night when I'd had enough studying. I can't say that the TV was all that impressive, but maybe I'm just not one of those people who are excited about 42" or 50" plasma TVs. I liked it, but I didn't try to watch it everyday. Since I had to study, I immediately tried to get online at the little office desk. It's a nice work area that includes a fax machine that took up more space than I would've liked. They provide the ethernet cable in a black plastic-encased spool. You pull it out and a tension spring allows it to snap back. I wonder how long before the cable needs to be replaced from the tension it exterted? To use internet, you have to turn on the TV (so thank goodness for the TV that had a good picture!) and use the menu to reach a screen that gives you a four-digit code. I'd pre-paid for internet, so I got my code. (During my last day I could not get a code because the money had run out, but a call to the front desk fixed that problem, as they just billed my card). Internet access was EXCELLENT. The fastest I've ever experienced anywhere, even at my job at an internet service provider. It was ridiculous, it was so fast! That was almost my favorite part of my stay (I'm an internet fiend!). More about the room- two bathrooms, one with a nice-sized tub, separate glassed-in shower, a small plasma TV (wouldn't you know- it didn't work!), double sinks, a mirrored shelf next to each sink, a scale (got on it every day) and a toilet in a separate little room that had a phone in it. I don't know about using a phone when you're on the toilet- all I know is I didn't touch it! The bedroom has a wardrobe with a digital safe in it, ironing board with an attached iron (that was a funny discovery), and nice wooden hangers. We had a king-sized bed that was rather lumpily made. The view from each room was FANTASTIC. The sitting room has a separate bathroom with just a sink, mirror and toilet. Everything was dust-free and shiny. That night we went to the dinner buffet at Mandalay Bay. We really loved it, but it was so pricey, at almost $23 per person. If we had eaten more it would have been worth it. We tried our best! The food was fresh, very pretty and plentiful. They had these small carrots (not quite baby carrots) that were so fresh and shiny that I ate them just for their looks, and I'm no vegetable eater. We tried crab legs, lobster, tiny quiches, shrimp, oysters- all the things we normally don't eat. They also have regular fare such as different cuts of meat, mashed potatoes with gravy, smoked salmon, cheeses, breads, green beans, fried chicken, friend shrimp, etc. For some reason, their iced tea was the best iced tea I'd ever had. Maybe it's because it was so darned hot that I got dehydrated or something. Our waiter was awesome, kept the teas coming and cleared the old plates with the swiftness. Mandalay's brunch staff were much better than the other brunches we visited. We didn't like the desserts at Mandalay very much, but many people loved them. They have quite a few choices- little cake slices, brownies, cookies, and more. My partner in crime had gastric bypass surgery so she was hoping to enjoy the sugar-free desserts- she thought they were pretty bad, though. There is so much waste at buffets, it is sickening. We wasted a lot of food that day, so we were more careful during our breakfast and lunch visits. Breakfast was nothing to write home about. In fact, my partner was a little miffed because the "chef" fixing her crepe was too busy gabbing with another chef to pay attention to her request for blueberries. She said it loudly three times and he basically ignored her. She had to make him open the crepe back up to put blueberries in it, which kinda ruined the experience. Both chefs laughingly blamed the other for his mistake. Glad they found it amusing. Lunch was all right. I guess because we had the dinner buffet first, everything else paled in comparison. The following day I called to have the batteries for the bathroom TV remote changed. It took longer this time to get them, and they turned out to be the wrong size. The remotes use AA batteries, people, not AAA! I didn't bother with the remote after that, but my partner took a luxurious bath and enjoyed the TV after feeling for the controls on top. The lighting in the rooms took a bit getting used to- so many switches and dimmers, but once we figured out what affected what, it was great setting different moods. I loved my little office space and the lighting around it. I locked my laptop in the safe when I wasn't in the room and never had a problem with theft (which some people in other reviews have mentioned). We used the valet every day after that first night, and it was fine. Valet is free at all the hotels, I believe. We tipped the valets each time, of course. Sometimes we had to wait over 5 minutes for the car to arrive, which in a thousand-degree garage isn't all that fun, but we actually acclimated to the Las Vegas climate quickly. The low humidity made it bearable. I guess the garage was about 10 degrees hotter than outside sometimes, but if you stand verrry still..... Because I spent so much time studying, I didn't do a whole lot outside of the room as my partner did. I can say that room service was fine, although overpriced. It is 24 hours a day and seems to serve the food from the 24-hour cafe "Raffles". They had too few food choices, in my opinion, but the sandwiches I ordered were good. The couch in the sitting room is not luxurious but it served its purpose for TV-watching and eating. Housekeeping was not very thorough at all, but acceptable. My partner broke an elastic hairband in the bathroom and every day afterwards we still found beads. We tipped our housekeeper $5 a day. The first day that we tipped her we found a whole slew of nice bathroom products at the next housekeeping visit! We thought, wow- wonder what we'll get after tomorrow's tip! But it was never as good as the first time. :-) The toiletries are all prettily packaged and enjoyable. The white linens were all clean, thick and absorbent. The A/C was great in the sitting room (it was actually too cold at night) but setting the A/C in the bedroom didn't have the same effect and we often ended up tossing all the covers off us before the night was over because it was too warm for us. Hall noise was minimal, but on Saturday night I could hear a lot of noise from the clubs outdoors. I could hear the lyrics to every song very clearly 29 floors up. I love a vibrant city so it was kinda nice, but made me want to go out and play instead of study! We visited the casino briefly, went to the House of Blues gospel brunch (fun but NOT WORTH THE MONEY), walked through the shops at Mandalay Bay and visited the attached hotels. The brunches at Phoenix (Luxor) and at the Paris hotel did not compare in any way to the wonders of Mandalay Bay's buffet. In fact, we didn't like the Paris brunch in any way, shape or form. Even the clothes they make those poor waitresses wear were bad. All in all our stay was excellent and I would definitely stay there again. I would just first make sure to check all the remote controls and the A/C, and put a few hundred on a card so I could charge room service, internet and the buffets to our room. Oh- and I'd be prepared with comfortable walking shoes, sunglasses and sleeveless shirts! I'm now officially too spoiled to ever want a regular hotel room again. -ADP

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous corner suite views, worst service ever”
Reviews.Author: nycjetset
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at The Hotel a year ago with a friend and had a fabulous time. So assumed the same would be true this time with my fiance. Service was terrible. When we checked in on Thursday afternoon, they told us there were no strip view rooms available when we checked in, and then 5 min later as we were finishing our paperwork, we heard the couple next to us receive a strip view. But that was nothing compared to the nightmare that followed. We were led to our room which was dark and absolutely filthy. There was literally crap in both toilets, stains and glass on the floor and no sheets on the bed. We had dinner reservations at Mix in 2 hours so we were a little anxious. However, the front desk advised us that the room would be made up as soon as possible so we went downstairs to get a drink. An hour later we returned to a disgusting room. So we called the front desk again and were told that there were no clean rooms available. After asking for a manager, we finally got a new room. So, back downstairs to get a key. Another 20 minutes to get a bellhop because they wouldn't let us move our own lugguge. And the new room was ... disgusting again. But no crap in the toilet at least. By this time we had been in Vegas for 2 hours and were about to miss our reservation. The bellhop was very nice and offered to run downstairs, get a new set of keys, and also check the next room to make sure it truly was clean. So after another half an hour, we were settled in a clean, but dark room. Right next to the elevators and housekeeping room. And the manager offered to put us in a strip view room first hting next morning before our spa treatments. And they made new reservations for us. The fun doesn't end here. Not surprisingly, we were not able to move into a room before our spa treatments at 11am even though i called at 8am (east coast jet lag). Front desk promised we'd be taken care of by 2pm at the latest. So we went to the spa where the staff was absolutely lovely. When they heard us mention our exhausting check-in process, the manager there offered to guarantee us a room. She called front desk where they guaranteed her that we would receive not only a room upgrade, but a fruit basket and of course a new room by 2pm. After lunch, we returned to a freshly made room. So we assumed that our new room would have been made up as well. But of course ... we had no new room to move. Front desk and manager promised us a new room by 5pm or 7pm that evening. So we kept calling to get a manager. Finally, 2 hours later we were moved into a very very nice high floor, large corner suite. No fruit basket of course! But by then we were exhausted ... We'll be staying at Wynn next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room....Lousy Service”
Reviews.Author: bodyforlife
Reviews.Content: I would have to agree with some of the other posts regarding "The Hotel". The room was one of the nicest I've ever been to in Vegas. Unfortunately, they think just having a nice room qualifies them for 5 star service (it doesn't). No one at their facility was especially helpful and we had to call 4 times for room service on a Friday night when we paid $300 for the room. Our room was finally made up at 7:15 that night (an absolute joke). I usually stay at the Venetian and will stay there again the next time I'm in town. "The Hotel" has serious service issues.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: chifinn
Reviews.Content: The wife and I and another couple set out for some down time in Vegas. I saw this Hotel and it caught my eye as something different. The service was great front desk was very helpful and accomodating (thanks to Vince). We got 2 suites right across from each other. In past reviews several people discussed dirty bathrooms. Sure enough there was some form of stain on the floor. Within minutes maintenance was up and had it cleaned. The wife is allergic to feathers, I saw the maid down the hall and within a couple more minutes we had new pillows. During the evening from our room we saw the fireworks on the fourth and had a very special evening. Yes the wave pool is crowded but the other pool was just fine. The walk to the casino and the pool is not an issue. Breakfast at the lobby restaraunt was very good. Had dinner at the House of Blues which turned out very good. We are already planning next year and this will be our number one pick

Reviews.Title: “Simply beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: tluv
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a bachelor party weekend in Las Vegas. We stayed at the Hotel at Mandalay Bay. Simply beautiful. The suite was great, plasma tv in the main room, classy dark wood furniture, comfy beds, huge bathroom with bath and shower, small tv in bathroom. Very trendy look, extremly upscale feel. Great looking people all over the hotel. The pool was great, very clean, cool wave pool. They even let us print out our plane boarding passes for free. I've stayed all over in Vegas and this was probably one of the best. A bit pricy ($300 a night) though.

Reviews.Title: “Best Room in Vegas, go elsewhere if you want service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Definitely the best rooms in Vegas. New and modern rooms and amenities are great. Loved have a separate living and bedroom and a huge bathroom! Very chic look and feel, no wonder its the hip place to be. The only think lacking at The Hotel is THE SERVICE! Not a customer service focused individual to be found there. We arrived around 12am, and the bellman didn't even open the door for us, actually he watched us try to walk into the wrong door with all our bags. The front desk was not crowded (a plus), but didn't do more than recite a "welcome to TheHotel speech" We had planned on staying at TheHotel for 5 days, but the next morning, after the Concierge told us that they couldn't help us get more pillows for our room (it only had 1 on the bed -but they could write down the number to housekeeping for us), couldn't make show reservations (we don't do that) and the pool service told us they couldn't bring us glasses of ice (I don't do ice) we decided maybe TheHotel wasn't for us. We are definintely not "needy" or "high maintenance" people, and usually do for ourselves. But when we need or ask for help/service we would like for it to be there. I felt that for what we were paying at TheHotel, we could do better elsewhere. For a few more dollars a night, we moved over the 4 Seasons and got exactly what we were paying for.

Reviews.Title: “TheHotel @ Mandalay Bay was GREAT”
Reviews.Author: fendi31575
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at TheHotel. We were there in late April, and it was terrific. Checking into the hotel was hassle free. In fact we arrived a about 1pm and were able to check in early. Customer Service at check in was a wonderful start to our stay at this hotel. These suites are the size of a small apartment, it's really cozy. I was shocked to find one full bathroom and a second half bath in the suite.....having that second half bath was great. I loved the main bathroom.......it was so large. As was the oversized soaking tub. It is large enough for two adults w/ plenty of room to spare. I enjoyed the the small flat panel tv in the bathroom as well. The complimentary bath amenities are surprisingly decent. The bed was a little too soft for me though. I'm not sure if the mattress itself was soft of if it had a mattress topper which was creating that softness. It wasn't uncomfortable, just felt a little odd. We did order room service for breakfast one morning, which was excellent. Terrific eggs benedict. The atmosphere of the room and hotel, I thought, were very subdued. Though it was crowded, it didn't have that busy & hyped energy the other hotels have. It was very different from many of the other LV hotels. This being just an oberservation, not a complaint. The rooms and hallways to the rooms were very clean and did not smell of smoke. I have no negative feedback for this hotel. We would definitly stay here again, no question about it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: Janiekins
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mandalay for my wedding - reserved 2 rooms months ago for my husband and 2 teenage boys. My son had to sleep on a cot for 3 nights because of room mix up which was never corrected!!!! My sister called to have champagne and strawberries delivered to our room - they never arrived!!!! This hotel was a bit of a dissapointment.

Reviews.Title: “Loved THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay”
Reviews.Author: JSchultz69
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas before and loved all the hotels we visited, but nothing compares to THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay. Our check in clerk told us our room was spectacular and he wasn't wrong. It is the most elegant room ever and we have stayed at 5 star resorts around the world. All staff was excellent. The Moreau Beach Club was the peace and quiet we were looking for. The staff there was attentive, but not invasive. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to relax but still experience the fun of Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “THE Hotel was The best!”
Reviews.Author: familyintheoc
Reviews.Content: We just got back from The Hotel today, we stayed 3 nights, June 28th-July 1st. We were meeting some family from out of state and had to bring our 4 year old and 7 year old with us, which made me a bit leary, but it worked out great! First of all, the staff from the valet, to the bellman, to the maid, to room service was excellent. Everyone was so nice you would of thought they took a happy pill! The room service was especially quick and delicious, and the room was fantastic since we could put our children to bed and shut the door, and the extra powder room made it extra easy. I took a hot bath each night and watched tv while I soaked. We brought snacks for the kids and set them on the bar for easy access. I noticed the cleanliness of the room was pretty decent, still some little stuff on the floor but that was hardly noticeable, plus I am one of those germ freak types and I brought a can of Lysol and some antibac wipes and wiped everything down myself. I can't stand the thought of my kids bathing in any bath that isn't totally sanitized! The maid did a great job each day in picking up after us! We went to the pool and the casino gave us a cabana after my husband gambled all night. I highly recommend the cabana, it was so nice and a necessity if you have kids or want any type of great service and privacy. Our kids loved the large intertubes and floating matts that came inside and the fridge was stocked with drinks, etc. and the tv inside was fun. With all the misters on the outside I never noticed it was even hot! And the server came by every 10-15 minutes and another host type server came by constantly too. We stayed out at the cabana from 10:30-5 and had so much fun! The next day we went to the Shark Reef (which was awesome!), to M&Ms World and to the Lance Burton Magic Show at the Monte Carlo which we absolutely loved and I highly recommend for kids and adults. We also shopped at Mandalay Place which was wonderful and the store Five Little Monkeys was so cute, we loaded up with cute stuff at the Shark Reef shop also and the Lance Burton Magic shop too. The strip was soooo busy but the Mandalay Bay and the Hotel were a breath of fresh air and had alot of nicer upscale people there. The halls in the hotel were quiet and there was always no wait at the Hotel valet and for an elevator which I noticed was not the case at the regular part of Mandalay. We actually got our entire trip comped and came home with over 4,000 dollars in winnings! So that made it even nicer! My husband and I will surely come back, but next time alone so we can try out all the wonderful restaurants we saw but didn't want to take kids into! ALso, the Chocolate Swan shop was so decadent with chocolates, desserts and gifts. I loved the shops there and loved The Hotel, it felt like I was in a neat art decco New York Hotel and it was so fun and different! email me w/any ?s, CLS

Reviews.Title: “Absolute best hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed @ The Hotel in June and it was my 10th trip to Vegas and the Best! This place is absolutely amazing! Everything about it is great...The look, the rooms, everything! Anyone who says this hotel is too dark etc..must be absolutely crazy!! I will no longer stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning! The best hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel at Mandalay Bay is by far one of the most impressive hotels in Las Vegas. All rooms are suites, each equiped with a flat screen tv, two bathrooms (one of them is huge) and a beautifully decorated living room. This is a very modern hotel --the lobby is striking in black marble, sleek brown leather chairs by reception --everything about this place is abolutely stunning. Location is fantastic. By staying at The Hotel, you are connected to the main Mandalay Bay resort (including use of the spectacular pool and "beach"), the Four Seasons hotel, and there is a fantastic monorail service to their sister resorts, the Luxor and Excalibur. I stayed at The Hotel for a bachelor's party but I would more than willingly bring my girlfriend back here to stay a couple of nights. It's truly an incredible place, very romantic, very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay...I am a SoCal native and come to Vegas often.........”
Reviews.Author: villarancho
Reviews.Content: Anyone who complains about this palce is NUTZ. All you have to do is mention you problem, if any, to the staff and they will take care of it. I have stayed at almost EVERY hotel on the strip, from Penthouse suites to basic, premium rooms, and I must say that dollar for dollar the THE Hotel is the best value in Vegas. Picture this: A living space of about 700+ square feet; a seperate living room, bathroom, and bedroom. I am sitting in my complimentary robe right now, and as I stare at one of the THREE tvs in my room (one 40" +plasma in the living, one 40"+ plamsa in the bedroom, and an LCD in the bathroom for crying out loud!!!), I can't find abetter spot. Beware that the hotel itself is not a casino, but not more than 100 yards from the elevator you will find all of the las vegas action you need. Plus, there is a sportsbook that is ulra close, and there is also a connecting passage to the Luxor. AND, the is a tram the will take you to Exacalibur, at no cost, in about 2 minutes. From there you can go accross to the MGM Grand, New York New York, etc. OH, and PLEASE DO NOT MISS THE NEW SHOW KA AT THE MGM. It is one of the top 3 shows, if not the best, in Vegas. Any questions? Please email me at villarancho@charter.net PS-i love this town!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great and Unique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BryanZ
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here for the past two years and have always had great experiences. The rooms, TVs, and overall feel of the THEhotel is very appealing. If you can get a room here for a good rate, I see no reason to stay anywhere else. I have been to all the other big name hotels on the Strip with the exception of Caear's Palace and find that the tasteful yet modern design of THEhotel is very unique. The walk to the pool can be long to those not expecting a 5-10 minute walk but never really bothered me. My only complaint is the lack of a top quality restaurant in THEhotel itself. I think, however, that they are opening a flagship-type restaurant on one of the upper floors of the tower.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mbinsac
Reviews.Content: The name is pretentious, but the Hotel is awesome. The rooms are all suites. Ours had a strip view. The beds are on a par with what you would find in a Westin or a W hotel, which is unheard of in Vegas. The plasma TV in the living room is a nice touch, but the LCD TV in the bathroom is a great feature. The lobby is architecturally fantastic and there are lots of pretty women to be seen. We played pool in the lobby, but I think we spent more of the time girl watching. The lobby is disconnected from the casino, no ringing slot machines to annoy you while you get your morning java. For nightlife try The Mix lounge atop the Hotel. The view is great and the girls are plentiful. If you're not shy and you're traveling without kids, spend your pool time at The Moorea Beach Club. Unlike The Beach, there are no kids running around, the pool is uncrowded and the service is great. The Moorea has european style sunbathing, but it's really more South Beach Miami style. One more thing, unlike the rest of the Vegas hotels where you hear partiers roam the halls all night long, the halls at the Hotel are very quiet. I've stayed at most of the major resorts in Vegas and the Hotel is the finest.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow! An all-suite dream! Everything was perfect. All the components that make a five star hotel great were present... spacious, luxurious living room and bedroom, three plasma tvs, a deep tub with special waterfall faucet, soft sheets and towels, clean, quick elevator, and lovely amenities made for a fantastic conference stay. I also liked the doorbells at each room. (My only item to change-- put coffee makers in the room, but that's not typically Las Vegas.) A cab can take you to the other desirable properties. We walked one night, but felt a bit unsafe- just take a cab! We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “THEhotel - WHAT a disaster!”
Reviews.Author: WilliamRedBud
Reviews.Content: Family friendly? Not. The whole two night stay was pretty much terrible. The room was not ready when promised, and housekeeping never got all the stale food off the floor from the previous occupants. Repeated calls to the front desk got us a discount but little else. Dirty bathrooms. Prompt, but lousy room service. Nice pool, but understaffed. Nothing of "kid interest" on the TV. Indifferent service. My eight year old son summed it up: "They call this a fine hotel that's family friendly, but it's neither." Never again, and don't you either!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: stdokl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Hotel June 10-13th. Four guys on a husbands only weekend. We thought The Hotel was perfect, a two room suite with two queen beds a sofa and a roll away worked perfect for us. Everyone had their own place to crash at the end of the night or early morning. Some Previous reviews questioned service, we experienced nothing but excellence from the front desk to housekeeping everyone was very helpful and friendly. Room is sharply decorated, great having the extra half bath we enjoyed the plasma tv's briefly. The Hotel atmosphere is upscale but not snobbish. I don't know why anyone would stay anywhere else. Distance to the casino at Mandalay Bay is minimal, pool is a bit of a hike but not a bad walk like some have mentioned, you are in Vegas you will have to walk to get to some things. Ate at the Lobby Cafe a couple of times both meals very good bit on the spendy side but good sized portions and decent service also very handy to use because of location. Used the BathHouse spa Sat. enjoyed a massage and the steamroom very relaxing and enjoyable. Can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “THE Hotel lives up to its pretentious name”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at THE Hotel in mid April and the hotel definitely met all of our expectations. First off, we wanted a quiet hotel. I know that sounds weird considering we were vacationing in Vegas. However, after a day or evening at the slots and gaming tables, it was incredibly relaxing to come back to a hotel where you didn't constantly hear the "ding/ding/ding" of the slots upon entering the lobby. It has a modern decor and I am just a bit embarrassed to admit that I was confused at the elevator corridors more than a few times. (I kept going to the wrong elevator area I think, in part, due to the darker halls and mirrored walls. By the third day, I finally got it.) The rooms of the suite were large and nicely appointed. I loved that while one of us napped, the other could shut the bedroom door and enjoy a movie on the 42" plasma screen. The bathroom is heavenly. I love taking baths and the tub was HUGE! My husband is a shower person and the separate shower stall was a nice touch. Some people may think that the hotel is situated too far south of the strip, but we got around no problem. But then again, we like to walk. We took a look at the Bellagio and it did nothing for us. If you're into crowds and overblown floral themes, then stay at the Bellagio. Otherwise, give THE Hotel a try.

Reviews.Title: “If this is how the poor live it is too good for them”
Reviews.Author: u9537503
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. We had spent some time in a cheaper hotel (Excalibur) and decided we wanted some time in a nice room in a nice hotel and this is it. For the cost of a half decent room in a UK hotel (especially London) you get a wonderful suite. We were lucky and had an upgrade to a V suite on the corner of the hotel looking straight down the strip. At night the floor to ceiling windows in the bedroom were amazing. Being a short walk away from the Mandalay Bay itself is nice as you feel like you are entering a whole new hotel. It is also one of the few places that you won't be disturbed by the noise of slot machines. Would I recommend staying in this hotel, of course I would, it is brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in early May. The rooms were beautiful. We enjoyed the plasma tvs and comfortable beds. The only disappointment was the bathroom. The maids did a horrible job cleaning our bathroom. When we checked in there was plenty of hair in the bathroom, and the shelves in the bathroom were lined with an inch or more of dust.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel provided The Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Hotel for five nights on my honeymoon in May. It provided us with some very happy memories. On checking into The Hotel, a very friendly desk clerk upgraded us (free of charge) to a corner, strip-view suite upon hearing it was our honeymoon. The room itself was a little smaller than I expected, having read all the reviews about the size, but it was still much larger than an average room. The view, from the 35th floor was stunning, especially at night, looking out over The Luxor to the strip beyond. The bed was perhaps the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The deep bath was a great place to relax after a day of walking the Strip and the plasma TV in the bathroom made the tub an even better prospect. You would think, however, that they could have incorporated some jacuzzi jets as well. Overall, The Hotel is a very cool, relaxed and classy place to escape the full-on, glitz of Vegas, but just a short walk down the corridor to all the action. The tram to the Excalibur is a good option and goes some way towards negating the long trip back to the hotel from the north end of the strip. I would recommend The Hotel for a special Vegas getaway!

Reviews.Title: “A nice break.”
Reviews.Author: GEFDenver
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Memorial Day and it was great. The in-room music system is really cool. When you walk into The Hotel it is as though you are not in Vegas, and then you walk down the hall and Mandalay Bay is right there. They have a good spa, although the spa lounge area, where you can read magazines, etc. could be a little more cozy. I highly recommend this as an option for people who want to stay in a Vegas hotel without the fanny packs and slot machine sounds (not that there's anything wrong with that), or as just a change in scenery.

Reviews.Title: “TheHotel was TheBomb!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I both loved TheHotel at Mandalay Bay! We were both first time Vegas visitors and spent one night at Mandalay Bay where the accomodations were very nice but nothing to write home about. After one night at the Mandalay Bay, we spent our remaining 2 nights at theHotel. I had read the reviews on theHotel and knew it to be an all suite hotel but was not expecting what we experienced when we walked into our room. It was beautiful. Even though we did not get our view of the strip (as requested) we were still pleased with our accomodations. Our room was set in an art deco style. It was very large, modern and luxurious. There were flat screen t.v.'s in every room including the bathroom. Our room came stocked with a full mini-bar complete with snacks. We even had a half bath in the suite which really came in handy when were getting dressed for the evening. All in all my husband and I were very impressed and enjoyed our stay at theHotel. Despite the odd name it had an ambiance and mood that none of the other Hotels on the strip had. It's location on the strip, allowed you to get away from the hussle and bussle and allow you to feel as if you were entering your own sanctuary, while still being only steps or a free tram ride away from all of the action. Through our travels, we have stayed in many 5 star hotels and rank TheHotel at Mandalay Bay as one of the Best.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back to Hotel at Mandalay Bay”
Reviews.Author: 17Greenparade
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel June2-5. Everything about it was up to our expectations. We checked in early- the maid was in our room at the time. We left our luggage in room and when we returned the room was cleaned. The suite was magnificent. We were on the 31st floor with a view of the strip. The wave pool, lazy river and pool and jacuzzi's were wonderful. I used the spa on the first day and had a treatment. Loved the spa so much I paid to go back and use the facilities the next day. I would definitely return to this Hotel. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A Facade 70s style”
Reviews.Author: astonmartinv8
Reviews.Content: All rooms here are suites and a good value per se, but there are better options in Las Vegas and you can get more space for the money. Jam packed full of 20/30 somethings, I found this hotel (deep breath + tongue in cheek) even more pretentious and shallow than all of the others I have stayed in in Las Vegas. All 1970s dark brown and cream decor, they have tried to do boutique and ended up boudoir with a plasma telly. Upon check-in, my room (whoops - suite) had lots of hairs on the bathroom and toilet area tiles and on my pillow (Yeeuk!) and there were crumbs on the sitting room carpet. There were also no mini bar snacks and we had to call to have these placed in the room. We called housekeeping to service the room - but shouldn't they have done that before we checked in? We also noticed that room service trolleys with half-eaten food were left in the hall for 24 hours!! On this break we also had a suite at the JW Marriot resort and a penthouse suite at the Mandalay (floor 62) for the final night. They were classy and peaceful, this was classless and seemed somewhat crass. Go here if you like to imagine you are staying somewhere cool and watch others watching you do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bathtub”
Reviews.Author: Baileybasset
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 rooms for 3 nights for a birthday celebration. Arrived early Sun. afternoon. We were allowed access to all of the rooms even though they were not cleaned. Desk clerk said she request a rush for housekeeping. Two of the rooms were cleaned within the hour. However, the third room was a disaster. MAJOR partying had gone on in there with beer bottles and unfinshed drinks everywhere and trash all over the floor. Two hours later we left the room. The housekeeping cart was outside of the room at this time. Returned after 8:30 PM and the bottles had been removed, but nothing else cleaned. Desk very apologetic and sent a housekeeper within 5 min. She spent an hour trying to clean this horrible mess. She should be "housekeeper of the week"! Anyone who loves bathtubs will be extremely happy with this one and the plasma TV on the wall is great. The bath toiletries were excellent and replenished daily. Shower wonderful. Quiet room. Used self parking which was OK, but could be a bit of a walk for anyone that has a lot of luggage. The cafe for breakfast was good ($10+). The food was cooked well and more than enough. One of our party was in a wheelchair and it was very easy to use the elevators and maneuver through the casino. The handicap signs for the elevator were well done and the tram to Excalibur was convenient and easy to use. The clerk on check out asked if all was OK and she didn't want to hear it when I began to tell her about the check in problem. That was the only problem and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation nightmare”
Reviews.Author: TravelForWork2007
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation with THE HOTEL in late April for Memorial Day weekend. I used the 1-800 # when making the reservation. When we got to THE HOTEL, I was told that I had made the reservation with Mandalay Bay Resort and Casino, not THE HOTEL. I am thinking..that's not possible since the rates for THE HOTEL and Mandalay Bay were not the same and the rates quoted back to me over the phone were the same ones that I saw on THE HOTEL's website (5/28-$384 and 5/29-$224). The assistant manager had to be called over to assist and I was told that the rate for that night at THE HOTEL was $799 and that they were completely sold out. Given that ALL of the nice hotels were sold out and that if you cancel less than 48 hrs prior to your check in date, you deposit if forfeited, we were "stuck" with the room at the Mandalay Bay Resort and Casino. The Asst. manager "upgraded" our room at the Mandalay Bay and reduced the nightly rates in order to compensate for the "confusion". I will be mailing THE HOTEL my formal complaint.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the room or in this case "suite"”
Reviews.Author: icomment4u
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay from 12-16 May 05. This hotel is all about the room or in this case the suite. If a nice room is your top priority when visiting Las Vegas, you will not be disappointed. I will hit the highlights on the suite that impressed me; modern decor, 3 plasma TVs, large bathroom, double sink, scale and more. Even the soap, lotions, etc. were worth taking home. It was so relaxing and ultra romantic. Don't listen to others when they say it's a long walk to the Mandalay Bay casino. This is ridiculous. I timed it at 2 minutes walking normal. The decor along the way makes the distance even shorter. Having access to all the amenities at Mandalay Bay makes you appreciate this hotel more. I did not go to the restaurant/club called the "Mix." Just too much going on. However, I did eat at the "Cafe" twice. It was over priced but good. Service was excellent. Also, they are open 24 hours. This was really convenient after a late show and late gambling. Like other reviews, all pool areas in Mandalay Bay were packed. However, I found one of the pools towards the back more private, a few people and nice. Most of the people are near the wave pool or adjacent to it. If you go early you don't have a problem. Regardless, you could still enjoy the water. It was fun and everybody was friendly. I recommend the "House of Blues" located in Mandalay Bay for a concert (We saw 2) but get tickets for the floor and standing area. This is by far the best seat in the house. Stand in the upper bar area and you have a can't miss view. Very nice and close. All the upper level seats are poor viewing to me. They have an annoying safety bar in the way and it takes one person to stand up and your view is gone. There are two mentionable negatives. 1. The distance from the hotel from the center of the strip. Get to know the trams and how they connect to other hotels. They can help you a little but expect a lot of walking. Be sure to bring comfortable shoes. I had a rental car so travel was easy but parking was not. Parking meant even more walking. I would still recommend a rental car for at least one day. 2. If you are a heavy gambler, you miss out on the comps, room discounts/upgrades and other goodies. Hopefully, Mandalay Bay casino can correct this and give you comps when you stay in TheHotel. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel for the room (suite).

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel is The Best in LV”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many hotels in Las Vegas, including the other two hotels at Mandalay Bay and the Bellagio and the Venetian and the rooms at The Hotel are simply the best. The room is a real suite. You enter into a living room with a wet bar and a half bath as well as a large Plasma TV with a dvd player. The bedroom has another large TV and the bathroom has a smaller plasma TV. The beds are the most comfortable pillow top beds with luxury linens. Our room had a beautiful view of the LV strip. The decor of the hotel from the lobby to the rooms is very contemporary but comfortable. If the Hotel has a theme it is ultra cool. We arrived at the hotel well before check in time and were able to be accomodated right away. The front desk attendant was very friendly and treated us as though we were the most important guests in the world. My sister used the spa and said it was very nice and compared favorably with the Grand Canyon Spa at the Venetian. We ate a late dinner and breakfast at the Cafe and the food was good with a great location for people watching. The french toast stack with layers of fresh bananas, strawberries and blueberries was outstanding and could easily feed two. You have direct access to Mandalay Bay and its casino and fabulous pool. The only advantage the Four Seasons has is its small but exclusive private pool. I highly recommend this hotel or any of the other Mandalay Bay resorts.

Reviews.Title: “1st class hotel in every way...”
Reviews.Author: one30eight
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved Mandalay Bay. It is a like a breath of fresh air when you enter. The lobby is gorgeous with the aqarium and exotic birds. The front desk service was A+. We were upgraded to a room with a view without even asking. From the lobby to the casino to the guest room, no attention to detail was spared. After spending the night out on the strip or downtown, I was amazed every time I returned to Mandalay Bay. The hotel was spotless. I have never stayed in a cleaner hotel. It even smelled clean. The only negative things I read before my trip was the location. I didn't see this as a problem. Transportation was easily attained and it was nice being away from the "hustle and bustle". The casino was great and the service was outstanding. Cocktail waitresses were often there before I finished my drink. Dealers were great and very helpfull in understanding some games I hadn't played before. The pools were just as great as I have read and not nearly as crowded as I would have thought. We ate at a few differant places and it was all very good to excellant. While not technically Mandalay Bay, but close enough, I used the spa services at TheHotel. I spent 3 and a half hours there and could have spent 3 more. I relaxed for a couple of hours and then had the swedish massage. It was overall a truely relaxing experiance. Mandaly Bay was excellant in every way and you will not be dissapointed with a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, but service problems”
Reviews.Author: sbndogg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at THE Hotel the weekend of 5/13/05 - 5/15/05. We arrived and we liked the decor of the lobby. Check in line was not bad at all. We took the chance and arrived at noon hoping to get an early check in. During check in, we were allowed to check in early, and we were offered a downgrade to a deluxe room instead of a suite. So THE Hotel is NOT all suites, they do have a limited number of deluxe rooms, which is your basic room with the THE Hotel decor. They told us that the suites were oversold and were offereing people downgrades. We saved almost 100 dollars a night, so we took it. Had a room on the 21st floor. It was nice because that set of elevators only went from lobby level to floor 23. When getting an elevator, they were always empty when we got it. Service Issue: So we get to the room and open the door, and it was not cleaned yet. It was pretty gross in that it looks like there was some major partying going on in there. There was a maid across the hall in the other room so we asked her about when it might be cleaned. She said it wasn't her room and said she was sure it would be cleaned later. About 5 minutes later, a housekeeping supervisor came by, and since we were changing to go to the pool, we asked her to come back in 5 minutes. Upon leaving, I called housekeeping, and had them note that we were new guests and wanted everything changed. We left for lunch, came back 3 hours later and the maid just started cleaning it. Slow, in service, but good timing in that i confirmed that she would do the new guest cleaning. Now as for the front desk staff, at check in, the rep changed the rate for the first night in the computer. Then she hand wrote the second nights rate on the form i signed. She said she would change it right away in the system. I knew she wouldn't. So sunday morning, I checked via the TV and had to go downstairs to get them to change the rate. The first rep didn't know how to change it, so she asked another person. The other man goes, "i'll take your word for it and make the correction". PLEASE, don't take my word and look it up on the paper! Anyway, the rate was changed. Hotel: As for the hotel itself. Its very nice and clean. They did not check keys to get in, so anyone can get into the rooms. Our next door neighbors had some adult entertainment in the room at 2AM. Like how they had a coffee bar right downstairs. Also its nice that there isn't a casino in the lobby. The distance between THE Hotel and Mandalay was closer than I thought. Didn't think it was that bad. It is closer to Mandalay Place, which makes it a quick walk into Luxor and Excaliber (all indoor walkways). Pool: Basically Mandalay Bay's Pool. Chairs were at a premium. We had to go when they opened at 9AM to get chairs. By 9:45, all the chairs were taken already. Just too bad this hotel doesn't have a dedicated pool like the Four Season's does at Mandalay. There is a policy now that everyone, regardless of age, must present a key to get into the pool area. So if you had a 1 year old, they have to have a key. I guess its one way of regulating that the number of people paying to stay in the room is the actual number staying there. You not only show the key, they test it to make sure it is active. Even with these measures the pool was packed, they have an overflow pool too, but that was packed as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you don't want a wacky hotel”
Reviews.Author: quadroplet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful time here. We were upgraded when we checked in to a corner room on a high floor-- wonderful huge windows and a great view. The room was enormous. It was more in the style of a W or modern boutique hotel than a typical casino hotel room-- nothing frilly, just very clean lines, modern furniture, the infamous 3 plasma TVs, etc. I loved the bathroom (though the lighting could have been a little brighter)-- the tub was really, really deep and you could really soak in it. Excellent bath stuff, too, and the maids were generous about giving us extras. I thought the bed was extremely comfortable (and I'm really picky about that). We had to return home two days earlier than we'd planned, and the staff was great about that too. The restaurants and bars at Mandalay Bay were great. I would highly recommend Fleur de Lys, especially to vegetarians looking for a great meal-- the 5-course menu is delicious. They even sent over a special extra dessert for us because we were celebrating our anniversary and sent us on our way to Mystere with a little gold box of candies. The Mandalay Bay pool complex is very nice... I wish we'd had better weather, but I'm sure anyone who's there when it's hot and sunny would love it. The spa at TheHotel is terrific. I had an honeydew exfoliating treatment that was one of the best spa treatments I've ever had. It was pricey, even by Boston and NYC prices, but it was worth it. The amenities available to anyone getting a treatment at the spa are great extras-- hot and cool plunge pools, sauna, steam room, and all sorts of hair products. The aesthetician even gave me a little cup of the honeydew lotion to take with me back to the room. (It smelled so good my husband thought it was some sort of frosting and was very confused as to why there was a small plastic cup of it in the bathroom!) All the employees we came in contact with were friendly, helpful, and polite without being snobby. Just from the look of the place, I'd kind of expected an attitude, but it was refreshingly absent. The one glitch we had involved housekeeping skipping our room on the final day, but I think that's more to do with our having to rush to change plans than with their negligence (we asked them to come back later but then were still making phone calls at that time and still had the do not disturb light on). I'm curious about the Wynn, so if we return to Las Vegas soon we might want to check that out, but I would be more than happy to stay at TheHotel again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Mamma Mia what a Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is gorgeous! If you prefer sophisticated upscale decor and don't want to stay in one of the kitsch theme park style hotels now abundant in Las Vegas, this is the place for you. The vibe here is definitely aiming for a younger adult clientel with a taste for a modern design atmosphere. We had a standard suite on the 37th Floor with a view of The Strip. I found the darker toned rooms to be very restful and had no issues with the lighting mentioned in some of the other reviews. Check-in was a breeze, no wait, no attitude, and even though we arrived three hours before check-in time the desk clerk gave us our room keys and let us put our luggage in the room with the understanding that the maid was preparing the room and would prefer that we come back after she was finished. The desk clerk also gave us a complimentary late check out at 1:00 p.m. instead of the standard 11:00 a.m. since we were departing on a Monday. We also had a great room service breakfast that we pre-booked the night before, which was delivered right on time. The Mandalay Bay pool area was fantastic, especially the Lazy River, although it is a little far from TheHotel to be convenient to returning to your room if you forget something you need at the pool. There are also quieter areas to lounge in away from the crowded and noisy beach scene. Service at the pool area we were in was very good. Can't wait to go back, and that is coming from someone who does not gamble and has never really cared that much for Las Vegas. If you are really into gambling and want to be in the center of the action, this is probably not the place for you due to its location at the end of The Strip. TheHotel appears to be directed more toward a non-gambling crowd that want to be in a destination resort atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: HBMichael
Reviews.Content: OK, this was my 7th Vegas trip and 3rd at THEhotel. This property is simply the best there is in Vegas. We have stayed at some very busy times (Halloween, July 4, New Years) and each time the service and rooms are impecable. The decor is very sleek, elegant, and smoothing... lots of marble, mahogony and other dark woods. The bathrooms are a good size and very trendy (reminded me of MTV cribs in a way), honestly I would love to have the designers make my apartment look like any room there. The pool/beach is incredible. I would rank it #1 overall and #2 in terms of catering to 20-somethings (the Hard Rock's eye candy is hard to beat but Mandalay does a nice job). As far as food we ate at the buffet and (like the majority of Hotel buffets) it was great, particularly great at THEhotel was the fruit - the freshest I have ever had (is it possible that the pineapple tasted better than in Hawaii?). I also ordered a salad from room service, it was very good - again you could tell they used the freshest ingredients. The outdoor cafe by the pool was good, the wait was a little long but we did try to eat right at 12:30. The Banana daquri was good but pretty weak. The menu isnt too extravegant but the service was good and friendly. Rumjungle, the Mandalay's club, was ok but it doesn't really compare to the other lounges/clubs around... If you like the service and style of THEhotel try the lounge at the TI called Tangerine... it opened on July 4th weekend and it is amazing - I wish THEhotel would have something like that (although then maybe I would never leave). Finally, the lobby/check-in staff was very very nice. I'm sure its in their database but they greated us by first name and mentioned our last stay with them (made me feel like a high-roller,which I deffinitly am not). And one very nice surprise (I'm still not sure why this happened) but on the last day there I received a very nice mandalay bay/Nike golf/gym bag full off goodies - including golf gloves, balls, a vest, two baseball hats, golf shoe carrier, a personalize thank you card with the cards of the concierge. I did not spend or gamble too much and my friend I was traveling with did not get the same thing - so either I unknowingly talked to the right somebody or it was just my lucky day. Either way it was a perfect end to (in my eyes) the perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved TheHotel!1”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband ,some friends and I stayed here from 5/5-5/9. Let me tell you it was one of the nicest hotels. I was instantly in love as soon as we walked into the lobby! Just my style - very chic and classy. Absolutely loved the dark woods and marble. We were upgraded to one of the rooms with the view of the strip - on the 32nd floor because we were celebrating our 5th anniversary and my husbands birthday. ( They upgraded us - even though we purchased thru a third party - very nice) . The bath products we to die for... in fact I plan on having them in all of my bathrooms at home. Also, love the stationary in the rooms. My husband and I had the opportunity to use the Bathhouse. Very dark , but none the less soothing. Met lots of very nice ladies while relaxing in the big hot tub. We were also able to spend one day at the Beach. Loved the wave pool. Lines started forming at 8:30 , but because of many reviews her , I was able to be one of the first 5 people in line ! We had an enjoyable day at the beach. Loved the sand. Hamburgers from the Beach Grill were very good and the staff was very effecient and helpful. The lounge area was a nice place to meet for drinks. Looks a lot like a cigar bar. again , sleek and sexy! I would HIGHLY recommend staying at TheHotel if you are in Vegas. My husband and I on't typically stay in the same place , but we WILL be visiting the Hotel agian!

Reviews.Title: “Too nice for the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: woodspinner
Reviews.Content: Once inside, you wouldn't know you were in Vegas. This hotel is stunning and the rooms are fabulous. Each suite is decorated in understated elegence. The work desk comes with a dedicated fax and printer. Although be advised they charge 25 cents everytime you print a page. I found the staff to be cordial, no lines to check in. Everything far exceeded any expectations we had. I wish I could give it 6 stars

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Thehotel”
Reviews.Author: phialpha
Reviews.Content: I agree with eveything great stated previously about this hotel. Rooms are fantastic, the break from the casino is key, decor is sleek and modern, and having access to all amenities on the Mandalay property was great. Only complaint is the front desk staff aren't all that friendly. Some of them made you feel very welcome. In my case, though, I shared my room with several other individuals. Each person had their own key. I, unfortunately, lost mine and everyone else was out doing their own thing. When I went to get myself a new key, they had to deactivate the other keys and issue all new ones to me. So here I am with four active keys and all my friends in the room with me are stuck with inactive keys. One of which was denied access and to the pool, and one other that could not get into the room when they REALLY needed to (restroom). The girl at the desk was far from apologetic for this INCREDIBLE inconvenience. Other than that, there is not much I can complain about. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Long Lines At Check In”
Reviews.Author: FromTheBu
Reviews.Content: There's really not much to say about Mandalay Bay, except that it's an incredible property. The rooms are 1st class and enormous. Everything everywhere is top notch...expect check-in. I stood in line for an hour on a weekday afternoon. I don't even want to think about how long you have to wait on a Friday evening!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay”
Reviews.Author: Rockfordsaksa
Reviews.Content: I surprised my husband with a trip to Vegas for this 50th birthday. We had never been there before, so didn't know what to expect. Overall, we were very satisfied with The Hotel. We had rented a car and it was a bit confusing to know where to park and check in. The nice thing about Vegas is that many hotels offer free valet parking. So all we had to do was drive up, and the valets took care of the rest. I do agree that the desk staff appeared to be complacent and indifferent. Perhaps we were just spoiled by the solicitous greeting we received when we went to Cancun. The hotel lobby is quite beautiful and the casino is spacious, and not crowded the way the Bellagio is. The room was clean, comfortable, and the bathroom was big and had both shower and tub. Loved the toilettries. Although it is located on the far end of the strip, we liked the feeing of getting away from it all. If we ever go to Vegas, we will definitely go to The Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: SlavaTravel
Reviews.Content: I was tempted to give it 4 stars, but its really a 4 1/2 stars experience. The room is super convenient, although small for a suite - there is very little empty space, once the furtniture is in place. Bellagio's Salone suite, although is a studio suite is larger thatn this 1 bedroom suite.) The living room is extremely narrow, but still very functional and has an extra 1/2 bathroom. The bedroom is fine and the bathroom is nice and modern. The problem with this new tower is that the pool area is now a complete mad house. This is exactly why this is not a 5 star experience. Pool area is a poor man's version of a spring break: no space, no lounge chairs, everyone on top of each other, kids running around, not a hint of a shade area. Mandalay adds 1,000 people to the property without so much as building another pool. Dining is average - china grill is past its prime, rum jungle is also on the way down. Someone wrote about the view in a previous post - remember if you are not facing the strip, you are facing the highway (pool view, lol) as this is the first hotel from the airport. Everyone raves about it, but I assume most will come back with a similar review as mine: fine property with good rooms, tough pool situation and dining with 10,000 people from Mandalay Bay and Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunnnychick
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed at The Hotel for a night in April. We got a really good midweek rate of 169$ which was great. The Hotel is very sleek and classy. We had excellent service from the moment we checked in. We were able to get a high floor strip view room with amazing views. The room was clean and was everything that we expected. The bathroom was gorgeous with the glass shower and DEEP soaking tub. The beds were comfortable and the three tv's were a nice touch. Definitely would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Bed is too soft”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
