Reviews.Content: This is the softest bed I ever had compare to the other hotel I stayed. This is my only complaint. It gave me a back pain. The hotel is beautiful and of course expensive. Everything in Las Vegas is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at The Hotel for four nights. We had a view of the strip and found our room to be perfectly nice. We stayed there mid-week and had a rate of 169/night which in my opinion was a great deal for a great suite. We enjoyed the location, the pool was amazing and didn't find it too far of a walk to get anywhere. We ate at the Cafe the first night we were there and loved the tuna tartar appetizer. We ate at The Mix one night and like all other reviewers......Do Not waste your money on dinner here. The food is way too expensive for the quality. All we had were two glasses of champagne (which they offer when you first sit down) and two entrees, an appetizer and dessert and the bill was over $250. Again the food was not worth the price. Like all the other reviewers warn, do not go here for dinner. Just go up for drinks, dessert and the view. We also ate at Red Square. The food was also not great but the drinks and dessert were wonderful. We went to Raffles for breakfast. We had to wait in line for about 15 min and while the portions were huge and the food okay the service was ....absent. I had to wait 5-10 min just to ask for syrup after my french toast had arrived. As far as gambeling is concerned. We didn't like mandalay bay much but loved the Luxor next door. They had a great 2 deck blackjack game with wonderful dealers. The service at The Hotel was fine. We had great experiences with the front desk, valet, and bell service. Overall we loved our stay at the hotel and can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - indifferent service”
Reviews.Author: joelk
Reviews.Content: THEHotel loses an excellent rating by being let down by the staff. They have an excellent product, but the staff are pretty indifferent and non-responsive. The rooms are beautiful and the separate lounge is great for entertaining friends who were in Vegas at the same time. Separate half bath great again when entertaining. Also separate bar with bar sink. HUGE TV's in both lounge and bedroom, and even LCD tv in Bathroom. Called Belldesk for car rental and was given numbers of airport rental desks. Reserved car through Budget and they came to pick us up. Returned car to airport and had to take shuttle back to Hotel. Then discovered Dollar Rental Car office in Mandalay. Told the agent there my story and she was speechless. They have rental cars available everyday on the premises!!! Seems to be plumbing problems - Shower never drained properly, and constantly showered in 3 inches of water. Probably should have asked to be moved but didn't bother. Overall loved TheHotel.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: LongingfortheBeach
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas (my husband's 3rd trip but he hadn't been there in 10 years) and I chose THE hotel over the Bellagio and Venetian based on all the reviews I read on Trip Advisor. When we arrived at THE hotel I was immediately impressed with the elegance of the lobby. At check-in, we requested a strip view room and were told that none were available and they gave us a "pool view" room. We arrived in our room to discover that a pool view was actually a view of the highway on the right and a slight view of the pool on the left. I then went and checked out the room and noticed that there was a stain on the bedspread (looked like blood). I immediately called housekeeping and they sent someone up. She asked me if I wanted to have a look at the sheets also and we both noticed that those were dirty as well. She went ahead and changed both. After that fiasco, we had a pretty good night's sleep in the room and it was fairly quiet. The only thing that we noticed is that if you are in the sitting room, there is a constant windy noise if your room is located close to the elevator. The next day we called down and asked if a strip view room was available and they told us that one would be available later in the afternoon after the guest checked out. We packed up our stuff and asked if someone could move our stuff when the room became available (since we would be out). They said they are not allowed to do that (I've never heard that before). So, around 4pm we were able to move to our new room on the 33rd floor. The first thing I noticed was scratches on the walls. Also, it turned out that a "strip view" in this case was literally a view of the strip (the street). If we crained our heads we could see part of Luxor and the beginning parts of the strip on the left. Despite this, we decided to give the room a chance. The first night in this room we both woke up around 3am because of the noise and music coming from Mix on the top floor. We ended up having to turn on the fan from the air conditioner (which blows really cold air) to drown out the noise. Not a great option when you have a cold. We ended up having to do this every night because of the noise. THE hotel and its rooms are really beautifully decorated and the connection with Mandalay Bay is great for the casino, restaurants and pool area (the pool area is one of the best of I've seen). However, I think the quality of the rooms on the strip side is poor because of the noise and also the quality of the rooms in general isn't as a great as I would expect from a hotel that is only one year old (i.e. scratches on the walls, stains on the bedspread).

Reviews.Title: “Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: love2holiday
Reviews.Content: Book this hotel if you can get a good deal. The suites are beautiful - especially if you get one with a view of the strip. Worth it for the bathroom alone, and the toilitries! The decor in the suite is great. Nice to get a bit of refuge from the craziness of Vegas. Note that this hotel is at the south end of the strip. Not so handy for Cesars, Venetian etc. but good transport (monorail, bus and walking) makes it worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jlhutche
Reviews.Content: Quiet, elegance. Would highly recommend. Great staff, pool, food and entertainment. I would highly recommend. No problems or complaints.

Reviews.Title: “large suites, but not so clean”
Reviews.Author: travelwriterwannab
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel last summer. A girlfriend and I and our three teeanage daughters were staying for two nights to get some fun in the sun and some last minute school shopping done. We made a reservation for 2 suites, connecting....double double (meaning two double beds in each suite). I was first told that this bed configuration was definitely available, then was told it was a request only and then when we checked in was told it never even existed...that the connecting rooms have a king bed connecting to a suite with two doubles only. So, I had to share with my girlfriend and the bed was not comfortable as other trip advisor reviews suggested. Try the Four Seasons for a decent bed in Las Vegas. I ended up sleeping on the couch the second night. When we got to The Hotel and had the bed configuration hassles...it took about 40 nminutes in line and then another 15 for them to figure the suite configuration out. We got to our suites and they smelled like mold...I took off my shoes and found that the carpet was soaking wet...not just in spots, all over. The evidently had cleaned the carpets and forgot to take our room off the list until it dried in a few days. When we tried to change rooms they told us that we could but we wouldn't connect to our daughters....so we had to live with it. They said they would bring in fans, but they never showed up. The bathrooms are very nice (nothing truely spectacular like the Penthouses at the Bellagio or anything), but nice. They were very dirty though...they have glass shelves on both sides of the vaniites and they were so dirty (almost like construction dust)...we only had one robe per room even thought we paid for 5 total people to be in our two suites. We called to get robes...they showed up the next day. We had to wear slippers the entire time because the carpets never dried at all....the rooms were changed and "cleaned" except for that thick dirt and dust on the bathroom shelves. We finally said something about it to housekeeping when we finally got our robes and they said they'd get someone to reclean our room while we were out at a show for the evening. When we returned the rooms had been tidied, but the dirt we were talking about was still there...even after physically taking the supervisor into the both bathrooms to show her. Later that night we found that there was a baby sock (not ours) in the sheet on the bed in the girls room and I found a baby toy (not ours) in the drapery when we pulled them back to see the view one night.... On our last day I was expecting a fax and we were having problems with the fax machine in our suite....we had to call the front desk and they were not sure how to use the machine...they referred me to the tech dept. and they told me how to use the machine but after a long dissertation, it was completely the opposite of how to use it....I waited for faxes that never came but were sent from my office at home.....turns out that the machine was out of toner....they told me that someone would be up immediately to fix it...they didn't show for hours. We ended up having to call 4 times and no one ever showed. We checked out and never got the faxes at all. The girls finally decided to write "wash me" in the dust on the bathroom shelves... I wonder if its still there???? I was asked by the front desk manager how our stay was and told her about the problems. She called me a few days later, which I was very impressed with and she asked me to try them again and she would be sure to take care of us. She left me her direct line and said to ask for her when making my next reservation and she would make it up to us. So, almost 9 months later, we are trying it again. We are going for my girlfriends 40th birthday. So, I called the desk manager and she said that she could get us the internet rate...of $399.00 per night, per room. What I am wondering is, exactly what it is she is doing to make the last experience up to us....she took 5 days to call me back and acted like it was an imposition for me to call her direct. I was disappointed in the way the staff handled themselves....the location is good though...close to the airport and the pool area (beach is great). My friend who'd birthday it is, likes to gamble there, so we are trying it again, I hope its better this time.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the sleepy”
Reviews.Author: sfuji1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at THE hotel this past weekend. I did not encounter an indifferent staff, but my co-workers did. They had asked for a room on a higher floor and were told none were available, yet we were given our choice upon checkin. The rooms are bigger than your average hotel however, our room was not clean, and had a ton of dust everywhere. The restaurant Lupo was disappointing, and surprisingly not one of Wolfgang's best. The service at the mainfloor restaurant was very slow and we had to wait 20minutes for a table on Saturday morning when half the restaurant appeared to have empty tables. Our biggest complaint is that on the 62nd or 64th floor where the nightclub is located, the conversation and continous electronic music could be heard all the way down to our friends 8th floor room. (We were on the 24th) This went on and on until 2-2:30am and I had to turn on the TV to drown out the noise. We could not figure out where all this noise was coming from until we investigated the next day. One of our friends is an engineer and he believes that the glass along the building is one continous piece causing the noise to travel down. Although the hotel is 'nice,' I would not recommend staying here especially in a town where rooms are plentiful. By the way, as we were leaving, the valet pulled up in one of the guests new truck with a huge dent and scratch on the side. They did not seemed too concerned about the damage, but the guest was obviously very upset.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Rooms - Indifferent Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You have likely read everything there is to read about THEhotel and its wonderful rooms by now. I certainly did, and I can tell you after reading such great reviews about this place, I had high expectations. We stayed for 3 nights in late March to celebrate my wife's 40th, so I was looking forward to pampering her for a few days at what seemed like a "sure thing". The room did not disappoint - everything written about the quality of the suites at THEhotel is dead-on. In fact, when I walked into my room for the first time, I felt it was exactly as I had imagined based on the write-ups. The decor is definitely very sleek and cool, and the lighting is quite subdued, but it is really a pleasure to come back to a quiet 'low-key' environment after the sensory overload of hours out on the strip (although some may disagree). My wife and I had no greater pleasure than getting back to our room after walking the strip all day, and sliding into the luxuriously oversized tub and decompressing while taking in some entertainment on the wall-mounted bathroom plasma screen (ok - so maybe there were some greater pleasures, but this isn't the forum for that!). Everything else about the room was top-notch and as advertised. Where we were quite disappointed though, was with the staff and their generally plastic and indifferent attitude. Let me start off by saying, we are not whiners who enjoy trying to find something to complain about all the time. We do however expect a reasonable level of service and courtesy when checking into a hotel of this stature. The entire time of our stay at THEhotel, we did not feel that anyone went out of their way to make us feel welcome or wanted. No, we aren't high rollers, so I don't expect the royal treatment, but I believe all guests at such a hotel and at such rates should be made to feel welcome and valued. Honestly, all of the positives of this hotel went right out the window just about any time we asked for anything. A few examples: At check-in, our room was apparently being made up at the time, so we were told it would be about 45 minutes until we could use the room (this was at about 2pm). We were told that a bellman would come and meet us to check our bags so we could relax. After 20 minutes of waiting beside the desk in plain view of the clerk that served us, and being turned down by the only bellman we ever saw come by (he apparently had more important things to do than check our bags), we decided to just give up and took our bags up to the room. When we got up to the room, it was evident that the room had been ready all along, as there wasn't a cleaning cart anywhere on the floor. The clerk just assumed that it was too early and never actually confirmed it wasn't ready. By the way, when we walked into the room, the first thing we saw was a beautiful bowl filled to the brim with cherries (my wife's favorite). What a nice welcoming touch! Forget about it, they're FAKE! On our second day, we came back to the room to discover that instead of two terry robes, we now only had one. Don't ask me why they would take a robe out of our room, but they did. After 3 calls to the desk to get the robe replaced we gave up, and shared the one robe the rest of our stay. We were certainly comforted by the desk clerk who told us not to worry, she made a note that we didn't steal it. Gee, thanks! Similarily, 3 calls to the front desk to get a burnt out lightbulb replaced in the bathroom resulted in more empty promises. It's ok, we just shared the one well-lit sink the entire time, while the other sat unused in shadows. We had a red-eye flight leaving at 11pm, so we politely requested a later checkout. We were told that the hotel was fully booked, and our room was needed by 1pm. Now, I can understand a busy hotel needing to check people in, and certainly they don't have to let us stay later than policy dictates. But if all the rooms were indeed booked, why after the clerk consulted a manager were they able to offer a 6pm checkout if we wanted to pay for an extra night? Obviously there were empty rooms available (as many guests certainly request a late check-in), but they are only available for a price. After we courteously declined such an enticing offer, we got the consolation offer. "If you would like to pay $22 each, you can go take a shower in the spa". Thanks again! Anyhow, that should give you an idea of some of the prevailing attitude at THEhotel. Not once were we confrontational with anyone - we just politely asked and observed in stunned silence. None of the above incidents were traumatic, but they definitely left us with a bad taste for what is otherwise an outstanding hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel for four nights during March - our first time there. There were alot of things I loved about the place, but alot of things I didn't care for. No doubt the room is sensational- the bath products were to die for and my husband was in heaven having ESPN on in three rooms at once. The bed was so comfortable I wanted to take it home with me. That said, we did not like the layout of the place. The lobby/hallways are dark and forbidding - we did not eat at The Cafe - it was not inviting and is out in the open for everyone walking by to look at you. It is also a long way from the other restuarants...plan on walking alot. Speaking of walking, be aware that if you want to wander down the strip you will be walking forever as it is situated so far from everything. Luckily the tram was working fine and that helped alot. The third day we were there we went downstairs to play in a poker tournament - when we came back we found our safe open and $200 missing. Filed a report with security....$200 was not going to make or break us but when you feel you have done everything to secure your property the first thing you do is report what happened. To make a long story short we should have saved ourselves the hassle as the management didn't seem to care. Despite the fact that they can verify both my husband and I were out of the room (security cameras in the casino show we were in the poker tournament when their own records show the safe was somehow opened)...it's not their problem. No apology, no explanation. I did not expect to ever see the $200 again, but when the management simply disreqards you that doesn't say much. So, despite the nice bed and three TV etc...we will not go back. The Golden Nugget has always treated us well and made us feel welcome and that's where we will return to.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel at Mandalay Bay is Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: schweppes14
Reviews.Content: All I can say is WOW, and I mean WOW. I could see the hotel when I landed at the airport ( I never knew the airport would be that close to the strip) We took the shutle to the hotel which cost 5.00 each. We were the third stop so I would say the whole ride took about 12-15 minutes. W When we arrived we were greeted by the friendly woman behind the desk. I did politely ask for a high room and we got the 19th floor which was good, however, I forgot to ask for a strip view, so we got a room that faced Hwy 15(I think ) and I nice backdrop of the mountains,but it was still OK. We arried around 1:15 p.m. and they let us check in without any problems The room: Fabulous. Very clean, yes the decor is dark and contemporary, so if you do like bright colors then this hotel is not for you. Since I love dark decor I fell in love instantly. The bed is just out of this world, very comparable or better than the Westin Heavenly Beds. The two bathrooms really helped and the multiple plasma televisions, as my travelling companion and I often watched different programming. Overall the room was very relaxing (if you can be relaxed in Vegas) and I would almost certainaly stay here the next time I go. The Location: I like the location, yes its at the southern most end of the strip, but that's Ok, I kind of liked being away from everything, plus everything we needed was at the neighboring Mandalay Bay Resort and Casino, so we did not feel we missed out on a lot. This is another thing, from some of the previous reviews, I thoughht I would have to walk outside to get to the Mandaly Casino, but you don't have to at all. There is a connecting walkway on the ground level between the lobby of t THe Hotell and the theatre area of Mandalay Bay, the whole walk takes about 1-2 minutes. The only reasons you can even tell that you are leaving The Hotel and going to Mandalay, is that the decor of The Hotel is so different than anything you have probably seen in Vegas. It has a very chic and sophisticated type appeal that is almost very New York City. I did get to go downtown to do some shopping. First we took a cab to Freemont Street, which cost about $20.00 on the way back we took the bus for $1.25 each(much better deal and we got to see more of the strip this way since the cab took the highway). Once I saw the rest of the strip I was even more happy that I chose The hotel. Even though we went on Sunday, the strip was packed with people, and some of the other hotels were just so gigantic looking, that I am sure I would have gotten lost in them. But then again I'm kind of a laid back person so the temperment of The Hotel was just right. Gambling/Casino: THe casino area was nice. Some of the slots that I favor in Atlantic City casinos were missing though. However, the servers were quite generous with drinks. I was able to order basic drinks such as rum & coke to more elaborate like pina coladas, without having to pay (only tip the server). Payouts were pretty reasonable, I did not win millions, but I honestly did not lose any money, which I always so in Atlantic city. There were very little lines and I was able to redeem my slot payoyuts within 3 minutes or less. Great atmosphere, and I like that the casino did not seem smoke-filled like some of the others. Definitely sign up for the players card as the points rack up rather quickly, plus you can use the card at several other casinos. Staff: Always friendly and courteous. Housekeeping staff gave us whatever we needed. I tipped one of the food servers when I got take out, and he made sure to give me lots of extra pastries, utensils, condiments etc. On a related point, found the taxi drivers, andbus, shuttle drivers very friendly and accomodating. No problems. Food: Recommendation would be to bring or pick up some sodas, juce etc. The drinks, sandwiches in The hotel were kind of pricey. We ended up having most ly sandwiches and desserts from the coffee bar in the lobby. On our last night we had take-out from Raffles Cafe in Mandalay It was basic American fare and very reasonable when compared to what I am used to paying in Washington D.C. The other restaraunts seemed full, but I never saw massive wait lines or heard about any problems. There are so many places to eat in the complex alone that I can't imagine anyone feeling like they could not find something they liked. Overall this was a great stay. I am still in awe by the whole experience. I highly recommend the hotel. Oh and check out was a breeze, no problems just dropped the keys in the box on the way out.

Reviews.Title: “Safe choice with excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: ErwinFromBelgium
Reviews.Content: For my second stay in Las Vegas, I picked THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay after reading raving reviews. Last time, I stayed at the Bellagio, which was an excellent choice. THE Hotel is comparable with Bellagio; both are very classy with THE Hotel being "modern" and the Bellagio "classical". The other difference is location: the Bellagio is perfectly situated in the middle of the strip, whereas THE Hotel is at the very beginning. This means that you'll have to walk-walk-walk, and don't have yourself fooled by the tram connecting THE Hotel/Mandalay Bay with the Luxor etc., nor think that the Monorail is an efficient transport system. On the other hand, the location makes THE Hotel an excellent choice for people wanting to spot celebrities, who seem to like its "distant" location. On THE hotel itself: another strong point is, it doesn't feel like your typical Las Vegas hotel. So check in to THE Hotel and enjoy every day another of the typical resorts like Circus Circus, Luxor, Caesars Palace, The Venetian, New York New York, Paris Vegas, Excalibur etc. just by visiting their lobbies, shopping centra etc. THE Hotel is a small hotel with regard to Las Vegas standards (only 1000 rooms) and offers only suites. The suites are remarkle: large and modern with only top amenities: a perfect bed, LDC TV's all around, a cozy separate salon to relax, a giant bath, upscale bathroom amenities from Gilchrist & Soames of the UK. Rooms are also very quiet. The only negative point: stay away from THE Cafe for your breakfast or whatever. We tried it 3 times (just to make sure) and every time again: very unattentive and unfriendly staff offering the slowest service I've had the past years. (and moreover, it's the typical "this is not included, that is not included" Cafe). THE Hotel shares everything with its parent hotel Mandalay Bay. Things to check out there: the private beach club Moorea Beach (offering a South Beach feeling in las Vegas), check the sand beach (!) at the wave pool, visit the Shark Reef and explore one of the fine, upscale restaurants. The Mix, Alain Ducasse's latest venture in Las Vegas is literally the top; everybody wants to get in (and as a hotel guest, you can), it's on the 64th floor and the pricing is top as well... The only restaurant facility you DON'T want to check out is the buffett of Mandalay Bay; it offers inferior meals in a highly uninspiring atmosphere. To conclude: THE Hotel is a safe and excellent choice in Las Vegas; with pricing from appx. 150 USD (week-days) up to 400 USD (week-ends) per room. Enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a few days in Vegas (my first time) and stayed at The Hotel - I was blow away from the moment I walked into the lobby and couldn't wait to see our room. The suite was amazing it looked like something out of a magazine - the living room had a 42 inch Plasma with DVD/CD and was beautifully appointed - the bedroom and king size bed was so comfortable and was also beautifully done (also with TV) - the master bath had two vanities a tub for two along with another flat screen tv and there was another 1/2 bath in the room as well - There was a great wet bar area an executive desk with a fax machine and computer hookup. The view was amazing. I highly recommend dining in The Cafe located in the lobby for any meal - it is also stylish with a great menu and decent pricing for Vegas. The hotel thought of everything, robes, slippers, blow dryers, iron and ironing boards, toiletries, etc...even the hallways were beautiful (carpeting, artwork, lighting) The best part about the hotel is that you are in Vegas, but you don't feel like you are in Vegas. The hotel is quiet and is very chic. Even the bathrooms in the lobby area are beautiful. The lobby also has a great coffe bar and lounge area. I only had one complaint and that was our dinner at Mix at the top of the hotel - the space is amazing the veiw incredible, but the dining experience was a miss - the food is way to expensive for what it is and the service started out great and then was just awful - not to mention a waiter lost his footing coming down the stairs with a tray of food and the entire tray fell over the railing landing on the table below, but thankfully no one was hurt. What designer would have a wait staff have to use a staircase everytime they have get and deliver food (dumb idea). I would recommend instead a drink in the Mix Lounge for great views (same as restaurant) or maybe just expensive deserts at the restaurant. But I can't say enough about The Hotel - I loved it and it will be the only hotel I stay at in Vegas - PS - The suite was only $169 per night - so check rates before you go - PS - The Hotel is part of the Mandalay Bay hotel which is a beautiful resort, great pools, casino, restaurants, etc...

Reviews.Title: “THE hotel exceeded our lofty expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: brianmu02
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at THE hotel March 26-29. I have to say, it lived up to my lofty expecatations I took from reading reviews here. There are very few, if any, negative things I have to say about it. Although my wife and I aren't the hardest to please and were joking around about some of the things I am sure some people around here would have been upset by. We arrived on Saturday around 5:00 PM or so, no line to check in, walked right up and was finished checking in just a few minutes. Asked for a room high up with a view of the strip and got a room on the 33rd floor with a wonderful strip view. Anything we needed was taken care of rather quickly. The only thing that took any time was getting a new hair dryer, but I think this may have been my fault, listening for a knock instead of a doorbell and didn't realize what the sound was at first. The room was awesome with a surprisingly comfy couch. The plasma TV was nice to watch a little of the basketball on. The tub fit 2 very easily and was a very nice little hangover cure in the morning. The bed was very comfortably, although I was only passing out in it. Ate dinner one night at THE cafe, food was excellent, but the service less than stellar, although I think we just had a bad waiter. Other tables seemed to have much better sevice, and we were eating at 9:30 at night. I would definitely recomend it, I think we just had a bad waiter on a bad night. We didn't go to Mix, we really only wanted to do one nice, expensive dinner and went to Delmonico's at the suggestion of my parents. Had one of the best steaks I have ever had there. Somehow my wife talked us into the Foundation Room Saturday night so we got to experience the view and drinking out on a blacony on the 60th floor. We ate at Raffle's cafe in Mandalay, very good food and very good service. Had some drinks at Red Square, this was very cool, especially with the top of the bar being ice. The pool was awesome, this being our first trip to Mandalay. My wife loves spending time at the pool so this was perfect for her. It did get a little crowded, the first day we were down there by 10:00 and had no problem finding a chair. The second day we got down closer to 11:00 and got lucky on finding 2 together. Then the third day, again got down around 11:00 and couldn't find anything. Although a convention was starting our last day there so things got a bit more crowded. I would recomend getting to the pool early if you want a chair. We really didn't mind staying down on the south end of the strip away from everyone else. You don't have all the walk through traffic, with the huge crowds just standing around or taking up all the tables like you have at places like Bellagio ro Caesar's. We always just took the tram from MB to Excalibur if we were going to walk up the strip. Overall, we had a great time in Vegas. As usual, not enough sleep and too much booze, but can't wait to go back. We would definitely stay the THE hotel again. We had the "Calm after the Storm" deal which made it significantly cheaper so that was definitely nice. We will probably try a few places mid strip the next couple times just to experience that part, but will definitely come back to THE hotel in the future after we have experienced all that. But if you can afford it, THE Hotel is definitely worth what it costs.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better hotels on the strip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was there recently on business and stayed there. The room was clean, spacious and more than adequate (I wouldn't expect many to intend to spend a lot of time in the room) My only complaint was that the shower was awful. The water pressure was very weak and there were 2 temperatures-piping hot or freezing cold. I brought this to the attention of guest services and they mentioned that they recently had to turn off the water system for some reason and this has caused problems. However, when I showered in the spa, there didn't seem to be a problem. In any event, it was an inconvenience. The Spa was among the better spas on the strip. The pool area was the nicest I've been to. (i've been to most, but not Hard Rock, Palms, Bellagio and a couple others). There are some very nice restaurants in the Mandalay. China Grill, Shanghai Lilly and Aeureole (sp?) were all very good, though pricey. Red Square is a cool Russian vodka bar. The buffett is good for breakfast. I would recommend the Mandalay Bay Resort. Just check to make sure the room showers work properly.

Reviews.Title: “It never disappoints...”
Reviews.Author: bmacbc
Reviews.Content: I just had the pleasure of a return visit to THEhotel at Mandalay Bay. We spent the last 11 days criss-crossing between Las Vegas, Palm Springs and LA, with stays at four different hotels in Las Vegas alone. (It was a busy trip!) So I have a real appreciation for what a hotel has to offer. We ran the gambit of hotel classes-- from budget (the Gold Coast which I adore) to mid-range (Flamingo which was good, but only due to the $65 rate booked well in advance for a midweek room) to four star (Caesar's Palace which is my choice for best all-around hotel) to luxury... which brings me to THEhotel. Coming back to THEhotel for a stay cemented for me that this is one fine hotel... anytime... anywhere. If I could stay here all the time I would. The rooms are plush, the beds are so comfortable. The bathrooms are exceptional. I could go on. Okay, I will! The rooms have every amenity. From robes and slippers to the best spa quality bath products. Even if you are not a bathtub kinda person, you will want to sit in your tub and hang out. A plasma screen in just about every room... a CD/DVD player Every room in this hotel is a suite... and a big suite at that. 650 square feet of luxury. And you can feel away from it all, which can be almost impossible to say for some other strip hotels. If money were not an issue, or if you can secure a good online rate, I would tell anyone not to hesitate and treat themselves to a stay at THEhotel. Actually, our stay at THEhotel was $159 per night... while nights at the Flamingo were pricier for the same period. So do your homework and check back often on room rates. Sometimes, this place can be a steal in comparison to other hotels. Get yourself on their email list and you will get online specials. I'm pretty close to gushing about this place, so I will stop my review now....

Reviews.Title: “This place was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: SpoiledStephy
Reviews.Content: This place was so great! We got upgraded to a V-suite on the 23rd floor (all we did was ask!) and ended up with a view of the strip (EVERYTHING--even Palms and Rio!) in both our living room and bedroom. We had two walls of windows in the bedroom so we also had a view of Mandalay, the airport, and the beach area! The bed was soooo comfy--I couldn't let my boyfriend lay down on it for more than 2 minutes or he fell right asleep! The service was impeccable--we asked room service to leave us extra goodies, and boy, did we get them. When we checked in, we also asked for free passes to the Foundation Room for that Monday (it's normally 30 dollars to get in per person) and were given them. We fell asleep though on that comfy bed and missed out. Food: We ended up eating up at Mix, and were NOT impressed at all. It was funny--everyone we talked to while in Vegas that had eaten there wasn't impressed either! I actually had to send back my halibut (it was way to dry--and being a New Englander I know how seafood should taste!). However, the server felt awful, so he gave us two deserts for free--those were delicious. Much better than the whole meal! Try the Mix Candy Bar and The Chocolate Dome--soo good! We also went over to the lounge--the view was awesome from there--same one we had from our room (we were only four floors down) but easier to take pics, since there was no glass on the heated terrace to get in our way! PS---try the gelato in Mandalay Place--it was the best gelato we ever had! I had some every day! All in all, this place was awesome and very relaxing. We both decided next time we go, this will be the only place we stay. We are young and didn't mind walking when we felt like it. Otherwise the tram is very easy and the monorail is good. Be warned about the monorail though: to get to the nearest station to Mandalay, you have to walk ALL the way through MGM--not fun. It saves a lot of money though and is a nice little trip. Go now! It was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Never Disappoints!! Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: spagirl
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here on our adult Spring Break! All good, the rooms are fabulous, beds so comfortable, everything that you need in the room, (except coffee) otherwise you would never leave the room! The check in staff were great, the bell man so helpful. Our rooms were next door to each other and our room had not been cleaned yet (they were unaware) so we called from our friends room and they gave us a newly cleaned room, same elevator - but up from floor 7 to floor 19. The bellman did everything, took the luggage, re-keyed our keys and brought us the new ones. Could not have been nicer. I became ill during the trip and the attendant at the taxi line moved us to the front to go to an urgent care facility, very considerate. Luckily they had xray capabilities and I was given antibiotic injections for pneumonia and made it to Celine the next night!! Harmon Urgent Care Center, if you ever need it!!! The Bathhouse Spa was great!! Room Service food unbelievable! A little island of pampering. This is my favorite hotel in Vegas.. Love the Venetian also, and it has a better location - but ThehOTEL is great!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suites at THEhotel”
Reviews.Author: sbthauer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at THEhotel for a weekend in early March. It was our first trip to Vegas, and we were so glad we selected THEhotel for our accommodations. I really do not have one negative thing to report. The entire place is positively serene compared to the rest of the strip. Our suite was huge with tastefully modern décor. I really loved the flat screen plasma TV in our palatial marble bathroom – nice touch. The Mandalay Bay casino is right downstairs, and The Bridge (the area that connects The Mandalay Bay to The Luxor) has terrifically unique and chic shops. We ate dinner upstairs on the 63rd floor at Alain Ducasse's restaurant Mix, overlooking the strip, and the food was to die for. Afterwards we were invited to join the party in the adjacent lounge/nightclub, which was hopping and had to be some of the best people watching in the city. We also dined at The Café, which was very nice (not to mention open 24/7). We did not use the Bathhouse Spa, but I have heard from close friends that the services are top-notch. If you want to just loll around the spa (or use the gym) you have to pay a nominal fee though. Bottom line, if you need to be right in the thick of the action then THEhotel is not for you, but if laid-back hipster is more your style then you may just find hotel Nirvana here.

Reviews.Title: “THEE Hotel is right...”
Reviews.Author: tracyvision
Reviews.Content: We're very regular visitors to Las Vegas (in fact we live here now, but we still vacation on the Strip) and The Hotel is one of our favorites. Great service, wonderfully appointed rooms (all rooms are suites), and fabulous beds! The comfy robes and slippers are a nice touch. And the mirrors on the front of the armoire in the bedroom makes for a little extra fun! The place has personality...all the bathroom amenities are labeled..."the soap", "the tp" (my favorite). The soaking tub in the bathroom is deep and generously sized for two. Our favorite dessert of the trip was the night we picked up a bottle of wine at 55° in Mandalay Place which we enjoyed while soaking in the big tub. The Cafe is one of the best inhouse 24-hr restaurants in town (only the Veranda in the Four Seasons is better). Not the place for a romantic dinner, but the food is great and it's a nice place for breakfast or lunch or 3am whatever. The Lounge is a great place to meet for drinks...comfortable chairs and a quiet atmosphere conducive to talking. And the Bathhouse Spa is wonderful. Pop for a massage and a bath, you won't be sorry. My favorite thing about The Hotel, however, is that it doesn't feel Vegas-y. There is no casino so it's quiet, and it has almost a South Beach asthetic to it, very clean and hip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Suite but END of Strip and Nominal Service”
Reviews.Author: jneephers
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this room. it was magazine perfect. We had an amazing view of the strip, a bathroom, a guest powder room all done in marble and granite. The living room was a little narrow but it was just too cool. Be aware that this may not be where you would chose to stay for business because the whole feel of the room and hotel is much more dark, elegant, nightclub than someplace you could actually concentrate. CONS: If it bothers you, the decor is totally masculine. I loved it but if you are into old-lady decor with florals and stuff this is not your hotel. It is a long walk to the center of the strip, say to the Mirage. Service: I am not a big gambler and as such I was invisible in this hotel. There is really no concierge to help you figure out how to do things like use the monorail or help procure an outside dinner reservation or tickets, something you would generally expect when you are paying $400 a night. The pool also closes at 5PM which strikes me as idiotic.

Reviews.Title: “THE Place to Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WOW! Do you like to be pampered? Do you enjoy the finer things in life? Then TheHotel at Mandalay Bay is THE place to stay in vegas. Yes, the lighting is a bit mellow inside, and yes you do enter via the garage parking area. However, you avoid entering through a loud, crowded, smokey casino and we enjoyed the moody lighting and found it quite relaxing. The architecture is modern, clean, uncluttered and beautiful. The staff was extremely friendly. When we arrived nearly 2 hours before check-in, it was no problem. We checked in early and got a strip view room. Another thing about this hotel was, that it was very quiet. We are usually bothered by noise at other hotels, but not here. We ordered breakfast to brought to our room at 9:30 a.m and it was there right on the dot, hot and scrumptuous. Also, if you love great cuisine, try the MIX for dinner. It was pricey, but quite a treat and the food was yummy. If you don't want to spend $80-$100 per person for dinner, go into the MIX bar for THE BEST VIEW in Vegas. There is a great drink menu (Try the Halo) and an outdoor seating area with couches and heating lamps. Can't say enough good things about this hotel. We won't stay anywhere else in vegas from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: SweetP101
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel I've stayed in. The service was top notch. The rooms were unbelievable and with an outstanding Strip view. Bathtub and bathroom could accomodate many people with seperate sinks and plasma TV. If you stay anywhere in Vegas, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KfromToronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the most beautiful I have ever stayed in. Miles above the W's in NYC. Very big, but doesn't really feel that way. The room was beautiful with a great view, and the bathroom was wonderful. I was in an upgraded King room with a tub with jets and 2 sinks and separate shower. The bath products alone were worth staying there! They were replenished generously every day, and maintenence was there within 15 minutes to fix a broken lamp. Would stay there again if I could afford it! The food in the Cafe downstairs was also really good.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here at least once”
Reviews.Author: lordnwench
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel. We've stayed in Bellagio, and will probably go back to Bellagio next time, but TheHotel was an excellent choice too. It's very different from other hotels on the strip as it's not attached to a casino, so it feels a little removed from Vegas action. However, that can be a good thing sometimes, and we enjoyed the place immensely. The food in cafe is excellent, and the whole place is very elegant. The room is wonderful, bigger and better than Bellagio's. Overall, worth trying as you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shrop
Reviews.Content: A really great hotel, I have stayed here 2 times now, on both occasions I cannot fault it. The suites are exceptional, great decor with all the ameneties you expect in Vegas. Great large bathroom and the plazma TV screens are really good. The restaurant food was excellent. We were attending a wedding on the last trip, we didn't want the maid service until late afternoon, true to their word they didn't turn up until 4pm as we requested. The spa is good but no better than the one in Mandalay Bay, it is more expensive though. Not as busy as other Vegas resorts and you are slightly away from the casino, giving it a more leisurley feel. The only complaint for some people is the walk to the pool area, otherwise a fantasic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Heaven”
Reviews.Author: snaggletooth
Reviews.Content: Heaven being Bellagio. We travel to Vegas at least 5 times a year. The best thing about THE Hotel is the fact that you leave the casino, and suddenly you are in a luxury hotel, far from the wilds of Vegas ( you can unwind instantly ) The rooms are fabulous. Very large, and all modern. The extra bathroom is a nice touch. It's located very near the Mandalay Bay Pool, which is fabulous ( but get there EARLY to get a chair ) The wave pool is a blast. My complaints about the place ( reason it rates "above average" and not "excellent") ---Customer service at Mandalay Bay is Non-existent. Rude casino staff. Rude Pool Bar stafff ( not an isolated thing , EVERY time we have ventured into the regular Mandalay Bay section we have been disappointed ) --A SMALL portion of this lousy attitude is seeping into THE Hotel, but so far at least they seem for the most part pleasant and accomodating. Out Plasma burned out and it only took about 90 minutes to get a new TV. Also, they screwed up our reservation last time, and fixed it fairly quickly, and upgraded our room (That NEVER would have happened at Mandalay Bay.....the fixing part, not the screw up part that is ) In short , it's a nice Hotel. The room is fantastic. We stay there during "pool season". Just stay away from the Mandalay Bay, and eat and gamble at the Bellagio where they know how to treat a guest

Reviews.Title: “how could ANYONE be dissapointed in this place???”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was impressed the first time i walked in the place. the room (suite) was really nice w/ all the little soaps, bath salt, free robes and slippers. i was a queen and had my king for the 5 days. we are going back in march 05 and staying guess where, you got it. LONG LIVE THE QUEEN!!!

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: msuvig
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the THE hotel....We chose it based on the numerous good reviews on this site, and had stayed at Mandalay previously. Our room had two different lightbulbs out, one obviously broken lamp, and a broken security lock on the hall door(the latch was obviously broken). These were not fixed until almost 7 pm-we reported all by 4 pm. We were there two nights-no turndown service either night -I've had turndown service at a holiday inn! There was more-suffice to say we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: raveman2001
Reviews.Content: I stayed a year ago and am happy to see this hotel has its own listing now. The room is by far the best hotel room I've ever stayed in in the world. Luxury, brand new, plasmas, phones, bar, it is pure excellence. I posted some pictures I have. Having said that this is not to relax in a al Mandalay. No tropics here. This is modern and happening. Make sure you are ready to be blown away!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Vegas. I'm picky about hotels. This is one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in and I've stayed in quite a few. I love modern decor, so I felt like I was in paradise. You can't go wrong if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The WAY to do Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Domer98
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the new Hotel at Mandalay Bay a few months ago and must say it is by far the coolest hotel in Vegas. Some may prefer Hard Rock and the Bellagio will always be a classic, but if you want huge rooms with all of the latest amenities, a chic lobby with great bars and restaurants and access to the the most amazing pool on the strip, look no further. I've stayed at the original Mandalay Bay many times, but the rooms in the new Hotel put the old accomodations to shame. The bathroom was huge, complete with an LCD TV. The bed was comfortable and the separate living room with 42" plasma TV was simply the icing on the cake. It may be a little bit of a walk from the rest of the strip, but it is worth it. This is my favorite place to stay in all of Vegas and I have already booked my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sinclair36
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with some girlfriends in November and it was fantastic. I am usually the most high maintenance one of the group and very picky about where we stay. I was more than pleased, and can't wait to go back. I almost always stay in four or five star hotels and this is right up there. Take your fabulous outfits! You will feel like a movie star staying here.

Reviews.Title: “It really is THE hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ImOnHoliday
Reviews.Content: It's so nice to find an on-strip hotel in Vegas without some goofy theme. THEhotel is really just how you would love to decorate your home if you had the money. My only complaint is that the lighting is very subdued throughout the suites, which means that you'll have a heckuva time trying to figure out how your hair or outfit looks until you get to the elevator, where the lighting is slightly better. Room service is outstanding. Since the hotel is removed a bit from the main hotel, it keeps the lobby pretty low-traffic, which is nice. The lobby bar and coffee bar are excellent. For the past few years, I'd complained that there wasn't a W in Vegas. Now, I think THEhotel possibly out-W's the W. It didn't hurt that I got a great promotional rate -- approximately $140/night!

Reviews.Title: “Feng Shui OD”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Based on TripAdvisor opinions as well as our 2002 stay at the adjacent Mandalay Bay Resort, I was looking forward to our stay at THEhotel. The main thing about the hotel is its signature design love it or hate it, you'll have an opinion. I certainly have one that began to form when we exited our taxi. The main entry to THEhotel is via the bottom floor of Mandalay Bay's garage. No grand entry here. The lobby is, for lack of a better word, cavernous. In essence, the feeling of being underground that started in the garage is amplified in the lobby. While the ceilings are high, the decor is stark with very little natural light coming in. All the surfaces are made of polished granites, marbles, and other exotic materials that I'm sure are expensive. The artwork is Spartan the architecture does all the talking. When we checked in, our particular hostess was terse and spoke very quickly a robotronic young lady. I felt as if my wife and I were being made to assimilate. Nobody offered to help us with our bags. When we asked for a room with a westward view, Ms. Robotic nearly said attempts to move rooms are futile and that a western room would not be ready for hours. I had another plan - move into our south facing (garage) view room and call down to another host in the hope of finding one not yet devoid of a soul. Schlepping our few bags to the 32nd floor was difficult because there were no signs to the elevators. We found them after a few minutes of being rats in the maze. Fortunately for us we had cheese and the lobby area is small. The elevator bays are small and dark, further reinforcing the notion of being in a cave. The room itself was nice (more on the rooms in a minute) but for one disappointing detail. The living room had a beautiful bowl of Bing cherries, my favorites. But they were plastic. As were all the other plants in our room, except for the flowers presented during turndown service. Sigh. Calling down to the front desk, Morticia adroitly moved us into a room looking west, away from the Strip and facing the snow-capped mountains. Very pretty views! At Bellagio switching rooms was much easier. Their the front desk remotely re-keyed our electronic cards and a bellhop immediately materialized to take our bags. At THEhotel I had to go back to the front desk, avoiding Ms. Robotic's icy glaze, to get the keys re-programmed. Then we had to move our luggage ourselves. The two rooms we saw had the same lay-out: Suites with the living room and bedroom side-by-side. The living room contained its own half bath, the traditional sink and fridge loaded with pay-through-the-nose goodies. Very sparse lighting throughout except for the master bathroom. The living room also contains a massive plasma screen TV and DVD player. We were unaware of the DVD player when we made our reservations. Bring your own DVDs, my friends. THEhotel has none to share or rent to you. In fact, THEhotel has no concierge. The couch is comfortable but is not a sleeper. The living room also has a guide listing THEhotel's amenities and facilities. Forget ordering a newspaper from faraway places, though, such as Los Angeles, New York, Washington, or even Las Vegas. Instead, each morning that perky paper USA Today awaits you. Joy. The bedroom, as others have noted, has a wonderfully comfortable bed. The pillows did not feel like they were stuffed with feathers though housekeeping assured me otherwise. There's another huge TV. Onto the bathroom, it has a dark granite shower, sunken bath (no Jacuzzi!), yet another TV and separate wc, always appreciated. Each room has a thermostat. I don't know how much THEhotel cost - I imagine somewhere on the order of a billion dollars. Regardless of the size of the investment, its reliance on the amenities and facilities of Mandalay Bay is essential. THEhotel has one restaurant, THEcafe (that my wife and I named THECave), a coffee shop, a bar, a teeny-weeny VIP lounge (bourgeoisie need not apply) and a new $18 million restaurant / bar complex, THEmix, on the top floor that we didn't get to see. I want to take a moment to compare THEhotel with Mandalay Bay. While THEhotel's suites are larger than the rooms at Mandalay Bay, dollar for dollar, I strongly recommend Mandalay Bay over its darker sibling. Here's why: *Mandalay Bay is bright, open, cheerful. THEhotel is dark, even oppressive. *The Spa and Gym at THEhotel has no natural light at all. Maybe Zen aficionados and adherents appreciate these things more than I. But stainless steel sinks swiped from nearby air force bases are simply not attractive. The much larger Spa and Gym facilities of Mandalay Bay are brighter and warmer. At $30 per day, a few hours at the Mandalay Bay Spa is a bargain. I think THEhotel has slightly more exercise equipment than Mandalay Bay, and all the aerobic equipment has individual TVs (fine if that's your gig). But by any other gauge MB's facilities far surpass THEhotel's. Mandalay Bay has an infinitely larger selection of shops, restaurants and attractions, including the casino. Again, I understand that the powers who design these enormous hotels need to save money. And relying on the resources of Mandalay Bay is probably smart. But THEidentity of THEhotel is just stark, dark, and cloying. My wife answered the question of why did they design THEhotel so oppressively? Because they can. PS - At least someone at THEhotel has a sense of humor. The last sheet of each roll of toilet paper is folder over and sealed with a sticker labeled THEtp.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend in January with a group of girlfriends and had a ball. The rooms were fabulous, lots of space, beautiful decor, clean and very opulent. THE Hotel was very upscale yet all the staff were courteous and attentive. Mandalay Bay is in the heart of the action and getting around the strip was extremely easy, especially with the tram. Mandalay Bay has great shopping, dining and nightlife. So much so that we spent very little time in the room itself. Rum Jungle is a pretty happening nightclub with cage dancers, house music and lots of beautiful people. The bars in the casino itself were also crowded with people and a great place to meet new friends. I would stay there agian in a heartbeat and highly recommend it to others. In fact we're returning to THE hotel for memorial day weekend, hope to see you all there.

Reviews.Title: “sexiest hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Mikeynla
Reviews.Content: This place is simply incredible and unlike ANYTHING else in Vegas. Bellagio may have the 5 diamonds, but THEhotel has the rooms there beat easy. THe decor is stunning and super sexy. The basic ammenities are just unreal: three televisions, three phones, wet bar, robes, slippers, huge soaking tub, seperate shower, 1/2 bath in the foyer. I could go on... For an incredibly unique Las Vegas experience, give THEhotel a try. If you feel more comfortable in floral-chic, however, you may want to stay at the stuffy Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “very impressed”
Reviews.Author: patrick-begley
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in November and must say I was very impressed. I had originally tried to stay at the Bellagio but it had no vacancies. The Hotel at Mandalay Bay was every bit as good if not better. No hassle at check-in or chech-out, a lovely suite (standard). Staff was first rate and very helpful. There is an array of restaurants to suit any taste. You have easy access to neighbouring casinos. Great swimming pool area. One word of caution, this is primarily geared to a youngish crowd, so if you want peace and quiet you might want to stay elsewhere but if you are coming to Las Vegas I guess peace and quiet do not matter. The Hotel is, however, a little detached from the main Mandalay Bay hotel. I go to Las Vegas once a year and have always stayed at tge Bellagio. I think I may be changing my plans next time.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations BIG TIME!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a hotel! We stayed here for a weekend in December and were very impressed with our spacious suite and luxurious accomodations. When we first walked into our room we couldn't believe the size with a living room, king-sized bedroom, 1 1/2 bathrooms and TV's everywhere. The master bathroom was most impressive with flat-screen TV, generously sized tub and separate glass-enclosed shower stall, 2 sinks, separate "toilet room," and overall walking-around space in there! The amenities offered are very nice as well, including their skin-care products and super-soft slippers. The room and hotel itself are tastefully decorated. This was our first stay in Vegas so I can't compare rooms at this hotel to any others. But, based on our experience I can only imagine that THEhotel is within the top 5 hotels on the Strip. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “GREATEST HOTEL in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: imaliveru
Reviews.Content: It's true. I'm tough to please, and this hotel excels in all categories. The amenities, layout of the rooms, decor, TVs, a HUGE master bathroom with amazing vanity, finishes, huge soaking tub and separate shower, beds, views, floor-to-ceiling windows, business services (in room fax, desk, etc.), etc., etc., etc. SIMPLY put: if you stay anywhere else at any price, you will have missed out. Stayed in a standard room w/4 people in December. Plenty of room. Two queen beds, then we got a rollaway bed and one person slept on the non-pull-out couch (big enough for a 5'9" guy). My sister loved The Bathhouse Spa as well. Starbucks is a bit slow (understaffed -- even with just two people ahead of you in line it takes an incredible amount of time to get served!) & expensive (of course) and the lack of in-room coffee makers is simply inexcusable (but is true of all Vegas hotels). The separate entrance is fantastic, the front desk and elevators are so close to where the taxi lets you off. It's worth the price alone, compared to Bellagio & almost all other hotels where you literally have to walk 2 blocks from front desk through casino to your hotel room! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is....HEAVEN!”
Reviews.Author: Jezka
Reviews.Content: I visit Vegas at least once a month, but this was my first visit to THE hotel at Mandalay Bay. I had high expectations because I think that the standard rooms at Mandalay Bay are fabulous, but my high expectations were far surpassed. I love modern decor, so the slate walls and minimalist contemporary decor were much to my liking. My mother has always claimed to hate modern decor because she thinks it feels cold and uninviting, but she LOVED this hotel! The rooms are modern, but they are gorgeous, inviting, warm, and oh-so comfortable. The beds even beat the Four Seasons! The Cafe was a little pricey, but well worth it...delicious! The Bathhouse was phenomenal! It is called THE Hotel for a reason...they spared no expense...they even replaced the standard "do not disturb" placard with a cute little button that signals the staff with a red light. If you get the chance to stay here do not pass it up! Keep in mind that the one person who gave this less than a 5 star rating also named The Orleans one of their favorites...enough said!

Reviews.Title: “My little secret hideaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The word is out about THEhotel! We stayed there on Jan 2-3, 2005. I don't think I could have described the suites any better than the reviewer from Texas. But all I can say is loved it, loved it, LOVED IT!! We were given a suite on the 31st floor with a strip view and it was wonderful. We live in Las Vegas, so the strip is nothing new to us, but we couldn't stop looking out the floor-to-ceiling windows. The view was amazing! In addition, we thought the bed was much better than the heavenly bed at the Westin hotels. One thing I must mention are the his and hers slippers. Whomever thought of that, thought of it all! I loved the bathroom and probably all the ladies that stayed here did also! Very spacious, huge tub, great toiletries (especially the soap), overall beautiful. I can't stop gushing over this hotel, so let me just say that the W Hotels better take note! We're definitely going to come back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “our new favorite vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: Corgimom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at THEhotel Dec 27 - 30, 2004. Not one disappointment, other than yet again leaving our money in the city, rather than bringing it home with us. This hotel is amazing. We paid $149, which is expensive considering we usually get free rooms from other casinos. The city was booked full and we were in the mood to try something different. We're glad we did. The service was outstanding - excellent front desk, valet and bell service. The hotel is beautiful - dark woods, marble and a quiet atmosphere. there is a coffee bar that serves Starbucks in the lobby. Wonderful art and ambience. The only weird thing was the "wind tunnel" sound in the elevator lobbies. The rooms are the main focus here and for good reason. Larger than some apartments - two full rooms. It even seemed bigger than the rooms at the Venetian. The plasma screen TV in the living room is phenomenal - it has a DVD player attached (there is a DVD of Mama Mia on hand if you are so inclined). There is a fax machine, a desk and a wet bar with minibar underneath. There is a 1/2 bath off the foyer, which also has a doorbell and a do not disturn light you can turn on. The bedroom was great - I wish the larger TV was in here, but it is still nice. Two closets in the armoire, with fluffy robes and slippers. The bed wasn't a "heavenly" bed, but the double sheets were great, and the comforter was heavy, with a lighter one underneath if you were warm natured. The bathroom was heavenly, with a waterfall faucet in the deep tub, and a separate glass shower. The marble vanity had cubbyholes to store your toiletries, and their selection of goodies was wonderful - I wish I had more of that shampoo. The wall mounted TV was a nice touch. If I had one complaint, it was no stool to sit on while applying makeup, but they did have a nice lighted mirror and - gulp - scale (now why would you want to know your weight while on vacation?). Connected to Mandalay by a short walk, we spent most of our time there and in the Luxor (connected by the Mandalay Place mall). Raffles, the restaurant at Mandalay, was our favorite place to eat, and service was wonderful, even with the crowds. We should have charged more to our room - we left comps "in the bank" for our next trip. They don't comp movies charged to the room, though. Had to pay $10 each for those we could have seen at the theater for $7.50 (but not in a fluffy robe!) The tram from Excalibur was crowded but is a nice touch when coming back from a long walk down the strip. We will return to THEhotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decor was great...however,”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Needless to say...the decor of the suites are excellent. After seeing all the different hotels that my friends stayed at during the same trip, TheHotel has the best rooms. However, I was not impressed with the blanket nor the sheets. There were fuzz balls in our sheets, and the blanket is showing wear and tear. For such a new hotel, and such decor, I would expect better sheets, or better upkeep of the sheets. Change them!!! Overall, this is a great place to stay. I recommend that everyone stay here at least once when staying in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've stayed at on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: jbeechuk
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights at THEhotel Dec. 19-22 and must say it is everything that I expected and more. We checked in at 2 and had no problem getting the strip view we wanted. We were given room #24805, which is the 24th floor, looking down at Luxor, MGM, etc. A higher up floor would have been nicer, as Luxor does block some of the view, but no biggie. The room was spotless and very classy. 2 plasma TVs and a flat screen in the bedroom were awesome. But what we really enjoyed was the main bathroom. It must have measured 12 x 15 ft. A separate room with the dumper even had its own phone. The double vanity counter was about 7 ft wide. There are built in shelves with all kinds of bath goodies that the wife loved. We tipped $5 every day to the housekeeper, and she would refill everything with 2 of each bottle. The bathtub was enormous, about 2.5 ft. deep and big enough for 2. The water comes out in a waterfall stream, very cool. The separate shower was marble in the back walls and glass on 2 sides. The top of it was open, so you could hear (and watch) the 15" plasma TV while getting ready. Of course, there was the mini-bar with wine, liquor, snacks, etc. The couch in the living room was very comfortable, I fell asleep on it one night. There is a desk with a fax machine/internet connection if you need it. There are separate heating/cooling controls for the living room and for the bedroom, which is nice. A USA Today is left outside your door every morning in a little THEhotel pouch. Pretty neat. By far, the bed was the most comfortable we have ever slept in in our lives. The mattress was super soft, and the sheets must have been 800 count. Even the pillows were amazing. My wife just loved it. I had to send a picture I bought home and called the Business Center. They sent someone up immediately and took care of it for me. I was impressed. We are not high rollers, but they made us feel like VIPs. We had breakfast at THEcafe and were pleasantly suprised at the quality of food. My wife got pancakes that looked like frisbees. They must have been a foot in diameter! I had an omelette that was superb. The prices were reasonable and I would recommend it to anyone. THEcafe is open 24/7. There is also a coffee shop and bar/lounge that looked nice, but we didn't visit. The decor of THEhotel is very dark wood, lots of browns and yellows. I really enjoyed it. Not all the lights and whistles that other hotels have. The casino is about a 2 minute walk away, but you cannot hear it or see it. I guess we really liked the upscale, away-from-the-madness feel. We have stayed at many hotels on the strip, including the Mirage, Treasure Island, Aladdin, Monte Carlo, and NY NY, but none were close to the quality of THEhotel. I highly recommend it. There is model of the rooms set up on the way to the Shark Reef near the Convention Center, so you can check it out. We may never stay anywhere else on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised...Not Your Typical Vegas Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A group of friends and I stayed at THEhotel at Mandalay Bay in August 2004 and had a wonderful time. It is not the typical Vegas hotel with overdone themes, crowded buffets, and the constant ringing of slot machines. The suites are spacious and have modern amenities such as flat-panel televisions and speakers in the bathroom. As a guest at THEhotel, one has access to all of the amenities offered by Mandalay Bay, such as the large lagoon-style swimming pool and beach, yet the guestrooms are far enough away from the crowds of Mandalay to allow for relaxation and quiet...a rare find in Vegas! The only negatives were that the front desk was not properly staffed for the afternoon check-in rush and that the lagoon pool was temporarily closed because of an apparent bathroom "incident" involving a young child. Although this was frustrating and invconvenient, it was reassuring to know that management took the necessary steps to ensure that the pool water was properly sanitized!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was VERY impressed! All rooms are suites- each room has a living room, LARGE AMAZING bathroom, a 2nd 1/2 bath and a large bedroom Request a high floor to get a great view of the strip No problem getting a late check out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice~!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at THE HOTEL and had a great time. WE stayed 7 nights and loved every minute of it. The room is spaciouis, consierge is helpful, and valet is nice if you choose to use it. We decided to park our own car, though, just to save some cash. Our room cost 250 dollars per night. We ate at THE Cafe a lot as well as the breakfast bar/lounge. The service at THE Cafe was not the best and the food is expensive...but what do you expect for a top notch hotel? WE only toured the spa, but it looked very nice. It was a nightmare trying to find a chair at the pool. There are actually several pools and I got lost trying to find a chair and make my way back to my husband at another pool. Also, when I was trying to find my way back, I ran into the ADULT pool which is clothing optional. It was funny when the lifegard at the gate asked me if I was sure I was here, because of course I had a clothing on (a bikini). We would definitely like to go back. Everyone should stay there at least once.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: ryansgirl
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Vegas a few days ago and i must say TheHotel is definitely worth the money. Unfortunely, i could only afford to spend one night there but i wish i could have just moved in. The place is beautiful. Like some ot the others have said it is definitely dark in there but i guess because of the contempo theme they couldn't use too bright lights. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We walked right up to the registration desk and checked in eventhough it was 3 hours before check-in time. The room was big and the bathroom was the biggest i had ever been in! Flat screens in every room and everything was cleaned to perfection. My husband couldn't stop taking pics of the place and calling everyone he knows to let them know how nice of a hotel we were staying in! LOL I can't wait to go back to Vegas!! *My husband said we will only stay at TheHotel the next time we go to Vegas. Works for me!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Fourth Stay This Year”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just finished my fouth stay at THEhotel in 2004. Great Rooms, love the three plasma televisions. The bathrooms are great, clean great soaking tub and seperate shower. Enjoyed soaking in the tub and watcing CNN. THEcafe has good food with somewhat spotty service. Sometimes on the money, other times not to great. I liked the idea of having the Cofee Bar a short distance from the elevator. The service is steadily improving. On my initial visit the front desk clerk was almost surly. The next visit I had to argue to get the floor and bed type I wanted. Things improved on the third visit the clerk was almost cordial from the start and my fourth visit( last week) I got an upgrade without requesting it and a cordial reception. One thing it would be nice to receive a welcome back after four stays of three nights each in the last 6 months. That is the reasons for the four rating in lieu of five. Still not top notch service but they are improving. Overall a great place to stay, a good value and a nice retreat from the insanity of the Mandalay Bay. Aside from the occasional service flaws it is a wonderful place to stay. Looking forward to returning in a few months.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel over Thanksgiving and loved it. The room was huge and felt just like a W hotel -very modern with a clean and simple feel. Only thing to keep in mind is that it is a far hike to everything. If you don't mind walking (we did not) you'll enjoy the feeling of getting away from all the people as you make your way back to your room at night. I've been to Vegas several times and stayed at the Venetian, New York New York, MGM and the Aladdian; The Hotel is in a class all its own. It resembles a 5 star hotel in a big city more then a Vegas themed property. This is my new Vegas home.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving at THEHotel”
Reviews.Author: NashGuyNashville
Reviews.Content: I concur with all the positive comments about THEHotel. The best part is the feeling that you are in a smaller hotel but connected to the larger Mandalay Bay / Luxor property. Constructive comments would be to upgrade the CD player in the bedroom and to provide more light in both rooms; dark is fine unless you'd like to see to iron, read, etc. If you have a car, the Valet parking is free and was convenient while we were there. I don't think the first part of Thanksgiving week is too crowded in LV, but we never had a problem/wait with getting the car. It was well worth the $2 tip for the convenience. From the parking deck take an immediate left over to Frank Sinatra Blvd. This street runs behind all the casinos on the West side of LV Blvd and makes getting to other properties in a car a snap. Only 1 light on the entire stretch. I understand this was built to help employess reach their jobs easier, but tourists should make note of it. At THEHotel, request a North facing room above the 23rd (or at least 10th) floor. I imagine that is a great view of the Strip. I think West facing rooms on any floor would have a great mountain view. We faced East for a view of the airport. Not bad, but there are better views. I like the Mandalay Bay Spa a bit better (roomier, more chairs to lounge on), but THEBathhouse is very nice; great showers! Watch their website for low rates (we had $149) and then make plans to take advantage of them.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late September 2004 and it was totally worth the money! Great decor, very comfortable bed, spacious bathroom complete with flat screen tv, very clean and relatively quiet for Vegas (we could hear music faintly from the hotel club). The only negative detail we found was that the windows are tinted making the room dark, but hey, we're in Vegas baby! Who needs a window when you have Mandalay Bay's beach resort right downstairs? It was my first and only trip to Vegas and I'm so happy we decided to stay at THEhotel. Definitely book it if you can, you'll be very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: tallsoylatte
Reviews.Content: Stayed at TheHotel in November 2004. Hands down the best hotel in Las Vegas! Feels very much like a W Hotel and it's a nice change from the other hotels in Vegas that tend to over-do the decor. Plus you have the best of both worlds - connected to Mandalay Bay casino/shopping/theater yet self-contained in a great boutique hotel-like atmosphere that almost makes the hotel and its guests feel exclusive in a good way. Don't hesitate to stay here. The Bathhouse Spa is worth checking out too - a great place to relax. I've stayed at Venetian, Aladdin, Luxor and Treasure Island so I have some basis for comparison. I was going to stay at Bellagio the next I'm in Vegas but have changed my mind. I'm going back to TheHotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Rooms”
Reviews.Author: kurkar
Reviews.Content: Thought the rooms in Thehotel were some of the best I've seen. And the bed was better than a "Heavenly Bed" at a Westin. The bathroom was sumptuous, and I like their toiletries. My only complaint is the lobby area. If you are the least bit addicted to natural light, this is not the place for you. Felt like I was entering a cave. I can not imagine getting up in the morning and eating breakfast at the cafe. So dark and depressing. The Bathhouse Spa at THEhotel is one of the nicest I have been to.

HotelInfo.Name: THEhotel at Mandalay Bay
HotelInfo.Address: 3950 Las Vegas Blvd South, Las Vegas, NV 89119
